On the other hand, I might have been somewhat less disappointed had I realized this was a 3.6% beer and adjusted my palate expectations accordingly. I’d certainly drink it again happily, especially at lunchtime if one doesn’t want a beer pack the full punch of one of their better 7 or 8% strong ales. Coming back to this beer a second time on cask (and yet again on tap) and knowing that I was getting a 3.6%, I was even more impressed. I’ve bumped the rating upward a few points accordingly. If this beer tasted half as good as it smells, it would be darn near unbeatable under 4%. Unfortunately, even the foreknowledge that you’re dealing with a 3.6% beer doesn’t entirely cut the watery disappointment that follows the sublime aroma.

name: Big Time Snowmelt American Ale
review: On Nitro: My rating may be effect by this. Orangy colour with a typical creamy nitro head. Nitro probably took some of the hop flavour but it did still have some nice hop aroma. Flavour was slightly bitter with the hops but balanced nicely with malts. Would like to try it without nitro some time.

name: Big Time Snowmelt American Ale
review: The pub was serving this on nitro when I went, but I'm not adding the nitro version as a separate beer because I can't figure out that rule. It was served to me in full cascading mode and it took a while for the show to end. Clear orange with a creamy head typical of nitro beers. I was expecting all the hop flavors to be washed out by the nitro, but not at this place. The Cascade hops ride high on a strong, malt backbone. Great use of nitro.

name: Big Time Snowmelt American Ale
review: Was called bitter the first time I had it.Lightly spiced hop nose. Flavor is also lighlty spiced but seems lacking in hops. Rather light and thin.

name: Big Time Snowmelt American Ale
review: Hints of spiciness in the bouquet are what is expected of a winter brew. Honey-colored, with a pleasantly spicy body that is smooth, but a little light on the underside--with a finishing hoppy piquance. Rerate: Much better than I remembered (this is on nitro)--bronze with a creamy head--and honeyed hops. A nice APA to encounter in the winter.

name: Big Time Frostys Spiced Winter Warmer
review: Nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon, ginger, almost pumpkin pie flavored. smooth and medium bodied.

name: Big Time Frostys Spiced Winter Warmer
review: Deep ruby color with a root beer head. The nose hinted at the spices to come, but it did not give any indication of the size and scope of the flavor. Tons of ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon and other spices that seemed backed up by an almost chocolate sweetness. The hops were only allowed to come out at the very end. Very smooth mouthfeel but very aggresive spices. I bet it would mellow nicely, but there is no way it will last that long.

name: Big Time Frostys Spiced Winter Warmer
review: This refreshingly winter-redolent beer is remarkably true to its name. Pungent with cinnamon, cloves, and orange peel in this maroon colored ales that brings out the Christmas season. Nice warming sensation from this quintessential winter holiday selection.

name: Big Time Frostys Spiced Winter Warmer
review: Tastes and smells like a clovey apple pie. Man, it's been a while since I had a really good apple pie. Hey mom, if you see this can you pop a pie in the mail for me?

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Hazy reddish brown color/ tan head. Nutty, cocoa, tea leaf aromas. Caramel sweet flavors with black tea leaf, mild floral, mild chocolate, nicely bitter finish.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Big Time IPA Festival – Seattle Beer Week 2010 Reddish amber in color, clear and thin head. Nice aroma with some grapefruit and clove aromas. Lots of hops with rye and other spices and malts. Very sweet with lots of caramel malt.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark red color with a small white head. The aroma is sweet caramel. The flavor is light spicy hops, rich sweet caramel. Decent.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Nose is somewhat sweet, some rye, caramel, iced tea, earthy hops. Pours hazy red, no head. Flavors of rye, ice tea, caramel, earth. More malty then hoppy. Easy to drink.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours deep leathery brown and quite hazy. Thin sudsy tan head. Very neutral nose; inoffensive. Medium body, active carb, resin-forward attack. Piney burny resiny bitter body and a long tobacco resin bitter cling finish. Barkeep mentioned that it has some roast malt in it; maybe under all the flavors I’m picking up is mainly roast. Nice stuff. Maybe not the most refreshing IPA in the world, but complex and satisfying and drinkable,

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Dark red, cloudy (of course), with a rocky head. Rich woody aroma, lots of subtle grapefruit and orange underneath. Slightly caramel-accented malt aromas. Rich and supple caramelly, woodsy malts and soft but insistent bitterness. Beautiful woody notes, light citrus, and faint chocolate. Excellent brew - almost the caramel taste of a great "Irish" red but with IPA hops.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Tap at the brewery. This is IPA #100 for me. Pours dark, dark orange amber for an IPA. The aroma is a lovely, classic centennial IPA: grapefruit and peaches and a bit of spicy pine. The flavor is equally nice: not heavily burnt-malted despite its dark color, just tasty hops not hitting too hard, almost like a Drakes Expedition or similar heavily-hopped amber ale. Mildly sweet but not sticky, a very characteristic Big Time flavor to this one. Fairly light body and palate, but that just makes this one wonderfully drinkable. A very nice beer and worth trying any time it is on tap.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: Draft. Rich dark amber beer with an off-white head. Low malty, grapefruit aroma. Nutty, malty flavor with some backing bitterness. (For an IPA, where’s the hops??). Medium bodied. Lingering caramel and grapefruit.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: On tap. Nice cloudy dark red. Good head. Spicy and lemon hop aroma. Lemon citrus taste is pretty strong. Bitter hops. Not very balanced and a bit thin, but worth trying.

name: Big Time Matts Red Eye IPA
review: not bad for an inexpensive beer. i don’t mind drinking it. i would buy it again

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: [3/2/15] Draught at Big Time Brewery in Seattle. Clear coper. Aroma of honey, graininess, butter and a bit of hops. Sweetish flavor with honey, graininess, a bit of butter, spicy rye and a bitter hops finish. Medium-bodied.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: On tap at Big Time, pours a clear golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out spicy hops, rye, some orange fruitiness, and biscuity malt. Flavour is clean and balanced, with notes of oranges and other citrus and tropical fruitiness, along with lightly spicy hops. Well-balanced and easy to drink. Very good stuff.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: Draft - Sweet caramel. Clear orange gold with a decent beige head. Light resin, orange and some spice. Nice and caramel forward.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: Pours hazy amber with a finger off white head. Smell sweet grainy cereal, straw. Taste mellow chalky texture on the end, a bit of grassy hops. Lighter bodied. Reasonable drinkability.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub. This beer pours a clear dark amber color with a medium bone white head that recedes steadily. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasty malt and mildly spiced hops. Medium body with a moderately bitter hops character and notes of rye and toasted malt in the background. The finish is hoppy with a lingering bitterness left behind. Decent brew overall.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: Decent tap beer. The rye is not showing a typical spicy character, nor do we get much IPA/hoppy profile. A quaffer.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: (Draft) Sampled at the 2011 Great Canadian Beer Festival on September 9, 2011. Nice head and mahogany body. Good bitterness and the rye is very apparent in this beer. Nice, I should have stuck with this for the remaining few hours. Good fun!

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: Clear dark amber color/ lasting ivory sheen. Nice floral, spicy sweet rye, pale malt aromas. Smooth medium body. Rich malty sweet honey biscuit, toasted rye bread flavors with some floral hoppage--fruity finish--good.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: On tap at Big Time. Poured clear pale amber with a white head. Was not able to make anything out of the aroma except maybe some bread. Light bitterness, medium sweetness, thin body, and no finish.

name: Big Time Powderfinger Rye Ale
review: GABF 2010. Pours a hazed copper with a thin lasting head. Aroma is spicy rye bread, toast, nutty, hints of light coffee, bread herbal leafy hops. Flavor is nutty earhty bread with rye malt, biscuit, burnt toast, light nutty chocolate with caramel malts and light herbal hops. Medium finish with light bitternes. Ok.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear copper with small white head that lasts. The aroma is grass and spruce. Medium body, pine, straw, bitter, good.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: At Big Time. Malty orange, creamy white head. Residual sugar, malty body. Banana-amber. but resoundingly bitter with residual sugar.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: On cask @ Big Time. Pours bright reddish dark golden with thick white head. Aroma is dry oaky caramel malt, fresh dark citrus on the hops. Taste is clean lightly sweet caramel malt, slightly darker than what you might expect from an IPA. Lots of fresh hops on the back, big juicy grapefruit and lighter pine notes here. Very much in the school of Sierra Nevada Celebration winter ale, which is a compliment.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: On nitrogen. Nose of caramel rye feet earth pepper. Pours dark amber nice nitrogen head and lace. Flavors of feet caramel sugar grain. A little slick in the mouth feel. Not my favorite.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Cask pour. Hazy amber color with ivory head. Mild hoppy pine, floral, caramel aromas. Medium bodied with soft co2. Nice floral, pine, toasted spicy caramel flavors--good....got to try this side by side with the nitro version of Lift Ticket, the nitro pour had some weird ass chemical astringent preservative flavors in it....

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Cask conditioned at Big Time. Two fingers white head. Big bubbles, good retention. Dark tan color, somewhere between an amber and a porter. Smell is light. Taste is mellow spices, soft smooth palate with a hoppy finish. Very good winter beer.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Was billed as Lift Ticket Winter Ale in Jan 2008. Pours a totally hazy luminescent orange. Hop-forward nose is very inviting. Some metal comes through in the taste. Thick palate. A very nice, relatively clean IPA...Lift ticket on nitro. Hazed burnt orange. Stable nitro head. Earthy aroma. Lingering resins and grapefruit. Soft palate I like the nitro here better than in a stout! alcohol apparent tho needs to be toned down just a little. Has nice citris pith flavor. Finishes dry and with mild spice like roots and bark. Dandelion. 3,7,3,8,14 not bad but not outstanding.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Cloudy copper with decent head. Fantastic ipa. Lots of c hops in the aroma and taste. Backed perfectly with malt to make it quite drinkable. Bartender said this year’s version is much hoppier than year’s past. I really enjoyed this...

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Tap at Elysian Brewing. Cloudy copper-coloured beer. Big fruity hop aroma. Cascadey type with tropical papaya/pineapple flavour, peach/apricot. Aroma is quite intoxicating. Flavour is fairly malty though, despite the bit hoppy aroma. A bit of cherry fruitiness, hoppy flavour with a fairly complex malt bill as well (pale malt, some sweet honey and a bit of caramel sweetness). Well balanced with loads of sweet hoppy flavour. Lingering bitterness. Very tasty brew.

name: Big Time Lift Ticket Winter Ale
review: Red-brown colour, nice head with decent lacing. Aroma is hoppy with some caramel malt. Sweet and quite hoppy with a honey flavour finishing with a sharp hop hit.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Short rate from terse notes just after St Patrick’s Day. Draft at Big Time. Black nitro pour, foam nitro khaki head. Aroma: metal, chocolate, Guinness, nutty toast. Taste: copper, chocolate, toast in the finish. Lasting roasty finish. Light body, poundable, creamy. Overall: alright.7/4/6.5/4/12.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Sample at the brewpub. Pours nearly black with a medium thin and creamy light beige head that dissipates to a dense film. Sticky rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Light, semi-dry body with flavors of sweet toasted malt, chocolate and a touch of smoke. The finish is short and malty. Slightly above average overall.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Pours a nice creamy finger of head with a dark red/brown color. Smell is subtle coffee and a bit of marshmallow and toffee, pretty malty too. Texture is creamy, very drinkable, not very viscous. Taste is a bit ashy, roasted malt, grainy, tiny bit sour on the end. Pretty good Irish Dry Stout.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Cask-cond’d version @ brewpub. Not much head on an opaque black beer. Aroma of simple coffee, some creamer, butter, and Coffee Crisp candy bar. Hardly any co2 but has a nice silkiness. Good smoky flavors and love the sweet soft licorice in the background. That does not overpower the the mild cocoa creme. Sweet in a licorice way and more woody, like toasty wood, than anything else at the end.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Black. Lassting nitro head thick creamy lacing. Nice cocoa coffee aroma. Light dry body. Creamy coffee stout.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Black with a creamy head and great lacing. Nose of smoke and roast malts. Beef jerky!? Todd concurs. Woody and more smoke in the flavor with some roast and bitter chocolate. Creamy palate of course (nitro) and thick smoke rolls through the finish.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Sampled @ Big Time, April 2007 Pours with a rich, creamy, nitrogen generated head that has a brown tinged, tan color. The beer is simply black, when analyzed in this pub atmosphere. The aroma is rich with notes of toasty malt, chocolate, a touch of coffee aromatics and a hint of burn raisin adds some unexpected fruitiness. The beer tastes dry and fairly bitter in the finish. The bitterness seems to be driven by the burnt malt notes rather than by hops. A touch of coffee flavors are here, focusing on roast bean flavors. This has a very creamy mouthfeel to it, which is typical of a degassed nitrogenated brew. The finish has a lingering, toasted, dry grain character to it. This is a good easy drinking brew, and a definite step up from draught Guinness.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Draft. Nitro. Blackish beer with a tan nitro head. Roasty aroma. Light flavor, slightly sour, slight roast. Lingering sourness/lactic. Lighter bodied.

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: (Draught) Sampled at Big Time Brewpub in Seattle on March 2, 2007. Pours a light brown head with an opaque body. Nose of JERKY. Yah - strange huh? Chocolate flavour, good carbonation and gritty texture. Lasting cocoa and coffee in the finish. Powerful and oodles of flavour. I loved this stuff

name: Big Time Buck Mulligans Dublin Stout
review: Black with creamy beige head.Chocolate espresso nose. Bitter unsweetend chocolate taste. Far too thin. Probably the worst offering I have had from this brewery.

name: Big Time Neighsayer Oatmeal Ale
review: A lover of oatmeal stouts--this was a bit of a twist. Rich amber in appearance with a cream head giving off a feint, but pleasant oatmeal odor and tasting silkily and gently of oatmeal. A cross between a stout and a cream ale, althought the commercial description tells it is really an English bitter.

name: Ridleys Chelmer Gold
review: Bottled. An amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel, while the flavor is sweet mlaty with primary notes of caramel, but also with a slight note of oxidation.

name: Ridleys Chelmer Gold
review: Bottled (BBE 1996). Dark amber colour, small white head. Aroma is bigtime sweet, but fruity hops along with some hints of hay. Flavour is hops, wood and some grassyness. Also a toffeeish sweetness lurking in the background.

name: Ridleys Chelmer Gold
review: Bottle, chris_o shindig. Clear straw, no head. Slightly vinous sour malt. 1D flavour, some sour maltiness. Hop tints. Palate is sour dullness and hoppy. Quite good for a beer with BBE 1996.

name: Ridleys Chelmer Gold
review: One of the tastiest ales I've had - very flavorful, balanced nutty taste, just one of my favorites. An excellent ale.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Draft at brewery. This beer is messed up. It tastes like bark, I guess. Or very very old malt that is offputting. Yuck, I can’t do it. I just don’t understand.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Pours blond with little head. Smell is flowery, soft. Taste is citrus, mellow, tangerine. Good beer.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub. The beer is a clear yellow-amber color with a medium thin white head that evaporates quickly to an outer ring. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of mild hops and bready malt. Light body with a lightly bitter hops character and sweet malt in the background. The finish is short with a grainy malt aftertaste. Solidly average beer overall.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: On tap at Big Time. Poured pale clear yellow/orange with a white head. Almost no aroma, but I think I detected a slight hint of orange. Light bitterness, light sweetness, light finish.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Draft at Big Time. Pours a hazy light amber with coppery overtones. Loose white head. Mild grassy and biscuity nose. Creamy medium body with somewhat understated carb. A little bit of orange present on the mid-palate, but far underneath a toasty, biscuity, slightly grassy flavor profile. A classic well-enough-made blonde, very refreshing and easy to drink. Not a deeply inspired recipe but those are very hard to find in this style.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Draft. Golden beer with a whitish head. Light malt and light spice aroma. Light malt and light cookie flavor. Medium bodied. Light cookie dough notes linger with light sweetness and light hops.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: on tap at big time brewery in seattle. typically blonde ale, a little flat in the flavor department

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Clear dark golden with a white head. Nice honey malt aroma. Light/Medium body. Decent honey malt grainy flavor with a crisp, clean finish. Draft@ Big Time.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: Clear golden with thin head. Overly sweet for me, and non-existent hops. Wheat comes through more than a hint. Nice and light for a session beer, but not much to get excited about.

name: Big Time Sunbreak Blonde Ale
review: 9/4/07 On draught at the brewery. Aroma is sweet, slightly grainy malt forward with caramel and light candy notes. Appearance is clear yellow with a moderate white head. Flavor is bubblegum sweet malt with a true sugar note and low hop citrus. Mouthfeel is a little odd, with an odd graint/low carb texture on the tongue and a sweet finish. Overall, too candilike, but good and drinkable.

name: Big Time Brewer Bills Pumpkin Ale
review: Amber with no head or lace really. Aromas of pumpkin spices and caramel malt. The flavor brings the pumpkin out more so. Crystal malts. Hops bitter and citrus. Very well done.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: On tap at Bottleworks, Seattle. Pours a cloudy orange with a thick, frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, piney hopes, grass, resin, hay and tropical fruits. Flavour of piney hops, tropical fruits, hay and grain. Bitter and well balanced. Very refreshing.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: On tap at Bottleworks, split with Matts_Property, pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of piney / resinous hops, caramel and tropical fruits. Flavour is very fruity - mango and peach, with a piney hop blast and a perfect malt balance. Superb.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: The best beer on tap when I was there. The initial hop flavor is quite tasty, with the strength only coming through at the end. Pretty good stuff.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Big Time Brewing Company--Decade India Pale Ale--1998 22 oz. Bottle. 7.80% ABV. (4.5 / 5.0) WOW Hoppy aroma. Golden rich pale IPA color. Rich sweetish body flows into big hop finish. Very floral and bitter. Front and finish overwhelm body throwing the brew a little off balance. Sampled 12/11/1998

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Thanks to AmEricanbrew. Poured a hazed dark gold with yeasty floaties. Can still smell a good amount of hops. Citrus and pine with a sweet bready malt. Hop forward flavor but mellowed by time. Pine finish with a mild-moderate bitter finish. Balanced great with sweet malt and a semi-dry finish. Light to medium bodied. Aged but not oxidized and nicley melded flavors. Pretty good stuff.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Cloudy amber with a thin head. Mild smell of piney hops and caramel. Full bodied and smooth. decent taste is first a sweetbread maltiness then a mostly bitter alcohol taste to finish. Their Bagwhan ipa is much better than this. 06/08/2007

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Hazy orange colour. No head. Nice grassy, caramelly hop aroma. Teaish flavour from the hops. High bitterness, nicely rough. Peppery, too.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Amber colour with a weak head. Nice aroma of caramel and heavy hops. Flavour of caramel and citrus-like from the hops. Ends up bitter, fruity and very much of citrus.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: A hazy orange beer with no head. The aroma is very powerfully sweet with lots of hops. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of both caramel and hops, and a very thick body.

name: Big Time Decade India Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Light hazy orange colour with a white head. Caramel malty, light citric, hoppy aroma and taste, sweet. Medium to full body with a light sweet, light alcoholic finish.

name: Big Time Pachyderm Pilsner
review: On tap at brewery. Pours clear yellow. Smell is light lager, bit of honey. Taste is a clean easy drinking lager. Solid.

name: Big Time Pachyderm Pilsner
review: Nose of grass and sourdough bread notes. A little grain. Pours golden slight chill haze soft head nicd lace. Bread saaz hops grass. Real bitter finish but i like bitter so its ok w me. Nice flavors but maybe tone bitterness down just a bit.

name: Big Time Pachyderm Pilsner
review: @ hopvine first review was pretty harsh, though not far from the mark. uber bitter and smells musky (like an elephant?)

name: Big Time Pachyderm Pilsner
review: Czech Saaz hops just don't do it for me--at all. This blonde colored ale is no exception with its stanky American standard flavor and unpleasantly bitter/sour finish. A yucky offering from Big Time (their worst) and a complete waste.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: On tap at brewery: Really aromatic beer. Green, earthy, grassy and wholesome hop flavors. Sweet caramel malts complemented well. Tasty stuff.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: On tap at Big Time in Seattle, WA--Poured a thin amber body with a small white head. Spicy, floral, nutty, creamy nose. Not very exciting for an IPA.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: Clear amber with a tight viscous head that lingers. Nice, subtle aroma of spicy hop and cascade tree resins. Super smooth cask brew with pine tree hopflavors and a mild caramel malty sweetness to balance. My favorite beer style to drink cask, and this was a good one.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: Crystal. On tap at the brewery 12/30/05.Pours a pale, slightly cloudy amber with a modest head. The malt stays in the background, showcasing the cops but balancing nicely; the hops themselves offer with a lovely dry bitterness without the strong citrus-and-pine of many of the popular PacNW varieties. The mouthfeel is good, and the beer is superbly drinkable. (As an aside, I’d call this an American Pale Ale rather than an IPA.) 7/3/9/4/17=4.0. Amarillo. On tap at the brewery 7/22/06. Pours cloudy amber orange with a nice fluffy head. The aroma is divine, a piney, citric wonderment of Amarillo hops. The flavor - well, let’s not pretend that this is a complex or subtle beer. It’s not. It’s hop juice, and I mean than in a good way. This one is plain and simple a showcase for the hops, and with lovely hops like these, that actually works quite well. I pick up a bit too much alcohol and resin in the flavor (and the malts are hiding like scared fieldmice) but the hops come through with more big juicy flavor than bitterness, despite the fact that this is not a particularly sweet IPA. On the whole it works very well, and makes me glad to work just a few blocks from the Big TIme so that I can sample this sort of thing regularly. 9/4/7/3/15=3.8. The batch I sampled 6/18/09 was better rounded, less over the top than my notes indicate about the first go-around -- though some of this may have been that it was on cask. Mt Rainier. Tap at the brewery 7/4/2007. For me, this was a first encounter with this Hallertau-family hop variety. The aroma is modest but enjoyable; the flavor comes through not powerfully but with a pleasant complexity that compensates for the relatively thin malt backbone of the beer. It’s not at all a pine and orange blast like most of the Big Time IPAs, but rather we get a somewhat resiny, mildly floral, mildly spicy, well-balanced hop flavor that renders it a delicously drinkable beer, lighter in feel than Scarlet Fire or Baghwan’s. Nice! 7/4/8/4/15=3.8 Liberty. Tap at the brewery 12/21/07. Pours a cloudy amber with a nice head and strong lacing. Sweet, gentle nose of candied gummi peach and overripe bartlett pear. While the opening flavor is likewise sweet and soft, orchard juice warmed by gentle candied malt, it quickly turns to a bitter and somewhat astringent finish atop a noticeable diacetyl . The hops close soapy with a bit of grapefruit pith. Spot-on mouthfeel, the carbonation textured but not aggressive. Pretty good, but not among my favorites of their IPAs or even of their their hopfest varieties. 7/3/7/4/14=3.5 Ahtanum. Tap at the brewery 7/16/08. This hop makes for a really nice fruity IPA, on the sweet side but not sticky, just not aggressively bitter. Citrus and amarillo-like tropical fruits/peaches, a hint of wood. I really like this stuff. 8/4/8/4/15 =3.9

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: Murky red-amber with a foamy white head and nice lacing. Light citrus and pine hops in the nose. Toasted malts. Fruity and sweet aroma. The flavor is a little nutty with a ton of toasted malts. Bitter hops and a lot of citrus and pine hops again. Warm and fruity finish with a ton of fresh hops.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: (Draught) Sampled at Big Time Brewpub in Seattle on March 2, 2007. Lasting white head with a deep orange body. Nose is very piney. Not hoppy crisp but malt balanced in a strange way. Short bitter finish. Good stuff.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: Draught at the brewpub. Hazy amber. Fruity and sweet with soft mouthfeel. The hops doesn’t provide much flavour, instead it packs a severe, inky punch of late bitterness. Not my favourite beer at this otherwise fantastic brewpub.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: (GABF05) Lightly hazed lemon yellow body with white head. Aroma is medium sweet, grapefruit, some pine. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, peach, some pine. Watery light-medium body.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: (Draft: Big Time Brewery and Alehouse in Seattle, WA) I’ve liked every single-hop beer featuring Simcoe hops I’ve tried, and it continues with this offering. It’s citrusy, grapefruity, but somewhat mild mannered. Lightly sweet pale malts provide a solid yet gentle base for the hops. Grapefruit really takes ahold of the finish. Similar characteristics in the nose, it’s grapefruity and hoppy, with a lightly sweet maltiness. Seems every bit as bitter as their standard IPA. Hazy amber color is darker than the IPA but the off-white head shows the same fade to a ring, and intricate lacing seems limited to the top part of the glass. Nice tasting beer that does a nice job of showcasing the Simcoe hops, but it doesn’t excite my senses.

name: Big Time Hopfest
review: Said, "Simsoe" hops of the day... unremarkable, try again. Sad but true! And I really love this little bar too.

name: Big Time Redemption Nitrogen Ale
review: Cloudy amber, fine white nitrogen head. Smells like grapefruit juice...tasted like grapefruit juice. Quite interesting these Amarillo hops are.

name: Big Time Redemption Nitrogen Ale
review: Hazy light brown, thick tan head. Citrus hop nose. Grapefruit hop flavor with lasting finish

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 18/09/2010 Hoppy aroma. Bronze coloured fruity hoppy and a little rich on the palate with a hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: (Draught at GABF) cloudy orange-brown with a creamy tan head. Nose of brown sugar, sweet grain, caramel and chocolate malt. Taste of sweet toasty raisins, caramel, sharp citrus hops. Creamy with an alcohol linger.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: On tap at Big Time. Poured amber with an off white head. Aroma was crisp, hoppy, and a small hint of lemon. Lightly bitter with medium sweetness. Body was medium and this had a bitter finish.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark copper color with a small white head. A sweet earthy hop nose. The flavor is smooth and easy; pine, sweeter citrus notes, fruity, earthy as are all of Big Time’s. Good.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: Dark auburn pour with a lingering head and really nice lace. TOns of malt in the nose. Caramel, toffee, some fruity notes. Very malty flavors, lots of caramel, dark fruit, toast and a touch of dryness - chocolate or roast. Hardly any detectable hop balance, but never too cloying or unpleasant.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: Draught. High fluffy off-white lasting head. Hazy golden body. Chccolate sweet aroma. Hoppy choccolate flavor without being bitter. Low carbonation, long aftertaste.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: Tap (a month or so ago). Dark copper appearance with small head. Sprightly mouthfeel with some sticky hops and alcohol. fruit and hops well balanced with some malts. Very fresh tasting, well done.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: Not sure what they were aiming for. Thin, wet dog and cardboard malt component. Dark, stale molasses. Plums and raisins, veggies, obnoxiously bitter for the style.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: On tap at Big Time. Pours clear dark copper with a full sweet body and light carbonation. Citrus toffee nose. Toffee and fruit in the taste. Nice finish.

name: Big Time Nemesis Strong Ale
review: Draft at the brewpub. Medium amber, looks quite still, with a thin but moussy tan head. Big orange and coriander nose. Styrupy creamy sweet mid-palate, with resiny bitterness and then that near-peppercorn tang of some spice or other...definitely seems like a coriander’s in there. Unique and really pretty awesome.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Bottle: Cloudy pale yellow with a foamy, bright white head. Lemon/grapefruit scent. Taste is mild pine and citrus-peel. A pretty nice, easy-going pale ale....bright and clean.... Nothing amazing, but solid.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Served from 12oz bottle into English pint glass. A 1" sudsy white head slowly drops with abundant lacing on the glass. Color is hazy yellow orange with mild streaming carbonation. Aroma of floral and pine along with yeasty bread notes and some spice. Mouthfeel is light to medium and resinous. Flavors of pine, floral, and some lemon hops, white bread and some sort of spices. Overall: this one was good but not what I personally expect in an English style pale ale.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Pour from a summer sampler is deep gold with thin head. Bready malt and citrus hops are balanced by a nice dry, clean light flavor. Medium body and active fizz, finishes nice crisp and dry.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Lemon zest nose. Cloudy amber, medium head. Lemon zest, tea. Medium body, easy carbonation.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Bottle from the mixed case at Bj's Mostly clear light golden color with a decent bubbly white head. Sweet bready and faint caramel maltiness beneath some light citrus and pine. Not horribly exciting but nothing objectionable either.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Hazy, yellow-orange pour with a white head. The aroma has pale malt and light earthy hops. It has medium body with crisp texture and lively carbonation. The taste is bittersweet with a slightly dry finish.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle from the Summer Sampler case purchased at Liberty Beerin in Pittsburgh. A nice reliable Pale Ale without any pretensions.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Pours a pure golden with a thin white head. Citrusy and a bit tart with a slight vanilla taste. Pretty good pale ale.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Poor aroma, appearance typical. Taste is basic and doesn’t offer anything in way of complexity for the palate. It’s an alright beer but I probably won’t have it again.

name: Samuel Adams Pale Ale
review: Bottle. It pours a dark hazy gold color with a frothy cream color head. The aroma is floral and earthy. The taste is slightly sweet. Overall, a nice tasting g easy drinking pale ale.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Gold/amber with clingy white head. Nose is very light apple. Flavor is sweet apple start with a slight sweet finish. ok

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Aroma is mostly apples, deadened by a bit of head on the pour. Very one-dimensional, a bit of a sharp taste, with a tart aftertaste on the tongue.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Originally rated on 6/4/08. Never had this before, its pours a fizzy golden body with a rather thin white head and spotty lacing. The aroma was of overipe apples and alcohol. the taste mirrored the smell. mouthfeel was thin but crisp, and it went down easy. overall it was a nice change of pace, and i would say its worth a try.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Bottle. Clear golden color. Aroma of tart apple skins and subtle vinegar. Taste is plain apple.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: A GOOD WAY TO DRINK OF THIS CEDDARS IS AT BEER FESITVELS. THEY’RE SO LOTS OF CEDDAR TO TRY 2 SIPS OF AND ITS GOOD. ESCPESHALLY WHEN ITS SO HOT OUTSIDE 2 SIPS OF CEDDAR BEERS AND YOU FEELING GREAT. HORNBY’S TASTE GOOD AND NOT TO SWEET OR TO MUCH APPEL FLAYVER BUT HAS A JUST A LITTLE BEER TASTE TO. DO YOU THINK THEY’RE THINK TO PUT IT IN TALL BOYS? THIS WOULD DRINK PRETTY GREAT AT THE POOL. BUT THOSE BASTE$)s KEEP TELLING ME STOP BRINGING GLASS. I HAVE A SUPRISES FOR THEM EHEHEHEHEHEH!!!

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Bottle. Clear orange pour with no head. Green apple. A little dryness on the finish but still some juicy apple sweetness here too. Pretty good.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Look: pours a light golden color. Very clear. White head but not very strong head. Smell: apples. Apple juice not cider. Champaign. Taste: heavy champaign. Light Apple juice. Feel: very dry. Medium carbonation. Overall: ok cider if u like champaign. Very dry. First drank: home 12/23/14

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Bottle at home. Pours Amber gold with no head. Aroma is sweet apes. Flavor follows. Fairly sweet. Finishes clean. Nice cider. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with a fizzy white head that dissipated immediately. Aroma is apples, acetic, sugar. Mouthfeel is decent with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a tart following. Overall this is so so and comes across unnaturally sweet.

name: Hornsby's Amber Hard Cider
review: "a touch darker and mustier than the other Hornsby’s. i originally liked it a little better, but in the end, they’re about the same...just ok. nothing bad, nothing great."

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Dark amber with a frothy beige head. Smell of soy sauce. Rich malty taste with cocoa notes. Low carbonation.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: When you've got some time to spare, take a look at the history of this brewery. It's quite remarkable, not to say very interesting. I combined this beer with a lentils curry. It's a dark brown beer with a nice foam head. A very rich taste for the moment the day turns to dusk and time runs a little slower

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Copper colored, small beige head. Aromas of caramel, bread, malt and alcohol. Taste of caramel, malt and alcohol.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Keg at GBBF 2016, Kensington Olympia. Clear, deep brown with a dense offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit, dates and big malt. Full flavour, with nice sweet fruity notes and chewy and roasty malt.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Color granate muy oscuro con reflejos rojo rubí muy bonitos, sin turbiedad, translúcida. Espuma beige claro de medio dedo de espesor y corta retención. Aroma escaso a maltas tostadas y ligero caramelo. Sabor a maltas tostadas, madera quemada, caramelo ligeramente quemado, almendras y nueces, notas a hierbas aromáticas y regaliz al atemperar, final ligeramente seco de moderado amargor herbal, alcohol bien integrado. Textura acuosa y levemente oleosa. Carbonatación media baja. Cerveza muy disfrutable que pide trago largo.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Sweet, smooth and light on its toes. Caramel, plums, raisins in the nose after a big, beautiful pour. Goes down easier than is safe. Seems like it should be heavier than it is. A good one to drink at home. Poured from a 500ml bottle after its glorious journey from Germany to Wisconsin.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Dunkler Doppelbock mit 7,1 % Alk. und 18,5 % Stammwürze. Sehr dunkle Farbe. Geringe Schaumentwicklung. Wirklich sehr malzig, noch nicht zu süß. Harmonisch herbe Noten. Genug feinperlige Kohlensäure, um schön lebendig zu sein. Karamalz für Erwachsene.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Bottled at beer run. Dark amber with brown hue, caramel flavor and smooth aftertaste.

name: Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel
review: Dark brown in color with a very small head. Not a heavy feel in the mouth. Slightly sweet with a good malt flavor. Not much of an aroma, but my nose is not that good.

name: Three Hearts Famous Export
review: Klar lys gul med hvitt skum. Aroma malt korn eple. Smak eple malt humle. Middels fylde, moderat bitter. Boks i gave fra Roger

name: Three Hearts Extra Strong
review: Jävligt god öl. En av mina favoriter. Det är ju krönleins bryggeri som har gjort den. De gör riktigt god öl. Den är väldigt god för att vara en 7,5a :)

name: Three Hearts All Malt
review: Bottled sometimes in the late 90’s. A pale, aromatic, fresh lager with a distinct flavour and nice bitterness. Pilsnerish, slim and really pleasant.

name: Three Hearts All Malt
review: OK for such a low OG, a dry, yellow pilsner in a German style. Nice bitter aftertaste.

name: Three Hearts All Malt
review: Nice pilsener from Krönleins. Maybe could have been little bit stronger. Discontinued.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: 2/5 i mörkhet. Luktar spritigt och maltigt. Ganska fyllig och söt och spritig i smaken. Spritig eftersmak.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Canned. Pale golden, small head. Malty marcipan aroma. Flavor brings so much alcohol I am about to throw up. Honestly, why brew a beer like this? And why accept it at Systembolaget? Obviously, someone at Systembolaget must have tried this and considered it good enough to be sold...

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: (50 cl can from Systembolaget) Clear golden color, medium size white head. Sweet malt and alcohol scent. Thick sirupy mouthfeel. Sweet sugary and malty taste. Low bitterness.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Canned (as TH Strongest Brew XXX). Pale yellow colouor, mediumsized white head. Aroma is malts, metal, alcohol along with some salty notes. Flavour is watery with weak sting of alcohol coming in. Some sweet malts also. Nice product, since it hides the ABV surprisingly well.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Can, "XXX Strong" (BB 01/2007). Pale yellow, very small white head. Sweet alcoholic nose. Slightly fruity, sugary-malty, alcoholic but not attacking strong. "Nice" product when trying to get drunk and quickly.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Can. Golden colour with a small white head. Light sweet malty, grainy aroma and a sweet malty, fruity taste. Medium body with a light alcoholic finish.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Can. Clear yellow coloured with a white head. Sweet aroma of malts, fruits and alcohol. Sweet flavour of malts and alcohol. Very alcoholic finish.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Yellow beer with a white head. Malty aroma with a corn like sweetness and notes of alcohol. Malty and sweet flavor.

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: (Can 50 cl) Very pale golden pretty much without a head. Slightly perfumy and very sweet without any real traces of hops. Extremely potent and full-bodied but considering it’s not overly unpleasant or alcoholic. Definitely above standard for it’s style. 081101

name: Three Hearts Strongest Brew
review: Dark golden with a small fizzy head. Sweet, flat aroma. Sweet, alcoholic flavour, notes of rotten fruit. Sugary, alcoholic finish.

name: Ingos Hammer Lager
review: [Bottled, rating from 1998] Ingo, that is the former world heavyweight boxing champion Ingemar Johansson, was given the dubious honours to have a beer called after him. As all beer with this kind of trendy marketing most of it’s character is on the outside bottle rather than inside, because this was one of Krönlein’s more boring offerings. It still has a little bit of that freshness that I like with Krönleins though. It poured pale yellow. The body is extremely light (for a heavy weight champion), and had no bite at all.

name: Three Hearts Julöl Extra Strong
review: Rating from way back. A dark brown/red-coloured beer. The brewery claims that it is a double bock, and I’d say that it is pretty close to the style. It has a nice head, powerful bitterness and feels rather "thick".

name: Three Hearts Julöl Extra Strong
review: Amber coloured. Sweet and alcohol-filled....................................

name: Kaltenberg Oktoberfest
review: From backlog. 0,5 litre Bottle from Systembolaget Charlottenberg. Amber with white head. Malts, hops, sweetness and some Citrus.

name: Kaltenberg Oktoberfest
review: Backlog. 500 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber with white head. Light malty, fruity with low to medium bitterness.

name: Halmstad Cider Äpple
review: Golden color with a smal bubbly head. Sweet artificial apple aroma and flavor. Never again..... [Can from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

name: Halmstad Cider Päron
review: Pale stuff with artificial aroma and flavor. Could have been nice on a hot summer day. It was rather unpleasant instead. Not recommendable. [No thanxxx to my sister for giving me the opportunity to taste this]

name: San Miguel Pale Pilsen
review: Thanks yantarcoast for the tip where to find it. Clear pale yellow, large airy white head of mediocre retention. Aroma: pilsner malt, walnut, a hint of alcohol. Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Taste: sweetish malts, restraint fruitiness. Low bitterness. I'll hardly remember the beer but I'll do remember the country tick.

name: San Miguel Pale Pilsen
review: From a can to a glass. Pours a clear yellow or very light gold color with a frothy foamy head. Aroma is Corn malt and slight bready note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight earthy hop note. Medium light mouthfeel. Average Pilsner.

name: San Miguel Pale Pilsen
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours a bright gold with a thin white head gone immediately. Scents of malt and biscuit. Dry malt flavor with some metallic hops notes to mimic pilsner imperfectly. Drinkable but roughly made.

name: San Miguel Pale Pilsen
review: 05.10.2019 -- 0.32l bottle from asia shop in freiburg. pours s clear pale golden with a frothy head. aroma of corn, lemon, cereals. flavour of lemon, lemondrops, corn, some zest. drinkable actually.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Can, labeled as 5%. Not sure I should thank lubiere. Corn and adjunct, slight skunk and sweet, high carbonation and mild body, only dry in the sense that if you get dry heaves after it might help. Well maybe not that bad but definitely not good. Or even decent. Blah.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Bottle from a Makati 7-11. Poured a clear straw colour with a fizzy white head. The aroma is malt, mineral, light hop. The flavour is moderate sweet, moderate to light bitter with a watery sweet malt, corn, grainy, light woody hop bitter palate. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Awful. Really awful. Sweet and sickly.Hard to finish a 330ml bottle and not even thirst-quenching.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Bottle on Boracay. Zlata farba, bez peny. Vona sladova, kukuricna. Chut sladova, kukuricna, jemne travnata.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Can - Light corn, lemon and a touch of pale malt. Clear gold with a frothy white head. Light hop bight, bit of pale malt and a dry finish. Of the series one of the better ones.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Clear golden, thick white head. Usual low quality beer from San Miguel, but with less corn taste.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer Appearance: Light orange, minimal head, a lot of lacing Aroma: Strong scent smell of alcohol, nothing else Taste: not really great Mouth feel: very carbonated Overall: good beer for the hot weather in the Philippines, and to get drunk quickly at the fastest rate and the most inexpensive way

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Bottle brought home from the Philippines by a friend. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light corn and light citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Watery. 201215

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: Bottle. Clear pale yellow with large foamy white head, faint malt aroma, high carbonation, crisp malt taste, smooth, abrupt finish. Nice for a lager.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: From a bottle. Not as bad as most of the other rubbish these guys put out, pretty fresh and not over ’processed’ tasting.

name: San Miguel Super Dry
review: From historic notes, bottles drunk in Davao, Philippines. Poured a light golden colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma of sweet malts, corn-chips and citrus hops. Light-medium body. Light dry bitterness in finish.

name: Pike Pale
review: Proeverij bij de brouwerij in Seattle. Maltig, citrus, bitters, hoppig. (9-2016).

name: Pike Pale
review: Bomber from Total Wine, Gainesville. Pours amber brown with a small dusting of a beige head. Aroma of honey, fall leaves, slight fruits. Flavor is nutty leaves, light fruitiness, a little citrusy but that’s quickly taken over by the roasted malt. Totally drinkable, but not out of this world.

name: Pike Pale
review: On tap at Pike Brewing. A well made beer, nothing flash, just a solid, very drinkable pale.

name: Pike Pale
review: Bottle, Orcas Island. Pretty clear, dark amber, big bubble foam. Sweet amber beer, nutty brown malt. Distant bitter. Old school. Not my vibe. Fruity overtones. Alright.

name: Pike Pale
review: (tap) clear bright amber colour with a small white head, faint aroma of honey, creamy palate, assertive balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish

name: Pike Pale
review: Clear amber with a creamy head. Not much aroma, perhaps some floral/ citrusy thing going on. Dry, typical pale ale flavor. Not bad, but nothing special, either.

name: Pike Pale
review: Tap at Pike. Clear reddish orange pour with a smaller white head. Earthy, hoppy, slightly metallic.

name: Pike Pale
review: Draught at Hops ’n Headz, Bellingham, WA, as Heirloom Amber Ale, 5.3% ABV Golden color, medium sized head. Regular blond Ale, a bit sweetish, but with decent hop touch, although the final is a bit too mild. Easy, not bad.

name: Pike Pale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a softly hazed amber with a thin white head. Soft malt, a touch of dusty citrus. Medium bodied, toast, soft sweet malt. Toast, dull citrus. Soft malt, gentle toast.

name: Pike Pale
review: A decent pale ale. Pours light amber, malty aroma, with a medium body. Biscuit and caramel. Tried with Josh at the brewery in 2016.

name: Pike IPA
review: Draft: Poured a clear golden color ale with a nice large white foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of citrus notes with some malt notes perceptible. Taste is also a mix of citrus hops notes with some light bitterness and some malt notes also perceptible. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nothing earth shattering but enjoyable west coast style IPA.

name: Pike IPA
review: Draft at the brewery. Clear, light amber with lacing head. citrusy and piney, a smooth, balanced IPA.

name: Pike IPA
review: A vice tasty IPA, discovered this beer on a trip to Seattle, very hard to find in Canada, if you can find it, try it very enjoyable

name: Pike IPA
review: Dorada consistentemente turbia, de abundante espuma cremosa. Aroma intenso lupulado, Muy suave en boca. Muy amarga, Intensa, frutal. Uva, pomelo. Buena IPA

name: Pike IPA
review: Proeverij bij de brouwerij in Seattle. Flink bitter, citrus, licht bloemig. (9-2016).

name: Pike IPA
review: Bottle flew straight form Seatle to Warsaw (Poland). Aromat hoppy sweet citrus. Medium to light bitterness. Not bad.

name: Pike IPA
review: Hazy orange with thin lacy head. Very fruity aroma, lots of citrus especially. Very sharp hop taste, really smacks you quick. Not too intense though it mellows to a more manageable fruity hop. Then finishes with quite caramely malts. Decent every day IPA.

name: Pike IPA
review: Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a plastic cup. Nice copper color with an off-white head. A little caramel and citrus on the nose. Medium body, average carbonation and moderate bitter. Bitter, but short finish. Simple, but refreshing.

name: Pike IPA
review: Pours a clear golden brown on tap with fluffy off-white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of mild piney and floral hops over deep caramel malt. Taste follows, a clean old school west coast IPA. It's ok.

name: Pike IPA
review: On tap at brewery on 1st Street, downtown Seattle. Pours dark gold with thick off-white head and lacing (my son called it crown lacing, so I’m going to adopt that descriptor, thanks to him!). Aroma: citrus, tropical flowers. Flavor: malt-forward (brown sugar, honey), floral. Mouthfeel: medium-bodied, soft on palette.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: Tried for the first time back in 2011. Poured Golden, thick foamy head. Aroma of bready and a little citrus. Flavor is more malty than expected.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: Pike Brewing Company--Pike Golden Ale--1998 Release--12 oz. Bottle--4.70% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Golden Ale--Bright light red golden color. Very nice malt flavor light but rich. Nice hop notes. Very tasty. Sampled 9/19/1998. Pike Brewing Company--Pike Golden Ale--Small Logo--1999 Release--12 oz. Bottle--4.70% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Golden Ale--Clear bright amber golden color. Earthy light floral hop front. Light textured roasted caramel malt body has crisp earthy pale ale richness. Light hop spice tinge finishes well balanced light brew. Sampled 6/24/1999.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: Another impressive brew from Pike- pours a bright golden brown colour with a medium white haed. Aroma is slightly grainy but also of german hops. Semi sweet mouthfeel, light, refreshing and finishes very crisp.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: Hazy gold ,big lasting off white head. Tiny bead. Fresh nose. Fruity malty flavor with decent hopping in the finish

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: Golden brown color, medium head. Slightly hoppy, some maltyness, slightly sweet (apricot?) yeast esters. A session beer (German style). Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is malty, slightly sweet.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: i would like to drink some more of this beer, nice ale......................

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: I would have to agree, this beer comes across clean and refreshing, the balanced brew is smooth and has a great finish.

name: Pike Golden Ale
review: A good clean tasting beer. Hops and malts are well balanced and the beer comes across clean and fresh.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Tap @ Pike Brewing Co, Seattle. Pours a deep amber brown, small pale tan head. Caramel nose. Medium bodied, nice toffee presence, a small amount of sweet malt grain. Good wee heavy.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Draft: Poured a clear burgundy color ale with a medium off-white foamy head with OK retention and light carbonation. Aroma of caramelized malt with light toffee notes is enjoyable. Taste is also a mix of caramelized malt notes, some toffee with some residual sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not the most complex offering from the style but enjoyable nonetheless.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Draft at the brewery. Dark amber color. Malty, with a slight hint of smoky scotch.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Warm and malty flavour, but lacking something. A bit too sweet and a little too unbalanced for my taste

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Hint of musk amd some florals. Amber pour with good head. Light caramel. Light sweet end. Tap at brewery.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Cobriza de buena espuma y buen aspecto. Aroma escaso, malteado. En boca es suave y de predominio malteado, tirando a dulce, con contrapunto de tono ahumado, ligeramente lupulado.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Fles 35,5cl in Seattle. Lichte rooksmaak wegens peated scotch whisky malts, carameltonen, wat maltig. Apart. (8-2016).

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Bottle flew straight form Seatle to Warsaw (Poland). Aroma caramel, toffee, bread. Little bitternes.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Bottle in Seattle. Ring of soft offwhite foam on a darker Ruby amber body. Lightly peaty and fruit forward malt aroma. Medium body with dry red fruit skin and a hint of metallic and peaty malts. Boring but enjoyable enough. Soft mid palate with some malt bitterness by finish. Classical American example of style.

name: Pike Kilt Lifter
review: Pours a clear copper brown on tap with thin ring of bubbly off-white head that leaves light lace. Aroma and taste of typical scotch ale, earthy hops, sweet and dark malts, a hint of fruity esters, booze is lighter here. Decent.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: 30-Jul-17 (12-oz bottle: Purchased 09-Apr-07 for $5.58 at Liquid Solutions in Tigard, OR) This aged Barley Wine pours a very hazy, amber-brown body, but just a ring of large bubbles because when I popped the cap, there was no carbonation rush. So, yeah, it's pretty close to flat. The nose is earthy and very caramely, with aromas of wort, decayed logs, toffee, and some milk chocolate. On the palate, lots and lots of caramel, but it's not nearly as sweet as expected. Earthy logs, lightly toasted bread, fig, and dried apricot, but the finish is strangely reminiscent of a slightly smoky Pilsener like the famous Urquell. The beer is medium-full in weight, low in carbonation, and because it's not that sweet and there's a touch of earthy acidity, it's not heavy or cloying in the least. Overall, with the exception of the low carbonation due to the twist top, this is very tasty and enjoyable.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: Boozy with lots of caramel. Pours hazy orange with good head and lacing. Bittersweet boiled down with tobacco. Tap at brewery.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: August 8, 2014 - with blankboy, gregclow, jercraigs and mabel. Bomber. Ruby-copper pour, nice creamy tan mottled head. Hoo yeah, US barleywine aroma all right - alcohol, floral/resin bitterness - lots of sweet cereal/gluten grain. Taste follows - strong, malty and big bitterness to match - just the thing (8+). Solid body, chewy, decent carbonation - big mellow bitter/boozy/malty finish ... I would grab this again in a shot.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: Bomber, 2012 vintage. Caramel malt aroma with notes of peaty smoke, dark fruit and grassy and floral hops. Pours cloudy caramel colored with a thin tan head that has little retention or lacing. Starts with caramel malt and dark fruit flavors with peaty smoke notes. Finishes dry with grassy and floral hops as well as light citrus hops. Pretty good barleywine.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: This gets worse as it goes along. Smells nicely of grass and molasses, with a nice similar first flavor. However, it gets sweeter the deeper in the bottle get, which, for a 2-year old bottle isn’t great. Maybe it’ll mellow out even more as it gets older, but I was hoping for a bit more here.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: It pours cloudy medium brown with a tinge of orange and a light brown head. The aroma has plenty of sweet malt with bread and caramel. It also has aroma of plums and floral elements. It also has hints of citrus that is orange like. The malt is predominant with a balance between the esters and hops in the background. The malt flavors are sweet with the hop balance being somewhat aggressive with a moderate alcohol element in the taste. It has bread and caramel malt richness in the flavors with floral hops and citrus that in orange like. There are also hints of plums and the alcohol does has a hint of whiskey element in it as well. It has a chewy body with moderately high alcohol warming that is a slight tinge hot, but not unpleasant. It is somewhat dry and the floral hops and dryness linger on the palate. Overall, this is a malt forward barley wine that is moderately hop aggressive as the beer warms.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: 2013 vintage. Nice maltiness, caramel and clove. Was a bit of medicinal taste on first sip. Pretty rounded as you might expect with a three year old barleywine.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: 22oz bottle, winter 2015 edition. Hazy dark amber, with a thin but lasting head, and spotty lace. Aroma is malty, caramel, smoke, peat, raisin. Flavor is sweet and malty up front, lots of caramel and dried fruit, a touch of peat, with some citrusy hops on the finish.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed amber brown with a medium sized tan head. Big sticky malt on the nose, sweet and fruity, a hint of isopropyl. Medium bodied, big and malty, rather sticky fruity malt. Slow malt, sticky and sweet. Big plum and prune notes. Long malt and soft bitterness into the finish, a bit of warming alcohol.

name: Pike Old Bawdy
review: Pours a hazy reddish brown. Aromas of hops, caramel malts, kind of medicinal. Flavor is to strong for me, big alcohol taste, malty with a citrus taste.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Draft at Pike Pub in Seattle, WA. Dark body, small head. Alcohol noticeable for such a light brew. Good deal of hops with some lingering woodiness.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: For those with a zest for dark porters, the Pike Old 89 is a wise choice. Pours a dark amber-brown body with a handsome tan head. Described as a modern version of an old world beers, Old 89 heads out much like an English stout, while coming at you with rich coffee tonus and closing with a particularly malleable, lightsome finish.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: on tap at the brewpub. quite dark with a thin, lasting off-white head. some cocoa powder and whipped cream in the aroma, smooth and drinkable, faint tartness and a little after dinner mint

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Tap at brewpub. Good nose, choc/coffee/mocha. Little egg or salty too. Classic brown/ black color. Good head that faded. Sweet and bitter flavors, chocolate/ soap/ tinny. Thin bodied, sweet dry finish. Slightly off from a classic porter. Just alright.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: hat this on tap and it was pretty good, I compare it as a tasty version of guniess. It was very creamy with decent lacing, and the taste was very full, very much a decent porter. I will go with this one again if I go back.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Had it on Tap, was supprised on this rendition of the old classic. My buddy thought it was better than a good Guiness I didn’t agree but still thought it was a damn good nitro brew. I did pick up a bit of ’wateriness’ that was a bit dristracting and the creaminess wasn’t up to par with what I look for in a Guiness style beer. But all in all this is brew can stand w/ the best of what I normally find of tap in Washington.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Dark brown/ruby, tan light head/lacing. The aroma is chocolaty with some mocha & coffee. Watery, metallic. The flavor is salty with some astringent malts. Very light and too dry.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Bottle(sample bottling) pours black with brown highlights, nice cream colored frothy head, with clingy lacing.   Roasted malts and a major amount of butter on the nose.   Forwardly butter like with minor roasted malt flavor.   By the middle and through to the finish the flavor falls off the boat and is completely gone after I swallow.   Maybe a light flavor of coffee or dark chocolate on the exit, but VERY light.   Body and mouthfeel are decent, but this is one that I will soon forget.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: Tap@Pike. Sweet caramel and toast, some roasted malt, soft and light. Also noticed odd aromas of sweat and nappies, which made it a bit more interesting.

name: Pike Old 89 Nitro Porter
review: This actually surprised the hell out of me. I tend to find nitro beers watered down beyond belief and aching to be gulped...not this one. This was wonderfully balanced between the roasted barley and great chocolate notes. I would be lying if I said this didn't carry with it the nitro characteristic of a less-than-full aroma, but the appearance makes up for it right?

name: Pike Weisse
review: Nitro tap@ Pike. Clear golden color with lasting white head. Light apricot, dusty pale malt, wheaty yeasty aromas. Super smooth medium body. Lightly tart wheat flavors with mild clove, banana yeast, and mild earth____smooth easy finish---not bad.

name: Pike Weisse
review: "there were only a couple brews at Pike that i DIDN’T like, but this was the worst of em. A weak ass beer, even for a hefe. a muddled slightly unpleasant aroma atop an unassuming beer in both body and flavor. one to avoid."

name: Pike Weisse
review: Not included in the Sampler, so I ordered a glass after I tried all the rest. It was a good decision as this is a decent Hefeweizen.

name: Pike Weisse
review: On tap at the brewery. Poured cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma was lemon. Medium sweetness, no bitterness, and a thin body.

name: Pike Weisse
review: this was very wheaty. I had this in my first visit and like the amber weisse better

name: Pike Weisse
review: 2010-07-05. Crisp dark yellow with a small white head. 3+ Mild aroma is lightly estery, touch of wheat. Flavour is thinner than hoped, fruity esters, tart grainy wheat in the finish lingers in the aftertaste. Average palate. bit dull but okay. On tap at Pike Place brewpub, Seattle

name: Pike Weisse
review: Draught at Brewpub, Seattle, WA, USA. Slightly hazy pale golden colour with small white head. Citrus, wheat and spices in aroma. Wheat, sweetish fruits, citrus and some mild hops in flavour. Slightly thin.

name: Pike Weisse
review: Draught at the brewpub. Served with lemon, which took over the nose. Some banana, clove, and ginger in there too. A bland American wheat ale cum weizen. Banana, lemon, and ginger in the mouth. Not very crisp or refreshing. Mediocre.

name: Pike Weisse
review: Tap at the brewpub. I suggest this is more of a wheat beer than a hefe. Eh. Hazy golden amber with a creamy white head. Mild malt/wheat aroma. Medium body; mild carbonation. Flavor is light wheat/malt with a little Belgian yeast/spice. Hints of fruit. Very refreshing. Might be some citrus, but they stuck a lemon on it. So?

name: Pike Weisse
review: tap at brewery. pours a clear golden with a small offwhite head. creamy wheat. light toast grass and sourdough notes. pears. okay.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Draft at the brewery. Opaque with a frothy, tan head. Aroma of chocolate and dark roast coffee. Smooth and creamy.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: 65cl bottle at home (27 IV 2019), as Pike XXXXX Stout. Allready shared such a bottle at a beer geeks gathering, now let's have this world class stout a go at a more convenient pace. The black tanned brew with orange-red to even brown gloom - never being sticky, whatsoever - comes with almost no foam. The beer is pitch-black at its core. The nose has a typical dry stout character, with a herbal and even creamy body. Think of black chocolate, of course, but also several hints at cacao, cigar, chocolate ice cream topping. The roasted malts are omnipresent. The mouthfeel is very soft, with just a hidden carbonation at best. The body is a sour, with different bitter chocolate and smoked malt features. Sweetness is unresponsive, which is nice. This continues being a good-old stout, so don't expect an explosion of taste sensations. The warming alcoholic touch is smooth and restrained. Here again, one can just feel those creamy, yeasty dashes. At the end, a caramel feeling drops in - making this a great treat.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Ingredients: Water, Malt, Hops, and Yeast....Plain and simple. A nice chocolate stout with good hop finish. Balance close to perfect for this style. Similar to the new Guiness Foreign Extra. This is my first sample from Pike and is a nice start. Solid beer that I would try again.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: 19-Aug-17 (22-oz bottle: Purchased 14-Mar-07 for $4.30 at Liquid Solutions in Tigard, OR) This Stout pours a black body and a thin, tan head due to lower carbonation from the extended cellaring. The nose is very roasty with lots of licorice, scorched earth, char, molasses, and old wood. On the palate, aged, earthy character and dark-roast dominate, with notes of chocolate, cocoa, some coffee, and molasses. The beer is medium in weight, medium-minus in carbonation, and very smooth on the palate. Overall, despite the long cellaring, this is still a very tasty and enjoyable Stout.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Roast and dark chocolate. Light caramel but properly subdued. Pours black with good mocha head. Rich and fairly dry. Velvety texture. Bottlr.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Excellent stout. Lots of bitter chocolates some dried fig and molasses but not too sweet. Typically all the stuff u want in a stout especially if u don’t like the too thick and syrupy type. Liking it more as I sip. Great balance of alcohol and fruit. Sexy beer!

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Proeverij bij de brouwerij in Seattle. Koffie, gebrande mout, flink bitter, licht romig. Ook zoeten. (9-2016).

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: Need an oil change? Smooth rich roasty stout with a dry finish. Very well made ale. A long-time fav. Go to the brewery in the market downtown and hope that it is on nitro... sip slowly and enjoy the moment. Doesn’t get much better.

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: pours opaque from bottle with beige head. very roasted with coffee notes. pretty thin feel. a good obe

name: Pike XXXXX Stout
review: 26/VIII/17 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle, shared @ RBBSG17 - BB: n/a (2017-1362) Thanks to Mathieu the bottle! Clear dark brown beer, small creamy beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: malty, grains, bit yeasty, pretty roasted. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very roasted start, bitter, malty, some coffee, chocolate. Aftertaste: rather bitter, some coffee, chocolate, caramel.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Somewhat grainey and rather dull, this beer sports a hint of roasted nuttiness, some sweet maltiness, but is overall pretty bland and boring.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Deep brown beer. Very faint aroma. Some light nuttiness over the sweet caramel and a light cocoa note. Flavour is pretty bland and watery though. Light sweetness and a touch of nuttiness. Meh.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: clear brown beer with a tan head. dominant choc nose. filed down the throat with ease. pushing mostly malty tones of shakra. mild and easy to drink but not impressive.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Medium brown colour with thin tan head. Medium malt nose with underlying alcohol notes. Mild roasted malt taste with a dry finish.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: on tap at pike. pretty decent brown ale. browny amber, caramel aroma, lightly nutty with a pleasant late saltiness in the finish

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Nut Browns tend to be smooth, but this was very much so. Mild malt, not so overwhelmingly flavorful, but loaded with caramel and slightly toasty nuttiness. Not the most palatable brown, with a malt loaded beer like this the palate should be a given, but this was a touch thin. Overall average, although tasty.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Tap at brewpub, ok nose, lite roasty, carmel & chocolate with a touch of orange. Clean orange brown color. No head. Bitter flavors. baker chocolate and touch of orange/ grapefruit came to mind. Thin bodied, bitter dry finish. I like it, though tad hoppy for a brown ale

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Amber mahogany with no head & some lacing. The aroma is like musky hop dishwater. The flavor is watery with some thick malt & a finish that really cries out for some hop or alcohol balance.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: Tap@Pike. This wasn’t too bad for a brown ale. Not too sweet or sickly, nice nutty malts and not much else, simple, but it tasted OK to me.

name: Pike Bootleg Brown
review: On Tap Pours a bit darker than the Pike Pale Ale but is similar in taste. Floral with a small hop undertone and sweet malt. A slight "woody" aftertaste.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Glad that I got this on clearance. 2nd sample from this brewer and liking what I am seeing so far. This is one of those simple beers. Description says "lots of malt", but the ingredients say "malted barley, water, hops, yeast ......" along with the other spices. Balance works well for me and is a nice representation of a winter ale. Does not seem that malty, and like a lighter version of a barleywine...or has that pale ale feel. Will look for this again next season.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Deep orange. Spice and orange zest with some caramel. Fruity, lightly toasted, medium bitterness. Light citrus tang. Decent.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Charlie Papazian bottle. Sweet and spicy aroma. Spot on with the winter spices. Nicely balanced by the malt. Would be good with a pumpkin pie. Where’s that pie anyway?!?

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed amber brown with a medium sized white head. Soft fruity malt on the nose, toast, a vague hint of spices. Medium bodied, soft and toasty, musk, a bit of dusty dry spices. Warm malt into the finish.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Pours a half finger of head on a dirty dark straw body. The aroma is grain and wet hay, a little barnyard. The taste is mildly sweet: plum and apricot; then some mild bitterness. A bit mushed in flavor. The texture is softer.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: 22 ounce bomber bottle to wine glass Appearance: Orange- brown color(held against light, hazy, minimal off white head, minimal lacing Smell: not a lot of aroma, slight toasted grain smell, hint of alcohol Taste: slight bitterness Mouth feel: Overall Good Beer but will not buy again

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Draught at the Pike Brewing Co, Seattle, WA. Slightly cloudy red brown color with a mid-size creamy tan head. Darkish sweet malt, mild hops and some dryness in the aroma. The flavor is dark hops, moderate bitterness and dry dark malt. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: Draught at Collective on Tap, Woodinville, WA Hazy dark amber color. Some caramel, very light biscuity malts, ordinary bitterness, tiny nuttiness in the final. Not much effort, but at least it’s clean.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: From bottle. Dark amber color. Aroma is light spice, citrus, and caramel malt. Taste is similar, with some coriander and slight bitterness. Lingering spice.

name: Pike Auld Acquaintance
review: 22oz bomber, this is the 3rd time I am buying this beer just to rate it. And you know I really want to rate it because its not a very positive review. Dark orange amber color. Head fades quickly. Aroma is sweet fruity and toasty. Nothing about that is fun or good. There are some poor spices, just a mix of bad stuff.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Pints out of the bottle at Harbour View Restaurant. Soaking wet cold and miserable with 4 hours before the ferry leaves Port Au Basques. Clear yellow lightly sweet and a bit grainy, cold and crisp. Its a macro lager, not anything you wouldn't expect cleanly made. The first one went down in record time as I slowly returned to somewhat normal. The next two paired well with the Greco pizza I savored before heading getting on the ship to head back home.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Bottled. Clear yellow body with small white head. The taste is mellow and yeasty and there almost no finish.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: 341 ml bottle @ Maxwell’s Goose Bay, Labrador. Pours a light, clear straw with a large, light, white head. Aromas are too faint when cold. Tastes are standard macro lager (light grain, corn) with only a subtle hint of hops. Light body, crisp, fairly assertive carbonation and a medium grain finish. Inoffensive and easy drinking but not interesting. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Sampled from the tap at Maxwell’s Plum. Pours a clear light gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges and laces. Aroma has notes of corn and sweet grains with some biscuit supporting. Flavor has lots of corn and stale sweet grains with a touch of bread underlying.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Draft - Light corn. Clear gold with a nice white head. Light something, but really nothing. A very tasteless beer.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Bottle at Kwang Tung, Fogo Island’s only Chinese restaurant, and apparently the most northern Chinese restaurant in Canada (as told to me by someone in St.John’s). This has basically no flavour or aroma. Very pale yellow with thin white head. Very faint honeyish flavour. This is an inoffensive alternative to water.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: On tap at the Fo’c’sle. Pours a clear golden colour with white head with decent retention. Aroma is hard to detect besides bland graininess. Flavour also has weak granny notes with some wet straw. Finish? What finish. No seriously off notes, but an incredibly forgettable beer.

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: In bottle and on tap; overall just OK. Another Molson beer .. easy drinking but medium bodied, not very interesting ...

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Aroma: Mild Sweet Corn Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes All Light, Thin White Head, Some Lacing Taste: Water, Mild Corn Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Light Bodied, Watery

name: Black Horse Premium Lager
review: Drank straight from bottle. Nose, corn and sweet malt. Taste of sweet malt, no hop character. Not as much skunk and adjunct flavor as most pale lagers.

name: Legend Porter
review: On tap at Legend, pours a deep dark brown / near-black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out toasted malt and some bready notes. Flavour is along the same lines, with toasted malt and a hint of earthy cocoa. Nothing special here, but it’s drinkable.

name: Legend Porter
review: on tap at the brewpub in Richmond - super dark color. Nice sweet aroma. A very good porter.

name: Legend Porter
review: Bomber->pokal. Pours black with tall frothy tan head. Moderate carbonation. Roasted malt and coffee, thin and watery.

name: Legend Porter
review: Tap @ brewery shared with HopTsing. Very dark with thin dissipating head. First sniff reminds me of wine, then I get chocolate, then light coffee, and a sour note. Light roast flavor. Lots of carbonation. Not too bad.

name: Legend Porter
review: February 2010. 22 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate and some coffee notes. A little sweet on the palate with a bitter finish.

name: Legend Porter
review: Poured from 22 oz. bottle at Dixie Bones BBQ in Woodbridge, VA. Opaque, near black with a huge brown head and fair lacing. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and toast. Taste of chocolate, roasted coffee, roasted malt, earthy hops and a hint of molasses. Medium/light body and medium/low carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Legend Porter
review: Received in a trade from RABinVA. Drank this brew with a fantastic birthday dinner of Falafel, African Mango and Avocado Salad , and Carrot Cake, all prepared by my darling wife. Pours Mahogany with ample tan head. Flavor notes of coffee, chocolate, and citrus, in that order. Weak scent. Glad I got a chance to give this a try. Bottle - Trade from RABinVA - Atlanta, GA

name: Legend Porter
review: Roasty light coffee and alcohol notes. Black body with slight red hue. Dry coffee and choclate notes with malty finish. Crisp and dry on palate

name: Legend Porter
review: Aromas of roasted dark chocolate, coffee, dark earth, and subtle citrus. Black with ruby highlights, and a mostly fading, beige head. Dry, earthy, and roasty. Medium body, good carbonation, and with a roasty finish.

name: Legend Porter
review: Very dark brown pour, light brown head. Dry porter, lots of roasted malt, licorice, dark toast, roasted nuts.

name: A1A Ale Works A. Strange Stout
review: NIce and not troo strong. Was part of the flight. Wasy to drink with some cocoa features and thick in shape

name: A1A Ale Works A. Strange Stout
review: on tap at the brewpub; black color; roasted malt and coffee aroma; smooth, roasted malt flavor with coffee notes; slightly sweet

name: A1A Ale Works A. Strange Stout
review: Draft at the A1 Aleworks bar. Poured into a pint glass. Very dark in color, nearly black. Thick mocha head. Some lacing. Aroma was mild but good. Coffee, chocolate, roasty toasty malts, and peat. Taste was actually pretty good and balanced. The roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, and earth combined nicely.
