review: Bottle. At first this seems like a fairly standard bitter but there is an unusual smoky element that is actually fairly pleseant.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Fluffy tan head left a decent cover on a clear conker coloured still body. Malt, demerara & spice aroma. Medium bodied, sharp on the front with a creamy back & clean aft. Heavy malt, syrup, fruity, faint hops & spicy tastes.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Dark and looks home brew. No head whatsoever. Bit soapy. Served too cold and got better as warmed.yup malts coming through now. Seems low score in review but I would take again

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Drunk from 50cl bottle bought from the brewery by parents. Enjoyable dark full bodied ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Tasted this at the Salt Cot, Saltcoats (JDW) on the 18th July 2015. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear dark amber in colour with a thin pale buff head. Aroma hasd a malty overtone with hedgerow berry fruit evident. Thin watery mouthfeel and good lacing. Mixed malts give a moist maltloaf base with hints of raisin fruit. Earthy aftertaste has a damp leaves quality to the hoppy aftertaste. Finish is smooth and malty with fruit notes of bramble and cherry. A decent ESB which tastes its strength.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Bottle from the Sulwath Brewery Tap, Castle Douglas, consumed on site. Tawny brown, with a slight off-white head. Aroma of hazelnut, malt, caramel. Tiniest vegetal note. Sweet malty taste with herbal edges. The naked honesty of this brewery excites me: the beers are so simple, and they either work or don’t. This one does.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Bottle BBE: 6/6/15. Well-chilled. Clear, deep copper body with a minimal tan head. Strong, bready cereal notes. Toasty. Some dried fruit. Slightly resinous hop notes and a little cheese. Medium caramel sweetness, with only a light bitterness and no real perceptible sour notes. Light-bodied, particularly considering the weighty flavours. A thin, yet clouded texture. Low carbonation with a lingering smoked finish. Overall, a beer with some potential, although the body and mouth-feel don’t match the anticipation of the nose.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Bottle at home. Pours amber red, nose is toffee, biscuit, taste is toffee, crisp, dry.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Cask at Cloisters. Pours clear dark brown, thin bubbly white head. Aromas are mostly vinegar at first, resolving to fruit cake (maybe sour fruit cake?). Taste is more of the same, sadly. Didn’t finish this, which is rare for me.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: Bottle from the Scottish Real Ale shop. Appearance - amber red with a nice head. Nose - subtle toffee and slightly elusive biscuits. Taste - much more pronounced toffee and biscuits Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. Overall - really enjoyable.

name: Sulwath Knockendoch
review: A dull as dishwater bitter. It’s drinkable but that is really they only thing I can think to say about it.

name: Swale Kentish Pride
review: Cask Conditioned at The Queens Head, Icklesham, Sussex. Light golden with slight head. Thinnish lightly malted mid bitter with a sharp crystal bitterness. Harsh in the finnish though refreshing.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: 16.9 oz bottle 4/00-Pours a dark golden/light amber with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, hops, and slight sourness. Taste of fruit, malt, citrus, and sweetness. This medium bodied brew was well balanced and a nice drinking beer. Was surprised.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Bottle and served in a no-nik pint glass; Pours a clean golden hue with a small but mostly lasting white head and okay lace. The aroma has notes of mint leaves, mild citric and floral hops, biscuity malt, hint of oncoming oxidation, and a vapour of dusty yeast esters. The taste is mildly fruity with a equally mild pale malt background, very good balance and the best part of this brew. The finish does have a subdued papery condition which would be caused by age, but the store just got these in so I dunno, perhaps setting at customs too long? The aftertaste has some citric and astringent qualities. Thin-bodied and watery mouth feel is the biggest problem with this beer. Not the best example of a session ale but is drinkable.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Bottle. Poured clear copper color with an average rocky off-white head that was mostly lasting and produced good lacing. Moderate hoppy sour citrus aroma. Medium smooth body with a soft texture. Moderate bitter citrus flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: So I scored this 500ml bottle but it may have some age on it. No date on it. Poured into a tulip glass with a big frothy head. Color is murky dark amber, no clarty in the beer and very little translucence. Aroma is strong - meaty slighty oxidized, sour tangerine with lots of sweetness. Taste is rather empty no recognizable affects of age though. Leaves no aftertaste, no bitterness. Medium body.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Cask handpump. Amber with a short head. Floral and some simple fruits in the aroma and a slight bitterness. Quite thin and boring.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: bottle from chevy chase. pours a clear light amber, very big white head. this is very highly carbonated, like a sparkling ale would be. aroma is intense fruity malt: apricot, pear, caramel...no real hop aroma. medium body, nice malty backbone, with a clean finish, albeit a little sweet. definitely get the impression that the hop bite was lost in long storage...there’s very little hop character at all.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Bottle. Small white head that was mostly lasting, sparse lacing, fine-small sized head, carbonated, hazy, yeasty, and a yellow golden hue. Aroma was malty, lightly hoppy and sweet. Bitter, hoppy flavor. Tingly palate. Light-medium body.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: This bottled brew poured a small sized head of frothy mostly diminishing white colored bubbles that left behind a good lacing. The body contained average carbonation, was hazy with yeast floaties and its color was unnoted. Its aroma contained notes of a notable amount of malts that made its presence known with mild hop content. Its mouth feel is initially slightly tingly and hoppy. Its flavor contained thin malts with caramel and hop notes.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Cask Conditioned, at the Market Porter, Borough, London . Faint hoppy aroma. Golden with frothy white head. Pleasant hoppy, pineapple aroma. Citrus fruits. Moderate bitter flavour and length. Part of the Beerlimey & Spiesy, tearing it up in London (on a Wed night) Tour.

name: Swale Indian Summer
review: Cask: Clear golden appearance. Impressive grapefruit/tropical citrus aroma. Sweet fruity flavor, mild citric bite, grapefruit apparent but not bitter. Restarined smooth IPA.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: 19/2/2019. Bottle from Four Hops, Reigate. Pours golden amber with an off-white head. Aroma of fresh raspberry, raspberry jelly, straw, hops, wheat and vanilla. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, hint of tartness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, above average carbonation. Light bittersweet fruit finish. Not bad.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Bottle. Red cloudy wheat beer; looks rather like a raspberry smoothie. Fruity; lots of tart raspberries, sharply fruity. Malty; wheaty. Very fruity wheaty throughout. Very dry slightly bitter finish. Drinkable summer beer. (2009-12)

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Bottle from a bottle shop in Whitstable. Poured a hazy reddish amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, big raspberry. The flavour is moderate sour with a dry crisp, acidic citrus, raspberry palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A little one dimensional as the raspberry really dominates, but fairly drinkable all the same.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: From tap at hotel Continental, Pours: cloudy orange-red liquid, small rose creamy head, Aroma: wheat, raspberry, citrus, Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter, medium sour, raspberry, lemon, apple, light wheat, Palate: light body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, medium long raspberry aftertaste, Overall: good raspberry wheat, bit light, but at least with some head and carb.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Orange/Rose in colour, small cream head with fizz in the glass. Sweet hoppy nose. Fruity taste a touch watery on the finish.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Slightly out of date bottle from the Hog’s Back Brewery shop. Pours rosé colour with a thin layer of white froth. Sweet raspberry aroma. The taste is tart raspberry with spice notes before a clean dry finish. A little watery. Good otherwise.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: A really delicate raspberry taste to a wonderful wheat beer with tones of banana

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: 330 ml bottle. Slightly hazy pink/golden body topped by a big, fluffy white head with shades of pink. Not very strong aroma of raspberry and yeast. Flavor is slightly sweet and light acidic berries with wheat and traces of spices. Medium body and average aftertaste. OK, it’s supposed to be a raspberry wheat and deliver what it is, the berries feels real and not artificial. On the other hand, I personally don’t think wheat/golden ales with berries are a good idea.

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Bottle split at JF’s, thanks to James, 23/08/13. Hazed dark amber/cherry red with a forthy light crimson topping. Nose is berry fruits, sugar syrup solution, raspberry jam, light soap. Taste comprises light berry fruit tones, toasted malts, light wheat, grain. Medium bodied, fine carbonation. So so affair, guess it could be refreshing on a hot day but hmmm .... had a lot worse mind!

name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
review: Bottle 0,33ltr: What’s happened the Valley of the Senne meets Kent. Hazy red/pink coloured brew with an fine sour taste and its have the thirstquenching abbilities. Quite interesting brew.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Not sure what is happening with my ratings bought this in a store in Montana years ago with some King’s and Barnes stuff.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Gift from SJ. An interesting odd stout. Dark brown pour with a dark chocolate and raosted malt aroma. A toasred, dry roasted taste with a mild sweet finish. Interesting.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Bottle. Thin dark brown pour with a tan film. Aroma of oats and fresh cardboard. Flavors of water and watery roasted malt. The body is thinner than the old men’s hair on the bottle....it’s actually refreshing at times, as if it were the Gatorade ® of stouts!

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Bottle: Pours brown with a loose tan head, I can tell it’s thin by the pour. Aroma, slight smoke, oats, a hint of a brand new freshly cut cardboard box. Flavor, some fruits, sweet oats, some slight hints of roasted malts and chocolate. Body is very thin and watery, and really detracted from the beer.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Name: Oyster Stout Date: 02/12/2003 Mode: Bottle Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta Black, nice tan head, roasted malt aroma, light roasted malt flavor, touch of chocolate, dry finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Cask Stillage at the Town Hall, Stockport 01/06/2001 Dark coloured stout with chocolaty aroma and flavour.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Cask @ Blakes of Dover, 2 February, 2006 Loads of chocolte in both aroma (could smell it two feet away) and in taste. Ther are also burned sugar and licourice in there. Nice aftertaste.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Too sweet for the light body but the toffee? flavor melds well with the roastiness. Still quite drinkable. Finishes light and dry.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Cask@The Market Porter, Borough, London. A bit too sweet and soft for a stout, quite light, with some sweet caramel, and then a touch of roasty, chocolatey bitterness. Needs more body and length of flavour.

name: Swale Oyster Stout
review: Bottle. It’s quite dark with a little reddish hue. It produced no head whatsoever. I found it somewhat refreshing due to the faint light notes. The oyster taste is existent. This would probably be better if it was paired with a meal, but it’s an okay beer.

name: Swale Kentish Gold
review: Date: 11/07/1997 Source: Brewfest, Real Ale Festival light amber, nice hop aroma with sweet malt, solid hop flavor on top of a good malt base (single hop) Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.6/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Swale Kentish Gold
review: I bought this from the Bexley speciality beer shop Cork and Cask. It looks like the place is in need of some support - the shelves were mostly empty, and the range was limited; but the chap behind the counter was very friendly and knowledgable. The Swale Brewery Company who make Kentish Gold, claim that they are the only brewery in Kent to make bottle conditioned beers. I feel I had this too young - there was still a year to run on the best before date, and the beer had a very vigorous carbonation. It smelled like beer, it kinda looked like beer, and it tasted like beer. Little more to be said. A very run of the mill beer. Outstandingly average in all respects. Re-rate: Still average, still fizzy. Good fruity nose. Cork and Cask has now closed down.

name: Swale Kentish Gold
review: I am submitting this review because I wanted to convey my enjoyment of this beer. But, I should note, that I haven't actually tasted it in two years. I had Kent Gold while visiting Canterbury, U.K., in the fall of 1999. This easy-drinking beer quickly became my favorite "new find" during my entire trip to Britain. It's a hazy straw-yellow in color. Spicey and complex for such a light beer, with some citrus noticable. A delicate head which laced the glass. Very thirst quenching (one of the few CO2 beers I enjoyed while in the country). I could not, categorize this beer into any particular style. It was slightly reminiscent of a saison, but I know that this wasn't the style. I wish that the Swale brewery would send this beer over the Atlantic.

name: Swale Old Dick
review: Date: 11/07/1997 Source: Brewfest, Real Ale Festival dark amber, mild hop aroma, light flavor Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Swale Old Dick
review: (Bottle 50 cl) I’ve had "Dirty Dick" and "Old Nick" - here the two seem to have merged into "Old Dick". Dark orange/light brown with a thick - almost stiff - and very rich head. Lovely aromatic and nicely balancing with nutty, malty notes and the Challenger hops. Dry and very drinkable. Excellent bottle conditioned English Strong Ale - if you can forgive the naive and primitive label. 230302

name: Triple fff Moondance
review: Cask at the Lincoln beer festival. Amber colour with a tan head. Aroma and taste are sweet and malty. Medium body.

name: Triple fff Moondance
review: Tap @ Duke of Sussex, Chiswick. Clear amber body with small short-lived head. Mild bitter malts, bread, caramel, some fruitiness/citrus.

name: Triple fff Moondance
review: Can’t believe I haven’t rated this yet. Cask pint at the Jolly Coopers, Epsom. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt. Sweet taste, bitter finish.

name: Triple fff Moondance
review: Cask at the St. Ives 'Booze on the Ouse' beer festival, 2017. Pours dark golden with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, hop, fruit and floral notes. Moderate sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation.

name: Triple fff Moondance
review: Cask @ St Ives Booze on the Ouse festival. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, flowers, malt and hops. Nice fruity finish.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: A natural, lightly sweet, cloudy beer that's smooth and doesn't linger long on the palate. Spanner.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: About the only good thing to come out of South Australia ever, although I will conceed Coopers has a lot going for it. This is a bloody good beer.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Light white delicious, mid amber/ golden with light cloud, whiffs of fresh sultana grapes (still on the vine). Clean malty middle amongst light spices, hints of cumin and pimento, citric acid at the end. Long dry finish for wheaty, neither sweet nor sour. Fresh from the factory,Yippee! Better on the second, third date. The more I drink,the more I like. 2nd rating.. it just seems better every time. On Tap is more various with + or haze anddry fruity flavours.Whew!! Beyootifull in summer.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: As most said it is not a good example of a Wit, but as a summer wheat it is an easy drinker and fair overall.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Like duff said a bit more belgian than germam, had a nice nose and citrus notes but the palate was a quite bland and lacked flavour. this beer is quite refreshing and easy to drink and will be good for summer.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Maybe a bit more German than belgian, a bit bland sweetish and flat though, but its easy to down, and refreshing for summer.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: After tasting Matilda Bay Redback Original, I was disapointed at this beer. I found it flat, sour and bitter without finding any other distinguishable flavours or aromas.

name: Southwark (AU) White
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: very unusual. Unlike any other Australian beer. Easy drinking and extremely fruity. The closest thing Australia has to a Bavarian wheat beer.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: 12 fl oz can. Appearance is a dull, hazy copper gold, with a thick one and a half fingers of soapy white froth. Aromas are a range from citrus and grapefruit, to pine and wood. Taste starts with a bittersweet grapefruit note, some bready malts and dough, piney and resin bitter, and a little toffee or caramel. Quite a range of flavours packed into a small can!

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: 0,473 litre Can from 7-11 Carlsbad, Ca. Golden with white head. Malts, hops, piney, grains.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. A 1" pillowy off white head drops slowly with moderate lacing. Color is hazy orange. Aroma pine, citrus, white bread dough. Mouthfeel is medium and slightly astringent with a quite dry finish. Flavor is well balanced between the pine/citrus hops and the sweet malts with a hint of honey. Overall: a classic in the style.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: This beer, with all due respect, destroys all others. In the words of Tina Turner "you're simply the best, better than all the rest".

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Aroma is some caramel some raisin some nice fruity grapes pineapple and other tropic fruit. Taste is sweet caramel slightly oxidized. Juicy drinkable and fruity. Long malty finish with the fruuty hop flavours above. Nice.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Bottle Packaged on 06/27/19 Coppery amber orange with slight haze Rich thick head with good lacing dissipates slowly Nose: Cream Caramel orange-vanilla, coriander and nutmeg with a hint of passion fruit and grape. First Sip: Sweet Malt bread caramel and cream opening to ripe stone fruit passion fruit Develops into dank loam pine and orange peel. Mouthfeel soft inviting vibrant and smooth. Finish Big long Hoppy finish characterized by pine grapefruit and resin, very smooth no astrigency . Overall a glorious IPA to drink and savor.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Bottle from Varsity. Amber gold with fine head. Grapefruit and toast aroma. Med carb. Really nice IPA without overpowering hops letting some fruity complexity through with a nuttier smooth finish.

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Poured from 12oz bottle. Amber color with nice, thick, white head. Smooth, got, and well-balanced. Superb APA!

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Thick foamy head color looks light orange copper smell of tropical fruits hops caramel taste of fruits bitter finish smooth drinking

name: Bell's Two Hearted Ale
review: Great piney and grapefruity hop profile with distinct malt backbone. Solid west coast style IPA.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Best beer in australia and iam not short of having tryed all popular beers from all states.Boags premium comes close.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: If you get to your local ALDI and realise you don't have a coin for the trolley, pop over to the drive through across the carpark and buy a can of EB. Then you've got change for the trolley as well as a beer to drink while you're doing the shopping! Well it worked for me anyway.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: the worst beer I've ever let touch my body even my dog turned away and went to bed at it!

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: 375ml can into glass. Label says 'Beer for Western Australia'. Unfortunately not FROM Western Australia. Golden beer with foamy white head. Laces well. Medium carbonation. Nose is over-cooked vegetables served next to an open drain. Light body, some weird sweetness in there. Finish is metallic. Horrible macro nightmare that looks good in the glass.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Is the beer on the can label bigger than the mans head? This is the better question when drinking this beer than how good is the beer? Hot work sweaty mans beer. An appreciated lager that is not really supposed to be held in the mouth for feel and palate referencing. It would suit Asian foods as well as any Asian Lager. This is not my beer of choice but given no choice or offered an ice cold one miles from nowhere after a surf trip in the desert it is gold.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Bottle from Copper & Oak Liquor Merchants 300416. This beer reminds me so much of the cheap crappy beer I used to drink in my younger days. Wet cardboard comes to mind, along with soap. Not pleasant at all.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: BB 20/06/16. Poured a crystal clear amber with a 5mm bright white open foam head that diminished quickly but laced well. Carbonation very low and coarse. Aroma subtly of malt with no obvious hops; very lager like. Taste of sweet malt with no real bitterness. Light body. Crisp, clean and refreshing with a coarse mouthfeel and bland (ie no real bitterness) on the finish. More like a pale lager.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: very light, not very bitter. Pale golden with thick, fluffy head, very grainy. Slick, smooth and creamy, flat, abrupt finish.

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Your all a bunch of eastern state pussies who can’t handle it. Emu Bitter is the best beer going. Its a real mans drink! Its liquid gold drunk best cold after a hard days work. Get it in to ya c#nts. Ken Oath!

name: Emu Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Ticking WA continues 375 ML can Golden straw color, rocky, one finger head. Looks pretty good. Falls to a thick collar and leaves nice lacing. Smells like a lager, no dry hopping. Very sad. Touches of grass, cereal, and corn. Smells like a supped up version of Emu Draft. 1% does make a difference. Grassy, metallic hop bite. It is bitter and it is not good at all. Lots of corn and sweet, stewed corn. Repulsive beer. Drink this puppy cold as hell to sort of enjoy it

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Most people miss the point of this beer. It’s an inexpensive mid strength beer meant to be consumed over a chat or a meal . It’s got to be very cold and in a glass but it’s simple ordinary beer . It’s a typical Perth beer ( though not made there anymore ) on a hot day , a cold Emu Draft is heaven and it won’t get you drunk like Export . If the weather is mild and the beer is not cold there are better options . It’s only available in cans but if pour properly it in a middle glass it loses the metallic taste and look much better . It’s all about context with this beer . There are better beers but in its place it’s good drinking .

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Can from Copper & Oak Liquor Merchants 190416. Pretty miserable beer this one but this comes as no surprise really considering it is a mass produced pale lager. Lacking in flavour is possibly the most complimentary thing I can say about this beer.

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Pale golden body with frothy airy head. Aroma of wet paper, tastes like nothing much. Finish is non-existant. Overall weak and bland

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: 375 ML can Golden caramel straw color. One finger bright white head. Nice retention to it. Nose is cereal and corn flakes. Thin and watery nose. Are there any hops to this at all?? Taste is corn flakes and artificial sugar. Just need Tony the Tiger and set. Way too artificial sweet . Light bodied, high carbonation, and thin. Does its job as a mid.

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Sometimes my mates drink this. Water taste better so I usually stick with that. When I don’t stick with that, I usually regret the first sip

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: For some strange reason I drank a river of this crap until I realised what horrible beer this was. Bland, watery, low carbonation and very little imagination. I would not recommend this stuff to anyone. Absolute shit!

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Pale gold/amber in colour, thin bodied with low to average carbonation. Small white head. Flavourless and watery, short dry finish, slightly bitter. Not great. (375ml can)

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: 375 ml can - Pale goldy amber colour with a lousy head which vanishes shortly after pouring. Medium carbination. Thin and watery with a weak grassy flavour. Rather pitiful really.

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Watered down version of Emu Export. Not awful but pretty ordinary. Full points for value for money - 30 cans for $22. But I think that pretty much sums up the quality of this beer. Best drank in summer, chilled to the max.

name: Emu Draft
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Like Emu export, only more gassy with a stinkier nose. Also, I can only find it in cans here in Perth, so automatic points deducted for that.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: 0,33l bottle from PWS, Perth. Pours veyr pale golden with a medium head. Aroma is light malts. Flavor is tap water with some malts. Well, it's better than Budweiser.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Light crisp and pleasant mainstream beer. Light colour. Slightly sweet aroma. Refreshing.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: I’ve drunk beer all over the world and this beer rates as good as anything. Been brewed since 1857, full bodied taste and the best thing....it’s got WA in it. Get it into ya

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Schooner on tap at Cottesloe Hotel. Pale amber beer with thin white head. Carbonation is low and slow. Nose is part malt, part pepper, part chemical. Laces well. Taste is malt with a slight touch of vegetables in the finish. Typical Aussie macro, good quencher.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Appearance: clear golden, ok head Aroma: light malt, hint of sulphur Mouthfeel: medium mouthfeel and carbonation Taste: clean lager, light biscuit malt. Clean balanced bitterness Overall: a drinkable lager

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Nothing special but bit of bite on the palate. Typical macro brewery product. Popular here in Castle Hotel York Western Australia.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Tasted 4/4/2016. Draught at Caves Hotel, Yallingup, WA. Poured a crystal clear pale amber with 5mm of bright white foam that diminished slowly to a collar that laced well. Carbonation low and coarse. Aroma of pale malt; no obvious hops. Taste of sweetish malt and no real bitterness; goes a bit sour as it warms. Light and thin body. Crisp, smooth and a hint of bitterness on the finish. Typical lager from a macro-brewery.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Goldgelb kaum schaum, Geruch getreidig grasig, Geschmack flach leicht metallisch nicht zu empfehlen in jeder Kneipe gibt es mindestens 1 besseres...

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Vom Fass in Perth. Goldgelb klar, flacher Schaum. Säuerlicher Gras grasiger Geruch. Metallischer Geschmack . Schwach.

name: Swan Draught
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Lager...What more can you say, bland, but goes down easy. Fairly tasty, quenching, slick body, extremely drinkable.

name: 1857 Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Deep copper tone? Mine must have been bleached then. See my comments about the Swan Gold. Same vat? I suspect so.

name: 1857 Bitter
brewery: South Australia Brewing (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
review: Off yellow with a small head with a bite of watered down acid. Not the best midstrength lager around. Tend to steer clear of this one.

name: Swan Gold
review: The great Aussie invention. A mid-strength beer. Really these styles have an identity crisis. Too low in alcohol to be a real beer and too high to be a light and therefore absolutely abhorrent. Yeah, nuff said, except for the blah blah about lack of body, astringent flavour and gutless flavour.

name: Swan Gold
review: Golden with a fast disappearing head. Very bland with acidic flavour. Not recommended.

name: Swan Gold
review: they don't make this anymore so i had to drink one that is about 5 years old. it was very cloudy, and had chunks in it. it smelt very sweet, and tasted the same. there was no head, but considering how old it was, it wasn't bad for an off beer.

name: Swan Gold
review: This beer has been discontinued, long ago. The reason: it was terrible. I don't know where mike84(22) got his taste buds etc from ..

name: Swan Gold
review: as far as mid-strengths go this aint too bad................................

name: Tooheys New
review: Bottle. Golden color, white head. Aroma has malts and some fruity notes. Malty body, hint of hops and fruit. Basic watery lager.

name: Tooheys New
review: My go to tap beer when I’m at a pub, not that great out of a can or bottle but delicious draught beer(weird phenomenon) Taste: mild - medium bitterness, low hops and slight metallic taste Body: the way lager should be with a moderate head Smell: smells like my early 20s late teens

name: Tooheys New
review: Toohey's new. Drunk from bottle. Very, very nice. Pleasant aroma, full heavy on the malt and hops but not too bitter or even fruity. Good aftertaste

name: Tooheys New
review: Aroma is malts/slightly earthy and fruit. The flavor is malts, mild fruit, a hint of caramel and a lightl bitter/hoppy finish.

name: Tooheys New
review: This is a classic lager that I always come back to, I don't believe there's too much of a reason to dislike it.

name: Tooheys New
review: Can thanks to wingmanwillis, Cheers Dave. Drunk as part of my Aussie carton of piss taste off. Golden beer with large bubbly head. Aroma of light malts. Taste is pale malts and some light floral hop action. Standard lager.

name: Tooheys New
review: Very average mass brewed Aussie beer. There are worse ones out there. Bitter, lager-y, beer-y drop.

name: Tooheys New
review: 375ml bottle from Tasty Life, Xiamen. Pours clear golden with a white head. Mild hop aroma with malt. Sweet taste. A little bitterness. Average.

name: Tooheys New
review: Bottle enjoyed during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.

name: Tooheys New
review: Seen in most bars in Sydney this larger may be a nice alternative to VB. Though dont expect much of a party for the palate

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: Boring foam, boring yellow, smells like a backed up toilet or maybe an old couch cushion after somebody farted in it after a heavy bean dinner. Taste is rather vile grain with heavy sugar and light ammonia. Lingering chemicals on the tongue. Awful and more awful, as well as especially pointless.

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: The is living. I had a 'TED' the other day simply because I liked the name. I didn't expect to fall instantly, head-over-heels in love. Never had I tried a beer with such a complex, yet delicate taste profile. The body is incredible. Will definitely be back for more when the wife lets me have another beer next year. This was the absolute highlight of my birthday party.

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: Best served in an ice cold stubbie Taste watered down Tooheys New, crisp finish. Body, what body Smell is light lager One of the popular lower carb beers, comparable to Carlton Dry Great on a hot day or as a session beer as they go down with no effort at all and a respectable 4.4%. Also good if you’re watching your weight

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: This is by far the best beer I have ever had been drinking it for about 10 years now but the plastic package that it's wrapped in is a pain in the ass surly you can come up with something better I have dropped so many beers out of the fridge trying to get the dahm things out of the packaging its bullshit thanks fingers

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: Fles 33cl in Parijs. 5%. Fris licht. Licht bittere drogige smaak. (5-2012).

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: Strandbier: wässrig mit einer Spur süßlichem Getreide. Und dann ist das Bier auch schon wieder weg.

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: 2Pac day '18. Really never had this one. Poolside Hamilton Island. Amber white head. A: mildly grainy, some peach, apple cores. A little watery. Pretty dry with apple and cardboard notes. Weedy bitterness. Okish

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: 330ml bottle Light gold pour with slight head. Grainy aroma. Grainy taste, quite sweet, not particularly dry. Ho hum....

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: Bottle enjoyed during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.

name: Tooheys Extra Dry (TED)
review: On tap. Pours amber. Sharp acidity, touch of lemon, quite a bit of stale bread. Thin and highly carbonated. Pretty unpleasant.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: 375ml Dose. Goldene Farbe, fast kein Schaum. Geass, Heu und Getreide in der Nase. Geschmack flach und süss.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: Bottle - golden pour with plastic looking white head. But of malt on the aroma. Slight sweet start mild finish.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: Ok, this is the cheapest of the cheap in the Tooheys stable so........750ml bottle (twist-top!) into schooner glass. Skunky nose from bottle, cooked vegetables from glass. Pale amber beer with many bubbles and lasting billowing white head. Has a chalky mineral water taste that zings on the tongue. Abrupt finish with a little malt, hard to find any hops in here. Actually palatable if you are desperate. Must be very cold. Lawnmower beer? Yes. BBQ beer? No.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: Can, 0.375l. Clear pale golden color with large frothy white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is malty, grassy, grainy and vegetably. Taste starts with moderate sweet malt, fresh grainy sour and metallic following, dry mouthfeel and light bitter finish. Light body, thin texture and average carbonation in palate. Oh my deer, nothing special...

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: Poured a clear pale amber colour with a thin white bubbly head that diminished quickly and developed moderate lacing. Moderate carbonation with medium sized bubbles forming trails. Aroma of sweet malt. Taste slightly sweet followed by a very mild, almost nil, hops bitterness. Light body bordering on watery. A weak flavoured nothing beer that is not really bitter.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: You look at the can, and just know its gonna be bad. Pours a celar gold, moderate carbonation and a frothy white head. Bready, malty aroma, a bit funky. Empty, watery flavour and texture. Slight bitter after taste.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: Bottled (thanks to my cousin Kaj!). No matter what the name says about red, this beer pours a golden colour with a white small head. Aroma is bready malts, some slight floral and herbal notes as well. Flavour is malts, some mild grassy and herbal notes along with mild bitterness. So atleast the "bitter" part is true in the name, even though to the style it is a pale lager. Better than expected.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: If heavily chilled then I actually don’t mind this one all that much. Sweet and slightly malty it’s certainly a better drink than Tooheys extra dry in my opinion, and it’s cheaper.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: From a 375ml bottle on 13/6/2010. A nostalgic trip back to the days when I was a young man and would buy cases of Toohey’s Red because it was nearly always on special. I’m pretty sure it used to be more than 4%. So how does it scrub up now that I know what a really good beer tastes like? It’s actually not quite as bad as I thought it would be. It does actually have a discernible sweet, malty, grassy aroma. In the mouth, it’s sweet, a touch metallic, with a very slight hint of hops. There is worse out there, but my case buying days are over.

name: Tooheys Red Bitter
review: 375ml can. Honey colour with a deep dense white foam blanket. Aroma of soap suds and dish water. Light and sweet flavour with nothing that really comes through. Very basic and boring.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Easy drinking beer. Still have your scruples at the end of a session while others are noticeably affected by the alcohol of heavy beers. Good on ya George!

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Not a total disaster. Clean and refreshing if of course devoid of real flavour. Kinda buzzy and dry but otherwise line and length for the Australian pale lager market. If I needed to drink mainstream low abv beer then I might look at this again.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Gold pour aromas lemon grassy flavours medium bitter grassy lemon dull old cabbage my word they have improved the finish dull flat vegetable grassy flat lemon a bitter not good

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Can (no bbe found), had during the 10 year anniversary of 2Pac on RB (Thanks Kaj!). Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is grass, some bready malts as well as mild hayish and cardboardy notes. Flavour is grass, bread, some mild earth and herbs. Thin palate. Seems like this beer either is hard to get, or nobody bothers rating it.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: 375ml can. Clear amber colour with a thick white head and mild carbonation. Aroma of wet cardboard and straw. Unpleasant and inviting. Not a bad taste for a midstrength. Dry in the mouth with a good mouthfeel. More flavour than some midstrength beers.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Can - Pours a pale golden with a loose white head. Not much of an aroma, maybe some malt, but also a bit cardboardy. Pretty bland small amount of malt, slightly metallic finish. Not great but a lot better than some of their other effots!

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: A dire concoction straight from the gates of hell. Awful. Not even enough alcohol to get pissed if that was the intent.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: 375 ml can ("Master Brewed version", which as the can says is brewed by "Tooheys or by related companies under license") - Straw Gold in colour with thin white head which rapidly died away to nothing. Medium carbonation. Watery. A little bland in flavour and bitterness but on a hot day it would be better than a softdrink.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Light straw coppery golden body, poor head, average mid-strength beer taste, some light bitterness,watery.

name: Tooheys Gold Bitter
review: Typical cidery urine aroma, tastes like bitter soda water. No sweetness which is good. Reminds me of drinking my old man’s Carlton Light whilst camping back in the day.

name: Tooheys Old
review: 330ml bottle. Poured a clear medium brown colour with a short-lived frothy off white head. The aroma is toffee caramel malt, light nutty, light spicy liqouirce. The flavour is moderate to light bitter sweet, with a light, slightly watery, dry, spicy, caramel malt, light red berry fruit, woody hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average to soft carbonation.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Had a work dinner. 22 of us sitting around a huge table, every with a pale ale except me with this Tooheys Old. It seemed to impress my Korean co-workers which probably made this taste better than it did.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Tap at park beach bowls club, coffs harbour. Dark brown color, white head. Smooth roasty nose, some coffee notes. Nice smooth little roasty taste, some coffee notes, some fruity notes.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Ah Tooheys Old. The best find at your local bowls club in Aus. Best beer in the Tooheys line up by a country mile. A little bit of bitter coffee, some sweet biscuit chocolate too. A hidden gem in plain site.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Bottle enjoyed during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Drank from a 375mL bottle at a hotel, BB May 2018. Milk chocolate taste but finishes empty. Sad thin body. I will properly re-review if I get an opportunity. Fun fact: Old was my first ever beer years ago (and unsurprisingly I hated it).

name: Tooheys Old
review: Old, but not old as in aged. Old as in that puff of dust you get by hitting an old cushion. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Tooheys Old
review: On tap. Schooner. Pours a ink black with a small tan head. Aroma: Roasted malts dominate. Mild coffee beans, toasted bread, dark chocolate notes. Taste: Malts dominate the flavour balance. Slightly creamy texture. Moderate carbonation. Mild bitterness lingers on the palate. A very good dark beer.

name: Tooheys Old
review: bottle. tastes roasted malts and light chocolate. medium bodied. no hops aroma or flavor.

name: Tooheys Old
review: Light toasted, nutty and toffee malt aroma and upfront sweet malt flavours of the toasted and caramel type. Mild and easy drinking with some malt depth but fairly thin body also. Low on the bitterness. Pleasant enough.

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: One of the better tooheys beers. At least it has a nice colour and a slight hops flavour.

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: A fair attempt at a mid-strength bitter by Tooheys. Better than Tooheys gold, but who drinks mid-strength anyway?

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: Great label, you just have to like something that has a buck on it. Trouble is you have to pay more than one to taste this and like all mid-strength beers it is just not worth it. Nice colour though.

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: My sample has had an extended lagering period you might say (it sat in my dad's beer fridge for the last 2 years) and it seems to have done good things. The main reason it sat there for so long is that no-one has been game to touch it (it's reputation precedes it) so I was pleasantly surprised to find, after I got by the aroma of fermenting carrots, that there is actually a bit of malt to be tasted, some sweetness reminscent of a carrot cake and very mild bitterness. I think I even noticed a bit of body (shock horror, there has to be something wrong with this bottle) but the most shocking thing about this is the (high) score I am giving it... I cannot recommend this beer under usual circumstances but if you want to try it at it's best, there is another bottle in my dad's beer fridge... ;-)

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: Mid strength beers just dont work ! this beer is not worth it...............

name: Tooheys Amber Bitter
review: this beer really sucked and tooheys brews suck..............................

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Bottle enjoyed during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Slightly stale aroma. Clear golden colour with good head. Fruity flavor with long finish. Light body with high carbonation.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: OLD NOTES OCT 14, 2003 Not really a remarkable pilsner by any means. Quite weak hop and malt character. Probably somewhat less offensive than most other Tooheys brews, but that says very little of it pedigree.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Bottle. Not a bad beer. It actually has a bit of flavour, not as hoppy as i would like, but a very drinkable beer.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: pretty good pilsner. Nice in appearance and flavour. Not a whole lot of excitement but still a passable drink.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: tasted recently at an Aussie beer tasting - outside of cooper stout, this was the best of the rest - and that is not much of a compliment - at least this had some body/palate, but don’t go out of your way

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Hop malt aroma with smokeyness. Clear amber colour with poor head and lacing. Malt spice hop flavour. Smooth palate.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Bottle - Pours a golden colour with a frothy white head. Not a very nice aroma, a mixture of boiled rice and cardboard! Starts of with a slight sweetness and then a vegetable thing. I notice they have dropped the saaz hops and the alcohol content to 4.5%. The last time I tried this it was much better.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: 345ml bottle. Clear and sparkling golden in colour with big bubbles that make up an average snowy head. Strong hop aroma and feels fresh and crisp in the mouth with a well balanced bitterness.

name: Tooheys Pils
review: Bottle. Clear yellow with a tiny head that disappeared. Malt, vegetables and metallic notes. I’m not detecting any true saaz character in this beer. Poorly advertised and definitely not a pils in any shape or form. It doesn’t really fair much better as a lager either.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: 375ml can into glass. I didn’t know they still made this. Nose is slightly hoppy, mostly cooked vegetables. Beer is dark copper with thin white head. A few bubbles. Watery and......watery. Finish is distant cardboard, a little malt then good old Aussie macro cooked vegetables. Not good but strangely given its low ABV, its colour and very low carbonation it could be the only Australian macro ’bitter’ that really is a bitter!

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Pours a dark honey color with a creamy head that fades to so me lacing. Aroma is quite muted with a trace of citrus, malt sweetness and grain. Taste is just a bit of malt sweetness and grain, really quite bland. Has a weak bitterness and fairly clean finish. Light body, a bit watery and short on any flavor. This beer is not really worth the effort. Even the brewers name is hard to find.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Can - pours golden with a frothy white head. Metallic cardboard aroma.Very thin bodied, just carbonation up front with a metallic finish.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Another really bad attempt from Tooheys to make a beer. This stuff sells from under $20 for a case, and thats still about $19.50 too much

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Tooheys seem to be distancing themselves from this 2.3% abv "full flavoured light". So should beer-drinkers. You have to look pretty hard to find the brewer’s name on the can. You also have to look pretty hard to find much to like here. The aroma is vintage Tooheys wet cardboard and metallic POR with a few honey notes. Thin in the limbs, with a dry, metallic finish. Gassy. Some honey sweetness and better bitterness than some of their higher abv beers. Funnily enough, it looks better than most LNN brews, pouring an intense gold with a rich lather of lasting foam. By no means the worst in the range. (375ml can from Amatos. Best before 7/5/07, or ideally not at all)

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: I bought this beer with 4 mates when I was 16. $5 each for a case (30 I think). 2 cans and none of us were even tipsy. Had to go and cut some hose from the neighbours to make a beer bong for the rest and was still standing. Lucky their parents had a case of VB other wise the night would have been lost. Hope they don’t make Blue anymore.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Bottled. Pale amber, average head. Light grasssy aroma. Fatty and lightly metallic with thin mouthfeel, Dry with ashy, resiny finish and a hint of raisin. There’s worse low alcs, but that doesn’t mean that this beer is any good.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Surprisingly dark - amber I’d say with an OK head. Sweet toffee aroma with some yeast. Tastes sweet and caramelly with stewed fruits. Flabby but not that watery which is a surprise. No hop and some faint metal in the finish. Some nasty spirit presence occasionally. Nothing that good about it but it’s certainly not that offensive.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Guam SwillFest 2004: Pours golden yellow with a thin white head. Had an initial aroma of day old coffee. It still has a small coffee aroma. Overall, really not that bad. Light on everything- alcohol, flavor, aroma, palate. Over carbonated but refreshing. Crisp finish.

name: Tooheys Blue Bitter
review: Dark golden/light amber. Aroma is of cidery cane sugar and a little hoppiness. Slight grainyness with a little POR hoppiness. overall a bland watery beer, but not so bad when compared to some other Australian light beers.

name: MeZ
review: Its a good idea and a whole lot better than cold shots. It just doesn't quite make it. If I wanted my own beer tequila combination I'd make it a lot stronger than this.

name: MeZ
review: I forgot I had this about a year ago. I do recall it well enough however. What a combination! And CUB decided to do the same type of thing with vodka!! Yeah, just Corona without the complexity, flavour, aroma, body and panache. A real RTD (ready to drainpour).

name: MeZ
review: Super pale gold clear with a medium small head. Smells like a cross between a cheap gueuze and sweet lemon bitter cordial. After that it plummets downhill real quick. Lime lemon cordial sweet palate and flavours. I'd rather drink a cordial than this one. does not really deserve to be called a beer. Its really an alcopop with some beer.

name: MeZ
review: you would not want to drink more than one of these. they are way to sweet, the only beer you can taste is in the after taste. after a few mouthfuls you can no longer even taste the beer. there is to much sugar and citrus flavour. it also goes to your head, and is quite alcoholic.

name: MeZ
review: Very poor beer would be much better with a reduced citrus flavour...........

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: Grains are big in the taste of this brew, along with a touch of spice and a bit of sweetness. My go-to beer in macro bars

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: 0.473l draught. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma of cardboard, corn, malt and grain. Taste is sweet and little bitter. No comment about IPA in the name...

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: Can, ty marduk. Pours golden. Aroma and flavor are sweet, hops, malt, grains, cardboard. Overall: okish

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: Can (random shop, Toronto). Clear golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Malty, grainy, cardboard, sweet, caramel, corn in aroma/taste. Feels very macro. Happens.

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review:
(Can, a sample, thanks Marduk, 20190817) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had caramel, sweetness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were cardboard, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and
…

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: 500ml can, thanks Marduk. Pours clear golden colour, small white head. Aroma is malty, quite sweet, grassy. Taste is malty, mildly hoppy, grainy. Medium body, average carbonation. Quite boring

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: Aroma 5. Appearance 2. Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 9. Malt and corn syrup aroma. Cereals taste. Not at all an IPA.

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: A 12 oz from the tap at the Red Stag, Halifax and consumed on the patio. Very average IPA

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: On draft at grand central bar and grill in Niagara Falls Ontario. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Aromas are melon and grass. Flavors are moderately bitter pine.

name: Alexander Keiths India Pale Ale
brewery: Alexander Keith's Nova Scotia Brewery / Oland Brewery (AB InBev)
review: A bit of graininess with a cloying sweetness. Very mild blonde ale style despite the IPA claim on the bottle. Not great but not unpleasant either, more drinkable than a lot of other macro blonds.

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: From Feb 2006 Poured from bottle(room temp) a cloudy medium gold with a fairly large head of foam that dissipated slowly leaving a fine layer with some lacing. The smell has malty and earthy tones to it. The taste is is a nice mix of sweet malt and hop bitterness with an earthy biscuity goodness in the background. This is yummy! And...at just 4%abv, I think it's a prime example of how a beer doesn't need a ton of alcoholic content to make it a great tasting beer. Well done, Jack Russell Brewing!

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: "pleasant beer. on the malty side, with a barely noticeable hop finish, leaving me wanting just a touch more. a good enough session beer...that’s about it."

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Draft @ Jack Russell. Pours a bright, brilliantly clear, golden-orange color; fine-bubbled off-white head; solid lacing. Light caramel, earthy/floral bitterness, possibly some rounded Maris Otter notes; lightly buttery and endearing. Medium body; modest CO2; nice rounded mouthfeel. On the sweet side for a best bitter; sweet, rounded English maltiness; nice earthy and floral bitterness; lightly on the sweet side; a nicely toasted finish with lingering earthy and floral bitterness; tasty!

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Name: English Amber Ale Date: July 06, 2009 Mode: Bottle Source: Roadtrip Appearance: hazy orange, frothy off white head, drippy lace Aroma: sweet caramel aroma, light earthy hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, plenty of balancing woodsy hops, light bitterness, nice breadyness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *4

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Growler poured a hazy amber with a small disapating amber head. Aromas of carmel, fruittiness and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, earthiness and light citrus with a smooth carmely finish. Tasty session beer!

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: ~Pours a cloudy orange color with diminishing white head. ~Light scent of citrus and caramel malts. Makes a somewhat raisin like scent. ~Citrusy malt flavor. ~Medium feel, lingering mild citrus finish. ~Fairly simple bitter. Enjoyable. I like it.

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: From 12 oz bottle from Corti Bros in Sacramento that cost $1.49. Poured light brown with a fat white head and good lacing. Nose of caramel malts, fruti, and citrus hops. Smooth mouthfeel. Nice flavors of light malts and hops, and a medium bitter finish. Very easy to drink. Nice beer.

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Bottle labeled "Best Bitter Ale" from Corti Bros., Sacramento. The aroma is so roasted it smacks of coffee! Hazy tea/amber color with a white head that barely arrived. Very smooth, medium body with light, creamy carbonation. Some stone fruit comes forth, and the roasted malt is right there. Must be bitter floral hop or something, because there is a lot of bitter, but no citrus or resin. It certainly fits an English bitter style, but it is different. A bit harsher in the finish, perhaps. Good ale.

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Bottle: Called English Amber Ale: Golden brown, puffy creamy head, lots of carbonation. Nose of light metal, acidic hops and light caramel. The flavor is nutty and toffee, lots of bitter hops, stubtle roast. The finish is toasty, a lightly jammy fruity tail. Eh, nothing.

name: Jack Russell Best Bitter Ale
review: Amber ale with an off white head. Sweet malty aroma, restrained hops. Sweet malt in mouth, lots of butterscotch, oily buttery mouthfeel, unpleasant. On tap at brewery, August 2005.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: From Feb 2006 Poured from bottle(room temp) a pitch black with a nice brownish head of foam that dissipated fairly slowly leaving a fine layer with some lacing. The smell is of roasted malt and it's quite strong. The taste is also of roasted malt with a touch of oatmeal and..there's a bit of bitterness there that balances the flavours out nicely in the finish. This is one tasty Porter that deserves to be tried! Bottom line: Another very tasty brew from the Jack Russell Brewing Company and a London Porter interpretation that, I think, compares very favourably to the Fullers. Get some!

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: "the bar is set awful high in this style by fullers, but this is pretty dang good, and one of Jack Russells better brews. malted chocolate and roasted malt abound. thin, but flavorful and aromatic."

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: draft at brewery. Much chocolate and roast in the nose. good here. Taste is astringent, roasty and bitter from a huskiness in the beer. Really drying and not in a good way.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: 4 ounce taster at the Taproom. Reddish color, less roasted flavor than the red.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: bottle thanks to bhensonb. poured dark brown with a beige/tan head. aroma was very pleasant with chocolate and coffee with a touch of hershey’s syrup. flavor was a bittering coffee followed up by subdued dark roasts with a nice bittering. medium body with high carbonation.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: 12 fl. oz. bottle shared by Lubiere (merci!), served cold in a goblet. Likely 3 years old. JA11/09. App.: Deep brown-black with ruby highlights, clear, tan head that diminishes quickly. Aroma: Wow! Really thick, heavy rum, dark fruits, smoke, vanilla, some coffee and milk chocolate, sour cherries, light acidity, black strap molasses. Palate: Medium-light body, fairly full effervescence. Flav.: Coffee, dark and milk chocolate, vanilla, a little smoke, some fruitiness, a bit of hops (green leafy?), a little cardboard, some light smoke/ash; fairly dry with good bitterness. Great stuff, held up

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: Draft. Nutty, malty aroma with light hints of chocolate, coffee and roast. The body is a dark ruddy brown and holds a thin tan head. Chocolate, some sour twang, toast, cocoa, coffee and a decent blast of roast malt. Not bad but not something I’d drink regularly. Just seems a little off.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: From a 12 oz bottle purchased from Corti Bros in Sacramento for $1.49. Poured very dark brown that looked nearly black, but when held up to the light turned out to ber a very dark red.. Head was quite dark also tending toward tan. Great lacing rings Nose is of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Mouthfeel is smooth and rich, and medium bodied. Flavor is rich dark malts with light hops in the background. Finish is dry and good to the last drop. A really quite excellent porter.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: Bottle from Corti Bros. Nice darkly roasted, nigh toasted, malt aroma. Near opaque black/brown color with a beige head. A bit thin in body, with light, creamy carbonation. It’s definitely dark toast. We are talking antique Guinness, nearly. There’s coffee. Small hint of chocolate. The finish is dry, with a very light sour note, and dark toast. It seems to be a high quality porter that could rival some stouts. Smooth it is.

name: Jack Russell London Porter
review: Dark brown ale with reddish hue and light moka head. Coffee aroma, with roasted bitterness. In mouth, roasted coffeee beans, powdery chocolate, medium bodied, very pleasant porter. On tap at brewery, August 2005.

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: "not bad, but it definitely doesn’t do anything to stand out. decent mouthfeel and musty/malt aroma...all as the style dictates. above average beer, slightly below average olde ale."

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Bottle. Dark mahogony beer with a tan head. Sweet malt and toffee aroma with light earth. Sweet malt and toffee flavor with light pine. Medium bodied. Sweet malt and toffee lingers with light hops.

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: This reddish -brown ale poured with a decent beige head and a strong roasted malt aroma. It looks good and smells good, but the flavor is lacking. There is some chocolate malt and coffee, but the finish is metallic.

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Bottle from the brewery. Dark reddish brown color with a decent light tan head. Rich aromas of chocolate and treacle. About medium in body with creamy carbonation. It does seem to have treacle, maybe some coffee. Maybe even chocolate. Something like a porter on steroids? Finish is rather astringent. Not sure there’s significant hop - but something is balancing the sweet. Think I got lucky. This one had been kept in the cooler!

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Not sure what it is with Jack Russell beers. They are either average or below average and this was no different. A malty aroma with a nutty angle but with a heaping dose of wet paper. Uh-oh. Oxidation time. It also set in on the flavor of the beer, which combines with the overly sweet malt bill and smallish hops made this barely drinkable.

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Bottled. CO2 FLEW out of this bottle when I opened it. When I poured it, it foamed over the top of my Duvel glass before I’d even poured half of it. It took three or four minutes for the tan, stiff egg-white-like head to subside enough to allow the rest of the beer to be poured. Even then it foamed up again making me wait to pour again. I’ve never seen a head of this size on a beer that wasn’t infected. Stay tuned... The color is black with a reddish hue. As I wipe the bubbles from my nose I can tell you the aroma is full of chocolate, prunes and cigars. When the bubbles finally subsided, I found the beer to be somewhat chocolaty and very much watery with notes of ashtray. It leaves a tongue numbing aftertaste of dirt and coal(?) Great beer for smellin’, bad beer for drinkin’. I’ll be pouring the rest of this out...

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Dark amber color. Small head. Aroma is malty and slightly spicy. A medium bodied ale. Malts are nutty and sweet. Slightly spicy, cinnamon and nutmeg. A very typical “inter warmer’ beer, but there is a kind of cardboard flavor as well. Its more annoying than unpleasant, but it still shouldn’t be there and detracts from the beer and cannot be recommended. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Dark brown. Malty but sourish. Not much bitterness..........................

name: Jack Russell Olde Ale Winter Warmer
review: Attrocious swill. Dirty, root-like flavors that coat the mouth and leave a sourish, unpleasant after-taste. Avoid at all costs.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: Ar: slod, karmel, miod, nieco ziola i chmielu, zbyt kwiatowo. Wyg: bursztyn, klar, piana ok, rozne ziarno, ladnie brudzi. Sm: slodko, kwiatowo-miodowo, nieco ziolowosci i iglakow z chmielu, ok goryczka, wzglednie. Pos: kwiaty, miod, ziolowy chmiel. Ov: cos nie bangla, zbyt slodowo i kwiatowo.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: This was a nice hoppy red ale. Reminds me of bells roundhouse rye pale ale. I don't understand the low ratings.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: Draft at the brewery in Estes Park. Pours deep copper with off-white head that dissipates quickly. Grapefruit and pine aroma. Bready malt backbone asserts itself after initial grapefruit hop notes. Sole resiny pine follows in the finish.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: This was good. I don't understand the low ratings. Very hoppy, nice red color, dense for the style and strong aftertaste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: Sample at the brewery. High creamy lasting off-white head. Hazy amber body. Fruity dry and hoppy aroma and flavor with low carbonation and a long finish.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: (Draught) Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a medium white head. Aroma of grass, herbs, orange, and grapefruit. Flavor of grass, citrus, earth, pine, and caramel with a dry, bitter finish.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: 12 oz. bottle. Pours a thinnish ivory head, poorly retained, with minimal lacing, over a slightly medium amber (SRM 13) body.....nose is citrus including grapefruit, tangerine, orange, hints of toffee/caramel, light herbs, balance to the hops......taste is light cereal malts,lightly toffee/caramel sweetness, with floral notes, citrus, with grapefruit tangerine, leading to a moderate bitter finish.....mouth feel, light of medium body, no alcohol, low carbonation. This is a soft and gentle IPA. The bitterness is relatively low and the malts are muted. The aromas and flavors of the hops are pleasantly complex and in charge of the beer. It could use a slightly bigger malt and matching hop backbones. BJCP 7/2/14/4/7

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: Look: pours a dark red copper color. White head. Very clear. Smell: citrus. Grapefruits. Lemon. Oranges. Sweet caramel. Juicy fruit gum. Taste: bitter on the front. Grapefruit. Slightly bitter finish but not overwhelming. Juicy fruit gum Feel: creamy thick mouth feel. Medium carbonation. Overall: good beer. Love how it all works together. Nice a smooth but not over the top. First drank: home 10/16/14

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: Pours hazy copper with little bit of head. Aroma is citrus and floral, very nice. It has a rich grainy texture with its caramel malt profile. It balances very nicely with a slightly bitter piney bite and some citrus and tropical fruit hops. Pretty classic good IPA.

name: Estes Park Renegade
review: 12oz bottle, purchased from Brennan’s in Madison during GTMW. Half hazy red orange color. Slight brown. Thin khaki head. Leaves decent ridges of lace. Decent caramel malt, kind of nice. Toasty, some dark fruit. Mild spicy herbal hop, some tropical fruit, resin. Light hint of grapefruit. More malt forward, but it’s not too sweet. Not bothersome. Moderate bitter taste. Light to moderate sweet. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of creamy, lighter carbonation. Light slick finish. Surprised at how much I enjoyed this one, it being a malt-forward IPA. It’s a nice balance, though.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: 12 oz. bottle. Pours cloudy yellow, with a small, off-white ring. Strong clover honey nose, with some light yogurt, lemon, ginger, corn syrup, and dust. Very sweet, with a hint of bitterness. Medium body, with a sticky and syrupy mouthfeel. This is a cloying mess.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: 355ml bottle. Golden pour. Aroma is fruity and vinous, white grape. Flavor is grapey and vinous, cranberry, very fruity.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: 12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and honey. Taste is malt, grain, grass, and honey. OK.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: Good inoffensive golden ale that makes good use of wild honey. Would be a good choice for anyone who is not a hop aficionado. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: Clean and a little bready. Slightly sweet but not overwhelming. Easy drinking; not super complex but tasty. Nothing to prevent me from getting again.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: Sample at the brewery. Low fluffy white lasting head. Clear yellow golden body. Weak malt straw grass aroma and flavor with mild hints of honey, little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a short finish.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: (Draught) Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of grain, honey, and wheat. Flavor of honey, grain, and herbs.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: Pour on tap at the brewery, clear golden-orange pour with white head, aroma brought some biscuit, honey, bread into a slight wheat, fruity and estery component, touch of grass in there. Taste is sweet honey into some grainy and husky malt, touch of wheaty fruit, hint of yeast, finishing with some grass, slightly watery.

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: Aroma from the bottle is honey and ale, taste is slightly honey flavored a little hops, finish is also slightly sweet but overall the flavor is baffled not over powering sweet

name: Estes Park Stinger Wild Honey Wheat
review: "nice feel and aroma, with the honey really smoothing things out. otherwise a pedestrian effort. very light hopping and muddled malts. if not for the honey this would be a pass, but the honey saved the day."

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: Taster at the brewery. Pours black, with a khaki film. The nose is bittersweet chocolate, black bread, some biscuit, and almonds. Sweet and malty, with a light bitterness. Medium body, with a watery, slick mouthfeel. This is a reasonable stout, but nothing interesting.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: Black pour with a thin light tan ring of foam. Roasty black malt and licorice aroma with a subtle touch of chocolate. Smooth roasty chocolate syrup flavor that’s bready and a touch medium bodied and finishes roasty and dry and grainy. It’s alright.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: Bottled. Near black, beige head. Lemony salmiak aroma. Dryish with medium body and rounded, spritzy mouthfeel. An unpleasant touch of citric acid across caramel and salmiak. Resinous bitter finish. Probably infected.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: 12 ounce bottle. Drain pour. Black, large foamy head, good retention. Aroma of roasted malt and cherries, a bit of bandaid. The taste is tart cherry juice and a bit of roast. Thin, high carbonation. Clearly infected.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: For some reason I really wanted to like this one but... There are much better oatmeal stouts out there. Flavors just seemed kinda weak to me, nothing really stood out in a good or bad way.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: This is the worst beer I have ever had. It tasted like musty skunk water and that is being generous. Had the Oil Can Stout version at Sanfords in Sheridan WY.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: Sample at the brewery. High creamy lasting brown head. Pitch black body. Mild roasted malt coffee liquorice aroma and lavor with a low carbonation and a long finish.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: A weak vanilla aroma. Black with a thin tan and minimal lacing. Dark roasted malts and vanilla with a slightly sour finish. Palate is a little creamy and moderately heavy.

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: Look: pours a dark black. Brown sugar color head. Smell: chocolate powder. A bitter coffee. Roasted malt. Black Licorice. Taste: chocolate bar. Bitter coffee. Malt heavy. Slight bitterness on the back. Feel: a little dry. Thin mouth feel for a stout. Overall: not a bad beer really. Nice balance in the malts and other flavors. All around good beer. First drank: home 10/22/14

name: Estes Park Samson Stout
review: a very nice, perhaps underrated oatmeal stout. very dark and very smooth. full bodied and yet light. very flavorful, oats and chocolate, hints of coffee. one of my faves of the night."

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Blind Tasted with 4 other "red" ales. Beers were 1. Crystal Lake Brewing Fox Rocker 2. Crooked Fence Trainwreck Red Ale 3. JosephsBrau Drive Thru Red 4. The Stanley Hotel Redrum Ale 5. O’Fallon STL Red. Rater 1 rated the beers 14253, Rater 2 14325 Rater 3 (ME) 14325. 355ml bottle. Orange pour. Aroma is papery and thin, slightly tart. Flavor is oxidized nad sweet, not great. Post tasting thoughts: Surprised to see this listed as a "bitter". I guess this brewery is stuck in 1985. It is a remarkably bad brew.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: (Draught) Pours a clear amber body with a medium beige head. Aroma of caramel, earth, fruit, and bread. Flavor of grass, caramel, earth, and grain with a somewhat dry finish.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Nice color, a little cloudy, with a slight yeasty aftertaste. Overall, it’s drinkable.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: 10/10/2010. Sampled at the brewery. Copper color with a white head. Caramel aromas with light roasted malt and hops. Light caramel flavors with hops on the finish, but all very muted.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: 12 oz bottle as The Stanley Hotel Redrum Ale. Reddish-copper and clear appearance with a white head. Pretty bland aroma and flavor, a balance of bitter hops and caramel malts. Light thin body with a soft, dry feel and a bittersweet finish. Not their best offering.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Sampled at the brewery on October 9, 2012 Clear reddish to copper color, tan head. Sweet, malty, fruity scent. Sweet, malty taste. A bit fruity aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Aroma is hops and fruit. Pours orange with a frothy white head. Taste is sweet and fruity with some hops.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Light hop/malt balanced nose. Amber in color. Smooth, malty amber-like ale with a little extra hop kick in the finish. Notes: Pub visit during ’09 GABF

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: This ale poured a clear, dark red colour with a soapy head. Not very appealing to look at. Scents include pineapple, citrus hopps, slight ripe fruit and hard apple cider. First sip was watery. Very thin mouthfeel. flavours of ripe fruit, hopps and cider. Finish is hoppy with a slight bitterness on the tongue.

name: Estes Park Trail Ridge Red
review: Tap at brewery. Amber pour. Caramel malt, hops, golden raisin aroma. Flavor is lightly bitter, lots of caramel malt.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: 12oz bottle. Old School APA. Not that impressive ever, and certainly not even close to par for 2017. Unfiltered murky orange-amber body. Thin, creamy, off-white head. Old school Ringwood style yeast tones...earthy, caramel, sweet. Resinous, but not that much hop depth. Drinkable I suppose, but not what I’m looking for in an APA.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a decent looking golden copper color body with a decent half finger white foamy head that simmered down to a nice adequate milky looking film of a lacing speckling the glass. The smell had a decent amount of citric like hops but also a balanced amount of caramel malts. The taste was sweet through the malts and the hops but still carried a decent amount of bitterness to allow a pervasive bitterness on my taste buds. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium with a fair sessionability about it. The carbonation was actually smoother than most APA’s I’ve had, still no worries. Overall, not a bad APA, just not one that shows enough to go bonkers about.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: A nice light hop aroma. Hazy in color, little head. Pretty light, with some hops in the finish. Very unaggressive but pretty well made.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: Thanks Crazy. Hazy yellow pour with wisps of white. Aroma is mild and sweet. Flavor is sweet with just a touch of hop bite. Medium body. Pretty average (but quality) APA.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: [Colorado Road Trip – 2006] A nice light golden colored brew. This had some great flavors and was easy to drink. Odd it was a seasonal at the time I drank it other than they had some left from the summer season. I did like the beer and would drink another for lunch.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
review: Bottle poured a hazy golden amber with a large lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel, hint of butterscotch and honey. Palate was medium bodied. Flavors of carmel, light citrus, honey and a hint of apple with a lingering bitter finish.

name: Estes Park Pale Ale
