Dark brown with a creamy tan head that is mostly lasting with good lacing. The balanced flavor is deep roasted chocolate with medium acidity and a short sweet finish. The lively full body is creamy/syrupy with an astringent feel to the finish. Very much a sweet porter IMO.

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: [on tap in Cincinnati airport] Opaque, dark yellow with a thin, wispy cover. Biscuity and wheaty aroma with plenty of diacetyl. Prominent wheat sourness in the flavour with butterscotch from both malt and yeast. No bitterness and with lemony notes. Also no hops flavour. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: Smells like canned corn. Hazy orange color with a low tight head. Foul grain taste - vegetable-like. Metallic quality come forward at the end. Some diacytel. Thin and weak. Yikes. Stay away from this.

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: Draft at Watson Bros.. Cloudy amber color with medium rocky head that diminshed quickly. Medium wheat aroma. Light body. Average wheat flavor with a light sweet finish. Earlier Rating: 5/14/2005 Total Score: 2.5 Draft sampler. Poured a dark hazy amber with small rocky head. Aroma was sweet wheat with the same medium flavor. Finish and texture was a little watery. Below average compared to style.

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: At the Cincinnati airport Watson’s outlet. Slightly hazy and active, with a mellow yeast aroma. Sweet and musty, with an average citric-yeast character.

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: Decent but not even as good as Blue Moon, a bit bland.......................

name: Watson Brothers Woodys American Wheat
review: Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. I found this to be a somewhat boring beer. I think it would be more enjoyable in the summer. Poured a dark yellow with a medium white head. Light citrus aroma. Lightly sweet citrus/pineapple flavor. Eh.

name: Watson Brothers Steamboat Stout
review: Had one of these on tap at Watson Bros Bistro & Brewery last night in Cincy prior to the Tool show. Nose of heavy chocolate and dried fruit. Dark black with a creamy tan head that is fully lasting with great lacing. Flowery and fruity sweet start and finish. Very low acidity. Dry, soft, full body. The best offering I sampled here.

name: Watson Brothers Steamboat Stout
review: Intersting beer (sampled off tap at Watson Brothers Brewing in Blue Ash Ohio). Very strong coffee flavors up front that leads into a sweet creamyness. The taste gets to be a bit much towards the end, almost a cloying sweetness, but its an interesting effort.

name: Moylans IPA
review: This is a backlog rating from 2011 from a bottle, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are citrus and floral hops, caramel, good.

name: Moylans IPA
review: 1pt 6 fl oz bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. BBD: not found. Supposed relatively fresh. Pours hazy dark gold with nice white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Herbal, fruity, some peachy, citrusy nose. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, dry, fruity, some residual sweetness. Quite enjoyable.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Tap at squirrel. Puts clear good some head and lots of lacijgZ nose is dank cardboard. Flavours of grapefruit, dank cardboard. Taste med bitter light sweet. Full sticky body lively carbonation.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Keg at the brewpub, 01/02/16. Golden orange with a decent off White covering. Nose is caramel malt, grapefruit waftings, toasted malt, orange peel, light bread dough. Taste comprises orange pith, citric tinged straw, melon, grapefruit flesh, toasted bread. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close.Solid enough old school IPA.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Draft at source. Nose is an incredible citrus explosion, mostly orange and lemon. Very clear pale golden color with a small white head. Taste is initially a pithy bitterness followed by some light lemon citrus and a hint of warming in the ears. Decent.

name: Moylans IPA
review: 650ml bottle, pours golden brown, clear, with a small, white head. Aroma is caramel malt, pine, light citrus, peppery spice. Light medium body, oily texture, finish is long, spicy bitter. Carbonation soft to average.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter nice herbal flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Oily palate.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Pours a hazy orange with a large fluffy white head. Sweet aromas of fruity malt, some spices and a variety of fresh hops. Tastes hoppy and nicely balanced with sweet caramel malt. Pleasant spicy bitter finish. Medium bodied.

name: Moylans IPA
review: Pale clear, huge white head. strong hopped aroma (floral, grapefruit, a bit piney). Taste full of tropical fruit with good bitterness barely balanced with the sweetness of malts. Strong carbonation, very soft dry finish. West coast

name: Moylans IPA
review: Botella @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 23/01/2015 Color ambar, aroma citricos. Cuerpo medio y carbonatacion moderada

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: A robust malt bomb of a beer with tons of smoky malt and leatheriness. Pours a very pretty striking mahogany with a sticky beige head. It does one thing, but it does it very well. Ample alcohol kick, but not hot, and drinks a bit a lighter than its ABV would imply. Worthy of several pints.

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: Copenhagen 16/10 2019. 47,3 cl can from Mad & Vin, Magasin, Kbh. K. Green and Orange version of Moylan's usual compact design. Pours murky, muddy Maroon with an orange hue. Small Off-white head. Settles as a small patch of lonely foam not nearly covering the surface of the beer. No lacing. Aroma is medium-intense and caught between the sweet and slightly candy-like and the salty. Sweet malts. Caramel with a touch of sugar. Raisins. Touch of Salt Water. Quite strong carbonation. Slightly thick, watery, tingling texture. Flavor is quite sweet followed by a more moderate bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet with a light sourish bitter undertone. Very light touch of metal. Semi-dry finish. Despite being on the sweet side it avoids being cloying - maybe due to the salty and dry touch. And the name may not be subtle - but it is amusing.

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: The beer is pretty strong at six percent and it goes down easy but not much going on in terms Of taste. On tap In the Burbank airport

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: Aroma: caramel and dried druits. Taste: caramel, malt, toffee, bit of dried fruits and herbs

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: Freezing Midtown bottle share. Clear amber with some light beige foam. Sweet honey malty nose, soft and pillowy. Tastes malty, sweet and light raw spice in the finish. Has still character although it drinks quite easy overall. Nice bitter tingle in the finish, dry and not much sweetness. Pint material.

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: Pours dark, caramelly copperbrown. Small white head. Smell is toffee. Caramel. Taste is full, sharp, tad bitter, toffee. Caramelly, full, OK body. Nutty. Nice !

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: 660ml bottle (Brevinga, Riga) Dry oxidised rich ale aroma, reminds me of some Latvian traditional malty brews, but with a ton of raisins too. Similar taste, some apple joins the mix. Finish is dry, and nutty-to-woody-to-papery. Palate is light, not feeling like an 8%-er. Im not getting alcohol in the taste either. Whats the BB on this, as this is very oxidised? But I like that.

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: 660ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Hazy brown color. Medium size, off-white head, stays. Dusty, berries, milky and some spices in aroma. Kind of bland aroma. Sour, caramel, berries, milky, buttery in taste. Buttery and caramel in aftertaste. Sharp carbonation. Buttery mouthfeel. Meh brew.

name: Moylans Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
review: Bottle (thanks fatphil). Pours amber with beige head. Aroma is sweet, berries, malt, raisins. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, fruits, caramel. Finish is sweet and malty, some bitterness and booze. Feels bit watery, carbonation is high. Overall: okish.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of light sweet malt and sourdough. Clear amber with off-white head, mostly lasting. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and some sourness. Light body, watery feel and light sour malty finish.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: On Tap at Growler Guys, Meridian. clear redish brown. Thin light tan head. Woody sweet malts with a touch of peat and brown sugar. Rather scotish I might say. Very malty and smooth.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Draft: Poured a reddish orange with a white head. Aroma is sweet malts. Taste was similar with lots of malt presence.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: On tap @ the brewpub during RateBeer weekend. Lightly golden orange appearance with a white head. Butterscotch, caramel, and citrus in the aroma. Thin, fairly malty, and buttery (butterscotch and toffee). Pass.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Copper body with a loose white head. Smells of cereal and dust. Full body with the taste of honey cereal and a bit of something berry like. A decent non offensive sipper.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Draft at the brewery, served in a flight. Pours a clear darkish gold with a thin white ring for a head. Not red, to be sure. Notes of cereal and sweet malts, honey, sugars, and Juicyfruit gum. Light-bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet, flat mouthfeel. No depth in any sense.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Sampled draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. Dark amber, creamy tanned head. Nose is old mold & herbal weeds. Taste is weird doughy corn, moldy yeast, paper, sugar, dough, herbal, big weird dough. Moldy doughy yeast body. Possibly past prime, excessive yeast, paper notes, messy profile. Not a fan.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: [2/1/16] Draught at Moylan’s Brewery in Novato. Copper-amber. Aroma of malt, caramel. Sweetish flavor with caramel, toffee, some vegetables, bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Draft - Grains with a touch of caramel. Clear copper with a decent a small white head. Caramel, light grains and twig with a dry finish.

name: Moylans Dannys Irish Style Red Ale
review: Draught at Moylans. Almost clear deep amber liquid with small white head. Aroma of caramel, light earth, bread and toast. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of sweet malt, licorice, wort and caramel. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Forgettable.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Bomber from La Mesa Market. Hazy golden color upon pouring. Sweet berry aroma. Some sourness as well. Sweet fruity flavored with some sour. Some sour/lambic qualities. Better than your average fruit beer.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Date: 03/22/1997 Source: Brewpub Appearance: cloudy dark yellow, whispy head, Aroma: sweet berry aroma, Flavor: light wheat flavor with a sweet berry finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Soapy and cloying palate with an extract laden nose. Mildly aspartame like sweetness and some acidity. Very extract forward finish with an overly fizzy mouthfeel.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: (22 oz bottle: $2.80 at Moylan’s Brewery in Novato, CA) What is with these guys? So many of their bottles are severely over carbonated. Despite a very careful pour, I still ended up with a complete glass of foam. Hell, there’s even an inch of foam topping the beer INSIDE THE BOTTLE now. I may as well go rate another beer and come back to this one after the head dies down. {Rated Abita Purple Haze} Okay, I’m back, and the head has receded to a very bubbly, quarter inch layer atop the beer. For quite some time, the frenetic rush of carbonation bubbles as they raced to the surface was quite a sight. Unfortunately, the wait wasn’t worth it. The berry flavor of this beer is lightly tart, and lightly sweet, but isn’t especially fruity and tastes artificial and plasticy to me. Since the berry is the overwhelming flavor, it’s hard to get past it. The wheat flavor in the background seems pretty standard. Mild hops bitterness isn’t especially noticeable until the finish, where it’s barely noticeable. The nose matches the tart berry and wheat flavor. The palate is (obviously) highly carbonated, and the beer is light to medium in body. Light golden color with a modest haziness on the early pours, but the final pour releases a good amount of sediment from the bottom of the bottle, so the beer shows lots of suspended particles. The foamy head is off-white, but with all that foam, there is no lacing since it just slides right down the glass, returning to surface of the beer. Not a bad beer, I mean, it’s okay, but if you’re gonna make a boisenberry wheat beer where the berry dominates, at least make it fruity.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Looks like an American Hefeweizen, but has the flavor of a great soft fruit beer. The fruit is nicely balanced with the wheat and is a great starter or finish beer for your meal at the brewpub.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: WOW this smells exactly like some skunky blue berry chronic and has a real fruity scent none like i have none in the past. It looks like a hefeweizen in the glass but don’t be fooled. I was fooled and wondering how they pulled off lacing berry flavors and not making the beer as sweet as it smells.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: at the brewery. quite pale, generic berry aroma, tasted lightly of blueberry and a little of the lemony wheat beer base. pleasant enough

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Nice fruity aroma - slightly cloudy gold appearance with an uneven head. Tasted like a raspberry club soda - the rest of the beer was hidden away.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Tap@Moylans Brewpub. Pretty refreshing, Very light bosenberry flavour, light tart. Simple and innofensive.

name: Moylans Wheat Berry
review: Draft at brewpub. Hazy yellow, nice head. Definite fruit aroma. Dry wheat flavor breaks into a big boysenberry syrup finish. Not bad, just a hair too syrupy sweet for me.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft: Poured an orange with a white colored head. Aroma is light wheat. Taste is sugary and wheat.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: On tap @ the brewpub during RateBeer weekend. Hazy yellow appearance with a white head. Aroma is a little twangy with some wheat, lemon, and corn. Thin and watery. A little buttery. Lemon flavor. Moderate high bitterness.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Keg at the brewpub, 01/02/16. Hazed orange with a moderate off White covering. Nose is a touch thin, light citric peel, grain, wheaten bread. Taste comprises peach, apricot, grass, grain, light bread. Medium bodied, slightly prickly carbonation, semi drying close. Forgettable.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft at the brewery, served in a flight. Pours a hazy pale gold with a small off-white ring for a head. Notes of wheat, yeast, hay, and muddled fruits. Light-medium bodied, with a wheaty, yeasty mouthfeel and low to moderate carbonation. Pretty simple and straightforward, not bad.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft at the brewpub. Hazed golden yellow coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is subdued cereal grains, little wheat, earthy hop. Flavour is composed of pils cereal grains, fruity esters, Berry. Palate is highish carbonation. Frothy, lingering grainy, Berry fruit.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft at Moylan’s. Nose is grainy bread without any real fruity notes. Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Flavor is lightly sweet with a hint of white pepper.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: [2/1/16] Draught at Moylan’s Brewery in Novato. Hazy golden. Aroma of wheat, vegetal notes. Sweetish flavor, buttery hint.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft - Light pale malts. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Wheat and a light sweetness. OK.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours mostly clear yellow with a creamy white head. Some buttery dough in the nose. Medium sweet flavor, some further butter notes, simple dough, light straw. Light bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish, more dough, light hay. So so.

name: Moylans Unfiltered Wheat
review: Draught at Moylans. Light hazy hay yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of earth, lemon, grain and light sweet fruit. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of lemon, earth and hay. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Forgettable.

name: Moylans Special Bitter
review: Draught at St. Augustine’s, Vancouver Golden color, clean, with thick nitro head. No aroma, it tastes like a bland Ale, a bit of fruity esters, low bitterness, and the nitro kills the flavor. Very boring.

name: Moylans Special Bitter
review: On tap at St. Augustine’s. Clear goldish blond, white head. Aroma and taste slightly hoppy, similar slightly to some pops. Meh

name: Moylans Special Bitter
review: Nitro tap at Peel’s Pizza. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a thick small bead nitro head. Aroma is rising bread dough. Taste is sweet pale malt, bread dough and mild floral hop bitterness. A simple thirst quencher.

name: Moylans Special Bitter
review: 100ml on tap at Taphouse. Stable pearl white head leaving lacing rings behind. Hazy golden body. Mid-dry citrus nose. Taste of mid-tart citrus. wheat, and leafy hops. Bitter ending. Medium bodied. Decent (Copenhagen 13.11.2015).

name: Moylans Special Bitter
review: Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen - golden Amber pour with white head. Aroma and taste is fruity and grassy hoppy, pretty citric fruity medium sweet with some souring off notes, straw, grassy bitter finish. Not sure on this. ---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Coopers Sparkling Ale
review: Mooi oranje geel van kleur met een milde witte schuimkraag. Het bier heeft mooie kleine koolzuur belletjes. Het bier smaakt granig zoet en heeft een mooie bloemige bitterheid.

name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
review: Black in the glass, medium carbonation, one finger creamy head. Smell of coffee, roasted malt, plums, blueberries and a bit of alcohol. Refreshing, easy drinking, coffee, roasted malt, black fruits, traces of dark chocolate. A bit sweet. The finish brings coffee, dark chocolate and hints of alcohol.

name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
review: This is the best tasting stout ever!! You must let the stout sit for a while after pouring to let it oxygenate in order to get the proper taste.It needs to be in more stores because it is very difficult to find. I have been telling friends about Coopers for more then 10 years!!!

name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
review: Chocolatey flavour with the most beautiful head and lovely smell and lovely finish.

name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
review: Black in colour, pours thick. A little confused as to what the "extra" in the title is referring to, because this is mostly tasteless. Won't bother with another taste.

name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
review: Bottle. A- Molasses, slightly sweet, mild dark fruits. A- Black color, black liquid, tan head. T- Cocoa, slightly milky, dark fruits, roasty. P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish. O- Bottled said best after Dec. 2017. So here we are 18 months later. Started off a bit more fruity while cold and become much more roasty and slightly dry as it warmed. Not bad. Pretty solid all around.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Botella de @Gustos, Guijuelo. 01/08/2019 Color marrón oscuro corona de espuma blanca aromas a cereal con notas a levadura, sabor maltosa, notas caramelo. Cuerpo medio.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Bottle. Brown-dark amber color, yellowish foam. Aroma: fruity, dried fruits, prunes, sweetness, caramel, plums. Taste: sweetish, caramel, slightly wine, prunes, light hops, mediocre.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Cerveza de estilo doble belga, de color oscuro caramelo y notas dulces y alcoholicas

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: From the “jug”. Pours brown with a voluminous beige head that slowly settles. Aroma is overall quite mild but a bit vinous with notes of tea and caramel. Taste is mildly bittersweet with hints of toffee lingering on the tongue. Dry at the end. Body stays fairly light, carbonation is mild. Easy drinking without the complexity of some Dubbels but pleasant enough.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Bottle, 500 ml. Another very poor beer considering it should be extraordinary. It's not. Actually it's very poor. Weak on the nose, dull on the palate, it's just not a good one. R u kiddin' me? Below average...

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Dark brown nearly black, medium white head and nice lacing. Aroma, terrible, of metal. Tastes malty and sweet, roasted hazelnuts and chocolate. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and astringent finish. Not impressed.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Poured into a tulip glass it poured out a very dark brown with a head that went away quickly. The aroma is sweet fruity, plum/raisin like. Taste is very carbonated/bubbly with nice roasted malty notes, and fruity esters with an extremely clean finish. A very good beer to drink on a warm summer evening. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: Bought this 50 cl ceramic bottle with flip top at Bierparadijs (Meer). Dark colour with a medium foam top. Strong caramel hints in the aroma. Tastes rather sweet with dried fruits in the aftertaste. Definitely a keeper!

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: 500ml ceramic bottle at home. Brown pour with reddish edges. Thick tan head with good retention and lacing. Caramel, dark fruit, bread, spice, yeast, mild floral hops. Lively carbonation and light body. Sweet finish. Honestly, given the packaging I was expecting a little more.

name: St. Sebastiaan Dark
review: 500ml ceramic bottle from the Offie, Leicester. Packaging is over the top but the beer itself is rather attractive: cola brown, slightly translucent with a loose khaki head. Light nutty aroma with some liquorice and sweet spice. Sweet taste with enough of a balance to give it character. Again there’s a nutty note in the fairly short finish. Very heavily carbonated, which works for the light body. It’s a delicious drink of a style I’m fond of, although I’ve had better.

name: Weihenstephaner Original
review: This is a nice hellea. Sweet malt, and lightly bitter hops. Very drinkable and a nice appearance with a tall white head.

name: Weihenstephaner Original
review: Malt, sweet aroma. I thought a little caramel honey. easy. grassiness. The taste is malt, with hop grassy. Aftertaste with a slight hop bitterness.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: 500 ml bottle at the Royal Oak. First new MJ 500 tick of this trip. Pitch black with a talll, bubbly head. Nose is chocolate, light coffee, a bit of soy sauce. Soft and chocolatey flavor, not sweet, minerals, grassy hop, lightly roasted. Very nice, easy drinking, wth huge flavors. The hops are noticeable, the roast not too much, and not too sweet. I would say that this is still a representative British porter.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: Tiefschwarz. Schöne anhaltende Krone. Geschmack von Röstmalz und Lakritze. Fast wie Guiness nur noch ganz so samtig.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: 4/4/2018. Bottle at Cobbetts, Dorking. Pours almost black with a small off-white to beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, hop, toffee, liquorice and a hint of coffee. Medium sweetness, moderate roasted bitterness. Moderate body, somewhat thin texture, soft carbonation. Ok but expected better and not one of Harvey's better ones.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: Bottle. Large thick cream head. Mahogany body. Nose is fruits, alcohol, dark oak, Crystal malt, hops. Bittersweet and tangy. Creamy mouthfeel. Dry fibish. Good.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: 500ml bottle. Black-ish chestnut colour with small, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white to beige head. Roasty, dark malty aroma with hints of liquorice, cocoa powder, slightly burnt coffee beans, roasted nuts, minimally floral hoppy overtones, a cautious touch of lovage. Taste is roasty dark malty, spicy, minimally metallic, diluted hints of liquorice, hints of lovage, an earthy nuttily touch as well; minimally watery.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: Bottle. Reddish black colour. Lots of lightly roasted malts (caramel, toffee, liquorice, some chocolate and coffee). Fruity (dark fruits). Port-like flavour. Sweetish leading to a dry roasty bitter hoppy finish. Very nice! (2008)

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: Bottle from the brewery in Lewes. Found this porter to be a little too bitter (prefer Harvey’s ales) although it did have some delicious hints of classic porter flavours at the back of the mouth.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: (bottle) Clear, slightly ruby brown colour with a beige and medium-sized foamy head. Leafy dark malty aroma with notes of dark chocolate, leather and mocha. Mildly roasty bitter and delicately sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Dry and slightly roasted malty taste with notes of bread crusts, dark chocolate, mocha and hints of licquorice towards the finish with a subtle dried fruity edge. 27.XI.16

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: 0.5 l bottle from ’Rudat’, best before August 2018. Clear, very dark red to black with a thin, frothy, almost stable, beige head. Faint, sweetish-malty, slightly roasty aroma of chocolate, caramel and some coffee. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty and minimally fruity taste of chocolate, coffee, licorice, caramel and some raisins, followed by a short, moderately roasty-bitter, a bit dry finish. Medium body, just slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Simple, classic, but tasty Porter.

name: Harveys 1859 Porter (Bottle)
review: Bottle: Deep chestnut-amber coloured, small and stable off-white foamy layer with a little lace; mild sweetish-bitter roasty nose with illusions of nuts and liquorice; mild to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied, very soft; drier toasty and a bit peaty finish with hints of liquorice. Very well drinkable stuff...

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: On tap (from sampler) at Alcatraz Brewing Co, Indianapolis on 15 March 2010. Very bright clear pale gold. Very pale in fact. Good condition. Does what it does OK. Clean, dry and drinkable.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: Tap at Alcatraz. Pours clear gold with an average, creamy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (grainy, meal, cereal), light hops (spicy), and light esters (fruity) with notes of dust and corn. Flavor is heavy malt (grainy, meal, cereal), light hops (spicy), and light esters (fruity). Light body, low warmth and creaminess, high carbonation with a dry and biting finish.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: (draught) pale gold with small white head. Very little aroma. Mild malt flavor. Nothing too exciting - perhaps a good transition from American pale lagers.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: Sampled at the brewpub. I suppose this is an obligatory beer in many brewpubs. Very clear light golden with a nice little white head. A light malt aroma. Some life in the feel. Light malt and soft malt in the flavor are pretty well balanced if way too thin. An "ok" beer at best.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: Seemed like a very average pale ale. Golden pour, white head. Usual pale ale look and flavor.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: Had on tap at the brewpub. Average and mildly disappointing, like most of the stuff I tried while there.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: light Lager with some nice lacing, fairly light in color, some faint attractive butter notes, the carbonation level contributes but isn’t dominant as in the big name brands.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: tap at the IN brewpub - Pours clear yellow with a thin white head. It has a slight malt aroma. The flavor is mild grainy malt with a touch of hops in the finish. It’s light bodied and bland.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: on tap-pours a white head and straw color. Aroma is grain, faint saaz, thin. Taste is sweet grain, faint saaz, thin. Right on for style.

name: Alcatraz Searchlight Golden Ale
review: Poured a golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma was mainly of corn and grass. Flavor is also pretty grassy with some bad adjunct, the only positive is it was very light so not too undrinkable.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: On tap (from sampler) at Alcatraz Brewing Co, Indianapolis on 15 March 2010. Gold. Clean and drinkable. Quite restrained hop presence. Middle of the road APA. Not a lot else to say really.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Tap at Alcatraz. Pours clear copper with an average, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, toasted), heavy hops (floral, pine, citrus), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of peach. Flavor is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, grainy, toasted), heavy hops (pine, citrus), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of pineapple. Medium body and carbonation, low warmth and creaminess with a dry and biting finish.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Sampled at the brewpub. Brownish gold with a light colored foamy head. Flavor is pine and grapefruit hop notes. A nice chewy caramel backbone. Just a hint of cinnamon. Nicely done.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Had this one on draught at the brewpub in downtown Indianapolis, Indiana. Hazy, reddish brown pour with a one finger, tan head. Excellent floral hoppiness in then nose. Grapefruit dryness and hops balanced with a nice, soft fruitiness that comes through into the finish, before being ultimately overpowered by the nice, potent bitterness of the beer. I liked this one, too.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Amber color. Nice flavor of hops and malts. Good balance. Light to medium body. Good but not extraordinary.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Had on tap while visiting my brother. Big floral/citrus hops, but something is off... not all that enjoyable.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: IBGF 2009: Light coppery hue with an okay head and lace. The aroma has notes of bready and caramel malts, grassy and citric hops, and a touch of mineral water. The taste starts with sweet malts and the hop are noticeable but a background player. Moderate hop spice and citric twang throughout. The mouth feel is a tad chalky but fairly good for the style. An okay brew but nothing to make a trip for.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: Amber in color with nice lacing on Tap in Indy. This Pale Ale was sweeter than most , but lt passes quickly, with straight dry hops in the middle to a clean finish. Aroma was not noticeably a big play.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: On tap at Anaheim. Pours a translucent golden with copper notes and a smaller off white head that laced. Aroma of light citrus, caramel and cereal grains. Flavor of mixed citrus, pine, caramel and doughy.

name: Alcatraz Pelican Pale Ale
review: tap at Mad Anthony Oktoberfest - Pours hazy copper and has a nice citrus hop aroma. The white head is long lasting and laces well. It’s hop heavy for a pale ale and in this case it works well. This medium bodied brew is a very tasty pale ale. sampled again at the Indy brewpub.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: On tap (from sampler) at Alcatraz Brewing Co, Indianapolis. Reddish colour - pretty much the same as the Irish American Red which I had a t the same time. So similar that I wondered whether they were really different beers but the brewer, who was on site, assured me that they were different. Actually tasted quite different. Lots of caramel and creamy toffee notes in this one. There’s a little hop bite. Overall, too much caramel for my liking.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Tap at Alcatraz. Pours clear copper with a small, fizzy cream colored head, low retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, toasted), average hops (earthy, grassy, woody), and light esters (fruity) with notes of peach and pineapple. Flavor is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, toasted), average hops (earthy, grassy, pine), and average esters (fruity) with notes of pineapple. Medium body, warmth, and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry finish.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Nice earthy malt flavors, brownish tan and just a little coudy., I would be hard pressed to call this a pale ale as there is minimal hop influence even at the end. A nice beer but maby more in the direction of an Alt. Nice Lacing as in several of their beers

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: tap in Indy - Pours amber and laces nicely. It has a mild caramel malt aroma. The flavor is caramel malt with light hops. It’s light bodied and overall too bland once again. So far that’s an unfortunate trend for the brewery, but it is significantly better than the blonde ale and wheat I had before it.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Tap at Anaheim. Pours a translucent amber with a medium creamy off white head that laced. Aroma of caramel, toffee and mixed citrus. Flavor of caramel, toffee, grapefruit, pine and ligtly toasted malt.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Pours a light red color with an off white head. Aroma was some sweet malt and thats about it. Flavor was very weak and watery, a hint of hops and malt, just bad

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Radish (no I didn’t mean reddish) colored beer with a ring of a head. Semi-sweet with caramel, roasted nuts and just a pinch of hop bitterness. Drinkable but not spectacular.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Tap in Orange. Style sheet said 6.0% alcohol. Pours a reddish color. Aroma of caramel and toffee, with nice light citrus notes. The flavor is nicely balanced malt and mild hops. Light bitterness, medium body. Solid, but unspectacular.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: Tap @ the brewpub. Poured a clear orange-copper color with an off-white head. Nutty and toasty malt with mild citrus notes. Light fruity caramel with a hint of citrus. Light to medium body.

name: Alcatraz Big House Red
review: On tap @ Alcatraz (Anahiem) 10/07 - Pours a clear amber color with a small off white head. Light spotty lacing. Aroma and flavor is mainly caramel malt balance nicely with the right amount of hops and a touch of esters. Light to medium body. A decent beer.

name: Alcatraz Breakout Stout
review: In Indy, this was a dry Irish stout. Roasty and dry. So so. Light hops. Enjoyable.

name: Alcatraz Breakout Stout
review: In Tempe (Phoenix) this is the Box Car Stout. It has an excellent strong scent with an equally strong taste of chocolate/coffee. A great stout for any dark connoisseur.

name: Alcatraz Breakout Stout
review: 11/02 - growler from Michigan - Medium to thick body. Strong roasted and chocolate malt flavors. well hopped - dry finish. This is listed as a sweet stout, but seemed more like a dry stout to me. Very good

name: Alcatraz Breakout Stout
review: Well, up here the Alcatraz stout is an oatmeal, rather ill made: sickly and poorly carbonated with a weird, rotted berry aftertaste.

name: Alcatraz Breakout Stout
review: Re-Rate 03/25/02Now called "Lights Out Stout". Not sure what "Hennes" was drinking, also this is the Arizona Brewery. Deep dark brown, chocolate head, fair lace. Toasted grain nose, chocolate, caramel. Front slightly malt sweet, the middle light, the finish dry and fairly well hopped. Light carbonation, a lighter version of a "Dry irish Stout".

name: Alcatraz Brewberry Ale
review: My Wife loved It. I thought it was a little too sweet, but good flavor. pretty pale and blah looking, but overall, i guess drinkable. amd i’d have maybe another, if a cute girl bought me one.

name: Alcatraz Brewberry Ale
review: The less said about this the better. I'll find myself ranting and fill up your screen with unfortunate expletives.

name: Alcatraz Brewberry Ale
review: Good fruity beer, malts, fruit and hops balanced nicely. Just not a fruit beer lover, they all tend to be a little to sweet as you would expect. Excellent selection if you like these fruit styled beers.

name: Bear Republic Golden Ale
review: Tap @ brewpub. Light golden yellow. Slightly sweet. Crisp start and a smooth finish.

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review:
From a bottle. Pours golden with a frothy head that dissipates to a one-inch rocky head. Good retention. Nice aromas of pine and citrus, but also biscuit, caramel and herbal tones. Upfront flavors of butterscotch, herbs, leather and grapefruit. Finishes with a hint dried apricot, citrus and some resiny
…

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: The pallet is what stands out on the beer. I get all the piney grassy hops of an ipa, but the pallet is crisp and smooth. Pretty good, nothing exceptional, but an every day ipa fo sho

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review:
8.26.2011 - Gingerman, Houston, TX On Tap
…

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: Amber with a light white head. Taste of sweet caramel then a nice hoppy finish. Overall a nice IPA. Would I pay 13/6 - no

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review:
the pour is an orangish amber color with, an aroma of hops, and citrus, some floral. The taste is sweet with a floral taste to start, then goes to a bitter hop finish. The palate is smooth and refreshing, but leaves a strong bitterness taste at the back of your mouth. Again, if your a hop head, you probably would like
…

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: not a bad little ale, kind of average. has that california salty hop flavor thats at least how i describe it. lighter color, not a bad aroma little hoppy little booze, pretty smooth and light, finishes with a little boozy aftertaste and grassy hops. ok nothing special.

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: Pours a nice anber with a good white head. Has nice aroma of citrus hops, fruits and flowers. Has a good mouthfeel. Good carbination. Not as hearty as Racer 5 but still pretty good. Nice bitter finish.

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: On draft at McG’s, I wonder why so few ratings? Not as massive as the prior taste of sly fox, but still a standard IPA. Nice hazy look to this, a bit pale, thick head. Standard grapefruit and pine.

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: Had is on tap at Bobbique with my friend Chapel. This beer was pretty decent. Maybe not the best for IPAs, but overall a good beer.

name: Bear Republic India Pale Ale
review: Tap at Bobbique. Not very IPAish, but the hops are present enough to count. I am no hop head, but this could have done with a little more just to add more definition to the flavor. It was otherwise a tad watery.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Backlog on tap in Philly, pours a dark red color with a small to medium beige head. Notes are grain, pine resin, floral, and caramel malt. Medium bodied with lower carb. Bitter finish.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Draft at Hair of the Dog - Phrom Phong in Bangkok. Pours a deep golden reddish-brown, opaque, with a one finger head that lingers, with lacing. Not much aroma - a hint of malt, slight soapy scent. First sip is deep malty flavour balanced with bitter hops - low carbonation, palate is a bit oily. Good residual hop flavour. With continued consumption, the malt recedes a bit, and the hops come to the front - and stay beyond the end. The palate is less thick than the colour would suggest. This was a pretty good ale - I think it just uses hops that are not my favourites.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: $1.49 bottle from Rio Hill Wine. Pours red and hazy with a beige head. Aroma is citrus, resin, red fruit. Ah, lovely flavor that somehow just took me back to Tahoe. Citrus peel and juice, caramel, sweet red fruit, pine. Very nice.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: From Mar 2008 I got this in a trade with goaliepride. Thanks Michael! It pours a hazy(that turns cloudy after the first pour) reddish brown with a good 2 finger head of foam. A couple of minutes into the session and there's a lot of shrinkage but there's still a solid layer in my glass and there's some good lacing. The smell is nice and hoppy(citrus) and has a faint roasted malt nose. The taste on first sip and I'm getting a lot hoppy goodness...citrus and pine dominate. A few more sips in and I start to notice the malt, both roasted and caramel, and it brings some nice balance to this Red Ale. Tasty stuff here. It has a pretty full mouthfeel to it for a Red, the carbonation is medium light, and it finishes slightly bitter with some bready tones. Very easy to drink and really satisfying. A top notch example of the style, me thinks. I'm glad I have another bottle but I know it won't be long before I pop the cap on *that* one.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Beautiful pour.. murky brown, huge foamy tan head. Slight malt on aroma... overall pretty neutral there. Taste is sweet, bitter, malt.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Claimed to be a malty Scottish style, but I’m missing that caramel component. Light sweetness, some chocolate, but that’s all that sets this apart from being an IPA. High hop aroma and bitterness. For me, it’s just ok.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: 15/20 reminds me of the founders dirty bastard, not quite as chocolatey, but an ale that’s a good mix of malt, bitterness and chocolate. Very good

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Poured from a bottle. Cloudy reddish-brown with a creamy tan head that leaves a fine lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty caramel. A light sweetness quickly followed by hoppy bitter with moderately long finish. Medium body and a little thick and creamy on the palate.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Bottle from Beers of Europe, drunk in the comfort of my own dwelling. It’s a deep brownish amber, clear with a magnificent off-white head. Lovely aroma: cherries, a touch of cinnamon, some glorious resinous esters. Sweet taste at first but the hoppy bitterness creates a barrier of dryness. Chocolate berry notes with an almost patchouli note in the aftertaste. Carbonation is extremely high. A magnificent creation.

name: Bear Republic Red Rocket Ale
review: Piana obfita, œrednio trwa³a. Barwa herbaciano br¹zowa, klarowna. W aromacie karmel, orzechy, mas³o, herbata i dojrza³e owoce tropikalne. W smaku dok³adnie to samo, pó³s³odkie, z zio³owym finiszem. Goryczka œrednia, tytoniowo przyprawowa. Œrednie wysycenie, lekko pikantne i md³e w odbiorze. Œrednie piwo, nie wiem sk¹d tyle nagród i wysokich ocen. Ewidentnie jest tu diacetyl, z tym tylko, ¿e to chyba zamierzone (coœ jak czeskie pilsy?). Niemniej mi to nie odpowiada i na pewno nie poprawia pijalnoœci.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours Dark brown with a thick tan head and a toasty aroma. Thete is a tasty roasted malt flavor with a bit of chocolate and a dry finish.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: On tap @ Encinitas Ale House. Black pour with a dense tan head. Typical aromas of the style. Roasted malt, a bit of cocoa powder and ash, some earthy hops. Perhaps a hint of smoke. Certainly coffee. Flavor is bitter coffee, earthy hops, and roasted malt. Light cocoa powder and smoke. Dry finish, somewhat thin on the palate. Average.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: On tap at the brewery. Aroma of sweet roasted malts and chocolate. A solid black pour with a lasting tan head (thanks to the nitro) and abundant lacing. The taste is rich and rewarding. Dark roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Full smooth mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Overall, very smooth and robust.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: (Old BA rate - nitro-tap at Rattle N Hum 5/15/09) Deep mahogany, near black color. Light tan cap of a head that looked like it had been painted on top of the brew. Great retention and curtains of lacing throughout the sample. Pretty muted aromas; some dry roasted maltiness and perhaps a whiff of some dark fruits....not much going on here. Roasted maltiness, but not overly so. Hint of graininess, and a very dry finish. Smooth, creamy, but at the same time quite a light body. Satisfying in all the right ways, and very much expected for what I would want in the style. Overall, more than worth a look and was a nice break from the extreme.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: On draft at Rattle N Hum in NYC. Pours a pitch black with small brown head. The aroma is slight roast. The mouthfeel is slightly watery. The Flavor is roasted coffee beans with a smooth finish.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: On nitro at Rattle n Hum. Whipped up black coffee and cream appearance.Lots of lace. No overt fragerance. Creamy mouthfeel as expected, and notes of chocolate. Decent stout, not too dry but not too complex.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: Tap at Bear Republic. Guinness-like black appearance with a nitro head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is roasted malt, toast, coffee, and chocolate. Fuller on the palate than something like Guinness. Dry finish.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: Draft. Blackish beer with a light tan head. Nice malty, roasty, chocolate aroma. Chocolate and sweet malt flavor with light roast. Medium bodied. Chocolate and sweet malt lingers with a bit of light lactose sweetness.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: I found this to be reminiscent of the Samuel Smith’s RIS. Thin, simple flavors, little head, bubbly, and very average overall. Alcohol has no punch, its pretty damn hidden, not too much mouth feel, but nothing offensive.

name: Bear Republic Black Bart Stout
review: Tap at the Blind Tiger. Man I just love this style, what can I say. A good dry stout on nitro simply can’t be beat (and no, I’m not talking about that bullshit Guinness). This beer has a subtle but delicious homemade cookie and chocolate aroma, smooth and silky, with lots of cacao nibs. Smooth, perfect body, dry and creamy, lightly chalky, more fresh cookie. Excellent.

name: Bear Republic Big Bear Dark Ale
review: Tasting Notes from Fall 2000: Very nice. Sweet, with good hop finish......

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: On tap @ Rattle N Hum. This is a darker looking one deeper ruby looking in color with a nice big lasting and leaving small dots down the glass off-white head. Surprisingly mild aroma. Expected a big punchy nose, didnt get that. Is a subtle softly dark caramel sweet one. Traces of nuts and earth. Tastes really good. Not too sweet at all, but it has a lot of dark caramel raisin sweetness. Almost like burnt raisins from a bun. It has a mild sticky kinda oily texture in the mouth and its creamy prickling on the bubbles. Lots of red berries like cranberries and freeze dried raspberries. Lots of flavor, and thank god its not too sweet. Like it quite a lot. 17.06.2015

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: 2 oz draft pour at SAVOR 2016’s Saturday session. Clear golden amber with beige head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, booze. Tastes of caramel, toffee, booze, butterscotch. Medium body with a dry finish.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Draft at the brewery, served in a flight. Pours a clear amber with a small off-white head that settles into a ring. Notes of banana, caramel, dried fruits, and brown sugar. Some earthy, slightly odd notes from the EKG hops. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, astringent mouthfeel. It’s okay.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Draught at Bear Republic. Clear amber liquid with medium white head. Aroma of caramel, raw sugar, raisins and dried fruit. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of caramel, toffee and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Decent.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Draft at source. Aroma is peaty, earthy, light smoke. Deep red color with small white head. Taste is caramel forward with very inviting hints of molasses and peat smoked malt. Really good.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Keg at the brewpub, Healdsburg, 04/02/16. Rich chestnut brown with a decent beige covering. Nose is sweet malt, toffee, pear drop, fruit esters. Taste comprises butterscotch, caramel, fruit rinds, biscuit. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Decent for style.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head. Nice toffee and caramel in the nose, some fruits. Medium to heavy sweet flavor with lots of semi-dark fruits, creamy toffee, dates. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sugary finish with plenty of bready malts, more toffee, ripe fruits. Nice.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Sample on tap at the brewpub. Clear copper pour with thin creamy white head. Aroma is very fruity, sweet malty aromas, tons of caramel, rich pear like aromas. Taste is sweet, very rich, caramel, boozy fruits. Palate is med-full bodied with med carbonation. Decent.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Really good malty nose from dark brown pour. Taste malty and somewhat sweet with a nice alcohol warmth. Finish lingers of sweet caramel and some sweet malts as well.

name: Bear Republic Heritage Ale
review: Draught at Apex, Portland, as Bear Republic Heritage Wee Heavy, 8.1% ABV Dark mahogany color. Heavy caramel aroma and flavor, robust body, fairly sweet, not much bitterness, some alcohol perception, and as often happens for these beers, lack of character.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Sparkling clear ruby dark-brown pour with beige head; decent retention. Aroma is weak; faint dark malts, maybe some dark fruit. Taste is medium sweet, with some sense of licorice and candy, far away maybe some chocolate. Mwah, not so convinced; this candy-ish element is not at it's place.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Aroma is metallic, slight hint of dark fruits and spice. Taste has a slight roasty tang, with hints of raisins. Has typical spice tones produced by Belgian yeast in the background. Very low body for a bock beer. Fairly dry. Taste dissapears quickly. Carbonation is average. Overall: not bad but still pretty dissapointing; would have expected better from La Chouffe.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Kolor ciemny rubinowy, z przeb³yskami. Be¿owa piana, doœæ trwa³a i obfita. Aromat przyjemny, owocowy, wiœnie w alko, przyprawy korzenne, Paszcza: cia³o niskie w górê, musuj¹ce, orzeŸwiaj¹ce, wysokie wysycenie troszkê przeszkadza, goryczka œladowa, lekka s³odycz, lekki metaliczny posmak, w posmaku kwaœne wiœnie. W sumie pozytywnie. Przyjemne, pijalne piwo z ma³o popularnego gatunku.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: 0,33 l Flasche. Rotbraunes Bier, cremeweißer, stabiler Schaum, schöne Gardine. Malzig, dezent nach Sauerkirschen, leicht bitter im Abgang, rund und vollmundig.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Aroma: malt, light carbon Appearance: core of red/tan, white head with patchy lacing Flavour: malt, sweet, balanced hop bitterness, some herbal Palate: finishes slightly steel & bitter

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Donkere bok. Flinke schuimkraag. Metaalgeur. Qua smaken: lichte rinse en zoete smaak. Licht kruidig met toetsen van rood fruit en zoethout.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Bottle. Clear dark brown/ruby with a decent white head. Aroma of malts, yeast and red fruits. Taste follows aroma with a note of cherries and hops. Slighty tart and fruity. Moderate bitterness. Low to medium carbonation. Ok.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Draft @ Café De Biet, Zierikzee. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Weak aroma of caramel, Belgian yeast, some dark chocolate. Taste is watery and weak, light sweet caramel, some bitter hints.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Donkerbruin bier met genoeg koolzuur. Aroma zurig en suikers. Smaak zurig, water, heel licht gebrande mout suikers, koriander. Medium mondgevoel. Zurige zoete nasmaak. Meer la chouffe dan bok.

name: Chouffe Bok 6666
review: Bottle at home. Reddish dark brown, cloudy, foamy beige head. Herbal, caramel and dried fruity malts, light-medium bitterness. Really nothing special. Light body, medium-high carbonation.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: 330ml bottle in 2016. Very dark ruby with an offwhite head. Aroma of dried fruit, dates, coriander seed, cloves, cinnamon and big malt. Fruity esters in the flavour and lots of dark fruit. Nice carbonation and very good linger.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Bottle, 10 years past BBD. Pours nearly clear dark copper brown with airy beige head. Dusty and estery aroma with notes of malt, caramel, and fruit. Dusty,mestery and sweet flavour of malt,mcaramel and dried fruit and bitter touches of hops. Dusty and estery aftertaste with bitter, hoppy hints and malty touches. Warming alcohol presence. Old but nice.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: This bottle is coming from Amstein, St-Légier, drinking and sharing it, at home, in the flat of Guillaume, at Lausanne. The color is brown and red, a bit troubled, white foam, regular carbonation. In my own way, it is a regular quadrupel, generous side of spices, cynamon, malt, sugar, plum, fruity with a decent touch of hop, at the final, a beer to drink step by step.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: 18.02.17 AR: hefig, holzig, leicht Dosenchampignon, leicht milchsauer, überreife Früchte (Banane?), Curacao AP: dunkelbraun TA: hefig, Pflaume, Schlehe, Karamell

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Pours clear, dark mahogany with three finger, light tan head. Aroma is dried fruit, spice and Belgian yeast. Taste is raisin and light caramel, moving to cinnamon, banana esters, light roast and Belgian yeast. Finish is banana, roast and Belgian.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Botella 330ml Color marron oscuro-cobrizo,espuma de color beige,fina,alta,cremosa,resistente.Aroma malta tostada,caramelo,especias,frutas rojas.Sabor dulce intenso,malta tostada,caramelo,especias,frutas rojas.Bien equilibrada

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Very nice Christmas beer though I'm drinking it at the start of summer. Dark and complex with a nice head that dissipated quickly. Alcohol comes over quite intense so boozy. Would it be a re purchase. Yes.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Really tasty complex dark strong beer. definitely showing the alcohol, but the slight spice makes it a perfect xmas beer. online belgian beer factory

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of dried fruits, sweet malts and yeast, taste of caramel, spices, caramel (sweet) warming alcohol. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation, sweet finish.

name: N'Ice Chouffe
review: 330ml bottle. Best before 2/2019. Pours a clear, ruby/mahogany with about a finger of khaki head. Aroma is warm with notes of dried fruits, spices, Belgian yeast, and dark candy sugar. Taste is slightly sweet with notes of dark candy sugar, Belgian yeast, spices, and dark fruits with a drawn out ending with little to no trace of the 10% abv. Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation. Lively in the mouth with a slightly syrupy texture but with a dry ending. Overall a really nice beer. Would be really nice sitting around a fireplace at Christmas.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Hazy golden pour. Nose is surprisingly clear. A soft malt aroma with a kiss of light hops still coming through. A bit of age showing although the hopping is still there. Crisp and clean although certainly a little bit simple.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Pale yellow pour. Crisp slightly hoppy malt taste. Beer is better than overproduced macros, but not all that great. Rated 3/25/04

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Gold with fluffy white head and lace. Sour, papery, light malt and good bitter. Thin but with good carbonation. Not as good as the 2.7 would indicate.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: 12oz bottle-pours a thin off white head and yellow/gold color. aroma is sweet grain/medium malt, secondary fruity hops. taste is grain/medium malt, secondary fruity/herbal hops, musty, not clean. Finishes medicinal/cardboard. it’s a shame they stopped brewing but still put out beer near their closing.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Suttree’s Nothing else to do in Mid-February Tasting. Sample from a bottle thanks to jcwattsrugger. Clear golden, whitish cover. Aroma is corn, just about all of it. Taste is corny, crisp lager finish, grass.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Courtesy jcwattsrugger - Thanks!Mildly cloudy orange, no head. lots of corn in the aroma, also kinda sour. Flavor pretty much follows suite, plus some biting into an aspirin bitterness. Not a whole lot to this.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Bottle at the 10th Richmond RateBeer Gathering courtesy of jcwattsrugger on 01/16/2010. Clear golden body with a small frothy white head. Big honey and toasty malt aroma. Sweet honey and light toasty malt flavor. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Clear golden color. Aroma is of malts, a little bit of skunk, yeast, lactose, and some earthiness. Flavor is a little bit of a metallic flavor, hops, malts, and yeast. It has a little bit of malty metallic aftertaste. This might be skunked so that will alter the rating. RIP Buzzards Bay.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Pale yellow. Light malt, touch of honey on the aroma. Flavor matches, with hop bitterness onthe finish. Little else.

name: Buzzards Bay Lager
review: Bottle from Maniac’s Richmond Tenth Gathering. Clear golden pour with wispy white head. Nose is like creamed fresh corn. Flavor is similar. Astringent. Pretty lacking. Extra point for cool brewery name.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: 12oz bottle: I didn’t realize that this one had been retired. It pours a cloudy brown color with a bit of head, which drops off rather quickly. The aroma is good, but a tad light. Notes of toffee and caramel malts. Possibly some raisins also. The taste is OK. Somewhat sweet, with some roastiness and dryness in the aftertaste. Not bad. Why did they kill this one?

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: This beer came to me in my beer club. I am not familiar with the brewer. Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a dark brown color with a medium sized dark tan head. The aroma is molasses, maple syrup and light roasty malts. The flavor is molasses, raisin and moderate roasty malts. A rather nice beer.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: 12 oz bottle. Reddish brown color, clear, medium head. The aroma has a big caramel character. Woah, the flavor has an interesting burnt flavor with a good deal of bitterness. Okay, so I like burnt flavors. The carbonation stayed around so that was nice, too. Interesting & good beer, try one.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: Clear, deep mahogany/brown with a small, tan head. Aroma holds pronounced caramel & oak with broth and an "oily" quality. Thin mouthfeel. Flavor is smoky with caramel malt flavor leading to a dirty, dry finish. Single bottle from Cornfield’s cellar.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: Like a soup that has only boiled a few min... the hops were there the malts were there but very dishwattery. You don’t get much of anything with this beer and I would not keep it in "stock"

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: pours out of the bottle a deep ruddy-brown. minimal tan head. smells of hops, malts, wood, caramel and florals. tastes strongly of caramel and roasted malts. started out sweet but finished slightly bitter. dried out my mouth. overall the flavors were not well-balanced or appealing.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: This amber ale pours a dark brown color from a 12 oz bottle. Small sized white foamy head. Aroma is floral, earthy and sweet, a touch perfumy. A medium to light bodied amber ale. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are grapefruity and slightly bitter. Pretty much tastes like your typical brew pub amber ale. Perhaps a bit watery and a little sweet, but still very drinkable. Mouthfeel is a touch thin. Finish is crisp and clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: Pours a dark copper color with mild white head. Aroma big on caramel, toffee, some roasted malts teamed up with a nice hint of hop. Flavor has a weird candy thing going on for it, maybe it reminded me of something I’d eaten before. Very sweet, with a really nice caramel flavor. Enjoyable.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: pours a nice mahogony, with a small head. has a nice bitter hops that doesn’t linger long. A nice average ale.

name: Buzzards Bay Stock Ale
review: Not terrible, but my sample had a strange "dusty" aftertaste. I’ve had beers with dry finishes, but this is ridiculous. Light caramel and roated toffee flavors with somewhat timid hopping. Prettier looking than good tasting.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Pale yellow orangish pour. Nose and taste is very bland burnt maltish hops. Just okay. Rated 3/27/04

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: August 2008 Beer of the Month Club (Rating is from 9/2/08) Overall Impression: Pretty dark and bitter for a golden, but lacking any exceeding flavor characteristics, just not a whole lot there.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: I am reminded of the smell I get from pouring an upstate NY lager like Matt’s or Genesee. A touch of hop, a slight, slight note of all spice or clove Golden to amber in color, the beer produces a modest head that decreases to a thin layer of bubbles within 2 minutes. Very clear. Very nice pale malt flavor that lasts well into the aftertaste. Midway, I sense a subtle hop, but this is a predominately malty ale, although it is more crisp than most. While thinner than most beers I consume, it is reasonably full-bodied. I wouldn’t necessarily clamor for more; but I would easily take another at a tailgate on a warm September afternoon.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Got this in the beer of the month (Aug beer) gift my wife gave me. Poured a clear burnt orange color, no head and very little carbonation. Aroma is very low but a bit of a burnt malt aroma seeps through mixed with a semi-hallertauer hops aroma. The flavor is pretty bland being mostly a light roasted flavor at the end and nothing really in between. An ok brew but really plain.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Sampled a while back. Let me start by saying I had Buzzard’s Bay Lager and this seems to taste just like it. Bright golden, color, very clear and topped with a pretty nice head. Somewhat sweet, smooth with a mild aftertaste. Grainy and not all that flavorful. It goes down fine, isn’t a bad beer but seems way too much like their Lager. Maybe that’s why it was retired.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle gift from a friend - Pours a clear golden color with a thin white head. Light carbonation. Very light spotty lacing. Has a grain and herbal hop aroma. Smells kinda skunky too. Light sweet grain malt and hop flavor. Thin palate and light body. Slight oxidation noticeable. This beer was a year past its prime. I doubt it was much better when fresh. Thanks Mike

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Better than the macros but not by much. Herbal hops present. Light in the palate but refreshing. Unremarkable.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Very pale yellow that was mild and easy to drink. A bit light for my taste but a well balanced and smooth beer.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: Very clear pale golden color with a sticky-lacing thin white head. Very mild, lightly sweet and floral hoppy aroma has some grainy notes. Thin, watery body has some grainy pale malty sugars, soft carbonation and light earthy hoppy bitterness. A very drinkable beer and fairly true to style, but bland and uninteresting.

name: Buzzards Bay Golden Ale
review: 12oz bottle acquired in trade jjppm74 (thanks!). Poured a lighter and see through yellow color with an averaged sized white head. Lighter aromas of spices and grass. Flavors of the same. Thin and watery. Kinda of reminded me of a watered down version of their lager I had earlier in the night.

name: Bockor Pils
review: 29/01/2018 - draught glass @Au Marché National. Clear golden, medium white head. Nose is malts, corn. Taste is malts, corn, tad sweet. Meh.

name: Bockor Pils
review: Bought a case from Dranken Geers. Clear, bright pale amber beer with a medium white foam head. Nose is light, grassy, straw, toasted grains, dry and slight citrus, malty grain chaff and mash. Taste is light, grassy, grainy, toasted grains, lightly dry and bitter.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Hazy dark red with a pinkish off-white head. Real cherry aroma. Starts very sour, then to be taken over by cherry. Very pure, no disturbing flavours distracting from it. Very good.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Schöne Balance aus süß und sauer mit Kirsche und etwas Zucker im Vordergrund. Kaum Essig, relativ echt, nicht schlecht.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: [Bottle (330ml)] Pours a nice-looking deep ruby with an average size lasting frothy pinkish head. Pleasant aroma (7+) of black cherries along with malt in the back -- more sweet than tart. Lightly tart black cherry flavour with malt in the back and just a hint of vinegar. Average bodied. Nice Flemish.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: 11.2 oz bottle received as day 1 of a 12 day advent mixed pack from my wife. Date of production 05 15 18. The pour is a ruby red, golden with a 1 inch pinkish white head. The aroma is sweet cherry fruit, vanilla and a bit of oak. The taste is brightly sweet cherry, almost soda flavored, then turns to the oak wood and vanilla adding to the character. The palate is medium bodied with fine active carbonation and big sugar after taste.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Bottle. Poured clear reddish brown color with an average frothy tan head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate sour cherry aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Moderate sour cherry flavor with a medium tart sour finish of average duration. Sour refreshing brew.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: (rouge, cerise pierrot (!), acido-cerisesque, doute vieillissement 18 mois, lambic 50%, no additifs, pas sur-sucré, ~light)

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Bottled, 330ml at Cafe Bottelje, Ostend, West Flanders, Belgium. Reddish brown with off white head. There are sweet cherries to the fore in this one, there is a little sourness, tanginess going on but it is more fruit juice than most for me.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Sampled from a bottle this beer poured a reddish brown color with a huge creamy redddish head that left no lacing. The aroma was black cherry, yeast and cola. The flavor was very tart and sour with cherry, yeast and cola. Very long finish. Medium body.

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Clear, beautiful ruby color, small non lasting ring off white head. Aroma is of some tart fruit and cheery, oak, bit vinegar bit lambic notes with some funk. Taste is medium-light sweet malt and cheery, moderate+ sourness, ,light aceto, some wild funky notes, oak, dry finish with cherry aftertaste. Light+ bodied, average carbonation, oily. (bottle from the brewery)

name: Jacobins Kriek
review: Bottle from the lcbo. Aroma lacks much character, it's watery cherry, with some minerals and light tin. Mouth feel is OK, carb is standard. Finish is quite tart actually, with a sweet cherry finish.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Old review, only really have a score from a Brussels trip long ago. from memory, a relatively mild and simple sour.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Bottle - 10 months past bb. Rosy amber with a beige head that's soon less than a coat. Weird aroma of a laundry left mid-clean, paper, apple peel. Quite sour with an acidic finish. No sign of any sweetness.Taste is better with some apples and cherries but not much funk. The aroma clears a bit after a while and it's better as it warms a bit ( a lesson I should have learned from previous Jacobins beers). Presumably something very like this beer is what gets softened up and rounded out in (the lovely) Cuvée des Jacobins. Interesting.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Bottle @ home. Thanks for bringing the bottle dad! Clear medium orange color, average sized white head. Smell and taste are quite nice: lightly green apple peel and unripe citrus fruit, mixed in a way that it provides a slight sweet background, a slight tart / dry note and a light, but dominant sour yet fruity flavor. Quite nice and perhaps also worth noticing: it's super cheap.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Fles 25cl thuis. Zuren en zoeten in balans, licht sprankelend. Valt mee voor een gueuze. (10-2017).

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Very nice and not so tart as many gueuzes. Easy to enjoy and drink while having a conversation with other beer lovers.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Dark golden beer with little white head. Aroma is sweet honey, grains, floral. Taste is nice sour and bitter. Light body. Low carbonation. Overall nice and simple sour beer.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Bottle at home, THT25.10.2017. Murky golden colour, almost clear topped by an offwhite foamy head. Base-for-oudbruin more than strictly gueuze, quite malty and almost cherry fruity, light-medium acidity, funk and tardness, medium dry finish. Medium body, low carbonation.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Ácida, porém com sabor intenso, pouca espuma, pouco alcoólica, pouco corpo, muito boa.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Bottle - pours orange with a white head. Aroma is tartwith some sweet malt and funk. Taste is confised mix of tart and sweet w8th a veg finish.

name: Jacobins Gueuze
review: Pours clear amber with low white head. Aroma of mild grass and grapes, light citrus, and hints of bread, somewhat funky and off. Taste is medium tart, grassy with some grape notes, lightly citrusy. Tart through and through, somewhat one-dimensional. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: Had this under the name Rapscallions on tap. Pours orange with a little bit of head and some lacing. Aromas of apricot, berries and red grapes. Very light in the mouth, tastes were basically a light sweet. Nothing special.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: The first thing I noticed when I poured is that the aroma is Welch’s grape juice. Very strong. The taste is significantly weaker than the aroma, but still grape. Light to medium bodied. Rated 9/26/04

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: Reviewing from memory - had this a couple years ago in Boston. Pours medium amber with a small white head. Aroma is pretty nice, with Concord grapes and a hint of pale/caramel malt. Flavor is pale/caramel malt, grains, and somewhat artificial-tasting grape juice. Bottle is a little thin and watery, especially for a winter seasonal. Falls a little short of expectations overall.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: on tap-pours a dissipating off white head and dark amber color. Aroma is wow, lots of purple grapes. Taste is purple grapes, secondary English malt, faint English hops-earthy/flat. OK carbonation.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: draft - Smells like grapes, imagine that... it tastes like a weak lager with a lot of grapes added. I certainly wouldn’t call it robust as the commercial description does. I found it thin and watery with too much grape flavor added to the decidedly lacklaster base ale. This rated higher than I expected here. I don’t get the appeal.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: On tap at the Connecticut Brew Fest. Amber with a slight white head. Nose is all Nehi grape soda! Good flavor, red grape at first, then a nice malty grainy flavor. Decent bitter finish. Good!

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: Deep amber ale with a light white head. Aroma of grape kool-aid or pez candy. Fresh malt in mouth with rather artificial raisins. Light and watery. Mondial 2005.

name: Concord Grape Ale
review: Best before 10/2005 bottle consumed 9/6/2005. Deep orange-copper with a definite currant-colored sheen to it. Moderate sized bubbles rise quite vigorously creating a large, 2-finger beige head with good retention. Moderate lacing as well, despite the fact that the beer seems pretty heavily filtered. Strong grape juice aroma right away, but it dies off somewhat and some crystal-like maltiness are detectable on the tail-end. Grape candy, but not overly sugary. Bit of sweet cream and a dry yeastiness. Flavor is not what I am expecting. Dry, not at all sweet. Grape medicine on the end. I’m definitely getting coffee or compost notes. Lots of vanilla wafers, cookie crumbs and white dough. Low carbonation. Interesting and not overdone. Almost like they made it so dry because everyone it expecting it to be so sweet.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: bottle - Pours yellowish and hazy with fine suspended yeast and a very thin head. It smells of yeast and a trace of citrus. The flavori s yeasty and malty. It’s light and avoids being too watery, so it’s a decent warm weather quaff but not something to seek out.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: Medium gold color. Small white foamy head. Aroma is bready malts, with a touch of sweetness. A medium bodied Dort/Helles. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are mild and slightly spicy. Light and refreshing. Crisp and clean. Mild flavor. Good lawn mower beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: 12 oz. bottle Just plain... unimpressive. The hop fragrance is slightly stale, although I can pick out the Hallertau. Quite thin, pale yellow, the sudsy white head diminishes rapidly - altogether lager-like. Certainly drinkable, and certainly acceptable, but doesn't quite make the grade.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: Light amber in color, small head that disappears quickly. Smell: average... this is beer, not liquid gold. Something funky about the taste. Reminded me somehow of eating stale pizza crust. Not horrid, but not my glass of beer. Mouthfeel was funky, almost scratchy... dunno how that can be, but whatever, that was my reaction. I'm no gonna drink this beer again, I don't care if it local. It's drinkable, but not worth it.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: Deep, lightly clouded amber pour with a nice off-white head. Aroma contains malt and slight hops as well. Smooth, somewhat citrusy yet slightly bitter taste. Very crisp finish. A fine brew by Crooked River!!

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: A nice average Helles, with a malty flavor and a clean finish. Actually, it tastes to me like their excellent ESB minus any bitterness. Locally brewed so it's always fresh. It doesn't floor me, but all-in-all a solid beer.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: This sure seemed hopped up for a lager, even if it's not intended to be. Has a smoky flavor and smell, which wasn't bad, but not great, either. Thought it would finish badly, but it actually finished quite nicely. OK stuff.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: Not bad, but nothing extraordinary to note. Tastes like many other lagers that I've had. Decent.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: Great looking hazy golden colour with a nice thick white head. The aroma is very nice, with malty characteristics along with some english smelling hops and even some lemon thrown in the mix. An above average beer from the sight and smell alone. A thin taste with a good balance of malt and hops, but it was a bit watery. Some of the citrus from the aroma went into the taste and palate of the beer, but it was very subtle. The aftertaste is decent, but not very strong. Overall, the beer looks and smells better than it tastes, and evaluates to an average beer for the style. Worth a try if you are in the area where it is offered (which happens to be here in the Washington suburbs :-). I bought this twelve ounce bottle at Total Wine in Manassas, Virginia.

name: Crooked River Select Lager
review: When poured into my glass, this beer had a medium sized white head with small-medium sized bubbles that was long lasting. The body was hazy with some carbonation observed and the hue was golden. I found the nose to be somewhat complex as I could not conclude what the nose was. The lacing with this beer was good on the sides of my glass. The flavor of this beer was malty and it had a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Crooked River Island Hops
review: A summer wheat ale from crooked river. Served in a 12 oz. bottle. Specs: This Kristal wheat beer is only available from May to September. It is a great beer that disappears off store shelves quick, fast, and in a hurry. A lot of people must wait for this beer every year, because I have a hard time finding it some years. It pours out a beautiful golden color, with a tight white head of foam. The head slowly disappears, leaving a ring of bubbles around the rim of the glass. Aromas are of wheat malt, slightly lactic smelling. Hop aromas are prevalent, with an emphasis on aromatic hops. Tastes great, a slight acidity to it, with a hops bite that will take your breath away, especially when you get a fresh batch. Find some when you can, but don't buy it all up. Save some for the rest of us poor saps.

name: Crooked River Island Hops
review: Headache inducing wheat, but not a bad brew on the hole... strong taste like most CR beers. I like this one in small quantities.

name: Crooked River Island Hops
review: A nice Crystal Weizen brew from Crooked River of Cleveland. This is a rare summer seasonal wheat beer that is both light and refreshing. Nice hops aroma and flavor from the Hallertau hops. The yeast provides complex flavors that are very enjoyable. I'm not normally a big weizen beer fan but this one caught me when I was thirsty and hot and I really enjoyed it.

name: Crooked River Island Hops
review: Big hop and malt nose, bad thing its a seasonal, good thing it stores well. Hop bit is big so not meant for beginners.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: 12oz bottle from jsquire. Pours a dark amber brown color with a finger of foamy tan head. Aroma of cinnamon, ginger, caramel malt, Floral hops, and some orange peel. Taste of cinnamon, ginger, caramel malt, some light citrus zest, and a hint of spruce.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: Bottled, almond colored pour with soft foam, tasty aroma and flavor of spice cake, carrots, fondent icing, sweet finish

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: Bottle, thanks Jeff! Nice aroma with vegetative and spice coming through. Reddish brown pour with very slight head. Nice spice profile (mulling spices, big nutmeg and allspice) up front. Finishes a bit bready. Good, solid holiday beer.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
