review: Deep amber color with a frothy off white head. Light spicy nose with hints of cinnamon and ginger. Sweet Christmas ale with lots of white sugar. Cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger spice with some bitter orange peel and a long bitter finish. Nice, standard spiced holiday ale.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: (From the 2011 batch) Slight dark fruit aroma, with just a touch of spice. Pours a clear ruby red, with a thin off white head. Nice spice flavor, with a hint of cherry in the background. Very nice Christmas ale, a bit more fruit notes then most of the ones around Cleveland. This is one I’ll be recommending to others.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: 2002 bottle consumed 8/18/09. Pours a hazy brown with some protein globules floating about and a surprisingly well developed head. Smells of muted spice, roasted malt, some chocolate sneaking in, some fruity hints. Tastes of sweet and roasted malt, velvety, spicy, some dark fruity elements, a nice touch of cocoa present. This must have been an amazing beer when fresh. Even with 7 years on it, it is still drinking well.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: 03-Sep-06 (12 oz bottle: Obtained 21-Mar-05 in trade with jeffin7, thanks Jeff!) I’m becoming a believer that these spiced winter ales age wonderfully. I actually have two bottles of Yuletide Ale, and although pushing two years now, the beer is delicious! Malty, chocolaty, roasty, lightly spicy and a bit earthy and smoky. Spices are surprisingly subdued, perhaps diminished from the aging. Malts are moderately sweet, and with hops playing little role here and the roast not contributing much in the way of bitterness, the chocolaty malts really dominate. Perhaps there is a hint of butter in the background when the beer warms up, but even warm, it remains a tasty brew. Body is medium and carbonation is light. The malty nose is chocolaty and lightly sweet. The initially hazy, brown-colored body turns fairly clear once all the particles settle to the bottom. Small, light-tan head dissipates somewhat rapidly, leaving just a thin ring as a quiet remembrance. Very enjoyable, one of those pleasant cellaring surprises for me.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: Reddish-brown color and a tannish head. A spicy aroma and a decent finish.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: Reddish brown with an offwhite head and aromas of citrus, dark fruit, and malt. The flavor has some earthiness and spice accompanied by a bit of malt. Finish on the palate is slightly astringent.

name: Crooked River Yuletide Ale
review: Reddish-brown body, slightly congealed looking in glass, with bubbly sediment. Head is eggnog colored, decently thick for being 3 years old or so, and very longlasting (till the last drop). Aroma is cherry, dates, malt of course, and snappy citrus hops. Fun! Taste is jampacked with flavor, nothing mild about the palate on this oldster. Heavy malt, plum, and dark cherries rounded out with caramel backdrop and lemony hops. Alcohol sizzle and caramel round out the aftertaste. Solid beer, deserves a better ranking. Picked this up in a "discount" crate (unfortunately, the date had worn off) at Chevy Chase Liquor and Beer, in our nation’s capital, Washington, DC.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Can. Pours hazy reddish orange with small foamy light beige head, resinous aroma, medium carbonation, bitter resinous caramel-malt taste, thin body, long bitter finish. Not bad though not very citrusy.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Pours slightly hazy orange, substantial off white head. Aroma is vaguely citrus, grassy, mulch, slightly dank? Taste is resiny, bitter, with, bready malt. Light to medium mouthfeel. Their are lots of better IPad, not sure what they were going for with this. No date on the can, so maybe it’s too old?

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: I’ve been to the brewpub in Lake Placid and drank this beer (and others) on tap, but was pleased to see they are canning now, which saves me an hour’s trip, so I picked up a six-pack. Pours clear orange-amber. Two-finger white head dissipates after a few minutes to leave behind some lacing. Aroma is of blood orange, pine needles, and fresh-baked bread. Taste is hop-forward with the above-mentioned aromas becoming flavors. It’s medium-bodied with great mouthfeel; the hop resins coat the tongue. There’s a long, lingering bitterness. If I had to re-categorize this beer, I’d call it an amber IPA because there’s a fair amount of malt, too.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: New England Bucket List Trip #170. Keg at the brewpub. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a large creamy off-white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of citrus, tropical hops, pale malt. The taste is tropical, piney hops, pale malt. Medium bodied, moderate lingering bitterness.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Draft at pony bar. Nice amount of green hops in this fairly light bodied IPA. Lots of lace on the glass. Some mint and fennel in the flavor.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Pours unclear amber small white head. Smell is pine fruity. Taste is straight rather intense bitterness, earthy hops. Nice and intense. Fi ish is bitter, bit earhty. The fruity hoppy character is rather hidden in the taste

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at brewery, which calls it an ipa, not s pale Yale. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, some dank, nice. Taste is light, dry, hoppy, citrus, tangerine, nice bitterness.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at the Brew Pub. 2nd day with Patty. Poured golden with a white head. Nice aroma of citrus like hops. Good body with the citrus hop flavor. Slight bitterness. Enjoyable.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Une bonn ipa, west coast pas sur, pas assez crisp mais neanmoins une bonne biere dans un minuscule brew pub. une belle decourverte dans une petite ville.

name: Great Adirondack John Brown IPA
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: A great pale in the style of a good west coast pale ale. Just the right hoppiness. Hopheads will like! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Great Adirondack Whiteface Black Diamond Stout
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Can. Pours opaque blackish dark brown with large spongy tan head, mocha aroma, medium carbonation, bitter dark chocolate/mocha taste, thick and smooth body, long finish. Very good brew.

name: Great Adirondack Whiteface Black Diamond Stout
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at brewery in Lake Placid, New York. Pours opaque black (no light gets through) with thick, creamy tan head. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, char. Flavor: espresso, oatmeal, dark chocolate, milk chocolate. Mouthfeel: full-bodied; rich, savory, delicious.

name: Great Adirondack Whiteface Black Diamond Stout
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Can - 12 oz. Pours an opaque black body with an average, lasting, beige foamy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with roasty and chocolate hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its well balanced malty/hoppy taste carries roasted cereals notes. Ends with a good roasty, slightly warming finish. Enjoyable.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at brewery. Pours golden with white head. Very light aroma, some malt. Taste is light, malty, no hops, Pilsner. Very light.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: 09/2011; on tap at the brewpub; gold color; light and bitter with a slightly sweet malt background

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at the Brew Pub. Patty had this because it was the closest to her light beers. Not much in the way of aroma, color, body or taste. She liked it.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: on tap at brewpub. clear light golden with a decent white head, some retention. sweet malts, cereals, light herbal notes. average carbonation, light body, very short herbal finish. bland but not horrible.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Included as part of a sampler at the restaurant. Unfortunately I do not remember the particulars on any of the beers I had tasted though they were all pretty good overall. Definitely plan to be back to retry some of these.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at brewpub Aroma aromatic bitter hop notes, copper malts, crisp and clean. 7- Appearance clear dark gold with medium off white head. Sparse lace. Flavor and Palate : Medium lighter bodied. Nutty frontal feel. Chewy malty textures with crisp lemon hop side. Plenty of flavor. Thirst-quenching brew. This one has more flavor than you would expect from given name.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at Brewpub. Pours a clear straw yellow. No head. Minimal aroma of grass, and citrus. Flavor is mostly grain with a touch of sweetness. Not much to it.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap @ Brewpub. Pours light yellow. Very light with not much going on, just a little more grainy than your usual macro. I didn’t like this.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On draft at Brown Dog Cafe, Lake Placid. Poured clear gold with minimal head retention. Slight bready nose. Flavor is sweet malts, corn, and a bit grassy. Thin, smooth, and crisp with good carbonation.

name: Great Adirondack Haystack Blonde Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: draft- not a fan, not much in the way of flavor which is probably why this is reccomended for newby’s to the craft brew scene. This brewery has a lot more to offer than this- thin, some corriender, not much else.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: New England Bucket List Trip #168. Keg at the brewpub. Pours a clear amber with a large creamy off-white head. Good head retention. Aroma of caramel malt and tart fruits. The taste is toffee, caramel, raisin. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: 09/2011; on tap at the brewpub; a nice, well-balanced red ale with English hops and a biscuity malt background

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Found some old rating notes from TapNY 2013 that somehow never got entered. (I’m keeping this a little shorter than my normal rating style to help catch-up my backlog a little faster.) This was an alright amber beer. Nothing overly differentiating for me. Drinkable though.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at the Brew Pub. Poured a transparent red color with a off-white head. Bready, malty, and roasted flavors come through with a mildly hopped bitterness in the end.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: on tap at brewpub. clear golden-reddish with decent off-white head, decent retention and lacing. decent caramel malts, nutty, hint of biscuity malts, grass and citrus, cereals, hint of warming alcohol, light phenols. average carbonation, medium body, decent herbal-citrusy finish.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Included as part of a sampler at the restaurant. Unfortunately I do not remember the particulars on any of the beers I had tasted though they were all pretty good overall. Definitely plan to be back to retry some of these.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at brew pub Aroma mild aroma, faint nutty hints , malty bottom with brown sugars touches , light alcoholic scent.7- Appearance clean amber-copper. Very nice shade. Medium white contrasting top. 4- Flavor and Palate : Medium bodied. Dry nutty character , hint of wood , dry walls, clean cut ale. Smooth, clean offering.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: On tap at the Great Adirondack Steak and Seafood Co. Served an amber color with a good head that slowly faded to some lacing. Mild aroma of malt & grain. Malt with some caramel sweetness. Had a light bitter finish. Medium body & clean. Nothing fancy. Nice brew, worth a try. Really went well with my dinner.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Pours a clear amber color with no head. Aroma of caramel and toasted malts. Flavor is mostly caramel and toasted malts with a touch of hops. Decent beer though not impressive.

name: Great Adirondack Ausable Wulff Red Ale
region: Lake Placid, New York, United States
review: Tap at Pony Bar. Amber pour with a thin head. The nose is lightly caramelly and toasty with a fairly typical unassertive toastiness. There is a really unpleasant chlorine note that I can’t pin down to either the beer or the glass. Light herbal hopping with a weak dusty finish. Meh… not much to write about here.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: Bottle from store in North Park. Has a funky aroma associated with old expired beer. Huge chunks of dead yeast floating and a glowing yellow hue with small fizzy head. The flavor is a sweet malt mess with a lot of honey like flavors but this is just to old for me to enjoy.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: Light gold color. Medium head. Aroma is malty with a hint of banana. A lighter bodied fairly average hefe. Nice wheat flavors, slight banana and clove flavor. Crisp and clean. It a pretty average American Wheat beer. Nothing wrong with it, but nothing special either. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: I am sick and tired and I'm not gonna take it anymore. So many American brewers have the audacity of calling there piss yellow fizzy beers that retain no head and have little or no cloudiness a hefeweizen. This is not a hefeweizen; it's an American wheat beer and nothing more. At least SN has the common descency of calling their beer what it is. This is a poor American Wheat to. Sure it's refreshing but so is every wheat beer I've ever tried. Budweiser, on occassion, has been refreshing. If I'm gonna pay $7.99/sixer I better get something that is more than just refreshing. GRRR!

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: This may be an old bottle... some signs of age. It pours with a quick white head, is only slightly hazy golden. Is fruit estery with apricot bordering on citrus. The hops are more substantial than the Anchor Summer beer which this is obviously a relative of. I prefer this beer though the Anchor Summer had a nice touch of history to it while this one is distinctly a newer generation American wheat.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: A hazy golden hue. Big foamy head that quickly dissapears. Has the typical wheat aroma with malty sweetness. Just enough hops to give it that crisp finish. A decent Hefeweizen.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: A very whimpy wheat (arn't they all?) Slight apricot flavor, nothing special.

name: Humboldt Hefeweizen
review: Light, yet kind of flavorful. Rich, with a slight apricot flavor. Refreshing and easy-drinking. Subtle yeast flavor.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Poured into a mug, the appearance was a sturdy dark brown color with a finger’s worth of a light tan foamy head. Dissipated fairly easy to leave some light lingering stringy lace. The aroma had some roasted nuts, slight dark malts, some caramel/toffee qualities, light earthiness and some hay. The flavor leaned towards a dry malty sweetness. Light bitterness came in for a decent balance. The aftertaste was somewhat malty and dry with a nice woody dry sort of finish. The feel was about medium bodied with a fair sessionability about it. Good carbonation. ABV felt fine. It’s dry yet somewhat smooth. Overalll, one of the drier brown ales on the market. Maybe again for me, not sure.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Nice carmelized malty brown ale with a bit of cocoa finish. Full flavored and balanced. Slight bitterness to the finish but overall malty and a bit sweet. Descent.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: 12 oz. bottle. Pour dark brown, thin off white head. Aroma was sweet brown sugar, some roasted malt. Taste was mild sweet, light roasted malts, nutty, herbs.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Pours a dark chestnut, resilient ivory colored head. Aroma of earth, sweet tea leaves, nuttiness. A bit thin on the tongue, toasted nuts, slightly sweet, caramel malts. Not bad, not captivating though.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Brown color with a quickly diminished head. After a re-pour the head was light tan for a second. Quite sweet from the start with a bit of toasted malt and brown sugar. Not much bitterness to back things up and has a worty/underattenuated flavor. Bleeeck! 2/11

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Greg & Jane’s Beer and Wine. Aroma is cherry and caramel. Appearance is beautiful clear, dark red with decent sparkle, 1/2 finger-width off-white fleeting head and no lacing. Taste is sweet dark fruits/cherry and caramel with late mild herbs. Palate is medium bodied with thick texture, average carbonation and sweet finish. Overall, perhaps picked up a slight contribution of the hemp in the taste but is not major. Is OK but nothing noteworthy.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Pours a medium brown color. Aromas of light chocolate, hops, and a touch of nut. Flavor has a smooth chocolate/coffee blend with a hint of nut, and a nice hop finish.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: I don’t know much about hemp. It used to be my summer job to exterminate wild hemp and noxious weeds from my late grandmother’s farm. (Her name was Mary Jayne - you can’t make that up). Hemp’s a hearty plant and a damned nuisance to remove. It smells sweet like oregano when fresh. It’s absolutely foul when burned. (Sadly, given the dismally low THC content burning it was not a pleasant removal method at all.) Humboldt Brown had a bit of that sweet, herbal character I remembered, but other than a faint aroma the hemp doesn’t really add much. In the end, this brown ale ends up being, well, a brown ale. Nothing remarkable but totally okay.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Not great, not bad. Would be great to drink a whole six pack around a fire. Probably would not get again.

name: Humboldt Brown Hemp Ale
region: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States
review: Can’t really smell but hint of something good in there...just so mild...dark reddish appearance... Smooth malty taste with no hops...mild straightforward with no complexity though, kinda a burnt taste...x2 Dark malty smell, taste is good toasted malt on front end but then finish is carbonated water, boo...tastes normal to me.. can’t tell what hemp brings

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: "not a bad pale...a little on the hoppy side for the style, but with more than enough malt to balance. light color and body, but flavorful and aromatic."

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: On tap. Pours an orange red color with a medium sized head. Sweet and somewhat thick with lots of muted citrus. Very well balanced. Well crafted for sure.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Growler from Big Z Beverage. Pours a clear light orange with a small white head. Aroma of hop oils, grassy hops, floral hops, citrus hops, a touch of tropical fruits, and bready malts. Flavor of citrus hops, hop oils, grassy hops. Palate is slightly weaker than I’d prefer for such a hoppy beer. Overall, very drinkable and tasty, great hop character. 8/4/7/4/15 [3.8/5]

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Humboldt Brewing Company--Nectar Ales--Firestone Walker Brewing Company--Pale Necter--2005 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 4.80% ABV--40 IBU’s. (4.25 / 5.0) Golden Ale. Beer of the Month Club Selection June, 2005. Mild lacy head. Clear bright golden color. Rich floral hop front. Crisp tangy dry sweet tangy grapefruit pale caramel body. Clean fresh rich earthy citrus hop spice dry end. Hoppy Golden Ale. Sampled 6/30/2005.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: 12oz bottle. Light honey colored pour. Thick white head. Malty, floral nose. Nice balance with it leaning toward the malt near the front. Slight hop bitterness near the end.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Bright orange, thick off-white head with early scant lace. Very fruity aroma of nectarines and melons. Caramel malt and citrus resinous hops, surprisingly little of the fruit aroma translates onto the palate. Very flavourful and very sessionable!

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Pours a dark hazy straw color with minimal whitish head. Aroma of hops and grapefruit. Taste is bitter (too bitter for the style) to the point where it affects drinkability, otherwise this would have been rated higher.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Pours hazy deep dark straw with off-white head. Nose is juicy wet hops, tropical fruit. Tastes piney hoppy, with a solid malt bill, and some grapferuit, tangerine, and piney notes.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: A refreshing classic. Great floral aroma, crisp bitter hops in the taste. Highly drinkable, and very hoppy for those looking to veer away from the maltier Pale Ales.

name: Nectar Ales Pale Nectar
review: Paprika, grapefruit and wood aroma. Cloudy golden pour, no head. Floral marigold on the palate but virtually flavorless.

name: James Page Burly Brown Ale
review: Poured into a perfect pint. 2.75 A: Clear, light amber brown color. Two fingers of frothy beige head. Retention is below average and very little lacing is left. 3.0 S: Toasty with nuttiness and caramel. Pretty standard nose for a brown, but this falls squarely at average. 3.0 T: Taste is about in line with the nose. Toasty, nutty, caramel. Neutral malt sweetness to balance. Grainy. 3.5 M: Lighter medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Lightly creamy. Good enough here. 3.0 D: Pretty average, run-of-the-mill brown. That isn’t to say it isn’t good. DavoleBomb, Jul 08, 2013

name: James Page Burly Brown Ale
review: Bottle - Point Burly Brown, from mix six from Giant Eagle in UA (I think). Brown pour, light tan head. Aroma of molasses, nutty, earthy, coffee, bread. Tastes are caramel, nutty, cola, brown sugar. Bit of grass bitter in the finish.

name: James Page Burly Brown Ale
review: Drank from a twelve ounce bottle. A cchocolaty aroma. Nice beer! Tastes like a well balanced, generic brown ale.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: I had no idea that they had changed the name. I used to drink this as "james page wild rice lager" I thought they had stopped brewin it. THAT WAS 13Y AGO! I am running out tomorrow and buying some! When I first became a beer snob i drank my weight in this stuff weekly. All i remember was being able to taste the wild rice, and a real smooth, slightly bitter finish. Great, now i am getting all misty.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Had this one bottled. Light orange pour with a filmy white head, nose of sweet bread, notes of baked bread, hops and orange. Not bad.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Pours a golden orange color with light white head. Aroma of bready grains and light caramel malts. You can definitely taste the wild rice. Interesting brew. Different enough to purchase again... and probably again.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Bottle courtesy of CharlesDarwin. An orange pour with a thin and fizzy light-tan head. A very unique aroma of freshly baked bread, vanilla extract and malts. The wild rice smell really shows up as it warms. Smooth, sweet stuff. Quite doughy. A little herbal with hints of anise. Unique stuff all the way.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: beer I had while in Minnesota. I went there to get a drivar’s lisence, I’m from Mexico and had to travel al the way up there just to get one. Glad you guys luv us illegals so much. tanks. beer was crisp, man, i could go for some of that crisp woman, no what I mean? Long live your friendly government. LOL........

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Bottle, Cold Springs Brewery. Dark golden color with a smaller diminishing yellowish (similar to a ages piece of paper) colored head. Toasted white bread aromas along with some light caramel and a hint of light floral hops. Really has a wild rice quality. Lightly sweet wild rice flavors mix with mild rose and lavender. A sweeter lager. A mild bitter linger helps ensure that his does get to sweet. A novel brew. Let see if Point does anything with this one. Thanks CharlesDarwin.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Nice amber hued gold, with a nice line of white crisp head. Effervescent. Sweet plain malt aroma, with a touch of grass. Flavor is pretty boring at first, of plain malt with the usual touch of hops. Ends with some caramel, more grass and a little saltiness. Not offensive, not amazing. Very drinkable and smooth. Palate is smooth and lightly sugary.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Its hard to believe anyone would brew something this bad on purpose. I’m thinking I got a bad bottle. Terrible paint thinner and licorice aroma. Pours a nice copper brown. Terrible rubber aftertaste. I’m rating as-is with an open mind to try another sample.

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: Hmmm... I wasn’t aware that Pilseners could be brewed using Ojibwe manoomin (wild rice). A decent enough drink, deep gold, slight head, musty earthy hop odor over sweet grasses. The flavor had a surprisingly fruity, apple & peach, kind of a twist. An earthy hop bitterness returns on the finish Sal’s Beverage World, Elmhurst, IL

name: James Page Boundary Waters Golden Lager
review: This smelled just like a field of grass. I was excited to try this because the other James Pages brews I have had are great. This one didn’t live up to the hype I gave it. Orangish color with a quickly diminishing bubbly head. This didn’t really have that smooth of a taste.

name: Distelhäuser Premium Pils
review: Hell herber Beginn, klassisch. Eher trocken, wenig Hopfen, geringe Bitterkeit. Spritzig, steigend bitter, leicht grasig. Trocken herber Abgang. Frisch. 8/10/11/11/10/11

name: Distelhäuser Premium Pils
review: On tap at der Restarant Meistertrunk in Rothenburg, Germany. Bright clear gold color. Frothy white head. Aroma is clean Pils malt, crisp grain and subtle lemon. Floral & spicy hops upfront. Light bitterness. Hoppy finish & aftertaste. Tasted on 8/17/19.

name: Distelhäuser Premium Pils
review: On tap at germany in a camping. Clear straw yellow colour small white head. Nose is grassy, flowers but held back. Taste is low bitterness, low citrusses, fruits flowers. A bit surprising amount of dry hops for a pils

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: bottle from Heinrichs 3000 Kornwestheim. Pale yellow with a mid-sized white head. Light-bodied, shy malty flavours with some bitterness in the finish.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Herb wässriger Antrunk, dazu getreidige und bittere Noten, die den Alkoholentzug deutlich aufzeigen. Wässriger, leicht bitterer Nachgeschmack. Trinkbar... 10/7/8/6/7/7

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: 0,5l bottle. What a thrill. Looks like a Pilsener, maybe too big head and too much CO2 pearls. Like a Helles on the nose. Taste starts with a little bit grain, followed by a thin and watery part. Little bit malt. Cardboard. Boring.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht malzig, getreidig, leichte Bitterkeit.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: It’s golden with a white head. Both aroma and the slightly sweet flavor have notes of malt, flower and hints of straw and a touch of metal. It’s actually quite easy, refreshing and OK to drink.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Slightly hazy pale golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, sweet and a little grass.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Bottle. Honey and barley malt aroma. Golden yellow color with small head. Lightly sweet barley malt flavor with a light grass hops finish. Moderate carbonation - about the same level as a US light beer.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Bottle (50 cl) from Toom Getränkemarkt, Würzburg, Germany. Clear pale golden, medium white head. Pretty clean but weak straw malt aroma with some grassy hops. Thin and a bit watery. Good balance with moderate bitterness. Not bad.

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: (bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a medium-sized blonde foamy head. Slightly sweet and a bit soapy malty nose. Light-sweet flavour, slim bodied with a medium carbonation. Malt-accented strawy taste with shy herbal notes; slightly sweet and faint bitter finish with metal (12.05.08).

name: Distelhäuser Leichtes
review: Bottle, 2.9%. Almost clear yellow colour. No head. Weird citricness to flavour. Thin. 8 months past BB date.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: keg at the brew pub... Golden yellow... Thin white lacing.. Soft dry grassy lemon fruits nose... Bitter grassy fruits. Mlong hay

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: I had it on tap at Bitting. It pours golden with a white head and lacing. The aroma is sweet malt and fruit. The taste is sweet malt and grain with a hint of hops. The carbonation is average, and it goes down smooth. It’s very drinkable.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: Clear yellow pour with white head. Aroma is grainy but mild. Taste follows nose. Too watery to be much, but could do yard work with it.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: 3oz sample at the brew pub. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma of grain and light citrus. Taste mimics the nose. Light lemon citrus, and sweet grain.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: Draft at the source. Crystsl clear golden color. Aroma of white pepper. Taste is peppery hay.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: Tap. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is grain and cereal malt with light earthy hops. Flavor is malt dominant with light hops and bitterness and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: Little bit of a strange aroma. Pretty good german hop presence, almost pilsner like. Nice peppery finish. Aftertaste is a little bit off, similar to the aroma. There are some deficits, but the good things make this a fair beer to drink overall. I’d say not bad.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: On tap at J. J. Bitting. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Crisp grain and crackers on the nose, sweet toast and biscuit. Sweet and grainy, caramel and toast. Crackers, light sweetness into the finish. Easy drinking, and no big flaws, but nothing that blew me away.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: Draft. Pours light gold with white head. Nose and taste of wheat malt, banana, malt and light pepper. Light body.

name: Bittings Victorias Golden Ale
review: This is pretty much your standard golden ale...nothing really exciting but enjoyable still.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Süßlicher, karamellig herber Beginn mit trockenem Hintergrund. Pappig malzig, steigend bitter von geringem Level aus. Süffig, eher langweilig. 9/8/8/8/11/8

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Bottle - clear golden, decent white head but dissipates quickly - high carbonation. Strong lemony aroma. Slight ting in mouth. Initial lemony tasting but no great finish. Not my type of beer.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: "Distelhäuser Märzen", Flasche von REWE, Kreuzwertheim. - Dunkleres Goldgelb, blank. - In der Nase etwas breiteres, leicht brotiges Malz mit süßlich-fruchtigen Noten. - Antrunk brotig hellmalzig mit deutlicher Fruchtigkeit, die an Orangenlimonade erinnert. Im Hintergrund unauffällige, wenig aromatische Hopfenherbe. Milder rezent, vollmundig. Im Abgang ein wenig Orangenschale mit schwacher ranziger Bittere. - Blaß malzig, limonadenfruchtig und arg laff gehopft, kein großer Genuß.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Nice labels. Clear golden beer with very small white head, smell is grass and malty, taste is malty, grass, floral, mild bitter, lively carbonation, light body, thin texture, short bitter finish, thin, (I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 09/18 and batch 20B1005)

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Flasche 50cl. Rötlich-Gold, leichte Trübung. Sehr wenig Kohlensäure, laff im Abgang. Malzig, leichte Bittere. Insgesamt enttäuschend, schade!

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Bottle bought in Germany a year ago, pours orange gold with a faint haze and a fluffy head, and aromas of Seville orange and dry grass. Full bodied and slightly sweet, but with drying bitter-orange notes and a peppery hoppiness.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: the aroma is malty and herbal with some shades of grain and hay... the taste is malty with notes of grain, caramel and grasses... sweet and dry aftertaste...

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: Deep golden, decent head. Malty aroma, bready, some toffee, minimal cardboard. Medium body. Well-rounded mouthfeel, nice balance. Bready taste with a toffee note and a fine hop bitterness. Very pleasant.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: 50 cl bottle. Golden color, good foam. Aroma: dried malt, slightly browned toast, a little honey notes, hint of aromatic hops. Taste: malty, more pils malt, a little caramel, alcohol-wine with light fruity notes.

name: Distelhäuser Märzen
review: 500ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours clear gold with a white head. Aroma of malt, bread. Taste is moderate sweet, caramel, malt.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Trübes gelb schaum is in Ordnung, im Geruch Hefe fruchtig, bananige fruchtig würzig hefig, nettes Weizen

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Bottle shared at Korntal. As “Distelhauser Weizen Hell - 5.4%” with orange and green label. Hazy golden with white head gently and skillfully poured by Michael. Sweet grainy and banany, light bubblegum coating and soft doughy. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Decent stuff.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: (abricot trouble, nez bonne banane, bouche aussi, généreuse, bien fruitée, houblonnage correct, bien sympa le midi)

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: On tap- cloudy darkish yellow with thick white head. Good bubblegum and banana aroma. Good mouthfeel. Went down very well, strong banana and bubble gum finish. Nice hefe.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Very creamy white head. Nice hazy golden color. Excellent bananas and cloves in the nose. Smooth mouth, Cloves, banana and spice. Smooth full bodied. Amazing depth. Top 10 hefes I’ve ever had. Having on draft in Rothenburg just off the main square at an top restaurant with a nice garden in late July. Perfect

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Ar: Bright peach and banana; notes of clove, star anise, and black pepper; doughy, light malt. Ap: Deep gold and slightly hazy; medium white head with moderate retention, leaves a medium-thin cap of foam. T: Banana and peach skin, moderate-high intensity; peppercorns and cloves; soft light bread fills the palate and lingers, mixing with more banana toward the finish; low bitterness, slightly herbal hop flavor; banana and dough linger. P: Medium body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: A pleasure to drink this German hefeweizen; deft balance of banana, peach, clove, pepper, and doughy malt, with some nice accents and complexities; quaffable while being very full-flavored.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Bottle. Best before Oct 31, 17 on back label. Classic to the style in every regard. Proper glassware shows a hazy golden color with a solid amount of carbonation. Aroma is the banana, clove, and wheat that comes from a pure German yeast strain. I know that this style beer doesn’t get much love but... It is spot on the style and drinks easy. Lightly sweet flavor. The banana, light clove/yeasty body and bubble gum are balanced. The finish has a slightly dry texture. My fresh bottle treated me well.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Aus der Flasche getrunken (Direktlieferung). Trübes Goldgelb im Glas mit weißer Schaumkrone. Ordentlich gebrautes Weizen.

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: Boca 0.5L - iako je po mirisu obeæavalo(banana) okus i nije nešto naroèito, dosta je gazirano

name: Distelhäuser Hefe-Weizen
review: 500ml bottle. Huge white head. Cloudy orange colour. Rather bland aroma. Watery taste and palate. Bad.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Bottle (thanks roman). Pours clear golden with whiteish head. Aroma is fruits, grains, banana. Flavor is sweet, fruits, banana, grains, cardboard, wheat. Overall: drinkableish.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Sampled @ my one and only THT 2018. Clear golden color, small white head. Smell and taste wheat, sweetish, slightly a hint of grainy hayish sweetness. Average to decent body and carbonation. Ok.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: The Hague Tasting - 13 July 2018 Great yellow color with small head. Rolling in mouth draws out complexity of flavor.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: July THT. Clear pale yellow, white head. Cardboard, lemon, dough, grain, coriander. Bit bland.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Bottle shared at THT actually July! Clear light golden with white head. Banana, sweet wheat, bread, CO2, light paper, bitter herbs, a touch of malts. Just medium sweet, light bitter. Over light bodied with fizzy carbonation.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: THT July at Kwartje. Bottle. Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, wheat, cardboard. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Little dry.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Klares goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, fruchtig, etwas Banane, leicht säuerlich, sehr spritzig.

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Mild hefiger, eher wässriger Antrunk. Leichte Herbe im Mittelteil, die deutlich zunimmt. Trocken herber Nachhall, dunkel, minimal fruchtig. 8/7/7/7/8/7

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Pianka spora i trwala, klarowne, wiadomo zapach gozdzikow bananow i moreli. W smaku jablkowo bananowe lekko przyprawowe, solidne w smaku i wyraziste jak na filtrowanego pszeniczniaka. Dobra robota, polecam tym co nie lubia osadu w tym stylu

name: Distelhäuser Kristall Weizenbier
review: Clear golden, lush frothy head. Aroma of spicy yeast, wheat. Medium body. Well balanced taste with much spiciness, light bitterness, bread. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone

name: Distelhäuser Dunkles Weissbier
review: BB 03/19. From a bottle poured a clouded mid-amber with 2-3cm of white froth that retained very well and laced OK. Carbonation average. Aroma moderately strongly of cloves with quite sweet banana and hints of bubblegum. Taste moderately of cloves, moderately sweet banana all with a nice flavour that is not overpowering. Light body. Smooth wirh a thin mouthfeel and moderate sweetness on a short finish.

name: Distelhäuser Dunkles Weissbier
review: Bottle - cloudy darkish amber with large off white head which quickly dissipates. Fruity aroma, tingre of banana. Good mouthfeel. Again fruity aspects come through taste - quite easy drinking.

name: Distelhäuser Dunkles Weissbier
review: Dunkel hefiger, süß brotiger Antrunk. Noten von Karamell, minimale Säure. Dumpf malzig im Mittelteil, muffig. Brotig zum Ende. Noch okay. 10/9/10/7/10/7

name: Distelhäuser Dunkles Weissbier
review: Bottle courtesy of Beerhunter111. Thanks. Hazy amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel and banana. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. 140317

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Fles 30cl thuis. Scherp. Eigenzinnig. Moeilijk definieerbaar. Wel te drinken. (4-2011).

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Goudgeel, witte schuimkraag, iets troebel, veel koolzuur. Aroma: Mouten , kruidig, gember en iets fruitig. Smaak: Metaal, licht kruidig en peperig, lichte mouten, iets gember en licht bitter en ook iets wrang. In de smaak een hint van wilde gist Niet spectaculair ook niet slecht. Medium body, veel koolzuur, afdronk is kruidig en droog.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Bottle. Golden pour. Aroma of yeast, spices and malt. Taste has sweet yeast, mild sweet spice, malt and some bitters. Very simple and no ginger to be found.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: 30cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat pale golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Ginger, caramel, malts and herbs. Quite nice, I’ve expected less.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Geruch malzig und fast wie ein Export. Der Geschmack geht dann auch in diese Richtung, aber vergleichsweise wässrig.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Dutchdrebus. Hazy yellow golden color, huge soapy white head. Smell and taste malts, lightly a hint of brett (that’s not intended is it?), slightly metallic, light to moderately bitter. Average body, medium carbonation. Well, I suspect something went wrong or at least I doubt it was intended like this, but it worked out in the end.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Bottle: Thanks Douberd: Served in a shaker: Medium sized white foamy head on top of a hazy yellow orange colored beer. Aromas of lambic a liks, some peach, lacto bac. some sweet tarty tones and wild yeast. (Huh? Infection I assume, but smells very nice). Flavours of sweet hops, herbs, some malts, hints of wilder yeast, light caramel, some lacto tones, cream... Must be a mild infection, but I think it only helps the beer a bit. Nice. Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, herbs, yeast, spicy sweets and a slight hint of carbo gass.. Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied and a light creamy texture. Decent but where comes the wild yeast from?

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Bottle 300 ml. Into a big tulip glass, ABV 7.5% Hiney-like orange colour on the body, huge white head, thick, with very good retention and heavy lacing left around the glass. Quite hazy and unclear. Aroma is fruity but with a brett-like sourness in it, manure, dirty hay. Taste is much better, grains, hay but cleaner as a flavour, grass, lemon. Moderate sour on the aftertaste. Quite carbonated, medium thin body. Dry palate. Overall nothing special but goes down easily, the aroma was quite unpleasant to me and ruined a bit the whole drinking experience.

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass deep golden, huge head. Starts milder than exspected, spicy-malty. Some woody notes, modest sweet. Finish drier, but still spicy. Not bad!

name: Huttenkloas Landbier
review: ondoorzichtig oranje, zeer schuimige witte kraag aroma: floraal, graan, stro, sinaasappel smaken: zure-balsamico basis smaken, matig zoet, matig bitter, matig fruit, mout, gist medium body, glad, prikkelend co3, afdronk wat zuur

name: Distelhäuser Festbier
review: Vielen Dank an kevnic2008! 500ml Flasche, 5,6% Alc. Klare goldene Farbe, fingerbreite weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig malzig, sehr getreidig. Geschmack sehr malzig, würzig hopfig, getreidig.

name: Distelhäuser Festbier
review: Bottle, 15/11/14. Pours a clear pale orange with a good-looking, but quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is a lot of graininess and pale malts. Taste is grainy, lightly corn. Quite dry. Light with fairly high carbonation. Boring and not pleasant.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: keg at the brew pub... Light golden yellow.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet raspberry juicy floral fruits.. Massive raspberry fruits nose... Light bitter herbal raspberry fruits.. Soft sweet raspberry fruit

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: I had it on draft at Bitting. It pours golden with minimal white head and some lacing. The aroma is raspberry. The taste is a grainy raspberry. I thought the raspberry was very natural tasting. This is one of better light beers they do there.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Did not like. Wish I tried it first. Near clear yellow pour. Hint of sweetness on the nose. Tastes like drinking hand sanitizer. Not something I would drink again.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: 3oz sample at the brew pub. Pours a clear gold color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of wheat and faint raspberry. Taste is grainy, light citrus, soap, and artificial raspberry.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Tap. Pours clear gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is raspberry, grainy malt and light hops. Flavor is malt forward with raspberries and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Draft at the source. Clear golden yellow color, thick white head. Aroma of dusty berries. Taste is intense berries, wheat is in the background.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: On tap at J. J. Bitting. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Sweet floral and perfume filled raspberry notes on the nose, strong syrup. Medium bodied, grainy and sweet, full of raspberry syrup again. Not as sweet and cloying as I would expect, this is actually drinkable. Not that I really want to drink it in any volume, but there’s not the big cloying flaws that you usually find with a lot of brewpub raspberry wheats. Finishes with more lingering “raspberry” flavor. Not for me, but better than most, which is something I guess.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Draft. Pours gold. Nose and taste of raspberry jam and wheat malt. Light body.

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Not very hazy in appearance but it does have a strong raspberry nose. Sweet but not very "wheaty".

name: Bittings Raspberry Wheat
review: Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Light fruity raspberry aroma with some pale malty notes. The flavor has a light raspberry sweetness on a plain pale malty base. Not bad.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: I had it on tap. It pours a hazy copper with some off-white head and little lacing. The aroma was fruit and floral hops. The taste was more fruity than expected with only slight hop bitterness. It was smooth. This was an okay beer.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Cask. Pours clear amber with a medium, bubbly off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is pear and apple fruity esters, earthy and minty hops with cereal malt. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with supporting malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Cask at the source. Deep golden amber color, fluffy white head with good retention. Aroma of peppery caramel. Taste is similar. Nice.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Draft. Pours amber. Nose and taste of bitter hops, earth and malt. Creamy bitter finish. Medium body.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Draft at the brewpub. Poured a good looking orange body with a fluffy mostly white head. Aroma was lousy and weak, barely detectable aroma of grains and vomit, yuck. Flavor was dry with notes of lots of ceral and grains along with a touch of chocolate. Body was medium with strong carbonation. Meh, it was okay but nothing special.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Cask Conditioned - Poured muddy copper with a fairly large small bubbled white head. The head quickly dissappears to a small white lacing. The aroma was warm and a bit orangy. The flavor was much of the same - not as bitter as I would have liked and not as good as the ESB’s that I love.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: I thought that this was Bitting’s best offering at the Split Rock beerfest. And it was that great. But is was decent and easy to drink.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Golden amber, with a small white head and almost no lacing. It looks nothing like a true English bitter, and the aroma and flavor was more along the lines of a pale...and a weak one, at that. Not hoppy, not malty, not horrible, but not impressed.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: This was an okay beer. I had this at the Split Rock Beer Festival 2007. Not something to remarkable, but okay.

name: Bittings Best Bitter
review: Cask. Pours a slihgtly cloudy deep muddy copper with a thin lasting head and very fine cobweb lacing. Aroma is fruity, light yeast, some herbla and tea-hops- very english like with a light toasty malt backbone. Smooth flavor- light bready malts, yeast, fruity esters- becomes a bit muddled, but finishes pretty smooth.

name: Bittings Knock Out Bock
review: This was a good, but light flavored beer. It poured with a small white head out of the tap. It was slightly floral with a bit earthy flavor but I think it was lacking flavor. Average beer.

name: Bittings Knock Out Bock
review: on tap-pours a creamy light tan head that laces with gold-yellow color. Aroma is malty. Taste is medium malt, background hops, roasty. Medium body, OK carbonation.

name: Bittings Knock Out Bock
review: Malty nose with ample caramel and a bit of molasses. Slightly sweet, but not overly so. Hops become more apparent at end of swallow. Balanced and light enough to drink on a hot day. Reddish brown with slight off-white head.

name: Bittings Knock Out Bock
review: Nice clear caramel color. Clean aroma. Big malty flavor. REally yummy. Very enjoyable. Clean malt flavor. Nothing bad about it.

name: Bittings Knock Out Bock
review: At the BP, the description contradicted the web, @ 6.4% ABV, and cold aged for 2 months, but I digress. Nice clear carmel color. Clean malty aroma with no off notes. Big malty flavor, that is exceptionally German like and outstanding. One of the best BP bock beers that I have ever had. Way to go August!

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: I had it on tap. Am I wrong, or has this one not been on tap for a while? It pours a hazy brown with a small, beige head. The aroma is caramel and smoky. The taste is caramel, nut, smoke, and grain. I like the subtle smokiness here. I'm usually not that big into the Scottish style. The smoke added a different feel to this one. It was pretty good.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: This scot’s ale had a very mild aroma but its appearance was a dark amber with a very small white head. The taste was strong caramel with a bit of toasted nut. The palate was good but the taste was a little sweet for me. I was surprised to see the low alcohol percentage.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: Great Scot! The beer’s gone a bit sour. I don’t think there’s supposed to be a citrus flavor here. Otherwise, mild and schwarzbier-ish. Scottish Ale meets Flemish Ale.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: on tap-pours a retaining, creamy, tan head with black color. Aroma-not noticed. Taste is dark malt, sweet, scotch. Well done, not my taste.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: On cask at J.J. Bittings. Tried a second time with a new batch. Thin but creamy head of fine bubbles. Light carbonation. Light malt aroma with a hint of roastyness. Also some chocolate malt and a bit of peat. Kind of weak aroma. Color is very nice dark mahagony red. Flavor is typical for a scottish ale. Roasted malts, peat and a touch of smoke. Pretty dry mouthfeel. Not as sweet as most scottish ales. Soft in the mouth. Lingering roasty, smoky aftertaste. Pretty good though.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: ON TAP: Toasted malt nose, dark brown color. Warm round malt base with a tinge of toffee and butty. This is not very good, thin and weak.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: Light black color. Small layer of a head. Clay taste, also malt, medium long lasting. Not much going on int he nose - kind of weird for a Scottish Ale.

name: Bittings Great Scot!! Ale
review: Wow, an 80 Shilling! I don't know if I will ever know the difference between an 80 and a 90 Shilling beer. Inflation? Pours a dark brown color with a medium thin light beige head. Strong malt and caramel aroma. Medium-bodied and a little smokey, with a nice malt presence. There is also a tiny bit of hops lingering around. The finish didn't seem to keep up very well but overall I liked this one.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: 0,5 l bottle now called "Disterhäuser Natur Radler" with the same barcode. Murky pale yellow in the glass, nearly no head. Citrus on the nose. Tastes like sweet citrus limonade, later soft grapefruit bitterness. Refreshing, yes, but beer?

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Tap @ Sternbäck, Würzburg, 14/11/14. Pours a hale yellow with a frothy, quickly disappearing, white head. Aroma is herb and lemon-lime soda. Taste is soda with some pale maltiness. Soda-like in the mouth. Disgusting.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Goldgelbes Radler mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr süß nach Limonade. So schmeckt es auch, sehr süß und keine Spuren von Bier.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: It’s plae golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of lemon, lemon soda and malt. The sweet flavor has the same notes and the finish is lemony. Thin-bodied, but quenching.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: A golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet lemony, and so is the flavor, but the flavor also has light malty notes. The body is thin.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: well, it was a hot day, cycling along the main, so it seemed to make sense. light golden, fizzy, no surprises in the lemonade aroma; actually quite ok with faint grassy hops. pleasant stuff. perhaps it’s unfair to rate radler under other conditions

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Bottled. A light golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma has light notes of malt and lemon. The flavor is sweet malty with light notes of lemon, leading to a dry, bitter, and lemony finish. The body is light.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Bottle. Lemon soda aroma with a hint of the export beer. Pale yellow color with nice head. Sweet lemon flavor with a light bitter finish. Nice Radler but not much beer flavor.

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of Hildigöltur/Dixen. Clear yellow with a dense white head. Very discreet aroma - the lemon is hardly detectable. Light body with vague notes of sweet lemon. 220309

name: Distelhäuser Radler
review: Bottle 33cl. Clear light to medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good - fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, light citrus - lemon. Flavor is light to moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20090322]

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: I had it on tap at Bitting. It pours almost black with a tan head and lacing. The aroma is roasty and chocolate. The taste is chocolate, roastiness, and coffee. It’s very smooth. This is a good all around beer.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: Good beer, has a nice dark colour, great pearly head, roasted aroma and well balanced palate.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: First really solid beer I’ve had here. Pours lehigh brown from tap with a thin brown head. Nice roasted and dark chocolate notes on the nose. Joining those notes on the tongue is a touch of coffee. The only drawback is the mouthfeel is a bit thin but it finishes clean.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: Sample at brewery. Pours out a dark brown with a tiny tell of a tan head. Aroma is of some chocolate, and faint tell of roast, but nothing overall that stands out. Flavor is light chocolate, roast and a faint tell of coffee, was looking for a much more full mouthfeel from a stout.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: Draft sampler. Pours an off brown body with no head. Aroma is weak coffee through a filter. Body is thin and undercarbonated. Flavor is weak coffee, earth, slight syrup and overly sweet for the style. Not good.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: A good beer but not perfect.. The "espresso-like bitterness" is a good description for this beer. It leaves a taste of burntness in your mouth as well. Nice dark, black appearance and dark tan head. Nice palate. The taste is almost too much for a whole pint. Very burnt, espresso, bitterness to it.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: On tap at bittings. Pours a deep dark brown almsot black with a lasting beige head. Aroma is nutty, doughy yeast, caramel, chocolate and light roast. Full flavor- sharp dark caramel- special B sweetness, Toffee, sharp dark chocolates, and some modest coffee roast character in the end. Mildly bitter.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: I was unimpressed with this oatmeal stout. It lacked any real palate and had nothing going else goin on either. Very dissappointing.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: Major coffee-espresso flavors going on here, plus a lot of nuttiness that’s either enjoyable or disgusting, depending on your tastes. Black like tar.

name: Bittings Black Jack Oatmeal Stout
review: on tap-pours a rocky tan head that laces. Color is brown with red tint. Aroma is dark malt. Taste is coffee, oatmeal, dark malt. Nice, even though not my taste.

name: Millstream Lager
review: From old tasting notes. Deep amber gold color. Bubbly yellowish head. Light grainy malt nose. Tangy malt flavor has a citrusy backdrop. Earthy malt/hop finish. Brisk dry aftertaste.m

name: Millstream Lager
review: Had this a couple of years ago, and it was nothing special, so no wonder they got rid of it. Fear not, they just brought back their crappy "pilsner" to replace it.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Octoberfest Coloring with Sandy Head. Sweet Malty Aroma...Very Subtle.. Sweet Malt, with a Light Hoppy Background....Very Bitter Finish... On the Darker Side of Pale Lagers but Good Session Style.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Thanks again heemer! Light ruby hue with a small, off-white head. Toasted dark bread, cereal, caramelized pale malt. Light herb hops. A little nutty with hints of butterscotch. Light sweetness thoughout with a crisp finishing bitterness. Acidity is a touch stronger than I’d like to be tasting. Above average carbonation is spot on; medium body with a watery, nearly creamy, texture.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Light amber color with a moderate yellowish head. Some lace. Light pale malt and mild floral hops. A touch sharp and earthy in the finish. I do believe these brews maybe improving.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Not too original yellowish haze, decent body, nice for an american lager. better then most actually. I would recommend it.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Perhaps it is because lagers are so difficult to identify. This beer I found equally difficult to rate. My sense is that it was a disappointing beer by both flavor and aroma. The trouble is that neither are easy to determine why. Instead of making the effort, maybe I will just go get another brand of beer.

name: Millstream Lager
review: Horrible brew. tart, tangy and undrinkable. This could be a bad batch but the beer was aweful!

name: Millstream Lager
review: Enjoyable brew. Creamy head. Complex in flavor. Hoppy and malty, Well balanced. A good brew.

name: Millstream Lager
review: A deep copper color, clear, the head is average, beige, the lace is also adequate. Nose is malt, the front sweet, the top is light, the finish is lightly carbonated, dry, and a fair hop presence, a bit thin in the end won't score many points with me. Ranks #864 on my current 1000 beer master list.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Bottle pour with a light straw color. Light rice aroma. Very light beer, notes of oats and rice. Really basic.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Clear gold with thick foamy white head Aroma is grainy Flava is grainy mildly sweet and wheat notes Feels light grainy with moderate fuzz Finishes moderately dry grainy wheaty

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Basically this is a good Kölsch. Pale yellow with a proper head and a well balanced taste that remains quite long. Unfortunately there is a slich touch of wet newspaper in the taste.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Best Kolsch I've ever tasted! Not too bitter or hoppy. Suggest a hot summer's day for this one!

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Tap @ the brewpub, Berlin. Pours clear pale golden color with a large white head. Malty aroma with subtle hop notes, hay and some distant buttery notes. Flavor is crisp and malty bitter, slick palate, hay notes, some toffee on the aftertaste. Decent. 3314

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Draught @ Gaffel Haus Berlin Aroma has strong malty tones and some grain. Flavour has grainy malt, some grassy hops and minerals. Decent Kölsch.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Sample@Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2019 - yellow pour with a white head. Medium sweet citrus fruity, some notes of cereal, grain, yeasty linger, medium body, crisp finish.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: Best foreign Kolsch Ive had. USA attempts at kolsch are ok with Leinie leading the way with their Canoe Paddler. That is good. This kolsch is crisp and tastes GREAT! Nice head that stays and a good clean taste. No, there arent "lemons and citrus" as some say. BS. It tastes like beer and a good one it is. Will buy again. Thanks for this site that does more than accept opinions that the site agrees with and not much else. Sites that claim to be your "advocate" do little other than support HOPS OVERLOADED beers. Is that really beer???? I think not.

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: 2nd ranked kolsch i believe, best ice cold from the bottle, but its a matter of taste, it has a stronger hopfy flavour than other kölsch but overall balanced and classical

name: Gaffel Kölsch
review: What's with all the low ratings? This beer is a real crowd pleaser on a hot day. I can't tell you how many comments I've gotten from people that it is one of the best lagers they have ever had, ever. And these are mostly from beer drinkers in Seattle who love IPAs, but on a hot summer day a Gaffel Kolsch is just the thing. It sells out at our local boutique store throughout the summer and even sometimes the big chains. Seriously shocked at the 1, 2, 3 star reviews. This is good beer! Maybe y'all just don't like lagers.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: From old tasting notes. Amber orange hue with lots of small bubbles leading to a fuzzy beige head. Pleasant floral hop aroma with a perfumy sweetness. Mildly sweet toasted malt flavor. Slightly biting finish has a nice hoppy character. Decent.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Served on tap at Des Moines Embassy Suites. Clear amber color with a white head. Malt grain aroma. Not much complexity. Basic malt amber. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Tap at the brewery on 7-18-16. Poured copper, off white head. Aroma was malt, caramel, nutty. Taste was bittersweet, caramel, breads.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Bottle into a shaker. Pours copper with a small and quickly dissipating white head. Very little aroma with just a hint of malt. A nice toasted malt and biscuit taste throughout. Good medium body and carbonation. A nice amber but nothing amazing.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: An okay amber. Near to no aroma. The flavor is a bit off. The malts taste like they were roasted just a bit too long, and the hops add a level of surprising astringency.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Not my preferred style of beer, but everything about it seemed to mesh together. I liked it, but I’m certainly not going to the store to purchase it.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Bottle courtesy of HuskerTan, many thanks! Clear deep golden amber color, white head that settles rapidly. Aroma of lightly toasted biscuit dipped in caramel. Taste is burnt caramel, light spice. Tasty but undercarbonated.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Pours a clear coppery reddish color with off-white head. Caramel malts, biscuit, and some light grass on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with some spice and bread.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Bottle. A solid Amber, light gold , moderate carbonation, mild finish. Medium body with balanced malt flavors.

name: Millstream Schild Brau Amber
review: Out of the bottle dated June. Dark amber/copper hue with a small amount of haze, white head with medium lacing. Nutty with caramel notes and a hint of smoke on the finish. Mouth feel is crisp with some decent carbonation. Sweetness in the beginning finished with an earthy mild bitterness. Very pleasant overall roasted malt flavor and balanced example of style.

name: Big Rock Chop House Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen
review: Cask Stillage from the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center 26/09/2009 Fruit wine aroma. Golden coloured fruity and a little sweet on the palate with a crisp floral dry and bitter malt finish.

name: Big Rock Chop House Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen
review: Tap: slightly hazy dirty orange color. Little head. Lots of banana and clove in the aroma and flavor. Decent lacing. Will agree with wolhfs there was some funk in the finish I couldn’t pinpoint. Decent nonetheless.

name: Big Rock Chop House Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen
review: Tap. Golden colored with a slight haze. Plenty of spice, clove and bananna. Lighter bodied, definate wheaty flavor. Clove and bananna carry over into the flavor pleasantly. There is a strange taste in the finish that I picked up in another of their beers. Not entirely unpleasant but shouldn’t be there. Overall a fairly decent Hefeweizen.

name: Big Rock Chop House Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen
review: This is one of the two best that they have. Strong banana esters dominate. This is what I expect to have in a good Hefe Weizen. It may be that I wanted something to be relatively good. Matched well with the seafood platter I had.

name: Big Rock Chop House Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen
review: Pale straw color, hazy, but not as hazy as it should be. Way too candied taste. Disrupted the body and dominated the beer, throughout the main part of the body. The initial taste was sweet and still retained some wheat flavor. The beer finished watery/sweet which was not appealing. Perhaps I am being too harsh, but I like my hefe weizens and this seemed too artificial. Would have appreciated crispness, as the description claims, but did not find it.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: Draft at RBSG grand tasting (notes). Pours a dark amber color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have citrus fruit, oranges, melon, caramel and bready malts. The flavor side had more toasted malt and general bitterness with the citrus dominating hop wise. This one was kind of lost in the sea of great beers floating around.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: tap at 2012 michigan winter beer festival. not as intense or flavorful as bonnies, but a solid beer that stands on its own. good hops.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: Backlogged rating: Deep golden hue with a frothy head. The aroma has notes of resiny and piney hops with citrus and tropical esters, hint of pepper and clove. Biscuity and bready malts. The taste is fruity, moderately bitter and good balance. Not as malty as the Bonnies Raggedy IPA before it. Lively aggressive mouth feel. A solid brew.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: Nose is great pine/citrus, solid caramel maltiness. Flavor is nice pine and resin with some dank. Strong flavorful hop character & a strong bitterness. great stuff!

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: Draft… RBSG/MBGSF… Clear amber ale with a mid-sized, creamy, white head. Excellent retention. The aroma is a mélange of tropical, citrus and fuzzy fruits. Medium to full-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor leans on the bitter side of balance, but has a very nice malt base. Much like the nose, there is an abundance of tropical and fuzzy fruit bitterness. Finishes moderately bitter and tongue-numbing. This beer seems to be a replica of the double IPA (or vice-versa), but with a little less body.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: RBSG 2010. Poured clear copper color with a large frothy off-white head that lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy earthy and sour citrus hop aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bitter flavor with a moderate to heavy bitter finish of medium to long duration. Very good brew.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: Draft at RBSG Grand Tasting I sincerely regret not sampling more of the draft offerings at the Grand Tasting, but every time I headed for the taps you people just kept filling my glass with amazing beer damn you! Why? Oh right, because you’re all awesome, exceedingly generous people. Anyway... Pours light amber/gold, thin white head, spotty lacing. Nose is grapefruit, honeydew melon, peach, lightly toasted malt. Flavours of peach, grapefruit, spice, lemon, Very tart, spicy, and excellent.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: RBSG 2010 rate. On tap. Pours a trtanslucent copper color with a small white head. The nose was a powerful blast of citrus with some cotton candy and a hint of green chlorophyll. The taste was biter hops forward with grapefruit and oranges set in a caramel malt base. The palate is just a bit thin, but it seems to work rather well here. Finishes long and biter. Overall: Very nice!

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: This is pretty good. A little malt and some hops. Flavor is okay, not top-of-the-line but still tasty.

name: Big Rock Chop House Norms Raggedy Ass Ale
review: blind sample, GLBN IPA Challenge 2010. Solid piney hop aroma. Over carbonation felt on the tongue. unbalanced IMO. neds some malts to balance heavy piney hop presence, piney bitterness lingers on the palate

name: Hoepfner Pilsner
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Helles Bier mit kräftiger Schaumkrone. Im Geruch leicht fruchtwürzig. Im Geschmack fruchtig süß mit leichtem Zitrus. Im mittleren Abgang fruchtig und leichter Citrusgeschmack

name: Hoepfner Pilsner
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Tap at the brewery. My 5th MJ500 beer on this trip. Brilliant gold, effervescent. Rocky head. Bright nose of crisp malt and spicy hops. Lemony hop flavor, somewhat stiff malt, peppery finish. A bit of cardboard. Somewhat watery but decent enough flavor. Not sure how this compares to the ones MJ tried here. They have been bought by a large company since then, as have many in Germany. This is an ok pilsner today, not not much more. Would not rate that high in the present world.

name: Hoepfner Pilsner
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Recht herbes Pils, mit zentralem Hopfen und wenig Malz. Leicht Gras und Getreide. Süffig und für einen Konzertabend definitiv gut. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Hoepfner Pilsner
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Typisch Duits plilsnerbier met een citroengeel/gouden gloed en een volle witte kraag. Smaak en aroma: erg verfrissend door de hopdroogheid, verder zoet moutig met wat kruiden accenten.

name: Hoepfner Pilsner
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: As an American I lived near Karlsruhe for over seven years and have drank dozens of different German pilsners. Hoepfner pilsner is one of the best pilsners in Germany and viewed as such by the Germans in the area. I have to agree with them. I haven't tasted a better Pilsner anywhere.

name: Hoepfner Porter
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: "Porter" aus der Privatbrauerei Hoepfner, Flasche von Bierselect.de. - Dunkles Schwarzbraun, klar. - In der Nase elegante aber etwas blasse Röstaromen, Mokka und Kakao, ganz leichte weinige Schwere. - Antrunk kräftig röstmalzig mit Mokka, Kakaopulver und ein klein wenig Asche. Leichte, mild karamellige Restsüße. Dezente aber aromatische kräuterige Hopfenherbe (Schweizer Kräuterzucker - ist das Tettnanger?). Vollmundig, leicht trocken; der etwas höhere Alkoholgehalt ist perfekt eingebunden. Im Abgang mild hopfenwürzige Herbe. Langer malzbitterer Nachtrunk. - Interessantes Bier, vom Geschmacksprofil her eindeutig untergärig und somit kein klassisches Porter sondern eher ein schwarzes Märzen. Jedenfalls sehr probierenswert.

name: Hoepfner Porter
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: This is a traditional German black lager that is named "porter", as were all the Baltic Porters in this part of the world then. The reason why they call have placed it under "porter" beats me. Finally had a chance to try this, and it's shite. Aroma of grape-flavoured Fanta and Karamalz. Flavour is also Karamalz, bit a touch bitter, disappearing before you even start to notice it. So uni-dimensional and brief is the experience, with this watery beer. The best thinks I can say about it is (1), the presentation is looking good, and (2) it is better than the Lausitzer Porter.

name: Big Rock Chop House Flying Buffalo Stout
review: Very dark color. Nice complex yet smooth yeasty/malty aroma. The thing that struck me most about this beer was its even taste. Must be the rolled oats. Had a chewy texture and some faint herbal notes that were intersparsed with malt. Fairly sweet as it warmed up, and left the palette not too sweet, but with not much other flavor.

name: Big Rock Chop House Flying Buffalo Stout
review: This is a fancier place with incredible service and great, if pricey food. I was treated to a visit here for my wedding anniversary and mostly remember the cuisine and the nervous valet who parked our car. This is the one memorable brew, though - sweeter and thinner than I like my stouts, but enough roast to keep me interested, despite the amazing menu.

name: Big Rock Chop House Flying Buffalo Stout
review: Nice chocolate undertones and a nice touch of sweetness. It was served up on a pleasant June evening and really hit the spot!

name: Hoepfner Cola-Radler
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottled (backlog). Pretty much coca cola colour, small head. Aroma is bread, mild grains and coca cola. Flavour is similar. Refreshing, but I do prefer Radlers to these Diesels.

name: Hoepfner Cola-Radler
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Cloudy, yellow beer. A white two finger high head. Nose: Wheat, banana, grass and pears. Taste: Wheat malt, caramel malt, yeast, banana and citrus. Mouth: Medium body. Smooth carbonation. This is a beer that's really easy to drink! It's good and refreshing but not that interesting.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Bottle @ Bayreuth. Pours hazy Pale yellow with a white head. Grains, esters, banana, wheat and cloves. Fine example.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: In der Nase Nelke, Banane, im Trunk mehr Nelke. Mittig leichte Süße, hinten crispy, bitter.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Pours a cloudy golden colour. White head. The flavour is quite yeasty and citrus with some clove.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty banana finish.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Draft at Brauerei Hartmann in Nov. 2013: Clean and expressively phenolic aromas of pineapple, flower nectar, gum, honeydew melon, clove, and a hint of cookie and citrus. Fluffy carbonation. Slippery and thin body. Opens with a pronounced weighty peach tang and slick banana notes. Malt doesn’t pack a whole lot of vividness as it takes a backseat to the estery onslaught. Ensuing phenolic intensity dries things out and temporarily displaces the pervasive fruitiness. Plenty of gum to accompany the clingy and starchy wheat base, though a gummy candy suggestion and saccharine-like sweetness mar the cleanness somewhat. Finishes with gentle flower petal accents amid a subtle nectar push. Soft maltiness precedes a lasting orange gummy candy slickness which lingers. Bit of a mixed bag for me. The nose is pleasant enough and features all that I look for in a well made weissbier, but it certainly doesn’t portend the odd slickness and fruity ester overload of the flavor profile. Decent.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Hazy golden color, medium head. Aroma of some banana, grain, bit yeast. Slight sweet weizen, banana, bit watery. Average weizen.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig nach Banane, leicht würzig.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts yeasty-malty, fruity notes of apricot. More and more dry-yeasty, finish a bit boring-dry. Nothing special.

name: Hartmann Felsenweisse
review: Draft at Hartmann. Hazed light amber body with a fluffy white head, highly effervescent. Browned bananas with strong phenols in the nose. Thin body for weizen with a rich dark cookie batter and dark wheat bread flavor, texture has a strong savoriness which defies its lean disposition. Creamy toasted bread / wheat. Enjoyable nose, I only wish the body had a bigger presence.

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
review: Draught at Zum Fransiskaner Stockholm. Big light beige head. Very clear red brown color. Roasted malt aroma om low levels. Malty taste with a very dry finish. Balanced bitterness. Huge drinkabillity.

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
review: 22-12-18 // tap at Klingelbeutel Mainz. Schwarz ist das nicht. Aber ein schönes süffiges, leicht staubiges Bier mit malzkörper und Karamellsüße.

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
