review: Clear, copper-brown beer with a beige head. Nose: Caramel, brown sugar, butter, molasses, nuts and raisin. Taste: Caramel malt, grass, fudge, chocolate, nuts and bread. Mouth: Soft an smooth. Medium body and medium carbonation. Creamy, almost oily texture. Light bitterness at hte end. So good!

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
review: Pours clear copper with low white head. Aromas of bready malts, caramel, spices, herbs. Taste has malty notes of caramel, brown bread, spices, herbs

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
review: 500ml Bottle - Dark brown with red tinges. Chocolate and some roasted notes in the aroma. Chocolate, nuts, roasted malt, raisins and hints of berries. Very nice.

name: Hartmann Erbschänk 1550
review: On tap at Brauerei Hartmann, Wuergau, Bayern, 5.10.17. Clear dark gold-copper with a white head. Sweetish, nutty aroma, sweet and nutty taste. Full body, nuts and chocolate aftertaste, fizzy. Well-balanced.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Flasche 0,5l: Kräftiges Gold, glasklar, deutlicher feinporiger Schaum; frische + malzige Nase, leichte Süße, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Vanille, Hefearomen, dezente Hopfennoten; frischer + recht trockener Körper, trockene Fruchtigkeit, Hefearomen, Malz, Getreide, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, dezente Hopfennoten; angenehmer trockener Nachgang mit deutlichen Hefearomen

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 0.5l bottle. Clear golden body, thin white head. Aroma of bread, cheese and earthy hops and some citruses. Taste of bread, yeast, grains and some floral hops. Thin bodied and a bit flat. So far this is the beer I like the least from them.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: September 2016 - Bottle share at Leighton’s, with many thanks to Fergus. As ’Hoepfner Edel-Weizen’, 4.9%. Clear orange, lightly sparkling, dense foamy white head, full thick lacing. Aroma is airy, papery, apple, light biscuit malts. Body is smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is quite washed out, touches of the typical banana and clove but the vibe up front is papery, card. Fine. (2.9)

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 19th September 2016 Leighton’s flat clearance. Thanks to Fergus. Clear gold beer, thin pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and mildly dry. Modest carbonation. Soft malts, some grain. Light floralness. Modest citrus. Light finish. Dull and a touch papery.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 55cl bottle shared at Leighton’s garbage share. Many thanks to Fergus for this one. It pours a clean pale golden color with a minimal white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy with starch and melon. Taste is also sweet and starchy with grains and sweet. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, meh

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle shared at Leightons gaff , 19/09/2016. From toom. A clear golden coloured pour with a lasting thin off white head. Aroma is thin banana bread, papery, thin grains. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, light grains, banana, light, dry grains. Palate is light, frothy airy carbonation. Not much to it. Ok.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Fergus. Pours totally clear gold with a creamy topping. Bland aroma, light citrus, pale grains, banana chips, doughy wheat. Light sweet flavour with mild papery notes, more banana chips. Light bodied with lively, massaging carbonation. Moderately sweet to finish, with more dried banana, doughy wheat. So so.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle thanks to Fergus. It pours clear amber with a small white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, toasty grain, banana candy, paper and icing sugar. The taste is crisp, clean, dry, sticky banana candy, paper, light vanilla, icing sugar and stare with a short, sweet banana finish. Light - moderate carbonation and fine, foamy carbonation. Ok for style.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle split at Bespin, thanks to Ferris, 19/09/16. Clear golden to light copper with a well appointed off white head. Nose is papery, bread, faint vanilla ,light nana strains. Taste comprises pale malts, grains, caramel, bread, vanilla, sweet and airy. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close. Ok for style.

name: Hoepfner Edel-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Klares goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Fruchtig, etwas Banane, etwas Zitrus, sehr spritzig.

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Draft. Cloudy amber color, fine white head. Banana and clove aroma. Dry taste, low bitterness, light sour. Malty, sweet banana aftertaste. Medium to high carbonation, medium body.

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 0.5l bottle, Hazy golden body, with a huge white head. Aroma of bread, honey, banana, lemon zest and a hint of sulfur. Taste of bread, banana, lemon zest and some cloves. A bit weak bodied, but still a nice weizen.

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Flasche 0,5l: Kräftiges Gold, leicht orange, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger Schaum; in der Nase recht süß, leichte Zitrusnoten, kräftige Hefearomen, leicht gehopft, Getreide, Bananenschale; im Körper schöne Süße, Zitrusnoten, kräftige Hefearomen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, malzig, Getreide, unreife Bananen; angenehmer leicht trockener Nachgang mit kräftigen Hefearomen

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: draught@Erzbierschof - cloudy orange beer with a little white foam left; aroma of cloves and straw; subtle yet solid carbonation, quite sweet yet decently dry; creamy aftertaste of banana and cloves - classical

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 50cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours hazy murky, orange with a white. Fruity aroma with bananas, hints of tropical fruits, citrus, yeast and spices. Medium sweet with nice fruity and wheaty flavours and hints of acidity. Nice and refreshing!

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: On tap the at the brewpub in Karlsruhe . 22/07/2015 Three days after the Etape du Tour. Hazed golden yellow coloured pour with a sticky white head. Aroma is big clove phenol and banana bread yeast profile, Flavour is composed of gooey banana bread, wheat, spicy clove, creamy.. Palate is medium creamy, airy carbonation, rounded. Ok Hefe.

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo swietnie pachnace bananami i gozdzikamu. Jablkiem pieczonym, grilowanymi owocami. W smaku bananowe, mus jablkowo brzoskwiniowy, suszone morele. Kolor morelowo pomaranczowy intensywny i metny. Minus to niewielka piana. Ogolnie dobry i tresciwy jasny pszeniczniak

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Hefetrübes Orange mit geringer Schaumkrone. Hefig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Banane, unauffällig, leicht würzig, spritzig.

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: On 50 Cl bottle from Streb Getränke in Karlsruhe. Almost clear golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity ; fruity, dominant banana also some citrus. Medium body & complexity . Balances well. Enjoyable ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Hoepfner Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottled. Hazy orange colour, small white head. Aroma is citrus, banana, wheat and mild spices/yeast to it. Flavour is wheat, citrus, spices and some yeastiness as well. OK balance, but leaves at a quite standard level with no surprises to bring it up.

name: Hartmann Edelpils
review: On tap at Zum Franziskaner. Golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, grass and bread. The same in the taste. Soft and easy to drink.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 0.5l bottle. Hazy dark orange/brown body, white head. Aroma of grains, wheat, banana, caramel, cocoa and cherries. Taste of bread, banana, caramel and some cherries. Very nice dunkelweizen.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Hefetrübes dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, etwas süßlich, Karamell, Röstaromen, leicht fruchtig.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 14th April 2016 Bottlshare at Mr Smith’s pad. Thanks to Fergus. Hazy amber beer, tidy pale tan head. Palate is smooth and has decent fine carbonation. Sweetish malts, a touch of cream. Tangy ripe fruits before a sweetish light finish. A tad on the sweet side but enough here to amuse.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle shared at Leighton’s place 14/04/2016. A hazed reddy amber coloured pour with a lasting frothy beige head. Aroma is banana bread with yeast esters, a little hint of tart berry, hint of smoke. Flavour is composed of of sweet gooey banana bread, caramel and vanilla, cakey malts. A little tart berry in the finish. Palate is medium bodied semi sweet, frothy carbonation.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: 50cl bottle shared at the mid-April tasting @Leighton’s. Many thanks to Fergus for this one. It pours a clean copper colour with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet and caramely with notes of toffee and burnt sugar. Taste is also bready and sweet with more notes of caramel and toffee. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, meh

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle shared in W2 - thanks to Fergus. Pours lightly hazy amber with a creamy, tan head. Rich berries in the nose, plum, fig, dates, some town bread, yeast. Medium sweet flavour with more rich bread character, grapes, berries, dates. Medium bodied with average carboantion. Bready finish, with ripe berries, figs, dough, also toasty wheat. Tasty beer. Pretty well balanced.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle share at Leighton’s, with thanks to Fergus. As ’Hoepfner Keller-Weizen’, 4.9%. Brown with an orange hue, opaque, lightly sparkling, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet, banana ester, honeyed bread, pastry. Body is smooth, lightly foamy, light carbonation. Taste is chewed up bread, banana, dark honey, sugary. Definitely very sweet but pretty tasty too. Solid wheat beer.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Bottle at Bespin, thanks to the Watford Deutsch Projekt, 14/04/16. Chestnut brown with a moderate beige covering. Nose is toffee, light peppery spice, clove, yeast esters. Taste comprises banana bread, toffee, clove, brown sugar, dates. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close. Decent enough German affair.

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Flasche 0,5l: Kastanienbraun, kräftige Trübung, etwas mittelporiger Schaum; frische Nase, fruchtige Noten, malzig, Malzzucker, leichte Röstaromen, dunkle Beeren; im Körper kräftige Malzigkeit, Malzzucker, Hefearomen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Röstaromen, dunkle Fruchtigkeit; langer frischer, recht malziger Nachgang

name: Hoepfner Keller-Weizen
brewery: Privatbrauerei Hoepfner Karlsruhe (Brau Holding Intl - Heineken)
review: Couleur brune sombre, forte mousse legerement beige. Nez malté, fruité banane mure. Gout malté, banane, nore caramel et pomme. Bon corps. Fin douce et fruitée. Pas trop mal

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Draft sample at the source. Clear yellow with a white head. Grassy and mild citrus. Medium body and medium carbonation.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: A hazed blonde ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet biscuit malt with grassy hops, light mineral notes, OK. In mouth, sweet biscuit malt with light chalky character, grassy hops, OK. On tap at brewery.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Draft sample. Poured clear amber color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate citrus hop and malt aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Drinkable brew.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Pale yellow. Full white head. Aroma is somewhat burnt. White lace. Good bitter flavor. Great clean finish.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of bread, biscuit, diacetyl, hints of trashy bread, hints of slight fruit. Taste is a mix of grass, bread, butter, caramel, hints of slight grainy notes, finishing slightly tart, dry.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Moderate citrus hoppiness. Caramel, white bread crumbs and citrus peel. A bit dirty but not bad. Standard fare pale ale, not that that’s a bad thing.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: This is just a GOOD BEER. It’s a safe pale ale that’s hard not to like. Of the beers at MCBW, this may be my favorite just ahead of their flagship Ghetto Blaster. It’s very mild, smooth, lightly carbonated, and with a watery mouth feel like most of the beers at this place. I’d get another one if I were to visit again, for sure. It’s not unique by any means, but it still makes for an EXCELLENT session beer.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Bright clear yellow color with sticky white lacing. Mild aroma with some grass notes. Very easy drinking with a slight creaminess. Not a lot on the finish. Fairly one note.

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: Bottle bought from brewery. Very soft aroma, mild, a little musty. A little cloudy, gold / yellow color, white head. Mild taste, simple finish. Not a hoppy pale ale at all... not much flavor. Maybe something is lost in the bottling vs. at the brewery...

name: Motor City Pale Ale
review: (draught at brewery) medium gold/amber with white head. Mild malt and hops aroma. Flavor is mild floral hops and malt. I’d have called this more of an English style PA

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: I drink this in the Cass Corridor... but mostly I'm in Australia! In other words, this is a Detroit-made beer, but I am in the media and I have lived and worked in Detroit on-and-off for more than five years. I don't know whre you can buy it outside Detroit, but I can get it at Detroit liquor stores, party stores and convenience stores, and I can also buy it at-source in the Cass Corridor section of Midtown Detroit. It has more bite than most American beers. I like the taste, and the funky can it is sold in, but I don't normally notice RateBeer criteria like 'appearance'.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: Side car to a bloody mary at One-Eyed Betty's on 8/10/19. Clear copper to brown pour with a medium beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel and roast. Sweet malt and caramel flavor with some roast before a dry finish.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: 12 oz bottle ordered at the Marriott in Livonia, Michigan. The pour is a slight haze copper orange with a thin light tan head. The aroma is caramel malt, apple fruit sweetness, and some honey. The taste is nutty malt, touch of floral, then moving towards softly sweet caramel in the back. The palate is medium bodied with lower carbonation and a clean nutty softly sweet mineral finish. Well constructed.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear copper with a creamy white head. Soft grains and honey. Medium body and medium carbonation.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: I'm not sure why this has such a poor rating. I thought it was a pretty good, mild, malty ale. A little caramel, a little nutty. Light and easy drinking. Tried with Nick at the brewery in 2018.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: A lightly hazed amber ale with a thin white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with grassy hops, light mineral notes, nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with grassy floral hops, light mineral notes, OK. On tap at brewery.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: On tap at the brewpub. Nutty medium bodied flavor with a clean quenching mouthfeel and a clean finish. Tastes more like a bock than a mild.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: Where Purchased: 347ml bottle from the brewery Consumed: from a pilsner glass Aroma: Smells faintly of malts. Appearance : medium amber with lots of head that last almost to the last drop. Good lacing. Taste: Malty and sweet with a hint of bitterness. Palate : light to medium body. Slight bitter aftertaste. Great carbonation (lots for an Ale). Overall: It was laking flavour just a tad. Kind of what I expected from a beer with 3.8% ABV. I must say it is the most full flavoured light beer I have ever had. Easy drinking Quality brew. I was glad to try and maybe buy again. MB. The Beer "Bear"on.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: Tap at brewery in Detroit during glbtq. Amber color with white head. Malty nose. Bitter, toasted grain. Finish is fast, weak, and unimpressive. Not great.

name: Motor City Ghettoblaster
review: Bottled. Pours Amber with a white head. Lots of caramel and malt In the aroma. Carbonation is quite high for the style. Bit of a watery aftertaste.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Draft sample at the source. Clear copper with a white head. Earthy and caramelly taste. Medium body and medium carbonation. A good nutty character.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Where Purchased: 347ml bottle from the brewery Consumed: from a pilsner glass Aroma: Smells malty and nutty. Appearance : dark brown with lots a thin layer of head that lasts to the last drop. Excellent lacing. Taste: Malty, toasty and nutty with a hint of chocolate. No hops to be found Palate : medium to heavy body. Decent carbonation. Mild sweet aftertaste. Overall: Good easy drinking beer that is in despite of it being a heavy and somewhat complex beer. Similar to 8th Sin, but no hops and not as dense. I was glad to try and would buy again. MB. The Beer "Bear"on.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Reviewed from notes. Thanks Mike. Poured into a becher pint glass, the appearance was a soft burnt amber almost brown color with a finger’s worth of white foamy head that fell off at a decent pace. Mild stringy lace. The aroma had some sweet to roasty nuts with a gentle clean maltiness of some caramel to toffee tones. Light earthiness, some grassiness. Little bit of some piney-ness. The flavor kept the roasty nuts up front and blended the sweet and earthy portions to the ebb and flow of the tastes rolling along my tongue. Not much of an aftertaste. Nice piney/earthy and nutty clean smooth sweet finish. The feel was about medium bodied with a good sessionability about it. Carbonation felt fine and the ABV felt as projected by the brewer. Overall, really nice brown ale well worthy of wanting again.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Bottle... Pours beautifully clear and brown with flashes of mahogany. The aroma features roasted tree nuts with an undertone of cocoa. Light-bodied and thin with adequate carbonation. The flavor is toasty and chocolaty, but also watery and thin. Lengthy, crisp, lightly bitter finish. Bottle courtesy of my father-in-law, Max, from Michigan!

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: On tap, poured into a snifger. The aroma is grape jelly and toast that mellows towards a praline aroma. The beer is dark and oily looking with a cola color, and is topped by a light tan head that’s dense, but thin and soap with a filmy surface that has a light retention and specks of lace. The beer is a medium sweet and light bitter. It’s water thin and smooth with a fizzy carbonation and a light body. Flavors of dry molasses and nuts and dominant on the palate with a finish that’s spicy with toast and alight coffee flavor. The dry aftertaste is clean with notes of spice and toast.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 11/19/2014. Pours slightly hazy deep reddish brown color with a 1 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, brown bread, nuttiness, herbal, light fruitiness, and yeast/roasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, brown bread, nuttiness, herbal, light fruitiness, and yeast/roasted earthiness. Fair amount of herbal/roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, brown bread, nuttiness, herbal, light fruitiness, and yeast/roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice complexity, balance, and solid robustness of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/yeast ester flavors; with a good roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp, and lightly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a very good English brown ale style. All around good complexity, balance, and solid robustness of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop/yeast ester flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A nicely enjoyable offering.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Tap. Dark ruby color. Really nice, thick white head. Very mild nose. Pretty sweet -- notes of pecan in particular. Way too thin for what it is.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: 12oz bottle from Steve a little bit on the thin side could use more mouthfell and some stonger malt backbone

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: More black than anything. Almost opaque. Aroma is a bit metallic. Flavor is dirty like the ghettoblaster. Light body. Miss.

name: Motor City Nut Brown Ale
review: Pour on tap at the brewery, dark brownish pour with off tan head, aroma brought notes of nuts, roast, ash, caramel, toffee, some very slight hints of cocoa. Taste is a mix of roast, coffee, over done coffee beans into some hints of toffee, cocoa, touch of spicy yeast, finishing roasted, ashy, dry.

name: Motor City Honey Porter
review: Draft sample at the source. Dark brown with a khaki head of foam. Sweet and roasty caramel aroma. Weird sweet taste. Medium body and medium carbonation.

name: Motor City Honey Porter
review: A dark brown porter with a thin brown head. In aroma, sweet chocolate malt with grassy floral hops, light mineral notes, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet chocolate malt with light powdery character, light mineral notes, nice. On tap at brewery.

name: Motor City Honey Porter
review: Where Purchased: 347ml bottle from the brewery Consumed: from a pilsner glass Aroma: Smells malty and sweet. Appearance : medium to dark brown with thin head that disappears immediately. Next to no lacing. Taste: Malty and sweet. The hops are kept in check by all the maltyness. I would say the IBU to be somewhere around 10. Palate : medium to heavy body. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Low carbonation. Overall: Flavorful, but not offensive. Heavy, but not too heavy. I was glad to try and would buy again. MB. The Beer "Bear"on.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: From old tasting notes. Deep gold color. Lots of bubbles lead to a creamy white head. Assertive citrus malt aroma. Bittersweet malt flavor. Intense fruity, winey flavor. Little hop flavor to speak of. Big alcohol note.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: Originally rated on 11/1/07. I used to drink this in the army because of the price. A case of this was comparable to bud so.. If you are looking for a cheap buzz this will do the trick. Like most malt liquors it wont impress any beer snobs, smells and tastes a little funky but its not as bad as some.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: 40 oz to pint (from notes). Exactly the nasty horse piss you’d expect it to be. Simply unpleasant in every way (although not as bad as Camo or some others out there).

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: Use to drink this religiously when I was younger, it was a hit and miss perhaps some stores didn’t have good cooling system. This beer is not good it will get u somewhere, but one will wake up smelling like pure bar or sometimes even worst. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: Big-ass can. Man, I think next time I’ll save myself the trouble and just cut my tongue out from my mouth with a rusty razorblade. Copper corn, rotten yeast, and stupid are all one gets from this crap.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: I thought this was going to be pretty decent since famous people drink it (i.e. snoop dogg and dr dre), I was wrong, it is terrible, tastes like beer that was fermented in an old gym shoe.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: My first 40 at age 12 back in 1991. This had only been around for a couple years back then but we knew all about it from Ice Cube and NWA. Very strong back then it was 7.3% when it was Ides Premium. Now its Ides High Gravity and it comes in at 8.2%. Still tastes the same but the original has the edge just because of its historic value to me. I am glad I was able to pick up an empty Ides Premium 40 for my collection a couple years ago. Also the St. Ides buzz is very violent. Its unlike any other buzz I have ever gotten from a 40. Be very carful as drinking 2 or more 40s of Ides will produce the worst hangover ever.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: the fact is for $1.89 in 1994-1998 , this was the best thing u could buy, wasn’t really that much worse than bud, best of the 40’s in my opinion. But the most important thing about this beer is that even a dorky indian doofus can feel like Ice Cube(the gangster one, not the barber shop one)!

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: As far as cheap malt liquors for college kids to get drunk off of I suppose it’s not completely horrible. Better than Colt 45, King Cobra or Old English for what it’s worth. Still, c’mon, this is nasty stuff.

name: St. Ides Premium Malt Liquor
review: So after I tried the St Ides special brew, I took a leak and out came the st ide premium. Geez this sucks.

name: Kirner Pils
review: On tap at Hotel Burg Stahleck Café in Bacharach, Germany. Clear medium gold pour. Large foamy white head. Mild grainy malt aroma. Notes of grass and hay. A hint of hop bitterness in middle. Crisp dry finish. Tasted great in the hot sun under the umbrella of the Café. Rated on 8/12/19.

name: Kirner Pils
review: Zuur en metalig. Alle versies van Kirner hebben dat. En rond Kirn vaak op de tap, jammergenoeg.

name: Kirner Pils
review: Draught at Restaurant Corazon, St. Goar, Rhineland, Germany. Gold with fizzed white head. There is a smoother cereal, grainy, malty character to this, slightly grassy and a touch sweet. Late fruitiness. It's fine.

name: Kirner Pils
review: 0,5 l bottle from Erzengel. Thanks a lot! Clear golden in the glass with a nearly three finger white head. Musty grassy smell. Taste is more grainy with caramell, some malt in the second row. Mid bitter hop in the middle part. Grainy pale malt aftertaste with a pleasant bitterness. Okay.

name: Kirner Pils
review: Bottle in Germay. A bit sweet, grass and toasted malts, drinkable, ok brew..

name: Kirner Pils
review: Wygl¹da bardzo fajnie, obfita piana bardzo d³ugo utrzymuj¹ca siê. Za mocno wysycone. Czuæ chmiel w aromacie, w smaku jest goryczka. Solidny pils

name: Kirner Pils
review: Flasche 33cl. Sauberes knackiges Pils mit erkennbar schöner Aromahopfennote. Ehrliches und ambitioniertes Bier, das sich wohltuend vom Massenmarkt abhebt.

name: Kirner Pils
review: [backlog] several on tap at Bruchwegstadion Mainz. Good old times. Bad stadion beer from a plastic cup. Typical pilsener taste, grainy malty, light bitter.

name: Kirner Pils
review: I give the full rates because I tasted a lot of beers in the world and this Pils is the most tasty one, very refreshing, lightly bitter and it never gae me a headache even I drunk more than 10 bottles.

name: Kirner Pils
review: Draught @ some pub in Cochum while on holiday. Typical pilsener: clear yellow golden color, decent sized white head, aroma and flavor have some malts and hay or straw in it with a decent enough (for a pils) bitterness. Nothing too spectacular, but in the warm sun it tasted fine.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: 8th July 2019, 500ml in a tall glass while sat opposite Cochem Castle. Hazy golden orange body, wispy head. Mild fruity aroma and taste, liked it.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Frisch gezapft. Klar und dunkelgolden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Etwas getreidig, bisschen Malz. Milder, süßlicher Geschmack.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Bottled, 500ml at Restaurant Carazon, St. Goar, Rhineland, Germany. Hazy yellow gold with thin head. Sweet, fruity, malty beer, cereals, grainy with a metallic edge. Carbonated but moving to quite dull when the fizz has gone. Just okay.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: [backlog] 23-09-15 // bottle at Porterhouse Mainz. Light hazy dark golden colour. Sweet malty, grains. Medium body.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: 50cl bottle. Hazy pale golden yellow colour with a small white head. Grainy and fruity aroma. Average carbonation and light body. Taste is sweet with some bitterness towards the finish. Overall, drinkable.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Bottle 500ml. Courtesy of Uli. Hazy yellow color, mostly vanishing white head. Aroma has fruityness and grainy notes. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Sweetish malty, grassy and grainy in a good eay. Basic unfiltered "landbier".

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Leicht trübe dunkel goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, floral hopfig, leicht nussig. Geschmack sehr hopfig, würzig, floral, kräftig malzig.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Hazyy pale yellow in the glass. Starts malty sweet, slightly bitterness, increases later.

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: 50cl from Rewe in Mainz. Nice slightly cloudy amber beer with a nice white head. The nose is a bit grainy, The beer starts sharp, a bit metallic. The mainpart is fullbodied, slightliy smooth due to the yeast. Still a bit metallic and sharp. Grainy. The aftertaste is long, grainy, smooth but unround somehow. --> 7/10/7/7

name: Kirner Landbier Hell
review: Thanks to erzengel. Pours a clear gold color with a small head. The nose is sweet and grainy. The taste is in line with the aroma. Light body with a soft feel...lightly carbonated.

name: Newport Beach Poohs Reserve Honey Ale
review: Great taste and aroma. I am really impressed. It's hard to find but worth it.

name: Newport Beach Bisbees ESB
review: Clear light Amber pour. Earthy hop aroma somewhat bitter. Dry clean finish and malty light.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Not a huge fan of this steamy beer, on tap at the brewery in newport, full bodied to say the least.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Pours a clear golden orange with a white head. Nose opens with bread and toasted malt. There’s a light grass note and a bit of floral hop character. A mild yeast and maybe some apple. The flavor is a bit sweet, definitely grainy, and some bread and toast. There is a mild yeastiness and a light bitterness. Floral hops, grass, and a hint of caramel.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours copper with white head. Very easy drinking. Smooth finish. One of the better beers on my visit.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Clear amber color/ white head. Mild salty black pepper, dry spicy aromas. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Bready grainy pale malt flavors with spicy hops. nice crisp, bitter finish.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Draft at the brewpub. Copper pour with a clingy white head. Light malty, bready aroma. Flavor had a slight bitterness, but finished quite smooth, pretty good.

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: Cloudy apricot, small lingering head. Bread, straw, malt and peat aroma. Rich yet a bit bitter in flavor, with slight citrus, spice and hoppy bitterness. Not as smooth as Anchor Steam, but a tasty beer with a bitter and dry finish. On tap at brewery minutes ago!

name: Newport Beach Coast Steam
review: I had this beer on draft at NBBC. I found it to basically be a study in mediocrity. Nothing really about this beer jumps out at you. Nothing was bad, nothing was good. a thirst quencher. it was a bit overcarbonated on the tongue.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: Draft at the Brewery The ale poured a nice deep brown color with a small beige head. You are greeted with roasted caramel malts. This was another easy drinking beer. The ale had a light body with soft carbonation. The finish ended with sweetness on your tongue.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: A: Not a very pretty beer to look at. Quite turbid, brown in color, with almost no head. S: Looks bad, but smells good. Lots of chocolate, particularly dark chocolate, with a solid nuttiness. Plenty of maltiness in the form of toffee and bread. A simple, straightforward, brown ale so far. T: Flavor is good as well. Plenty of the same chocolate character with a more pronounced roastiness. Toasted bread and nuts along with sweet toffee. A nice caramel note and some mild earthiness. M: Medium in body with a moderate carbonation. O: Was pleasantly surprised by this beer. A pretty decent brown ale all around.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: On nitro at the brewpub. Dark brown, with a little red tinge to it, had a real nice creamy off-white head from the nitro. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, some dark fruits, sweet malt, this was very tasty.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: On tap at NBBC. Nitro; poured reddish/orange brown. Nice looking. Aroma of earth, cocoa and "brown" malt. Flavor of caramel, chocolate with a light coffee presence. Also hints of earth and butter. Thought this was a pretty good version of the style.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: I had this on tap at Newport Beach Brewing Nice brown pour with red highlights. Nice roastiness with good malts.

name: Newport Beach Balboa Brown Ale
review: Brown color (no shit huh?) with a decent sized tan head. Low carbonation with a high amount of maltiness and tastes of roasted malt. Didn't have any hop bite nor bitterness.

name: Newport Beach Duke Dark
review: This dark beer is heavy on malts, and light on coffee flavor. It is very drinkable, but a tad watered down in my opinion.

name: Park Pils
review: blassgelb mit weißem Schaum. Geruch malzig, herb. Geschmack ist malzig, leicht süß, würzig, herb, moderat bitter und eine leicht buttrige Note, wie bei einem böhmischen Pils. Gut

name: Park Pils
review: 16-07-18 // 500ml bottle from Globus Neustadt. Clear golden. Small white head. Grains, a little dusty malty. Old hop bitter.

name: Park Pils
review: 0,5 l bottle from Erzengel. Thanks a lot! Pours out clear golden with a two finger foamy white head. Sweet grassy smell. Taste starts with a hop bitterness, some metallic elements. Less malt. Low carbonated. Also metallic elements in the aftertaste. Little bit boring.

name: Park Pils
review: From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.

name: Park Pils
review: Park Pils one of the best beers that I tasted in my 10 years in Germany. I would rate BirBirger as #two(2)and than the beers of Munchen.hay, herbs, leaves, golden, clear, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation,

name: Park Pils
review: medium body, creamy, lively, long finish, Best beer I ever tasted. Drank it from Spring 1966 to Spring 1967. Never found anything that was comparable.

name: Park Pils
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy straw gold color.mcreamy white head. Unappealing cardboard malt aroma. Dryish malt flavor has a bitter hop backdrop. Brief dry finish.

name: Park Pils
review: 33cl bottle. Klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig hell malzig, würziger Hopfen. Geschmack würzig hopfig, getreidig, leicht metallisch, lange Bitterkeit.

name: Park Pils
review: 15 dec 2015, bottle. Yellow, clear, steady bubbles. Nose is skunky lager hops. Thin body and moderately fizzy. Lemon rind, straw malt, faintly bitter. Nice enough for a pils.

name: Park Pils
review: Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo o zniklej i niewielkiej piance. aromat slaby, typowy. Smak odrzucajacy, syropowy, kukurydziano grysi, kasza jeczmienna. Wyczuwalny smak ekstraaktu chmielowego. Niezbyt pijalne i nieprzyjemny pils.

name: Park Export
review: Clear golden with a decent white head. Fruity aroma. Taste is grainy sweet with a mild bitterness. Drinkable

name: Park Export
review: Das beste Bier der Welt. Das ist die Referenz. Quasi das Urmeter des Bieres. Ihr könnt das auf dem hinteren Etikett nachlesen. Park Export hilft sogar gegen Heimweh. Stimmt! Wenn ihr wirklich Ehrliche Biertriker, keine Pilsköpfe seid kommt ihr daran nicht vorbei. Wer geht zu McDonald's? Klar niemand, aber die machen riesige Umsätze. Genauso ist das mit dem Export Bier, als Maurer- oder Pennerbier verschrien, so ein Quatsch. Export ist besser als sein Ruf. Auf den Oktoberfest trinkt auch keiner Pils.

name: Park Export
review: 06-08-18 // 330ml bottle. Clear golden. Grains in the nose. Sweetish grainy. Old grain taste, typical for an export.

name: Park Export
review: 0,5 l bottle from Erzengel. Thanks a lot! Clear golden, small head. Low grassy metallic smell. Taste is dry malty grassy, some grain and metallic bitterness. Not really quaffable.

name: Park Export
review: One of my favourites and my uncle's favourite. Their Pils is even better!

name: Park Export
review: 50cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of grainy malt, mild sweet malt, some hops. Taste of dry grainy malt, medium sweet malt, cereals, boring!

name: Park Export
review: Pours two fingers of head on a clear straw body. The aroma is mild grain. The taste is fairly bitter, lemon and a little metallic. The texture is crisp and fizzy.

name: Park Export
review: Optisch ok vielleicht ein bißchen blaß, im Geruch leicht würzig, Geschmack nicht sehr vielschichtig und irgendwie nicht nach gutem Hopfen

name: Park Export
review: Pours a golden color with a decent head. Aroma of citrus, some malt sweetness and bit of fruit. Taste of citrus and malt sweetness wi th a trace of fruit and grass. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Fairly light body, smooth with a nice feel. Not a fancy beer, but quite enjoyable.

name: Park Export
review: Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks simple but okay. Beer in the glass deep golden, nice head. Starts malty, dry, a bit artificially dry. More and more moldy-malty. Finish unbalanced. Not my favourite.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: 50cl bottle. Pours hazy dark golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of yest, clove and some banana. Taste of yeast, some dry fruits and a bit clove, nothing special.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: (Park Weizen Hefe) Bottle 500ml at home from a trade with Beerhunter111, thanks! Served into a weizen glass. ABV 5.2 Orange colour on the body, hazy, with a tall and thick snow white head on top, average retention. The usual hefeweizen aroma with wheat, ripe pears and light clove. Taste has wheat, clove, banana, ripe pears, a hint of bubblegum on the finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Good.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: 500 ml bottle. BB 18/04/14. Vielen Dank an Erzengel! Cloudy golden colour with a huge foamy white head. Sweet caramel malt, wheat, mild yeast and mild banana in the aroma. The flavour is wheat, bitterish yeast and some dry malt. Soft carbonation. Mediocre.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts mild, malty-yeasty, modest sourish. Fruity notes of apricot. Finish drier, less fruity. Not bad!

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Muffiger, hell hefiger Antrunk. Mild, fast laff, die Hefigkeit bleibt konstant, das Bier wird aber trocken und wenig bananig. Wässriger Abgang. 7/8/7/6/7/6

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Die Parkbrauerei braut zwei verschiedene helle Weißbiere. Neben diesem noch das Valentins Weißbier. Die Farbe ist orange-trüb mit fruchtig-bananigem Geruch. Im Antrunk ist das Bier vollmundig und schön süffig, jedoch kommt schon nach kurzer Zeit eine muffige Herbe, ganz ähnlich wie bei den Valentis Weißbieren, ins Spiel. Im Hauptteil ist das Bier aber für meinen Geschmack runder und mild-süßlicher. Die muffige Herbe ist bei wietem nicht so stark ausgeprägt. Der Nachgeschmack ist leicht, schon fast etwas wässrig und ganz leicht muffig-herb, wobei dieses durch die mild-hefige Süße schon wieder kompensiert wird. Auf der Zungebleibt eine mild-hefig-süße Note, die aber schnell wieder verfliegt. --> Leckeres, aber etwas aromenarmes Weißbier! (Test vom 22.2.2009) --> 12,10,12,9,12,10 - 10,45

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Being wowed even more by Park’s weizens (see previous review of Valentins). Heavy, creamy mouthfeel, huge pillowy head. Hazy golden color, aroma and taste hit all the right notes. A new favorite for me.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Pale head. Hazy yellow colour. Mild slightly bananey nose. Soft bananey and hoppy taste. Not very sweet.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Draught at Parkplatz in Pirmasens (Ausshank) Cloudy blond color; compact head. The aroma is mild, with banana and light spices. The mouthfeel is balanced; there is some wheat, spices and banana flavor, light residual sweetness and correct bitterness. It’s a fair Hefeweizen.

name: Park Weizen Hefe
review: Wow a great and hide Hefe. This stuff was very nice and will be one of my favorites.

name: Park Weizen Radler
review: Thanks to Erzengel for that one! Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, huge head. Starts mild, fruity notes of lemon, modest sweet and yeasty. More and more moldy. Okay, but nothing special.

name: Park Weizen Radler
review: Schöne hell-trübe Farbe mit sehr zitronig-limonadigem Geruch. Der Antrunk ist sehr limonadig-süß mit angenehmem Weißbier-Geschmack. Die für Park-Weißbiere typische muffige Herbe wird durch die süße Limonade gut überdeckt. Der Hauptteil ist erst sehr angenehm limonadig-süß in Kombination mit einer schönen Weißbiennote, fälltdann aber sehr schnell dank des Süßstoffs in die chemisch-fade Ecke ab! Der Nachgeschmack ist zwar noch schön mild-hefig und frisch-zitronig, aber die chemische Süßstoffnote ist durch den faden Geschmack allgegenwärtig. --> Wäre kein Süßstoff drin, wäre es richtig klasse!! (Test vom 22.2.2009) --> 12,10,12,7,12,9 - 9,75

name: Park Weizen Radler
review: Clear yellow with a white head. Light lemon aroma. Light body with discreetly sweet lemon accents and a dry finish

name: Park Weizen Radler
review: Bottle. Lemon juice and banana/clove/wheat malt flavor. Cloudy pale yellow color with moderate head. Lemonade and banana/clove wheat malt flavorl. Moderate carbonation. Nice refreshing drink that has some beer flavor.

name: Park Leicht
review: 50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of graina malt, a bit sweet and hints of metallic hops. Taste of grainy malt, crisp, medium metallic hops, boring!

name: Park Leicht
review: Die Farbe des «Leicht» scheint einen Tick dunkler zu sein als die des „normalen“ Pils. Der Geruch ist neutral und leicht muffig. Der Antrunk ist wässrig. Keinerlei frische Hopfenblumigkeit o.ä. zu spüren. Der Hauptteil bleibt erschreckend flach, eine leichte muffige Herbe gesellt sich zum Wasser, auch eine Süße ist kaum auszumachen. Der Nachgeschmack ist außer muffig-herb hauptsächlich wässrig. Es fehlen einfach andere Aromen!  Katastrophal wässriges Leichtbier. --> 40% weniger Kalorien und Alkohol als das «Park Pils», aber auch 95% weniger Geschmack! Da gibt es aber wesentlich bessere Light-Biere!! (Test vom 19.2.2009) --> 12,2,12,3,12,2 - 5,15

name: Park Leicht
review: Beer flavored water. Period. Slight lemony aroma, pours with weak head. Taste is not bad, but non-existant. I’ve had better non-alcoholic beers.

name: Park Leicht
review: Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and very watery.

name: Park Leicht
review: Pours a nice light golden yellow. Aromas of hops, grass, and maybe malt. Taste is crisp with a nice mellow hop flavor. This is one of the better low-alcohol beers on the market.

name: Park Radler
review: 31-12-18 // 500ml bottle shared. Pretty boring Radler, not much of an beer aroma, lemonade isnt pleasant aswell.

name: Park Radler
review: 33cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden/yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of citrus lemonade, sugar, no beer. Taste is the same, meh...

name: Park Radler
review: Pale yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of lemon and sweets. A flavor of lemon, butter and sweets.

name: Park Radler
review: Thanks to Erzengel for that small bottle. Looks simple but okay. Beer in the glass light, zippy, nice head. Starts mild, modest fruity, hints of lemon. Finish less fruity, modest sweet. Okay.

name: Park Radler
review: 0,33l bottle, BB 19.07.14, N3 Very pale in the glass, artificial fruity in the nose. The beers starts very lemonade-sweet. The mainpart seems full-bodied, but more lemonade than beer. The aftertaste ends abrupt. The artificial sweetener does its work - and as there is nearly no beer as basis, the aroma is gone within seconds. An artificial lemon-taste with some hops and grain remain on the tongue. --> there are many way better Radler! --> 7/10/7/7

name: Park Radler
review: Decent radler, not much aroma to speak of, appearance is about normal for a radler, flavor is good, but uses a limon soda, rather than real lemonade. This is how it is usually mixed at the bar, so this is about as expected.

name: Park Radler
review: Clear yellow color. Smell fruits and lemon. Tastes the same. Little bit fizzy carbo and low body.

name: Park Radler
review: Bottle, courtesy of fonefan. A clear, pale golden beer with a dense off-white head. Rather lemony dishwashing soap reminiscent aroma. Not bad, just not my cup of tea. The flavor is quite sweet, with a lemony sourness. Thin on the palate. Short finish with some bitterness. A radler I won’t have again, not bad, far from good. 110130

name: Park Radler
review: Bottle 500ml. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate citrus, sweet citrus, lemon. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light citrus acidic with a average duration, fresh. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20110130]

name: Park Radler
review: Bottle 500ml @ fonefan Pours clear very pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of lime and lemon. Taste is light sweet and sour. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: Not a whole lot going on here. A craft version of the classic macro. No cord, and with hops you can actualy taste. Touch of grapes and honey. That’s about it. Not really brewed for the beer geek crowd, so take that into consideration with this review. OB makes some damn tasty beers, this just isn’t really their moment in the sun, but probably accomplishes exactly what they want it to.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: On tap under a different name. Pours a clear golden color with big fluffy head that laced. Classic lager aroma of malt and a bit of hops in the back. Nice dry bitter flavor balanced by a slight sweetness that did not last into the aftertaste. Lively carb, med to full body, wet refreshing texture and feel. Classic lager, simple and refeshing which is what I look for in this style. The beer you want to drink when just want a "beer".

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: his is a pretty nice lager. It smells kind of sour, like draft beer lines that haven’t been cleaned well but it tastes just fine. It’s fairly crisp and light.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: Too sweet and too thin. I found it suspiciously cloudy. This brewer was once the last best hope of hopheads on the great Southside (of Indianapolis), but has sacrificed quality for quantity in recent years.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: A medium sized white head with fine sized bubbles.The body was carbonated and slightly hazy.The hue of this beer was a pale yellow and it left only a fair amount of lacing on the sides of my glass.The nose was malty and somewhat fruity.The flavor was bitter, sweet and it left an aftertaste that lingered.The mouthfeel was smooth and thin.This beer lacks character as nothing really stood out with this beer.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: This brew poured a medium head of fine to medium sized mostly lasting white bubbles that left very little lacing and a hazy straw yellow body behind. Its aroma is one of malt and banana or fruit. The mouthfeel is initially smooth then bitters in its finish. The flavor is a mixture of fruit and malt with a beady or doughy nature to it.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: Had it on tap at the brewpub. Defective, strong diacetyl and slight DMS. A poorly made lager that I couldn't finish. The porter black bean soup, OTOH, absolutely rocked.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: On tap. Zippy pils. Almost a little salty. Long saaz finish. Good palate. Woody gold. Cool winged Victory logo.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: Out of the bottle this beer was clean and light, with a nice flavor for a lager. I prefer a heavier beer, but on a hot day, this will hit the spot.

name: Oaken Barrel Meridian Street Lager
review: This is a pretty nice lager. It smells kind of sour, like draft beer lines that haven't been cleaned well but it tastes just fine. It's fairly crisp and light.

name: Oaken Barrel Leroy Brown
review: Draft: Re-issue at brewpub...5.2% Clear, deep amber-brown with a small beige head. Honey, nut, caramel aroma. Taste is sweet and rich, caramel, chocolate malt, roasted nuts, honey.... Smooth....sweet... An awesome brown ale.

name: Oaken Barrel Leroy Brown
review: Proper medium brown color, translucent. The head was well-retained, which is not always the case at this brewpub. The aroma is rather similar to light toast. The taste is a bit light as is the mouthfeel.

name: Oaken Barrel Pale Ale
review: Light golden pour. Good citrus hops on the aroma follwed by some nice malt. Flavor is a nice combo of caramel malt and very good hops. This is pretty damn nice for an APA.

name: Oaken Barrel Pale Ale
review: Very refreshing, moderate fruity hop aroma, decent malt balance..........

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Fles 50cl thuis. Lekkere, bittere pils. (12-2011).------------------------.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Has a bright, golden color with a froth, white head. Smells of a gentle interplay between grains, hay and herbal hops. This foundation gets joined by a sweet caramel peak, producing a nose, which still relies heavily on the hops. Has a light, refreshing body, to to a well working balance with a lively, metallic carbonation. Tastes way maltier and heavier on the grains than the nose indicated. Establishes a rustic malt foundation with a soothing aqueous quality, which evolves a late, herbal hop hint. Finishes clean and light, reminding of its opening with an additional mineralic note. Smells nicer than it tastes, since it tastes more like an industrial brewed beer, while it advertises to be a local heron. I don’t appreciate this very much, since, regarding the rather boring taste of this, that is solely a marketing strategy. Malts and water, not much else going on apart from that.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Bottle @ home. Clear golden color, medium sized white head. Smell and taste malts, hayish, nice malt grainy and medium malt bitter. Decent quite smooth body and texture, suitable moderate carbonation. Quite nice.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: 0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: malzig, süßlich, brotig, Honig. Erscheinung: Hellgelbes Bier, flacher, weißer Schaum, schöne Gardine. Geschmack: malzig süß, Honig, minimal säuerlich, leicht bitter. Nachgeschmack: leicht bitter, leicht süßlich. Gesamt: Lecker.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Gezapft in einer emsländischen Kneipe. Gelb-klar. Aroma hopfig. Geschmack leicht süßlich, ansonsten mild, kurzer Abgang

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Flasche (50 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin-Wedding. - Hellgelb, klar, reichlich lockerer Schaum. - Geruch dumpf und etwas streng, erinnert an benutzte Babywindeln. - Antrunk schlank mit kräftig zitroniger, aber etwas künstlicher Note, die eher an Geschirrspülmittel oder Zitronenbonbons als an Aromahopfen denken läßt. Malz ist nicht zu schmecken. Gut rezent, schlank. Im Abgang wechseln sich schroff zitronige und stumpf bittere Fehlaromen ab. Derber, metallisch herber Nachtrunk. - Ziemlich mieses Pilsener, bei dem allenthalben der billige Hopfenextrakt herausschmeckt, aber wohl auch sonst noch hier und da gespart wurde. Ein Fall für den Ausguß.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: (Rolinck Pilsener Premium) Bottle 500 ml at home, served into a footed pilsner glass, ABV 4.8% Deep golden yellow colourt on the body, with lazy activity in it. Two fingers of white, thick head, with good retention, leaving spots of lacing on the glass. On the aroma grass, straw, band aid. Taste also of dried straw, malts, old bread, light bitter aftertaste. Thin body, high on the carbonation. Not good.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: Schön herb, frisch-malzig, leicht würzig mit süßlichem Touch. Der Nachgeschmack ist feinherb, leicht süßlich, nett herb.

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: 0,5 l bottle. Good looking bottle art design. Clear golden in the glass, nice CO2 lively, midlasting fine white head. Grassy herb on the nose. Starts with a sourish hop herb. Flat middle part, metallic aftertaste. Average. (13. April 2012)

name: Rolinck Pilsener Premium
review: On tap @ cafe central, Rheine. Thick creamy white head. Clear golden pour. An ok pils.

name: Oaken Barrel Old No. 10 Barleywine
review: Draft at brewpub. Pours an orangish copper color with a thick slightly off white head Nice lacing. This was served in a shaker and was difficult to get an accurate aroma. Aroma was light with notes of malt, alcohol, and sweet fruits, possibly raspberries. Flavor is malty with a very nice hop bitterness. Notes of alcohol, chocolate, sweet dark fruits, with a dry bitter finish. The mouthfeel is lightly carbonated smooth on the tongue. Thin to medium mouthfeel. Very good.

name: Oaken Barrel Old No. 10 Barleywine
review: Clear dark amber body, small beige head. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, cherry. Taste is moderately sweet, cherry, some caramel, moderate alcohol in the finish. Full body.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: *Old rating, best before 04.08.10. Mild-weiches, nicht zu tiefes Bier. Schön süffig, malzig, leicht muffig, nett.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: 0,33 l bottle with a good looking simple label art. Clear golden in the glass, small head, low CO2. Low grainy in the nose. Strats more like a thinner Helles, later a little bit hop, little bit grain, nothing unusual. A typical nice Lager. (13. April 2012)

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Northern German ’Münchener’ helles from the town of Steinfurt (in a region where nearly every town has its own lager brewery). Dense, mousse-like, creamy, fairly thick, snow white head, colour a pure and cristal clear golden blonde with fine sparkling. Malty aroma with honeyish and a bit cheesy accent, some popcorn, floral hops reminiscent of sage and chamomille. Neutral onset with a sharp carbonation, then turning into a nearly sweetish graininess, mineral water, finishing only lightly and briefly hoppy without ever turning really bitter - one of the main features distinguishing a helles from a Pilsener in modern-day German lagers, I guess. But decent, refreshing and thirst-quenching it certainly is.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Recht sueffig und mild ein wenig an Butter und Vanille. Dazu leicht im Getreide mit milder Hopfung. Eigentlich ganz nett.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Pours out of the bottle in a clear light golden colour with low head and thin body. Aroma of mild hops and straw. Taste of mild hops, straw, grass, basement and dust. Mild finish. Drinkable.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Keine Hopfennote. Ansonsten süßlicher Geruch. Beim Trinken sehr malzig, ansonsten wenig ester. Mein erstes Bier damals. ;-)

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Malty nose with a little sulphur.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: 33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and straw. Bitter, grassy and light cornish. Bitter and toasted malty. Bitter and grassy finish.

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Bottle. Clear gold with a solid white head. Aroma is fresh grass. Flavour is sweet with a light bitter palate. Light texture

name: Alex Rolinck Feines Lagerbier
review: Golden and clear. Nice stable head. Pleasent Aroma: Mint, grass, herbs. Not bitter enough for a lager, emphasize is on malt. Sweet aftertaste.

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangegoldenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, leicht fruchtig, Geschmack malzig fruchtig, getreidig.

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: a) Malzig-muffig, leicht herb im Abgang, dabei auch etwas süßlich. Langer muffiger Nachgeschmack --> interessant! Test vom 31.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,8,11,8,13,9 - 9,50 b) Schöne dunkle Bernsteinfarbe mir weißem Schaum. Der Geruch ist leicht süßlich-frisch und etwas würzig. Im Antrunk ist das Bier angenehm würzig-frisch mit einer leicht herben Note, die zum Hauptteil hin stärker wird. Der Hauptteil ist von malziger Würzigkeit geprägt, wohin die angenehm feinherbe Note sich gut eingliedert. Insgesamt aber erwas flach-wässrig gehalten. Der Nachgeschmack ist malzig-würzig-herb und lang anhaltend --> Ein leckeres Bier, aber für meinen Geschmack nichts Herausragendes! 10+11+8+9

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: #695 "Traditionell gebrautes, mildwürziges Bier" steht auf der Rückseite und das ist es auch. Es plätschert ziemlich uninspiriert die Kehle herunter. Der Geschmack ist wie die Farbe dieses Bieres: Ein Zwitter. Die Farbe ist zu dunkel für ein Export und zu hell für ein Alt. Dunkles Bernstein trifft es einigermaßen. Geschmacklich kein Export, da es etwas nach Röstmalz schmeckt; aber auch kein Alt, weil der Abgang einfach ohne diesen typisch bitteren Nachzieher auskommen muß. Kurzum: Ein Bier, dass es so in Westfalen kein zweites mal gibt...und auch keiner vermissen wird! Rolinck, bleib bei deinen Leisten und macht lieber euer lecker Pilsken über die Region hinaus bekannt! Test vom 3.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,9,9,9,10,9 - 9,05

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Der Friedensreiter auf dem Etikett macht auf mich eher den Eindruck eines Postillions. Und er überbringt keine guten Nachrichten. Das Aroma kann außer einer leichten Röstnote nicht viel vorweisen. Der Antrunk ist wenigstens noch nichtssagend. Die Mitte eine Katastrophe: Ein stechend-bitterer Geschmack verleidet den Genuß. Vom Nachgeschmack meldet sich ein Fünckchen Herbe. Das Rolinck Friedensreiter Bräu ist ziemlich mies. Durchgefallen!Test vom 2.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Prickelnder und milder Malzantrunk, herb. Herber werdend, das Malz wird etwas kräftiger und festigt seine Position. Zum Ende etwas säuerlich und bitter, hintergründig weiter malzig, angenehm. Nett. Test vom 17.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,8,9,9,11,9 - 8,85

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Bottle 33cl. w. swing top. Clear medium to light dark yellow orange color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, hay, toasted, sugar notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090404]

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Bottle, 4.8%. Clear orange colour. Smallw white head. The flavour is OK malty, a little grain. Rather high carbonation, but good mouthfeel.

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: 33cl fliptop bottle: poured light amber with a medium white head. Moderate iced tea aroma with a touch of hops. Flavor is kind of chemical and borderline nasty. Light malts and hops, light bitterness, but that chemical taste really got to me. Horrible.

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: Draught: Poured a orange to light brown with off white head. Aroma is harsh bitter hops. Taste is malty with almost a bubblegum flavor in there, finish is just hopped enough to be balanced.

name: Rolinck Bernstein (Friedensreiter Bräu)
review: 33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a huge, off-white head. Mild dry malt aroma with a light note of hops. Flavour is vague malt with a dry bitterhops on top. Goes gradually more dry and bitter towards the finish. I lack some maltbase to counter balance the hops.

name: Oaken Barrel Maibock
review: Draft at brewpub. Poured clear copper color with an average fizzy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate complex roasted sweet malty aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate balanced malty sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

name: Oaken Barrel Maibock
review: Small, non-existant head. Copper colored throughout. You can almost catch a whiff of clove in smell but not in taste. The palette has a small alcohol tingle and a fair amount of flowery after taste. It seems to somehow miss the front of your mouth and slip directly down the back of the throat.

name: Oaken Barrel Maibock
review: Small, non-existant head. Copper colored throughout. You can almost catch a whiff of clove in smell but not in taste. The palette has a small alcohol tingle and a fair amount of flowery after taste. It seems to somehow miss the front of your mouth and slip directly down the back of the throat.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Backlog entry. Well balanced and generally as expected. Nothing too outstanding.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Draft @ brewery. Orange-banana, wheat malt, and light clove aroma. Cloudy straw gold with a small white head. Citrus, banana, wheat malt, and clove flavor. Medium body, soft carbonation.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Draft. Orange, banana, clove, and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy pale yellow with moderate head. Sweet orange-lemon, clove and wheat malt flavor. Full bodied. A very well-made Hefeweizen.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Cloudy appearance and pale gold with a white head that is smooth and creamy. The head holds moderately leaving a low level of lace. The beer looks thick. Banana and clove in the aroma. Both are distinctive and arrive on in a different place as opposed to combining. The banana is stronger and one has to work a bit to get the clove, but it is not insignificant. The flavors are more balanced than the aroma. Clove and banana compete for attention with lemon playing a supporting role. Alcohol is present and adds to complexity and balance. There are even light hops accenting the lemon. This has good carbonation and is thick in body. An excellent example of the style and a true German from America.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Draft: Pours completely cloudy, murky yellow..almost no head. Aroma is banana, wheat, cloves, pepper. Same flavour,...tart and sweet, almost a little sticky. Very nice.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Small light head that dissipitated quickly & left a nice clean-looking lace. Served with a lemon wedge. Very mild wheat & lemon flavors (duh!) Just the right amount of carbonation for a light wheat. Served draft so no "beer pulp" from the bottle :( Not as good as a German wheat but still a nice beer. Not too sour. A murky uniform appearance that unfortunately didn’t have any yeast foaties (beer pulp.)

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Cloudy blonde weissbier served seasonally at the brewpub. Clovey aroma was about right. The head died as I sat watching. Taste is a bit tart for the style.

name: Oaken Barrel King Rudi
review: Small light head that dissipitated quickly & left a nice clean-looking lace. Served with a lemon wedge. Very mild wheat & lemon flavors (duh!) Just the right amount of carbonation for a light wheat. Served draft so no "beer pulp" from the bottle :( Not as good as a German wheat but still a nice beer. Not too sour. A murky uniform appearance that unfortunately didn't have any yeast foaties (beer pulp.)

name: Oaken Barrel Plum Stout
review: At the King’s, Leicester. Lovely deep red with very dense creamy head. Very strong aroma of plum and hints of roasted malt. Plumb flavour tastes a little disconnected from the rest of the ale. Very smooth to drink and finishes sweet. Overall worth a try, but not worth buying a full pint.

name: Greene King Abbot Ale (Filtered)
review: 2016 08 12 Butelka 0,5 l. Kolor piwa miedziany, herbaciany, trunek klarowny. Piana barwy brudnej bieli, obfita, z drobnych i œrednich pêcherzyków. W aromacie toffi, karmel, nuty opiekane, zio³owe. W smaku bardzo podobnie - karmel, toffi, skórka od chleba, nuty chmielowe - trawiaste, zio³owe i przyprawowe. Pe³nia œrednia, wysycenie œrednio niskie. Goryczka œrednio niska, krótka, zio³owa. przyjemny, zbalansowany i pijalny angielski bitter.

name: Greene King Abbot Ale (Filtered)
review: A number of cans at a beach house in West Sussex. Decent dark amber fruity malty ale with good balance & well hopped.

name: Greene King Abbot Ale (Filtered)
review: Beer with copper color, clear aspect, soft bitterness, flat carbonized, low volume of foam on top, (drunk a 50cl can beer with PG, bought at "Apolónia", Almancil, PT #1063)(#18 EN)(#3 Suffolk).

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: 12 oz. bottle from 2002. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Strong burnt malt, musty bready smell. Medium bodied, it has an airy, fluffy mouthfeel. Very strong flavor of roasted malts and black coffee. Has an acidic strong black coffee bitterness to finish. An unusual American stout in that it’s not sweet at all. Quite nice.Feb 2004

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Bottled. Very dark brown coloured. Chocolate aroma. Roasty flavour with notes of dark chocolate. Dry finish with hoppy notes. Soft mouthfeel.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Coffee, roasty, thin consistency. Very good color. A chocolate-y aftertaste.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Dark oily color with a nice tan film of head & lacing. The aroma is roasted with tar and mocha, lightly apparent hops; from the aging perhaps. Also some licorice, vanilla and fruity dust. The flavor has a good balance between astringent roast, residual sugars and hop bitterness. Finishes mild, robust and chocolatey. Good stout, too bad it’s not in production any more. Fucking Moosehead Brewing! Thanks a ton mitch!

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Brown with little head and oily lacing. Roast aromas with some bitter hops and coffee. Some chocolate and a touch of tobacco. The flavors are pretty much in line with the aromas. The chocolate comes out quite a bit more. Bitterness is milder. The roast is happy. Smooth and silky palate. Smooth finish of malts.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Mild stout. A little bitter, but not too much. Nutty flavour. Quite roasted.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: The aroma is fantastic with notes of chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. The color is black and it has a chocolate brown head though disappearing. The flavor is of roasted malt and dark bitter chocolate, in the end it turns to coffee and get a little acidic. A really good beer.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: I thought this was a little bit thin for a Stout. Not bad, but it won't rate at the top without a little more body and aroma. Drinkable and pleasant beer.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Moose Juice Stout, what a name! This stout pours like most; dark brown, settles solid black in the glass. A strong pour produced a finger high dark cocoa brown, foamy, uniformly bubbled head with a bit of a rocky top that faded slowly to a thin ring and some stringy patches of lace. Looks damn good. How's it smell? Wiff in....ahhh, nice sweet chocolate, sorta dark and chocolate milkish; cocoa, a bit of burntness of cookies, some coffee, and notes of hazelnuts. How's it taste? Sip, gulp....Oh well, the smell doesn't transfer as strong as I wanted; not nearly enough. Its quite quick and thin of chocolate and cocoa, slight roastyness and a faint light nudge of coffee with some burntness character attributed to the middle and a coffee-like dryness mixed with a solid little hop bite in the finish that lingers a bit. But its over far to fast. Although...this stout likes to change character quickly as it warms, it goes through a bit of transformation from thin to more of a bolder quality and finishing a bit stronger as well. But not enough to enhance the experience any. Feel is smooth and creamy and a bit thin of a lighter medium body that gains some momentum into the finish and a dot more as it warms. This stuff goes down very easy, its very drinkable! To bad it doesn't pack a bit more flavorful punch. But, as-for-mentioned, it gets a bit more noticeable subtleness to its flavors and feel as it warms. My suggestion is to let it breath a bit before diving in. A smidgen better at a warmer temp.

name: Grand Teton Moose Juice Stout
review: Dark, ok head, coffee and bakers chocolatey notes. Dry finish like a mouthful of cotton. Drinkable.

name: Grand Teton Old Faithful Ale
review: (14/08/19) 355ml can, Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming. Light golden with a white head. Malty, earthy aroma. Taste of malts and biscuits with floral and grassy notes. Mild bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. Pleasant but nothing special.

name: Grand Teton Old Faithful Ale
review: Got this from my super, he's a really cool dude. Can right from the good old yellowstone park. Slightly below room temp can. Pour is big foamy brew. I think I jiggled it a little on the way in. Slight haze on pale. Taste is quite ale like, of course, you know, all those negative attitudes about ale in general. Not too bad considering the temperature. Probably a little more like a wheat ale, if you ask me. Yes, not as behaved as Indigo Imp Blonde Bombshell, Rusty Rail Blue Collar, North Country Bucco Blonde or even Paladin Sir Kenneth. Compare it to a wheat ale like Terrapin SunRay, Tap Room No. 21 Moe's Backroom Wheat Beer, New Belgium Snapshot, Blue Moon Rising Moon Spring Ale or Beaver Chamomile Wheat and it still needs manners.

name: Grand Teton Old Faithful Ale
review: (12oz, bottled 07/10/18) Pours a clear golden body with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus zest, pine, grain, and earth. Flavor of grain, earth, lemon, grass, and caramel.

name: Grand Teton Old Faithful Ale
review: (Bottle) clear, bright yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of jam, grain; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

name: Grand Teton Old Faithful Ale
review: 12 oz bottle. Bottled on 1/31/18. (The Liquor Store of Jackson Hole) Jackson Hole, WY. Cloudy golden color with a small to medium size foamy white head. Green apple, dryness, mild metal and some straw in the aroma. Cheapish aroma. The flavor is not much more desirable with metal, dry malt, straw, mild green apple and some bitterness. Not that rewarding... quite opposite to Yellowstone.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: Pours a hazy golden brownish color. Aromas of mild berries, wheat bread, and a touch of hops. Flavor is a nice balance of soft fruit flavor with malts and a crisp dry finish. I’m not big on fruit beers, but this one has a subdued flavor, not over the top.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: Had this beer on 6/22/2000. Aroma is a fruity scent. Color is a hazy golden brown, with good carbonation and too much head. Taste malty and lightly fruity. Starting with a light body and going down easy. Finish is a light sour malt flavor with a somewhat bitter fruit end.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: I'm not a big fruit beer fan, but I will attempt to be unbiased. As an overall beer, I thought this was a little thin and lacking. Fruit replaces complexity in this beer to produce a refreshing beer that will make a macro swill drinker feel that he has become a connoisseur of American Micros. Put in more malt and hops and save the huckleberries for pancakes in the morning.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: clear golden color, quickly fading white head, didn't notice any huckleberry flavor or aroma. On the palate, it's a bit sour.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: Sweet fruity nose, nice gold with a white head, lite lacing. Flavors of citrus, and a good balance between the malt. As far as the huckelberries, didn't really find them. There is a sweet finish to it, maybe that is them screaming to get out.

name: Grand Teton Huckleberry Wheat
review: So I'm settling into the Cheyenne, WY library to rate the beers I've had on this western trip, and I rate this one first in honor of brother krisbierjaeger, who designed the label and gave me many good tips for beer hunting out here. First the label, which is a couple of Grizzlies beneath the mountains - reminding me of the bear I saw in Yellowstone a few days ago. Tasteful, well done Kris! The beer is pleasant, sweetish, mellow - my wife and I tried real hard to find the huckleberries, but couldn't really taste them, other than a whisp of fruit here and there, like a mirage in the desert. The beer, though is a good citrusy quencher and a fine start to a session of Grand Teton beer.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: 22oz bottle in a shaker. Pours light amber with a lacy off-white head. Aroma of light hops and fruit with a little bread. The hops are a little light in the flavor, and the malts could be increased too. A decent beer for this style, but not the best.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: Bomber from Network Liquors in Roseville $1.99 sale on bombers. Pour is copper orange with a frothy head and minimal lacing. Aroma is sweet sugar and malt. Taste is more sweet sugary malt and some nice subtle hops and spice. Palate is fizzy and sticky with a chaulky dry finish. Solid pale ale.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: i can’t believe this pale ale is rated as low as it is. pours deep orange with nice head. nose is typical, malty and citrusy. taste is rather complex, i get the hint of mango or papaya along with peach and lyche. definately more taste than your standard PA. 22oz bottle was on sale for $2. definately heading back for more.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: A huge oatmeal appearing head. The huge amount of foam seems to be a hallmark of Barrel House beers. The beer is golden with a touch of amber. Complex hop aroma is kind of muddled as is the malt and fruit. The flavor, again, seems to have the Barrel House yeast taste. It is also a bit muddled but is nicer than the aroma. Sweet citrus fruit, sugar, caramel, cinnamon spice, and toast. Hops are noticed very late and definitely don’t assert. Not a great beer and hops need to make themselves known.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: 22 oz. bottle. Pours a medium orange amber color with a medium off white head. The aroma is grassy, citrus hops , and light moderately sweet malt. The flavor is more grass with the citrus hanging around as well. Dry comes to mind, as does a strange damp hoppiness that is strange with this beer. There is probably a reason it has taken me this long to rate some of the few locals we have in Cincy.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: Pours gold/orange, wuith a very large head. Aroma is hops, grass, and malt. Flavor is hops, grass, and some fruit. Light to medium body. Slightly bitter finish.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: 12/19/2007: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale (Cask) has a grassy aroma with some vague citrus and a hint of butterscotch. The beer is a clear copper-orange color and is nearly still. The flavor is somewhat disconnected through. It is very grassy and dry with flavors of both old hops and "wet" hops (Cascade?), although it isn’t that good. The mild to moderate bitterness is lasting. This beer has a medium-light body and is smooth. I’m not so sure that the cask aging and dry hop did anything positive for this beer... CASKsample at Nicholson’s Scottish Pub in downtown Cincinnati, Ohio. Rating #102 for this beer...

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: Draft pint from Arnold’s in downtown Cincinnati. Light orange pour with thin white head. Strong but quick blast of hops, also sweet, peachy, citrusy, and floral. Worth a try but unspectacular.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: Bomber. Pours a copper body with a huge white head. Grainy, floral, moth y citrus aroma. Metallic notes and tin, with a grainy finish. Hops are very subtle. Nothing to write home about.

name: Barrel House Cumberland Pale Ale
review: 22 oz’er. Poured the suspected orange-copper color with a quick head. There’s a sweet grassy aroma to this. The initial impression is the same, a sweet citrusy beer -- but then a deepr metallic, woody sting, with a distinct peachy aspect to it, too. (#3541, 5/17/2009)

name: Barrel House Oktoberfest
review:
9/26/2007: Barrel House Oktoberfest Lager is extremely disappointing. Beyond the typcical Oktoberfest beer appearance the aroma is extremely buttery (lots of Diacetyl) and the flavor is acidic like sweet vinegar. I has a full body though that is creamy and smooth.
