Soft mellow chocolate and bitter bean in the nose. Perhaps a bit too one-dimensionally bitter in the taste, at the expense of coffee’s deeper and more subtle qualities, but there were enough choc malts and hops to balance things out. Not bad.

name: Bloomington Java Porter
review: On tap at Lennies / Bloomington Brewing Co on 14 March 2010. No ABV stated. Dark brown colour. Looks rather cloudy but too dark to see clearly. Lots of coffee. Rather dry mouthfeel. Some burnt bitterness. Slightly thin and maybe lacks a little depth but, overall, pretty decent.

name: Bloomington B-Town Brown Ale
review: Draught at Lennie’s. Rub/ychestnut highlights on a dark brown/black body with minimal beige head. Nose is nice and roasty, light chocolate, some nice tar, mild tobacco, but a touch too sweet. Light body, nicely bittersweet despite the apparent absence of hops/IBUs, faint chocolate, etc. A nice little dirty porter, but too sweet and missing the chance of packing in more roast and depth (nutty undertones would be nice here).

name: Bloomington B-Town Brown Ale
review: Copper color with a tan head. Mild roasty, nutty, caramel aroma. Medium body. Decent flavor is roasted nuts with sweet caramel malt with some spices. Nicely bitter finish.

name: Bloomington B-Town Brown Ale
review: Not a bad beer at all! Pours deep brown, transparent, minor head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel. Similar flavor profiles with a moderate mouth feel.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Thanks to Richard for this rare ass beer! Pours out a yellowish orange color without a head. Smell is hoppy and grassy with a little sweet malts. Taste is similar, refreshing and very easy to consume. It was gone before I knew it. Thanks!

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Another rarity from IrishBoy - Pours a golden color with a thin off white head. Has a very light grassy hop aroma with some light caramel malt. Flavor is lightly sweet and smooth. Light to medium body. Nothing fancy, but a decent beer. Thanks Richard.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Thanks to IrishBoy for sending this brew out to me. A nice dark golden body, slightly cloudy with a thin white head. A light and sweet aroma, caramel and hops are present. Taste is light and delicate, sweet hops with some light honey malts. A very pleasent beer.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Body is amber with a very thin light head. Aroma is centennial hops, with a bit of caramel and honey, light pleasant aroma. Taste is a sweet hoppiness which is much like the aroma but a little sweeter which fades into a light hop bitterness. Palate is normal.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: (BOTTLE FROM IRISHBOY)clear bronze body with a small white head.aroma was of citrus hops and caramel malts.flavor boasted much of the same.this is a nice solid pale ale.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Bottle from Albertsons supermarket in Atascadero, CA; Nose of hops and a little malt; light amber color with a small white head; flavor of caramel malt with some hops and a mildly bitter hop finish.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: This beer was clean and refreshing, left a very nice after taste. Highly recomend

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: Pours a golden color with a nice white head. The aromaand flavor was mildy hoppy, with a nice malty sweet background. Bubbly feel made this a great thirst quencher.

name: Bonnema Pozo Pale Ale
review: deep honey colour, nice head, mild hop aroma, fresh, smooth, bitter aftertaste, well-structured

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: Bottle from Richard. Reddish colored pour, no head. Smell is malty and sweet. Taste is similar, with no real body or much of anything here. Pretty bland actually. Probably not something I would want to get again.

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle via trade with IrishBoy - Pours a clear amber color with a small off white head which faded quickly. Light spotty lacing. Has a light caramel malt aroma and flavor. Medium body. Worth a try. Thanks Richard.

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: Thanks again to IrishBoy for sending this my way. A very nice dark red body with a very thin lacing of white head. Nice aroma, sweet... almost milky-like, hops and malt with a light fruit presence. Taste of caramel, some light hops... maybe some chocolate powder, very interesting. Slightly sweet and smooth ending, not offensive at all, subtle.

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: (yet another free bottle from irishboy...thanks!)clear amber with not much head.caramel and bananas dominate the aroma.flavor is a strange mix of bananas,chocolate,metal,and tobacco.

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: Caramel, with hazelnut, and malt in the aroma. Taste is nutty with caramel, not a lot of depth to it by any means, but it’s not bad. Much more like a brown rather then a red, or bitter.

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: Bottle from Albertsons supermarket in Atascadero, CA; Nose is bitter, not hoppy with some spice notes; Rusty colored with a tiny beige head; flavor shows spicy and some bitterness, with the flavor of an oily fat added that i’ve never seen in beer before. I can see where the first rater wanted to compare it to beef, it might have a light beef bullion note, but not a major flavor. Unique beer taste!

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: I see why this beer was awarded 1st place gold medal in Sacramento Ca. 2003

name: Bonnema Red Kroeker Ale
review: My second beer of the night with an odd aroma. I swear it smells and tastes like spiced beef. Nice mild bitter tones to this beer, and a crisp dry finish. The beef flavor kinda ruined the experience for me though. The color was a pretty red color.

name: Bonnema Mudhole Porter
review: Dark and very rich, creamy head, with a roasty hint in the finish, not a bitter porter, very enjoyable I would recomend

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle labeled Everett’s Ale and EK Ale. Dark amber pour. Short, off-white head. The aroma is weak, but does have notes of sweet grain and caramel. The flavor was moderately sweet and slightly bitter. Light acidity. Medium body. The finish was chalky. Drinkable, but unremarkable — perhaps too much past its prime.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: 12 oz. bottled labeled "Everett’s Ale" - this is the closest to the bottles listed and I am not going to enter a new beer for a closed brewery: Pours a crystal clear amber with a thin cap. The nose is subtle, with sweet bread and caramel. The body is thin, but good, with lingering notes of nutty caramel and toffee. Hop presence is limited, but this bottle may be a bit dated.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: 12oz - Aroma of cherry and malt. Transparent amber color with no head or lacing. An interesting flavor that is sweet and cherry jolly rancher like. I was not expecting it and surprised that I like it. Smooth palate. Not sure how old this one is.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Decent aroma, nice amber color, pours with little to no head. Lacking in bitterness.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: poured muddy with floaties with a big fluffy head and descent lacing. aroma fruity. flavor malty sweet cherries and a slight taste of yeast. finish dry with a nice sweet bitterness not to bad hope to be in the boyne river area in the fall hope to pick up some more of their beer

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Decent example of the style. Good mouthfeel and a decent head. These beers keep popping up around MI.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Maple/mahogoney/carmel color. Some carbonation. Soft mouthfeel. Yeah, like the DrBeer, it's dry. Not bitter enough.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Orange with no head. Fruity aroma with brown sugar tones. Dry flavor with rocky tones.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Bottled. Amber coloured, slightly hazy. Fruity and flowery. Toned down crystal malt character, soft mouthfeel. Surprisingly low bitterness for a US bitter. Pleasant.

name: Boyne River Log Jam Ale
review: Light brown. Very Cloudy. Minimal head. Fruity aroma. Caramel and some round hops in the nose. Ditto for flavor. Some bitterness. Smooth. Medium body. Tasty! I'd love to try some of this on a cask.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Light brown/amber in color. Lots of sweet, floral notes and also a slight tang. My label is also different and looks very new. Loving in Michigan lately I have seen Boyne River beer at a number of stores, even though they have been out of business for a while. Enjoyable and well crafter beer.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Hazy, light brown iced-tea color. Fairly white head. Nice hoppy aroma, some Cascades maybe, but hidden behind some other English hops. Same in the flavor, but there is some bubble gum sweetness and chewiness to this brew. Like crazy-man-behind-the-mask says, the label I have is quite a bit different. Also, they seem very new. However, I'm drinking this 4 months later.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Fruity hop nose and cloudy peach color. Flavor is a lot like Anderson Valley Pale Ale, but fitted in a slimmer frame. This finish has a bit of citrict sourness. This might be the last rating of this beer, now extinct. Thanks Psych Prof for this tremendous artifact.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Brownish Orange. Big head with some lace as the pint is diminished. Big American cascade nose. Biscuit aroma. Awesome balance of hops and malt in aroma and flavor. A truly excellent American Pale Ale. My favorite from Boyne River. Update: Picked up a bottle still on the shelves at Horrock's in Battle Creek, MI. This beer is starting to lose some of its luster. Still nice but not quite as brilliant as it once was.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Very cloudy light brown color. Nose is floral (cascades?) and piney with some sweet malty notes as well. Balance is very much to my liking; walks a fine line between malty sweetness and hop bitterness. I'm not the world's biggest APA fan, but I did enjoy this brew.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: My bottle is quite hoppy (though reading the other reviews suggests that's not something you can count on), with good graprefruit flavor dominant. Also some pine hops and a bit of yeast. Some sweet maltiness creeps in as part of the aftertaste. I could be happy with this as a session beer, if only the brewery weren't going away. Thanks PsychProf, for bringing it to Toronto.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Light frothy head, yellow-orange cloudy color. Well balanced, not as hoppy as I expected, refreshing lemon-citrusy aroma and flavor, I like this pale, thanks PsychProf.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: citrusy, piney aroma. deep amber color, lots of lace. very blended, nothing spectacular. varies wildely from bottle to bottle.

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Dark orange color, good malty taste, without a lot of hops. Clean dry aftertaste. This be summer drinking beer. Thanks PsychProf!

name: Boyne River Pale Ale
review: Average Pale Ale. I would of liked it better with more hops thrown in. Easy drinking though.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: Toffee, butter, and toast in the nose with a thin white head on an amber body. Light biscuty malts with toffee. Finishes with toasted butter and more malts thta turn to caramel. Stood up to time real well.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: This was an ’01. The aroma was dark fruit, slightly tea, butter, slight roast, and citrus notes. The flavor was thin, and watery tea textures, slight roast, citrus, and buttery notes. The beer poured a cloudy brown color w/ golden orange highlights; thin head and lacing. THe mouthfeel was light bodied and creamy w/ a wet finish.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: Chesnut color with a nice tight white head. Aroma is malty and nutty. Smooth mouth feel. Touches of roasted malts and nutty flavors. Some bitter hops in the finish. Pretty solid brown ale.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: I thought this was a pretty decent brown. The clear brown elixir is topped by a little head with some lacing left behind. The aroma is slightly sweet and malty with roasty, nutty notes. The flavor is virtually the same as the aroma but with some hoppy notes. Medium bodied, smooth and slightly dry.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: um? I don't get it? light clear brown with a lasting head..malty, lightly chocolatey aroma..light body with the same old subtle malt and chocolate flavors..how good can a brown ale be anyway...uh oh, was i supposed to be rating by style? I forgot.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: This is a very light bodied that has a nice roasty nose but a lot more bitter than I'd like to see in a brown.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: Dark earthy brown pour with a very nice roasty nose. Light body, nice roasted malt front with a little nuttiness to it. Fairly sizable bitterness in the finish for a brown.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: A moderate brown color with a mildly foamy head. Smells much like a bowl of holiday nuts. Has a very average fully nutty body to it.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: Good Nut Brown. Translucent brown color with a small white head. Aroma is nutty and malty. Flavor is fairly malt sweet, with slight bitterness. Thin bodied, balance finish.

name: Boyne River Brown Ale
review: Good aroma, slight hint of coffee. Smooth flavor. Liked this better than the brown from SKA.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Pours a dark brownish black color with a thick sudsy tan head. It leaves some thick laceing along the sides of the glass. The nose is nice and roasted, you can really smell the toasted barley and chocolate malt. The flavor is nice and roasted with a lot or earth exploding in your mouth and it leaves this tangy bitterness that is also smooth and semi sweet on the side walls of your mouth. Overall it is nice and flavorful with a finish that is all right could use some more carbonation though.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Pours a near black clolour with ruby edges and a massive, rocky mocha head that dimples as it fades. It has insane head retention and lacing that coats the glass with thick. The nose is muted coffee and chocolate and not much else. There are some tin-like notes as well. The flavour is roasty, citric, and has notes of coffee, peppery spice and some light fruits. The palate is watery, harshly carbonated and harshly bitter. Not a great stout.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Pours as light as it tastes. Very thin, and leaves no lasting taste in the mouth.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Pretty good stout, little on the lighter side for me, but not bad. Had the typical coffe-chocolate aroma and flavors.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Thick roasted coffee aroma. Body starts sweet and roasty with some smoke and a salty fish(?) finish. Thick oily palate delivers the flavor. This has perhaps aged too long, but I bet it was a pretty good brew in its day.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Dark with a medium off-white head. Roasted malts, silkly mouthfeel. Rush of bitter dryness and accenuated roasted malts during the finish.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: 22 oz bomber (I know, like I could get it on tap now) courtesy of Psychprof. Medium quick-dying head, black. Roasty chocolate coffee aroma, nothing unusual and rather weak -- could be result of age I suppose. Nice bitter chocolate flavor, pleasant but not what I would call intense; sort of a "lighter" stout, not my cup of tea entirely but so very drinkable; I could probably do 2 of these in a night without breaking a sweat and there aren't a lot of stouts I'd want to say that about. Sadly I won't likely get another.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Dark brown, fairly light colored for a stout. Ring of white bubbles, again fairly light. Thought this might be heading in the wrong direction for a stout then the HUGE roasted aroma hit me. Sweet aroma of milk chocolate, toast, coffee, burnt stuff, faint fruit (concord grape), and a faint smoke/wood that catches p with you at the end. Semi dry flavor with a burnt finish. A little light on the palate, but a fine stout.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: Dark black in color. Distinguished roast taste to the favor. Not much else. Decent stout.

name: Boyne River Lake Trout Stout
review: One of the few stouts that I could drink all night long -- not too much body that you get tired of it after a while.

name: Boyne River Oatmeal Stout
review: Crazy ass 1 liter swing top bottle seemed to protect this beer from the ravages of time. I don’t know what black hole and/or time warp yjb pulled this one out from, but it was well worth the effort! Dark cola brown with a dense creamy tan head. Lghtly sweet round malt. Light cola acidity from roast. Chocolate is light. Low carbonation. Thin body, very quaffable. Lightly sweet, big vanilla. Subdued chocolate. A bit like vanilla coke, only much better. Rather clear with a bit of that oatmealiness. Really doesn’t taste old, but judging from the age of these ratings... anyways, must have either been kept in great condition or the age helped this beer out!

name: Boyne River Oatmeal Stout
review: I was really looking forward to trying this stout, but was sadly disappointed. I assumed that the people who brought us Boyne River Brown Ale would be able to make a decent stout. If you like the combination of cherry cough syrup and coffee, this is the stout for you. I must admit it had a beautiful deep ruby color.

name: Boyne River Oatmeal Stout
review: Well, I can't say I'm a huge fan yet, but I intend to have a few more. The thing comes on strong with cherry syrupy flavors and pours a nice dark ruby color.

name: Boyne River Hefe Weizen
review: A nice find in a 750 mL bottle. Not sure when this was bottled. Tangy wheat aroma with a hint of cloves. Cloudy yellow-orange body with a thin off-white head. Nice flavor reminded me more of a typical American Wheat than a Hefeweizen: fruity and light with strong wheat tang and estery notes. Nice mouthfeel due to tight carbonation. Too bad Boyne River is out of business, but these bottles of Hefeweizen are still solid.

name: Boyne River Hefe Weizen
review: Crystal clear straw color with large head. Spicy wheat aroma with some citrus notes. Estery. Some malt aroma and flavor. Slight hop bitterness in the finish. Spritzy light-to-medium body. A very nice refreshing hefeweizen.

name: Boyne River Hefe Weizen
review: This hefe weizen has a wonderfully citrusy nose which is unfortunately not carried out in the flavor. I tend to prefer very citrusy hefe weizens, but still enjoyed the complexity of this one.

name: Boyne River Hefe Weizen
review: Excellent nose - spicy and estery, and this carries, though more faintly, into the taste, with a splash of bitter and citrus action on close. A decent Hefe on a decent summer day in the home of laid back ales. Stay tuned for a RateBeer article on the place from yours truly.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Can to cup. Pours a copper orange with moderate white head that retains well and has creamy aspects. Aroma is fruity and even slight bubblegum. A sweet graininess invades the background. Taste follows aroma with the malt more pronounced. Easy drinking and enjoyable.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Can shared. Pours clear golden with a fair frothy white head, fair lacing, medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, bitter-sweet finish. Floral aromas, citrus, caramel, good balance between hops and malty sweetness, refreshing and easy going.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Can. Honey yellow. Average white head. Nectary melony aroma. Tropical fruit in the background. Medium body. Nice dry taste. Hoppy frutiness. Green tea. Medium bitter. Good -- rated with beerbasher/winphone

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Dark Amber with thin white head. Not a lot of aroma but what's there is malt sweetness. Malt fiesta with a little citrus hops. Easy drinking but nothing special. Rated by BrewTom

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Can (shared by philduk, thanks). Pours dark golden. Aroma is sweet, citrus, mango. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruity, citrus, tangerines, honey. Drinkability is ok. Overall: rather good, but would like to try fresher version (bb of the can is unreadable).

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: 355ml can (Ochutnavkova, Brno) Sweet malty aroma, a bit papery and old, some fruity esters too. BB date is completely illegible, so no idea how old this is. Old, a bit papery, some messy bitter hops, soapy. Watery palate. Dull one.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: 330ml can (Ochutnakova Pivnice, Brno). Clear amber color. Tiny to almost no head. Sweet, fruity, malty, grapefruit in aroma. Caramel, fruity, citrus, malty in taste. Caramel and fruity in aftertaste. Feels and tastes old. BB is all over the place so I can’t see. Drinkable at best.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Golden color with a light white head. Slightly oily mouthfeel with a bitter hop finish. Nose is floral with a little funkiness. This is a nice beer but there are better pale ales out there for sure. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: 33cl can. Orange hazy apperance. Thin white head. Medium crispy body. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Aroma is malty, orange, hops, piney.

name: Caldera Pale Ale
review: Can. Pours golden with off-white head. Aroma is flowery hops. Taste is sweet floral happiness with a mellow citrus grapefruit piney finish. It’s a easy drinker.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: 35,5 cl can @ Bierlokaal Locus Publicus Aroma has caramel and resiny malt. Flavour has minerals, some resiny malt and grapefruity hops. A tad too dry but decent anyway. Faithful to the style.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Amber malts and packed with fruity hops. I have now had a few Caldera beers and their treatment of hops is always on point.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Van tap bij 't Witte Konijn in Amersfoort. Maltig , harsig, hoppig, cinnamon, rood fruit. Zoet, zuur en bitters wisselen elkaar af. (8-6-2019).

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: firey, spicy aroma. appearance is amber with a green-tinted foamy head. low bitterness, strong flavour, how nice, cinnamon, coriander, bits of chocolate, peaches and more. full and milky body. thats good and a big surprise.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, bread, pale, amber, amber, orange, red, brown, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness,

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Copper colour,slightly opaque,weak white head. Smell is caramel toffee, yoghurt and a subtle ashy smokiness. Taste is bitter sweetish with recognisable amber sourness. Bitter finish. Yoghurt and toffeed apples. Nice.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Aroma: caramel, malt, resin, floral. Appearance: amber with small white head. Taste: malt, caramel, hops, floral. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation, long bitterness finish.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Plechovka od beershop.sk. Jantárová farba, biela pena. Vôòa sladová, karamel, citrusové tóny. Chu plné sladovo telo, jemne karamel, citrusové tóny, najmä pomaranè, krásne horká dochu. Plné telo, stredná nasýtenos.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: Red orange/copper with foamy, short-ladting white head. Some lacing. Nose is floral aromas, resin, caramel, biscuits, red grapes. Taste is medium bitter with hints of elderflower, resin, caramel, yeast. Medium body, average carbonation levels, creamy texture. Dry finish. Yummy beer.

name: Caldera Ashland Amber Ale
review: On tap @ beertemple Amsterdam. giallo ambrato carico, limpida ma non cristallina. schiuma beige fine e persistente. Aroma non molto complesso ma fine. caramello, luppoli aromatici tendenti alla agrume, scorza d’arancia e canditi.abboccata, leggera tostatura caramello, malto, e fruttato agrumato. non molto amara. poco/nulla carbonata, non tanto calda, rotonda, piena equilibrata ed armonica. senza grosse pretese.

name: Caldera Cauldron Brew Amber Ale
review: Bottle at post De Molen 30 bottle breakfast ... copper ... sweet toffee malt nose ... very soft ... over sweet toffeee ... light hop.

name: Caldera Cauldron Brew Amber Ale
review: On tap at the rose and raindrop. Pours a very dark brown, light red tint to it, with a thin light tan head. Aroma has a faint roastiness, more noticable is a lightly rich sweeter chocolate hint up front. Taste starts with a hint of cocoa up front fading quickly to mildly roasty body, smooth, with a bigger bitter finish. This brew didn’t remind me of an amber at all, but was to thin to be the stout.

name: Caldera Cauldron Brew Amber Ale
review: Dark brown, good tan head & lacing. Musty hops, dry malt finishes. Sharp and cobwebby but very drinkable.

name: Caldera Cauldron Brew Amber Ale
review: Draft. Mahogony color with a malty/fruity/hoppy/slightly herbal taste that's a bit different. You don't notice the hops first, but they're definately there. The fruity taste is a bit different and gets very tiresome towards the end.

name: Caldera Cauldron Brew Amber Ale
review: Probably an amber, this beer had a full and thick body and was very smooth and drinkable. Not too hoppy, but the hops were there. Not a bad brew for a night at the Horse Brass.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Taste @ brouwerij Het Veem, Eindhoven as 8% ABV Black with a beige head. Heavy roasted malts with lots of coffee and chocolate. Taste is fairly bitter with burnt aromas and strangely enough a very smooth finish. Very nice uncompromising straight forward stout.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: 7 4 8 4 16 Draft at BeerTemple, Amsterdam. Near black with a tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, cocoa powder and creamy oaty notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Pours a finger of head on a black body. The aroma is lots of burnt and roasted malt. The taste is burnt and roasted malt as well... lots of it. There is a balancing bitterness. The texture is smooth with a softness to it. I enjoyed it. Some might find the burnt flavor too much.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: An awesome Oatmeal Stout from a local brewery I have never heard of until now. I look forward to visiting and taking a tour.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Draught. Black body with thin fast disappearing beige head. Light oat aroma. Body is light to medium, roast malt and oat. Malt flavour. A light hop edge to the finish as if the brewer wished to say, ’I put hops in it.’ Drink it if you come across it.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Tap @ New Old Lompoc... Poured dark, near black with a kahki head. Aroma of soft grains, roast, burnt sugar and coffee. Lots of roast and coffee tones. Smooth palate and chocolatey goodness. Creamy and sort of like whopper candies. Little bit of smoked tones, and a hint of acidity. Mild bitterness, oats and malts came back in with the finish.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Poured bown/black. Roasted malts, subtle sweetness upfront, chocolate, bitter cocoa, in the nose and flavor, and had a creamy mouthfeel. Was given to me at a steakhouse in the outskirts of Ashland, OR. The more I drank, the less I could eat, lots of body in this stout. Overall, I was surprised by it. I would recommend it to any sweet stout lover.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Sampled draught at Caldera Brewery, AshlandDark auburn color with a nice creamy tan head. Nose of creamy oats & milky roast. Flavor is nice & smoky. Finishes toasted with a nice rich body. Yum! Major thanks to the brewmaster for letting us taste these at the brewery when he was already busy.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Dark brown with a thick tan head and huge lacing. Oatmeal aromas with some soy and bitter coffee. Roast and oatmeal flavors. Bitter coffee and hops. Creamy, bitter tail.

name: Caldera Oatmeal Stout
review: Blew the keg on this at Amnesia Brewing Company, Portland. Deep black body, light tan fluffy nitro head. Sweet and dry, creamy milky malts, milk chocolate aromas and flavors, sweet robust and dry all around... smoky and tart at times. Can’t pick up any oatmela, but it’s a fine dry stout.

name: Caldera Imperial Chocolate Stout
review: I like chocolate and I like stouts. This beer combines them both in a smooth, dark, enjoyable ale.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: Deep hazy straw body. Lots of carbonation. Immense banana nose. Big grainy wheat malt backbone that provides a solid foundation for the clove spice. Peach sweetness with lemons notes.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: Draft at 7th St Brewhouse, Redmond, OR. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a wheat malty aroma with some hints of banana. Sweetish malty banana flavor. Has a sweetish wheat malty finish with some hints of bananas in the aftertaste.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: Tap at Cascade Lakes Lodge pours out clear strw color topped with a white head. A nice aroma of banana and spice. Pretty good body. A nice Hef.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: on tap at the Lodge. Slightly hazy very light yellow with a thin skin of a creany white head. Thin persistant lacing. Nice up front aroma of light pale malts and lots of banana. Flavor was banana bread and a bit of clove spice. Thin but very soft palate. Crsmy and smooth. Nice.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: (Draft at the brewpub Bend) Pours hazy orangey gold with a big white foamy head. Aromas of banana and citrus (lemon) and wheat bread. This is decidedly not an American-style wheat. Light-bodied, crisp and clean. There’s a bit of sweetness mixed with the tangy finish which I found a little unusual. Best wheat beer in the Bend area.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: [Draft - Bend, Oregon] A nice darker golden color brew hazy in the apperance and had a nice head. A deep wheat flavor and a hint of banana and cloe in the flavor and nose. This was a great brew to drink I liked it. No lemon needed this was a beer with some flavor.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: Pale golden. Aroma is very wheaty with notes of lemons, bananas, bread and more wheat. Nice tart finish. This one offered way more than the American wheats from the other 2 Bend brewers I visited.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: A very light version of this style, it really needs alot more body and maltiness. Zingy lemony acidity, light bodied and very clean, with some light banana flavors. Could be alot better.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: GABF 2005. Pale yellow, too clear for the style. Light bananna bread aroma. Taste is orange citrus, slilght bitters. Finish has some off acidity.

name: Cascade Lakes Weiss
review: (Draft: Seventh Street Brewhouse in Redmond, OR) Spicy and wheaty nose, with modest banana and clove, this seems like a far cry from the typically bland American wheat beers. The flavor features a moderate wheat base, mild citrus, a light spiciness and a hint of banana. Light bodied, but clean and refreshing on this hot Oregon day. Pale straw color, hard to get much paler, somewhat cloudy in appearance, with a slowly-fading snow white head, and patchy lacing on the glass. Light and easy to drink, but a quality wheat beer.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Nice pale ale. Floral notes. Fair bite on palate. Looks good. Quite hoppy and will try again

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: It’s hoppy, it’s piney, it’s a caramel bodied pnw IPA, finished with floral notes, ehhhh

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: "Eh. Average iPa at best. Nice use of floral cascade hops but otherwise very simple and Unassuming. Pleasant enough, but nothing special.............."

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Bottle: Clear copper color with a small head and white ring around the edge. Carbonation seems pretty lively. Hoppy aroma but not huge, a little skunk, and wet grass. Flavor pretty well balanced. Hops up front with a maltier aftertaste than most IPA’s. I did notice a floral character in the flavor as well. Ok, I like a more in your face IPA than this.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Bottle: &nbsp Vibrant straw, lively carbonation, large pillowy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Looks tasty. &nbsp Pale citrus rind on the nose, subtle hops. &nbsp A little stale on the tongue, decent malt background, barnish, but the hop aspect is minor. &nbsp Decent body, fairly sticky mouthfeel. &nbsp Biting, but almost not in a hoppy sense. &nbsp Feels more of a Pale than an IPA. &nbsp Mild sweetness. &nbsp Quick finish. &nbsp Tiz okay, but overall a bit too light.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Sulfur in the aroma, reminds me a bit of a lager. Taste has some honey, floral, bitterness.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: light hoppy and malt aroma. Pours a pale copper, nice foamy white head. Mid range hops, some alcohol in the finish. Light body.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Draught at the brewhouse in Redmond. Dark gold to pale amber with a very stable head. The aroma is mostly dank, fruity, grapefruit peel hops that come off pretty fresh, but there is also an odd, unclean, alcoholic edge that muddles things a little. Resiny hop flavor quickly leads to a rough, astringently bitter finish that doesn’t really have and malt for balance. The body is thin and astringent, leaving an uncomfortable feeling. Bitterness needs to be scaled back significantly here.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Mix of citrus and skunky hops, though a definite pale malt presence, which continues in the flavor, hopes on the harsh side but not intensely so. Good weight in the mouth. Quite yellow with a foamy head that lasts and laces. Dry bitter finish.

name: Cascade Lakes India Pale Ale
review: Overly bitter with minimal aroma, tastes like a heavy bitter blond ale. 22oz bottle.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: 12 oz bottle pour. Pours a dark brown color with barely any head. I’m starting to think I just love porters all around, and this one was no exception. Nice roasted chocolate malt aroma. Gentle roasted flavor, medium body brew. A bit of dark chocolate on the finish. Looking forward to trying more from these guys. I’ll be visiting them soon. Good beer.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: "it is strong on the roasted coffee, more in the flavor than on the nose, which is too bad...that’s a great smell. not as good as Rogue Mocha or Pipeline, but pretty solid."

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Draft at Horse brass. Black pour, frothy tan, nitro head. Roast, bitter coffee. Some chocolate as well. Finishes with ash and burnt toast. Creamy texture.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Pours black with small head that disappears quickly. Aroma is chocolate and smoke. Taste is more chocolate, dry finish, getting better as it warms.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Bottle. This was an ok porter but nothing very special. I would give it a miss unless you have a reason to go for it.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: January 2012. From bottle. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Medium carbonation, but a bit thin. Easy to drink.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Tap at Cascade Lakes Lodge, Bend, 23/05/13. Light black with a thin tan head. Nose is roast malt, light chocolate, dark toffee. Taste comprises roast malt, chocolate, light biscuit, leather. Medium bodied, carbonation is a little overcooked and spritzed up for my liking, bitter roast in the finish. Ok stout.

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Bottle: black with minimal head. Smells of dark roasted coffee. Tastes of grain & roasted coffee grounds with a twang at the end. Medium bodied, clean sipper. ~m --RaucusBacchus

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: 12oz bottle from the Boise guys Clear dark brown with a small beige head and some light lacing. Aroma of dry roast coffee, roasted malts and chocolate. Flavors of roasted malts, coffee, rich chocolate and vanilla Very nice

name: Cascade Lakes Monkey Face Porter
review: Brown, clear, off white head. Aroma of bready, biscuity, nutty malt. Flavor of nutty and chocolatey malt, a little raisin, finish is malty. Flavorful and easy drinking. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Pale yellow. Medium-sized, white head which disappeared very fast. Malt , bread, earthy hops, hint of citrus in aroma. Watery , malty taste with mild hoppy bitterness. Drinkable

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: 12 oz. can. Pours a hazy yellow with a large fizzy, foamy white head. Aroma of cereal and stale cardboard. Taste is light malt, cereal, hint of fruitiness. Very bland, and doesn't taste much like a Kölsch.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Some paper and a hint of barley but that’s reaching. Pours golden with OK head. Light crisp finish. Nothing going on here, even for a kolsch. Tap at NY Beer Company waiting for a bus.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Draught @ Albion. Pale yellow with small white foamy head that disappeared even before tasting the beer! ash-like aroma, low carbonation, thin watery body, slight honey taste, abrupt finish. Not a remarkable beer at all.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Pours slightly unclear yellow . Scent is a bit hop, but mostly malts . Taste as well has very aromatic malts , together with some hoparoma undertone . Nice and balanced, easy drinkable beer . Not really bitter as well

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Cask. Pale orange, clear, still. Aroma is strong malt, almost cheesy. Body is medium, slightly foamy. Taste has a nice strong musty hop profile, almost to the extent of being smokey. I thought this was pretty good.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Pale yellow colour. Light and boring. This is bland, soapy, not a very nice beer.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Part of a tasting paddle at The New York Beer Company. Rating from September 2013. Tasty blonde ale. With a hint of peach and nectarine in the flavour.

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Tap at the stags head NYC. Poured a real clear yellow with a small white cap. Nose presents faint yeast and malts. Very average. Taste is boring. Drink these after you've had several others. Not a lot going on ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Chelsea Checker Cab Blonde Ale
review: Great light beer, very refreshing. Not a lot of aroma and a small hop flavor. Very smooth. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Draft at Valhalla, 9th Ave, New York City. Pours dark amber red with a small off-white head. Aroma of biscuit, malt, toffee, light chocolate, yeast and light toasting. Medium plus sweetness, moderate bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, average carbonation, dry finish.

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Cask@The Ginger Man, NYC Chestnut brown color, medium-sized beige head. Some "heavy" toffee in the nose. Light-bodied. Toasted maltyness behind, crystal malty caramel, some grassy notes. Don’t know if casking is doing any good for this (versus keg).

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: NYC Beer Week Opening Bash: Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel and small fruitiness. Taste is boring and pretty simple. It is not surprising that this style went by the wayside.

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Drought. Copper red with small beige foamy head, nutmeg aroma, spicy taste with hint of cinnamon, low carbonation, sour finish. A bit weak for my taste.

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Pours ruby copper with light beige head decent lacing. Nose of toffee and hops. Tastes light hop bitterness, caramel, honey, and plywood. Thin palate and watery.

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Full bodied beer with a deep red color. A good light hoppy taste with a good caramel taste in the middle. A solid beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: Weatherspoons Gatwick. Red with off white head. Dark fruit notes. Light with strong bitter finish. Okay.

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: 1/2 at the Tilley Stone Gateshead. Dark ammber with a dense off white head. Demarera sugar and citrus aroma. Toffee, grapefruit and pineapple flavour. Sweet with a bitter finish. Nice, but not earth-shattering

name: Chelsea Sunset Red Ale
review: 1 pint on tap @ Bright Helm. Pours clear amber with a low creamy head. Aroma is mostly malts. Flavor is bitter malts with some fruits and hops. Decent.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of dough, yeast and hay. The taste was similar to the aroma with more dough, yeast, hay and medium carbonation with a light aftertaste. Ok.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: At the source: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is bread. Taste is lightly sweet and pretty bready. Simple but fine.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear gold with a white head. Doughy honey notes in the aroma. Sweet and bready. Lighter body, medium carbonation.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Tap at the brewpub. Clear light gold pour with a white head. Bready malt, very light, just a hint of grassy hop.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Tap at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is biscuit and honey malt, light spicy hops. Flavor is sweet malt, light hops and bitterness with a sweet finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: On tap at the source, Slightly hazy golden color, faint bready pilsner malt, light fruit and astringency. Decent enough beer but nothing too exciting.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Sampled at the brewpub. Clear golden with a small almost white layer. Typical of this style there is not a lot going on. Some soft grass and grain. Soft malts. Light fruit and a dry bitterness.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Clear yellow pour. Mild malt and hops. Maybe a bit of grain. Goes for both the aroma and taste. Would enjoy it doing yardwork.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub on 7/3/13. Clear yellow to gold in color with a medium white head. Aroma of malt and crisp hops. Malt flavor with crisp hops before a dry finish.

name: Coddington Golden Ale
review: On Tap at the brewpub. Clear yellow pour. Aroma is crackers, slight breadiness. Maybe a bit of a spicy hop note. Flavor is similar. Thin, bodied and weak. Ok. Not great.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured an amber color with an off-white head. The aroma was of hops, dough and earth. The taste was similar to the aroma with more hops, dough, earth with medium carbonation and a different aftertaste. Ok.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: At the source: pours caramel with a white head. Aroma is bready with a hint of hops. Taste is not an IPA. This is not good. My wife hates this beer... so does my brother. What?

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear copper with a white head of foam. Crisp herbal bitterness. Dry and floral. Sweet and mildly bitter. Medium body and medium carbonation.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Tap at the brewpub. English earthy malts, clear orange pour, lightly hopped. Not really my type of IPA.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Pours Amber with white head and some lacing. Aroma of English hops and light fruit and pale malts. Taste is mildly bitter with noticeable biscuits malts.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Tap at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is toast and grain malt, earthy, pine and citrus hops with apple esters. Flavor is medium hops and bitterness, toast malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: On tap at the source, Slightly hazy golden amber color, faint sweet bread and caramel, light earthy hop with a hint of astringency. Decent ipa but needs more hops

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Sampled at the brewpub. Amber golden with a nice long lasting creamy layer. A sweet malt aroma. Floral? The flavor is also sweet malts to begin and then is floral and citrus. More citrus comes lateand it is accompanied by tropical fruit. Soon that dominates. Those malts continue to make this sweet. I like it.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Clear copper pour. Aroma is citrus rind with white pulp. Taste is grapefruit rind. Enjoyable.

name: Coddington India Pale Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub on 7/3/13. Pours clear amber with a thick off-white head. Malty nose with piney and floral hops. Malty flavor with a dry, earthy and floral hop finish.

name: Coddington Vienna Lager
review: On tap at the brewpub. I was excited to try this beer, because I hadn’t had a Veinna for a long time and wanted to settle into some rich, toasted maltiness. Instead, I got a confusing and odd arrangement of unclean lager brewing and paleness. Poured very hazy and in kind of a strawberry blonde color. Aroma was subtly a pinch of raw grain (this runs throughout the brewpub’s offerings) and some unbaked bread dough. Then a weird mineral-heavy wash of what just seems like lager yeast gone wrong. Not attractive.

name: Coddington Vienna Lager
review: Pours a amber color with a thin white head. Flavors of roasty malt and caramel. Not a bad beer and could drink a few of these if I had to.

name: Coddington Vienna Lager
review: On draft at the brewery. The pour does not match the commercial description, as it was pale, almost straw pale. The nose was pungent, toasted grains, honey and grass. The flavour was similar, with honey sweetness dominating and some dry, bitter hops that finished somewhat medicinal. The mouthfeel was slick, sharply carbonated and relatively full-bodied for the style. For such a low abv, alcohol presence was rather high. Either this was an infected batch, or they could have done a better job with this offering, but Vienna’s just aren’t really my bag, so I’m biassed.

name: Coddington Vienna Lager
review: this was a well balanced beer. Easy to drink and full of flavor. Had it on Goat Island in RI. Next time I’m up I will go the to brewery to sample a few more.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured a dark red color with an off-white head. The aroma was of malts, roast and coffee. The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, roast, coffee with medium carbonation and a nice aftertaste. Decent.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: At the source: very light dry stout. Not much going on here. Drinkable, however.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: Tap at the brewpub. Very dark brown pour with a rich dense tan head. Roasted malt, hint of coffee, softer palate. Good beer.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: On tap at the source, Solid black color decent tan head. Roasty grainy earthy. Nice dry stout

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: Black pour with light tan head. Aroma is mild coffee. Taste is sweet coffee followed by immediate bitter.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: Sample at the brewpub on 7/3/13. Clear dark reddish brown in color with a thick beige head. Aroma of malt, roast and molasses. Malty and caramelly flavor with some chocolate before a dry, roasty finish.

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: An overlooked gem? Not a brew by numbers beer, some smoked malt, some anise baltic porter notes and a rich creamy feel packed into a tight 3.4% body. Nice concept and execution. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Coddington Irish Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours black with a thick tan head. Aroma of roasted sweet malt and a hint of roasted malt. Flavor is thin, chalky and roasted/charred malt. Not too bad, I was expecting worse given prior ratings. But the palate is pretty decent with lots of charred, roasty malt. Overall, a dry stout I enjoyed. 7/4/7/4/14 (3.6/5)

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: Draught at the source. Pale straw color; slight, but not too hazy. Yeasty, bready aroma. Wheat flavor, malty and smooth. No citrus notes. Light bodied but not thin. Well done beer.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: On tap. Clear light golden in colour with no head. Thin and very sharp feel in the mouth. Slightly hoppy and very anonomous. May have been slightly infected.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: tap at brewery-man, this place is a riot! its a mulletfest in the middle of a pretty nice area. pours pale yellow with a nice whtie head and good lacing from the start. grainy aroma with some subtle notes of hops. some sweet flavors from alot of pale malt, but no spicy hop notes that i was expecting. some grain in the finish as well. pretty boring.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: Pours a very pale, straw color with a wispy pale head that sits atop this quite clear beer. There is a hint of spicy hops and subtle malt in the nose, but just barely. The taste is light and quite fruity with notes of strawberry and tropical fruit. This is certainly not fruity like a Belgian beer, but more than I was expecting, though not much more than your standard Blonde ale. There is barely a hint of hops and malt in the taste. Overall a bland unexciting beer.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: Sweet malt and citrus aroma and flavor with a watery body with a light hops finish.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: Smapler. Gold color for body. Well the beer was cold and wet. Could of had a Miller Lite, not much difference

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: I'm more into heavier beers, but this blonde surprised me. Refreshing and flavorful.

name: Copper Canyon Foothills Blonde Ale
review: I do beer quest to several breweies and brewpubs on a regular basis, this is a favorite stop for me. this particular beer is a little light for this heavy duty "gusler", good training wheel beer. Fair malts and hops, quite clean and refreshing.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: Backlog, from notes. On tap @ the brewpub, 22 May 2001. Starts out OK, enough aroma’s - malty sweetness & hops, but soon becomes bland, with a rather neutral taste and nothing going on in the finish.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: On tap. Clear golden in colour with no head. Feels thin. Slightly hoppy and slightly malty and a somewhat dry finish.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: tap at the brewpub-flacoalto nailed my first comments on this beer-no head and no aroma to speak of. I almost snorted this beer while trying to get an aroma. pretty boring beer we hvae here-pours a copper hue with no head. no aroma as i stated. flavors are really off-caramel apple. this has been sitting on the tapper for a long time.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: This beer is a brilliantly clear light copper color and it has no head on it. I can’t really pick up anything in the aroma of this beer, it is like smelling water. The taste is lightly sweet, and is pretty light on the palate as well. There is a hint of a caramel note to it, and this is joined by a hint of spicy hops in the finish. Again there is really not much here, though there is perhaps a bit of bitterness in the finish.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: Copper color with a very small head and lacing. Aroma and flavor of light malt with a watery body.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: Sampler. More of a darker gold color. Some musty malt aroma. Tatste well man thought this one was watered down abit.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: This beer, and others from this brewery, are certainly better than anything BMC has to offer, but nothing to write home about. This amber ale is clear, dark yellow w/ a slightly malty flavor. There isn't much more to it than that. It's a fairly benign beer, but nothing special.

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: Light for an amber, but decent maltiness and body...........................

name: Copper Canyon Amber Ale
review: Good beer as ambers go, decent malts and a fair hop floral nose. Medium bodied and decent flavor, a step up from thier Blond Ale.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: On tap. Clear light ambercoloured with no head. Hoppy and slightly malty. Grassy notes that leads to a bit of a dry finish.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: tap at brewery. pours an orange hue with great cascading lacing from a white head. citric hop notes in the aroma with tones of pineapple, grapefruit, and some grainy malts. subtle tangerine note as well. taste is very jucy, with all these citric notes coming out. light oxidization but not offensive. pretty good munich malt base here. this beer is pretty solid and a step away from something great.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: This beer is a clear copper-amber color, it has a ring of a pale head around the glass. There is a slight aroma of citrus here, most notably grapefruit. The taste is light and off-dry, but it has a nice tingling bitterness to it that is evident on my tongue. There is a malty caramel note in the finish that is quite nice, though it is subtle. I get notes of lemon, currants, and pine. This is one of the better beers here.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: Dark amber with a nice thick white head and lacing in the pint glass. Flavor of malt and lots off hops. Flavor was all hops, citrus and grapefruit. Very good IPA.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: Sampler. Well will have to go back and get a full glass because this one tasted just like the Amber Ale, watery. Maybe the bar maid gave me two of the same beers in my sampler.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: I had this at the Great Arizona Beer Festival in Phoenix. It was nothing special.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: Decent beer. Not the best pale ale, but not the worst. Good hoppy taste and smell.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: THis beer is listed as an IPA on Copper Canyon's menu & I'd have to agree. Definitely some citrus/grapefruity hoppy nose & taste going on here. It is a clear golden color w/ a decent hoppy/citrus nose & flavor. It is a respectable west coast IPA. Nice, but not outstanding.

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: Great hop flavor and bitterness. By far the best Copper Canyon beer........

name: Copper Canyon Arizona Pale Ale
review: Now we are getting someplace, the IBU's are climbing. Hops and more hops in this beer, but to be fair there is a nice malt sweetness that lingers under my hops.

name: Copper Canyon Jackrabbit IPA
review: Backlog, from notes. On tap @ the brewpub, 22 May 2001. Hoppy aroma, with some malty sweetness & fruits. Flavor is getting there: nice moderate hop bitter. Finish is full on bitter. OK!

name: Copper Canyon Jackrabbit IPA
review: Her we go. After my sampler plater was complete I had a full glass of this one. Had a good floral aroma. Copper color body with of white head some lacing. Had a decent citrus flavor. Good balance to this one refreshing yet a little dry finish. Best beer of the place.

name: Copper Canyon Jackrabbit IPA
review: Draught @ the 5th Annual Strong Beer Festival in Scottsdale, Arizona. Orange in color with a large and dense head of foam. An aroma of hops mainly, with hints of apricot, pine and grain, nuts and cereal. Very dry and hoppy (lemon, grass, apricot, pine) with a miserable amount of malt contribution (grain) and a lingering finish. Not very good, quite honestly.

name: Copper Canyon Jackrabbit IPA
review: A very good IPA. Once again, Copper Canyon is true to style with color, aroma, appearance, etc. It did seem to add a little more hop punch than "standard" IPAs.

name: Copper Canyon Jackrabbit IPA
review: 3rd on my list of style favorites are IPA's, if there's a problem with this beer is that it's not always available. Big hop floral nose and a decent malt grainy sweetness that balances nicely, If it's available, and you like IPA's you will like it big time.

name: Copper Canyon Leapin Lizard Light Ale
review: Good beer, for beginners, way to light for me. Decent in all respects. to me minimal hops and malts, but clean and crisp.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Draught at the pub. Golden color with a pinkish hue. Aroma is raspberry and slight hops. This beer actually has a strong malt background, some complexity, maybe a british variety added. Raspberry flavor is up front but not overwhelming or syrupy. Not very tart, semi-dry. Good enough for a second one. Refreshing.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: On tap. Clear light pinkish in colour with no head. Totally sweet and sticky. Rasberry and a bit hoppy in flavour - oh and did I mention sweet? Feels a bit sharp.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: tap at brewery-pours a golden yellow with a pink tinge as well from the flavoring. some good lacing and head retention i must say. raspberry cough surup aroma, but not that offensive honestly. flavors are sweet raspberry and a fizzy carbonation makes this beer pretty dry. not bad and not offensive for what it is. the chic beer for the mullets!

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: This beer is a clear light copper color and it has a wispy pale head on it. There is a hint of raspberry color to the beer as well. The aroma is dominated by a strong raspberry note, and nothing else. The beer is pretty dry, which helps to keep the dominant raspberry note in check. There is also a slight acidity in the finish, which seems to be from the raspberries. This beer is certainly dominated by the raspberry notes, not much else here. If this was sweet I would most likely hate this as it would be too much with the raspberry and all, luckily it is just dry enough to be drinkable.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Very odd tasting beer. Aroma of raspberry with a very watery body. Flavor started with raspberry but finishe with the heavy taste of handcream on the palate. Blah!

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Aroma is of raspberry. Flavor was watery raspberry maybe I just had the worst sampler that any one has rated. Not to impressed.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Usually, raspberries impart a tart/sweet combination that can work well in beers. In this case, they didn't. It does have a nice raspberry aroma and, it isn't a bad looking beer, BUT it tasted like a sweet raspberry soda. If you've ever had one of those Hansen's fruit sodas, then you know what this beer tastes like.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Too tart and absolutely no body. I'm not a big fan of fruit beers, but this is worse than average for that style.

name: Copper Canyon rAZbeery Ale
review: Beeter than average fruit beer. Tart and crisp, the hops add a lot to this beer, great aroma and fine fruit and malt flavors.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: tap at brewpub-this beer poured dark brown with a fizzy beige head. some roast, char and mocha aromas that were match one for one on the flavors. this beer is pretty heavy on the roast and not enough on the chocolate. pretty one dimensional, but not bad. body is fluffy and has a good mouthfeal. actually, this beer scored a little better than the red, but i liked the red better.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: This beer is a clear brown-amber color and it is topped by a thin wispy light brown head. Again the aroma is quite muted here. Finally though I have found a little bit of flavor in one of these beers. There are some good notes of chocolate to this porter. This beer is light on the palate, thought this is the thickest beer that I have had from this brewery. There is a soft sweetness that accompanies the dominant chocolate note. There is some soft fruitiness here as well, I get notes of currants, raisin, caramel and some toasted malt notes. There is a bit of bitterness in the finish, which seems to be a combination of hops and dark malt.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: Black with a decent head. Roasyy malt and coffee aroma and rich roasty flavor. A bit to thin but worth a full glass.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: This was actually the first one that got my attention on the sampler plater. Had the sweet malty aroma of a porter. Dark body. Rich malty sweet flavor. Not to bad of beer. Worth a full glass sometime.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: A nice, robust porter bursting at the seams with roasty flavors and aromas. Coffee, toffee, some grassy hops at the end. It warmed to become vinous.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: This porter is light/medium bodied and brown colored. It's not transparent, but you can certainly see more than what you would in a typical porter. It did have a nice roasty-toasty nose and flavor, but the thin body did a take a bit away from it, IMHO.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: The pour creates a full, white head. no lacing to speak of. Dark ruby (when held to light) color. Slightly sweet nose, no aromas that stand out. Flavor is full and roasty. Nice coffee finish. Thin palate. Worth getting again and trying the others.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: Great head, good lace. Dark brown as expected, very smooth with deep coffee undertones.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: Not a bad porter. Nice appearance, average aroma and flavor. This was a very true to style porter, but nothing stood out. Went great with the burger I ordered.

name: Copper Canyon Penta-Yum Porter
review: A very nice porter. There are plans to open a Copper Canyon near my house. I look forward to trying their other offerings.

name: Copper Canyon Stout
review: The aroma is sweet and toasty. A very smooth medium bodied stout. Has the typical coffee and chocolate flavors but these stimulate the palate. The bitter roasted malts give it a nice ending. A nice respectable beer.

name: Copper Canyon Stout
review: A decent stout. Not as opaque as I would like. Really wasn't full-bodied like I would expect. Good roasty flavor.

name: Copper Canyon Stout
review: A very representative Oatmeal Stout, smooth and creamy with a great dry roasted malt flavor, big nose that hints of chocolate and coffee. Adequate hops adds to the unique qualities of this beer.

name: Greyhawk (Copper Dragon)
review: This rich dark Oatmeal Stout proves to be Carbondale’s best. A combination of a mildly fruity taste giving way to a dark rich nutty aftertaste makes this beer great from the time it hits your lips until the time it reaches your belly.

name: Copper Tank Copper Light
review: I actually had some respect for this beer. For a little it wasn't bad. But that doesn't say much. Light nose, pale gold color, low head. Light lemony ale and low bitter. The balance is on.

name: Copper Tank Copper Light
review: Yep. It's light. On everything. Including flavor. Now I have to come up with 75 characters to fill the review.

name: Copper Tank Copper Light
review: Yes, this is the obligatory lite beer that must be served if you want RateBeerians to think your brewpub is weak. Most brewpubs would serve a Blond Ale instead. Extremely mild.

name: Copper Tank Copper Light
review: The mandatory light beer that every brewery must have to keep the chicks coming. Blaugh...a friend of mine put it appropriately when he said, "Makes Coors Light seem like it actually has taste".

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Pours reddish-brown with little head. Some maltiness and nuttiness in both aroma and flavor. Very thin, kind of just a light american beer with more color. I didn’t like this one much at all.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Had on tap at the Copper Tank Brewery in Austin,Tx. Dark ruby red to dark brown appearance. Thin, slightly mocha colored head, slight lacing. Aroma has some nutty notes. Flavor has some strong chocolate notes which are quite nice and surprisingly strong. Some nutty notes come through as well. Finish is a bit weak.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Poor showing overall. Light nose, auburn color, no head. Cherry fruitiness and a some nutty roasted malt tones. Metallic bitter end. Thin. Haphazard balance.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Okay, there is some head and a bit of lace. Not strong in the flavor department, but was good.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Slight notes of bitterness yet a touch watery. Adequate. Oh yes, and a bit nutty.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Looks kinda like red tea and doesn't taste all that different! Flat. Vague nutty tastes.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Soap-like tackiness and astringency. Vaguely hoppy finish, but there was nothing to it, especially when set against my pulled pork sandwich on day-old bread (and cold french fries)--in fairness, this was the day after Thanksgiving. (on tap at Austin location)

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: good stuff! Went down smooth, chocolate notes. Like newcastle with a pulse

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: A nice brown...not in the same class with Newcastle...very smooth and very drinkable. Didn't taste any chocolate though.

name: Copper Tank Big Dog Brown Ale
review: Dark brown. Caramelly maltiness, rather sweet, and - yes, a hint of chocolate. Medium bitterness.

name: Copper Tank River City Raspberry Ale
review: What the fluck? Why don't you cocksuckers geet a real goddamn beer and quir pussying around with fucking raspberries. One of my fucking rules...no raspberries in my fucking beer. shove thee raspberries up your ass you bunch of cocksuckers. you bunch of shilly shit raspberries eating homos. as;;;;kjkja;liwubzdn

name: Copper Tank River City Raspberry Ale
review: Light bodied sweetish ale with a too sweet flavour of raspberries. No, this is not my cup of tea.

name: Copper Tank River City Raspberry Ale
Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Dark copper appearance, decent sized white head with adequate lacing. Slight floral nose; not unpleasant. Grapfefruit citrus flavor is prominent and there is not much of a balancing malt background - more akin to an IPA in my opinion. Mouthfeel has the proper thickness for an APA. Overall, mark this as decent - would drink again.

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Copper Tank is the weak step-sister to Austin's Bitter End Brewery. This pale ale is somewhat thin and rather mild. An unchallenging beer with good Cascade usage.

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Dark orange with soapy aroma and as-promised soapy flavors. Weak attempt at a pale ale!

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Nice head, solid well-rounded beer with bitterness and hop flavors typical of an APA. A nice example of the style, satisfying against the food they serve (BBQ). (on tap at Austin location)

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Typical american pale ale. Orange coloured, medium bodied, dry, big flowery hop aroma. I've had at the Dallas location.

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: I'd rather have a Sierra Nevada, but this is definitely not a bad pale ale for a buck per 8 ounces! I know, I know, those words are usually an excuse to buy things like Sam Adams, but this is really decent beer, especially for something brewed in Texas.

name: Copper Tank White Tail Pale Ale
review: Just the right amount of hoppiness. I love the cascades!!! Goes down very smooth for a Pale Ale. Good atmosphere, good beer, Copper Tank is the place to be in Austin, TX!

name: Coronado Brewhouse Blonde
review: got this on tap at marriotts in san diego, gas lamp district. pour is a clear golden with small white head, very good lacing. smell is faint, some floral, citrus, yeast. taste is creamy, some citrus, wheaty on the back-end, it has surprisingly bitter touch to it.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Restrained aroma with cloudy light gold colour. Followed with a full, well rounded flavour (with just a hint of banana).

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Draft at the brewery. Pours hazy yellow gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like wheat, cracker malt, creamy lemon. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like creamy wheat, light lemon, herbs.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Keg at the Coronado Island taproom, 13/11/14. Clear pale blonde with a moderate off white swirl and edgeing. Nose is yeast esters, clove, lemon rind, spice, corriander. Taste comprises banana, yeast, candied fruit, lemon rind. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Ok hefe.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Lemon fruit aroma with some wheat. Pretty wheaty beer, but it’s not too bad. It actually has some flavor to it.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Decent hefe, not very interesting. Cloudy gold pour, citrus, banana, wheat, light pepper, and yeast.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Didn’t really pick up much German Hefe notes in the nose. Mostly wheat, light fruity sweetness, some citrus notes, and an earthy peppery hop presence. Pours cloudy golden orange with a thin head. The flavor starts with wheat and cereal notes then moves in to a light fruity sweetness followed by some quenching crispness and a light earthy peppery bitterness in the finish. Nice quenching brew with lively carbonation. Was looking for a little more yeasty twang and notes akin to a Bavarian Wheat though.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: Sample at the brewery. Pours cloudy orange, white head. Aroma / taste, hoppy, some spices, saaz hops, metallic finish with some yeast, and light citrus hops.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: On draft. Cloudy orange hue with big thick head. Light fruity and banana aroma. Flavor is subdued for the style, wheat and fruit flavors dissipate quickly leaving a sweet citrus tang in the finish. Creamy smooth texture with fair drinkability, a decent beer that misses the typical hefe phenols.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: A nice average hefeweizen. Fruity and sweet. Nice color and hue. On draft at a sushi joint in San Diego.

name: Coronado Islandweizen
review: (11/5/08) Draught sample at the brewpub in Coronado. Cloudy orange color, served with a slice of lemon. Weak aroma with a bit of wheat and fruity esters. Sweetish flavor with yeast, some fruits, and a slightly bitter finish with some hoppy hints. Light to medium body.

name: Coronado Silver Strand Steam Ale
review: Bready caramel malt aroma. Amber with a moderate off-white head. Caramel malt and herbal hops flavor. Body on the light side of medium, average carbonation.

name: Coronado Silver Strand Steam Ale
review: Backlog, from notes. On tap @ the brewpub, 10 May 2001. Some of everything in the aroma: malts, caramel, hops. Light sweet taste, mild bitter finish. Very nice!

name: Coronado Silver Strand Steam Ale
review: I put this side by side with an Anchor and the difference was so wide that I didn't really need to. Fuller in body and flavor, caramel malts and accompanying hop balance put this close to the amber ale style. Still holds that refreshing lager drinkability.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: The aroma had citrus, grapefruits, and a malty sweetness. The beer poured a clear orange/yellow color w/ no head or lace. The flavor had caramel, malts, citrus, and a hint of grapefruits. The mouthfeel was light and crisp.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Type: Draft Glass: Half-pint glass From: Coronado Brewing Company in Coronado, Calif. (San Diego) Price: $3.00 Misc.: Had on Jan. 21, 2013 Poured a copper orange color with one finger of off-white head when I got it. Nice even layer of foamy lacing all the way down. Nice retention. Smelled more like an IPA than a pale ale. Got the citrus hops - orange and tangerine. Sweet lemon grass as well. Tasted wet Cascade hops, citrus hops - orange, tangerine and lemon, caramel malts and a buttery finish. Medium-to-light body. Creamy texture. Average-to-lively (above average carbonation). Abrupt watery finish. A decent start to my day. A good, but not great pale ale.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: (tap at brewpub) amber with white head. Mild hops aroma. Flavor was floral hops with caramel malt.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: A clear orange/amber colored beer, with a off white head. The aroma of fruits like citrus/orange, with hop bitter. The taste of fruity sweet, orange/mango, ith soft hop notes. The aftertaste is sweet with some hop bitters.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Orange with a white head. Toasted malt and light citrus aroma. Flavor was mostly bready malts with a light floral and citrus note. Medium sweetness. Not bad but not one I’ll care to revisit.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: On tap at the Brewpub. Gold in color with a flowery aroma. Sweet flavor. Smoother than the Island Pale Ale but still good and hoppy.. Great balance and a drinkable session beer.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Draught @ Beer Saurus, Tokyo. Rated on 07.09.2011 Aroma is light and a bit weird for PA. It has bready malt and just slight hops. Flavour has honey and bready malt. Some resin-like hops too. A bit weird PA, not good.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Draft at Isaac Newtons. Amber pour with some light head. Caramel and some light earthy and dry hop tones, amongst a bit of oxidation, and cardboard like tones.

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Clear amber color/ ivory head. Mild floral hop, pale malt aromas. Medium bodied with avg. co2. Mild, lightly sweet caramel malt flavors with mild floral hoppage--mild--

name: Coronado Four Brothers Pale Ale
review: Over tha past few weeks I’ve drawn to 4BPA as a shift drink. Medium bitterness, attractive amber appearance and a pleasant flavor. Just right in every way including the alcohol percentage.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: On tap at brewpub named Nuclear Nimitz. Reddish with a decent enough head after I pour it into another pint glass. Unfortunatly the flavor has a burnt caramel thing going on and not in a good way. Hoppy with some cinnamon.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: On tap at Coronado Brewery. Interesting beer, pours a deep amber. Has spicy aroma as well as spicy flavor, not bad a must try.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Reddish brown with no head. Sweet malty aroma. Bready taste some banana sweetness and a rye bread taste to the finish.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Draft at brewery. Nice aromas of hops and toast. Flavors fell off a bit as it seemed a bit watered down. Some more toastiness in the flavor and a decent hop bite. OK

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Drafted at CBC under the name Reagan Rye. This beer had a slight rye to the nose, and tasted a little like the seed as well. Smooth and easy to drink.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Draft sample at CBC under the name of USS Reagan Rye. Clear amber color pour with a moderate fizzy white head that mostly lasted and had good lacing. Good sour citrus and spice aroma. Medium body with a thin texture. Medium balanced flavor with a light bittersweet finish of short duration.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: On tap @ Coronado. Waitress called this one the ’Ronald Regan’ Rye. I assume it is the same one. Poured a Medium, hazy yellow with a small white head. You can taste and smell the rye. Light stirus as well.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Golden amber appearance. Grainy malt aroma. Sweet malty flavor, light touch of peppery spice. Moderate bitterness in the finish.

name: Coronado Reggae Rye
review: Had at the brewpub. I think they renamed this to "Riptide Rye" but I rated it here as this is already in the RB database. Poured a clear red/amber color and a nice medium rocky head. Aroma is somewhat hoppy with some rye detected. The flavor is quite pleasant. The rye flavor is barely detectable but adds a subtle but interesting taste. Medium body with a fair amount of alcohol noticable on the swallow. A decent beer.

name: Coronado Mermaid's Red Ale
review: Color ámbar con tintes anaranjados de espuma media y cremosa. Aromas a azúcar quemada, hierbas silvestres, caramelo, toffee, cebada tostada, cereales, almendras y bizcocho, café y cacao, hojas de té. Sabor cremoso, persistente, balsámico, amable, amargor suave al final Toffee, hierbas silvestres, cebada, ruda, manzanilla, caramelo, chocolate bitter, mocca, hojas de té negro. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Coronado Mermaid's Red Ale
review: As soon as I poured this, I felt that it may be a bad bottle. Not much fizz and came out murky and color of the Suwannee River. Still had some carbonation and flavor, which saved this beer...but I could tell something was off. Texture a little heavy and flavor has a slight sour to it. Still decent though of caramel malt...mild bitter hop at the end. Just an average amber. I'd bump up the rating a few points if fresh.

name: Coronado Mermaid's Red Ale
review: Fruit aroma hop, a little caramel. Muddy, dark brown beer, foam a little brown. In the taste of fruit, pine, caramel. In the aftertaste of a slight bitterness. Body average, carbonation average.

name: Coronado Mermaid's Red Ale
review: Draft. Pours reddish copper with off-white and lacing. Nose of bread crust, chestnuts, and pine. Bread crust malt with chestnut and pine notes. Medium finish. Medium body.

name: Coronado Tent City Tan
review: (Draft: Coronado Brewing Co. in Coronado, CA) Tent City Tan, which according to the menu used to be called Red Rock Amber, looks pretty ruddy for an amber ale, and it’s a fairly dark amber too. The small, off-white head settles to a perfectly even, filmy layer. The nose just isn’t very aromatic at all, and no particular aromas jump out at me. It just smells a little sweet and caramely, like most brewpub ambers. The flavor is also quite generic: lightly caramely, lightly sweet, somewhat grainy and gently bitter. Just not much going on here. Balanced but boring. Medium-bodied and fairly clean and crisp for an amber. The dense curtain of lace on the glass dissipates at a much slower rate than the head. Yup, another boring, generic brewpub special, not worth drinking the rest of the pint.

name: Coronado Tent City Tan
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours dark amber in color with a thick off-white head. Has a bit of a citrus aroma. Perhaps a bit of coriander? Good bitterness and GREAT lacing. Spots form atop the head. Finishes with a low-tartness lingering bitter bite. Nice.

name: Coronado New Scots Ale
review: Backlog, from notes. On tap @ the brewpub, 10 May 2001. Red-brown color. Aroma’s: malts, some fruit, a little dusty (cork?). Flavor is lightly sweet, fruity. The cork flavor was a bit off, but solid otherwise.

name: Coronado New Scots Ale
review: Now called "Hop Scotch Ale" at the brewery. Pours dark copper with no head. Aroma is caramel and some malt. Good peatiness up front that bleeds into caramel and sweeter malts. Wanted more, but still a pretty good beer.

name: Coronado New Scots Ale
review: Called Sotally Tober on draft at brewery in Coronado, CA: Dark ebony color, nose of sweet caramel, just caramel, oh, and a bit of earthy peat. The flavor is chewy and light in intensity. A bit of malt but underhopped. Decent tail and finish.

name: Coronado New Scots Ale
review: Draft at the brewpub: Pours a dark brown color with a small tan head. Lacing is quite good. Aroma is oak and whisky. Sweet malt and biterness also around.
