review: malty aroma. sun-like brown appearance, translucent. tastes really good, sweet malty with pretty (floral) hops and such. feels good, creamy, full, but a bit dry in the end. overall, very good, but nothing too great. reminded me of a maltier , sweeter anchor steam that seemed to be alot more full. well, that's strange.

name: H.C. Berger Indego Pale Ale
review: Dark golden color. Malty aroma. Malts are ever present on the palate and in the aftertaste. Different from an American pale.

name: H.C. Berger Indego Pale Ale
review: Poured an red-tan body with a white head. Some lacing. Lots of hops in the nose. Some sweetness in the nose too. Nice balance between the malt and hop. The maltiness is a little more pronounced than the hops even. This beer really works just from the balance. A bit fizzy on the mouth though.

name: H.C. Berger Indego Pale Ale
review: 3/30/03: bottle. orange-red color. sour apple taste. not what i’m used to in an american pale ale. darker color than expected. no lacing noted.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: From old tasting notes. Opaque black color. Small creamy beige head. Rich smoky malt aroma. Creamy sweet roasted malt flavor. Nice underlying smokiness. Big chewy malty stout.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: I know this brewery is discontinued, but I feel I should pay some respects. From memory I always liked this beer. Of course I was in my early 20s and new to the craft beer idea. These guys were one of my first introductions. NOTE: I am rating the average as not to affect the overall percentile.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: 12oz bottle-A black body with a tan head and an aroma of chocolate. Taste of the same with the chocolate being very prominent. Good tasting stout. I miss this brewery.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: Date: 03/08/1998 Mode: Bottle Source: Total Beverage, DC black, scant tan head, sweet malt aroma, strong chocolate malt flavor, slight bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: Old notes. Dark, tan head that thins quickly; opaque black/brown color. Intense chocolate aroma with a touch of dryness and some hazelnuts. A slightly sour chocolately, sweet character (probably from too low a pH). Finishes sweet with a slight roast character. More of a porter than a stout.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: How did you find this one Shag? It wasnt bad but the bottle was probably old. It was chocolatey more than anything. A bit watery but not bad at all. RIP.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: How I managed to stumble across this is beyond me. But low and behold there was a lonely 6 pack sitting on the shelf. The beer poured like motor oil. Dark black appearance with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate. Its slighty bitter with a heavy chocolate taste. Some sourness is present in the aftertaste. Not a bad stout at all.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: Dark as night color. Minimal head. Malty aroma. Rich chocolate flavor with hints of caramel. Soft on the palate, not much texture from a stout. Very drinkable though.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: Black beer with a thin, oily film on top. Strong roasted nose with big hints of vinegar. Dark bitter chocolate tastes but also burnt caramel sweetness. Decent, but disjointed. And now its gone.

name: H.C. Berger Chocolate Stout
review: Nice deep dark choolate syrup/motor oil pour. Fresh, molasses, pruney like aroma, bit of chocolate to sweeten it up. Thick, dark pour with a caramel color head and a fair amount of lacing. Excellent stout flvaor - hint of bittersweet chocolate and burnt coffee. Flavor does not let up throughout the entire 12 oz - does not sour or bitter up. Overall - an excellent stout! Thanks Aurelius for this one.

name: H.C. Berger Red Raspberry Wheat Ale
review: Had this beer on 2/8/1998. Color is a burnt orange, average carbonation and very little head. Aroma has the scent of fresh raspberries. Taste is light and refreshing with good tones of raspberries coming though. It starts off with a light crisp body, going down smooth and clean. Finish is a nice raspberry with a light bitterness that balances things off well. This is a great summer beer it goes down smooth and would really quench your thirst on a hot day.

name: H.C. Berger Red Raspberry Wheat Ale
review: 12oz bottle-One of the first flavored wheat I ever tried. It was a nice balance between the flavors and was not overpowering in the fruit aspect.

name: H.C. Berger Red Raspberry Wheat Ale
review: Nice balanced raspberry beer. Not terribly fruity, good flavor though. Nice aroma of berries and malt. Nice beer.

name: H.C. Berger Red Raspberry Wheat Ale
review: Hmm, as far as Raspberry Wheat beers go, this one is about my favorite so far. Nicely balanced with the sweetness and bitterness. Definitely fruit beer, but not overwhelmingly so. It’s not Leinie’s Berry Weiss, in other words.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Dark Brown Coloring. Hard to Detect Aroma as it Was a Smokey Joint, But Tasted Nuts so It Was Probably in the Aroma as Well. Malty. Very Decent Brew.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Dark brown color with a thin head. Slight nut aroma. Pretty rich malt flavor and solid nut presence as well. Some chocolate as well. Good example of a brown.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Dark brown body. Soda-shop malt flavor with notes of dark chocolate, brown sugar and leafy hops. Chocolate-malt aroma. I liked this chocolately rendition of a brown.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Little aroma but a nutty taste. Very sweet & malty but unbalanced, even for the style.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Nice dark brown color with fl;oral aromas. Unlike most browns not too sweet. Very nice. Love the name.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: light mohagany body, thin tan head. hazlenuts and sweet chocolate. sweet and nutty, but weak in body and lacks in depth. a cardboardey finish.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Chestnut color with a light tan head. Caramel nose with slight undertone of herbal hops. Flavors towards the caramel/toffee malt side with just a bit of hops to balance. An average brown.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Initially very crisp but flavor quickly dissapates to nothing. Beautiful amber (not brown by far) hue, not nutty at all. Thin.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: Dark ruby brown in color. Very smooth and rich, with an average nutiness. Very fresh, dry finish. Nice complexity but slightly lacking in omph.

name: Angelic Shakedown Brown
review: This brewery offers mediocre beers at best. This brown was okay, sweet and an appropriate hop balance. It didn''t encourage us to stick around for more however.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Cloudy Light Orange Coloring with Light Tan Head. Hoppy Aroma.. Wet Hops..Sweet and Bitter Taste... Nice and Subtle.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Murky amber color with a thin head. Slightly floral aroma. Taste of fresh grains with some extreme bitterness, but lacking the floral hops which I found to be nice. Very fine amber.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: The old Believers Bitter. I found out the name was changed because a consultant was hired and indicated that people did not want a "bitter" beer. THey indicated that sales have increase significantly since. For a city that prides itself on policital correctness and intelligentsia, you have to love the naivete. Copper color with a light cream colored head. Light fruit and citrus nose. Caramel, earthy malt and light fruit. A decent brew and now that it is an amber, better than most.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Sampled at Angelic brewery. Wonderful, hoppy, caramelly aroma, smooth. Nice red color. Small, off-white head. Nice flavor. Impressive.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Clear copper body with small off-white head. Aroma is floral and medium sweet (peach). Taste is minimally sweet, peach, earthy/floral, finishing decent earthy bitter. Medium body.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Medium brown color, with a slightly nutty scent. This would have been a fine beer if it was their brown ale, which it wasn't. This tasted a lot like Newcastle. Not a bad beer, but not great, and certainly not to style.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: I tried this beer at a "no crap on tap" block party fundraiser for a local independent radio station (5/18/03). I really enjoyed the beer and detected none of the negative tastes others experienced in the posts below. To me, the beer tasted like a nicely-hopped pale ale with a somewhat fuller & maltier body. Very nice in my estimation.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Nice bitterness, although slightly off balance. Medicinal. Somewhat of a dry, toasty finish.

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: Something went wrong with this beer. It should have never made it to the taps. Very medicinal flavor and distorted tastes. Ugh! My girlfriend made the mistake of buying a pint and felt sick all night after drinking it. Bad batch or bad recipe? Who knows? I just know this one sucked!

name: Angelic Arch Amber
review: This beer looked OK in the glass--a rather standard deep copper with minimal head. Hops were revealed in the nose and provided a welcoming floral fragrance. So far so good.... I lifted and drank and then quickly considered spitting it out as if this was wine tasting. This beer was horribly medicinal. The taste had an almost antiseptic character. The aftertaste offered no escape as the strong doctor's office feeling came along for the swallow. Nasty!

name: Angelic Harvest Moon Hefe-Weizen
review: Stopped by Angelic, and this was the only one of their beers they had on tap. Apparently they are moving their operations off site so they can bottle their beer (YAY). One of the better Hefe’s I’ve had in a while. Made me smile.

name: Angelic Harvest Moon Hefe-Weizen
review: Yellow-orange and very cloudy with a thin, and creamy white head. Very light aroma with some tiny hints of banana. Nice sweet wheaty flavor with some banana and a hint of clove spiciness. A hint of grassy hop flavor comes out in the finish, but only if you pay real close attention. Dry with good carbination. Not too complex but not bad.

name: Angelic Harvest Moon Hefe-Weizen
review: Cloudy yellow, medium head; lowish carbonation, fairly malty though not all that sweet; faint banana/lemon notes throughout. Finish rather dull.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: This 09-05 bottled Sake from a bottle shop poured a head of no head clear colored bubbles that were and left behind a uncarbonated . The mild aroma was polished rice. The mouth feel was tingly at the start with a mediumly tingly finish with a soft dry aftertaste. The mild flavor contained notes of mild nail polish vinous and semi-sweet. It has a very mild alcohol burn to it. An OK Sake typical and nothing special.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Bottled. Clear and very pale golden. Yeasty rice-aroma. Stale. Flavour from yeast with stron alcohol. Oily palate.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: [i]Bottle (30 cl), at a Göteborg RB tasting[/i]. Clear pale golden. Alcoholic aroma with notes of banana, pears, and some oily notes. Very smooth mouthfeel.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: (300 ml bottle, thanks rigk!) Oily pear color, pretty much clear. Butter, pear, wood, alcohol scent. Pear, hazel nut and alcohol taste. Warming alcohol. Alcohol and nutty aftertaste.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Honestly, I have no idea how to rate this. Bottle. Totally clear, no head at all. Potato and rice aroma, with alcohol. Some apples in flavor, but most of all alcohol, rice and potato peels. I have no idea how this is supposed to be, and I dont feel like trying many sakes after this...

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Bottle. Aroma is rice, wet cardboard. Flavour is rice, alcohol, mild, wet card board. Weird taste but still drinkable.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Bottle. My second time ever to taste sake. This is really not enough experience to rate this, but you got to start somewhere. The body is pale and clear, I really can’t see anything wrong with this, but believe I should try to follow the more experienced rater and go for the more average 3-point appearance. The aroma is strong; the first impression really reminds me about a bad moonshine experiment from the deep, dark woods of Norway. A little more detailed analysis of this is a distinctive alcohol flavor, alcohol with fusel. It could also give a feeling of sweet overcooked rice and old, wet, moldy newspapers. Flavor gives much the same impression as the aroma. Not a very pleasant experience but interesting. I really don’t know what you are expected to eat together with this, but we tried with some salmon, and the sake actually tasted better. Have to sample some other sakes later, particularly together with someone more experienced.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: 300 ml bottle. Crystal clear. Aroma of pears, melon, light yeastiness and some sweet tapioca. A hint of soft spice and perfumey floral notes. Heathery sweetness. Soft texture with pear, melon and pepper flavour. Lightly alcoholic but still balanced and smooth. Tapioca and fruit with an aromatic light fruitiness.

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Bottled. I am not a sake fan, but when I got the opportunity to taste this one, I had to give it a try. Aroma is sweet, with notes that reminds me of cold, overcooked rice, and wet cardboard. It is clear, and with a yellowish color. Flavour has alcohol, rice and some hints of fruit. Should probably taste more sakes and really get to like it before starting to rate them... (051022)

name: Hitorimusume (Only Daughter) Sayaka Junmai Sake
review: Very light; sweet aroma. Slight alcohol scent. Not much taste at first and the alcohol is a little overpowering, though the alcohol bite does not linger long like other mid-qualityJunmais. Must be rolled in mouth for a while before the subtle apple/pear flavors appear. Not a bad drink, have had much worse.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: sweet, mellow dark fruit, spice, a little alcohol aroma. Taste fairly malty, caramel, sweet, a little bitter.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: From bottle. Hazy orange, thin white head. Aroma is sweet wheat, orange, cereal malt, coriander. Taste is wheat, yeasty bread, orange, big malt sweetness, finishes dry.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review:
Burnt orange color. Small soapy head, some lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, alcohol. Flavor has some fruitiness, pretty malty and rich, caramel, alcohol. Banana is absent until it warms. Medium syrupy mouthfeel. Full body. Lingering wheat and malt finish.
…

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: ottle poured a clear orange amber with a small lasting creamy ivory head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, fruittiness, carmel, toffee and light brown sugar. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, carmel, toffee, fruittiness and light spice with a smooth lingering fruity finish.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: Bottle. Hazy yellow/orange pour with a smaller white head. Big banana on the nose.Moderate palate, some carbonation. Taste is banana and a bit of caramel. Nice brew.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: Heavy banana, malts and alcohol in the aroma. The flavor is banana, malts and slightly sour. Although very good as a whole, it was slightly abrasive, still pretty good though.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: Courtesy of northernbrews. Copper with minimal head. Big residuel sweetness/decoction in the nose, followed by banana, not much else. Flavor much the same. Syrup/sweet mouthfeel. Decent overall.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: Pours a brilliant hazy orange. Nice white head. Aroma is very sweet and full of banana. Taste is just as sweet, but not off balance. Very enjoyable.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: Spot on weizen, very fruity aromas and initial taste. The second glass was heavier to drink, this is a tickers’ beer who likes it initially. Still very good, but the fruitiness dissipitates to just very good maltiness. Worth seeking out for fans of the style.Aove average mouthfeel.

name: Capital Square Series Weizen Doppelbock
review: a solid, sweet malty brew. Pours a deep drown amber with an off white head. Almost like a week BW.

name: Portland Brewing Hefeweizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Bavarian Style Weizen--1997 12 oz. Bottle 4.50% ABV. Mild Bavarian Hefeweizen.

name: Portland Brewing Hefeweizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Cloudy light yellow; very crisp banana flavors, tart, sweet and tickly to the palatte. Little of the heavy yeastiness that turns off some.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pours a muddy copper color. Lacks the spices and warmth you’d expect from a holiday ale. Nose and taste is mostly malts, caramels and roasted barley. Rated 1/8/01

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Bobby Dazzler Old London Style Holiday Ale. 1999 12 oz. Bottle. 6.50% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Winter Ale--Clear burgundy brown color. Pours thick with spicy floral hop aroma. Rich spicy cherry toasted body with sweet balanced by spice hop. Crusty hoppy earthy base to roasted flavor that lingers to end. Sampled 11/15/1999. 2000 12 oz. Bottle. 6.50% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Clear bronze red color. Floral coriander spice hoppy front. Rich roasted, mild black cherry fruit, balanced sweet, medium textured body. Good flavor. Clean end with hot hoppy spicy notes. Very Good. Sampled 11/1/2000. 2001-A Bobby Dazzler Top 12 oz. Bottle. 6.50% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Clear rich deep red color. Carbonated front with hoppy toasted mild winter spice. Thin toasted dry black cherry spice body. Crisp aromatic flavor. Lingering toasted mild hop sweet fruit spice end. Subdued. Sampled 11/28/2001. 2001-B MacTarnahans Top 12 oz. Bottle. 6.50% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Clear rich copper amber color. Spicy front with nutmeg hop notes. Crisp tart dry amber ale body. Good lace in nice head. Slightly sweet. Spicy mild hop cinnamon end. Somewhat hoppy. Sampled 2/14/2002. 2001-C Happy Holidays Top 12 oz. Bottle. 6.50% ABV. (3.5 / 5.0) Clear thin copper ruby color. Spicy malty medium floral hop front. Sweet mild caramel maltiness. Lingering sweetness in mild hop finish. Tasty slightly spicy and sweet rich. Sampled /17/2002.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Really old bottle from Liquid Solutions. Used to drink this years ago. Bet it has stayed well. Pours clear, dark, ruddy copper with a decent foamy tan head. Aroma is of really dark fruits. It has changed. Medium body with very mild carbonation. Flavor is chalky, bitter evergreen, muddy malt. Turns up a chocolate note. Love drinking this old stuff. I think this is 8 years in the bottle. Held up well. Especially for 6.5. They should revisit the recipe and revamp it into IS. This will never get there, but it has taken the first step.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Blast from the past here. Dark amber pour with light white head. Very sweet smelling, fruits and malt with very little hop action. Same thing in the flavor, very much a sweeter moderate abv beer. Not really my thing then and definitely not now.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Had this beer on 1/12/2000. Aroma is a rich sweet malt scent. Color is a rich bright amber, carbonation is light with good head. Taste is full and roasted. Starting with a full body it goes down smooth and rich. Finish is a deep roasted flavor backed with a strong hop bitterness. Overall it seems to be a good winter brew.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pours a nice dark reddish amber color. Aromas of HOPS, and some other hints, maybe fruit, maybe caramel. Flavor is a bittersweet, malty, and hoppy with a nice dry finish.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Dark Brown/Red coloring with White Ring. Dried Cranberry, Sweet, and Malty Aroma. Sweet and Malty on Tongue as Well.. Cherry and Cranberry, Dry Ending. Nice.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pours the color of mud. Heavy malt and caramel aroma. Rich malt in the taste with a bit of sweetness and almost a pinch of salt. Simple, but kinda tasty!

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: An interesting brew that i found the other day but hasn’t been around for a while. Pours a dark copper red, very clear, with a white head. Aroma is very strong and sweet, just like a well aged barleywine, big caramel malts, brown sugar. Taste was a big letdown though, very thin body with much less sweetness. There was a bit of oxidation in the finish and some faint spicing. I think this brew is a bit past its prime.

name: MacTarnahans Bobby Dazzler Holiday Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Chestnut color with hues of garnet. Beige smallish head. Spicy hops and moderate malt nose. Roasted and caramel malts with a acidic hop bite. Some light fruits mid quaff. Light feel.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest Marzen Lager--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 6.00% ABV. (2.75 / 5.0) Very clear amber red color. Pours thick. Tasty with medium body and slightly fruity flavor. Few distinctive notes. Just a touch of the characteristic Oktoberfest flavor. Nice clean finish. Sampled 9/10/1998. Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest Marzen Lager--1999 12 oz. Bottle. 6.00% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Clear thin ruby red color. Carbonated medium pour. Smoky hints over earthy rich toasted Oktoberfest body. Crisp classic flavor. Crusty dry malt body has minor fruit. Crisply toasted with spice. Sampled 9/13/1999. Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest Marzen Lager--2000 12 oz. Bottle. 6.00% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Clear bright copper red color. Mild malty fruit front with toasted Oktoberfest notes. Medium body is smooth with good flavor and slight sweetness. Clean Oktoberfest flavor with mild spiciness. Not bad. Sampled 10/29/2000. Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest Marzen Beer--2001 12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Clear thin copper bronze color. Mild toasted malty front. Light head but good lace. Crisp smooth clean slightly creamy malty body. Toasted smoky caramel notes. Clean malt spice end. Nice. Sampled 9/16/2001. MacTarnahan’s Brewing Company--Portland Brewing Company--Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest Marzen Beer--2002 Longneck 12 oz. Bottle. 6.00% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Clear thin copper amber color. Mild malt spice floral front. Crisp smooth mildly toasted sweet fruit caramel Oktoberfest body. Slightly tangy malt end with mild hops. Tasty but mild Oktoberfest. Sampled 9/2/2002.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: MacTarnhan(Portland) Brewing is long standing, respected mico, that has produced rock solid beers over the years. Uncle Otto’s is a fantastic domestic example of marzen/Oktoberfest beer, that had me crying for more. The beer is brewed with six different malts, an authentic lager strain, hopped with Mt. Hood and Saaz hops, then cold lagered for a full two months. This makes for a very authentic, very malty, hearty, delicious beer. Uncle Otto’s Oktoberfest pours to a beautiful, deep amber to chestnut color with a thick and creamy white head and a good bit of carbonation. The nose on this beer is wonderfully malty and aromatic with big sweet malty and nutty aromas balanced with some herbal hop aromas. The palate is full and soft on the tongue with lots of big nutty, sweet malty, and toasty malt flavors that glide over the tongue on a smooth, round, body. This beer is so hearty and flavorful but just so drinkable. Uncle Otto’s finishes with more big nutty/malty flavors up front, then ends with some vibrant herbal/grassy hop bitterness to balance out the sweet malty flavors of this beer. This hearty beer is the perfect match with hearty dishes, from stews, to roasts, to brats, take your pick.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: pours a dark amber color. Aromas of rich caramel, nuts, and hops. Flavors of toffee, fruit, and a finish of subtle hops.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: NOTE: These comments are on a bottle purchased in 2004, and aged until 1/2005. Strong malty aroma, some warming alcohol and fruity esters in the nose. No hop aroma. Deep, warm brown color in the glass, not much head, some belgian lace. The flavor is slightly warm and smooth, with malt dominant and negligible hops. Some raisiney esters in the flavor. Mouthfeel is full and soft, with moderate carbonation. Terrific beer for a cold day -- to make your beer-loving friends’ eyes pop (and release more of the malty aromas and some of the fruity esters in this lovely beer, pop it in the microwave for five to fifteen seconds and drink it slightly warmed.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: red amber frothy hue. malty nose with hints of peaches....gives way to a chewy rich mouthfull, sweet goodness of roasted malted crunch. a good example, yeah! prost to your momma!!

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Notes from last Thanksgiving. Rich deep copper pour, with aroma of caramel malt, toffee, some spices. Tastes as it smells, with some finishing hops and spice.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This beer is bipolar. It starts out a little tart and seems to like that, but suddenly switches to sweet. Normally this would be no big deal; plenty of beers do this. But given that it is an Oktoberfest, this puzzles me somewhat. I guess that’s what you get for let a Scot brew a German spezialty.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottled. Nut brown. Loads of caramel up front. Sweet big crystal malt character and clean mouthfeel. Low bitterness. Not bad, but lacks malt character, and is not even remotely in the style it states.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle purchased in Montana. Who knows if it is fresh or last year’s batch. Malty, oily alcohol aroma. Dark reddish colour. No head excepting a light ring around the edge of the glass. Body is nice but perhaps a touch light for the style. Alcohol presence in the flavour. Nice roasted malt finish.

name: MacTarnahans Uncle Ottos Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I’m assuming that this bottle was old - I just got it last week (in July) - because it was pretty bad, bordering on horrible. I was looking forward to trying it because I really like this style of beer, but I was very disappointed. I hope it was just an old, stale bottle and not the true flavor of the beer.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy yellow gold color topped with a thick rocky white head. Perfumy, sweet malty nose. Light fruity malt accented taste. Tasty hop balance comes through in finish.mzesy and full bodied.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Served on tap at the thirsty pig. Cloudy orange color with a white head. Citrus tropical fruit hops aroma. Grain malt hops aroma. Grain up front malt middle with a bitter finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Portland Ale--1990 32 oz. 5.50% ABV. Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Portland Pale Ale--Genuine Oast Ale 1999 12 oz. Bottle. 4.50% ABV. (3.25 / 5.0) Pale Ale. Clear light bright golden color. Sweet aromatic floral hop front. Thin body still balances hops with sweet caramel malt flavor. Finish is very clean with a hop spiciness missing its bitter side. Sampled 6/2/1999. Portland Brewing Company, Inc.--Portland Pale Ale--Genuine Oast Ale 1999-B 12 oz. Bottle. 4.50% ABV. (3.0 / 5.0) Clear bright golden color. Good head. Light sweet floral hop front. Crisp lightly sweet body with light caramel malt character. Clean sweet dry finish with minimal hop spice flavor. Nice smooth easy light. Sampled 7/12/1999.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Had this beer on 6/14/1999. Color is a bright crystal clear gold with good carbonation and a thin head. Aroma is a sweet malt scent that reminds me of apple juice, there is no hop aroma. Taste is lightly sweet and boring. Starting with a light body it goes down a bit crisp with a very mild malt flavor. The finish is a very light malt flavor with a very mild bitterness. As a Pale its just not good.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: 12oz bottle. Poured a medium golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of citrus, wet grass, and some cookie dough. Tastes of citrus and light carame. Tastes and body on the thin and watery side.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Cigarette ash malty, grassy, watery. Resin/pine spores dust. A bland style I do not like.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Poured from a bottle picked up at a local bar. Don’t know if the beer had been sitting for a while and was skunk, but the taste was pretty bad. Maybe will give it a try again one day, but not anytime soon.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pours a nice orangish color. Aroma is grassy hops. Flavor of a classic pale, big grassy hop flavor.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle: Decent malt aroma of caramel and cookie and the slightest hint of floral hops. Pours a transparent golden-orange with a small white head. Flavor is mostly all malt. Caramel and cookie up front. Light floral hoppiness. A decent pale ale.

name: Portland Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pour is golden with a thin fast fading off white head...smell is resin, corn, grass...taste is grain and sweet corn...this is not good...

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: From old tasting notes. Dark brown, black nearly opaque color with a tan head. Complex roasted malt aroma, reminiscent of scorched coffee and chocolate. Intense roasted malt flavor has intense coffee notes upfront. Rich roasted malt in middle. Toned down hop finish. Full bodied flavor, yet subtle and smooth.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: Rockies Brewing Company--Boulder Brewing--Stout--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 6.00% ABV. (4.1/ 5.0).

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: black in color with no light at all.white head that went away after a minute or so.not much aroma,but lots of good flavor.sweet chocolate,bit of coffe,and maybe a hint of smoke.not bad at all.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: A bit thin and light for a stout, but it has some sweetness and aroma of chocolate, maybe coffee. Very likeable if not entirely enjoyable. The right price and the right circumstances, I might be inclined to try it again.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: Appearance seemed a bit pale. Good rich sweet tones on the flavor end. A good but not great stout.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: Draught. Body is dark brown to black. Aroma is moderately malty (milk chocolate, caramel), with a note of vanilla. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Quite sweet, very chocolatey aroma, almost artificially so in both cases.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: Deep brown to black color, chocolate brown head, nice lace. Nose is toasted grains, caramel, chocolate tones. Start is sweet, the middle medium, the finish is dry, nicely hopped, moderate carbonation, drinkable and a pleasant good not great.

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: no head whatsoever to my bottle, very hoppy aroma...pretty good coffee flavor which lingered VERY long into the aftertaste....a little too hoppy for me in a stout

name: Boulder Beer Stout
review: Very little, if any, head retention. Sweet and chewy, with an almost Porter quality to it. Has a decent flavor, but lacking robustness.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: Best before 6/09...sampled on 8/10/10....but wth, it's only fitty cents! Got on clearance sale at my local retailer, so grabbed bunch of lighter stuff for filler. Hadn't tried this yet, so wanted to know what I'm getting into before buying a 12 pack this fall. I think I like Sammy's Oktoberfest better, but this is ok. Nothing special really, but good economy beer. Will probably have to try fresh to validate this.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: Not the best Oktoberfest, actually one of the weaker German Oktoberfest I’ve had. Thin and a little watery. Biscuit, Carmel, a little lemon zing at the end. Tried for the first time in 2009.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: From Sep 2007 Purchased at Albertson's for US$7.00 a 6 Pack. Pours from 12oz bottle a clear amber gold with a small head of foam that shrinks quickly and leaves a fine broken layer with a bit of lacing. The smell is of roasted malt, biscuit, and a touch of citrus. The taste is pretty bitter up front and it has some notes of biscuit and roasted malt but again, this is a pretty bitter taster for the style. It finishes dry with a short aftertaste and it's a medium mouthfeel with medium-high carbo. First time I've seen this one in many moons and I find it pretty average as a beer and below average for the style. 1 6'er will do it for me.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: This is my all time favorite Octoberfest beer. You can just taste all the different spices throughout but yet its a smooth tasting beer. I look forward to this coming out each and every year

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: 12 Oz bottle in my daughters new house in Laguna Niguel, California on 3rd Feb 2017. Really enjoyed it, good Amber colour, good malty semi-sweet aroma and taste. One of the best O’fest beers outside of the actual, real fest in Munich I can remember ever having.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: 12 oz bottle poured. Saw this bottle, and just had to have it. Copper pour with a lasting foam head. Pretty skunky aroma, straw from quite a distance. Flavor seems to be similar to the regular Becks product, only sweeter. Some caramel addition. A bit of a spicy malt if you sit here, concentrate, and really think about it. Overall, extremely odd, but not discouraging. Drinkable. My biggest regret: not saving this for a larger tasting. Sorry, Mcberko.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: Bottle in Seattle. Thanks Andrew. A Lutton tick if there ever was one! Modest foam, very clear amber Vienna lager. Rotting vegetable aroma. Sweet, disgusting odd malty character. Egg, fermented rotten veg, odd fruitiness. Bright carbonation, at least. Bitter cocoa. Rather disgusting, an insult to the style. Pretty darn similar to the regular becks with a touch of added fruit and disgustingness. Nein, danke.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: 330ml bottle from a Lider supermaket in Providencia. Santiago, Nov. 2016. Pours a clear bright reddish color with a small fizzy white head that diminishes slowly leaving a thin film. Aroma is malty, with a good solid profile showing notes of biscuit, bread, caramel and some fruity touches. Slight hints of apple and pear. Quite good. Taste is light, not overblowing, but solid. Mostly sweet, biscuity, with good bitter balance from (probably) Saaz hops. Herbal and apple touches near the finish. Light to medium body. Highly drinkable. I drank gallons of these in the last few days when meeting some friends. Great when in the mood for a simple, straight-forward lager with character.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: 354 ml bottle. Bought in a Lider supermarket in Santiago. Dark amber/pale color, low head. little smell, some yeast, red fruits, honey sweetness to it. Easy to drink, super sweet ending, and pale beggining, nuts it there. Like a belgium beer without the strength. Well made and balanced. Pretty good value for money.

name: Beck's Oktoberfest
review: (bottle) Samples at Gee’s Oktoberfest last month. I will be generous and say maybe this is much better fresh from the keg in the Deutscheland. But this is a poor offering for the biggest beer celebration on earth.

name: Old Mill Elora ESB (Special Bitter)
review: No head carbination was a bunch that left quickly. Amber looking. Smells bitter and like an ipa. some of the taste and smell reminds me of mad tom ipa from muskoka if I recall right. Up frunt is piny and forest like,backround is grapfruit like and there is bitter in there at some point. Filling. Good for trying out. I have no problem trying out brewerys e.s.b’s but not a style I wanna drink alot of or offten. cheer’s.

name: Old Mill Elora ESB (Special Bitter)
review: Aroma of basically nothing. Appearance was a flat bright clear orange amber. My wife wandered into the room asking if I was drinking Kool-Aid... I wish I was. A very simple beer. Too simple. Sweet and appley with a bit of caramel. Wishy washy finish. Very thin mouthfeel with minimum carbonation.

name: Mary Anne Two Penny Scotch Ale
review: Feeble little sister of the majestic Corne de Brume…Weak bitterness and light caramel body…

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: After reading a bunch of negative reviews, I am thinking that Seadog took out the "Old East", and just calls this "IPA" now. I couldn't find anything labeled just IPA, so am reviewing it here....saw a few on ratebeer.com did the same, as there is no straight IPA listed there. The bottle just says "IPA" and the label is a little different...but it has to be the same. I did notice the aroma to be off, like wet/old dog. Even before reading the reviews, I said "This is not an IPA". More like a off balanced-pale or extra at best.....not quite a copper. Not much citrus...just did not work for me. Was not horrible, I'd say is still drinkable. Just does not seem to live up to what it represents.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: The beer has got a golden colour with a steady had and medium Body. Aroma of hops and pine. taste of hops, pine, spruce, herbs and flowers. Mild finish.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pour a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Soft lemon with a touch of citrus on the nose. Medium bodied, grain and a bit of early bitterness. Soft and easy, not much going on. Long bitterness into the finish.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: Brown amber in colour. In the nose, tiny notes of European hops, notes of resin, underbrush, important presence of caramel, roasting. In mouth is medium - light bodied, with hints of toasted bread, after that a scratchy presence of continental hops and some notes sulphurous. Not very balanced and not super clean ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: Aroma is citrus/fruit, caramel and mild tea. The flavor is citrus, English malts, fruit, tea, hops and a mix of mild bitterness and slight heat in the finish.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: Pours a nice hazy amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with malts and a crisp finish..

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Amber-copper colored with a small head. Aroma is citrus and hints of spruce. Taste was spruce and citrus.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: 355ml bottle from Tasty Life, Xiamen. Pours hazy amber with a thin white head. Aroma of pine with some citrus. Bitter finish.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: 12 fl.oz bottle. Pours clear deep amber colour with a huge most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of strong toasted malt, resinous hops. Taste of resinous hops, citrus, toasted malt, nuts and caramel. Long bitter finish.

name: Sea Dog (Old East) India Pale Ale
review: Bottle, 355 ml from Pivoteka, Zagreb. shared with JFK10000. Pours dark golden with off-white head. Malty, biscuit, floral notes. Sweet with bitterish finish.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: On tap. It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of toffee, caramel and malts. The taste was similar to the aroma with more toffee, caramel, malts and mild carbonation with a mild aftertaste. Ok.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: Draft at Sea Dog Brewpub in Conway, NH. Clear copper color with no head. Good nutty brown ale flavor. Unremarkable, just good.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Deep copper brown color. Rocky beige head. Sweet earthy toasted malt aroma. Crisp dry malt finish leads to a bitter hop finish.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a relatively clear browned amber with a thin white head. Soft malt on the nose, toast, a bit of sweet fruit. Medium bodied, soft malt, toast, a touch of fruit. Soft malt and toast into the finish.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: On tap at Hopjacks. Pours a cloudy amber with thick off white head. The aroma is raisin, honey, and floral. Thin mouth, toffee and caramel, sweet finish, good.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: On tap at Sea Dog brewery in South Portland, Maine. Nice heady mahogany pour. Sweet caramel malty and nutty aroma. Medium body. Malty yeasty flavor with a slight after bite.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: Tap at the Orlando venue. Pours dark copper with a creamy beige head. Aroma is pleasantly fruity. Flavor is malty, but not nutty. It seems floral with some grass, and is decently bitter. Could be a short circuit in my brain, but it suggests Best Bitter.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: Draught. This is a decent little brown ale. By no means my favorite but not bad either.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: Pours a deep clear brown on tap with fluffy tan head that leaves good lace. Aroma is nice toasted nuts and barley, a hint of caramel. Taste follows with notes of chocolate, slight bitterness, sweet finish. Not too bad actually.

name: Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale
review: On tap @ Sea Dog Brewing, Bangor, ME. Pours a clear rusty brown/amber. Aromas very malt dominant with caramel, biscuit, and honey. Tastes are similar with a nice sweet biscuit and honey up front and a gentle bitterness on the finish. Medium body, light carbonation and medium bitter finish. Nice beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Optisch eben Porter, schwarz wie die Nacht. Im Trunk röstig, leicht bitter, dennoch recht süffig. Haselnuss und Schokolade, lecker.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Pours black with thin light tan head. Aroma is roast and hazelnut. Taste is light caramel. Moving to roast and hazelnut. Finish is roast. A decent stout.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Worth the try, but nothing really special here. Tasted like possibly some vanilla in there...not as hazelnutty as I thought it would be, which is OK cause I'm not a big fan of overwhelming hazel. A thinner porter, more on the medium-dark brown side versus near black appearance. Pretty much an average overall beer.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: On tap at Federal Jack's. It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of coffee, nuts and vanilla. The taste was similar to the aroma with more coffee, nuts, vanilla with medium carbonation and a nice chewy aftertaste. Tasty.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Draft at Sea Dog Brewpub in Conway, NH. Clear dark mahogany color with a small off-white head. Good lacing. Smooth. Heavier than average body. Has only a light coffee flavor.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: From old tasting notes. Translucent reddish brown color topped by a rocky beige head. Interesting nutty malt aroma. Soft nutty malt flavor hints at English toffee and cappuccino. Tasty and drinkable.n

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed brown with a thin tan head. Toast, hazelnuts, soft cocoa. Medium bodied, soft cocoa, roast, nuts, chocolate. Gentle toast into the finish.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Some hazelnut, some roast. Not very well put together like knock off leggo. Pours bittersweet. Black pour with decent head. Tap at beer festival.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: Sampled on draft this beer poured a very dark brown color with orange highlights and a medium sized foamy beige head that left no lacing. The aroma was roasty, sourish and off with notes of cocoa and nut. The flavor was buttery, sourish and off with some nut and roasty malts. Medium length finish. Medium body. Not good.

name: Sea Dog Riverdriver Hazelnut Porter
review: (Tap) clear, bright, dark reddish amber colour with a small brown head; aroma of hazelnuts, hazelnut liqueur; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Deep reddish brown color. Bubbly tan head. Complex roasted malt nose. Sweet toasted malt flavor has a fruity character reminiscent of black currants. Very tasty. Chewy malt finish.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Better than expected. Touch of sweetness but still plenty of malt to balance things out.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Had this beer on 2/11/1998. Color is a deep rich red, good carbonation and nice head. Aroma is a mild scent of toasted malts, no noticeable hops. Taste is a heavy but smooth flavor, it stares off with a creamy body full of roasted malt flavors. Goes down well and finishes buy leaving you with a nutty malt taste and a slight hop bitterness. Its a very well rounded beer with rich flavors all the way around. This would be a good beer any time you’re in the mood for a nice full flavored beer.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: 12oz bottle- A medium amber body with a good head and an aroma of malts and slight hops. Taste of the same with a little more hops than malt.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Date: 07/13/2002 Mode: Bottle Source: Brewfest, Athens Dark rusty amber, off-white head, rich malt aroma, rich dry malt flavor, a touch of bitterness, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.8/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Yes, I have found some old notes. Rudy copper color with a moderate off-white head. Simple caramel aromas along with a touch of raisins and floral hops. Flavors follow aromas in simplicity, but things are a touch dryer than the fruit and caramel suggest. A bit like dry toast.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Oh, come on! This is beyond doubt the worst beer I’ve ever tasted. It’s filth. The stench alone is enough to turn most stomachs.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Reddish brown with a very thin head. Nose is slightly vinous, slightly sour with a hint of toffee. Flavor is earthy and slightly medicinal. Not one of my favorites.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Very strong hops in the nose and the sip. Very overpowering. Not very appealing, not my style admittedly. Good appearance and mouthfeel. Just too hoppy for me.

name: H.C. Berger Red Banshee Ale
review: Ruby red in color with a thin head. More malt than hops in the aroma. Reminds me of Killians red, the Coors version. Not bad if you like the style.

name: H.C. Berger Kolsch
review: Picked this up at random at the local shop where it occupied the back of a shelf. Decent reddish color with a thin head. Flavor is a bland malt feel with somewhat strong crispness. Could be better, but it could be fresher.

name: H.C. Berger Kolsch
review: A good, easy to drink intro to the style. Good clean hops with the expected fruit finish.

name: H.C. Berger Kolsch
review: This beer has a nice citrus flavor the right amount bitterness. A tad too sweat.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Had this beer on 7/24/2000. Aroma is a lightly sour malt scent. Color is a pale gold with light carbonation and head. Taste is like a piece of burnt bark. Starting with a medium body it goes down sharp. Finish is BAD, it comes on with a taste that is like burnt malt ground up with stale wood. Overall this may be one of the worst beers I’ve ever had and is definitely the worst beer H.C. has ever made. I just don’t know what they where thinking.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Bottle from Party Town, KY. Poured amber color with a moderate white head that diminished slowly with good lacing. Moderate sweet malty aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Heavy sweet flavor with a sweet finish of average duration. This did not meet my expectations.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Old notes. Light in body, crisp but insipable when cold, as it warms its drinkability increases and the finish weighs in with a complex caramel maltiness. Light, but rich red in color. Very little bitterness.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Poured red amber with no head or lacing. Aroma and flavor of malt made this beer too sweet for me. Drainpour.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Orangish color,small to no head mild lacing on the side.Malty sweet aroma with a raisin hint and other dried fruit in it,possibly bitter orange peel,mild spice as well.Malty taste with a decent spice to it and mild bitterness fruity and nicely hopped.The after taste is sweet hoppy and mildly fruity as well.nice mild feel in the mouth.A good brew worth trying again.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Light yellow color, medium head. Decent malt aroma. Nice malty flavor with a bit of hops. Decent texture. Nice finish.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: This is better than any Indian beer I have had. A fine example of a English pub ale. Very malty, some sediment, on the whole a very drinkable beer.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Could use a large blast of hops to even things out. Very malty. Not sure what the India connection is but nothing like anything Indian I''ve ever had IMHO. I enjoyed it but probably won''t look for it again.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: Golden-yellow colour. Caramel malt aroma. Caramel malt flavour with just a hint of spicy hop flavour right before the sweet finish. Reminds me of Redhooks ESB.

name: H.C. Berger Bombay Express Ale
review: All malt nose. Hazy tea colored brew with cool label, and griffin & barley emblem. Dinging it for the twistoff. Thin palate. Malty brew with a tea-herbal aftertaste. Not very balanced, but OK and a little different.

name: H.C. Berger Dopplebock
review: Malty, flavorful without a strong alcohol presence. Only had once, and it is not longer produced.

name: H.C. Berger Dopplebock
review: (Note, this IS actually spelled with the "l" before the "e" in "Dopplebock" on the label.) Upon opening the bottle and pouring, I get an outstanding Doppelbock aroma, with strong hints of chocolate and some kind of coffee (mocha, maybe; I'm not sure as I'm not a coffee drinker). Probably all kinds of other scents that, as a relative novice, I can't quite distinguish. I could be pleased just by taking repeated whiffs of that wonderful aroma. Dark, dark liquid, nearly black & opaque. Virtually no head to speak of, though. The first sipping starts out with strong mouthfeel and gives way to a rather thin, mild taste, and something of a lackluster, flat, underwhelming, stale finish (but still get the smooth, sweet taste of chocolate on the finish). The chocolate is really quite prominent throughout. Note quite as impressive in the taste and palate (rather disappointing, actually) as in that wonderful, inviting AROMA. Overall, this one is hard to really like. The flat taste, mouthfeel, palate and finish, despite the nice chocolate overtones, is going to make this one hard to come back to. It's simply hard to drink, like a flat/stale soda-pop. It does not help in the slightest that this costs $4 a 16.9 oz. (500 ml) bottle sitting in a store a 45-minute drive away. The aroma is about all it has going for it. Despite my liking for doppelbock styles, this falls into the middle of the pack among the 7 doppelbocks I've tried so far. I really wish that this hard more of a sharp character to it, because if it did, it could be first-rate.

name: H.C. Berger Dopplebock
review: Aroma of malt, caramel, molasses, some coffee, alcohol, nuts. Completely vanishing head on a nice brown-black liquid. Medium to full body, cloyingly sweet, sticky, very little dryness at all. Flavors of molasses, maple syrup, malt, raisins. This is too sweet, somewhat unbalanced (for once I think an American beer is a bit is too light on the hops, bet you thought THAT would never happen). No off flavors and pretty nice aroma, but too much like drinking syrup.

name: H.C. Berger Rauchbier
review: MUDDY BOG LIKE BROWN COLORING, VERY TASTY WITH HINTS OF SMOKE LACED THROUGHOUT.VERY POWERFUL ALE THAT KICKED MY ASS GOOD! TOO BAD I ONLY HAD ONE DAMN BIG BOTTLE OF IT!

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: From old tasting notes. Bright yellow gold color. Small white head. Sweet malt nose. Toasted malt flavor with a sweet caramel-like character. Nice dry hop finish. Long cloying malty aftertaste.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: 16 oz can shared at Tyler’s. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of malt, biscuit. Tastes of malt, biscuit, light citrus. Light body with a dry finish. Solid.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma is light malt and slight citrus. Flavor is light sweet malt with bready notes and a crisp citrus and herbal finish.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. The aroma is pretty standard and light for the style. The taste has a bit of grassy notes, some cracker and biscuit, not strong but fairly flavorful.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Keg @ Weepin Radish. Gold with a modest white head. Neutral nose. Cereal and little else. Taste is pretty grainy. Somewhat hot honey and a touch of caramel, light mineral. Spritz water. Medium body, active carb.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Draft at the farm Brewery The beer poured a clear gold color with a small head. We were told this is the lightest of all the beers they produce. It had a light body with soft carbonation. Faint aroma of sweet malts. Clean sweet finish.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Draught at the Weeping Radish Farm, Jarvisburg, NC. Clear deep golden colour with a small white head. Weak sweet malty aroma. Sweet malty and cardboardy flavour. Watery.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: 22oz Bottle. The pour was a clear golden yellow with an average (1-2 finger) white frothy head that quickly diminished, down to a light wispy film and small collar with fair spotty lacing. The aroma was very mild with a light biscuit malt, some grassy hops and a dusty yeast with hints of caramel, adjuncts (corn I believe) and a slight grainy appeal. The taste was lightly malty with a touch of caramel early on, and then became mildly bitter and grainy with a mild adjunct finish. The flavor lasted only a short while proceeding the swallow, with a slightly bitter grainy taste left behind. Mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a medium carbonation. Overall I found this brew to be just OK, it was refreshing but really did not have a lot of flavor. This is a good brew when doing yard work on a hot Summers day when you’re looking for something more than just to quench your thirst... www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: 9/4/2012. Sampled at the brewery. Light golden color with a white head. Malt, grain, hay and floral aromas. Malt, light hoppy flavors, but somewhat diluted.

name: Weeping Radish Corolla Gold Helles Lager
review: Bottle. I’m pretty confused by this beer since it might have suffered from some quality control issues, but it’s still not all that bad bc of its tart nature. Clear gold hue with a thin white head. Some sweet crackery malts, grass and a hay sourness. Flavor is quite sour, tart, hay and slight sweet malt in the end. Weird

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: From old tasting notes. Nice Amber red color. Foamy beige head. Sweet toffeeish toasted malt aroma. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor with a chewy mouthfeel. Good bitter hop finish.mvery faithful to the German style.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: Rated from old notes. Hoppy and toasted taste. Unchallenging and has the makings of a failure, but comes back around and settles into a drinkable if unglamorous beer.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: 9/4/2012. Sampled at the brewery. Light amber color with a white head. Caramel, malt and light fruity aromas. Caramel flavors with malt, but watery. Goes OK with the German sausages.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: Had on tap at Howards pub in Ocracoke. Pours a nice amber/ orange color- white head disappates immediately. Light and refreshing on the palate- feels like a amber summer beer. Lots of sweetness from the malts- not much hoppiness or finsih to it. Pretty inoffensive- interesting that all the lighter beer drinkers in the crowd chose this from the tap list. Good crossover/ sesssion beer. Might be nice at a summer bbq instead of the usual mass produced offererings. Not bad.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: On draft at the brewery restaurant. Pours clear amber with a white head. Sweet malt backbone. Not much else.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: Virginia Trip – at brewpub on tap Aroma mild nose , gentle sweetness from malts. Touch of caramel. 6+ Appearance proper ,clear amber with medium off white top. Some lace.3+ Flavor and Palate : Medium bodied with fuller walls. Slight nutty hop character. Gentle slight tartness behind. Mellow with lower carbonation. Sessionable Vienna.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: On tap. Dark orange with a thin off white head. Scent is malty. Taste is malty and some nuts.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: Hazy amber orange pour light off white head ... aroma of sweet malts and tastes very malty with a light spice to it smooth and sweet malts with a light hop in the dry malty finish ..... not a bad brew sessionable

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: From a bottle poured a brown color with a fair amount of head. Nice light malty flavor with a quick finish.

name: Weeping Radish Fest Amber Lager
review: 22 oz. bomber. a light lager with not much flavor but although is drinkable and refreshing. dark orange color, medium head. It definitely has a clean taste.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Bottle from Beers of Europe. A clear, dark brown with a thick, creamy head. Rich aroma of dried fruits The taste is complex and wel-balanced, rich, but not too sweet and good bitterness, but not too dry. There are flavours of dried fruits, orange peel, toffee and red berries and a lovely, earthy bitterness. A very good bock beer.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Bottle pour with a dark amber color. Aroma of banana. Deep banana flavors with hints of clove. No off tastes from the yeast, really nice.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Plumb color pour with decent head. Lots of spices (cloves!) but also a hint of the weizen. Living up to the expectations, very nice doppelbock

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Plum colored pour. Thin foam. Sweet fruity nose. Taste is not overly sweet but more strong with sour notes. Palate is tangy

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Bought at Alko in Turku in a half liter bottle. Appearance: dark beer with off white head. Nose: banana, clove and lots of sweet malts. Taste: in the beginning a lot of the clove, from the white beer. Later more sweet, toasted malts from the bock. Really a hybrid to me. But nice. Not more then one in the evening.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Sentori di banana matura e liquirizia predominano. Taco loco la vende. Ottima birra una delle mie preferite

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Donker bruin bier met een licht creme kleurige schuimkraag. Het bier begint mooi granig zoet met een klein beetje smaak van de donkere mouten. Al vrij snel komen de donkere smaken vol opzetten, de cacao, drop, donker gedroogd fruit, vijgen en iets van banaan. Deze smaken tillen het bier naar een hoger niveau.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Keg at The Schneider Weisse Brewery, Kelheim in 2016. Deep, cloudy rust colour with a big offwhite head. Aroma of cocoa, dried fruit, dates, caramel and herbal hops. Banana, esters, cloves, raisins and big malt in the flavour. Wonderful lingering fruitiness and fantastic body. Absolute classic.

name: Schneider Weisse Aventinus
brewery: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review: Weizenbock with a dark color and rich taste. The 8,2% alcohol isn’t noticed till you stand up...

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Bottled. Dark brown colour, small tan head, poor durablity. Malty aromas with burnt notes and some coffee. Smooth taste of roasted malts, slightly sweet caramel and some coffee. Light body, average carbonation, thin texture, dry and a bit watery finish. Nice sessionable dark lager, but its too moderate for me.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Bottle pour with a dark brown color. Light charcoal and molasses aroma. Light body, smooth with a very mild profile, notes of burnt toast and char.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: On tap at the bar in the Shoreline Restaurant, Gill's Rock, WI. served to a shaker showing a darkest brown hue, with some amber highlighting, a thick layer of tan froth much like a nitro hat, and waves & spots of lacing. The nose was roasted, coffee, touches of cocoa & char, with moderate malt. The taste was similar, with a medium body, lively carbonation, some dryness, and a pleasant, roasted & earthy bitterness. A tasty, session worthy, Black Lager.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Bottle. Clear dark red, almost brown, thick, creamy, stable, off-white head, nice lacing. Aroma malty, nuts, dark bread, pumpernickel, roasty. Taste smooth, full, not sweet, roasty. Carbonation medium to low. Bitterness medium to low, roasty. Aftertaste malty, dark bread, roasty, pumpernickel. One of the best Schwarzbiers one can get.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Thuis uit een flesje (0,33). Schwarz inderdaad, lichtbruin schuim. Geur en smaak niet heel krachtig. Wel een lekkere nasmaak, licht bitter. Gezien het percentage een lekker bier.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: 500ml bottle in 2017. Black with a thin beige head. Aroma of dark malt, light sweetened coffee and rye bread. Slightly roasty flavour, but more dark fruit and cakey notes.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Draft at the Shambles. Pitch black pour, moderately-sized tan head. Nice dry roasty aroma, chewy (but not thick or sweet) flavors, mild fruit, and balance, balance, balance. Delicious.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Caramel taste with rye bread and coffee notes. Super dark colour and no beer foam, when you are pouring into a glass. Super!

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Bought draft in Trier, Germany at the Trier Brasserie, a superb restaurant. This is a black lager, so it is thin as expected, but flavoursome with the dark malts and light hops coming through. A nice foamy head. Served cold, refreshing and tasty.

name: Köstritzer Schwarzbier
review: Dark brown color. Roasted malty and coffee, even chocolate aroma. Taste is a little bit watery, a bit sour, bitter and also sweet. But overall has a good taste and aftertaste.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Ar: slod, karmel, intensywnosc niska, ok, pustawo Wyg: zlotawo-bursztyn, klar piana ok. Sm: wysycenie srednio-wysokie, slod, mdly karmel, pustawo. Pos: slod, lekka goryczka. Ov: pusto i kiepsko, ale bez wad.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Not s’bad! Refreshing and best served cool.. cold is also suitable. 2.8 because it’s better than average

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Found out of can. Pours a dark amber with thick white foam. Slight malt but still enjoyable late fall option.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Shared 12 oz. can poured to snifters showing a clear, orange/amber color, with a presentable layer of off white froth, and foamy spots of lacing. The nose was a bit ripe, with dried fruit, soft grain, and some candy & caramel sweetness. Light bodied, with fair carbonation, the taste was similar, but less sweet, with a touch of dryness, and slight, earthy bitterness. Somewhat washed out texture-wise. Questionable Amber Ale beginning, but came around a little in the flavor.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Canned @ 5% from BevMo. Lightly sweet malty flavors up front. Some notes of biscuit. Kind of odd tasting. Reminds me a bit of a cheap eastern European beer in some way. Not a shining example of the style.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Clear copper with a white head. Aroma is toast, caramel, and earthy. Taste is light sweet and light/medium bitter. Palate is light body, thin feel with average carbonation.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Pours a medium amber with an off white head leaving little lacing. Nose is slight caramel. Body is medium light. Aftertase is slight bitterness. Another Breck weak example. Well, it is InBev. 12 oz can from the 15 can variety pack BBY 1/5/19

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: 355ml can. (5.0% ABV) Pours a slightly hazy copper with a medium, frothy, long lasting, beige head that laces. Mild, sweet aroma of toasted caramel malt. Sweet flavour of toasted bready malt, caramel and light nuts with a dry, mild bitter finish. Light body with a thin, watery texture and soft carbonation. A malt forward Amber that could use some more hops. Ok, for a boring style.

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Draft at the Union Bar, Gering, NE. Drinkable American red ale with low level of bitterness

name: Breckenridge Avalanche Amber
review: Y'all can fuck off this was a really great beer. Classic amber malt and sticky mouthfeel.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Bottle at trailer tasting. Clear cola color with tan foam. Toasted caramel, black malt aromas. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly sweet toasted caramel, herbal, dark bread flavors--- not bad

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: It is in cans now. Dark amber pour, disappearing head. Nose is faint roasted grain. Middle is toasty grain, thin body, light bitterness. Finish is a little bland. Not much has changed

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Can. Clear amber, beige head. Looks promising. But alas, aroma/taste fails to live up to the appearance. Toasted malt, hints of chocolate, lager, metallic notes. Watery finish.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Tap at Todd English in Birmingham Alabama. Aroma has roasted malts and Cascade hops. Pours brown amber body with off-white lacing. Taste is medium bitter with some sweet malts in the finish. Palate is medium bodied, oily texture, average carbonation and a odd herbal finish. I doubt the Germans would approve.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: From tap at House of Blues, New Orleans. Aroma is dark malt with caramel, light roast with a touch of chocolate and nuts. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a mild roasty biterness. Body modest to medium. A bit better than expected, fairly dull but hardly bad.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: A hazy, red pour with a tan head. The aroma has plum and black cherry with some caramel. It has a light body with smooth texture and average carbonation. The taste is sweet with a slightly dry finish.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: 12 ounce bottle into lager glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy deep orange/copper color with a 1 finger dense cream colored head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, and nuttiness; with lighter notes of chocolate, cocoa, herbal, grass, and roast/toasted earthiness. A bit of fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice and pleasant aromas with good complexity dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, and nuttiness; with lighter notes of chocolate, cocoa, herbal, grass, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal/grassy hop and roast bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, chocolate, cocoa, herbal, grass, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering hop/roast bitterness. Nicely clean on lager flavors, not too fruity/yeasty. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a nice dark lager. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the mildly bitter/drying finish Very flavorful for the low ABV. Clean and nicely rich malts, with mild earthy hop balance. A nicely enjoyable offering, and well made style example. Kind of midway between a dunkel and schwarzbier.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Got this in a to-go cup on Bourbon Street. A pleasant change from a bland pale lager, but not great or anything.

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Dixie Blackened Voodoo - Mixed six pack from Mike’s Food Mart, enjoyed at Mayan Import Company on Magazine St. Great place where you can just sit out front smoking and drinking. Even some of the people inside were going next door to get glasses of wine. Love how much New Orleans lets grown ups be grown ups. The atmosphere improves this beer dramatically. If regular Dixie is Lone Star of NO, this is the Shiner Bock, but a bit richer and more deeply and sweetly flavorful. When I first tried this back in 90’s it was one of my favorites ever. Now I’ve been “jaded” by so many incredible brews swished through my mouth it does not blow my mind so much. I’d recommend it to any 18 year old to start their education in flavors, beer history and adulthood in general. IG NutkickReviews @dixiebrewco #dixiebeer #dixiebrewco #neworleans #blackenedvoodoo @mayanimportcompany #mayanimportcompany https://dixiebeer.com/beers/

name: Dixie Blackened Voodoo Lager
review: Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours a clear, nutty brown with a lacing, beige head. Nose has subtle burned caramel. Medium body, very soft on the palate. Again burned caramel, subdued roast, slightly nutty with a hint of cardboard. There's not an awful lot going on here, but it's a decent little drinker in it's own right. 241117

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Can’t believe I didn’t review this famous beer. Review in ewk terminal for aa. Won’t tip the bartender. It’s the worst service I have had.

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: This beer scared me from ever drinking blue moon again. It was an alright beer, if it was there I would drink it, but one time drinking Belgium white I took a drink there was a chunk of something in there. I damn near threw up

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: tastes like a belgian white was diluted 50/50 with a coors. sweet smelling cheap wheat and corn with old orange peels or orange flavoring. flavor is the same - sweet brew of cheap wheat and corn with weird orange flavor - not getting nice yeasty funk or spice or anything youd expect from a good white ale. cloying orange flavor and stale grain aftertaste - will avoid...

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Somehow I never got around to rating this one. Seems I've had it many times over the years but never bothered to note it. Well here it is in Cyprus on tap of all places! Has medium cloudy body and modest foam, sharp coriander aroma. Flavour is orange citrus and coriander. Crisp finish. Unique and reliable, must be why it's so ubiquitous.

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Dirty yellow-orange with no head. Smell of wheat and orange peels. Oaty and wheaty taste with an orange candy component, like Fruitella Orange, and a coriander note. Low carbonation. Rather stale this beer.

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: 330 ml bottle. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is coriander, wheat, oranges. Flavor is coriander, wheat, oranges, banan, cloves, citrus.

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Bottle. Hazy orange color. Medium size, off-white head, stays. Sweet, coconut, sugary, honey, wheaty in aroma/taste. Happens.

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Hazy orange pour. Citrus nose. Wheaty, sweet, loads of zest and citrus. Ok white

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Citrusna aroma, poput nekakve pomorandže, pomalo kao mango. Lep izgled, mutno, maglovito. Ukus isto pomalo citrusan, kiselkast poput pomorandže, osjeæa se pœenice. Jako lep osjeæaj u ustima, pecka za nepce pomalo. Odlièan aftertaste. Kupila sam u rodu jer nisam imala para za pljeskavicu, ostavila da se ladi i otišla po pljeskavicu sa novcima za pljeskavicu. Odlièno prelepo iskustvo. Boca 330ml. 7.5

name: Blue Moon Belgian White Ale
review: Nose. Bright, coriander, orange and some white bread. Taste. Dense body, Taste spicy orange, in something pastry shop. The aftertaste is a little astringency from the zest and notes of “spicy oranges”

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Deep Amber orange color. Bubbly beige head. Sweet berry aroma. Tangy fruit malt flavor is balanced by an assertive, crisp malt/hop character.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Slightly deep copper but clear, under a very thin white cap. Crisp and light aroma that’s got a touch of raspberry fruit, and light lagerish tones. Crisp and semi-light body, blonde lager tones with a kiss of light raspberry fruit. No tartness, just smooth and light and actually a little full bodied from some oats in the brew. But it certainly doesn’t taste like 6%

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Didn’t hold out too much hope for this 12 oz., retired, cellar straggler, but was pleasantly surprised by the quick fizz to the cap removal, nice clarity to the coppery amber color, and modest, but lasting bubbles to the soft white layer of head foam, with light spots of lacing. The aroma even impressed with sweet & fruity, raspberry puree, some cordial character, a bit of tart cranberry and a touch of cookie to lightly soften the nose. The taste, on the other hand, sadly disappointed, with a light body, a sweetened, fruit water nature, only subtle hints of hop astringency & malt, and carbonation that was too low to save the flavor in some palatable degree.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: 12oz bottle (Old Notes)-Pours a light pinkish amber with a decent sized head. Aroma of raspberry, wheat, and malt. Taste of a raspberry creamsicle. This light bodied brew is well balanced and not tto shabby.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Sample on tap at the Jax Beer Fest 2013. The brewer said that it was revived for the festival. Pinkish pour with a decent off-white head. Nice sweet but balanced aroma of raspberries and cream with an actually nice raspberry and cream flavor as well. This is probably one of the better Blue Moon one-offs I’ve had.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Old beer at home. Pours a reddish orange. Pretty flat at this point. Smells like juice. Kinda one note at this point. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Creamy pour, fluffy head. Raspberry notes and caramel malt, some faded hops. Flavor is ok, light berries, wheat, caramel.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
review: Bottle at GABF. Pours a ruddy pinkish ambery looking thing. White head. Nose is raspberry jam, though somewhat subdued. On tasting, more of the creamy raspberry, light tartness. Lots of tannin comes through and an iced tea type note. Pretty interesting beer and not bad.

name: Blue Moon Raspberry Cream Ale
