review: Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a clear golden colour with a lasting frothy white head. The aroma is malt, light citrus, piney hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light, crisp, fresh, malt, citrus fruit, dry woody hop bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: Aroma: Medium citrus, sweet orange. Appearance: Hazy, gold body. Large white head. Medium bubbles, Good retention. Flavour: Medium-light bitterness. Medium pith, grapefruit. Medium-light toffee. Dry, bitter, pithy finish. Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Smooth, easy drinking IPA. 355 ml bottle, poured. 21A. American IPA. Session

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: Neben der Bierschmiede aus Steinbach am Attersee gibt es auch in Kalifornien einen Bierschmied, der sich AleSmith nennt. Das Bier ist wie sehr viele amerikanische Ales sehr gut mit Aromahopfen versehen, welcher gut harmoniert. Die Malzigkeit tritt in den Hintergrund. Ein gutes Bier, das man auch einem "Bier-Laien" zumuten kann.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: Color naranja oscuro, brillante. Espuma blanca duradera. Aroma herbal y cítrico. Sabor igual, seca al final. Esperaba más amargor.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: 355 ml. bottle @ home, served in a teku glass. Aroma: not very intense aromas of grapefruit, pine, resin, citrus. Some malts, caramel malts and flowers in the background. Appearance: light gold to gold color with perfectly white head. Medium to high head thickness with low to medium retention and low to medium Brussels' lacing. Medium haziness. A very thin layer of foam remains on top of the beer. Taste: low sweetness, medium bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of pine, resin, grapefruit, citrus, lemon, lemon zest, lime, tangerine. flowers. Some toasted and caramel malts in the background. Balance is toward the bitterness. Palate: low to medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation, quite long dry finish with low to medium bitterness and the same aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is not noticeable. Low astringency. Overall: good appearance, weak but pleasant aromas. Powerful flavors of grapefruit, resin, pine, flowers and some malts in the background. Too watery texture. Not very good but maybe this bottle it's too old after travelling to Europe.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: 0.355l bottle. Slightly murky golden body with a somewhat loose white head. Aroma and taste of grapefruit, pine, bready malts and lemon zest. Simple APA, but very well brewed.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: Mocno cytrusowe i tropikalne piwo o œrednio-wysokiej goryczce. OrzeŸwiaj¹ce, aczkolwiek cia³o niekoniecznie jest lekkie; przez goryczkê przebija siê delikatna, s³odowa kontra. Bardzo fajne, klasyczne american pale ale.

name: AleSmith X Extra Pale Ale
review: A light yellow beer, a head is medium and blond. Aroma has complex citrus, some caramel, hint of grain. Taste has the same elements, grapefruit, citrus, some caramel, enough of bitterness to keep balance with sweetness. Medium bodied. Again the great balance as the Alesmith can do it. Very good beer.

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: Very subduded hop nose with a faint touch of malt. Much of the same with a bit of sweet caramel. Some resinous hops. Impressive hideing of the 6.5 abv. A bit too subdued in all fronts for my tastes.

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: Brown and cloudy with a sweet candy-like chocolatey aroma with hints of mint leaves and nuts...the flavors were a medley of minty hops and a nutty malty toffee-like chewiness...in sum, toffee candies and mint gum combine in a nicely hopped nutty brown ale with a buttery toffee feel to it and notes of mint popping out everywhere...

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: Damn was I glad to finally get a shot at trying this fine beverage. Dirty brown color with some nice moderate head, and it really looks like there is some grey in the color, but would that even be possible. Had a malty, nutty, even some peanut brittle in the aroma. The flavor followed right up the ass of the aroma, only a little bit more of the nutty notes. Damn good combination, I thought it would have some caramel in it, but i could not find it. Actually smelled like a payday.

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: very nice. sweet, caramel/toffee/nutty flavors predominate, eventually leading to a nice, somewhat dry finish

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: Vey cool way of making this beer, and very good to drink to boot. Very smooth mouthfeel. I have tried this one off cask and keg and both were fantastic. very well balanced beer in all aspects. the flavor changes in your mouth from slight spice to smooth, sweet maltiness. The alcohol leaves the mouth a little dry and warm but that is the only time the alcohol is noticed...until you stand up after several of them.

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: 3/14/02: Gusler, this has to be the closest I have tasted to the perfect brew. 3/14/03: Pours a deep mahogany color with a medium tan head. Nose is sweet and malty. The taste is sweet and rich with a hint of burnt caramel, a slight hop bite and a light dry finish. A hint of cocoa in the aftertaste.

name: AleSmith Blarney Stoned
review: You must try Ale Smith's beers to understand how great they are, pricey, strong, big and malty, high ABV, just damn good.

name: AleSmith Coles Porter
review: a very nice porter, especially when served from the cask, which really allows the hops to blend nicely with the smoky, roasted malt.

name: AleSmith Coles Porter
review: A top 10 Porter on my list. Nice malt and hop nose, Caramel and roasted grains and a nice dry finish.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Bottle shared at NYE, several years old. Hazy reddish brown colour. Frothy beige head. Aroma's: hoppy, caramel, slight oxidation. Retronasal: toasted bread, sweetish, roasted, bitterish, light oxidation. Flavour is moderate bitter and light sweet. Medium bodied. Quite bitter finish. Pretty good, despite the age.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a hazy dark reddish colour almost brown with a mostly lasting frothy white head. The aroma is caramel malt, piney citrus woody hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a crisp, bready malt, fruity, dry woody floral hop bitter palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average to soft carbonation.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Bottle. Pours murky amber-red with small foamy beige head, faint caramel aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter caramel malt taste with floral hops, thin body, long finish. Quite flavorful and tasty.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Bottle. Good example of what a red ale can be, Basically a Red IPA. Dep reddish amber hue. Deep malty backbone with roasted chestnut and caramel malts. Plenty of hoppy bite in the finish, Decent session beer - even at 6.6 ABV,

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: From backlog. Bottle shared with Bergstaden in Vista, ca. Reddis/brown with beige head. Malts, hops, pine, Citrus. Nice.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Bomber from Bottle Jockey in Burnaby. A dark reddish amber beer with generous golden head. Slightly hop forward here with citrus and resinous notes. Plenty of caramel malt in the background. 3.7

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: DATE: January 14, 2018... OCCASION: coming down after a thrillingly improbable finish to the Vikings/Saints game... GLASSWARE: Hop Devil nonick... pours a dark ruby red body, murky and foreboding--too dense to see through... the thick, creamy off-white head sits like a velvet cake frosting, and it laces like a stormy sky, and plateaus as a two-finger mesa--attractive! Immediate resin, spruce, and earthy malts leave the best impression; secondary scents of toasted malts that suggest soon-to-be-born bread, a little yeast funk, and some vegetable... traces of citric aroma, but not as much as expected... a creamy, frothy, breathy ale that is smooth, soft and extremely drinkable--nothing dead here, though a bit of butter accompanies the finish... a lingering, pleasant experience.... the flavor is resin, mango, peach, and light pine... the caramel promised is secondary, with the sweetness blunted by vegetable and toasted bread malts... I like the overall experience, with its creamy comfortably encouraging the next sip, and each sip lacking a bite at a middle-of-the-road ABV... ultimately, a beer that probably pairs with Autumn well; here in January, it stands well but not out--other ambers have been maltier, sweeter, hoppier.... this does enough to be in the second tier of that conversation...

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Nice cider/ruby color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted caramel malt, pine hops, & fruit/citrus; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel, spicy hops, fruit, and some nuts; Finish is dry & slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Uzupe³nienie profilu notatki. Piana obfita trwa³a, zdobi szk³o. Kolor czerwony mêtny. Aromat niesamowicie intensywne owoce, truskawki, poziomki karmel. Amerykanski chmiel w formie zanikaj¹cej jak w idealnym ABW. Smak bogaty, z³o¿ony, s¹ owoce, poziomki, truskawki, lekka ¿ywicznoœæ, cukierki owocowe i lekka s³odycz, karmel. Chmielenie wyraŸne przez le¿akowanie ju¿ w zaniku, goryczka wysoka nie dominuje. Ca³oœæ dawa³a by efekt wyœmienitego ABW gdyby nie to ze piwo sprawia wra¿enie rozcieñczonego, ewidentnie brakuje to wiêcej cia³a i mocy, nie to ze jej tu nie ma, ale intensywne smaki nie graj¹ z lekkim pijalnym charakterem. Jako RED ALE jest to najlepsze piwo z tego stylu jakie do tej pory pi³em i nale¿y mu siê czerwone WOW.

name: AleSmith Evil Dead Red
review: Strong toasted wood and molasses aromas along with equally strong hoppy notes from a crystal clear dark amber body with a reddish tinge. The taste is immediately sweet toffee and dark caramel quickly followed by a rush of green grassy and pine hop bitterness that balance each other and also fight each other for dominance. In the end, they do reach an equilibrium and settle to a woody aftertaste with a lingering bittersweet chocolate note. This tastes like a bigger beer than it is and it's one delicious monster. Happy Halloween!

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Tap at PAMP. Brown with small white head. Roasty malt but balanced with light hop and grain. Rich biscuit. Very tasty for this style.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: 0,3 litre Bottle from Total Wine And More, Laguna Hills, Ca. Clear brown with little offwhite head. Malts, Caramel, sweetness,

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Cask at Golden Cross, Bromsgrove. That’s more like it! Delicious. Dark brown with patchy off white head, foam clinging to glass. Aroma is treacle. Taste is malty biscuity sweetness, sugary treacle, coffee, smoke, ending in a dry finish. Good. Brewed by Shepard’s Neme exclusive to JDW apparently.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Cask, William Wygston, Wigston. Dark brown with an off white head. Sweet bready toffee malts with earthy coffee. Tangy berry notes. Creamy body. Nice brown ale.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: It's a brown ale, if you like browns you should know what to expect. I'm not going into aroma, flavour or whatever as this is another from Ryan Smith, a name always worth looking for and once again bringing a welcome touch of US craft to the handpumps of the UK-wide Spooneria beer fest. Compared to the ubuitous corporate sugar sludge-pit known as Newcastle Brown (and some indie UK browns, sorry) this is great. It seems daft that once again a US brewer has taken one of ours and turned it into what it should be and maybe once was. And that's coming from a man with a preference for hoppier, paler beer varieties. We have great indie companies in the UK but many US breweries are genuinely better with flavours and ingredients. So why can't Alesmith Nut Brown be permanently available? Because it's got 'stuff' in it, that's why. Costs money. Or maybe it's just had more care put into it, either way is fine by me. So come and set up over here Ryan, we're behind you. And if you need someone to look after the UK marketing, Fat Carlo has the stomach of a concrete rhinoceros...

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Surprised to find it in the Spoons Fest. Pours mahogany body with thin lace top. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is medium sweet to bitter with more treacle than but in my opinion. Decent without any pretensions to being more.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Pint at the three John Scott's Jdw. Thin creamy beige head. Clear amber pour. Served too cold.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Pours a dark caramel brown. Malt, toffee nose. Malt forward flavours, bread, burnt caramel, spice. Quite dry but a hit of bitterness at the end to freshen it up.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Pours deep brown with light head. Medium body with soft mouth feel. Malt forward with astringent finish. Very nice refreshing beer.

name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)
review: Can, 9C (too cold?). Clear brown with a pale beige head that settles to a cm. Aroma of chocolate, bread, mildly earthy and spicy hops. Fairly light bodied. Moderately sweet with a dryish and spicy bitter finish. Fine but not much character.

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: On tap at the Hilton Bayside in San Diego. Pours a hazy gold and makes a small head, with a generous amount of lacing. Aroma is of fresh hops and caramel. Tastes of citra hops. A good but not overpowering IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: 650 ml bottle. Aroma sharp hoppy with bitter notes of boiled vegetables, cabbage. Tastes very fresh and clean, sharp bitterness with citrus.

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: Det första som möter en är en fantastisk fruktig doft av mango, tropisk frukt, godis. Men smaken är lite tafatt. Det hela avslutas med en god bitter och pepprig beska men jag hade väntat mig mer efter doftupplevelsen.

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: Pale golden colour. Aroma of hops and a bit malt. Citric. Watery to start with, watery in the end.

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: Good pale, nice amount of hops with a slightly sweet, malty finish. Good overall.

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: a decent easy drinking beer; nothing more, nothing less.....................

name: AleSmith Pale Ale
review: A top rate pale ale, not my favorite, but good. Decent hops and nice malt sweetness to balance the beer.

name: AleSmith Anvil ESB
review: Fles 66cl thuis. Zacht maltig, caramel, hop bitters, boterig, licht stroperig, citrus, fruitig, licht droog. Goede balans. Goed. (18-8-19).

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Bottom line is not inspiring and probably last time I would drink this beer. The beer is a hazy orange-amber coloring with a thin film of head. Aroma is flowery, with caramel notes in the background. Overall, the nose was a bit muted, and the flavors seemed a bit watery. Very light bodied beer. There were slightly sour malt flavors with flowery and citrus sweet highlights. Slightly sour, again, on the aftertaste, and a mid-lingering finish. A little weak for the style in terms of body and flavor.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Brilliant amber color/ fleeting head. Nutty, caramel, pine aromas. medium bodied with soft co2. Decent malty sweet bread, nutty caramel flavors.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Poured copper and clear with a decent white head and average lacing. The aroma smelled of infection as did the taste. Thin, harsh mouthfeel. Bad bottle. Need to try again.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Pours a brown amber, with small head. Sweet malt, caramel, citrus, light bread and some hops. Boring and bland.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Bomber. Pours a cherry coke sort of a color. Somewhat sweet malty aroma. A hint of hops as well. Fairly crisp and malty. Good hop character. Somewhat grainy for an amber. Pretty tasty though. I’m glad to see they got rid of that sour cream flavor.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: On tap. Creative name. Color was a dirty amber. Aroma was fruity and bready. Flavor was like HI-C punch, which was quite bizarre. Some yeast and mineral water as well. Very strange, but not terrible.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Okay, nothing really to write home about. Subtly hoppy but not over the top. Decent mouthfeel, but underwhelming, just kind of an average decent drinkable, but not noteworthy beer.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: A nice looking brew, decent head, malt, slight caramel, Hoped nice for the style, nice drinking brew. Bought bottled at the Alpine Village Euro Market, next to the brewery, so it was probably very fresh.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Pretty decent beer, would like it a little more if it had a bigger finish, it just drops right off of the palate. Otherwise pretty well balanced, a rich toasted caramel maltiness, some light toffee notes as well. Pretty sessionable, I would drink this again.

name: Angel City Ale
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: 12oz bottle from BevMo! One of the better Angel City beers. An aroma of malt and caramel on an amber body with a head that dissipates quickly. Toasted malt and some amount of bitterness.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Smells like piss, nice golden color, med. body, floral-piney, hoppy taste. Easy to drink, like a beginner IPA ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: 11 jan 2014, bottle. yellow, clear, steady bubbles. nose is pine hops. thin body and mildly fizzy. piney hops but kind of stale and a tad sweet. ok.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Clear gold with a medium white head, minimal retention and unimpressive lace. Aromas of grassy hops, English malt, pepper and... soap? Citrusy hop flavors with toffee malt. Light body, watery mouthfeel, minimal carbonation and a thin finish.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Pours a dark rust orange. Has a floral hop and citrus aroma. Taste is smooth and light for an IPA with some lemon, orange, and floral flavor, and ends with a good hoppy bitterness.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Good IPA, very pleased, bitter, hoppy, dark/tan, nice head, drank straight from the brewery

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Pours a light orange color. No oily hop presence. Metallic taste and thin carbonation. I would not call this an IPA. Not sure what it is, except it’s bad!

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: 20-Feb-08 (22-oz bottle: Purchased 19-Feb-08 for $3.29 at BevMo in La Jolla, CA) So here we are two years later, and having been assured by the brewer that bottling issues have been cleared up, it’s back on the shelves. So, here goes a little quality control... This is what you expect from a West Coast IPA: big, bold and full-flavored with significant punch from hops. Moderately bitter, piney and a little citrusy, the hops are certainly not shy, but there is still sufficient malt backing to keep the beer nicely balanced. The malts tend to show a little graininess in the finish, but the beer well-attenuated, keeping sweetness levels in check. The nose is fairly grainy, but unfortunately, the hops don’t really project much aroma, and the beer smells a little soapy. Medium in body with ample carbonation and a long, crisp, dry finish. Golden in color with slight haze, the beer is capped by a tall, fluffy, off-white head that settles to a thin layer. The head leaves a very impressive, dense, ringed lacing down the entire length of the glass. Overall, the aromatics could use a bit of work, but this otherwise is a very solid IPA has nice flavor, superb balance and looks great in the glass. 21-Apr-06 (22 oz bottle: $3.49 at BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Okay, so when you’re drinking a west coast IPA, but the hops is completely overpowered by off-flavors, you know you really have a problem on your hands. Unlike the infection in their Dunkel which contributed a significant sourness, this is just massive diacetyl. But just like with the Dunkel, this beer smells and tastes like rancid fruit, though here, it’s extremely unpleasant. Really not much point in writing much more, but a beer this brutally awful, so obscenely polluted by off-flavors, has to be put on the record. And I’m gonna talk to my manager at BevMo and get this pulled off the shelf. It should also be noted that this beer was kept cold the entire time because I stuck my bottles in the cooler as soon as the driver delivered them (and he came straight from the brewery, early in the morning). A definite rerate is in order, but not until the bottling line is cleaned up. (2, 3, 2, 2, 2 = 1.1)

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Hazy medium brown, no head. Old oxidixed hops, burnt malt. Flavor much the same, past its prime. Dissapointed.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: Very bad IPA. Pours a golden amber with thin white head. Aroma of musty malt and corn. Flavor is pine, light fruit, bad malt, and metallic bitterness. Tastes bad, hard to drink.

name: Angel City IPA (-2013)
brewery: Angel City Brewing Company (A&S Brewing - Boston Beer Co.)
review: On tap; for the style this is scraping the bottom of the barrel. Aroma was light; some fruit and citrus. Color was amber/copper. Flavor was very bland and there was not much hopping to speak of. Bready and earthy mostly, with some yeast. How can I like there pale lager better than the IPA?

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: One of those forgetable brews. Average all around. Balance is ok, a tad on the rusty side. Typical caramel malts, etc. I am thinkin that I just prefer brown ales over ambers, so naturally these styles get lower ratings from me. Glad that I sampled a single, b/c I wouldn't really want a 6-pack of this.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: Pours a reddish amber color. Two fingers cream colored head. Excellent retention and excellent lacing. Aroma is like an ESB. Lots of malt, hops and yeast. Smells tonicy, with stone fruits. Taste is ESB like. Not so much like an amber. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied. Dry. Papery. Hoppy, but not necessarily bitter. Overall it’s good. Hard to describe. I’d recommend it and buy it again.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: From a bottle at GABS on 20 May 2018. You can always count on Ballast Point for a great tasting beer and with this amber they haven’t disappointed.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: Good mouthfeel & pretty pour. The taste was just decent tho. Had the other intangibles!

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: (Bottle) The hoppiest beer I've ever seen marketed as an "amber ale". The commercial description references an ESB, and although I'm getting a little bit of this, it's also hoppier than any ESB I've tried. I like this, but not when I think of it as an amber ale. Aroma has a good balance of malt and hops. This is also a very malty beer and the malt has a sort of depth to it. There's a hint of fruitiness which I found very welcome. Quite sour. Bitter throughout; has a bite and leaves a bitter aftertaste. Slightly metallic quality mid-sip. Like most of what Ballast Point makes, this was a very complex beer with a lot going on. It is not easy drinking though: if you like IPA's I'd imagine you'd like it, but if you want something more like a typical amber ale, I recommend steering clear.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: Ballast Point California Amber Apparently an ESB inspired ale that clocks in at 5.5% It’s a matte reddish brown with a thick beige head. The aroma is sharply fruity in the berry & stone fruit mold. Medium to light bodied with a prickly carbonation and sharp dry finish. The taste is herbal, spicy (celery salt type minerality, mild caramel and stone fruit with raisins & biscuit. The finish is woodsy herbal and grows in low level bitterness. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: Aromas mainly consisting of caramel and some citrus. Pours a dark copper color with a good sized head that leaves some lacing. Flavors were a little weak but had some toasty notes with a definite American hop presence. Slightly watery body. Overall it was pretty good but nothing to write home about.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: A bottle from Jason's near NCCU. Aroma: citrus, a bit of caramel. Appearance: hazy milk chocolate, 2mm. tan head. Palate: medium-bodied and slightly creamy, average carbonation. Predictably astringent finish, but more complex at the end than your average. Taste: medium bitter, a bit malty, not bad.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: A fruity brown beer. Fruity smell and bitter hoppy finish. Great dark amber color.

name: Ballast Point California Amber
review: On tap at Puerto 27 in Pacifica, CA. Aroma is amber. Taste is ale. Amber ale. Not much here.

name: Ballast Point Big Eye IPA
review: 355ml bottle in 2015. Bright amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of big pithy hops, citrus, lemon zest, pine and biscuity malt. Really good balance of big bitterness, with a gentle malty backbone that adds some dried fruit sweetness and the alcohol plays nicely.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Bottle. Pours a very dark brown color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malts, chocolate, earthy, lightly nutty flavors, moderate bitterness, good.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: A solid all-around porter. Chocolate malt stands out here with a creamy texture. Flavors are full and rich. Mild hops. Still prefer something like an Anchor Porter over this though, especially for the price. Good to try, but not sure it would be a regular for me.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Very solid porter. Near black, medium body, roasty chocolate, some resinous hops and coffee. Draft at Disney's Hollywood Studios.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Nearly black with a tan head. Roasted malt with a hint of chocolate. A bit more hoppy than the average Porter which does it well. Nice.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: black with a creamy off white head; nice roasted malt aroma with coffee notes and hints of bitter chocolate; great, bitter, roasted malt flavor with coffee and bitter chocolate notes; nice dry, bitter finish

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: From flight of 5oz tasters. Almost black with thin head. Roasty, chocolate and light coffee taste. A little sweet with some vanilla but also some bitterness coming through too. Good ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Draught @ Ballast Point-Little Italy, San Diego. Pours back with a creamy brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, little red berries. Flavor is sweet, rich malty, caramel, rich chocolate, some alcohol. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 240718

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Draft at Ballast Point. Dark, almost opaque brown with thin beige head. Chocolatey, some hints of vanilla and caramel. Nice.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Backlog, bottle. Pours a brown color with a one to two finger creamy top. Aroma and flavor of nuts, roasted malt, chocolate powder, hops, and sweet malt. Roast at first then sweet at the end. Not a fan of this porter.

name: Ballast Point Black Marlin Porter
review: Great Porter in most ways. It could use an alcohol content at 7% or more, if you ask me.

name: Ballast Point Wahoo White
review: Draft at the Eagle - a wit with a slight hop kick. Wife approves. Wheat banana finish. More lemon zest.

name: Ballast Point Wahoo White
review: Das Wahoo White von der Ballast Point Brewing Company aus San Diego, Kalifornien (USA). Die Etiketten sind bei der Brauerei meist mit Meeresbewohnern bestückt, schaut gut aus. Gelblich-Orangefarben im Glas, hefetrüb, leider entwickelt sich hier überhaupt kein Schaum, nicht mal ein Bläschen oben drauf, dass schaut schon direkt nach dem Einschenken abgestanden aus. Fruchtig frischer Antrunk, Orangennoten und Koriander dominieren den leicht hefigen Körper, der sehr wässrig wirkt. Hopfenbittere ist nicht vorhanden, nur leicht säuerlich im Abgang. Es ist viel Kohlensäure enthalten, aber kein SCHAUM!!! Als leichtes Sommergetränk kann man es trinken, ansonsten "Nix Gscheits"!

name: Ballast Point Wahoo White
review: Aroma is typical witbier: light citrus, yeast, wheat and sweet toffee. Taste is light and refreshing, but a little dull with lemon rind and spices trying their best lifting this one up. Sweet ending with coriander seeds.

name: Ballast Point Wahoo White
review: Draft at Ballast Point. Hazy, very pale yellow. Definitely wheaty. Easy drinking, not bad, but not exciting either.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottled. Clear yellow colour, small but stable white head. Intense citrus hop aromas with some honey, pine and grass. Taste is slightly sweet with some caramel, grapefruit, lemon juice, lemongrass, peach, pine, grass. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture, fine hoppy finish. Great summer beer.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Flasa zo 100 piv. Vona pomerne silna, medova. Krasna cira medova farba. Chut horkasta medova trochu alkoholova. Prijemna aj ked skor by som si myslel ze iny styl.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Smell and taste sits between a lager and a pale ale: some aromatic hops, reminding of berries and tropical fruit, as well as the lager-typical grassy hops. This beer is only mildly bitter. It has an attractive amber colour.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 0,355 l bottle from Systembolaget. Very good pale ale, refreshing in hot summer day!

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Esta é uma cerveja leve, muito agradável. Excelente cor e aroma. Sabor pouco intenso e agradavelmente amarga. A repetir, sem dúvida

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Backlog, bottle that pours an orange golden with a medium top. Nose is florals, grapefruit, pine, ash, and pepper. Flavor is the same but has some weird pepper quality to it. Thin bodied. Meh

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 355 ml bottle, BB Feb 13th 2020. Clear, orange-brown, thin white cap, medium low carbonation. Aroma is very malty and sweet. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonated, sticky finish. Taste is tart berries, honey and caramel. Nice try, but it still is an average APA.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: The aroma is bright, the resin dominates in it, then some grass. Amber color, transparent beer with a small white foam. Taste immediately a little sweet, then rolls a little bitterness and pine. The body is medium, carbonation is quite moderate.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: On tap at Fat Kahuna's. Copper pour with a white head. Citrus hops and roasted malts in the aroma and taste.

name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle. Clear dark orange golden with a stable creamy head. Grainy, earthy, citric, herbal, a bit soapy aromas. Sweetish, toasted malt, grains, herbs, lemon peel, bitter finish. Light-medium bodied, smooth, rather dry.

name: Leffe Vieille Cuvée
review: Bottle from Beer Supermarket. Aroma started as farty vegetable but moved into classic Belgian strong / Leffe. Still some fart remains. Mahogany colour. I generally am not a fan of Leffe due to its strong sicklyness but this is just disjointed for me. Sickly sweet leffe with too much booze chucked in. Moments of niceness but overall doesnt work for me.

name: Leffe Vieille Cuvée
review: 2015 08 23 Butelka 0,33 l. Piwo doœæ mocno nagazowane, piana gêsta, wysoka, utrzymuje siê przez d³ugi czas i pozostawia obrêcz i koronki na szkle. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, miedziany, piwo klarowne. W aromacie typowo belgijskie fenole, przyprawowe, wyczuwalna kolendra i pomarañcze, dro¿d¿e, ciemne owoce. W smaku s³odowe, na pierwszy plan wybija siê kolendra i skórka pomarañczy, mo¿e rodzynki. Alkohol po prze³kniêciu bardzo przyjemnie grzeje w gard³o, byæ mo¿e po ogrzaniu wychodzi lekka bimbrowoœæ, ale nie wywo³uje nieprzyjemnego odczucia. Piwo mocne i pelne, typowo degustacyjne. Dobre, chocia¿ trochê gorsze ni¿ Leffe Brune.

name: Leffe Blonde
review: Poured from a 330ml bottle. It has an amber body with a thick white head. The aroma has sweet malts, bitterness and fruit, with notes of apricot and more bitterness. The taste is fruity and bitter, but there's something artificial about the sweetness that I can't put my finger on. The aftertaste is dry, but sweet. Too fruity and bitter for my tastes.

name: Leffe Blonde
review: Bottled. Clear deep golden colour, medium-sized bubbly white head, poor durablity. Fruity and malty aromas with some yeast. Taste of apple, peach, sourdough, subtle medicin-like bitterness. Thin body, fizzy carbonation, a bit watery mouthfeel, fruity and slightly bitter finish. Not that bad, but in the belgian league its featureless.

name: Leffe Tripel (Triple)
review: Gekruid bier met een geelblonde kleur en een goede schuimkraag. De smaak heeft zoete en bittere elementen.

name: Leffe Brune / Bruin / Brown
review: Bottled. Clear brown colour, small creamy tan head, fair retention. Fruity nose with bread, coffee and raisins notes. Taste of chocolate, breadcrust, fruity tones, yeast. Light to medium body moderate carbonation, smooth mouthfeel, light roasty finish. Quite good.

name: Leffe Brune / Bruin / Brown
review: I went into drinking this with the lowest expectations. As predominantly a real ale drinker, I'd been left thoroughly unimpressed by the Leffe Ruby offering, which tasted like very cheap, bad, alcoholic Ribena, and smelt far worse to boot. It was my first try with any Leffe beer, and regretted it. So, I cracked open this bottle of Leffe Brune/Bruin, which I'd bought at the same time as the Ruby version. First of all, it looked and smelled better. A lot, lot better. The traditional beer type smell gave me some confidence that I may actually enjoy this drink. Whilst I find it difficult to detect any scent from most beers I drink, at least this one didn't smell repulsive like Leffe Ruby did when I took a whiff of that. Nor, thankfully, does it taste repulsive, either. In fact, it tastes rather good. It's slightly more carbonated than say a British real ale, but this isn't a bad thing. It doesn't taste overly carbonated or fizzy, and keeps a good head once poured, all the way down the glass. It has a fairly rich flavour, with mild burnt chocolate notes with some subtle fruitiness. It's definitely not a bitter taste, but has some body and depth behind the flavour. Really pleasantly surprised by this. So much so, I would buy this again.

name: Leffe Brune / Bruin / Brown
review: 0,33 l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier, cremefarbener, stabiler Schaum, schöne Gardine. Karamell, dunkle Schokolade, angenehm bitter, leicht alkoholisch, leicht erdig im Abgang.

name: Shipyard Brown Ale
review: On tap. It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of toast, malts and bread. The taste was similar to the aroma with more toast, malts, bread and mild carbonation with a mild mouthfeel. Ok.

name: Shipyard Brown Ale
review: I bought this in the captain's collection variety pack. I'd say it was my 2nd favorite in there so far.....with the Blue Fin Stout being the best. This was pretty good for a brown ale. I had a variety pack from them years ago, but forgot the details so waited til now to review. I'd say this is one of their better ones. Has a darker brown appearance but not super-dark. Smell is a little yeasty, sort of like those Dutch Brown or European ales. On the lighter ABV% side, so has some good malty flavors (caramel, chocolate, etc.)....but a decent bitter hoppy finish to it. Can also taste that yeast as well which adds some flavor. I bought a single brown ale from Smutty to compare it to, and curious to try Sammy's Brown Ale as well. But this is something that I would buy again because the price is right.

name: Shipyard Brown Ale
review: From tap. Pours clear, dark brown with a deep amber glare with a small tan head. Roasted malty and light breadish. Toasted, sweet malty. Bitter, toasted and light dry finish.

name: Shipyard Brown Ale
review: Dal Maine, New England, una buona brown ale all’inglese. Color marrone, mogano, con una schiuma di poca persistenza. Aroma di malto, leggera tostatura. Buona all’assaggio, sapore di malto, un po’ di caramello, piccole note di cioccolato, amaro quasi assente se non appena nel finale. Molto beverina visto il corpo molto leggero, il basso grado alcolico e la carbonazione minimale. Non da ricordare, ma si difende.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: I like the new label better than the old one.....picture of a Marlin or Tuna on the front. This was my favorite of the Shipyards that I sampled so far. Lots of chocolate, decent amount of coffee, nicely hopped. This almost reminds me of a porter. I would buy the variety pack again just for this beer, as I haven't seen it in 6-packs yet. I wouldn't say this is one of my favorite stouts, but for just over $1 a beer, I'd say for the price really can't be beat.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 4/20/2016. Pours clear opaque dark brown/black color with a 2 finger fairly dense and rocky tan head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a large cap that lasts. Thick foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, and toasted dark/brown bread; with lighter notes of nuttiness, smoke, char, herbal, grass, pepper, dark fruit, and roast/toasted earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and light fruity yeast/earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, and toasted dark/brown bread; with lighter notes of nuttiness, smoke, char, herbal, grass, pepper, dark fruit, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/grassy hop and roast/char bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toasted dark/brown bread, nuttiness, light smoke/char, herbal, grass, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; with a great roast/hop bitter/sweet balance, and zero acrid/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from hop/char bitterness. Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.7%. Overall this is a delicious dry stout. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the modestly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful for the low ABV. Nicely rich English pale/roasted malts, balancing hops, and mild fruity yeast characteristics. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Draught @ the source. Opaque dark brown with creamy beige head, faint mocha aroma, low carbonation, sweet mocha taste, thin watery body, long sweet mocha finish. Too thin.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: From old tasting notes. Translucent brown color with th a huge creamy tan head. Roasted malt nose hints at French Roast coffee. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor with a real espresso feel. lots of chocolate and black malt. Rich and full bodied. A good stout.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Nice malty aroma and rich taste. A little over carbonated. Very flavorful for a medium abv. Bottle

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Bdbdndbdndnsndndndkdndjbdzksksnsjsjskskdkxndnxkdndndjxndndndkxn sjsndjdBdbdndbdndnsndndndkdndjbdzksksnsjsjskskdkxndnxkdndndjxndndndkxnBdbdndbdndnsndndndkdndjbdzksksnsjsjskskdkxndnxkdndndjxndndndkxn ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Bottle. Black in colour. Malty; roasty malts, lots of coffee, chocolate, caramel. Fruity; some sweet fruit. Hoppy; good hop bitterness. Good malt/hop balance. Bittersweet roast malty with a nice balancing hoppiness. Dry roasty throughout. Decent. Very drinkable. (2011-11-11)

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Bottle; pours dark brown with a beige head; roasted malt aroma with chocolate and coffee; taste is mostly sweet with chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee; finish is dry and a touch bitter with some roasted notes; good stout

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: 355ml twist off (Still?) bottle. It is overcarbed, but if it wasn’t it would be a fine looking beer. Cola/bronw color and a large tan head. Aroma is typical dry stout, bit of coffee, bit of cocoa, bit of metal, grain, leafy hops, oxidized licorice. Surprisingly not heavily oxidized as this bottle is about a month past it’s BB, the havy carb might help. Flavor is predictably metallic, fruity though, some oxidation in a sherry form coming through, licorice and coffee, huge carb. It tastes like the stale English imports from years back, they’ve done a good job imitating old english brews with this one, maybe i should try it fresh and properly carbed someday.. It’s nothing to behold.

name: Shipyard Blue Fin Stout
review: Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are light roasted malts and coffee flavors.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Another brew sampled from their Captian's Collection variety pack. I'd say that I like this tied for 2nd with their Brown Ale...with the Blue Fin Stout coming in at #1. This would be a daytime or starter beer for me, or something to come down off a heavy dark. On the lighter side, but has some decent flavor. Mostly caramel malts and some mild hops at the end. I guess I would try this again since the price is right.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: I got this 12 oz. bottle from a beer club along with three other selections. Pale ales typically do not thrill me and that carries over here. It has a decent pour, a medium yellow liquid and a glorious, strong, bright white head. The smell is grain, dough and a metallic tone. The taste, well, still grainy and some kind of astringency. You try a new beer and sometimes it works and other times it does not.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Beer list bottle, thanks to johnnnnie, clean bready nose, orange color with slight head , fuggles, nickel flavor , bready finish

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Bottle from the sampler case. Pours with a beautiful head. The taste and balance is very good. You will like this beer.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Pours a nice deep amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with malts and a nice finish

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Pours an amber from a bottle, thick white head. Aroma of caramel malt. Not much going on here, except unlike many pale ales the overall mouthfeel is well-balanced. However, little hoppiness, and an over-reliance on caramel malt. Meh.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Orange brown with thin tan head. Fruity, butter, hops, malt, toffee in the nose. Malty with notes of butter, grass, hops and toffee. Firm dry bitterness.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Bottle - Malt forward with some good hop backbone. Pretty basic and one dimensional taste. I will say it stand up to my cigar that I am smoking with it which is nice.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Distinctly mediocre. No head. Little malt and curiously bitter for ABV. Not true to type.

name: Shipyard Chamberlain Pale Ale
review: Tan pour, almost no head. Nose is medium roasted grain. More bitter than sweet. Middle is light cherries and light malt. finish is bitter but one dimensional. OK.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: (Bottle, 0.5 l - BB 30.09.2020, from a Sainsbury's, 20191015) The beer poured deep golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, sweetness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, sweetness, fruitiness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. A decent pale ale.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: I found this to be a below average IPA. Balance wasn't really working too well for me. Overly bitter, but not a good hoppy way....more like the metallic semi-swillish kind. First sample I thought it was OK, but on the 2nd try I wasn't feelin it. I found some others in the Captain's Collection variety pack to be worth the try, but not this one. I'll stick to my Bell's Two Hearted Ale, Lagunitas, Sierra Nevadas, etc. when looking for affordable IPAs

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: fantastically hoppy and crisp beer. picked up a whole case of this once marked as "damaged" and had piles of it in the fridge for ages. i remember it well for its dark fruity flavours mixed with the zingy, citrus hop burst. deceptively strong/medium strength too.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Bottled 0,35L. Dark orange color, hazy aspect with good bubbly and short head duration. Soft yeasty and hop aroma, notes of wood and something sweetish malt. Medium prickly mouth, a little bit smooth taste with modest bitterish and unbalanced final.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Tried this on 2-18-09 the bottle says best before 5-08 so... It pours a slightly cloudy amber orange body. Thin off white cap disappated quickly and left some lace. Aroma and flavor was mostly of caramel malts with the bitter hops showing more in the mid and after taste. Overall it was fairly decent, but i wouldnt mind trying a fresh bottle

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: bottiglia 355 ml, schiuma beige grossolana evanescente, colore ambrato carico torbia, al naso aroma erbaceo, carbonatazione moderata, in bocca lievemente fruttata malto, corpo scarno molto watery, amaro moderato discreto nel finale. Non mi entusiasma l’uso di un solo luppolo Fuggles- IPA anomala

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Bottle. Quite clear, nice copper coloured beer. Floral, grassy hop aroma. Sweet malty and bready taste with a herbal finish. More like a pale ale than an IPA. OK.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Bottiglia 33cl. Colore ambrato - arancio chiaro con schiuma bianca sparita immediatamente. Aroma floreale e leggermente erbaceo. Stessa cosa in bocca, dolce, poco luppolo, piuttosto insignificante. Ok come session beer.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Drank from a pint glass, poured from a twelve ounce bottle. Not loving the aromas from this brew, (I’m not an IPA guy, but love me some Fuggles!) Would have thought "Malted Wheat" would have made this brew a bit more hazy. But I don’t think I would consider this an IPA, not hoppy enough, brewed 3 months ago, but the fuggles shouldn’t have died out that quickly, needs some more hop oomph to be an IPA. All in all, not a bad brew.

name: Shipyard Fuggles IPA
review: Pours a nice orangish color. Aroma is grassy hops. Flavor of a classic pale, big grassy hop flavor.

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Cerveza de estilo belga de cuerpo denso y sabor alcoholico y dulce con toques a madera

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Golden, Clear, White beerhead with frothy, abundant and fine foam. Good retention. The first impression is toasty-bread, the second smell can feels peppery, spicy, and floral hints. Light sweetness, high Carbonation, light body, slight oxidation, dry in the finish. The taste is mainly malty flavors such as toasty-bread, biscuit, and light toffee, also yeasty is touchable like phenolics, and cloves flavors. The fermentation profile is clear.

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Troubled golden appearance with a steady head. Smell of stone fruits and spices and a bitter, fruity taste that stays a while in the mouth. Agreeable and persistent after-taste. From experience I know this beer goes well with raclette, as a replacement for the usual white wine.

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Pours a golden color and has a malty aroma with a sweet spicy taste. Good but not great.

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Standard Belgian blonde. Amber with a small head. Malty with yeasty zest and minimal hop bitterness.

name: Maredsous 6 Blond
review: Hazy golden color with small white head. Malt, bread and light coriander aroma. Refreshingly sweet and light dry taste.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: From old tasting notes. Reddish brown color with a huge tan head capping lots of big bubbles. Sweet caramel-like roasted malt aroma. Flavor follows the nose with a candy-like quality. Big warming alcohol prescence. Intense bittersweet malt flavor. Caramel, bread, nutty and earthy. Excellent.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: From the archives: Had a gift pack from Brussels + variety on the side. All beers in the series are well balanced and complex. This one was rather thin. From time to time, Mardesous beers are available in Tallinn, Stockmann . (Not this one though)

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Ok dubbel/dark ale. Some sweet licorice and caramel, nice amount of bitter in the aftertaste.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Also a lovely beer. Pours dark bronze, with caramel and nut flavours. Goes down smooth. yesssssss

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Sampled long time ago in Antwerp. Neutral aroma. Chesnut colour, laing creamy brown head. Dusty/yeasty edges, oranges, roasted, earthy notes. Tart hebal finish. Medium body. Earthy rye bread aftertaste. Not my favourite.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Bottle@tasting, 33cl. Head: beige colored foam. Color: clear copper. Aroma: fruit. Taste: some bitter and sour. Palate: refreshing, somewhat watery body. Overall: ok.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Bottle. Muddy brown colour with nice off white head. Faint bovril in aroma? My nose is knackered. Flavour is nutty, caramel, sweet but a good kind of sweet. Pleasantly surprised, I thought this was a tasty dubbel (which I’m presuming it is, I couldn’t find that if it isn’t).

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: 33cl bottle 1 year old. Monday, November 22, 2010 dark amber colour. Ok white head.

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: The beer label says Maredsous Dobbel. This is the closest I could find. Pours brown caramel in the glass. Nose and taste of sweetness, dougs and beet sugars. Rated 6/15/2000

name: Maredsous 6 Donker
review: Not sure about the appearance as I got it in the Maredsous pottery chalice thingy... nice creamy head though. Smell’s warm and earthy, with lots of spices. Reminds me of sourwood too. Bitter, liquorice, strong coffee taste. Very spicy, with very little sweet, rather salty actually. Very bitter aftertaste. Refreshing.

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Nice overall malty flavor without being too sweet or too bitter. Made by Duval. Nice brown beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Brown color with lacing beige head. Aroma has caramel, dark malt, nuts, bread, biscuits. Taste is malty sweet with long quite bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, dark malt, nuts, ripe fruits, bitter grassy elements and biscuits.

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Miko³aj Rutkowski is drinking a Maredsous 8° Brune by Abbaye de Maredsous Takie se

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Great beer , dark ruby color , aroma of dried fruits , caramel and roasted malt and a sweet taste, some alcohol notes.

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: hazy dark ruby big thick foamy head. smell sweet, caramel, dark fruit, toffee. taste is sweet caramel toffee chocolate. coffee roasty bitterness in finish. slight alcohol burn as it warms up. very complex

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Dark appearance with a frothy head. Smell of caramel, vanilla and cocoa. Bitter taste of roasted coffee or cocoa. More bitter than other Belgian dark beers.

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: The yeast flavours are spot on, the malt is nice. Perhaps the bottle is a bit oxidize as it tastes kinda stale. but best before date is still 11 months away. online saveaur bier

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Aus der Flasche im 2013-01 getrunken. Süffiges Dubbel, wirkt aber etwas verwässert! Weiß zu Gefallen, aber es gibt wirkliche bessere!

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Appearance: dark cherry-colored, hazy, good carbonation, one finger brownish creamy head. Aroma: fermented dark fruits, alcohol, wooden barrel, a bit of caramel, coffee and roasted malt. Taste: balanced, a bit bitter, good feeling of the carbonation, easy drinking. We have dried plums, alcohol, coffee, roasted malt. Aftertaste: medium to long, alcohol, dark fruits, coffee and roasted malt.

name: Maredsous 8 Brune/Bruin
review: Fabulous beer. Nice aroma. Great all round double. On the re purchase list.

name: Maredsous 10 Tripel
review: Proefglas van 33cl-fles. U: Licht wazig goudblond-oranje met een witte schuimkraag. G: Karamel, beetje muf, gist en een tikje sinaasappelschil. S: Zoet met een lichte bitterheid. Wat zoethoud, karamel, gist en hint van sinaasappelschil. Alcoholwarmte. M: Medium body en medium carbonatie.

name: Maredsous 10 Tripel
review: Slightly hazy amber with a white head which doesn’t last. Aroma is fruity. Taste is more bitter than is typical for the style, with underlying alcohol warmth.

name: St. Bernardus Tripel
review: Als ich dieses Bier gestern in der schönen 0,75l-Sktflasche bekam, habe ich gedacht, dass ich das schon lägst mal getrunken hatte, aber für mich war es tatsächlich neu. Es ist sin schönes, klassisches Tripel, das mir aber etwas samtiger und süffiger (und auch süßer) vorkommt wie die meisten Vertreter dieser Art. Es mag zwar inzwischen ein Industrieprodukt sein, aber geschmacklich ist es wirklich toll.

name: St. Bernardus Tripel
review: Burnt sugar, citrus, pepper butterscotch. Creamy, a bit sweet but very tasty. Some umami somewhere in there

name: St. Bernardus Tripel
review: Pours hazy topaz with a thick and frothy ivory head. Aroma yields fresh malt, yeasty, stone fruit and subtle resiny hop tones. Flavor delivers zesty fresh malt, yeasty, stone fruit, butterscotch and resiny hops. Texture provides lively fizz and smooth, fair body. This tripel is no tripe!

name: St. Bernardus Tripel
review: Very tasty tripel. Visited the brewery in Watou Belgium it’s off the charts outstanding.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Una roja con sabor medio fuerte al final. Safa pero No se si la volverá a probar.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review:
Big malty flavours with a nice floral hop hint to give it a great taste. This beer is perfect for sipping on by a bonfire on a beach on Maui, full on suckling pig and good times.
…

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review:
Appearance: copper; slight head Taste: similar to Sam Adams Lager 04/11/18 - Kona Brewing Co. ((Kona,
…

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Not real impressed with this one. Medium bitterness but not much flavor to accompany it.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review:
Ruby red appearance with thin head. Roasted malt and hints of sweetness in the aroma. Taste is predominately malt, raisins with overbearing sweetness. Short malt finish.
…

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draft at hotel bar in Waikiki. Nice malty hit. Quite refreshing. I prefer it to their other drops.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review:
Pours a finger of head on a dark straw body. Aroma is mild grains.
…

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Clear copper with small offwhite head. Aromas of roasted malt, caramell, honey, orange and mango. Taste is about the same with a medium bitter finish.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle, reddish amber beer, chunky cream colored head. Aroma is malt, dust, and caramel. Taste is malt and caramel. Palate is smooth, carbonation moderate.

name: Kona Lavaman Red Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle: pours amber with a white head, malty aroma and taste, just the lightest touch of hops in the finish, fairly dry.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a golden yellow with a white foam head. Aroma is bread and grass. Flavor is sweet bread. Crisp, easy drinker. Not bad.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 355ml bottle Slightly hazy gold with OK head. Grainy aroma. Light grainy taste.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Solid lager. Slightly more malty than hoppy. Arrow pointing away from Heineken style. Full flavor good gold color. Good ball game lager but maybe not the most crisp on hot day. Definitely a beer fridge regular.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: September 14th, 2015 - The Longboard Lager is everywhere, and as our vacation comes to an end, I figure I would try it closer to the source to see if it is superior to the mainland stuff. It is a straw colored brew, with another head that's hard to solicit, and a lighter aroma. It's tricky to pick out over the wafting scent of cigars. But the flavor is still identifiably crisp, with some apple, and a flatter palate. It is exceedingly "okay" and about what I anticipated.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle from Food Lion. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is grasses, light citrus hints. Flavor is lemongrass, bread, light citrus.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Orange color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Aroma: bready malt, herbal and spicy hop Appearance: clear golden color with a one-finger white head Taste: bready malt, some herbal and spicy hop Palate: light body, watery, medium-high carbonation, crispiness Overall: It's just another commercial lager. Nothing's special.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 355ml bottle from REWE Supermarkt, Waidmarkt 1-3 in Köln, Germany. F: medium, white, average retention. C: urine yellow, almost clear. A: malty, light grassy, bit citrus, bit yeasty. T: light malty, bit grassy, caramel touch, decent dry bitter finish, medium carbonation, nothing special yet easy going beer.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Can drunk at home. Clear golden appearance. Aroma is malt and corn. Flavour is crisp, bitter, hops and yeast.

name: Kona Longboard Island Lager
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 0,33l bottle. Pours pale gold with white head. Had a "perfume-y" aroma when opening, but disappeared quickly. Aroma of malt, lemon, grain. Taste is sweet malt, lemon, slight grassy hops. Decent, refreshing.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: A solid lighter beer that I hadn't found yet on the mainland. Found it at Duke’s in Kauai, coincidence?

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pale yellow with little head that vanishes completely soon enough. Very light aroma. I guess if I just mowed the lawn and downed one, I mean 1 3/4 of these instantaneously it would be awesome, but I don’t mow anymore. Maybe I should start again....................

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draft. Pale gold in colour with strong carbonation. Fairly neutral aromas of wet grain and mild grassy hops. Grainy and oddly heavy malt flavor with a long mineral finish. Bland, and not terribly refreshing in spite of a light body.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draft at Koko Marina. Clear golden yellow color. Aroma of biscuit and lemon. Taste has light citrus. Easy drinking.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draught at the Kona Brewing Co, Hawaii Kai, HI. Clear straw color with a small white head. Mild hops, mild bitterness, papery dryness and grainy maltiness in the aroma. The flavor is dry hops, mild fruitiness, papery dryness and malt. Very easy. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draught at Duke’s. Very pale straw colour, fine white head. Aroma has light fruit and straw. Very average.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: This was a draft pour at the brewpub in Kailua Kona, Hawaii Came in the glass a clear gold with a white head. Nose is light citrus and floral hops. Light in body. Flavor is citrus and there is nothing in the finish. Very bland. this brewery makes some very nice beers. This is not one of them.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: On tap at Duke’s Waikiki 261214. Not as good as some but not as bad as bad as others . Middle of the road average golden ale.

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: "easily Kona’s worst brew...almost no aroma or body. the look is typical of the style, the flavor is typical of the style, which is to say...BOOOOOORING. many other good one’s to choose here."

name: Kona Duke's Blonde Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Tap. Clear light golden pour. Straw, grain, fruit. Light body. Not bad but I am sure blonds in Hawaii can be better

name: Kona Pahoehoe Porter
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: A very reasonable porter. I enjoyed this much more than many other microbrew porters, especially for the malt and hop flavors within.

name: Kona Pahoehoe Porter
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: A decent porter, nice nose and a fairly dry wine like finish. Nice malt and hop presence.

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle 0,355ltr: Clear golden colored brew with mildly dry bitter taste and easy hints of sweet soft fruits. caramel, citrus and tiny bit of honey.

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Gives a good aroma, has a light somewhat fruity taste to it, and goes down easy. This is good for a hot summer day and it captures the feeling of vacationing on a beach. Not much in terms of taste, but it'll do.

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle 0,355L. Clear golden color with small, frothy white head that dissipate fast. Malty aroma with fruity and piney touch. Taste is light sweet, watery and crispy with medium body and almost fizzy carbonation. Dull and boring...

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Aroma is caramel, honey, and mild adjunct. Taste is medium malts with a bready and caramel body. Simple profile but refreshing.

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Typical golden ale. Urine flavour reigns prominent after the immediate taste. There are some tropical notes, but the body is much too thin to sustain them.

name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle at home, drank from the bottle. Citrusy, grapefruity quite standard hops on top of a clean and light base ale. Light bodied, medium carbonation.

name: Kona Awa Awa India Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: I’m not sure if this beer was past it’s prime, but it seemed really muted. Smuggled back by a buddy on vacation. He grabbed this beer on tap and rather enjoyed it. I was not a big fan.

name: Kona Awa Awa India Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: draft in maui. decent tasting beer with lots of hops, bitter ending and flat to the pour. just ok.

name: Kona Awa Awa India Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draft, in Kawaihae (I think this was what they served me). Pretty typical US IPA; not terribly hoppy; PNW hops; very drinkable.

name: Kona Awa Awa India Pale Ale
brewery: Kona Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: A decent IPA as they, good nose and a pleasant bite. Fair head and lace, quite a refresher.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: From old tasting notes. Labeled as "Victory Brandywine Valley Lager". Bright yellow gold color topped by a bubbly beige head. Fragrant caramel malt nose. Tangy, fruity malt flavor hints at pink grapefruit and mango. Nice spicy hop finish balances this ale nicely.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Notes from 2004. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a golden color with a trace white head that faded and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was fairly strong basic lager with a hint of ripe fruits. The flavor was fruity and malty with a effervescent quality. Short finish. Medium body. Solid.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: On draft at Just sports with stegosaurus in ’05. Pours golden with a white head. aroma of sweet malts, hops, and citrus. Flavor is citrsu, sweet malts, and bitter hops.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Good golden lager. Has slightly sweet malty taste with smooth finish. Easy to drink.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Pale yellow color with a thin white head. Sweet grain aroma and a similar flavor.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: All Malt Lager is styled after a classic German Export, a style made famous in the city of Dortmund. Export is a very drinkable, tasty beer, which falls some where in between a Helles and and a Pils. It has a just a touch more malt character than your average Helles, but is a little less hoppy then your classic German Pils. Balance is what defines this beer, and Victory’s example is one of the best domestic examples of this style you will ever taste. It is brew with with 2 row German malts, and whole flower German hops, and comes in at 5.2% abv. Victory All Malt Lager pours to a beautiful, bright, deep golden color, with a bright white head that fades, and a moderate amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer is fantastic with a very pleasing, spicy/grassy hop aroma. The plate on this beer is so crisp and clean, with really great pale malt flavors, with a smooth, round body. Victory All Malt Lager finishes with more crisp malt character up front, then ends with a quick and snappy, grassy hop bite that balances this beer out to perfection. It is the simple, yet elegant character of this beer, that makes it such a wonderful beer to drink.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Poured an effervescent amber with a fizzy white head. Sweet aroma of light corn, wheat, and a touch of hops. Taste is surprisingly sweet with mild corn and hops. Surprisingly full body. Sweet and smooth. Nice.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Bottle, from New World Beer. I’m guessing that this is the Dortmunder as it has no dating on it and by my taste is closer to others description, anyway. Good nose, fruity and sour. Lemon, popourri spice kinda thing. Orangy gold color got a decent amount of sediment, little to no head. Bitter flavors, tart. Kinda lambic ish, cherry, lemon, hay. Thin body, lite watery mouthfeel, tart dry finish. Interesting brew, not what I was expecting. Not that much into Dortmunder/Helles so I’m a little unsure of this.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: Vanilla, floral, lavender, herbal hops and light graininess in the aroma. Clear pale golden body with thin white fully diminishing head. Cookie dough-like yeastiness with a lemony character and some grainy, cereal malts. Strong metallic finish. Medium-light body with a sticky texture and low carbonation. Bottle.

name: Victory All Malt Lager (Dortmunder)
review: poured light golden with a nice fluffy head, smel of malt and a slight little sweet smell also, flavor is different lemons and a bit bitter, drinkable though id try it again.

name: Tetleys English Ale
review: Cerveza de amargor medio alto, ligero sabor a madera y caramelo y espuma densa

name: Tetleys English Ale
review: Color ámbar, cristalina. Dos dedos de crema con excelente retención. Sin aroma. Gusto ligero a malta tostada, toques herbales y metálicos, débil en general. Cuerpo acuoso. Típica bitter industrial nitrogenada, con muy buen aspecto pero que se te queda corta porbtodas partes.

name: Tetleys English Ale
review: On holiday in wales from tap amber colored body with a white head and with a spicy malt hop aroma a spicy malt hop sweet taste with a light bitter finish

name: Tetleys English Ale
review: Appearance Pours a clear amber, with a creamy white nitro head. Aroma Typical English aromas; herbal, earthy, and with a bit of toffee. The overall aroma is that of stale beer, and it does taste a bit of grain and butter. Taste Very sweet, with a weak bitterness. Palate Low carbonation, nitro creaminess in the mouthfeel. Overall While the beer does have the typical English ale aromas, it has an overall aroma similar to that of stale beer, and the taste is far too sweet for my liking.

name: Spaten Pils
review: Piwo jasnos³omkowe, klarowne, piana niezbyt mocna, bia³a. Aromat to lekkie cytrusy i delikatny chmiel. W smaku s³odkawe, przyjemne na podniebieniu, dobre piwo.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Best before May 2020. Good thing I looked at the reviews; I didn't realize that I hadn't reviewed it yet! It pours a lovely clear amber with a very healthy looking head of foam. Smells of bread, caramel malt, some grassy hop notes. Excellent balance imho. Bready malt, grassy hops, working in unison. Sip after sip, a true joy to drink. Light sweetness, which is overdone in quite a few domestics of the style. Not too hoppy, again, I've tasted that in some domestics. Simple, tasty, done right. Smooth, almost creamy mouthfeel. I haven't seen this very often in Casper. This was part of a mixed case of the Premier Lager and Optimator Doppelbock. Cost me around $34. What a bargain!

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Ein Prosit, ein Prosit Der Gemütlichkeit Ein Prosit, ein Prosit Der Gemütlichkeit. OANS! ZWOA! DREI! G'SUFFA! Ziggy Zaggy Ziggy Zaggy, Oi Oi Oi!

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Bottle from Beer Zoo. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of earth and a hint of sour grain. Flavour follows the aroma. Medium body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft fizz. Not bad, but not one I’d rush to have again.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Tap @ Slainte, Salamanca, Spain. Amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, straw. Taste is malt, sweet, hints of toffee. Medium body, average carbonation.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Botella 500ml Color Ambar,espuma blanca,fina,alta,resistente.Aroma malta,caramelo,frutal.Sabor una combinacion buena entre dulzor y amargor,malta,caramelo,frutal

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Tap, Sharkeys Radford. Pours medium amber with light tan head that is not persistent. Aroma clean, caramel very light hopping. Taste is dry, light bitterness, sweet malt, clean finish. Not a lot going on here but clean, well made and drinkable (just ordered a second, if you’re counting). The Germans know how to make drinkable beer. The caramel distinguishes this from their Helles in a good way. I love the fall ... leaves turn color, the air turns crisp, Spaten Oktoberfest shows up, yada yada yada.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: $2.25 bottle, GTGSP. Amber brown, clear, off-white head. Green grasses, brown leaf and grasses, cracker, caramel nose. Brown leaf, roasted malt. Dry. Decent.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Fun to find a true German octoberfest but...Lots of malt. Reminds me how much better American beer is than European. They beat us on tradition but their beer has been outdone by American microbrews.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Draft at Zieglerbrau Dachau. Tastes like toffee malt, dried fruits, and corn. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like corn, toffee malt, and dried fruits.

name: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur-Märzen
review: Pours clear dark amber. Falls short of being significantly memorable. Finding this ordinary.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: These folks speaking ill about Laser are nothing but corporate shills being paid by big beer to distract you from the fact the perfect beer once existed in this dark and lonely world and it was called Laser. Don’t listen to these naysayers for they know they’re lying. They just sold out and they have to live with themselves. I, however, will be butt naked at Walmart drinking the last 40oz Laser in existence when the rapture comes. Hallelujah!

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: Alcoholics do not even like to drink this swill. It looks like week old pee and the appearance is the high point of the experience. Last time I saw this it was 89 cents.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: I used to drink this when I was underage and lived in Green Bay in the late 90s. Don’t really remember what it tasted like too well (I wasn’t as picky back then). But it was cheap and I loved the label. I wish I could find a t-shirt.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: Hey, it was 99 cents back when I was in college for a 40. However, I should have just spent the money for something less offensive. Don’t even try this as a joke. Nice 1980’s label. Serving: 40oz!

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: This beer is AWESOME and tastes like robots and puréed kittens. Nice lingering finish.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: back in college, a friend and i discovered ’Laser’ in a dimly lit convenience store with bars on the windows in the worst part of town. look at the label and that’s all you need to know. smells like napalm, tastes like diesel fuel and cat urine. they should have paid us to remove it from the store. for 30 cents a gallon, we got what we wanted - drunk.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: skunky scent of a broke down caddy with hints of the crotch of a 2 bit hoe yellow as the dog piss on the carpet and as tiney as the foil on the windws

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: When i was underage My sister was going to the beer store and I told her to suprise me. $4 for a 12 pack of 16oz. I never did find anyone who could finish one.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: I used to get this when I was in High School. We used to drive to the hood, find ourselves a fine homeless gentleman to by us beer and, this is what he’d always get us (with one for him to boot). It was disgusting then, it’s disgusting now.

name: Laser Malt Liquor
review: (bottle - 40 oz) Clear gold color with not much foam. Smells like stale hops, corn oil, and gasoline. Flavor actually isn’t that bad though. Very dry and hoppy with a watery middle and that normal malt liquor finish. Lingers for a while.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Sampler wheel at the brewery. Holy shit I didn’t realize they’d be 7oz tasters. Now I have 56oz of beer in front of me arranged in a wheel that makes me feel like I’m captaining a pirate ship. Hunkering down because this is going to be a long night. Anyway ... Clear straw pour with white head. Deeply toasted cereal wheat with honey is the impression from the aroma. Also feet. Lightly sweet taste up front with a really harsh, unpleasant bitterness in the finish. So much bitterness it hurts. 7oz is going to be an eternity. Banana flavored wheaties coated in nettles then burned and rubbed with hops. Palate: feels like bitterness coating my entire mouth. Overall: not great.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Another unfinished flavor, I.E. low alcohol with a lot of sweetness but no real flavor. Finish was fine but didn't have a lot of aroma. I'm not a wheat beer guy so I'm not the best judge of them.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Draught at the brewpub. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. The aroma is very grainy with some bread crust and toast, maybe some earth. The flavor is lemon, earth, bread crust, and seltzer. Dryish finish, a little astringent. Meh.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: This was by far the worst beer in their line up. There was a slight hint of wet hay in the aroma and the flavor was more akin to a pale lager than anything else. I could barely drink this.
