name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Had on tap at the brewpub with my fiancee but unfortunately was eating dinner and didn’t take good notes.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Sample at the brewpub. This beer pours a hazy yellow color with a thin ivory white head that dissipates quickly. Stringy lacing. Wheat and sweet fruit in the nose. Light body with flavors of wheat, citrus and sweet malt. The finish is clean and fruity with a short sweet aftertaste. An "introductory" beer through and through.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: gold with a thin white head. Grainy dough in the nose. Malt, dough, citrus, pepper, and honey flavor. Slightly bitter, kind of watery.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: On tap at the brewpub. This is not retired. Simply the brewpub changed its name. Same brewer, same beer, same recipe. Pours pale yellow with a whispy thin white head. Slight diacetyl aroma with an odd off-flavor fruity mistake flavor. Little to no hop bitterness.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: Draught at the brewpub. Attractive looking beer...cloudy and yellow with a thick white head that left some lace on the glass. Dry grainy aroma and flavor with a touch of bread dough and citrus. Decent American wheat.

name: Third Base Golden Hawk Wheat
review: On tap at the brewpub. The body was a very hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma was lemons with some sweet cake donuts. There was also a smell of bathroom cleaner. The taste had some woody dry soap. There was also some strange lemon zest. A bad wheat.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: hazy amber with a thin white head. Hoppy nose. Caramel malt and hops flavor, a bit of citrus but the hops overpower it. kind of thin and one dimensional as I didn’t pick up much else from this one. Decent.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. This is not retired. Simply the brewpub changed its name. Same brewer, same beer, same recipe. This was the only beer served here with any hop character. However, the malt backbone has whimpered away leaving this an unbalanced watery potion of harsh hop bitterness.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Clear light orange color with filmy off white head that left some lace. Aroma is of subdued malty caramel and sprucy hops. tasted of caramel and a touch of brown sugar with a pleasant soft bitter finish. There was also an annoying soapy flavor lurking somewhere in the background.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub: Reddish amber with a lightly sticky head. Pretty watery. Sharp citric bite, but no body behind it.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: Light amber color with traces of a head. The aroma is fairly nice with grapefuit and some bread. Fresh grass too. Solid aroma. The taste is bitter grapefruit with a medium mouthfeel. There is also a little pine. Actually a very nice bitter that approaches an English style pale ale.

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: Dark amber body. Caramel and sprucy hops in the aroma. The hops take the lead in the flavor, they’ve taste like sprucy dandelions. There’s a hint of caramel sweetness but not too much. Quaffable!

name: Cedar Flying Aces Ale
review: Pretty decent pale. Nice hoppy aroma with decent caramel sweetness and a nice fairly dry finish. Solid.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Sample #3 at brewpub. Medium amber with spotty lacing. Aroma of caramel, bread, honey, resin. Taste: moderately sweet with bitter finish (I’d say "quite" bitter, but after the last two this is a relief). Palate: medium body, aggressively high carbonation scrubbing my tongue raw. Overall: 3 down. I can do this. Also, yeah sports! And guns n roses. Yeah, I’m pumped!

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a light to hazy red color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. The lacing was somewhat spotty and didn’t arrange itself in any sort of fashion - it just was all over the place in its lacing. The smell had mainly a malty kind of sweet to roasty/earthy bittered but tangy citrus hops. The taste was mainly sweet through the earthy maltiness. A more pronounced caramel maltiness comes out in the taste. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was right on par, as it wasn’t too sharp nor smooth - it seemed just right. Overall, good red ale worthy of having again.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Not bad at all! Kind of a Marzen IPA hybrid flavor. I really like it. Nice sweet start with a light body with the tang of an Oktoberfest but an IPA finish.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy rust color with beige head. The aroma is mild and toasty with some caramel, some tangerine, and grapefruit. The flavor is raisin and tangerine, light hop bitterness, grapefruit and toast in the finish. Not mindblowing, but solid.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: On tap at brewery, Pours a light amber with almost no head. Aroma is typical of the style with a mild hint of hops with earthy overtones. The flavor is very similar to the aroma with a little less hop profile and more earthiness.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Had on tap at the brewpub with my fiancee but unfortunately was eating dinner and didn’t take good notes.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub. The beer is a clear dark amber color with a thin beige head that recedes steadily. Swiss cheese lacing on the glass. Equal parts hops and malt in the nose. Medium body with moderately bitter piney hops and malt flavors. The finish is hoppy at first and leaves an earthy malt aftertaste. Solidly average Amber all around.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: pours a reddish amber with a thin white head. Pine hops and molasses in the nose. Similar flavor, honey and bread also. Smooth, little carbonation. My session beer from them.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. This is not retired. Simply the brewpub changed its name. Same brewer, same beer, same recipe. Pours a semi-reddish amber in color with a non-descript white head that thins quick. Very subtle aroma of toasted grains. Watery and boring, but not offensive as some of the beers here.

name: Third Base Red Rocket Amber Ale
review: Tried this at the Festival of Iowa Beers, reddish bronze color, light sweet aroma, flavor is sweetish, no discernible hops, a little citrus.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Golden color, with good foam. Nose. Malt, grassy hops. Taste Malt, hop. After taste, hop bitterness.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Aromat mokre zboze cukrowy karmelek i ten skunks na potege. No jak zmrozone, chce ci sie pic to i szybko wypijesz to ok

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Illata finom, szaga büdös, íze ízetlen, jelleme ízetlen, színe arany, álatja fácán.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Golden color, medium white head. Malty lager aroma. Malty, slightly sweet taste, some crisp hops at the end. Good body, medium carbonation, good balance. Not bad, but just a decent, average lager.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Bought it in Slovak supermarket,can 0,5l,wasn't that bad but i didn't felt it that day,was a bit on bitter side,i need to try it once more and give it another review,but for now...

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Czyste z³oto. Piana s³aba, oran¿adowa jej struktura. Znika. Pachnie s³odowo. Musi œwie¿e, bo skunksa niet. Smakuje s³odowo. Akcenciki miodowe. Niska goryczka.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Ez az egyik kedvenc pilsener söröm, talán a legjobb szlovák ivósör. Nemrég elérhetõ áron az eredeti újra kapható lett itthon. Nagyon szép sötét arany színe van, a hab pont egy vékony ujjnyira marad meg. Kristálytiszta komló-maláta illatelegy, semmi zavaró, a komló van többségben. Friss, komlós, közepesen keserû, van egy kis malátás édesség is mögötte. Pont jól szénsavazott. Nem véletlen, hogy a lagzimban ez volt frissen csapolva :)

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Botella 0,5l Dorada con blanca espuma,fina,alta,media resistencia.Aroma malta,herbal.Sabor combinacion bastante buena entre suave amargor y ligero dulzor,no es tan amarga como muchas cervezas eslovakas,malta,herbal

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Blind test - 25 koncerniaków. Wygl¹d: Barwa z³ota, klarowna z drobno i œrednio pêcherzykow¹, nisk¹ bia³¹ pian¹, która szybko redukuje siê do zera, brak lacingu. Aromat: Diacetyl z nut¹ estrów jab³kowych oraz lekkie utlenienie i akcent s³odowy, chlebowy. Smak: Tak jak w aromacie. W ustach pó³s³odkie, treœciwoœæ œrednioniska, wysycenie œrednie. Goryczki brak. Finisz wytrawny z mas³em diacetylowym.

name: Zlaty Bazant (12% / Golden Pheasant / Premium)
review: Boca 0,5L - kupljena u Èeškoj - prosjeèan pilsner, malo više sladnih nota..ipak slabiji od dosad probanih koji su pristigli iz Èeške

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Sample #7 at brewpub. Opaque deep brown with frothy khaki head. Aroma of semisweet chocolate and cola. Taste is moderately sweet, chocolate cola with a lightly bitter finish. Umami, maybe even a bit salty. Light body with smooth texture and light carbonation. Overall: okay. After the initial train wreck these last few have come together better.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Tap at Third Base. Pours black with a little red at the edges. Thin tan head that dissipates quickly. Just a little coffee in the nose. Some chocolate and coffee in the taste. Tastes better as it warms up.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Draught at the brewpub. Pours reddish black with tan head. rich chocolate and coffee aroma with some almond notes. The flavor is bitter chocolate with a South American coffee note. Very silky mouthfeel. I notice a slight Craisin note after a few sips. Not too shabby.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Had this at the brewpub. This beer pours black with a medium tan head . Nice line of lacing on the glass. Roasted coffee aroma smell with malts/caramel. Creamy flavor of roasted malt and coffee along with some chocolate. Decent overall.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: This looked in all parts like an oatmeal stout and it had the thin mouth feel of an oatmeal stout but an oatmeal stout it was not. The nose was that of a rauchbier which was wonderful and the flavors that followed were along the same line. Very smokey flavors but none of the subtle oatmeal at all. Not sure what happened here, but it was good.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Strong coffee aroma with a short lived head. Good flavor with a lingering finish. Not as smooth as I like, but it’ll do if you need a dark beer fix

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Had on tap at the brewpub with my fiancee but unfortunately was eating dinner and didn’t take good notes. All I noted for this one was "Flawed."

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Sample at the brewpub. The beer pours black with a medium beige head that diminishes steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Roasted coffee aroma with notes of malt. Medium, creamy body with flavors of roasted malt and coffee along with some sweet chocolate. The finish is short and roasty with a bit of coffee left behind. Decent overall.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: Black with a thin tan head. Flavors of oats, coffee, caramel, maple syrup, and smoke. Slightly bitter, decent hop kick. Good.

name: Third Base Black Cobra Oatmeal Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. This is not retired. Simply the brewpub changed its name to Third Base Bar & Brewery. Same brewer, same beer, same recipe. They claim that they brew this beer with 50 pounds of oatmeal in every batch. If that is true, they must be brewing a million gallon batch. I get no oatmeal smoothness or thickness of palate. It is dark brow/black like a stout, but the head is thin and whispy. Far too watery for the style, this merely musters up a burnt flavor to the taste.

name: Cedar White Rapids Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub: Very light yellow with no head to speak of. Lemon-grassy and shallow sweet candy, almost lemonade-like.

name: Cedar White Rapids Ale
review: Very light yellow with almost no head. The aroma is white bread with some oranges. The taste is slightly sour oranges with some grassy notes. I guess this is created for the Bud drinkers in the establishment.

name: Cedar White Rapids Ale
review: Piss-yellow body with not much head. There’s a hint of grainyness or grassyiness in the aroma, but there’s not a whole lot there in the first place. Unremarkable flavor, light malts with pilsener-y hops thrown in.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: Had on tap at the brewpub with my fiancee but unfortunately was eating dinner and didn’t take good notes.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: Sample at the brewpub. This beer is a mostly clear amber color with a medium light beige head that recedes steadily. Sweet malt and honey aroma. Light body with an unrelenting sweet character. Honey and malt dominate the flavor, with just a touch of fruit in the background. The finish is sugary sweet with a malt aftertaste. Barely average overall.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: amber with a thin white head. Not much in the nose, slight malt sweetness. Candy sugar, honey, a bit of hops in the flavor. Sweet at first, bitter as it goes down. Kind of water.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: On tap at the brewpub. This is not retired. Simply the brewpub changed its name to Third Base Bar & Brewery. Same brewer, same beer, same recipe. The beer is served super cold here and has little if any aroma as it is. Hoes not smell like a bock, or even a lager. Light amber in color with a thin white head. I get little sweetness or honey. The beers here vary only in shades of amber and are all watery.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: Draught at the brewpub. Clear orange-ish color with thin off white head. Aroma was a bit lacking with only minimal brown sugar and honey. Flavor was equally uninspiring with a bit of light honey and a malty brown sugar note. Slightly sweet. Okay beer, but overall it was pretty boring.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: On tap at the brewpub: Golden amber and yet another sharp lemon twinge. Only difference between this and their White Rapids was a slightly darker color.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: Clear light gold with a thin head. The aroma is definitely honey with some breakfast cereal. The taste is light honey and some malted oats. There is also a hint of cherries and flowers. A decent light summer type brew.

name: Third Base Helles Honey Bock
review: Golden color. Mild roasty, caramelly malt with a lightness that could be attributed to the honey. Meh.

name: Cedar Dunkel Weisse
review: Draught at the brewpub. Muddy brown color with thick tan head that laced the glass. Nutty banana aroma with a healty amount of roasted malt. Flavor was similar. Full bodied, yeasty. Decent beer.

name: Cedar Dunkel Weisse
review: On tap at the brewpub: Reddish black. Vaguely wheaty, yet still with the now famous Cedar lemon twinge. Decent enough malty sweetness, and probably their best offering while I was there.

name: Cedar Dunkel Weisse
review: Dark amber color with traces of head. The aroma is light malt with nuts and bananas. The taste is rich walnuts and some bread. Notes of beef jerky. Decent, but finishes a little sour.

name: Cedar Dunkel Weisse
review: Dark brown body. Dry, sort of smokey aroma. There’s also some caramel sweetness. Enjoyable flavor, has dark wheat bread and caramel. Finishes with sharp wheatiness. A good example of the style!

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: Tap. Clayton Hotel, Manchester Airport. Clear gold. Barely a head. Decent grassy hop, and fairly clean grain. Touch of caramel. Smells ok. Taste errs toward sweet, with some grassy bitterness. Light to medium body. Fine carbonation. Light bitter finish.

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: Clear golden with a frothy but fast dissipating head. Strawy, metallic smell with an apple note. Smooth taste with nice hoppy, floral notes. Low carbonation. An utmost drinkable beer, it goes down the throat like nothing.

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: Aromat s³odowy, lagerowy. W smaku s³odowe, lekko s³odkie. Nic specjalnego..

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: 9/10/2019. Draft at Spatenhaus an der Oper, Munich, Germany. Poured clear golden with a good size white head. Aroma of hops, malt, fruit and straw. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average carbonation. Not bad to go with the meal we had there.

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: 500 ml bottle. Grass smell (better than the usual lager) Gold color low head. Google "beer" in google and this what this beer looks like. Taste is average, but well made. DEUTSCHLAND! average/good

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: 500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.2%. Pale golden. Medium, not-too-long lasting head. Aroma somewhere in between pear and sweetcorn. Moderate carbonation. Very straightforward lager. Equal parts grass, sweetcorn and bready malt, but all are so dialed down that it just becomes one flavour, completely dodging eaches potential naffness. Not dissimilar to Heineken (the hop extract connection, perhaps?). Cool and refreshing, with an entirely inoffensive taste (rarer among lagers than you might think...). Nothing to recommend for the beer-savourers; nothing to fault for the thirst-quenchers. Therefore I can't rate this too highly, but certainly not too lowly. Of course, for the price, most wouldn't think it was worth it, but hey ho. Worth drinking a bottle if you want to set yourself a baseline for lager - anything better than this is definitely good lager, anything worse probably isn't.

name: Spaten Münchner Hell / München / Premium
review: Can. historical beer as long as I heard. sweet maltiness. can’t feel any dominating hops or aftertaste. Great one for thirst. A bit higher ABV than plain lager beers.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Bright Amber orange color topped by a thick creamy mousse-like beige head. Mild toffee malt aroma. Soft creamy toasted malt flavor. Smooth and silky.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: 14.9 oz nitro can-A copper body with a of course big foamy white head and an aroma of mild hops and malt. Taste of the same with a little sweetness thrown in. Not bad nor good.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: Vinny and Jen are scary!! They make this beer taste normal... it needs something... like to crazies talking in the back ground!

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: pub can. Yeasty aroma, some malts and a little hop spice. Pours out foamy white ad settles to a rich amber. Rich, thick, some malt sourness mixed with mild hop bitterness. Creamy feeling on the palate. Not a fan of some Greene King beers except for this and Ruddles County Wide mouth.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: From a can.Metal taste,plastic look,offensive aroma,Greene king,you get the picture.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: Out of a widgeted can - This pours a light copper color with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is malty sweet and fruity. The mouthfeel is a widgeted smoothness, almost a bit too creamy... which is why I’m usually not too fond of things rattling around in my bottles and cans. It’s too much. This, tho’, didn’t taste all that bad. It’s basically a sweet malt drink with a mildly contrasting hops bitterness. Nothing too exciting one way or the other.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: Tinned, nitro widget. Amber with gas induced head. Low impact poor quality tinned beer, metallic taste, thick mouthfeel with the nitrogen. Pants really.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: 14.9 ounce can. Pours coppery with a huge nitrogen-widgeted cremy head, with a Guinness cascade. I just love these N2-widget cans. Aroma of hops, citrus, malt, and fruit. Tastes malty, fruity, hoppy, with a crisp, slightly dry finish. Very complex.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: This is another typical English nitro can along the lines of Boddington's or Caffrey's. Dark golden amber color with a medium creamy off-white head. Medium thin lacing too. The aroma is mild hops. Medium-bodied and creamy with a lightly malty and hoppy flavor. The bitterness comes through more in the finish which is very dry. Ho hum.

name: Ruddles Pub Ale
review: typical nitro ale....too thin, underhopped, nice amber color, malty and a bit too sweet.

name: Hempen Ale
review: Consumed from the bottle but not inhaled. The hemp seeds add a unique flavor that might be unpleasant to some, and should not be likened to the flavors of hops as the brewer suggests. Might appeal to some, but I’ll abstain the next time this one passes around.

name: Hempen Ale
review: The ONLY thing negative about this beer is that it is retired! The wonderful aroma hemp and hops hit you in the face the moment you opened it. No it doesn’t taste like bong water! It’s a good full body beer that’s hoppy and has a beautiful reddish color. The sudsy head even tastes good! I miss it and can hardly wait for it to come back. What a good idea Flying Dog!

name: Hempen Ale
review: 12oz bottle. Had this in 1997 with all of my hippy friends because it was made with hemp. Very weak and watery with a dirty finish. I remember comparing this to a combo of Bud and bong water. Thankfully it is not made any more so other hippies dont have to taste this evil ploy.

name: Hempen Ale
review: Notes on a ticket stub from The Other Ones 1998- Golden brown, fluffy head. Caramel and chocolate malts on the nose. Creamy mouth-feel with notable hints of nuts upfront. Finish’s with malty/hoppy blast

name: Hempen Ale
review: Yep, smells and tastes like hemp. Goes great with Bob Marley and cheez-it crackers. If your are expecting anything better then a pleasant mixture of corona and bong water, you will be dissapointed.

name: Hempen Ale
review: Had this beer on 7/14/1998. Color is a nice golden brown, carbonation looks good with a light head. Aroma is a strong malt scent with good back tones of hops. Taste is full of flavor almost a Pale Ale. It starts off with a creamy body full of a roasted malt feel, this goes down easy. The finish is also full of flavor with a light bitterness and a good floral hop flavor part of which they claim comes from the hemp seeds. It fits the description on the label very well and is a great full flavored brew.

name: Hempen Ale
review: Name: Blue Ridge Hempen Ale Date: 05/17/1997 Source: Brewfest, Richmond VA Appearance: dark amber, thin head, Aroma: toasted malt with floral hop aroma, Flavor: malt flavor with a definate earthy hemp touch that substitutes for bitterness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Hempen Ale
review: I am all for gimmicky beer, but it should have some distinct or interesting taste. I have said it before, and will say it again "Just because you can, doesnt mean you should".

name: Hempen Ale
review: Rating from memory, had a few years back. wanted it to be my 420th rating. Never found this beer to be hoppy at all. It had a sweet after taste almost like bottled iced tea. Aroma was sweet malty with some lingering hop aspects. Don’t know what hemp seeds taste like in order to say if i could taste it but like others have said it is a novelty beer.

name: Hempen Ale
review: Bargain bin at my distributer for $0.79 for a 12 oz bottle. I dont really know what hemp seeds are supposed to taste like but if they did substitue all the hops for hemp bitterness and flavor it kinda tastes just like a regular ale. This is not to say it is bad however, I actually enjoyed it. Deep amber color with a pretty good head. Some spice in the aroma, which is otherwise dominated by malt as is the flavor profile. You can clearly tell they used lots of crystal and caramel malts as well as a hint of chocolate. Just a brief hint of those cascades in the aroma as it warms. Different in its approach, yet very middle of the road as far as overall taste and uniqueness.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles’s place. Thanks Stas. Clear golden. Oxidized aroma with malt, honey, caramel, cardboard, alcohol. Sweet flavor, oxidized, with malt, cardboard, honey, caramel, and a bitter stale hops finish with a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Purchased at Trader Joe in Vegas. Pours a very slight hazy golden-amber colour with a warm cap, decent retention and lacing. Fruity, sweet, nutty aromas. The taste is pretty sweet, with some hops in the middle blending things, but with some metallic notes. Some oranges and light alcohol. Ugly label and the beer is not that well balanced. Glad I only have one of these.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear orange color with a small white head. A light toast and orange nose. Toasted malts, sweet sugary notes, berries, strawberry especially. Odd one. Like an E European lager. Not really my thing. But it still has a drinkability and sugary sweetness like a cake that is enjoyable.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Had a bottle on the 4th of July. Aroma is brown sugar. Flavor is generic amber ale. Meh.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Bottle. Pours a copper color with a fair head that fades quickly. Aroma isonthemild side with some citrus, caramel and bit of grain. Taste is also a bit mild with caramel sweetness, citrus and grain. Mild bitterness that lingers in to the finish. Fairly light body, quite smooth but expected a bit of character.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: [Bottle (12oz)] Pours a slightly hazy gold with an average size frothy lasting white head. Mild aroma of fruit, wheat, paper, caramel and vegetal notes. Flavour of fruit, alcohol, paper, caramel and bread. Moderate bitter finish. Medium bodied. Not sure what style this is supposed to be, whatever it is it’s only O.K.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: From the 12 fl. oz bottle. Light amber yellow pour with huge, foamy white head. Clarity is decent. The aroma is a fairly straight forward corny, cereal malt character. A little toastiness. The body is light to medium but also creamy. The taste has a gritty pale malt character that ends clean and crisp. There is nothing exciting about this. It is another Trader Joe’s offering that manages to do the trick but does not stand out as anything extraordinary. But, sure, now I could eat a few hot dogs with it.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: From a 12 ounce bottle. Pours a copper gold, slightly translucent with little carbonation. Smells like meister brau. Bitter and biscuity, can taste the alcohol. Leaves an aftertaste as if from a corroded pipe. Grows on you though. Not the best, nor worst.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Bready, slightly-off over-ripe tropical fruit aroma. Color is slightly murky yellow with a one-finger white head. Taste is really not bad. Slight tropical fruitiness, malt sweetness, mild hops bitterness. Very generic, but certainly not bad to the point of a 17, its current score. Perhaps I got lucky? From my local Trader Joe’s. I don’t want to have it again, but it’s definitely not bad.

name: Fat Weasel Ale
review: Bottle pours gold cloudy with white head. Aroma is slight fruit with malt. Very little other flavors. Taste is light DMS, caramel. Very astringently bitter. Like chewing asprin.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Pours a cloudy opaque golden with an off-white head. Sweetish fruity nose - but not very banana like. Medium body, sweet fruit with only a discreet edge of yeast. Dry finish, OK as such, just not very Hefe-like.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Not terrible for a wheat beer, but certainly not great. As far as this brew pub is concerned, come here for the view and food.... not the beer.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Draft. A light golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of citrusy and wheat. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat, leading to a dry wheaty finish. Boring.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Sampled at the brewpub on 7/10/2009. This wheat beer pours a slightly hazy light gold color from the tap. Small to no head. The aroma is wheat and cereal. A light to medium bodied wheat beer. The malts are fruity and cereal, touch of banana. Nice carbonation. Kind of a so-so, typical brew pub, wheat beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild wheaty, less on the estery notes. Mild wheaty and medium dry flavoured. Ends mild bitter and dry.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Date: July 09, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy yellow, fine white head Aroma: light wheat aroma Flavor: light sweet malt flavor Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 7/20 Rating: 2.1/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: *+/4

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: I had this on draft at the Beach Chalet brewpub. This is a hazy yellow pour with not a whole lot of flavor or much going on.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Tap at the brewpub: Pale golden with a fading white head. Simple aroma- lightly wheaty and very clean with no ester actions. Light bodied and crisp. Clean wheat malt base meshes with a grainy pale malt sweet note. Not much yeast character. Very American feeling. No major flaws, just boring.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Hazy golden. Aroma is very light with light wheat, grass and pale malt notes. Quite sweet, even more bland.

name: Beach Chalet West End Wheat
review: Blond colored without much carbonation. Not very wheaty looking. No aroma. Light wheatiness in flavor. Stale, dank hops.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: Nice dark cola color, white head and good lacing. Slightly sticky malt flavor that lasted for a while. Smooth, I like it coming in a larger re-cappable bottle.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: (Bottle) Pours a lightly cloudy amber body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Dry palate. Caramel malt flavor. Fairly one dimensional beer.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: Not impressed with this one. Pours thin, taste is a hodgepodge of malts and hops with no definite direction in mind. Finish is sour and unmemorable.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: Sour nose. Barely tart at first sip, sweet and light malts quickly fade to grassy, gritty hops. Lingering sourness aftertaste. Strange. The "quick taste" is here and gone in an instant with only hints of sourness left over.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: Sour, sour nose, but a mild taste. Pale amber color, with some grass and straw flavors. No real head to speak of. Needed a bit more complexity.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: I found this to be a nice, fairly complex bitter. Nice, mild start with a touch of sweetness, finishing with a bitter taste and a bitter, but not overly so, aftertaste. A nice occasional beer, but not a regular one.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: This beer reaffirms the fact that I don't like French beers. This just doesn't taste good and there's nothing special about it to make me interested in it.

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: The notes on this are as below... particularly bland and mediocre...........

name: Fischer Hoopla!
review: As with most of Fischer’s beers they fail to meet my standards for acceptability and this one falls right into line. The beer pours a limpid gold with a bright white head that is average in size and frothy in texture, the lace a very thin but covering sheet. Nose is crisp and fresh, mostly malt, sweet and the start sweet with a fair malt presence, top is fair to middling in feel. Finish has a brisk acidity, the hops adequate and the aftertaste dry, just average, just to light for me, but not a total loss.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Draft. Poured clear light golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Light to moderate balanced aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Light to moderate sweet flavor with a light to moderate sweet finish of medium duration. This beer met my expectations.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Draught @ Beach Chalet Brewery, SF. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, light hay. Flavor is light sweet, malt, grain, hay. Thin to medium body, average to lively carbonation. 180718

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Sampled at Beach Chalet Brewpub in SF. Pour was clear yellow Nose of grains. Very light body and a watery mouthfeel. Flavor is something odd. No finish at all. A glass of Bud would be better.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: On tap at Lake Chalet under the Lady of the Lake alias. It pours a pale yellow color with a white head. The aroma has huge notes of buttered popcorn and dough. Uncooked grains. The flavor is the same. Low carbonation with heavy notes of butter and lighter notes of lemon and noble hops. Pretty much a train wreck.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Typical light. A bit more citrusy than most. Very watery appearance. Nice view of the beach to accompany it. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Draught @ the Beach Chalet restaurant. Clear golden pour. Aroma is slightly sweaty and grainy, some spices and quite watery. Flavor is slightly bitter, some grains and thin with some meatyness. Strange brew.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Pale gold beer with a slight haze. Light dry palate. Moderate carbonation. Floral bitterness with a little citrus. Dry finish with a lingering bitter aftertaste.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Pale straw colored pour with a white head. Rather vegetal hop aroma. Fruity esters, straw, grass, and pale malt notes with a primarily grain sweetness. Perhaps a hint of yeast. The flavor is watery, vegetal, and grassy. A bit salty, even. Some grain sweetness, pale malt, yeast, and a mild fruit ester component.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Draught @ the brewpub, San Francisco. Rated on 18.10.2012. Pours a clear pale yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of mild grainy malts, some hay and honey. Flavour of grassy hops, grainy malts and hay. Light bodied, foamy mouthfeel and a light malty finish with bitterness. Pretty German for a Golden Ale.

name: Beach Chalet V.F.W. Light
review: Tap at the brewpub, 17/08/12. Fizzing, thin-lidded pale straw with strands of lace. Light herbal, grassy aroma with sesame sprinkled bun. Sesame and grassy hop finishing with bread. Dash of lemon. A bit throwaway but pleasant.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Draught @ the Beach Chalet restaurant. Clear golden pour. Aroma is grainy with some German malts. Flavor is malty but also a bit watery. A bit boring brew.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Slightly darker amber color. Aroma is toast, bread, grass, caramel. Medium to light body, quite drinkable. Lacks the finesse of some better ones out there.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Deep copper body with an off-white head. Spicy caramel aroma. The flavour is grainy and sweet with lots of caramel, and the body is fairly well-balance. Decent, but I’ve decided that oktoberfests are not for me.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Draft. Rich caramel color with an off-white head. Caramel, earth, and spice aroma. Buttery, caramel, earth, spice flavor. Medium body. LIngering caramel and butter.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: A big malty beer here. Strong caramel aroma and taste. I appreciate the bold flavor and aroma. Something about it just doesn’t blend well though. Needs to be smoother and rounded out more.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Red amber ale with a light white head. Light sweet caramel malt with fruity esters. Sweet malt in mouth, with some vanilla notes and nutty. Medium bodied. On tap at BP, August 2005.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: On tap at the San Francisco "Brews on the Bay" Festival. Light copper appearance, nice white head and lacing. Slighlty citrusy aroma. Faint trace of caramel, some vegetable notes, but more like an everyday amber than an Oktoberfest.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: tried this little beer at the beach chalet, a beautiful place to have brunch while in SF. amber hue with soft marmalade head. hints of orange, raisins, vanilla and maybe even theat darn bee thing honey. big moltiness up front, with the citrus underneath with unique hop flaver, good but a little off for the style IMO.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Copper color. Crystal clear. Nice malty aroma with a touch of fruitiness. Slightly sweet flavor with a touch of underlying bitterness. Fairly clean. Quite nice.

name: Beach Chalet Ocean Beach Oktoberfest
review: Tap. A medium golden color with a tan head. Malty with a slightly aromatic nose but otherwise like a marzen.

name: Beach Chalet Churchyard Strong Ale
review: Poured a brown with red hint, the head was thin and tan. Aroma is sweet and sticky fruit, caramel malts with some wine like hints of alcohol. Bold sweet malts, dark fruits, toffee, leafy, and soft alcohol burn.

name: Beach Chalet Churchyard Strong Ale
review: GABF 2007: Poured a clear amber color with an off-white head. The aroma was very chocolatey and dry. Notes of cigar tobacco and cocoa. Mild roasted flavor with big coaco. Medium body.

name: Beach Chalet Churchyard Strong Ale
review: Date: October 13, 2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, GABF Appearance: hazy dark gold, wispy dirty white head Aroma: sweet dark malt aroma with a hint of fruity character and a touch of earthy hops to balance Flavor: rich chocolate and dark caramel malt flavor, lots of earthyness keeps it dry, touch of fruityness is the only sweetness Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **+/4

name: Beach Chalet Churchyard Strong Ale
review: Excellent strong ale rendition here. Nice brown/red color. Big malty caramel aroma and flavors are the first things I notice in this beer. Next the hops creep in and they are pretty potent too. A strong bitterness melds everything together nicely and provides cover for the alcohol and sugar. Good creamy mouthfeel. Excellent brew!

name: Beach Chalet Churchyard Strong Ale
review: Slight roasty malt aroma with a hint of peat. The taste is creamy with sweetness and a tobacco hue. The lack of nose is bothersome but forgivable.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Draft. Poured clear brown color with an average frothy tan head that lasted with very good lacing. Moderate toasted dark malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate dark sweet flavor with a moderate dark sweet finish of medium duration. This beer met my expectations.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Draught @ Beach Chalet Brewery, SF. Pours very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, little coffee. Flavor is light sweet, roast malt, coffee, light earthy, chocolate. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet and light bitter finish. 180718

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Draft @ SF Beer Week Opening Gala 2017. Pours a dark brown black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty caramel and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel and chocolate finish.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Sampled at Beach Chalet Brewpub in SF. This was the last beer of a flight and I was sorely disappointed so far. My thinking was how can you mess up a stout. Well I found out. Poured more of red than the dark brown or black you would expect. Nose of some burnt malts and a bitter chocolate. No hops show Light to medium body. Thin for a stout, Flavor is burnt malt being almost smoky. Finishes acrid in the mouth, Not good at all.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: On tap at Lake Chalet. It pours a dark brown color with red highlights. Mostly clear with a khaki head. The aroma is a little smoky with some cocoa and coffee. Not bad. The flavor is a little worse with some dirt and heavy roasted malt. Ash, and toasted malt. A bit acrid in the finish with low carbonation. Meh.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: This might be the wrong beer. It was labeled generically as "dark side" on the receipt. Awesome nose of chocolate and wood. Dark color but not a typical stout black. Almost reddish. Great balance between hops and malt on this one. My favorite beer out of the sampler. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Pours dark with a thick and creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, oatmeal and chocolate. Taste of roasted malts, oatmeal and creamy bitter chocolate.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Other than the fact that I was drinking this out of a cheap plastic cup, it was a good beer. It warmed considerably on this lovely Sunday afternoon in their back garden, and it never possessed the body I would have liked, but the basic flavor profile was good. Chocolate coming through, roasted notes, with a somewhat quick, hollow finish. On tap at brewpub.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: Mediocre beer with a nice deep chocolate color, but a pretty watery mouthfeel and little taste.

name: Beach Chalet Fleishhacker Stout
review: On tap at Social Kitchen. Pours with a deep brown body and a tan head. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa nibs, coffee. Some earthy and tobacco notes as well. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, cocoa nibs, earthy and a bit chalky. Feels a bit flabby. Lightly metallic. Light bodied.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Draught @ Beach Chalet Brewery, SF. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grass, old hops, light fruit, earthy notes. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, little grass, earthy / moldy notes. Medium body, average carbonation. 180718

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: From bomber to glass. Aromas of metallic-rich malt and toffee. Pours perfectly clear amber orange with an off-white head that is shortly sustained and leaves a collar of large bubbles. Taste is metal and oxidation, with a mid-palate of caramel malt and a quick bitter finish that includes floral hops.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: A bit of malt on the nose, nice color. Up front it's surprisingly sweet with a hoppy finish. Not bad at all. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a malty hoppy caramel aroma. Sweetish malty hoppy flavor with some hints of caramel. Has a sweetish malty hoppy finish with some hints of caramel in the aftertaste.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Amber colored. Aroma is spicy, grassy hops, somewhat floral. English yeast, light caramel backing. Not a ton of character, but I liked the style.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Tap at City Beer. Pours with an amber color. Very malty, a bit of a hops bite and some toffee notes. A good seesion beer but not much going on.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Draught, Beach Chalet. Head is mostly diminishing. Body is medium to dark amber. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (cookie, caramel), lightly to moderately hoppy (grapefruit, apricot, resin). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, fizzy/lively carbonation.

name: Beach Chalet Elevation Zero ESB
review: Draught at the brewery. Beer is clear, medium amber with a small, beige, frothy/creamy, clingy, diminishing head.Malty with light notes of toasted grain, caramel, toasted bread crumb; Hoppy with light/moderate notes of orange and lemon zest, resin/pine, light note of tea; Trace of doughy yeast; Trace of simple syrup.The flavor is moderately sweet, light/moderately bitter, moderately acidic with a long, lightly acidic/citric, lightly sweet, lightly/moderately bitter finish.The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is fizzy.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: Serviert aus einer Flasche 0.33 in einem Glas mit einer Scheibe Orange. Es ist lecker, sanft im ersten Moment würzig herb im Abgang. Aber mehr als eine Flasche will man dann auch nicht trinken.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: It’s an alright beer for the holidays at most - Nothing special here. I can’t have more than a bottle though - Doesn’t have the greatest after taste.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: Average craft beer at best. Typical ale, malty and somewha bitter. Pours red in color and had this in Oklahoma which ha the worst beer selection. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: Fruity orangey coriandery beery thing. Not really my cup of tea, but interesting nonetheless.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours a reddish brown with light foamy head. Aromas of caramel and malt extract. Flavors of watery brown sugar and sour malt extract. A hint of what a good beer starts with but in general a miss.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: This is another light, refreshing beer, like Landshark, that I drink while it’s too hot in Texas. There isn’t much to the taste, but the slight orange under-notes are a nice change and provides an excellent accent for spicy foods, seafood, and even a good stout. One of my favorite things to do with Blue Moon is fill a pub glass about three-fourths full of Blue Moon and top the rest off with Guinness Draught.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: Nice little beer. Earthy nose with notes of toffe on the palate. Thin mouthfeel. Overall good beer nothing special.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: This is a decent little beer. Nothing too special but it’s a great clean tasting beer. Not a fan of adding an orange slice to it neither.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: It’s pretty good for washing down seafood. I don’t get the thing of serving it with an orange slice, though. This stuff tastes like a light lager with tang mixed into it. It’s already too damn orangey. Adding an orange slice to this stuff is like canned laughter in a sitcom... it’s the producer telling you you’re too stupid to figure out what’s going on.

name: Blue Moon Abbey Ale
review: Ruby pour with a small fleeding tan head, malty sweet taste with an after taste of figs and toffee. I find the body a little light.. 5.6 avb ????

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Draft. Pours amber with an off white head. Light malty sweetness, mild floral and herbal bitterness, and a balanced and quick finish. Not horrible.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: On tap @ Belmont Brewing. Amber pour with a creamy white head. Bread, olive, and grass on the nose. Some soap and lemon as well. Meh. Flavor is better as it’s mostly just toast and bread. Some grass, light lemon, and floral hops. Soapy feel on the tongue. Kind of bitter finish.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Draught @ Belmont Brewing Company, Long Beach, CA Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and pine. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma of malt, grains, fruitiness and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malt with caramel and nuts. Medium body, average carbonation.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: On tap at the brewpub. A clear, amber beer with a small off-white head. The aroma is a bit weak, with caramel and fruity scents. Caramel, some bitterness and a fruity touch in the flavor. Dry on the palate, nice carbonation. Bitter finish. Not the most exiting amber I’ve had, a bit dry too I think. 130812

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Part of the sampler tray at the brewery. Moderate amber ale. Bit of a tinny taste

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Draft @ brewery. Malt caramel with citrus grassy hops on the nose. Pours a clear copper. Piney hops with bready malts and hints of citrus hops. Balanced

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Tap at the brewpub. Nice amber pour. Smooth malt taste with some toasted and caramel touches. Light malt aroma. Just ok.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark amber color. Aroma is a little toasted with dark fruit, mainly plum. The flavor is cardboardy with some fruit and very a barely discernible hop finish. Not a terrible amber ale.

name: Belmont Top Sail
review: Pale amber pour with a bit of head and some lacing. Solid malt flavors with a touch of hops to balance. Nice richness with earthy undertones. Pretty will made beer that is a solid performer, but nothing really stands out. I’d certainly put this on an order when I go there. this beer is a bit tought to recall in light of the fact that I tried their Hop Head Red afterwards, which blew it away.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: (Tap) clear, bright yellow colour with a small white head; slight grain aroma; light, refreshing flavour, more assertive than most bland blond ales; long light bitter finish

name: Belmont Marathon
review: Draft. Pours clear gold with a white head.Grainy malts, hints of straw, mild sweetness, low bitterness, and a relatively clean finish. Not bad.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: On tap @ Belmont Brewing. Clear straw pour with a white head. Nose is mostly corn and sweet cereal, kind of like Corn Pops. A bit of sugar, lemon, and grass. Watery, too. Sweet palate with a mild bitterness and tartness on the finish. Lots of cereal, grass, and water. Slight biscuit character.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: Draught @ Belmont Brewing Company, Long Beach, CA Pours clear pale yellow with a white head, Aroma has notes of malt, grain, corn and herbal/floral. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours paddle golden with a white head. Atoms of malt, grains, some spicy and herbal notes. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: On tap at the brewpub. A clear golden beer with a small white head. The aroma is lightly fruity with some cellar like malty notes. Dry on the palate, medium to thin with a pleasant carbonation. Fruity flavor with a little bitterness. Easy to drink, but boring. 130812

name: Belmont Marathon
review: Part of the sampler tray at the brewery. Laclustre golden ale. Would not be trying this again

name: Belmont Marathon
review: Draft @ brewery. Cereal grains on the nose. Pours clear blonde. Cereal grains and hay flavorl, very light.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: Tap at brewpub. Light yellow pour. Light grain aroma. Taste is light malty and crisp, with a touch of hops. OK.

name: Belmont Marathon
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pale yellow color with no head. Faint aroma of yeast and grains. The flavor is watery with some corn and a grainy finish. Not much going on here.

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: Bottle pour. Aroma is strawberry and wheat. Yellow in color with a large foamy white head. Medium somewhat oily body. Sweet with a light bitter finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: On tap at the Bonaventure brewery as their strawberry blonde. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Big fruity strawberries, smells artificial though, a bit like strawberry bubblegum from my childhood. Medium bodied, grainy and sweet, tastes a good amount like how it smells, fruity and gum like. If someone told me this was a radler, I’d believe it. Too sweet for bulk drinking, but the sample in my flight was doable, and I’m not ashamed to say I’d drink a full one by the pool on a hot day. I might not brag about it, but I’d definitely do it. Too sweet and gummy, but certainly drinkable.

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: (Tap) clear, pale yellow color with a small, white head; aroma of strawberries, grain; dry flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: I had this one at Bonaventure Brewing. It’s a light beer, some fruit come through. Not strong with the strawberry but rather a mixture of other red fruits.

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: Bottle. Pours clear golden with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma is strawberry, honey, perfume. Flavor is medium sweet, perfumy strawberries, some honey, light bitter. Medium body. Meh

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: Draft. Pours clear gold with a white head. Sweet candy, strawberry fruity notes, mild acidic tartness, and a quick and pleasant finish. Y’all are haters you know you like this better than you’re rating it.

name: Belmont Strawberry Blonde
review: Clear golden color in the pour with a small head. Aroma of some strawberries with some malts and grass. Taste is rather bland with mild strawberries and mild bitterness. Quick finish, not much their.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Perfectly trusty pale ale with more malt than hops (the old-school way). I like hoppier pales personally though.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Medium copper to light brown in appearance. Good head. Smells slightly of apples and copper. Taste is malty as hell... roasty and deep.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Pours a nice dark honey color. Head quickly disappears into a halo of tiny bubbles around the edge of the glass. Nose is biscuity with very little hop presence. Flavor is disappointingly middle of the road as is the body. Reading the label led me to think I was in for a colossal "C" hop bombing. Unfortunately I got an average APA. Nothing special.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: This one poured a very fiery orange color with very light carbonation and a thin but creamy froth white head that laced moderately on the glass. Heavenly aromas of malt, grain, fruit and citrus, with the grain aspect dominating. The taste begins with an excessive malt front followed up by a nice Cascade hop bittering which dries the palate and allows the sweet malt to really work its effect in the aftertaste. Those Cascade hops are just everywhere these days. Nice palate feel, low carbonation, and nice dry ending sweetness. A nice pickup, thanks to beerguy101 for sending it my way.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: one of the few pale''s i can stand. nice malty flavor. helps that it is straight out of the tap.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Tap @ brewery. Amber color. Good citrus in the aroma which balances with the hops. Malty flavor.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Light Amber color, nearly copper, medium head. Nice maltyness, slight sweetness. Refreshing beer, good aftertaste, more malty than bitter

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Pleasant, fresh hop nose. Strong hop taste, but a napkiny finish. Certainly think enough, but a little awkward overall.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: The brewery is just down the street and I've never been in there till recently and their Pale Ale is rather good.

name: Bison Pale Ale
review: Semi hazy amber. Creamy off white head. Steady carbonation. Piney hop aroma with caramel and light toasted malts. Crisp. Citric yet sweet, bitter yet with burnt caramel notes. Solid lacing. Turns mellower as it sits. Nice overall flavor, kinda ESB-ish if not for the Pac NW hops. A decent pale ale. Not eccentric like their other brews.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Pour is a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is not a huge chocolate but I am getting a large cinnamon. Flavor is again a very minor bitter chocolate with some ashy malt. This was a bit too thin and not enough chocolate stood out.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: 12oz bottle pours a muddy dark cola brown with some spitty, brown head. Nose has toast, roasted grains, some chocolate, cakey. Flavor is heavy with the roast and toast, cocoa powder. Dry finish.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Bottle. Pours a dark brown with small tan head. The aroma is roast and bready malt. Thin mouth and watery, light roast and cocoa, not much going on with this one.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: This was a very good stout it was smooth, dark and had a great smooth head. I was impressed with how smooth it was. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Didn’t pick up much chocolate and was hoping for that since I’m not too keen on the Dry Stout genre.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Bottle at the hotel room in San Diego. Black beer with a small head. Roasted chocolate aroma, licorice, coffee, cocoa powder, caramel, earthy notes, some biscuits. Roasted chocolate flavor, tar, coffee, kinda bitter, hay notes, some tar. A bit too heavy on not so good coffee. Liked the aroma though.

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: This beer is lacking something, its not horrible just weak, not enough alcohol or just not enough stout flavor overall ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout has a thick, beige head, a very dark brown (almost black) appearance, with heavy lacing left behind. The aroma is of dark coffee, cream, bitter chocolate, and rich, dark-roasted malt. Taste is of acidic, strong coffee, chicory, cream, bitter chocolate nibs, and dark malt. Mouthfeel is high medium, and Bison Organic Chocolate Stout finishes semi-wet and drinkable. RJT

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Aroma: roasty, chocolate, Appearance: clear black, brown head Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, Delicious

name: Bison Organic Chocolate Stout
review: Bomber poured into a pint glass black pour with a light brown head decent lacing. Chocolate, roasted malt, cinnamon, cocoa powder, dark fruit, roasted flavor with toast, burnt nuts. A good dose of bitterness counteracts the cocoa leading to a dry finish with a subtle tinge of hops. This stout taste a lot better when served at room temp.

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: copper in color, soapy head, flocculent particles in the bottle version, strong, strong coriander bitter spice flavor, lighter in body than it should be and thus loses a little balance, overall a good beer

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: Interesting beer! Dark Copper color, small head. A spicy light bodied ale. The question is the spiciness from the coriander or the rye? Probably a little of both. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is hoppy and spicy. A different taste. I like this beer a lot.

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: Horrible. This was absurdly overcarbonated. The liquid (most was fizz) tastes like lemons/lemon peel--I don't think this is a good way for beer to taste. The coriander provides artificial bitterness and causes coughing. Different and good aren't synonymous. I'd drink Budweiser over this.

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: Very aromatic with hops and lemons dominating. A nice tart/crisp mouthfeel with a balance of lemony coriander and tons of grassy hops. Lovely brew. Thanks us_ex.

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: Surprisingly "edible", aromatic ale. .......................................

name: Bison Coriander Rye
review: WOW!, spicy and aromatic, tart and crisp, clean and bold. Nice malt nose with a fair hop finish, unique maybe a word to use.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Head is initially small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is hazy light yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (lemon), with light notes of banana and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Light body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Extremely effervescent pour, lots of foam. Very cloudy, yellow pour. Aroma is mild and citrusy with light minty clove notes. Sweet banana flavors on the palate, albeit a little restrained. Stays smooth throughout. Light bitterness in the finish.

name: Bison Weizen
review: out of all the beers i had at the bison. this was my least favorite.. of course this one was still not that bad at all. a nice german style hefe.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Tap @ brewery. Light yellow. A real spice kick in the aroma and flavor with citrus and banana.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Cloudy straw color, medium head. German style hefe-weisen. A subtle banana nose, more noticeable in the taste. Finish is smooth. Aftertaste is very slightly bitter, hardly noticeable. Nice beer, very reminiscent of the style.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Got this on tap. Incredibly thin. Totally flat. Slightly sour. I sent it back and they set me up with their Hibiscus Hard Tea which was incredible.

name: Bison Weizen
review: Wheat and malt nose, and that chill haze makes it quite appealing. Decent hop spicy finish, a citus twang is also present.

name: Bison Mocktoberfest
review: Dark Amber color, small head. Burnt/roasted aroma. Bock style beer, slightly bitter, roasted malts. Finish is smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Bison Mocktoberfest
review: Another strange brew that is quite aromatic and strong. Big nose, big middle, big finish. grains and the hop flowers blended nicely, a bid strange, but quite tastey.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: This grew on me a little towards the last sample of the 4-pack. A little thin for a porter. Flavors kind of like a sour. Has potential to be an 8 in that category, but the balance not quite there. A little too much spice for my preference though, as it overtakes the chocolate malty qualities that represents this style.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: in portland .. . brown .. mild head, lacing .. . fuck dancing .. the spice is nice, leveled out .. mouth is where it drops a bit, but its not unexpected or unpleasant .. its nice, i’d want turkey with this. no joke. and some biscuits, tall style .. .. . . i will slice YOU!!!.... a wedge of delicious refreshing watermelon you beautiful hoe

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Smells like gingerbread. Medium carbonation with very light foam. Taste is all gingerbread. Aftertaste is 10-20 seconds and the same with the addition of a slightly bitter ginger taste.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Bottle - Spicy cinnamon ginger, malty and dark sugars. Deep a,beer with a light beige head. Light bitter toffee and some spice with a touch of ginger. OK but nothing special.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Bottle, shared by Ferris. Clear deep copper, off white head. Aroma and flavour is floral mace with dark caramel. Simple amber ale with a prominent spice character.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Caramel notes aroma with a hint of ginger, brown color with a small amount of lacing. Medium body. Has some bitterness similar to a stout. The ginger flavor is apparent almost to a fault.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: This is one of my favorite holiday flavors :) It has a very rich toasty flavor while the gingerbread in it is very distinct while not overdone. It’ll pour dark but isn’t as bitter as some of their other brews :)

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Drank a bottle shared with the family. Smells like mild stout, dark too. Perhaps some spices in the back of the olfactory. Decent co2 and mild stoutish flavors in there. Ginger yes, but its not in yer face. No burn and its just layen around in the background barely perceivable. Not overdone in the spices and I appreciate that.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Pour out of bottle, dark reddish brown pour with off white head, aroma brought cinnamon, clove, ginger into a bit of caramel, slight dark fruit, some toasted bread in there with a hint of nuts. Taste is a mix of bread, biscuit, toffee into some ginger, cinnamon, slight clove into some hints of sugar, finishing dry, slightly spicy.

name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
review: Poured from a bottle. Medium clear brown color, small white head. Ginger bread and burnt match aroma. Light body with a watery malt flavor and a light finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: BJ's ESB
review: Full disclosure- I am not a big ESB fan. That said, this ESB was a big meh. Light in flavor, mostly detecting bitterness w/o Hop character. Light yellow color

name: BJ's ESB
review: A pretty forgettabe ESB, definitely mediocre and inoffensive. I’m not crazy about ESB’s in general, so I downed it pretty quick and moved on to the rest of my tasting flight.

name: BJ's ESB
review: Date: 11/08/1997 Mode: Firkin Source: Brewfest, Real Ale Festival Appearance: amber, Aroma: sweet malty hop aroma, Flavor: light malt flavor, low hop bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 2/10; Flavor: 2/10; Palate: 2/10; Overall: 5/20 Rating: 1.4/5.0 Score: */4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: BJ's ESB
review: One of the special brews at the brew house in cupertino. Pours very nicely with a decent head on it. It has a fair hoppy aroma. Flavor is strong, which was expected. Strength of the hops could have been better. Overall this was a good beer and one of the betters i have had at BJs.

name: BJ's ESB
review: sample in boulder. This one did have a nice taste to it, but that is comparing to the other samples I had.

name: BJ's ESB
review: Draught at the brewpub, Plano TX, as Dock ESB, brewed on Fuller’s premises Hazy red-amber color. Malty brew (most of all the flavor), medium bitterness; far away from the original ESB, but enjoyable.

name: BJ's ESB
review: Draught at BJ’s, Burbank (CA). Clear nut brown. Neutral aroma. Dry with clean mouthfeel and light body. There’s some cardboardy malt flavour and mustard-like hop notes. Spicy, medium intense bitterness dominate the finish. Not a convincing ESB.

name: BJ's ESB
review: Tap. Had a good hop aroma to it. Copper colored body small head. Had a good citrus flavor that wasn’t too bitter for me so that was nice. Good beer.

name: BJ's ESB
review: Draught. Red amber with a smallish head and lacing. Hops and citrus aroma and flavor like a good IPA. Fruity, hops finish.

name: BJ's ESB
review: It says "Seasonal: Winter" but they were serving it this week in July. Good-looking orange-gold beer with no head. Citrus and hop taste with a dry finish. Decent beer.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Dark malts and light cocoa. Deep amber with a decent beige head. Caramel, cocoa and malts with a cocoa finish.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: On tap at their Sterling Heights location. Brown pour with a tan head. Aroma and taste of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, and nuts.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Brown color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Draft at the BJ's location in Glen Allen, VA. Poured a brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma was actually pretty pleasant nutty, malty. Light caramel malts, with some touch of chocolate. Flavor was similar, toffee, some brown sugar, with a little bit of light vanilla. Pretty good.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Dark cola brown pour, with a thick tan head on top. Aroma has brown sugar and chocolate milk. Taste is very smooth and mild. Cocoa powder, milk, and nuts blend up to make you want another sip. Very easy drinking.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: A malt forward brown with tones of vanilla, woodiness and milk chocolate. A tiny bit of metallic zing that is not out of place. Plenty of toffee and a nip of brown sugar. Pretty clear brown pour but lacking much head. Great.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: It was a nice standard brown. Good coloring, light nutty aroma and mild bitter ale taste. Nothing over the top, but I wouldn't flush it down the drain. Tap at brewery in Colorado.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Some nut and some roast. Caramel. Reddish brown pour with creamy head. Slightly tangy finish. Tap at BJs in Tysons.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Hazy brown with tan head. Nose was earthy, walnut, brown sugar, nut brown flavor, smooth, decent.

name: BJ's Nutty Brewnette
review: Brown color with a small, off white head that left light lacing on the glass. Caramel, nuts, toffee, roast, faint citrus.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: Good one to have with lunch. Decent flavor but light. Easy one to drink. Little bitterness but fades fast.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review:
Where and how: south-west coast trip @ brewpub Aroma malty profile, light hop notes, profile was similar to their lager. Clean yet ordinary.
…

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review:
Not one of Bj's better entries, this Kolsch style beer puts a light straw yellow with a small ring of white head that leaves some scattered lace. Aroma is very musty with some light honeysuckle notes baking it up. Light bodied with a zippy carnation wash at the finish. Very grainy. A bit floral, and very musty. Some
…

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review:
Surprising that a "craft brewery" managed to make something shittier than bud light. At least it looks and smells decent, but that's where the goodness ends.
…

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: [On tap at BJ's, Brea, CA.] A hazy amber pour with no head; grainy aroma; sweet grainy body; and a dry finish with a touch of esters. OK.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: Draft at BJs in Bowie. Pours almost clear gold with a very thin head. Tastes like dough, corn, grass, and straw. Light body and low carbonation. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like corn, dough, grass, and straw.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: Draft. Pours bright yellow with minimal head. Bready nose. Flavor is the same-just wish this was a crispier.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: Draft at Allentown. Hazy gold with white head. Some pale malt, hops in the nose. Mild fruit, crisp flavor, lighter body, no major flaws.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review: Tap at Charlottesville location. Flavor is quite light: wet cardboard and grass. VERY drinkable, but there’s nothing to it.

name: BJ's Brewhouse Blonde
review:
Can poured. Light yellow with a good foamy white head. Aroma is citrus and wheat. Light to medium somewhat oily body. Light bitter with a small sweet after taste.
…

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: [On tap at the Brea location.] A straw coloured pour with a tight white head; yeasty aroma with some banana and cloves; similar taste with a pleasantly creamy body; and a nicely balanced finish. Rather good.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: Pretty solid hefe, bright and crisp with pronounced notes of clove, straw, and banana, with yeasty lemon tones, hints of vanilla, and a bready, smooth fade. Much better representation of its style than this chain’s IPAs are of theirs.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: Liked this alot. Hazy orange yellow pour. Sweet aroma. Taste is wheat and banana. Very good.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: Draft at Allentown. Hazy gold with white head. Nose was hops, limey citrus, florals. Tasted of florals, spice, citrus, bready pale malt.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: Aroma: wheat malt, banana Taste: intensively malty. Sweat wheat malt is dominant. Distinguishable flavor of apple, banana on the background. Bittersweet aftertaste.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: On tap at the South Reno location. Super cloudy opaque golden orange color. Thin white head. Fruity and citrusy with a soft milky texture. Dry body. Slightly refreshing.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: Pretty good and refreshing German style hefe. Light sweet taste, clove and banana aroma and finish with some spice. Solid hefe.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: I have tried many microbrews and Hefeweizen style beers and this one is up there with my favorite, Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier. Very similar to Hefewweissibier with the same cloudy golden-yellow wheat beer color and white foamy head. You can smell a light hint of cloves with a refreshing banana-like after taste. Pricey but worth it.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: On tap BJ’s, JAX. Spicy clove aroma with a tiny bit of banana and Belgian phenolics. Hazy yellow under a lasting beige flannel blanket. Delicate herbal banana and sweet wheat malt flavour with moderate clove phenolics. Interestingly different than in the nose. Almost no bitterness. Moderate carbonation, smooth.

name: BJ's Harvest Hefeweizen
review: On tap at Orlando. Typical well made hef with a hint of banana and some bubblegum in there.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: AKA Peach Cobbler. Light orange blonde pour. Smells mildly of peach and weaker malts, tastes the same. Not bad, but doesn’t stand out in the slightest.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: 9/24/16. On tap in a flight at BJ’s, Tallahassee. Orange pour with a small khaki head. Sweet peach aroma, some pale malts. Sweet peach flavor, crackery pale malts, a hint of spice. Could be much worse, especially considering I don’t really love peach.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Sample at Gabf. Pours a hazy orange with small white head that lasts. The aroma is peach pith, oak, wheat. Thin body, oak. light peach, cereal, light tartness, decent.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: On tap at BJ’s Restaurant & Brewhouse (Short Pump, VA). Aromas of peach nectar, light clove, cracker. Hazy gold with a somewhat lasting white head. Fruity, lots of seemingly artificial peach flavor, the balance is weird, the finish is not good. Light bodied.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Draft in a flight at BJ’s-Florence. Pours a cloudy gold color with a small white head that settles into a film and ring while lacing the glass. Notes of peach, cereal, hay, wheat - not much to it. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a fruity, sweet mouthfeel. No better or worse than the other stuff here.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Certainly has a nice peach aroma. Thin but fruity, this is okay. Certainly a beer for the non-beer drinking ladies.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Advertised as a peach hefeweizen brewed for a California summer. falls short in a few ways. first the peach taste is missing and you only gdt a vague "friutyness" straw colow and frothy head. taste is light, bready and has a lingering fruity sweetness

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Had a pint while celebrating M.A’s birthday .. Dark gold .. Fantastic head, minimal lacing .. . Peach skin n, juice, straw .. Pretty bitter .. Medium finish .. Pretty good stuff .. . . The cans of soup are jealous

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Pale yellow, clean peach nose. Bitter hops mixed with peach, finishes with bitterness. A bit thin. A little more peach would have been nice.

name: BJ's Magnolia's Peach
review: Location: on tap at the brewpub Appearance: Clear light amber with a fine head of white bubbles Nose: Sweet malt and peaches Taste: Watery peach sweetness. Light malt. Mild floral hops Body: thin Parting thoughts: a watery thin beer with a decent peach flavor

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: On tap in La Jolla - Nitro pour, light ring of white head above black liquid. Solid roasted notes on nose. No blockbuster but true to the style.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Pours cola brown in color, light taste of roasted malts, hint of nuts, ok, tap at brewery.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Roast and some caramel. Black pour with creamy head on nitro. Light bitter finish with some nut. Nitro at BJs in Tysons.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Nitrogen tap that pours a dark brown almost black with a tan head. Medium mouthfeel with chocolate malt. Finished dry. Better than expected.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Pours dark brown with an off white head. Roasted malt aroma with Caramel malt and chocolate. Flavor is roasted malt with sweet caramel malt and chocolate.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Nitro at BJs in Bowie. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Tastes like earthy malt, roasted, wood, some dark chocolate, bitter coffee. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like earthy malt, dark chocolate, wood, and roasted coffee.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Draft at Allentown. Hazy brownish black pour with tan head. Nose is roasty dark malt, chocolate, molasses. Roasty, dry flavor, dark malt, hops chocolate.

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate Taste: caramel, dark chocolate, notes of citrus and coffee. Medium body. Lovely nitro porter

name: BJ's PM Porter
review: This is very similar to a Guinness, both in looks and flavor. Light body and mild chocolate. Clean finish.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Light earthy citrus hops. Clear gol$ with a decent white head. Earthy hop bitterness.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Orange color, middle foam size. Really not bad apa with good aroma and bitter taste.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: [On tap at BJ's, Brea, CA.] An amber pour with a thin white head; fresh citrus aroma, quite grapefruity; then dry in the mouth with tropical fruits and citrus over some sweetish malts; and a clean finish. Very drinkable, best of the bunch on this occasion.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Clear golden appearance with a lacy white head. Aroma of floral hops, mild citrus zest and lightly toasted grain. Similar flavor, adding pleasant hop bitterness and a touch of malt sweetness. Light to medium body with a clean finish. Solid.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Draft at BJs Orlando walked to this place after dinner. Golden amber pour. Nose is faint citrus and red fruit and pine. Tastes of forest, cardboard, lemon, red plum. Watery palate.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Draft at Allentown. Poured hazy straw. Hops, mild citrus, florals in the nose. Tasted hoppy, floral, citric, medium to lighter body.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: 12 ounce can from Liberty Beer in Pittsburgh. Just like a pale ale would be, maybe a little better than average. Okay overall.

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: Aroma: grass, pine, notes of grapefruit Taste: medium intensity mix of pine, grass and citrus hops. Medium body. Easy drinkable, yet hoppy

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
review: With Audrie in Coral Springs, on tap, pours annamber dark color with a small beige head. Nose is all and all flat with some mild hops. Taste is watery, with a build up of grain without any real flavor. When your expectations are low it dampens the disappointment. Quaff Score 4 / 10.......4-3-4-2-8

name: BJ's Piranha Pale Ale
