review: Vat. Helder goudgeel kleur, fijne witte schuimkraag. De geur van tropisch fruit en hars. Smaak is zoet, erg moutig, licht grapefruit en licht ananas. Vol Lichaam, Veel koolzuur.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: [On tap at the Brea location; a dark, almost opaque, tawny coloured pour with a tight beige cap; aroma of chocolate and coffee; rich body with lots of bitterness from over roasted grains and very obvious alcohol. Lacking subtlety.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: On tap at BJ's Sterling Heights location. Black pour with a creamy tan head. Aroma and taste of dark roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: 16 oz draft at Jacksonville location near Costco. The stout poured a dark brown with an off white head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and licorice. Could be less sweet. The taste has more roasted malt with chocolate and licorice. The stout has a medium body with softcarbonation. The finish is clean with some lingering sweetness.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Heavy notes of dark chocolate, molasses, raisin, and anise, with a shockingly prominent booziness on the back end. So close to being a good beer, but the pure alcohol astringency on the back end is pretty unforgivable.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Pours up black with a tan head. Boozy coffee aroma. Taste has lots of dark roast, smooth creamy. Some coffee and the same booze presence. Not the best stout, but not bad.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Tastes and smells like a decent stout mixed with rubbing alcohol. On tap in AZ. Hopefully this is a bad batch

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Pours dark black, some malts with a biting hop finish, watery palate, disappointing as an imperial, tap at brewery.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Roast and some caramel. Nut. Black pour with creamy head on nitro. Some booze in finish. Nitro at BJs in Tysons.

name: BJ's Tatonka Stout
review: Draft sample at the BrewHub Taproom St. Louis. Almost black with some amber. Tan head stays. A roasty, grainy, and chocolate nose. Chocolate is tasted first and is prominent. Sweet milk chocolate. Roast under that and a little heat. And now I see what the ABV is and understand the latter. This is rich and substantial. Tasty stuff and kind of in my wheelhouse.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: "another nondescript entry into the books for this brewery (and for the style). i know it’s hard to make a wheat beer that really stands out, but c’mon..."

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: This ain’t no German hefe. Aroma sucks. Looks watery yellow. I wouldn’t even gues this is a hefe. It is aweful.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: Draft at Tap 25. It pours clear yellow with a nice creamy white head. The aroma has lemon, wheat and a light hint of clove. The flavor is very wheaty and dry with more hints of lemon and clove. The texture is a bit watery, but this is a nice summer thirst quencher.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: This is a pretty good hefe. Not funky like American hefes. Easy drinking. Not real noticable, but good.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: Hazy bright yellow with afizzy white head. Grainy citrus and mild skunk aroma. Big citrus taste with a bready finish.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: Bubble gum sent.?. Spicy citrus taste then it all goes bad. Lager flavors and metal thinness obliterate any decent taste that might have existed. Too top it off it ends on bad bitterness. All around disappointing.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: At NorCal Brewers Guild Festival at Raley Field. Banana aroma. Hazy gold color with great white head. Starts with banana, followed by light clove spice. There’s a lot going on in this one. Clean fruity finish. Delicious.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: draft. Pours witha yellow color and quite hazy, seems unfiltered to me. Aromas are dominated by fruit, inparticualr lemons, fruit and yeast. Flavors of banana, lemon, cloves,yeast and various sother spices. Quite complex and a very good example of a good Hefeweizen. I did really enjoy this one.

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: Draft. Pale yellow and clear. The description says unfiltered but the one I had was obviously filtered- I hope I have the right beer here! Aroma was clove and banana with a bit of citris. No hop charactor at all. Slightly malty with the banana very outstanding in the flavor. Not really my cup of tea but a pretty good example of the style (less the filtering).

name: Black Diamond Hefeweizen
review: Draft. Golden and cloudy. It lokos the part of a Hefe and there is some spice and clove, but way too much lemon here. The flavor has lemon and wheat malt and then the Bavarian characteristics. Misses the target.

name: Black Diamond Pale Ale
review: had this at a brew fest for a couple years now. gotta remember not to waste my time at this brewery next year. everything they make is uninspired and boring."

name: Black Diamond Pale Ale
review: Medium head, caramel and floral aromas. Beautiful dark amber color with good carbonation. Medium heavy body and great clean finish. Very nice beer for sitting by the lake in the summer.

name: Black Diamond Pale Ale
review: 12oz bottle I picked up while in Arkansas. Pours clear golden copper with white head. Aromas of caramel malt and a bit of citrus. Flavors of mostly caramel malt with a touch of citrus. Boring attempt at style.

name: Black Diamond Pale Ale
review: Draft. Amber beer with a nice off-white head. Light citrus aroma. Light citrus flavor with some doughy tones. Nothing to stand out.

name: Black Diamond Cask Ale
review: On Firkin at the Triple Rock gravity fest 2006 "Best Bitter" was the name it was given there. Complex slightly sour taste behind the biginning flavors. Pleasant toasty malt flavor. A little harsh at the finish, but overall a very drinkable beer. reminds me of brewing with wyeast 1968 - ESB ale yeast.

name: Black Diamond Barley Joy
review: Tap @ 2004 Toronado Barley Wine Festival. A light amber color. Rather generic and plain in the lineup of barley wines at the festival. But a hint of fruits the dominant hops or robust flavors of a barley wine. Listed as 9.5% abv.

name: Fat Weasel Unfiltered Wheat Beer
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Great looking unfiltered brew, didn't keep that much of a head, very hazy appearance naturally, very smooth, mild body, very nice wheat beer

name: Brewbakers Pilsen Ale
review: On tap at the Visalia location. Pours hazy yellow with a decent white head and a fruity aroma. Thisale tastes a lot like a lager - very light, yeasty and refreshing, but not much flavor. Dry finish.

name: Brewbakers Honey Wheat Beer
review: Sample at the brewpub (this is the Visalia location which should not be affiliated with HB). The beer is a slightly hazy yellow color with a thin white head that recedes quickly to a film. Spotty lace. Wheat and banana in the nose. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal wheat and banana. The finish is sweet malt and honey with a touch of wheat. Average overall.

name: Brewbakers Honey Wheat Beer
review: Slightly hazed amber pour with a white head. Bland nose of wheat and bread. Light floral hops and maybe a touch of yeast. The flavor is similarly bland and unimpressive. Some sweet bread and wheat notes, and that’s about it. Maybe a bit of toast, floral hops, and yeast.

name: Brewbakers Sequoia Red
review: Sample at the brewpub (this is the Visalia location which should not be affiliated with HB). Amber color with a medium off-white head that dissipates quickly to an outer ring. Malt and caramel in the nose. Light to medium body with flavors of roast malt and caramel. The finish is sweet with a short malty aftertaste. Average overall.

name: Brewbakers Sequoia Red
review: Brewery: Brewbakers Brewing Company (Visalia) Date: July 13, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: muddy brown with a red hue, fine beige head, drippy lace Aroma: earthy hop aroma with light dry malt Flavor: rich caramel and chocolate flavor, lots of earthy hops, well balanced bitterness gives way to a long tasty light bitter finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *4

name: Brewbakers Sequoia Red
review: Deep red ale with a good balance of hops and malt. Pleasant aroma and an easy refreshing beer. Glad you guys are in my back yard!

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Slightly hazed golden pour with a white head. There is a half decent hop nose to this. Citrus peel and floral notes with a touch of sugar sweetness. Maybe a hint of pine. Light pine and grapefruit bitterness on the palate. Some tangerine, a bit of sugar, and a light floral hop note, too.

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Draft at Kern River Brewing. Listed as 6.7% ABV. Nose is very citrusy withe a slight ivy note. Cloudy yellow orange with a big pale yellow head. Flavor is modrately bitter but the bitterness increase to be quite heavy as I went through the glass.

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Sample at the Huntington Beach location. This brew is a slightly hazy orange color with a medium thin off-white head that diminishes quickly. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops and citrus. Medium body with flavors of citrusy hops and malt. The finish is short and hoppy. Slightly above average overall.

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: On tap at the Visalia location. Pours golden with a thin beige head and a toffee aroma. There is a full caramel malt flavor with some carbonation and significant hop bitterness

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Decent hop aroma. Taste was kinda watery and mild bitterness. Not that great

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Name: IPA Date: July 13, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy orange, wispy off white head, streaks of lace Aroma: sweet orange and tangering aroma, crystal sweetness kicka in the citrus hops Flavor: sweet crystal malt flavor, lots of fruity hops, balancing bitterness starts light and builds through a long bitter finish Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **+/4

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: I guess this is where this goes. Had the Brew Bakers Cask-A-Bomb IPA on cask at beachwood BBQ. Very nice. Great warm with a very aromatic hopping and a head that just would not quit. So...if this isn’t where this goes,...Yeah.

name: Brewbakers IPA
review: Very drinkable beer. nice white head fruity aroma and bitterness that lays on your tongue. Good beer!

name: Brewbakers EPA
review: On tap at the Visalia location. Pours hazy copper with a thin off-white head and a sour malt aroma. There is a hearty caramel malt flavor that is slightly sour and very tasty.

name: Brewbakers Sherman Stout
review: Black pour with an off-white head. Roasted malt, coffee, and some dark chocolate notes to the aroma. There’s a little bit of earthy hip and dark fruit to it as well. The flavor is mildly sweet from some chocolate notes. Plenty of roasted malt and coffee, a bit of licorice, and some hints of earthy hops.

name: Brewbakers Sherman Stout
review: On tap at the Visalia location. Pours black with a thin tan head and a slight smoked malt aroma. There is a rich treacle flavor with a fair amount of finishiing bitterness. .

name: Brewbakers Possum Porter
review: On tap at the Visalia location. Pours black with a thin tan head and a strong chocolate aroma. There is a hearty chocolate and treacle flavor with a very dry finish.

name: Brewbakers Possum Porter
review: 1st rating. On draft. Poured a black color with tan head. Aroma and taste was mild roasted malts with some burnt caramel. Not too bad. A little thin.

name: Beli Saazer Doppelkaramel
review: Sweet, sweet and more sweet. Heavy malt components in the nose and flavor. OK for a malt beer, particularly compared to Pinkus Malz (see my rating). Needs something to balance the sweetness.

name: Beli Saazer Doppelkaramel
review: Malty citrusy aroma. Dark amber little head. Malt and caramel flavor but much to sweet - and no carbonation, ok...but not again.

name: Beli Saazer Schwarzbier
review: Draught at 16. Berliner Bierfestival. Sweet caramelly aroma. Clear dark brown colour, almost black. The flavour is a little sweet with a bit of rye bread.

name: Beli Saazer Schwarzbier
review: Near black, some red tones in color. Head vanished quickly. Sweet, roasted malt aroma with some chocolate and syrupy tones. Soft mouthfeel with little carbonation. Flavor has slight chocolate. Mild flavored but still nicely balanced brew, more hops or carbonation could be nice.

name: Beli Saazer Schwarzbier
review: Toasted grain nose. Nice deep brown color and an OK head. Sweet roast malt taste with hints of chocolate. Round mouth feel and a quick profile. Not complex and overall sweet.

name: Beli Saazer Schwarzbier
review: Malty with hints of hoppiness. Dark amber - what else...and a intervalling flavor, changes between bitterness and sweetness. It is nice, but something is missing.

name: Beli Saazer Premium Lagerbier
review: Dusty nose and with a faint grainy aroma. Very very light yellow color. Delicate light malt taste and an herbal finish. Thin body.

name: Beli Saazer Premium Lagerbier
review: Skunky! Pee yellow no head and a - how did this happen? - hoppy sweet aroma that turns into a bitter aftertaste. Like a sweet fart says pivo. Unbalanced!

name: Beli Saazer Pils Lagerbier
review: berlinerbierfest04. reasonable floral saaz aroma but little sign of bitterness. quite light, faint hint of rockmelon, pleasant enough

name: Beli Saazer Pils Lagerbier
review: Sweet fart-like aroma -like canned corn. Light gold color and no head, unfortunately. Sweet grain taste with a slight peppery, hoppy end. Creamy mouth feel and thin-ish. Do-able, but not great.

name: Beli Saazer Pils Lagerbier
review: plato 11, hoppy light aroma, yellow body with no head. Very hoppy that gives the long lasting bitter aftertaste, to bitter for my taste.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: March 31st, 2015 - Last on the list here at Oggi's is the Black Magic Stout. Predictably dark, the nose has some heavy charcoal and a little teriyaki but the smell is mild and mild mannered. The flavor is rich with soy and teriyaki, and a little jerky spice, but the body is just a touch thin. I lean back and feel that the beer is "okay" which is better than some of the brews from today's tasters, and worse than others.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: DWF; Bottle, large, drunk at Cardinal. Pours moderate, black with a bobble, lacing and lasting tan head. Nose is heavy, roasted malt, tar, chocolate, coffe, moderate dried dark fruit . Taste is heavy sweet and bitter with a lasting roasted, warming finish. Body is full, texture is thick, carbonation soft.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: Black with a small light brown head - Roasted malt aroma - Roasted malt body that has some chocloate and coffee notes with some bitterness in there as well - The roasted malt with bitterness goes into the finish - This was nice

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: Draft. Pours deep brown with a light beige head. Espresso-like coffee, relatively light sweetness, low bitterness, and a nice roasted coffee finish. Pretty good.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: 27 May 2015, tap at Oggis. Black. Nose is licorice, acidic black malt. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Black toast, brown sugar, licorice. Pretty good!

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: Draft at Oggis Point Loma. Pours very dark brown with a thin, beige head. Tastes like burnt malt, burnt toast, a little bit of sweet chocolate, and some dark coffee. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like burnt toast, burnt malt, some dark chocolate, and some burnt coffee.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: Disneylandish. Slammed this because we had to leave and I found the need to stuff in an extra pint. Also cuz it was average and required no thought but ’consume’. Roast, choco, bit o’ coffee, slight ashy thing, sweetness close to licorice but not close enough. Off to find any shitty store that sells liquor and without doubt will carry a small selection of eye opening craft at prices that will make me weep.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: Draft sample at Oggi’s in Garden Grove. Black with tan head, medium body. Mildly bitter coffee flavor, clean finish.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: On Tap From Notes Poured black with tan head. Smell of chocolate, coffee, and malt. Taste of chocolate and caramel with a hint of coffee.

name: Oggis Black Magic Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured a dark brown color with a small tan head. The aroma was of roasted malts, chocolate and a touch of coffee. The taste was of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Very nice.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: March 31st, 2015 - The Sunset Amber invests all in on honey as an attractive aroma and scent. Colored like honey too, it smells deeply of mesquite honey and...honey, and more honey, drizzled with honey. The flavor is also dominated by the honeyed taste, though it is tempered by a slight nuttiness and a good carbonation. The mouthfeel remains a little flat, but it matters little when the flavor is so strong.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: My third and final 16oz pour at Oggi’s Encinitas outlet on 8th May 2016. Asked for it not to come in a frosted glass, still arrived so cold it had no aroma foe ten minutes and no taste for even longer. Amber blend with not a lot going on to be honest, knock up the temp by 15 degrees and it might have been decent. Scored kindly and objectively.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: Draught at Oggi’s in Vista, California. Clear copper/Amber beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy caramel aroma, grassy, fruity, citrus notes. Hoppy floral flavor, grassy, citrus, some roasted notes. Ok beer.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: Draft. Pours amber orange with an off white head. Relatively clean, with pale malts, mild toasted notes, lighter sweetness, and a mild earthy bitterness. Not bad.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: 27 May 2015, tap at Oggis. Light Amber, clear, no bubbles. Nose is toasty, and acidic. Med body and mildly fizzy. Mildly toasty and sweet malt. Nice enough.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: Draft sampler at Oggi’s Garden Grove. Butterscotch colored, caramel malt with light hopping. Lingering bitter finish.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured a clear deep amber color with a small off- white head. The aroma was of light malts and esters. The taste was of light malts, esters and just the right amount of bitterness. Nice.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: Tap. Pours clear amber, small beige creamy head, great lacing. Aroma is caramel and cardboard. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, caramel, bready. Better than it smells. Medium body.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: On tap at brewpub Of all the beers that were brewed to some style this may have come the closest to being true to itself. A lightweight memorable bitter would fit in well with the tons of average casks at small pubs dotting the English countryside. Aroma / Appearance - A rich caramel base is the color of melted chocolate bars. Calm malt and earthy hops float in the air like a light mist. Iced tea and semisweet chocolate provide some depth but overall this is a simple draft. Flavor / Palate - Almonds, walnuts, and iced tea refresh the palate. The transition is mildly bitter and soon fades in the back of the throat. A decent amber / ESB is fairly mundane and something to pass the time over lunch.

name: Oggis Sunset Amber Ale
review: On tap @ Eastlake location: I took very little notes about this beer and that’s a sign to me that it wasn’t that important. Appearance was a dense mahogany color that looked as though it did have some artificial coloring and was able to create a nice frothy head. The flavor and aroma both seemed to have more hops present then malts, but the flavor was nicely balanced and seemed to stand out to me as a decent amber ale.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: March 31st, 2015 - Oggi's Paradise Pale is not a complex brew, but not bad either. There's a slight happiness with a bit of grapefruit at most. The carbonation is strong and supportive, with a good depth of hops. As the taste proceeds in gets a little sweeter, bringing in bubble gum and grapefruit. And that's about it. Minimal but tasty, it works well with the smell of pizza in the world.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: Draught at Oggi’s in Vista, California. Hay golden/orange beer with a decent offwhite head. Hoppy bready aroma, caramel, citrus notes. About the same in the flavor, rather blend and boring.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: Draft. Pours golden orange with a white head. Mild herbal hoppy bitterness, faint fruity notes, and a plain malty base. Just a hint of sweetness, and very low lingering hoppy notes. Fine; drinkable.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: From Notes: On Tap. Pours gold with white foam. Biscuit, caramel, with slight citrus smell. Taste is even with the smell.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. It poured a clear copper color with a white head. The aroma was of citrus and pine hops. The taste was similar with caramel and citrus hops with a bitter hop finish. Nice.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: A completely milquetoast pale ale. The adjustment of hops feels muzzled and the nose is near-absent. The appearance is hazy gold with light piping on the head. Best as a filler for a sampler; skip the pint.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: Tap. Clear pale amber, medium white head, great lacing. Aroma is faint, but nice, citrus, , pine, mango. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, mango, orange, not harsh. Light body, decent.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: On tap at brewpub Meh. This is a fair to middling pale ale that hints at much more. This felt like par for the course for Oggi’s. As a brewery they would be a fine place if not for so many other world class options just around the corner. Even so I have had plenty of worse beers. Aroma / Appearance - A caramel foundation supports a thin veil and icy legs. Cream, vanilla, and low key malts contrast with fresh earthy hops. The overall profile is middling to below average. Flavor / Palate - Creamy vanilla yogurt tickles the senses. After a few seconds it morphs into a mixture of malts and clean noble hops. The bitter finish of fresh brewed iced tea lasts for only a fleeting moment. In other parts of the country this would be normal. For southern California it sinks to the bottom of a crowded field.

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: 18 jan 2014, tap at Oggis in Fullerton. Light gold, clear, no bubbles. Nose is pine and lemon hops. Odd body for an American pale ale. Reminds me of British cask ale, just slightly fizzier. Medium-ish body and faintly fizzy. Lemon rind and cereal malt with some bitter finish. Mediocre. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Oggis Paradise Pale Ale
review: Good Pale Ale with a nice hop bitterness. NothiNgs goNNa blow your way but it’s good.

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: On tap in Mission Valley after braving Costco the day before Thanksgiving. Red in color with off white head. Nice spicy maltiness to it. A bit light in the back. Enough sweetness without being too much. Fine beer.

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: Tap, Mission Valley. Pours dark amber in color. Aroma is somewhat sweet with some noticable hoppiness. Slightly metallic malty flavor. Finish is a little hoppy and bitter.

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: Nice balaced amber ale. Good crystal malt note some hints of black tea and caramel. The roasted malts are slightly noticeable with agood balanced hop bitterness. Nice hop resin nose with some malt sweetness coming thru.

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: On tap GABF 02: Pine/resin aroma, syrupy mouthfeel. A bit too much hops for the style, but like I''m gonna complain.

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: A light sweet malt taste, followed by a hint of hops. Quite quaffable.......

name: Oggis Rancho Red
review: I felt as though i was sucking on a cherry jolly rancher with whipped cream being plopped on my head from up above...quite drinkable, creamy, non-offensive, but yet non-impressive

name: Oggis McGarveys Scottish Ale
review: March 31st, 2015 - Scottish Ale in name, the McGarvey's tastes a great deal more like a low ABV amber. Expecting heavy scents and dripping malty flavors, the aroma is more like a sweet toast, alongside some coffee beans. Where it really suffers is in the flavor, which is muted, though shows off some caramel and a little smokiness. But the flavor is a little flat, with only the mouthfeel any flatter.

name: Oggis McGarveys Scottish Ale
review: Not a bad Scottish Ale from a chain restaurant. Nice color and maltiness. Prety easy drinking.

name: Oggis McGarveys Scottish Ale
review: I thought this was a pretty nice Scottish ale. Not as sweet as many, gives it a nice smooth finish. tasty.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Pours an amber color with a nice head from the bottle. It smells sweet with a bit of spices and herbs in the nose. It is a thick IPA and a bit bitter. I found it to be very balanced. I thought the hops and the malts fought each other nicely leaving a good after taste on the palate. I enjoyed this one.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Toasted biscuit and herbal hops nose. Sweet and almost honeyed palate with notes of roast and pine. Big mouthfeel with more malt than one would expect for the style. Clean and lingering finish.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Nice amber color with a rocky and frothy head. Sweet, biscuity-yeasty nose. Creamy and rich mouthfeel; nicely carbonated. Malts had notes of freshly baked bread and fresh yeast. Wholesome, toasty and earthy. Slight sourness. Nicely balanced IPA, although it had a malt slant.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Bottle. Hop and grainy flavors. Bitter. I liked how rich this beer was...

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Quite nice. dark orange color. very hop floral aroma. it is one of the sweeter IPA that i have had and liked. starts sweet and definitely allows you to experience some hop bitterness in the middle but that is cleared away by the sweetness returning.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: On tap GABF '02: Amber color, flowery/spruce aroma. Starts sweet and ends even sweeter.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: I love this beer, a wonderful dark (I know) and the hops! This is a great beer, all hopheads must go to Fortuna and give this a try.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau IPA
review: Dark for an IPA with some amber, excellent floral aroma with a hint of vine. There's some significant sweetness -- what if it aged longer? Still very expansive with bursting hop and a hin of dark roast finish.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: [12oz bottle from Total Wine, Huntington Beach, CA.] A pale amber pour with a tight white head; herbal aroma; soapy mouthfeel with a sweet grainy body and some grassy bitterness; and a slightly drier biscuity finish. Pleasant enough, reminds me of a steam beer.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: Pour from a 12oz bottle. Darker lightly hazy gold brew with white head. Aroma of faint malts and light floral hops. Taste is mildly sweet with a light floral hops, finishes a little on the sweet side. Enjoyable and presenting some character, but overall rather plain. Well crafted and inoffensive.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: Sampled on draught at nFuse at the Marriott at the Anaheim Convention Centre. A pale blonde ale, with a light malt flavour and mildly bitter, light hop taste. Very easy drinking and refreshing. Surprisingly tasty, but just a little on the bland side.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of citrus/earthy hops, pale/wheat malt, and fruity yeast notes; with solid strength. Taste of lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light herbal, floral, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness and balance of citrus/earthy hops, pale/wheat malt, and fruity yeast flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and no cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, and fairly sticky mouthfeel that is good. Not as crisp/clean as expected, a bit too malt heavy. Zero warming alcohol for 5.8%. Overall this is a nice American blonde ale. All around nice robustness and balance of citrus/earthy hops, pale/wheat malt, and fruity yeast flavors; smooth and pretty refreshing to drink with the mellowly bitter/drying finish. A bit too fruity/yeasty, but not overwhelming. A nicely enjoyable offering, and good style example otherwise.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: Won fire placing 2nd in age in redwoods half marathon. Clear. Light. Sone citrus. Hoppy for a blonde.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: In draft at the brewpub it is a clear golden color with a head. The aroma is malty and the taste is thin sweet with hints of malt just so so

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: In draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Aroma of bread dough. Flavors are sweet biscuits with very littl hop bitterness. Smooth finish.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: 12 oz bottle into a La Chouffe stemmed tulip on 2nd Jan 2018 at my daughters in California. Slight haze to the golden orange body, full white uneven crown of foam on top which sadly soon turned into a wisp and collar. Not a lot going on aroma wise, some light grassy floral notes as the beer warmed maybe, otherwise nothing. Taste was fairly bland too, or subtle, depending on your kindness. Refreshing but boring.

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: Disappointing bland. I want something cool and crisp and light on hope for hot summer nights. What I got was fizzy water. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Eel River California Blonde Ale
review: From can it’s clear orange-gold with a short and unsustained head. Smells of grain ethanol, gunpowder, cake frosting, fabric, chemicals, not much in here that resembles hop or malt. In the mouth it’s light bodied, sweet and filmy, tangy and hooch-like in the finish with a poor malt liquor-like representation of pale malt (tasting of corn, saccharine, alcohol). All sorts of technical problems with this one.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: "a little light in body/color/characer, even with lower expectations for this organic brewery. not a bad beer, but definitely nothing I’d bother going back for. refreshing wnough, with a dry bitter, slightly hoppy finish. some flaorals in the aroma, but not enough. just ok."

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Pours pale yellow brown with thin head. Little lacing, many bubbles. Sweet malt aroma. Flavour is sweet maltish, with a little hop, followed by an unpleasant soapy finish, sort of like when you don’t get all the soap out your cup. Thin bodied.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: Pours pale amber with white head and foamy lacing. Notes of caramel, dirt, and peach with a hint of mineral. Balanced taste with a very short bitter finish; almost non-existent. Crisp.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: Poured into a pint glass. Bought this for a buck at local place. I was only going to have one beer tonight, but the last one sucked so bad that I needed to drink this as well. 2.0 A: Hazy brownish yellow color. Agressive pour resulted in half a finger of head that fell quickly, but surprisingly left a decent amount of lacing. 2.0 S: Slight (as in zero + the smallest discrete unit of measurement) floral hoppiness and nothing else. 2.5 T: Slight bitterness along with the meagerest of citrusy hops. Nothing else really going on other than musty vegetal-like flavor. 3.5 M: Not as horrible. Medium body, but it lays heavy on the tongue (like carbonated lead or something like that). 2.5 D: The worst part about tonight is that this wasn’t even the worst beer I’ve had. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 11-17-2009 00:14:52

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: Not sure why this one has such low ratings. We found it very enjoyable! Crisp, light and refreshing...not too deep, but a nice drinkable brew. Especially enjoyed the nutty aftertaste. S-3.7 K-3.9

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: Pours golden with a tall spritzy head that lingers a bit. Smells of perfume and pine. Medium body with only mild residual carbonation. Very clean with mild biscuit essence and pronounced perfume. Very mild on flavor finishing bitter.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: bottle poured a golden color with a thin white head. aroma has caramel malt, grains and sweetness. flavor is light with a twang of bitterness, sweet caramel malt, corn, grains, and a touch of hops.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: ( 12oz bottle ) Pours a clear golden body with a small white head. Aroma of grass, grain, florals, caramel, and cereal. Flavor of grass, caramel malt, light soap, some citrus, and grain with a mildly bitter finish.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Dark golden in color, clear, and has an off white head. The smell is hops, slight caramel, some malts, and sweet. The taste is hops, malts, slightly blah.

name: Eel River Certified Organic Extra Pale Ale
review: 12oz shorty bottle. Cloudy orange-tan color. Some orange and vanilla in the aroma, in an off or old sort of way. Solid straightforward crisp bitterness, oddly characterless, with a sweet sugary aftertaste. An interesting variation, I’m sure it fares better brewery fresh. As for the bottle, definitely sub par stuff. Soapy, gross sugar syrup aftertaste.

name: Eel River Climax California Classic
review: Sampled at the brewpub on 8/5/10. Pours a clear amber with a medium off-white head. Earthy and grassy hop aroma with a bit of pale malt. Caramel malt flavor giving way to earthy and grassy hops with a malty finish.

name: Eel River Climax California Classic
review: Draft @ Eel River. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a sweetish malty fruity caramel aroma. Sweetish malty caramel flavor with some grainy hints. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish with some hoppy hints.

name: Eel River Climax California Classic
review: Poured a nice light yellow with a nice white head and great lacing. Nose of light malts and hops with hints of citrus and flowers. Mouthfeel is very clean and it has a refreshing taste, and flavors are very nice for a pale lager. According to the brewer this was their first brew. I do not know how old this one is, but it tasted fresh and clean, and was pretty darnn good for a pale lager. While this type of beer is dominated by some of the worst beers in the world, this one stands out from the pack for me and it the best example oI have tasted.

name: Eel River Climax California Classic
review: Eel River's version of Steam Beer - while not my favorite it's quite drinkable and a very good lager.

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: Iced tea, mild hops and a touch of caramel in the nose. Light and sweet palate with some grassy undertones. Iced tea and caramel finish.

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: The beer dispenses from the 12-ounce brown bottle a luminous brown with a substantial creamy light tan head that last and last, the residual lace a clinging sheet to obscure the glass. Nose is sweet malt, earthy and fresh, slight hint of hops, quite appealing, start is sweet with a pleasant grain profile, the top is moderate in its feel to the palate. Finish has a stern acidity and the hops delightfully spicy, quite dry aftertaste that last a long time, a fine drinking beer from a brewery that is new to me, well done Eel River!

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: Flavorless amber a sweetness that made it very unpleasant. Pretty flavorless and a bitterness that did nothing for me.

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: Bubble gum malt mixture aroma. Medium layer of a head on the deep mahagony colored brew. Malty, slightly toffe but very week.

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: It's beer a year since my last Amber - according to my notes it is a refreshing beer and just right for a Saturday afternoon session. As long as you stay at the Super 8, next door.

name: Eel River Climax Amber Ale
review: The malt and bitterness seem to really clash against each other in this beer, and not in a good way. Just not very well done.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: Bottle (GBBF 2010) - Very dark brown, almost black. Malty aroma with a hint of chocolate. Malty and grainy taste with notes of roasted malt and chocolate. I was expecting more, especially for this strength.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: Draugt. Dark brown w/ fully diminishing tan head. Espresso and toasted bread in the aroma. Tastes of dark chocolate w/ a green apple tang. Finishes dry. Lingering notes of chocolate and tobacco.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: Big overrasoted nose with esspresso and Bakers cocoa and tobacco notes. Dry and mildly astringent on the palate. Not my style of porter.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: From a 22 oz bottle purchaed directly from the brewery at the brewpub. Poued into my Duvel glass it was a very dark brown that rose into a big tan head that left large chunks of lacing as it settled. I generally find dark beers show their best if not served too cold so this one came directly from my 55 degree "beer cellar". Solid nose of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, with a touch of sweetness that was both caramel and fruit. Very rich and smooth tongue-feel and nice and oily going down. Flavors were like the aromas only with a little hops and a bit of exta sweetness that adds to its character. This is an exceptional Porter It it too bad Eel River brews don’t get wider distribution. I notice that this is the first rating in 3-1/2 years. I believe they are going to expand their brewing capaciy soon so maybe this will become more available to beer lovers everywhare. It sure deserves it.. It is great.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: This is a fantastic porter with its hops and malts equally balanced. One of the better porters I've had lately

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: Dark brown color. A full-bodied porter. Chocolate and coffee malts. Nicely hopped. Good flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Excellent beer.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: Wonderful rich beer, this is a very chewy beer and on a damp winter night in California, nothing is better to warm the soul.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: A very assertive example of the style, could this be a Baltic porter? Big, full-bodied beer with strong bitter chocolate essence. Quite sugary on the tongue. A top flight porter.

name: Eel River Ravensbrau Porter
review: A sea tinge to the nose, some light carmel, totally cocao and a bit wheaty, some wood, full textured malty palate and smooth, lots of sugars. Very nice.

name: Tetleys Mild (Cask)
review: Half pint, cask at Sailmakers Arms, shared with Finn. Dissipating beige head. Deep rosewood coloured body. Fragile lacing. Moderately roasted smell. Taste of mid-sweet dark malts with a touch of liquorice. Roasted end. Watered. Accepted (Hull, 25.11.2015).

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Draft. Clear deep amber color, medium white head. Aroma of nutty caramel. Taste is malty, light body.

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Black colour with a fine creamy off white head. Mild roasted malt aroma. Very tasty concidering it is only 3,2%. Mild creamy roasted malt flavour. [On tap at The King Charles in Liverpool, England]

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: First sampled this mild in Sedburgh, July 1991. Cask, handpump dispense. Ruby black in colour with a thin white creamy head. Slight roasted malt in the aroma with a decent creamy mouthfeel and good lacing. Slight nutty texture with a hint of plain chocolate and dry dusty black malt. Slight prickle of hop resins noted in the not too dry bitter aftertaste. Nutty flavour noted in the dry malty finish. A decent session mild.

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: cask at dog and partridge preston ... deep brown ... thin tan head ... soft dark fruit roast malt nose ... soft dark berry ... light sweet light roast malts ... simple but tasty enough

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Draught The Bluebell, York pours near black with creamy tan head. Roast malts in aroma. Smooth mouthfeel, very nice. Roast malts in flavour, not at all bitter. Very enjoyable

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: 7th April 2010. Clear dark brown beer. Light palate. Slightly dry palate. Neutral malt with a hint of appley greenness. Semi dry finish. Supreme blandness!

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Pint on handpull, black with a thick creamy tan head. Light roasted character to the malt. Drinks as a good standard Mild without standing out.

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Handpulled cask at the Red Lion, Haddenham, Bucks. Deep ruby/black with an off white head. Surprisingly decent quaffable mild with roast malt and caramel aswell as a spattering of fresh english hops.

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: Cask-conditioned at the Victoria Family & Commercial, Leeds 23/06/09. Brownish-red, with plenty of caramel, a hint of chocolate and short, vaguely roasty finish. Ok.

name: Tetley's Mild / Dark Mild (Cask)
review: (Cask at Wenlock Arms, London, 16 Apr 2009) Dark brown colour with brief, off-white head. Malty, roasted nose with dark fruit and caramel. Malty, taste with notes of dark fruit, wort bread and caramel. Not very exciting, but a decent and well made mild.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Nice Pale Ale (I think it was this one, perhaps another one. But it was Tetley's)

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Amber-brownish colour with a dark white small head. Light aromas of toffee, roasted malts, hay and some light earthy herbal note to it. Soft carbonation, smooth texture, medium body. Some sweetness outbalanced by some resinous hop bitterness. Short-medium finish. Bit average for ’imperial’.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Keg at Norton Cricket Club, Stockton-on-tees. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma is woody caramel. Taste is woody cheatnut. Ok.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Keg draught at the Golden Lion, Whitby. Looks good. Medium off white head sits atop a blackened chestnut body. Nose is raisin, rum, fruit, caramel, some nitrous and iron, spice. Bittersweet then bitter. Lingering dryness. A watery palate.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Dark brown with a good head, roast malt aroma and a fruity roast malt taste, this beer is a lot better than other reviewers argue and I like it.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Draught at The Black Horse Inn, Whitby. Pours a clear very deep orange-red with an average size off-white head. Mild aroma of hops, some mild roastness and a hint of smoke (didn’t expect that). Flavour’s a little toasty, less sweet and fruity then most of the Bitters I’ve had here which is a refreshing change, more bitter as well. Some caramel malt and nuts in there too. Medium bodied. Pretty enjoyable stuff.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Deep ruby in colour, with a slightly nutty flavour, but this was rough and didnt work

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: On tap before a trip to White Hart Lane. Maybe the surroundings added to the experience, but this Tetleys went down remarkably well. Orange/brown with a nice mild hoppiness. Served just this side of room temperature and went down oh so easy.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Slightly aged sample Medium but dense, creamy off-white head; orange-foxy beer with a slight haze all the same. Bit of caramel or even toffee, yet not overly sweet nose. Some extra smell that reminds me both of honeysweets and... stinging nettles? Caramel, and a discreet hoppy bitterness that has a metallic, even galvanic tang to it. Bit smoked, but not as smoked malt nor ashes. Reasonably refreshing, bit gassy. Something vaguely (hazel)nutty in the aftertaste. The "Imperial" name is less than clear. It’s a decent bottled ale, for sure. Thanks to podge, who yielded to my stubborness.

name: Tetleys Imperial (Pasteurised)
review: Bottle. This is actually a very nice bottle of beer. Tastes of confidence and experience. Nice brown sugar flavours, caramel and toffee with a gentle balance of hops. Very drinkable. [2.8]

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: It was ok, but had a thinner body, mouthfeel and taste than Hof Brau Dark which I had had a night or two before. I would not order this particular Dinkelacker again.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: draught in h town pours dark, a bit of caramel malt. Nothing fancy but ticks the boxed.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: From old tasting notes. Translucent reddish brown color has an immense creamy tan head. Light roasted malt aroma. Toasted malt flavor. Dry finish has grassy hops. Less complex than the lighter CD Pils. OK, but not as good as other German Dunkels.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: Another of those treat beers while ago..this and original DinkelAcher..this was drier,roastier than the original.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: "tried this once when the mood hot for a malty dark. not bad, not great. it satisfied the craving. about average for the style, but i generally like dunkels, so it’s an above average beer. a little on the unassuming side."

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: Dunkelbraun, reichlich Schaum. Malzbetonter Geschmack nach Karamell, Toffee und Nüssen. Solides Dunkel, wenn auch etwas langweilig.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: Bottle- Pours a dark brown color with a off-white head and good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, some caramel sweetness and hint of fruit. Flavor is a mixture of roasted malt and a bit of caramel sweetness. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body, smooth and creamy, nice balance. Easy drinker, good for a few.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: 11.2 oz green bottle, I’m hoping for no skunkage. It pours a dark brown with a hint of reddich/orange/gold. The head is fizzy and off-white. The smell is classic, no skunk here. It has caramel, cocoa, and dark bread. Along with this is some honey and some light husky grain. I’m not really smelling any hops. The flavor is excellent, everything you want in a dunkel. It is smooth and caramally with some cocoa, raisin, and munich malts. The hops are present in the flavor and add a little zest to it. It is extremely drinkable. A winner. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 01-19-2011 19:28:32

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: Like a slightly thicker Warsteiner Dunkel in every way, a little bit better malty flavor, just not anything better than a little better than average.

name: Dinkelacker Dark
review: 12oz bottle. Translucent amber-brown color. Minimal soda-like head. I’d have to guess the bottle was old. Pungent, devolved dark malt tones. On the light side of medium bodied. Some toffee tones. Cheap Eastern-European dark beer. Probably way better fresh, certainly not one to age.

name: HopTown IPA
review: O-town throwdown III 2007. Bomber shared by hopscotch. Pours a hazy peachy amber with a thin head. Aroma is loaded with DMS- tons of cream of wheat doughiness, yeasty dirtiness, grass, chalky and mineral with stale cheesy hops. Flavor is more doughy yeast, corny dms, wheat dough, pastry dough, grass, stale cheesy hops, light toast and a light bitterness- lots going wrong here. Sucks cuz it seems they have probably fixed these problems. My notes are from 3 years ago, but hey are pretty detailed. Ill try to find a bottle and re-rate.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Great sessionable IPA from NorCal...had a few bottles while spending some time in the mountains near Weaverville. Light, flavorful, and priced right!

name: HopTown IPA
review: very bubbly, clear golden color, decent white head. unfiltered, floaties at the bottom of the bottle. smelled hoppy and floral. taste is sweet, mildly hoppy, yet strong at the same time. as they say with altoids, "curiously" hoppy. not enough to make your tongue curl up, just a tease. pretty good!

name: HopTown IPA
review: Bottle shared by puzzl. Pale amber beer with a nice clean crisp hoppy aroma. Orange and grapefruit over a fairly clean malt base. The aroma is more impressive than the flavour and the beer doesn’t taste nearly as hoppy as it smells. Light breadiness. Still, quite good, if indistinct.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Bottle, shared by puzzl. Gold / amber pour, some haze. Aroma is nice, citrus hops, fresh, some caramel malt. Flavor is decently balanced, medium bitterness, same citrus and malt presence. Good but nothing to set it apart.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Bomber. Good aroma, yellow hops, pine, peanut butter. Flavor is quite bitter, lots of grapefruit, salty brine.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Nice IPA. Pours orange with a small head. Aroma is sharp citrus in nature. Taste is full in the mouth. Very prominent citrus bitterness that finishes cleanly.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Hazy orange color with nice sized off-white head. Nice nose of citurs and pine. Flavor is more hoppy than the nose leads on. Big hit up top, then the slight malty flavor rounds out this medium body brew.

name: HopTown IPA
review: Cloudy orange, moderate head with good lacing and retention. Aroma is citrus, pine, some wood, some grass. Medium bodied, moderate to low bitterness. Somewhat light, doesn’t bring the big hop flavors I expect from the C hops.

name: HopTown IPA
review: On tap. Nose is nice citrus hoppiness. Decent looking beer with a full head. Flavor is a good blend of the pineapple hops and a sweetness from the malt, that subsides to a clean bitter finish.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: Pours cloudy yellow with a massive white head that fizzled away quickly. There is a floral aroma and a substantial, slightly bitter caramel malt flavor. A pretty good light beer.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: I am going to bump this one up. As far as Golden Ales go, this one is one of my favorites. The aroma and nose are very fruity, with lots of grassy notes. Lots of aroma (of course this is a very fresh batch on tap.)

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: A great big thanks goes out to cquiroga for the bomber of golden ale. Beautiful pour in a big 22 oz clear mug. Looks like a hefe with an unfading tall rocky head. Very appealing look to the sparkling carbonation. On the tongue it’s also quite zesty. Uh oh, do I smell a little butter? Can’t taste any butter in it. Has more of a citrusy bite. Tho a bit hoppy, quite an interesting experience. Some bitterness builds on the top back of the throat during the finish. Appears to be quite fresh, S4L4F3T4O10 hoptown golden

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: Very hazy straw gold, big white head with decent retention. Floral hop aroma, with floral-accented clean malts on the palate and a crisp bitter finish. On the lighter side, but very well made with good flavours and balance. Surprisingly enjoyable!

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: In the bomber bottle from HyVee CB. Pours a cloudy, yeast chunky deep overnight pee gold. Has an incredibly thick as a brick white concrete head. This has a very solid yeasty and bready aroma. I really love this beer because it tastes just like many homebrewed golden ales that I have made. It is thick and has lots of lemon-yeast flavors at the finish. Plenty of hop presence without seeming bitter at all. Just a great homestyle beer.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: Bomber from Bottle Barn; Nose of sweetpeas; very floral and sweet; lightly hazed gold with a huge white head; flavor of light hop bitterness, and some lemony citrus.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: Hazy straw color, tons of sediment kicked up in the bottom of the bottle, a little of which made it into the glass. Very carbonated, producing a massive, yet short-lived head. Lightly perfumey grainy aroma, a little bit of lemon essence; moderate yeast presence. Fairly sweet opening, segueing to a somewhat flabby grainy body, more sweetness, more lemon and perfume. Pretty clean finish, light yet prickly hoppiness. A little low on the hops for my tastes - I like this beers pretty dry with some refresing bitterness. Very sharp carbonation, which I actually like here, but it’s still a bit too much. I keep thinking I shouldn’t like this style, but yet I do.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: 22 oz bottle given to me by heermer77. Thanks Eric. The bottle said 5% AbV. Served at cellar temperature. There was some nice yeast sediment at the bottom of the bottle. Poured a hazy golden color. Head was rocky and white with pretty good retention. Aroma was mostly of cereal grain and light citrusy hops. There was also a whiff of caramel. Dry and effervescent on the tongue with carbonation on the higher end of the spectrum. The flavor was dominated by bitter citrusy hops without much of a malt backbone (other than some light cereal grain). The bitterness peaked at about 6 out of 10. Overall, this one was light and easy to drink.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: Bottle from Johncy’s in North Liberty, IA. Cloudy gold body with a bright white head. I smelled soap, watermelon and some light grapefruit in this one. The taste has light hints of grapefruit rind with some roasted peanut shells. There are also some strange notes of pears and black pepper spice in the finish. This is a brew that seems to me to be halfway between an amber and a Belgian Golden strong ale.

name: HopTown Golden Ale
review: From a 22 oz bottle poured a hazy gold with a huge foamy head the just would not quit. Nose of piney and floral hops, backed up by mild malts. Somewhat carbonated leading to a light mouthfeel. Flavor slightly sour, and a bit sweet. Finish mildly bitter. Easy to drink.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Bottle from gondor. Dark brown, minimal head, fades to film. Somewhat transparent. Aroma and flavor consist of faint chocolate and coffee and not much else. Very muted. Thin mouthfeel.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Sample at the Most Honorable SuperHappyFun Stout Tasting: After reading the label, I think if it were me vs. a long Russian Winter, this wouldn’t be a bad beer to have along for the fight. This beer smells like it might keep you warm on those long, cold nights. Aroma is booze and vanilla. A very syrupy quality that leaves a coating on the tongue here. Dark sugars. Did I mention booze? This tastes stronger than 9%.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: This was a 22 oz bomber i had for a while and it was not bad at all with a lot of roasted malts and hints of coffee and chocolate as it warmed the abv was apparent and it had a nice rich taste to it.CHEERS!

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Sample at the Most Honorable SuperHappyFun Stout Tasting. Bottle from Park Lane Liquor in Lancaster, CA. This beer pours black with a medium beige head that recedes steadily. Stringy lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and coffee, plus some hops. Rich body with a chewy mouthfeel and flavors of roasted malt, coffee and hops as well as some dark chocolate. The finish is rich and smooth with sweet malt and coffee lingering in the aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Vintage 2005 Pours opaque black with mahogany edging, and barely a quarter-inch of beige head. The whisp of foam dissapated quickly leaving a placid surface and few small streaks of lacework. Aromatics are full of dark chocolate, Kahlua, and espresso-drizzeled fudge. A hint of tart vineousity follows though along with a trace of nougat. A bit short of full bodied, but still chewy enough. Velvety, slick and oily. Lowish carbonation. Rich, dark chocolate leads off the pallet, with coffee infused fudge and charred cocoa nubs. Black forest cake batter drizzeled with a Kahlua reduction. Bitterness is balancing, and hopping in general is without a trace. Alcohol is barely warming and an afterthought at best. Finishes quite mellow and rounded, with a hint of vineousity. Very much like a aged Baltic porter. Great stuff and very well could be peaking at three years. Still quite fresh tasting and bold, but plenty of aged complexites and mellowness.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Bomber. Poured clear, very deep brown with a shorter cap of dense toffee head. My first impression on the palate with burger grease.. thankfully that dissipated promptly.. became molasses with some dark chocolate and coffee character.. roast was moderate in the aroma, and much more pronounced in the flavor department.. deeper, and it really hid the alcohol well. As mentioned, the flavor was more roasty with molasses, licorice, and coffee represented.. sticky licorice and soy with some coffee bitterness at the finish.. just too roasty without enough flavor development to make it really good. Heavier-bodied and slick with low carbonation on the palate.. the heavy roast stuck at points, and this never developed as I would like.. overall a decent and drinkable, but far from great imperial stout.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Pours black with a brown sheathing. Great smell of pit tree fruits, vanilla and blackened malts reminds me of a buttered sweet roll. Velvety smooth mouthfeel and way too easy to drink. Good taste is well balanced with sweet ripe pit fruit up front then bitter blackened malts to finish. Good stuff. 012606

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: deep dark color. small tan head. great heavily spicy aroma. very smooth flavor of roasted malt and pepper. a solid imperial.

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: Date: 12/02/2005 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, Strong Ale Fest Black, thin tan head, big roasted aroma, creamy body, nice roasted malt flavor, easy drinking but not very complex Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: **/4

name: HopTown Old Yeltsin Imperial Stout
review: 22oz, I think from HiTime. Thick black pour, looks oily, with very minimal head. The aroma is fairly rich and chocolatey, with some roast coffee coming through. First sips are quite pleasant, with a pleasing balance of roast and somewhat dark fruits, like overripe plums or even prunes. A pleasant mix, but somehow I feel this beer would be better with a richer, creamier mouthfeel. The taste just isn’t quite deep and intense enough to carry it as is. Still, a very solid RIS that I’d be stoked to drink again.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: "this beer is way dark for an amber...but it’s not really a red either. i think they just did what they wanted with this one. it’s malty all the way, like a brown but sweeter. it’s actually an unbalanced mess (no hop presence whatsoever) but for whatever reason i’ve always really enjoyed it. the caramel malt flavors are great, and it is refreshing and highly drinkable, just not true to the style for an amber or red."

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: On tap at Mammoth Brewing Company in mammoth lakes, ca, the new contract brewer of this beer. Appearance: Pours a perfect amber with an offwhite stripe of head. Aroma: No aroma what-so-ever. Taste: Modest bitter hops and slightly chocolaty Munich like malt. Mouthfeel: Thin with medium carbonation. Overall: Boring, lacking any sort of depth or flavor.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: Must have held on to this one for too long. It was all messed up on the palate.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: Bottle from Booze Bros, in Reno, NV. Poured and amber color. Sweet taste with an almost metallic aftertaste. I don’t feel like I rated very fair because I bought the bottle almost 8 months ago. Looks like its retired so I may never get to try a fresh bottle.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: This amber ale pours a dark amber color from a 12oz bottle. Small sized white foamy head. The aroma is caramel and sweet. A medium bodied amber. The malts are caramel and sweet. The hops are earthy. This amber is more caramel malt, than fruity and sweet. It is not as sweet as most ambers. Good carbonation. It is an amber, but not that objectionable. It looks like the brew pub is closed, but this beer is still being produced. This bottle was purchased within a couple days of sampling and seems fairly fresh, so where is it being brewed? Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: Bottle from Strawberry market, not sure if it is retired, does not seem to be the case. A hoppy amber ale,with a good balance of malts and hop flavors. Bitter finish. Pours with a nice reddish color. Nice example of an amber style beer.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: Retired? Draft at NorCal Brewers Guild Festival at Raley Field as "Red Ale". Aroma of malt and light fruit and spice. Reddish amber color with a strong and lacing white head. Firm mouthfeel. Fruity start - balanced with some malt. Mild bitter finish. Very fresh and refreshing.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: Sampled in Truckee. A nice brew. Aroma was fair but the key was the appearance. Was very dark red with a thick head. One of the best amber ales i have had. Mouthfeel is smooth and the flavor is nice and hoppy.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle courtesy of Grant. Peaty, floral, caramel, musty, malty aroma. Definitely different and quite aromatic. I also detect some chewing tobacco in the aroma as well. Transparent dark amber/light mahogany body with a light tan head that is rather small with nice lacing present. Mossy, peaty, strange swampy malty flavors to start. I also detect some band aids as well. Turns a bit more coffee-like in the mid-late area. There is a weird astringent sourness later on, which seems more like a flaw to me. I am not a fan of this beer.

name: Lake Tahoe Crystal Bay Red Ale
review: (10/2006. 12oz Bottle.) Deep, dark amber with a nearly non-existent head (just a little ring around the edges). Malty nose with ever so slight hints of sourness in the background. Malty, caramel notes in the taste with hints of nuttniess and, again, some sour notes. Medium-full bodied but also nearly flat. A lingering, again, sour aftertaste.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: now a defunct brewpub (although the bottled beers are still rollin’) this beer was very good. it had a great body, although on the dry side, always served on nitro. solid earthy roasted aroma, and chocolate/coffee/malt flavor with a slight hop balance."

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: Draft. Blackish beer with a creamy beige head - nitro pour. Roasty malt aroma. Roasted malt and chocolate flavors with a very earthy backing. Full bodies, but goes down easy.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: Beautiful beer! It takes a few minutes to pour this one with a lovely, creamy, off-white head and reddish brown, but near-black body. Aroma is light and surprisingly hop endowed, although predominantly yeasty, like earth tones. Flavor is smoothe front with a tremendous yeast wallop, like raw dough with roasty and chocolate tones followed by a very unique bitter and sour finish. Small duration on finish flavor. Body is oh so thick and creamy. Overall: very yeasty(typical of the brewwer), light hops, complex finish and nice palate for enjoyable and intriguing drink.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: black with a rather fizzy head. Good mouthfeel and a great session beer. Chocolate flavors with very little else going on. But good for what it: A Plain.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: Great looking beer. Nice smooth, rich, creamy texture. My favorite of the Lake Tahoe beers.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: Draft... It is midnight black. I couldn’t see through the pint glass even when held up to the desert sun. The aroma is of pure, bitter-sweet cocoa. The flavor is of rich, unsweetened, Godiva chocolate blended with Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee. The mouthfeel is rich and silky and the finish is dry... not sweet. Perfeclty balanced.

name: Lake Tahoe Blackout Stout
review: Some coffee aromas, it's a very clean stout with not much particulate. This was maybe served too cold. Roasty with a lot of chocolate extending into a long bitter finish.

name: Lake Tahoe Nutty Winter Ale
review: "i’ve yet to try this in the bottle, but i’ll rerate, or adjust, as it’s been a while since the pub was open. this is a nutty, slightly above average interpretation of your standard brown, maybe with a very light spice profile as well. 2/20/09 had from the bottle...still nutty with a nice roasted aroma, good head...a little hint of funky things to come in the nose? something unpleasantly astringent, even olive-like in the flavor. not something i’ll have again. tap was a 3.2, bottle is a 2.2ish, so i’ll average the two..."

name: Lake Tahoe Nutty Winter Ale
review: Dark brown, basically black with a large medium tan head. The aroma has some rich cocoa and cherries. The taste has some cola and light milk chocolate. There is also some light malt. A nicely crafted brew, too bad it’s no longer available.

name: Lake Tahoe Nutty Winter Ale
review: Draft. Brown reddish color with a nice off-white head. Rich nutty flavor with some cocoa and hop backing. A little light in body and easy to drink. Light malty aroma - overpowered by the hot sauce at the next table.

name: Lake Tahoe Nutty Winter Ale
review: Nice dark brown color. Looks great. Not much aroma, but a great taste. The taste of a brown ale with a winter kick.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: Pours a beautiful clear copper with full white head. Malt overpowers and the Cascade is lost. Very faint hop characteristics.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: On tap, HL. Clear amber body with light white good lancing. Aroma is herbal, caramel, toffee, very herbal. Taste has high bitterness, herbal. Body is medium, high carbonation.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: Sampled draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. Dark amber, creamy off-white head. Nose is sweet old yeast, sugar, old medicinal yeast notes. Taste is old yeast, herbal, dull plaster, stale medicine. Body is old yeast & plaster. Meh, ‘though feels old.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: on tap ambrata velata agrumato terroso buona secchezza amaro medio Non molto lunga poco corpo

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: Light copper color with soapy head and retention. Aroma is very herbal without much else showing. Medium to lighter in body with a lingering herbal finish that hangs for a good duration after the sip. Could this resumable a healing tonic from the early part of the 1900’s? perhaps, simple, straight forward and well made.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: On tap @ the brewpub. Copper colour. Bready, malty, light citrus, bland taste

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: On tap @ the brewery during San Francisco 7/7/14 beer tour. Pours a dark orange appearance with a creamy colored head. Caramel, toasted malty aroma with some grassy / stalky notes. Pretty sweet flavor. Chewy herbal flavor. Some caramel and grass. Pass.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: On tap at SF Beer Week Opening Gala. Pour is copper with almost no head. Aroma and flavor are both of roast, floral hops, biscuit, and caramel. Sweet finish.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pour is clear orange with a huge cream colored head and great lacing. Bready, husky, light grapefruit, citrus, and grassy aroma. Taste is pretty bland - slightly floral, grainy, biscuity, grassy, and herbal with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Not bad for less than 5%.

name: Magnolia Prescription Pale Ale
review: Draught @ Magnolia Pub & Brewery, San Francisco. Rated on 15.10.2012. Pours a hazy golden copper colour with a white head. Aroma of toasted malts, floral hops and bread. Flavour of mild toasted malts, really strong and pungent hops, raisins and hay. Medium bodied, slick and a bit thin mouthfeel and a dry bitter finish. Nicely hopped, but lacks maltiness.

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: Fat @ Magnolia Brewpub. Bärnstensfärgad öl med vitt skum. Doft och smak av lätt rostad malt, frukt och karamell.

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: On tap at Gabf. Pours a hazy orange with medium white head. The aroma is toasted malt and toffee. Medium body, spice, toasted malt, nice sweetness, very good.

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: Pint at Growl Movement in Salem OR. $4.00 Clear copper color ale with a small lighter tan head. Not much aroma. What there is light toffee, leaves and nuts. Taste is the same as the nose. Light and malt. A touch of English hops. Mouth feel is fine for style. Nice English bitter.

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: Out of a growler. Pour is a semi clear light brown, small head that last 1/3 of the ways through the drink and leaves sloppy lacing. Smell is kinda bland of malt and caramel, basically like an amber. Taste follows. Not specifically "bitter" or whatever. It’s aight

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: Lightly bitter with grain and cereal notes, it could have been really good but there were these terrible mettalic/soapy notes too.

name: Magnolia Blue Bell Bitter
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed ruby amber with a thin white head. Soft caramel and a bit of malt on the nose. Medium-bodied, soft nutty malt, a bit of toast. Light bitterness into the finish. Easy and clean.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Draught at Magnolia. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, toffee, toast, nuts and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, nuts, toast, grass and toffee. Good English style IPA.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Sample at the source. Now with some more light grain in the malt bill on this one. Getting that sweet light corn flavor again. Finish is mild and grassy. Smooth and easy to drink.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed ruby amber with a thin white head. Soft malt and a touch of citrus, a hint of dank skunky weed. Medium-bodied, soft malt, a bit of resinous citrus. Earthy citrus into the finish, slow earthy bitterness, a hint of lingering citrus.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Pint at brewpub. Ok aroma, sweet. Grainy, lite citrus and hone. Reddish orange color, ok head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body smooth creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. It’s ok, seems weak overall. Has lingering bitterness.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: ambrata velata non molta schiuma lieve caramello buona luppolatura leggermente terrosa lieve nota fruttata media secchezza lieve agrumato

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: On tap @ the brewery during San Francisco 7/7/14 beer tour. Pours a red orange appearance with a tan head. Buttered popcorn, dull fruity hops, and slight toast in the nose. Twangy, lemon/tangerine fruity, buttery flavor. For fucks sake, does every beer here have to be a fucken butter bomb.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Has a dark rust orange pour. Aroma is strong in honey and some malt. Taste is interesting with some sweet honey and hops. Has a light bitter ending.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Draught @ Magnolia Pub & Brewery, San Francisco. Rated on 15.10.2012. Pours a golden colour without a head. Aroma of herbs, grainy malts and weak floral notes. Flavour of grainy malts, metals, nuts, astrigent, herbs and some hops. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and a rough, grainy, herbal finish. Weird.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: Had on tap, cask conditioned at magnolia brew pub. Not much flavor and hops are suttle.

name: Magnolia Spud Boy IPA
review: 12 oz. Draft on Cask at Magnolia Pub and Brewery, SF, CA. Excellent hoppy, pine and flowers, scent over a cloudy copper pour with a fluffy white head. Excellent mouthfeel, thicker bodied than most IPA’s, with a dry slightly fizzy finish. The flavor started great with citrus, pine, and bitter notes, but then it took an earthy, nutty route that I wasn’t fond of. Just not my personal preference.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap at Gabf. Pours amber with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is toasted malt and raisin. Medium body, spice, bread, dark fruit, light finish, good.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear ruby with a thin white head. Nutty malt, a bit of toffee and caramel. Medium-bodied, nutty malt, a touch of toast. Crisp and easy drinking, malt and a touch of bitterness into the finish.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap at Smokestack. Reddy amber coloured pour with a lasting g cream coloured head. Aroma is earthy nutty grains, raisin, dirt / earth, cakey malts. Flavour is composed of earthy nutty malts, raisin bread, nutty, some mineral. Quite authentic mild. Palate is pretty high gassy carbonation. Light sugar. Passable.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: Tap at smokestack. Clear reddish chestnut, small tan head, minimal lacing. Aroma is nutty, caramel, bread. Light sweet, minimal bitterness, malty, bready. Medium body. OK.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: From cask at smokestack - delicious malty sweetness with touch of fruit but not too sweet. Prefer cask pour... More complex flavor profile without too much carbonation and warmer serving temp.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap @ the brewery during San Francisco 7/7/14 beer tour. Pours a reddish orange appearance with a tan head. Some diacetyl, caramel, and toasted malt in the nose. Moderately night carbonation. Some more butter in the flavor. Mild toffee and toast. A touch of fruit. The butter isn’t overwhelming and I think acceptable in small doses for the style. Fine.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: Quite good mild session beer. Perfect pairing with some excellent BBQ at the new brewery in Dogpatch! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap at Magnolia, pours a clear dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma is very subtle, with some very slightly caramel-tinged toasted malt. Flavour brings out toasted bready malt, very very dry caramel accents, and some dry red fruity notes. Highly drinkable, bready, and dry caramely. Good stuff.

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: A - pours orange with no head. M - light body with almost no carb. Weak palate and uninspired body. Drinkable. T - light citrus hops wet grass dirty water and negro modelo 2.3

name: Magnolia Saras Ruby Mild
review: On tap at the Pub, August 2013. Clear reddish/copper with a medium head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, nuts, toffee and some fruit. Soft and easy to drink. The finish was dry. A solid one.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: Poured from home tap into a pint glass. Pours cola brown with a decent cream head and a quickly dissipating head. Flavor has coffee and licorice with a nutty aroma with caramel and chocolate notes with some mild crystal malt sweetness. Would recommend to friends. A decent brown ale!

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: Welcoming rich mahogany color with hints of bitter sweet chocolate in the aroma. More complex than your typical brown ale.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: Their best beer i've had thus far. Smoky, but not overhopped. Medium body, but it suits the beer perfectly, making it an easy drinker. Magnolia SF

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear cola brown with a thin tan head. Maple syrup on the nose, big brown sugar. Medium-bodied, soft roast, toast, a touch of molasses and brown sugar. Never picks up the sweetness the nose implied, which is a nice thing actually. Gentle bitterness into the finish, super easy drinking and loads of flavor for a beer under 4%. Nicely executed.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: Pours a really dark brown colour with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is of toast, a little nutty, with a slight vanilla-like scent. Taste is dry and malty sweet with a slight bitterness closer to the finish. Medium body, softer carbonation, and slightly creamy on the palate. Overall a really good brown ale.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: On cask at Magnolia. Clear brown with a beige head. Roasty caramel aroma. Nutty, toasty, roasty, sweet taste, with a slight bitter finish. Mmm smooth cask mouthfeel. Good.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: 10 ounce sample on cask at the brewpub. The aroma has a really nice nuttiness, as well as some good toasted malt character. Lightly sweet, and nicely aromatic. Transparent mahogany body with a medium, bubbly light tan head. Good lacing. Starts with a flavorful toastiness, before a little light coffee character comes in the middle. Finishes with light astringency. Very easy-drinking.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pour is deep brown with a frothy tan head and great lacing. Roast, cocoa, graham crackers, bread, lightly earthy, vanilla, and coffee in the aroma. Taste is roasty, bready, biscuity, grassy, graham cracker, and slightly herbal with a lightly roasted bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Not bad.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. It pours a nice mahogany color, clear but dark with an off white head. The aroma has great notes of strong toffee, cocoa and toast. Kind of like a Heath bar without all the sweetness. The flavor is more toffee, toast, mild red berries, and a hint of mineral tartness and toastiness in the finish. Dry. A great session beer.

name: Magnolia Big Cypress Brown Ale
review: Classic looking brown. See through. Nice off white head. Aroma is brown sugars and caramel malts. Taste is slightly roasted, caramel, no hops, very good for a low ABV beer! Tastefull!

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: This is a decent stout, but personally I think it’s a bit lackluster. It certainly needs a little bit more flavor and aroma. Use more malt, Magnolia!

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
