review: Great looking nitro pour, large, creamy head with a black body. Minty, roasted coffee aroma. Biting body, smooth chocolate and coffee tones. Toasted, bitter finish.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Draft @ Magnolia’s. Pours a very dark, chocolate-brown color; medium-tan head, creamy with great retention and fine-bubbled lacing; great pour. Nicely dry, roasted malts and dark bitter chocolate in the aroma; nougat and chewy chocolate and some floral notes. Medium mouthfeel: nicely full, highly drinkable British-style stout; nicely acidic coffee and bitter chocolate and light citrus; filled-out; almost a touch of Fantome-like yeasty funk. Lengthy finish: dry, bitter chocolate, coffee, and nicely toasty.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Draught at the brewpub. Near black, firm creamy head. Roasty coffee aroma. Dry and creamy with light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Typical Irish stout is enery way - light, dry, creamy, coffeish roasty and bitter.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Black pour, light tan head. Very light aroma, reminiscent of Guinness (which is bad). Light roast, coffee and chocolate are here, light hops. Another stout ruined from nitro.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Aroma: Roasty and toasty Appearance: black with a nice creamy brown head Flavor: Fabulous roast and coffee flavors Palate: Surprisingly light on the tongue for a stout Overall: A surprising find... it is not common to find a dry irish stout with such a low alcohol percentage... an awesome session stout... classic old world style

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: On tap, at the brewpub. Damn, this was a disappointing end to a great session at Magnolia. Black with red hues. very thick big beige head. Slight roasted weak aroma. Thick nitro mouthfeel. Bland watery dry taste. Lingering bitterness, but sour roasted quality to it as well - it struck me as a Guinness clone. Just bland. A solid brewpub’s weaker offering.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Tap @ brewpub. A solid black color with a creamy brown head. Big roasted and coffee flavors.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Average, slighly rubbery flavor. Nitro stout that I could have done without.

name: Magnolia Spooky Tooth Stout
review: Boring, dry Irish stout. Not much flavor. Served on nitrogen tap. Nice appearance.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: On tap at Magnolia, SF. A nice near double IPA. Robust, well balanced, nice smooth mouthfeel.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Draft. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy hop forward balanced aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. This beer met my expectations.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Draught @ Magnolia Pub and Brewery, SF. Pour golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of malt, light grain, grassy hops. Flavor is light bitter, malt, grain, grass, light fruity hops. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 180718

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Good juice! Fresh clear bright hoppy tasting straight from the can. Would buy again ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Pours orange amber color with thin head. Citrus, pine hoppy aroma. Crisp on palate with balanced bitterness. Orangey citrus tangerine with slight grapefruit flavors mixed with mild resin and malt backbone. 7.0% alcohol ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Draught in SF. Dark orange with a medium head. Aroma of toasted soft fruit. Flavour is blood orange, sharp bitter, nutty base, long lingering finish.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: Draft at Hog Island Oyster Co., S.F. Pours a hazy orange-gold, with a white head. Aroma of citrus, pine. Taste is citrus, pine, grapefruit, caramel, a bit of pineapple. Good.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: From tap at Magnolia, San Francisco. Aroma has notes of berries including some strawberries, hops, biscuity malt, light caramel with some buttery notes. Flavour is sweetish with a bitter finish. Body is medium. Very different, fairly likeable, despite the buttery notes.

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: At the Barrel House in Sausalito. In a tall glass. Murky golden yellow with no head. Creamy vanilla and citrus hops. Medium hp finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

name: Magnolia Proving Ground IPA
review: 12 ounce can from ABV. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. A big sweet fruity toast and certainly I get some butter in it. Lots of floating particulates in it, which also seems amiss. The flavor is certainly buttery, orange peel, vanilla, butterscotch. Not the worst diacetyl but something is way off. Sweet sticky flavor. Pretty bad. Bitter and buttery.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: Draught at Haight. Clean yellow with a thin head. Aroma is lemon wheat. Flavour is light wheat, fruit and vanilla. Malty base.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: On tap at the Haigh Street brewpub. Thanks to Bobby. Very pale yellow coloured pour with a small white froth. Aroma is earthy grains, rough rolled wheat, husks, grainstore. Flavour is composed of harsh earthy grains, honey, honey monster cereal, Palate is semi sweet , mineral and moderate carbonation.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: Light yellow color and a flavor if Cheerios. It is a pretty typical wheat beer. It is mild and if you like simple beer it's very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: On tap - The beer pours out a pale straw yellow body, clear with a foamy white cap. Aroma is very light, some hint of lemon, a touch of air freshener (floral I guess). The flavor is very, very light. Light hay, a subtle twang, some weak vanilla and cereal flavors. Easy to drink.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: On tap at the Pub, August 2013. A bit hazy light yellow with a small white head. On the thin side with some coriander, wheat and light notes of fruit. Not the best one.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: A - pours a nice golden honey with low head. S - wheat, lager. Light grains and a hint of coriander. M - light and drinkable with a slight tang. Average carb. Weak palate. T - simple slightly more flavorful macro lager. Some light grains, wheat, and lager. O - simple and summery. 2.9

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: Clear yellow color. Had a white head. Very refreshing and light. Straw taste, hay. Nothing much going on here but very refreshing.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: I don’t particularly care for wheat beers, but this one is down right bad. If you find yourself at this otherwise lovely brewpub, steer clear of this mundane drink.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: on tap-pours a white head and pale yellow color. Aroma is wheat/grain, some herbal. Taste is wheat/grain with some sweet, secondary herbal/spice hops. Easy.

name: Magnolia Weather Report Wheat
review: On tap. Pours with a clear, golden hued body with a small but mostly lasting white head. Aromas are fruity, estery, phenolic (cardamon), coriander, mint, a hint of raw grain, diacetyl, butter, butterscotch, caramel. Flavors are grainy, wheat, lightly spicy, cereal, vanilla, some esters and white pepper. Medium bubbles, mouthfeel is a bit slick. Medium bodied. Mostly dry finish. Unique wheat beer.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Tap. Pours crystal clear amber, medium creamy beige head, good lacing. Aroma is light caramel, bread, grass. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, a bit of green apple tart, a bit of acid. Lightly metallic. Light body.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Clear golden with no head. Earthy aroma and taste with smooth caramel flavors and a mild bitterness.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Deep red with a nice smell of hops. Decent amber. Like the fact they use local everything for their beer. Nice place, but small. Parking a BIG problem. Had to park 1/2 mile away to get there. The area is not good. Wouldn’t go at night.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Dark amber colour and reasonably rich, slightly earthy malt aroma. Has a slightly chewy note, with breadcrusty finish. Could use some hop attack for authenticity’s sake. This is really just an amber.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Draught at the brewpub. Dark amber. Extremely fruity. Pineapple and cleaning agents jumps in my face. Sweet with raw, mellow mouthfeel. A sharp chemical vegetable finish leaves a burning sensation in the mouth.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Draft. Dark amber-brown-red with a nice beige head. Malt aroma. Malt and caramel flavors (though a bit light) ending with a touch of earthiness.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: a nice brewpub but i don´t know about their beers. this was a paleish alt, mild lightly honeyed sweetness and light bitterness

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Deep red/purple. Vibrant, fextive flavor or grains, wheat, sweet musty farm-like nose and flavor. An excellent altbier.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Tap@ Magnolia Pub and brewery, San fransisco- Pretty OK in terms of drinkablitity, got some appleskin and toffee in the flavour, grainy body, approachable for the masses.

name: Magnolia Ashbury Alt
review: Tap. Hazy dark amber color. A very crisp wheat yeasty type flavor. Some little hop addition.

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: Cask @ the brewpub. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a malty fruity hoppy aroma with some hints of citrus. Fruity malty hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hopy finish.

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: Cask. Rich amber beer with an off-white head. Light citrus aroma with light malt. Citrus, pine flavors with biscuity malt. Medium-light body. Somewhat watery. Lingering citrus, pine, and light caramel.

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: Hand pulled cask at the brewpub in San Francisco. Bright orange-amber with a creamy, sticky head. Faintly fruity and leafy aroma, very much the same on the palate, mostly reminiscent of fresh celery or perhaps melon. Low bitterness. Interesting.

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: I was pleased to be able to get this when I was visiting (on June 16th, 2007). I had it on the cask version. But...I didn’t care for it. Another hop-driven beer with none of the virtues of the Proving Ground. Amber in color, somewhat subtle hops (struck me as Maris Otter, but I see now that it was actually Cascade)--at any rate, a restrained vegetal flavor that didn’t suit me (but I don’t care for this style so much anyway). (on cask at brewpub)

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: Pours with an amber-orange body topped by a thick head with some lacing. The aroma is slightly sweet and malty with a touch of underlying grapefruit and apricot hoppiness. The flavor is similar with a note of grain. Light to medium bodied, slightly dry and smooth.

name: Magnolia Jubilee Ale
review: Tap. Golden ale with a nice fresh hoppy aroma, Fresh biscuity malt taste, with a touch of hops, very pleasant and fresh. Medium bodied. (June 2004). Got lucky as this was to be released the next week.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at Magnolia Smokestack in San Francisco, CA. Aroma is fruity malts, burnt sugar. Taste is malty, caramel, mild smoke and slight bitter finish.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at Gabf. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is dark fruit, spice, roast. Medium body, bready malt, caramel, fig, nice dry finish, very good.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at Final Gravity. Pours reddish brown with a thick tan head and a toffee aroma with a hint of chocolate. Thete is a medium-bodied smoked malt flavor with a moderately bitter finish.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: [2/2/16] Draught at Magnolia Gastropub and Brewery in San Francisco. Dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of caramel, toast, some fruitiness, faint spiciness. Sweet flavor with caramel, toffee, fruitiness. Medium-bodied.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at the Haigh Street brewpub. Thanks to Bobby. Clear ruby red / caramel brown coloured pour with a small cream head. Aroma is nice liquorice, red berry, nutty malts, red berry, light smoke and molasses. Flavour is composed of layered malts, nutty, liquorice, red berry, cranberry. Palate is sweet and malty with highish carbonation. Decent malty beer.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: Brown hazy. Little brown head. Aroma is chocolate, fudge, caramel, raisins, bubblegum. Taste is maly, not as complex as aroma. Tastes "brown". Not too impressed but decent.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: Murky dark amber in color with a finger of off-white head. Super sweet, very sugary, maybe some dark fruits. Raisins, light booze, heavy on the sugar and caramel. Just way too sweet.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours with a deep brown body with a tan head. Aroma of molasses, cola, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Flavors of cola, brown sugar, nutmeg, estery with a sweet finish. Highly carbonated for the style. Not bad. On tap at Blue Palms. Aromas are spicy, bready, cinnamon, cardamom. Hazy deep golden hued body with a minimal head. Aromas are of cinnamon, grainy, wheat, caramel, pine, persimmon, bitter. Drinkable for how crazy spicy it is. Lots of astringent, bitter spice though. Cinnamon sugar lasts.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: On tap at toronado SF. Pours brown with an off white head. The aroma is a little simple with mostly caramel and plums. The flavor is fruity and a tad spicy with some sweet caramel, light butteriness, and a medium bitter finish. Nice little winter beer.

name: Magnolia Winter Warmer
review: Dark brown with a fizzy off white head. Mellow sweetness and molasses aroma and taste with alcohol evident in the finish.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Pours hazy caramel with almost no head. Aromas of raisins, caramel, toffee, figs, dates, slight butter. Taste is very sweet with lightly roasted notes and some honeyed nuts. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: [2/2/16] Draught at Magnolia Gastropub and Brewery in San Francisco. 11.7%. Deep reddish amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, butter, toffee, some fruitiness. Sweet flavor, caramelly, buttery, a bit boozy. Medium-bodied.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Murky mahogany pour with an off-white head. The nose is somewhat oxidized and prune-like. Dark fruit sweetness, caramel, brown sugar, and toasted malt. Some sherry and alcohol on the finish. There’s plenty of caramel and brown sugar sweetness, some oxidation, sherry, and dark fruit. Some alcohol flavor and heat on the finish.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: carmel sweetness vs a strong hop bitterness in the finish. not a favorite BW, but better than previous scores here indicate imho. red in color with a medium thick body. would do well with a little age."

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: On tap at Magnolia. Pour is dark amber/brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is very malty and boozy with notes of molasses, chocolate chips, pineapple, and tropical fruit. Flavor is much the same with a bitter and boozy finish.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Draft @the brewpub. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty caramel aroma with hints of chocolate and hops. Sweetish malty spicy caramel and weak chocolate flavor with hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty caramel finish.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Murky mahogany pour with an off-white head. The nose is somewhat oxidized and prune-like. Dark fruit sweetness, caramel, brown sugar, and toasted malt. Some sherry and alcohol on the finish. There’s plenty of caramel and brown sugar sweetness, some oxidation, sherry, and dark fruit. Some alcohol flavor and heat on the finish.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Pours a ruddy brown with a thick but shrinking beige colored head. The aroma jumps out as cherry hard candy with hints of malt and molasses. The flavor is punishingly alcoholic but tasty with sweet cherry, caramel dense maltiness with a strong toasted bitter finish. Nice one, if a bit tough to drink.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: Clear light brown with a creamy tan head. Sweet molasses aroma and taste with smooth caramel notes and a creamy palate.

name: Magnolia Old Thunderpussy Barleywine
review: on tap-pours a tan head and copper color. Aroma is mild medium malt-caramel, some orange. Taste is anise/caramel-medium malt, some orange hops bite. Syrupy mouth feel.

name: Lost Coast Downtown Brown
review: Bottle poured in tulip Aroma: light to medium roast coffee, a little roasty, a little sour (like Ethiopian coffee) Appearance: amber body with thin head, head retention is low. (The bottle was from 08042018 so there was a significant of precipitate in this bottle. When I poured, I was trying not to get all the precipitate into my glass, so the head was thin, but I still saw silky precipitate in the body in my glass. Donno if this is normal) Flavor: coffee, with a sour hint, but not nearly as strong as the scent indicates. Some level of sweetness, like caramel or maple syrup. Low level of bitterness, well-rounded taste profile with some hint of roasted nut and butter-y note, in a pleasant way. Mouthfeel: not too bubbly, not too fizzy, moderate level of CO2 in the body. The body is very smooth, and this beer is easy to drink. Overall: I think this is a very good and very unique brown ale with its focus on the roasted coffee profile in the flavor.

name: Lost Coast Downtown Brown
review: Hints of caramel and hop aroma. Brown with big tan head. Light bitterness and sweetness. Short finish, light body, a bit thin. Good for a summer noon.

name: Lost Coast Downtown Brown
review: Average brown ale with hints of roasted nuts and caramel. Light brown color witha medium weight.

name: Lost Coast Downtown Brown
review: Bottle. Pours a brownish amber color with a decent beige head. Aroma of malt, nuts, with bit of caramel. Taste of dark malt, nuts with caramel and bit of brown sugar. Mild bitterness and fairly clean finish. Medium body, quite smooth and creamy. Nice for the style.

name: Lost Coast Downtown Brown
review: 12oz Flasche von Beer Republic. Schwarzes Bier, hellbeiger Schaum. Malzig-nussiger Duft. Sanfte Säure. Säuerlicher Röstmalz Antrunk. Haselnuss, Kuchenteig. Ein Hauch Muskat. Recht süffig.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Bottle:   1999 vintage from brewandbbq.   Still black after 12 years.   Thin sudsy brownish head, dies as I pour it, with no lacing.   Yeah, that too is expected.   Still some roasted malts and graham cracker on the nose, despite the aroma of oxidation.   Very musty and basement like on the tongue, super dank, with a soft roasted malt background.   Seems a little gritty and dirty.   I guess whats to be expected after 12 years.   There is a slight hint of sourness to this one, but its minor.   Body has a lot left to be desired.   Again, I am surprised that a beer this old isnt worse than it I thought it would be.   Any bitterness has diminished, leaving only a small roastiness with a hint of sweetness.   Otherwise its dank and musty, like a basement full of old coffee bags.   I gotta say that I am actually somewhat impressed that this isnt completely sour.   Seems like most brewers today can’t brew an Imperial Stout that doesn’t sour after a few years.   I opened this thinking I would be pouring most if ot down the drain, but its quite the opposite.   I am totally over analyzing this one because its held up extremely well.   This is one of those gems in the bunch that you never expected.   Damn...

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Draught at Beers in the Plaza. Black with a thick tan head. Toasty grain and dark chocolate aroma. The flavor is dry and toasty with smooth darkly roasted malt and medium hop bitterness. Medium bodied and feels pretty light for an imperial. Definitely on the more drinkable end of the style, and nicely balanced, if not very distinctive.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Dry roasted chocolate covered nuts with mild praline and salt notes. Soft with mild coffee and cocoa on the palate. very delicate and thin for the style. A clean and soft finish.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Draught at the brewpubPretty much black with medium brown head. Very chocolatey aroma with a light nuttiness. Creamy body, with lots of chocolate character. Not much else, really, but it tastes quite nice.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Deep dark stout with a thin moka head. Light chocolate aroma, not intense. In mouth, very strong bitter chocolate, burned coffee, and sharp hops. Astringent. Medium bodied IS with character, and oily mouthfeel, remaining in mouth. Russian River Beer Revival & Barbecue Cook-Off, August 20, 2005.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Eclipse black color. Small head. Aroma is roasty malts, chocolate and vanilla. A medium bodied Imperial Stout. Malts are roasty, chocolate and coffee. Hops are slightly bitter. Nice roasty malts. Very smooth taste. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Tap @ Small Brewers Festival. A dark brown color with a dark brown head. Chocolate and mild dark fruit aroma with a nice malty and chocolate flavor.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Poured a dark black with a small tan head. Light aromas of coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Light coffee taste with slight bitter aftertaste. An OK beer.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: As the foam shot down the sides of teh bottle from underneath the cap which was not yet fully removed, I though, "yep, this one is shot." Quick reflexes managed to get the the bottle to the other side of my narrow kitchen and into the sink with only minor splash damage to the counter and dishwasher near the sink. Still highly carbonated, it took forever to pour what remained of the 12oz bottle into my .75 liter glass. As I waited for the head to subside between pours, I drank the Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout. I was actually afraid to go back to this, fearing that it would be badly infected. Instead, it comes out very nice. The aroma is nice, melon, a hint of fresh grapes, bananas over the mellow warmth of the malt. The flavor is milky, more of the banana esters, chocolate, caramel and just enough coffee and char to be noticed. The beer is quite attractive with it's large, lasting head and dark body, but I have to count off 1 point since you have to wait for it. I'm also counting off for the overcarbonation in the mouthfeel, although after it had been sitting in the glass for an hour it was just creamy instead of overcarbonated.

name: Mount St. Helena Imperial Stout
review: Riveted pockets of pillowy tan head preside over a hazy dark, dark brown body. Aroma of prunes, espresso, grapes, and hazelnut. Flavor is quite smoky, interesting and not off-putting hint of metallicness, tar-like malts. A little bit of bubblegum and a pleasant bitterness help obscure the raucous alcohol taste. Not too bad.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Orange color. Pretty boring pale - not quite English but not hoppy enough to be a decent APA either. Maltss, bitterness, light florals. Meh.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Shaker showing dark amber finger of clean white foam. The nose shows moderate hop intensity of pine and tropical fruits. The palate is light bodied, well carbonated. Clean fresh pine and light ipa bitterness. Just a normal straight forward pale ale.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Backlogged rating thanks to some kind and generous soul. The smell is weak, hops, fruits, and floral. The look is white head, golden in color, and cloudy. The taste is bitterness, hops, and fruit.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: bottle thanks to bhensonb. poured yellow with a white head. aroma was fruity and citrus. flavor was much the same with the addition of raspberry. body was light with high carbonation.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: (12oz bottle, courtesy of ericandersnavy) Pours a hazy yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of florals, citrus, grass, florals, and mango. Flavor of mango, citrus, and grain.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Thanks to ericandersnavy for sharing this bottle. The beer pours a hazy golden color with a large white head. The aroma is pretty bland with some wheat/grain and earthy hops. The flavor is toffee malt with some earthy hop notes. Medium mouthfeel and high carbonation.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: (12oz bottle thanks to ericandersnavy) clear medium yellow with lasting white bubbles and excellent lacing. Nose of honey, oranges, bread, celery and honeydew. Taste of bitter citrus oils, earth, celery, unsweet, hop extract. Soft velvety carbonation with a dry bitter finish.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. poured light amber with a cream head. nose is malts and faint hops. light on the palate, malty flavor, faint hops, smooth finish.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Appears overcarbonated. Pours with a huge white head over a hazy golden body. Aroma of nutshells, grass, husky grain. Taste is grassy, dry and grainy. Fizzy mouthfeel.

name: Mount St. Helena Palisades Pale Ale
review: Pours golden with a massive off-white head and a faint grassy aroma. There ia a thin pale malt flavor and little else.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Backlogged rating thanks to some kind and generous soul.The look is a big, foamy, white head. The smell is wheat, sweet, honey, off. The taste is the same and off.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: bottle thanks to bhensonb. poured clear yellow with a white head. aroma was fruity and bubblegum. flavor was fruity and wheat. light body with high carbonation.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: (12oz bottle, courtesy of ericandersnavy) Pours a clear yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Flavor of citrus, honey, and wheat. Over carbonated.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Thanks to ericandersnavy for sharing this bottle. The beer pours a clear gold color with a large white head. The aroma is heavy on the wheat with not too much else. The flavor is honey, wheat, caramel and toffee malts. Medium mouthfeel and high carbonation.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: (12oz bottle thanks to ericandersnavy) clearish medium yellow with voluminous head of tight bubbles. Nose of wheat, honey, yeast and spices. Taste of unsweet grain, wheat, odd alcohol esters, and spices. Didn’t enjoy the lack of sweetness. Very dry and over-carbonated.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. poured yellow with a white head. nose is honey, wheat, and light fruits. decent on the palate, heavy honey flavor, faint wheat, fruits in the finish.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours with a large white head and a hazed golden body. Aroma of vanilla, fruit, wheat, and very sweet overall. Taste is tea, sweetness, vanilla and orange extract. Lively bubbles, possibly overcarbonated.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Pours clear golden with a massive white head that bubbles away quickly. There is a slightly sour wheat aroma and a nondescript wheat flavor with a bit of honey.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Bottle from Bottle Barn in Santa Rosa, CA. Pours gold with a six finger head. Light sweet aroma with citrus. Medium minus body with sharpish carbonation. Flavor is not all that light, it’s wheaty, with citrus. The honey shows up as everything else washes away. Pretty good for a wheat. Pretty flavorful, that is.

name: Mount St. Helena Honey Wheat Ale
review: Draft in Calistoga during recent West Coast tour. American wheat with a touch of honey - just doesn’t quite cut it for me. Still, the ladies like wheats.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Pours a dark amber color with an off white head. Caramel, toffee, toast, floral, earthy, biscuit and peat aroma and flavors. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Caramel and biscuit finish.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: March 15th, 2013 - Here’s the second beer of the day here at San Diego’s Epic Beer Festival - a malty, Irish red. It’s got the flavor, but not the mouthfeel, weighing a bit too lightly on the palate, and more closely imitating Killian’s Irish Red than a brew with a bit more body. Give this a little more muscle mass and and I’d really dig it, but as it stands it’s a touch too light for my personal preferences.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: vast amount of hops that are present in this beer (given the style). way hoppier than an irish red should be. definitely an "american" red ale, no matter what they call it. the hops and carmel and slightly nutty malts pair well together, and this is indeed a nice session ale. just don’t expect a traditional irish."

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Backlogged rating thanks to some kind and generous soul. The look is amber in color with a white head. The smell is malts, peat, caramel. The taste is cardboard, malts, and ok.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Bomber. This must be aged. Bought it on sale for $1.99/bomber. I’m smelling a little cardboard. Crystal malts are there. Would love to try it fresh.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: A hoppy aroma accompinied with a malty sweetness come from this hazy red ale with almost no off white head. A hoppy bitter dry taste at first with a sweetish malty flavor in the middle with a bitter and alcoholy taste on the aftertaste. Its pretty decent minus the haziness Its light medium bodied with decent carb. Worth a try pretty good.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Pours a thin head on a hazy rust colored body. The aroma is barley and malty all the way through. The taste has a solid malt backbone with moderate lemon bitterness. Good balance. The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation. Enjoyable.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Pours a rich copper penny color with a piney nose aroma. Taste is clean and simple with a grapefruit aftertaste. Notes of earthy pine needles mixed with a floral film left on the palate after the swallow. An slight IPA style finish with a quickly dissipating bitterness. A good Irish Red beer.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Great dark ruby-red color with a head that is even rather orange itself. Hoppy nose dominates malt scent, lot of grapefruit and pine. Taste is super hoppy (more grapefruit and pine, plus orange) for an IRA, which I personally find extremely yummy, but with a robust, earthy caramel malt presence that stands up to the hops very impressively. Very easy to drink. Maybe too hoppy for the a traditional IRA, but a very good offering by Rubicon.

name: Rubicon Irish Red Ale
review: Good sized beige head misty dark brown pour strong carbonation with piney aromas caramel earthiness rich malt yeast character the flavours dryness pine raspy note toffee earthiness good bitter taste good irish this decent body slight creaminess nuts honey chocolate touch the finish best aftertastes earthiness rich malt lingering bitter and piney hop creamy dry taste good ale

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: On nitro tap at the brewery. Pours a deep black with a medium sized tan head. Soft roast on the nose, chocolate, cocoa. Medium bodied, but a touch thin from the nitro. Chocolate, cocoa, roast, soft coffee. Roast into the finish, a touch of bitter bakers cocoa.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: Nice enough stout, nothing unusual though. Very frothy and creamy head, fortunately served in a 20oz glass so there was room for it. On tap at the Rubicon brewpub.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: "a decent example of the style. i thought they served it on nitro, but this one was not. i think it would have been flavorful enough to hold up. Big roasted malt and some chocolate in both the nose and flavor. very dry finish. only a very slight vegetal off note prevents it from a higher score."

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: The aroma is slight but malt is noted. A velvety black pour with thick and lasting tan head providing ample lacing. The taste is overall bitter with notes of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Overall, while the taste is less than robust, it is enjoyable and easy to drink.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: On tap at the brew pub. One finger of tan head on a black body. The smell is all roasted malt. One sided but good. The taste is roasted malt with a mild bitterness. The texture is crisp with low carbonation and medium body. A little disappointing mild flavor and lighter body for a stout. Drinks more like a dark ale than a stout.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: Tap. Pours black with a medium, frothy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and roast malt with dark fruity esters and earthy hops. Flavor is malt dominant with medium hops and bitterness, dark fruity esters and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: On tap at Rubicon for cask night! (From notes) This is a Co2 beer. Aroma is of coffee and roasted notes. Nice dark colour with a great head and lacing. FLavour is surprisingly hoppy! Also has chocolate flavours. This is a very good stout. Definitely west coast or cali style! Palate is a little thin.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: pours black with a malty roasted aroma. Has flavor of light chocolate and a slight touch of coffee.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. It pours dark brown with a tan head. I can see a little light through this one. The aroma is pretty standard with some coffee and cocoa, roasted malt, hint of black licorice. The flavor was the same, although a bit muted. Also, the body was very thin, even for a nitro stout. Roasted malt was very weak. Nothing really wrong with this brew, just a bit substandard if you ask me. I’d stick to their lighter colored beers which are very good.

name: Rubicon Irish Stout
review: Pint on tap at the brewpub. The aroma is mostly sweet with sugary chocolate notes. There also is some roastiness present in the background. Smells good. Moderately transparent dark mahogany body with a fine, nitrogenated light tan head. A little too transparent for my liking. Starts somewhat metallic with scant, sweet choco malts. This then becomes very roasted, burnt, and even ashy with some patent malts. Some anise is also present. Finishes bitter and metallic.

name: Rubicon India Pale Ale
review: Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus fruits some caramel spicy and bitter hops flavor malts citrus pineapple grapefruits spicy and bitter hops

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen - Amber pour with white head. Sweet malty and fruity with some caramel and toffee sweetness, some herbal slight twiggy hoppy nuances into the finish. Okish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Rubicon Amber
review: From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty, caramelish and slight breadish. Dry, toasted and malty. Breadish. Mild herbal. Toasted and dry malty finish.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Draught at Taphouse. Clear orange colored with a small off-white head. Fruity aroma of caramel, bread and hops. Fruity flavor of caramel and hops with notes of grass and bread. Hoppy finish.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Draft. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: From tap at Taphouse. Amber colour with an off-white head. Malt, hops, fruit, caramel and bitterness.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours an almost clear dark amber with a thin white head. Light malt on the, the faintest hint of hops. Medium bodied, a touch of hmalt and grain, a hint of fruity sweetness. Light toast and a soft earthy bitterness into the finish.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Amber colour with frothy head which fades to a light foam. Light fizz with a light bitter aftertaste. (K)

name: Rubicon Amber
review: "a pleasant surprise here, above average for the style. pours dark, almost ruby, like a red ale. well balanced with caramel and nutty malts, and an assertive hop profile. recommended."

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Pours a thin head on a hazy amber colored body. The aroma is grainy and malty. Like a bag of wet barley. The taste is lots of barley, grain with mild lemon bitterness. Great use of the malt side. The texture is softer with moderate carbonation. Here’s an amber ale that’s malt forward. A nice exception to the currently popular bold hoppy amber ales.

name: Rubicon Amber
review: Dark amber color with a khaki colored head. Slight roast character along with toffee, nuts, and caramel. Very grassy hop character, light citrus, and some floral hops. Semi-sweet flavor of toffee, toast, and caramel. A bit of roasted malt and nut, some chocolate, and grassy hops. Light bitterness of pine and citrus rind.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Draft. A hazy light golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has light notes of malt and straw. The flavor is sweet with light notes of malt, leading to a lightly bitter finish. Plain, but nothing wrong.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: On tap at brewpub. Golden colour with small diminishing head. Mild hops aroma with minimal malt undercurrent. Quite enjoyable

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Clear yellow with a fizzy white head. Malty and musty aroma. Sweet vanilla malt and a tangy fruit taste.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Vague hoppy aroma. Light fruity and mild hoppy flavoured. Downplayed malt presence. Mild fruity and subdued bitter finish.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Draft. Golden beer with a whitish head. Light hay aroma. Fruity, light grain flavor. Medium bodied. Fruit, light grain, and light hay lingers.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Tap at the brewpub: Very pale yellow effervescent pour. Nice saaz aroma- crisp, grassy with a light crackery malt background. Light body with a dry flavor. A bit thin with a mild crackery pilsner base followed by grassy/restrained saaz charcter. What’s present in this beer is good, there’s just not quite enough body nor bitterness. Solid though. Many of this places beers are underrated.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus aroma. Fruity malty and slightly grainy flavor with some light hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Draught at the brewpub Pale golden with a brief, white head. Weak, slightly citric aroma. Dry and flowery hoppiness with a rather high bitterness.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Tap @ SFBC. Clear yellow color, short head. Bit skunky pils aroma. Slight bitter, grainy. Ok for a pilsener.

name: San Francisco Albatross Lager
review: Blonde with light film of head. Slightly tannic grain aroma. Light dank, grainy flavor that is unsatisfying and becomes increasingly tannic-sour on the finish.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Draft. A pale amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel as well as lighter notes of fruit - but in a lager? The flavor is sweet malty with light notes of caramel and bread, leading to a dry and lightly bitter finish. Nothing special.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: On Tap at Brewpub. Golden colour, with minimal white head. Discreet aroma, but an easy drinking lager.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Mild fruity aroma. Roasted malt flavoured, overripe fruity. Subdued sweetness and bitterness. Lingering roasted malt flavour into the far finish.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Draft. Amber beer with a whitish head. Light toasty aroma. Malt and light caramel flavor with a light fruitiness. Medium bodied. Caramel lingers with light mineral notes.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Tap at the brewpub: Rich golden color with a white film of head. Toasted malt nose, some evident Vienna and biscuity/bready notes. Light-medium bodied. Firm malt flavor- lightly toasted with a vegetal note. Clean overall with mild hop presence. Toasted bready finish. A decent session.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a malty grainy aroma with some hoppy hints. Sweetish malty grainy bready flavor. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: clear amber body, no head, sweet malt nose, sweet malt body, mildly bitter, very good, just what i was looking for, well done, nicely balanced big lager, nearly bockish, a well rounded vienna though, tasty

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Draught at the brewpub Golden with a white head. Grassy, nutty hoppiness. Thin body and very weak aroma.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Tap @ SFBC. Hazy orange amber color, short head. Aroma of some hop, bit toasty, caramel. Slight bitter taste, caramelly.

name: San Francisco Emperor Norton Lager
review: Bronze-amber with light head. Easy drinking with a light graininess. Slight sour and cardboard finish.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: On tap @ brewpub. Pours a deep black color with a foamy tan head. A slight sweetness lurks behind the otherwise hoppy &#40for the style&#41 aroma. Light bodied and easy drinking, with hints of licorice and malt. Good bitter bite, not a bad offering.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: Dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Sweet molasses and coffee syrup aroma. Like my wife. Concommitent taste. And attitude. Could be better. Like my marriage.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: black body, biggest head in the brewery (meaning it actually has one), roasty chocolate flavors, dry and well balanced, certainly the best ale that I had at the brewery, very light on the palate while still maintaing a rich source of dark malt flavor, dry, a very nice stout indeed

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: Draught at the brewpub Dark brown with a small, tan head. A lot of cocoa and milky chocolate. Pretty burnt with a slightly too thin body.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: Sampled at SFBC, June 2007. Muddy, opaque dark brown with a beige head. Nice roasty mocha-laden nose. Bold and flavorful. Full chocolate, rock-solid caramel sweetness, mocha, coffee, light soil and a hint of roastiness. Medium smooth body with mild, fine-beaded carbonation. My favorite of the SFBC’s beers I’ve sampled.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: One of the very best of the West Coast stouts. Available only on tap at the brewery in San Francisco.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: Enjoyed a few pints of this one at the brewpub on a trip back to San Francisco, CA in July of 06. This beer was the most enjoyable of the beers I sampled, and a good version of Irish/dry stout. This beer pours to a jet black color, with a thick, creamy, white head, and a soft carbonation. The nose on this beer is nice, with some good dark chocolate, coffee, and light roast aromas. The palate is soft and fat on the tongue with good dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted barley flavor. The beer finishes with more good dark malt and coffee flavor up front, then ends roasty, dry, and pleasingly bitter. A decent pint of stout.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: no great surprise that the stout turned out to be this place´s best offering, but that´s not saying much. lightly lactic in a way that reminded me of sweetened german dark beers, chemicals and barbecue sauce

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: Tap@San Francisco Brewery. Roasted, sweet choc/caramel and mild bitterness, sweet and thin. Not much point.

name: San Francisco Alcatraz Stout
review: A nice dark color with little to no head. Much stronger taste than the Porter, somewhat bitter, and the aroma smelled like a little bit of Jack Daniel's.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Draft. A murkcy chestnut brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, and caramel - not very porter like. The flavor is sweet with an acidic edge from the roasted malt, combined with notes of sweet malt, caramel, and alcohol, leading to a dry alcoholic finish. Where is the roasted malt?

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark deep amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt, light yeasty note. Roasted malty and slight caramelish flavoured. Medium dry and bitter flavoured finish.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Cask. Dark mahogony beer with a dark cream colored. head. Malt and light roast aroma. Caramel/toffee flavor with light coffee. Medium bodied. Caramel and toffee lingers with light roast, light coffee, and very light frutiiness.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Tap at the brewpub: Deep copper brown with a lacing off white head. Mild toasted aroma with a touch of sweet crystal malt. Mildly carbonated and creamy. Nutty, freshly malty flavor with a chocolaty note. Has a light toasted malt back. Solid, feels British.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and coffee aroma. Roasted malty chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate finish.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Tap @ SFBC. Clear dark color, short head. Aroma of coffee, cardboard. Soft roasted coffee taste. Not a good porter.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Black-brown molasses colored with ring of head. Caramel and roasted notes contribute to aromatic balance. Decent roast flavor with caramel complexity. Well-balanced and nicely nuanced.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Sampler at the brewpub. Dark brown body with a small tan head. The aromas are sweet and roasty. The flavour had hints of chocolate, smoke and roasted malts. I say hints, because this had a disappointingly light touch, and the flavours seemed more shadows than reality.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Draught at the brewpub. Clear dark brown, small head. Sweet and salty with rounded dense mouthfeel. Roasty with some licorice, fruity and quite syrupy. Salty finish. Light flavoured and lacking in malt firmness.

name: San Francisco Gripmans Porter
review: Draft at SFBC. Very small tan head that quickly dissipated, mostly opaque, no visible carbonation and a dark brown hue with a red tint. Nose was chocolate, malty and roasty. Ditto for the flavor along with a burnt taste. Smooth mouthfeel and light body. Disappointing for the style as it lacked character and the flavor was "just there". Did not leave me wanting more. Much better out there of this style to be had.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Draft. A hazy amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has light notes of hops and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, malt, and straw as well as lighter notes of hop and grapefruit, leading to a bitter finish. The body is light.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: On Tap at Brewpub. Orange in colour, with a small white head. A definite malt aroma of caramel.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Clear dark yellow with a fizzy white head. Faint malty aroma with a brassy metallic orange taste.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Light hops fruity and bitter aroma. Smooth malt flavoured, light fruity and bitter flavoured. Medium dry and fruity hops finish, light bitterness.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Draft. Amber beer with an off-white head. Light malt aroma. Grainy flavor with light mineral notes. Medium-light bodied. Grain lingers with light mineral and light hay.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Tap at the brewpub: Deep orange with a white ring of head. Malty nose with some caramelized notes, bread crust and mild vegetal character. A touch over carbonated with a toasted pale malt flavor; some carapils notes as well. A bit of vegetal comes through. Mildly hopped. Run of the mill.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a malty caramel aroma with some hoppy hints. Sweetish malty caramel flavor with some hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty caramel finish.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Tap @ SFBC. Clear orange color, short head. Some hop and malt in aroma. BIt fruity and malty. Ok balance. Decent ale.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Clear copper color. This batch was definitely filtered. Head was thin and white and left no lace. Smelled of light brown sugar and caramel with a hint of grain husk. Flavor was similar, but without the huskiness detected in the aroma. There was also a hint of dried cherry.

name: San Francisco Pony Express Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy unfiltered dark gold with a sizeable frothy white head. Aroma is slightly floral with a bit of finishing hops, but not much. Flavor is mild and uninteresting. Gypsum is the dominant taste. Carbonation is low as this is a fairly flat beer.

name: San Francisco Grace Darling Bock
review: Draft at SFBC. Small tan head that was mostly lasting, no lacing, transparent, no carbonation, and a brown hue. Nose was malty and slight roasty. Flavor was malty, watery and thin tasting. Mouthfeel was smooth, watery and thin. Light body. Totally missed the mark on this one for the style. Extremely disappointing since this is one of my favorite styles. Was really looking forward to this one, and was greatly let down.

name: San Francisco Grace Darling Bock
review: This draft brew from the brewery poured a head of finely sized bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a transparent softly carbonated . The mild aroma was brown malt. The mouth feel was semi-flat. The flavor contained notes of malt and sweet. An OK brew just nothing special.

name: San Francisco Grace Darling Bock
review: Mahogany dark amber color with lacing and white head. Smell of dark malt mostly. A touch of bitterness, toasty malt, but a bit watery though, and light coffee flavors even. Different for a bock, I thought, and ok, but nothing to get too excited about.

name: San Francisco Grace Darling Bock
review: Draft. Bronze with an off-white head. Lots of diacytle. Medium body. Just skip it. PLEASE - just skip it.

name: San Francisco Grace Darling Bock
review: Clear golden coloured body with a very thin white head. Aroma of coriander seed, wheat, malt and some slight sugars (caramel mostly). Light to Medium-bodied; Nice malty flavour with some good sweetness throughout. Aftertaste clean with malt and a tiny bit of hops. Fairly standard-nothing special-but still a treat in San Fran! I sampled this pint from draught at the San Francisco Brewing Company in downtown San Francisco, California on the second day of 10-June-2004...our first was spent in Sydney, Australia.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: ...draft, at the shithole. What a poor excuse for beer. Served at room temperature, with hints of chemicals, dirty dishwater, and ass. The lemon slice was the best part of this "beer" that was so utterly horrible, I didn’t even want to finish it. Complete shit.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Sampler at the brewpub. A murky yellow body with a thin white head. Tons of banana in both the aroma and the taste. This is a very fruity beer, and I think the sweetness would not be as pleasant over a whole pint. A very decent brew though. I agree with a previous rater that this a hefe. Its like a paler clone of the denison’s wheat beer, which tops that category.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Draught at the brewpub. Cloudy yellow with minimal head. Evident lemon aroma from the lemon sliced it was served with. Sweet with some light banana esters. A bit fruity with some yeast, dough and vanilla, rounded mouthfeel. Thirst quenching.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Decent hef here. Really shouldn’t be in the wheat category, this is definitely a HEF. Pours hazy golden with a thin head. Aroma is lots of spicy cloves and maybe a little banana (but not much). Smooth mouthfeel.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Draft at SFBC. Small off-white head that was mostly lasting, minimal amount of lacing, minimal amount of lacing, cloudy, no visible carbonation, and a straw yellow hue. Nose was sweet, spicy, clove and bananas. Ditto for the flavor with a dry finish. Smooth, dry mouthfeel. Light body. Quaffable for the style, nicely balanced and a refreshing brew on a beautiful, sunny SF Saturday afternoon.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Sampled at SFBC, June 2007. I would classify this as a hefe due to the yeast strain used. Classic cloudy golden with a white head. Banana, clove and herbal-ness in the nose. Flavor is light with notes of banana, lemon, citrus and wheat. Moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Light body with subtle carbonation. Solid.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Listed as Andromeda Hefeweizen and tasted like one, this draft brew from the brewery poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a and a fair lacing. The nice aroma was malty and banana. The smooth mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The good flavor contained notes of malt and banana. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: Pale hazy yellowish pour. Taste was what you’d expect from a hefeweizen to me, and was clovey. I thought it was boring, and average, and not different from every other standard wheat I’ve had. blah.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: On draught. Tasted during trip to California. Cloudy golden colour with a nice head. Sad that they pu lime in tha glass. Little wheat aroma, and ofcause lime. Very average wheat flavour. Overall a very common wheat beer.

name: San Francisco Andromeda Wheat
review: A nice yellow color with minimal head served with a lemon. Nice crisp and very smooth. Not much taste except the lemon. Kind of light.

name: San Francisco Anniversary Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub Amber with a white head. Flowery hoppiness with mild toffee. Some light chocolate and licorice as well. Dry, medium bitterness.

name: San Francisco Anniversary Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. The bartender described this as an ESB. Dark, dark amber- more of a reddish brown. Has a faint aroma of fruit. The flavor is WOW! Plums, raisins, figs. The mouthfeel is low alcohol for such a big beer. Yummy in the nutty flavor.Has a roasted medicine-like finish. This brew has some good complexities and must age really well. A shame they don’t bottle it.

name: San Francisco Anniversary Ale
review: Deep red amber to brown ale with no head. Sweet malt with vinous notes and light hops. Very sweet malt with light bitterness, short in mouth, and with nutty raisiny notes. Very short in mouth. Not bad. On tap at SFBC, August 2005.

name: San Francisco Anniversary Ale
review: Tap. Mahogany color with a laced white head. Good malty character with a little chocolate and toast. Smooth and enjoyable.

name: Devenish Brown Ale
review: 275ml bottle from Shropshire. Vintage 1983. Creamy carbonation. Creamy texture. Soy sauce. Vegetation. Some malt. A certain warm sogginess. Faint cardboard. Medicine. Some sulphur. Drinking an eggy damp fart in a cardboard box. Inhaling the month old fumes of an extinct volcano in the rain. Hmm. This isn’t the best of the brown ales I’ve had.

name: San Francisco Christmas Cheer
review: dark dense body, no head, minimum carbonation, flavor is allspice, that’s it, no real malt body, just carbonation and allspice

name: San Francisco Christmas Cheer
review: Draft. Mahogony beer with a dark cream colored head. Light spice aroma with some malt. Christmas spice (mostly cinnamon) flavor with some malt and backing light berry. Medium body. Cinnamon and malt lingers with again a bit of berry fruitiness.

name: San Francisco Christmas Cheer
review: Sampler at the brewpub. A rich, red-brown colour with a tan head. Dark fruit aroma. Sweet, malty flavours, with notes of chocolate, and the alcohol evident. Very smooth on the palate. This is a good winter seasonal, but after flying in from somewhere with a lot of snow to mild California, it seemed out of place!

name: San Francisco Christmas Cheer
review: Draught at the brewpub. Cloudy dark mahogany, small head. Vague yellow plum aroma. Sweet and malty with medium to full body. Drying salty finish, Warming, but a bit neutral.

name: San Francisco Christmas Cheer
review: tap at the pub. Pours a dark brown with a large light brown head. Aroma of malt and a hint of chocolate. Flavor is slightly sweet and a bit cloying. Not much in terms of hop undertones. It is somehat similar to the Gripman’s Porter.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Labeled as a brown ale. Labeled here as an APA. I'd say a cross or somewhere in between. Appearance is semi-cloudy light brown. Balance is more on the hoppy side, but good caramel malt content. I am liking all of the Hebrews. Sampled a single first, but would get a 6 of this.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Visual: (cellared for 4 years). Pours clear brown with no significant head, thin hazy ringed retention, some bubbles here and there, minor lacing. Nose: sweet nutty caramel malts (lvl-5)-pungency Attack: crisp-thicker mouthfeel Mid-palate: tingly CO2, toasted barley malts, bready-biscuity (lvl-5-sweetness) Finish: background gentle bitter hops, mild sour-tangy astringency. Summary: A good thick mouthfeel akin to their other beers, but this one having some astringency in the background and emerging in the finish. A bit above average.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Dark orange hazy and no head. Flavor is bland but not infected or tart sour acidic just and real nothing brew. Good cold on fishing trip I guess.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Rated from old notes. An easy going amber ale with a pleasant if non-distinctive taste. Poured with a foamy head that rapidly dissipated. Hints of malts, but for the most part rather bland. Best had with food.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Pours a hazy dark golden orange color with apricot edges and a one finger white head that quickly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Spotty lacing left behind. Slightly earthy floral hop aroma with hints of pine needle and fresh cut grass countered by caramel malt sweetness, toffee, and biscuit. Kind if bland without much else going on. One dimensional hop profile and the malt presence is stronger than I prefer. Light bodied with delicate hop bitterness that lingers over the sweet malt backbone into a slightly dry finish. Light and easy to drink but not very complex or interesting. Dry, grassy bitterness countered by caramel malt, biscuit, toffee and a touch of dark fruit. Hop profile is one dimensional but has decent flavor. Malt presence is stronger than I prefer but provides some needed balance. Sessionable but kind of boring.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Slight hazy amber color with a big soapy head. Strong burnt caramel malt aromas with a touch of pepper and honey. Bitter on the palate and not very well-balanced. Leans toward the bitter side. Malts are there but seem burned and astringent. Finish is bitter and astringent.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: I don’t know about this one. It’s not very good and just a pain to describe. It’s basically a bad amber ale. The flavors are kind of weird and I can’t decide if this is a novelty beer or not. I don’t think it is. It’s kind of malty.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: far more bitter than malty. a good, complex beer for the style, but it comes off just a bit harsh. like i said, more bittering hops, and maybe not enough citrusy high floral aroma hops. pretty good still."

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Definitely more of an amber than a hoppy pale ale. Awful pour, tons of head with no lacing. Lots of malt flavours. Meh.

name: He'Brew Genesis Ale
region: Clifton Park, New York, United States
review: Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a decent amber/red color with a slight transparency to it. The head was about a finger’s worth of white foaminess that dissipated within less than a minute. The smell had some crisp caramel malts coming through in a slightly dry sort of way. The taste was fairly sweet through the malts. On the palate, this one sat fairly light and had a fairly good sessionability about it. Overall, this was a decent Amber ale as its nothing to go bonkers about.

name: Southern California Screaming Lobster Lager
review: Clouded pale yellowy appearance, Heaily carbonated, moderate head formation. Malty, honey aroma, slightly skunked (albeit sold at the source). Sweet malty palate, not much bite. Unspectacular.

name: Southern California Buckhorn Bock Beer
review: Pretty good stuff. The higher alcohol content packs a punch that would cause you not to want to drink too many, but for a bock beer, this was decent. I'd have rated it higher, but bock beers just aren't really my thing..

name: Hofbrau Premium Light Beer
review: Straw yellow color with a grainy aroma. Flavor of grain and malt. Not much of a difference between this and the regular lager.

name: Ayinger Maibock
review: Golden color. Perfumy, apricot, bready, sweet maltiness in the nose. Full bodied. Modest bitterness. Smooth and rounded.

name: Ayinger Maibock
review: Bottle, 0.5l. Clear golden/copper pour, three finger frothy white head, long lasting. Thick lacing on the glass. Malty nose, a bit liquory, grassy and grainy notes. Medium body, soft carbonation. Smoth mouthfeel, chewy texture. Pleasant on the tongue, goes down nicely. Sweet malty taste, subtle alcohol bitterness in the background, nicely balanced. Simple aroma but works well. Caramel malt, wheat, grains, grass. Bready, mild peppery. Lingering alcohol notes. Sweet and slightly sticky. Short to medium finish, dry. Good one.

name: Ayinger Maibock
review: Bottle from Alko. Pours really clear golden color. Aroma of malts, bread, grain, herbal and fruity hops. Mediumish body, quite mellow and strong taste.

name: Pacific Rim Peacock Spit Pale Ale
Birra Moretti
review: Wygl¹d: Idealnie klarowne, s³omkowe. Piana jest idealna lagerowa. Aromat: Bardzo s³odowe, delikatny DMS, nic po za tym. Smak: Te¿ s³odowy, trochê kartonowa goryczka. Niskie wysycenie . Ogólnie: Eurolager jakich wiele, tyle ze z W³och.

name: Birra Moretti
review: Világos ,áttetszõ szín ,szinte semmi hab.Jellegtelen illat.Tolakodóan kesernyés íz ,erõs szájhatás.Olasz Borsodi megfeleloje. Az édes és keserû kontrasztja jellemzi.

name: Birra Moretti
review: classica birra industriale, sentori di lattina, mais cotto e verdura cotta.

name: Birra Moretti
review: Kolor z³oty, klarowny. Piana bia³a, sk¹pa, szybko opada. Nos: chmiel, stêch³y s³ód, trawa, Paszcza: mokry karton, di acetyl, wytrawne, œladowa goryczka, nasycenie œrednie. Ogólnie jest to przeciêtny

name: Birra Moretti
review: Pours golden with thin white head, medium carbonation. Taste has a lemon and orange taste. Finish is bready malts. As far as Macro lager go, decent.

name: Birra Moretti
review: [Butelka b.d.] Barwa jasnoz³ota, klarowne. Piana œrednia, œrednio pêcherzykowa. W smaku i aromacie klasyczny lager, nawet niez³e. Goryczka niska, nasycenie œrednie.

name: Birra Moretti
review: 660ml bottle brewed in UK at 4.6%. Decent, fairly long-lasting head. Pale, washed-out lemon/straw colour. Medium carbonation. Grassy aroma. Brewed by Heineken, and isn't too dissimilar to Heineken, hop extract and all. A little lemony and grassy hop taste, then some somewhat-savoury malt, and that's your lot. A straightforward lager that manages not to offend the palate - nothing exciting for the beer lover, but could be so much worse. Not bad at all with a meal.

name: Birra Moretti
review: # 350; 7/2016. Naprosto pøíšerná vùnì. Chu obilná až rejžová. Žádná sláva, ale s ohledem na styl dobrý.

name: Birra Moretti
review: 33cl bottle from Delhaize Chazal in Brussels. F: medium, white, quick gone. C: gold, clear. A: malty, bit bready, caramel and grassy touch. T: medium malty base, bit grassy, caramel touch, sterile bitterness, bit bready, medium carbonation, no expectations here of course for good beer.

name: Birra Moretti
review: Orgasmic, really tiggled my Gooch, would highly recommend, 660 ml bottle can't go wrong, €3.33 in weaterspoons with a employee discount, all in all its a nice tall beer you can have at any time, breakfast lunch or dinner a bitta birra morretti will hit you in all the right spots,

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: From old tasting notes. Bright yellow gold color. Fluffy white head. Tart, malty nose. Dryish malt flavor hints at grain. Clear and crisp. Refreshing and drinkable.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: I found this in the back of my cellar behind some aging Lost Coast Eight Ball. Not sure how long it has been there or when I got it but if must be over three years old. Poured gold with almost no head. Nose of stale malts and floral hops. Fizzy mouthfeel. Flavor was bland. I suspect this was a crappy beer to begin with, and made no better or worse by age. I wonder if this was something Trader Joes once sold.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: (12 oz bottle: Wine Time in La Jolla, CA) Oh my God, look what I found in the 99 cent section of the beer cooler in this place. This store is always good for finding some obscure, retired, (supposedly) crappy beer, and that’s what I’m expecting with this beer too. Okay, well it pours a hazy, medium golden color, so that’s darker than I expected, but there’s also some nasty-looking brown sediment that’s not precipitating out of the beer. The head is small and whitish in color, but it is managing to hold onto a thin, partial layer atop the beer. It smells like a pretty awful lager that’s seen too many years in the bottle, which of course is entirely appropriate. But at least the flavor isn’t hideous. Well, actually, it’s pretty bad. It’s mostly just cheaply grainy, but also lightly sweet, strangely spicy, and a slight bit earthy. Body is light, but not crisp because of the age. Sorry for some disappointing news, but I think I bought the only bottle of this rare gem, so there’s no need for my local buddies to run over any grannies trying to get this beer.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is hazy medium yellow, particles of all sizes, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (cookie), lightly hoppy (flowers). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter, slightly husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. A bit grainy in the finish, and the sourness isn't to my liking, but the aroma is pleasantly malty and floral. Reminds me of a cream ale...smells/looks like an ale, tastes/feels like a lager.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: Sugary, "cake-frosting" nose. Cloudy, murky-gold with floaties - not inline stylistically. Very little head. Soft and sweet malt with chocolate-chip cookie dough flavors. Mild carbonation. Slight bite of hops in the middle. Semi-dry finish; chewy sweetness lingers - raw bread flavors. Overall, seemed "green" and unbalanced.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: Faint metallic aroma. Weak and thin but refreshing. No real flavor. Slightly bitter on the aftertaste. Overall, a boring beer.

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: Had this a Peculier Pub in NYC. A forgettable Aussie lager.................

name: Razor Edge Australian Style Lager
review: not a beer that sticks out, a very plane item...............................

name: Dorada Draft
review: Dégustée le 2019-05-13 .

name: Dorada Draft
review: Good beer for in the summer. Light, malt, refreshing taste like a radler but 4.4%. Good with light meals.

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle in La Havana, Cuba. Really hot in here, i liked thid beer because it’s really refreshing, it taste like radler

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle, medium bubbly head, clear pale yellow color, very light malty aroma with a bit of skunk flavor of honey and some lemon sourness, just a little watery. Drinkable but really simple.

name: Dorada Draft
review: Pours pale yellow with no head, aroma of fruits, rice, acidity, flavor of rice, corn, sweetness, light bodied

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle. Clear pale yellow with small foamy white head, very faint malt aroma, high carbonation, very little bitterness, weak and watery body. abrupt finish. Not good at all.

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle in Guatemala City. Paler and yellower than other Guatemalan lagers, I actually liked it less, even less flavour and more of a corny sweet skunky thing going on.

name: Dorada Draft
review: 330 ml Dorado Draft Edícíon Especial - A limited edition fancy wrap around label on the bottle could no hide the otherwise carbonated watery taste. Very weak on taste, palate and aroma. Little to dislike but even less to describe.

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Thanks DSG. Very light yellow with no head. The aroma is skunky, floral with notes of corn sugar and urine. Sweetish flavor, sugary, skunky, light bitterness, watery. Moderate carbonation, light-bodied.

name: Dorada Draft
review: Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks mom for this bottle! Pale watery golden color. Very skunky aroma with hay and graininess. Slightly sweetish flavor, grainy, with skunk, and a faint bitter-sourish note. Light-bodied.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Dégustée le 2019-03-26 -

name: Monte Carlo
review: Bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, Jan 19. Thanks Simon for this. Pours clear gold, small white head. Aroma is corn, sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt, cardboard, corn. Not too bad. There are worse.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Green bottle share between four of us at the Jan 2019 Shrewsbury Beer Exchange group meeting; cheers to Simon's dad for sourcing this one. Poured a light golden colour, clean and clear, on top a decent enough white crown that tried to linger for a while. Fairly sweet in nature with not a lot of hop action going on, but a better beer that I was expecting.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Tasted on 23.11.17. Small head disappearing to thin layer. Clear light golden colour. Weak malty aroma with hints of basement. Unpleasant malty sweetness with no bitterness.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Bottle in La Havana, Cuba. Common Lager, with nothing special. Halped refresh on the Malecon

name: Monte Carlo
review: (12oz bottle) AROMA: a little floral and honey, sweet malt, hint of pils hops, smells a german-ish. APPEARANCE: pale straw yellow, light white head that fades quickly, clear, good carbonation. TASTE: sweet corn and a little tropical fruit, a touch of barley and coffee, hints of Bavarian Pils, some dryness on finish. PALATE: light and crisp, more body than your average mass market lager, some bitterness on finish in the cheek/throat. OVERALL: a very non-American style lager, more flavor and substance than what you’re probabaly used to from pale lagers, no bad flavors, I’m surprised at the low ratings.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Bottle. Clear pale yellow with very small frothy white head, sweetish bread aroma, high carbonation, very little malt taste, weak watery body, abrupt finish. Slightly more tasty than water.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Butelka 0,33l, dziêki Lechu. Kolor jasnoz³oty, piana nik³a. Zapach lekki trawiasty. Smak gorzki, bez wyrazu.S³abe piwo.

name: Monte Carlo
review: Yet another example of brand proliferation from the mighty Cerveceria Centro Americana, this one appears to be a premium brand commanding roughly a 5 quetzal premium over Gallo. Not worth it. Tastes of nothing really, ever so slightly sweet.

name: Monte Carlo
review: 355 ml bottle - Monte Carlo is quite hard to describe. Firstly I’ve had water with stronger tastes than this but despite its lack of taste, non-existent aroma and palate it is actually refreshing. Sampled twice now in 27-34c Guatemalan heat, it is really refreshing. Perhaps looking at it purely from a domestic market it makes sense, and on top of this it is actually sold as a more premium alternative to the mainstream Gallo. Having said that the Gutemalans I’ve asked prefer either Gallo Ice or Moza to Monte Carlo.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: Bottle from Beers Of Europe. Hazy golden body with a white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of straw, white pepper and coriander. Flavour of grass, underripe pear and pithy lemon. Thin body with a slick texture. Very fizzy. Crisp and clean.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: 500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.1%. Dull murky orange, not too much yeast in suspension even with the lot poured in. Citrus, banana and wheat aroma, melded together. Smallish so-so lasting head. Moderate-medium carbonation. Citrus hops, bit of pear as well as banana in the yeast, and nice lingering nuanced wheat malt to round off. Fairly light body for a weissbier, but still has just enough of that foamy mouthfeel to deliver the goods. If you want plenty of flavour but not Erdinger-style super foamy mouthfeel, this is your bag. Ayinger as usual make a distinctive variant of a style while resolutely ticking all that style's boxes. Quality brew, if perhaps with not quite as much body as some fans of the style would prefer; it certainly doesn't fall short on flavour.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: Der Geruch erinnert mich etwas an Most. Geschmacklich fruchtig, spritzig. Eine angenehme bittere Note fällt auf, die einen schönen Gegenpol zur vorhanden Süße bildet. Das Bier bietet außerdem einen guter Kompromiss zwischen Süffigkeit und Substanz. Guter Stoff.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: Cloudy golden, creamy ivory head. Gentle banana smell, light spicy, maybe some paper but clean otherwise. The taste is a pretty regular clean but not outstanding weizen with a touch of cardboard. Ok.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: W aromacie goŸdzik, lekko kwaskowy, pszeniczny, banan, przyjemny. Barwa ciemno¿ó³ta, piana ³adna. W smaku pó³wytrawne, goŸdzik, bardzo przyjemnie zbalansowane. Jak te Niemce maj¹ takie weizeny to nie dziwie siê siê ¿e krafcik nie hula.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: slucajno u izlasku na pivo u grad svratimo u lokal gdje nikad nije bilo craft piva i nadjemo ovo pivo ... neocekivano .. posto nisam ljubitelj psenicnog piva tako mi se ovo pivo nije svidjelo ...pivo mi je preslatko ..nisam zadovoljan ...

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: Bottle. Pale cloudy yellow/orange with a massive white head. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat, honey and yeast. Taste is citrus fruits, wheat, banana and clove. Slightly herbal and spicy with a distinctive bitterness. Medium to strong carbonation. A little bit watery. It's alright and really süffig but not my favorite Weizen.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: Bottle at home. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma of banana, clove. Taste is medium sweet, wheat, banana, clove.

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: I never tire of drinking a good Weizen. This time the honors were for Ayinger Bräuweisse. The first impression is that the beer isn't that yeast-cloudy. And the usual large foam head didn't make her appearance. The smell was a typical weizen though and the taste... It is a good one!

name: Ayinger Bräuweisse
review: aromat bardzo dobry balans gozdzika i banana, slodki ale wlasnie przelamany fenolami. Miekkie, lekki, slodowy lekko kwasny. bdb

name: Ayinger Oktober Fest-Märzen
review: Served on keg, the Grove, Huddersfield, bronze coloured lager, with thin white head, (nice lacing on the glass), slightly toffee in aroma and taste. Does not taste it's strength.

name: Ayinger Oktober Fest-Märzen
review: Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Total Wine & More, Burlington. Appearance is clear light orange/amber with beautiful sparkle, finger-width off-white foamy head with fair retention and no lacing. Aroma is wheat cracker, toffee and pear. Taste follows aroma. Mouthfeel is light side of light-to-medium bodied with mostly smooth but late frothy texture, soft-to-average carbonation and finish as taste with lingering sweet malts over mild bitter. Overall, about as interesting as this style can get and certainly well made.

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: Dirty brown with a frothy head. Smell of banana and clove. Unbalanced taste with an acidity peak. Medium carbonation, banana aftertaste.

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: 500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.8%. Good-sized decent-duration head. Very dark murky orange, almost tan. Pretty focused aroma, citrus hops fused firmly with some wheat rusk with some yeast fruitiness underneath it all - slightly smoky, even. Moderate carbonation, fading fairly soon. Somewhat dark citrus orange hop notes, slightly muted but recognisable banana yeast joining them with a firm and tasty rusk wheat/barley brown bread-crust malt combination that underpins the beer and lends it a character distinct from a non-dunkel hefeweizen; there's a pretty tight flavour profile and while all flavours are good, none quite get to sing as I'd like - in particular the malt keeps its head down while it's working. Good creamy body, almost chewy, so it is perhaps the mirror of Ayinger's Brauweisse which is high on flavour but perhaps a tad thin for some drinker's tastes - not that either could be said to have poor flavour or body, mind. Don't let me make you think this beer lacks flavour - it doesn't - but it's just somewhat to-the-point for a style that can be so indulgent at its best.
