If you're not concerned with flavour developing lengthily on the palate, or demanding of a broad taste profile, this may be a perfect weissbier in your book, especially if you like its more compact, darker, slightly caramelesque malt than the typical lighter and airier offering. For me it's just a little tight, or to-the-point, even if only somewhat - I want it to stretch its legs and indulge damn it! Then again, that's only because it has such good flavours to begin with, so I can't exactly rate it poorly. You should definitely let this one stand a while and lose most of its chill for maximum flavour - perhaps even eschew chilling it at all if in cold climes...

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: Dark orange in colour. Smell and taste of banana. Quite good. Will recommend this. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: 500 ml bottle from Whole Foods, pours cloudy dark orange brown. Medium body. Banana cloves and caramel aroma. Yeasty banana malty taste, with sweet malt finish.

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: Erinnert an die helle Variante "Bräuweisse". Der Geruch hat etwas von Most, allerdings mit dominanten Malznoten. Geschmacklich fruchtig, spritzig, süffig - deutlich malzbetonter, mehr Substanz und runder als die helle Variante. Eine bittere Note fällt auf - die ist sogar noch stärker als bei der hellen Variante ist (noch angenehm - mehr dürfte aber nicht sein). Erwähnenswert: Sehr stramme 5,8 % Alk. - hier wird die helle Version deutlich übertroffen. Gefällt mir sehr gut, sogar besser als die bereits sehr ordentliche helle Variante

name: Ayinger Urweisse
review: On tap at the Tap House, Aying, Saturday 12th October 2019 in company of Dad, and Pauline before we headed off to meet Jonas at the Oxen racing. Pours hazy warm, gold with a large white head. I have to confess to rather rushing this as we wanted to head off but it was enjoyable, Fresh and clean wheaty with a fruity linger. Good.

name: Sierra Madre Ice House Lager
review: Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet malty aroma with hints caramel. Sweet malty flavour with grainy and cardboard notes.

name: Stoddards Pale Ale
review: Date: 08/16/1998 Source: Brewfest, San Jose dark yellow, light hop aroma and flavor, touch of lingering bitterness, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Stoddards Pale Ale
review: Quite pale in color with medium head. This beer just didn’t do it for me. Subtle hops, subtle malt, sublte alcohol. Everything about this one was just a bit to subtle. It’s not bad, but there’s just nothing good about it.

name: Stoddards Pale Ale
review: Colored a golden yellow with a lacy white head, the Pale Ale was quite attractive in the glass. Subtle bitter aroma. Hoppy and light flavor with a bit of a zing to it. Mild bitter leave. (submitted from the restaurant via my Treo)

name: Stoddards Pale Ale
review: Arrived in Sunnyvale on the 17th, and headed straight to Stoddards based on a recommendation from the kind peeps in the Ratebeer forum. This would have been my "desert" selection. This brew pours from the tap a light sparkling amber with a very thin white head. Something on the glass must have offended the lacing because it didn't show up for the party. The nose is faint citrus and spruce. The taste is mostly floral and toasty with a very british feel. Could use some dried fruit tones in the finish. The palate is medium to full, dry and lively. The finish feels chalky.

name: Stoddards Pale Ale
review: Tap. Medium golden color. Crisp malt and hop aroma. Slightly bitter and grainy. Good malt aftertaste.

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Pours a deep brown color with thin head. Lots of sweet carmel malt in this one, not that bitter. Tastes a bit more like a brown ale to me. Not bad.

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Medium orange color. Small head. Aroma is fruity and sweet. A medium bodied ESB. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are slightly bitter and citrusy. Nicely balanced, medium bitter ESB. Touches of orange and citrus. Nice session beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean, crisp and dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Draft. It's a beautiful reddish-brown color with a nice head. Lightly bitter and easy to drink. Sweet malt backbone with some fruitiness to it.

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Poured a nice dark amber with a creamy tan head that lasted quite some time. Subtle hoppy aroma with hints of sweetness to it. SMOOTH subtle flavor that just creeps up on you. Hoppy taste with overtones of wood and honey. Excellent beer.

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Arrived in Sunnyvale on the 17th, and headed straight to Stoddards based on a recommendation from the kind peeps in the Ratebeer forum. My first selection was this brew. Pours from the tap a medium copper. The fizzy white head is mostly diminishing with fair lacing. The meek nose is spicy and floral. The taste is balanced and fairly complex. The finish is long enough with a nice toasted bitterness. The mouthfeel is medium, dry and lively and feels very astringent at the finish. Not bad, but I knocked the overall down a point because it didn't meet my expectations for the style.

name: Stoddards ESB
review: Tap. A dark amber to almost brown. Malty and a little raisin or tea flavor. A hint of fruit in the aroma. Light body.

name: Stoddards Porter
review: This was quite a decent beer. Lots and lots of roasted malt in this one. Coffee, burnt, and chocolate flavors are all over the smell and the taste. Nice full, smooth body. Easy to drink.

name: Stoddards Porter
review: Dark and ruddy in the glass with a fluffy tan head. Faint malty aroma-nothing to write home about. I was expecting this to be yet another California watered down porter, but I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The flavor of this one is VERY layered, with hints of roasted malt, sweetness, anise, and something else that I can't identify... almost an evergreen taste. Drink this beer.

name: Stoddards Porter
review: Tap. Brown with plenty of clear spots at the edges. Great light brown head. Nice roasted malt aroma with hints of chocolate. Somewhat dry. Leaves a nice malty aftertaste.

name: Stoddards Stout
review: Tap. Dark brown color with a laced light brown head. A light roasted malt base with a milky chocolate base.

name: Stoddards Kristall Weizen
review: In the glass, it almost looked like a urine sample, unfortunately. Bright yellow with just a slight haze. The aroma was overpowereed by the lemon in the glass, but there seemed to be some serious sweetness to it. It tasted mild and wheaty, with a creeping bitter that lingers pleasantly afterwards. So apparently looks CAN be deceiving.

name: Stoddards Kristall Weizen
review: Tap. Golden yellow with a well laced white creamy head. Solid body and simple aroma. I thought this looked and tasted more like an American Wheat. It had none of the haze or spice I expect in a German Wheat.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Not a whole lot to this beer bet a decent refreshing Pilsner. No bready Pilsner German taste.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Pours a a yellow color. Pretty good carbonation. Two finger white head. Good retention, great lacing. A little paler than typical pils. Aroma is light lemon and light butter. Lots of cracker malt. Zesty hops. Taste is malty. Lightly spicy hops. Good balance. Light lemon and pepper. Mouthfeel is medium light body. A touch of slick bitterness. Slides right down. Overall, this is a great pilsner. Not much more to say. I would recommend it and I would buy it again.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: On tap at Venice Ale House on 15 October 2017. This is a clean and crisp beer that reminded me that Pilsners can have some flavour. While it looked a bit pale in the glass there was a lot more body and substance to this beer than I was expecting.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Bottle at Sunset Beer (17178 stamped...178th day of 2017? end of May?). Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is hazy light to medium yellow. Aroma is moderately malty (grain, dog food, wort), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a light note of soap. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly unclean. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Could be a bit old at this point, but the malt seems really clunky/raw. A total dumper.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Bottle. Pale yellow, slightly hazy, with a lasting white crown. Lightly bready pale malts with mild Noble hop character and assertive bitterness. Crisp and clean.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: super bright yellow pour big white head. Aroma honey and grass. Tastes husky grain rustic herbal grassy hops. some honey. punchy and good.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: 12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and citrus. Taste is malt, corn, lemon, and grass. Pretty good.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Bottle. Pours a golden color with a fair head. Aroma of fresh grain, bit of citrus and malt in the background. taste of citrus, light malt sweetness and grain. nice bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, crisp, clean and refreshing. enjoyable beer that has a bit of that old world character.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Pour is a clear yellow with a average white head. Aroma is a dry pils malt but also a kind of sweet simple syrup to it. Flavor loses the sweetness from the aroma. The rest it your typical dry cracker malt with just enough grassy hop. Typical easy drinking soild pils neither great nor bad.

name: Sudwerk Northern Pilsner
review: Pours light clear yellow with smaller white head. The aroma has pale pils malt, spicy hops, light herbs and touch of dough. It has a light crisp body with fairly sharp carbonation. The flavor starts with cry malt, bright minty hops, grass, minerals and crackery malt. The finish is fairly astringent. Pretty good.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: In the description it says no fruit garnish necessary this is true because there’s print plenty of fruit flavor in this beer

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Hefetrübes Orange mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, hefig, leicht fruchtig, leichte Bananenaromen, minimal Nelke, spritzig.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Pours an orange golden color. Two fingers bone colored head. Okay retention, okay lacing. Lots of sediment. Aroma is interesting. Light cloves, light yeast, light coriander, very light banana. It has a little more orange than your average hefe. Touch of nutmeg. Taste is same as aroma. Light cloves, light yeast, light coriander, very light banana. Moderate orange. Mouthfeel is light bodied. Creamy, smooth. Highly drinkable. A little lighter bodied than I like. Overall, it's alright. Too light bodied. It won't knock your socks off. I probably would not buy it again, and I would probably not buy it again.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: 355ml bottle. Minimally cloudy, orangey golden colour with small to average, macropore, rapidly diminishing, white head. Weak, wheaty and fruity aroma, hints of apple, pear, banana, a touch of clove. Taste is dry, wheaty and slightly yeasty spicy, hints of banana, dried banana, a touch of sage and clove; light, minimally watery. Adequate composition, but for real "Bavarian style" a tad too light.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Draft at BLAH. Cloudy yellow color. Aroma of spiced banana. Taste has light spice and citrus. OK.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Draught at BLAH. Pours cloudy orange with a medium, creamy white head, medium retention. Aroma is moderate coriander, light citrus, medium earthy wheat malt and banana esters. Flavor is lightly tart citrus, moderate coriander, medium earthy wheat malt, banana esters and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Draft. Pours hazed gold with a white head. Fruity yeasty base, mild spicy notes, and just a touch of sweetness. Pretty good.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Flowery, maybe Orange Blossoms and wheat-y. Definitely not my favorite style but this was floral and fruity.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours light gold with a nice white head and aclight floral aroma. There is a slightly sour wheat flavor with a dry finish. Earlier Rating: 4/3/2009 Total Score: 3.2 On tap at Sacramento Brewing. This cloudy yellow beer poured with a thin white head and a flowery wheat aroma. The wheat base is tasty and there is a fair amount of hop bitterness with some banana ester.

name: Sudwerk Hefeweizen
review: Strong banana clove vanilla and bready aroma Pours a hazy golden color with white frothy head that starts to disappear Clove and banana flavor with bready malts. A bit heavy on clove for me Medium light bodied with medium high co2, lingering clove spice finish Not one of my favorite Bavarian style hefes. Yeasty clove phenol is a bit too overpowering for me. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: a fairly flavorful lager. fuller flavored and fuller bodied than the pils, but not as crisp and clean. overall, a nice session beer, neither good nor bad."

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours clear golden with a decent off-white head and a light floral aroma. There is a slightly sweet light malt flavor with a mildly bitter finish.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: A very clear straw pale beer with doughy scents. It is thin malty smooth a little more malty then necessary. Palate is left with a sos so tasting malty residue.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: 12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of grass and malts. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: On tap at Jacks in San Francisco. Golden, flat, little head. Smooth hops, not pils, German like. Hoppy and zest aroma (with a hint of urine!). Looks bad, smells bad, tastes nice! Slips down nicely.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: Bottle. Aroma is grassy, malty and hoppy. Taste is similar and overall watery. Leaves a sweet film on the lips. Overall an above average beer.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: Aroma is grassy hops and grainy malts. The flavor is malts, beery hops, a hint of fruit and a dryish finish.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: 12oz bottle pours crystal clear deep gold with thin near white head. The aroma offers up a nice sweet breadiness, clean fresh malt graininess and gently flowing into thin streams of floral to sort of spicy hops. The taste is both lively with carbonation and hops as well as grounded by pleasing malts, grainy malts and a bready note or two. The hops are modest in strength and seem to be nearly equal in bitterness and flavor hoppiness with notes of spicy and floral hops. Darn nice Helles.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: Crisp, golden coloured body with a light copper glow with some orange highlights and a nice, one centimetre tall slightly off-white head. Aroma of pale malt, light caster sugars, a touch of citrus and some very light low a.a. german hops. Medium-bodied; Nice complex grassy and herbal flavoured hops up front with a good but pungent malt presence, some alcohol flavours soon afterwards and a touch of citrus. Aftertaste is relatively complex, for the style it shows some good citrus twangs, a touch of earthiness and some subdued alcohol flavours on the end. Overall, a nice helles with some good flavours and a nice crisp finish. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Total Wine in Tustin, California on 03-February-2012 for US$1.99 sampled at home in Washington on 19-February-2012.

name: Sudwerk Lager Münchener Helles
review: Not one of my favorite styles but this one was really well done. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy apricot color with a medium sized foamy yellow-white head that left good lacing. The aroma was tangy and citric and a touch sour. The flavor was tangy and sweetish with notes of citrus, grass and a hint of perfume with a light bready undertone. the finish was long, tangy, sweetish and nicely hoppy. Medium body and smooth. Pretty good for what it is.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Tap. Pours clear pale Amber gold, medium creamy off white head, nice lacing. Aroma is quite hoppy, pine, pot, herbal, field grass. Flavor is light plus sweet, light plus bitter, saison like, grassy and herbal. Medium creamy body.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: 12oz bottle 6/22/14 (Judicious Spirits Singles)-48° in Mug-Pours a medium golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, grains, and hops. Taste of the same with more malt. This medium bodied brew is not bad but just not my favorite style.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Enjoyed at Total Wine’s summer beer tasting class. Nice mild malt aroma. Nice flavor. Mildly effervescent mouth feel. Full body, creamy texture. Good after-taste. One of the better ones in this style.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Decent recreation of the style. Loud enough without being weak, but weak enough that it’s not as full as it could be.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Sun Devil Liquor bottle. Pours a nice golden color with active carbonation but just a thin white head. Sweet aroma of malt and corn with a hint of alcohol. Flavor is strange, it starts sweet and then ends almost tart/sour. Not really a style I’m familiar with but this seemed a little strange.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Rich, malty aromas from a crystal clear light copper body with a fleeting white head. Caramel and light butterscotch jump out with raisins and plums following. That distinctive German lager taste and creaminess comes through along with a dry, leafy bitterness and a good alcohol bite. It all wraps up into a delicious, sweet, herbaceous and warming finish. I think even the Germans would agree this is an excellent Maibock.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Appearance: Slightly hazy orange/gold with a decent off white head. Aroma: Sweet malt, fruity. Flavor: Malt, alcohol, somewhat harsh finish. Palate: Medium to full bodied, mild to moderate carbonation. Overall: great aroma, with some nice malt characteristics, but uneven.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: Clear bright orange pour with a white head. Sweet caramel malt, some candy/sugar, lemon peel, and a bit of yeast. A nice fruity ester aroma, some bread, and a bit of yeast. There’s a lot of apple, lemon peel, and sugar sweetness on the palate. A bit of bread, some yeast, and toasted malt. A bit too sweet for my tastes.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: 12-oz long neck bottle. Pours a nice golden-amber color with a moderate head. Pleasant aromas of malts and hops with an additional perfumy scents. Sweetness comes first on the palate, immediately balanced by a bitter finish. slightly creamy and overall satisfying. True to type.

name: Sudwerk Maibock
review: I love this beer and can never have enough of it. While I have yet to try Sudwerk's Doppelboch, this one rates as my favorite right now. A nice gold appearance and a wonderful mouth feel, my only complaint is the dry mouth after a enjoying the swallow of this fine beer. If you are lucky enough to find this in your beer aisle, don't pass it by. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: On tap at Friendship. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of toffee, malts, dark fruits and bread. The taste was similar to the aroma with more toffee, malts, dark fruits, bread, brown sugar with medium carbonation and a nice chewy aftertaste. Nice.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: 12oz bottle thanks to Eric. Pours out a dark cola color topped with a sand head. Nose is toffee pit fruit rich malts and a little roast. Taste is more of nice rich pitfruit malts some caramel and toffee sweetness.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Dark ruby/mahogany with a half-finger off-white head and minimal lace. Aromas of toasted malt, yeasty bread, dark fruit and brown sugar. Flavors of fig and plums, with a touch of spice, warming alcohol and some bittering earthy hops. Medium body and carbonation, incredibly smooth mouthfeel and a long warm finish.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Pours a clear brown color with a 3/4 finger thick light tan head. light lacing. Aroma is lightly roasted malt. Flavor is toasted malt, light chocolate, and herbal hops. Finish is a little harsh. Medium body. A decent beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Pour is a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is a mix of sugar and loads of dark fruit. Lots of plumbs and figs. Flavor is pure raison juice with a bit of treacle and toffee. This was such a dark fruit forward beer. One of the best dopple bocks I’ve had in a long time. This beer leaves so much raison on the tongue you may think you are eating a box of sun-maids.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Pours a dark mahogany color. About one finger mocha colored head. Poor retention, okay lacing. It’s so dark, it’s hard to see it. But from what I see, it looks good. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and malts. Lots of fruits. Raisins, cherry, figs,. Smells great. Taste follows the nose. Very malty, no hops. Very fruity with cherries, raisins, figs. Sweet, no bitterness. A little alcohol burn, but can’t taste the alcohol. Chocolate and toffee. Mouthfeel is full bodied. Creamy and rich, but has alcohol burn. Can’t taste the alcohol. Be careful, high ABV, sweet and easy drinking, could make for trouble. Drinkable yes, sessioinable...no. Overall, it’s rather tasty and enjoyable. I don’t have much more to say about it. I would buy it again and I would recommend it. It’s mighty fine!

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: The beer pours deep brown with a reddish hue with a beige head. The aroma has toffee, rich malt, some dark fruit/berries and lager smoothness. It has a medium body with some mild carbonation. The taste starts with dark toasty bread, lager smoothness and burnt toffee. The finish is pretty dry while maintaining the richness. Pretty good.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Rich and complex, with a layered malt character. Brewed with generous amount of Munich malt. And a subtle addition of chocolate malt for a distinct roasted character, and a range of caramel malts for a full, rounded flavor with a silky creamy finish. Chocolate, Coffee, Smooth. Nice Beer

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: On tap at Harry’s Hofbrau during a Sudwerk event. Very rich caramel malt with slight chocolate. Alcohol burn.

name: Sudwerk Doppel Bock Ultimator
review: Aroma is bright sweet caramel malt with hint of chocolate roast. Appearance is dark brown with redish tint, medium off white head. Taste is bright sweet malt followed by a light chocolate bread crust followed by a light herbal hop flavor/bitterness. Palate is medium. Crisp yet full, hides alcohol well. Overall a very nice beer. Not a world class example, but has some malt depth and very clean. Good example of the style

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: (Tap) clear, bright pale amber colour with a small white head; aroma starts with crushed weeds, then stewed fruit, honey; nicely balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: [1/30/17] Draught at Thirsty Bear in San Francisco. Hazy golden. Fruity hops and a bit of butter aroma. Flavor has a sweetish butter hint, and bitter fruity hops.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: On keg at the brewery, deep gold with no head, resin and orange nose. malty and hoppy bitter, honey and a little mango, nice balance, quite short finish for the potency.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: Sampled at GABF 2015. In the sample glass golden orange with a white head. Nose of citrus and pine. Medium body and resinous mouth feel. Flavor is solid citrus and pine and the finish is earth and bitter. Quite solid and good.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: Pale orange yellow color. Aroma is citrus peel and pine as is the flavor. Fresh. Not bad.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Soft citrus on the nose, malt, crisp grapefruit. Medium-bodied, soft malt, a good amount of earthy bitterness right away, a touch of sweaty hops, green. Earthy citrus into the finish, bitterness, malt, crisp and easy.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: On tap at the brewpub. Clear golden / light orange coloured pour with a lasting white froth. Aroma is decent floral citrus hop, caramel, fruity strawberry. Flavour is composed of solid base malts, biscuit and light caramel, citrus hop, zesty, firm citrus Hoo bitterness. Hint of pine. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Lingering spicy slightly dirty hop. Bog standard IPA.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: Clear amber with live hoppy aroma. Malty with slightly sour hop flavors. Strong bitter finish. Not a favorite.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: Pours a clear honey with a thin white head. Citrus, fruity aroma. Hops and pine in the flavor. Creamy texture. Fizzy carbonation with a soft finish.

name: Thirsty Bear Howard Street IPA
review: Pours a light amber color with a white head. Hop, citrus, floral and malt aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a floral and citrus hop finish.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Sampled at GABF 2015. In the sample glass yellow with a white head. Nose of coriander and citrus. Medium body. Flavor is light fruit and spices. Finished spicy. Decent.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours an opaque hazed gold with a thin white head. Big honeydew melon, light musky citrus on the nose. Medium-bodied, musky citrus, light and smooth. Nice balance of wheat and citrus. My server told me this batch came out hoppier than they had intended, and it definetely worked out of the better. Probably the best beer there that day, nice hoppy session wheat thing going on. Slow musk and citrus into the finish, light pith and grapefruit bitterness.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: On tap at the brewpub. Clouded yellow / greyish coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is weird stale wheat, peppercorn, savory meat, pepperami. Flavour is composed of strange sweet and savory, wheat, doughy grains, cracked peppercorn, pepperoni. Palate is semi crisp, drying finish, frothy carbonation. Bit of a weird one.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. Bready and lemony aroma. A bit funky. Mild dry flavor with more citrus. Thirst quenching. Pretty good overall, but could be better.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Pours a pale yellow with white head. Wheat, citrus, floral and honey aroma. Wheat, coriander, spic, floral and yeast flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Citrus and wheat finish.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Tap. Pours hazy yellow, medium creamy white head, great lacing. Aroma is wheat, coriander, lemon zest. Flavor is light sweet, a but of citrus, coriander, banana. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Draught at the Thirsty bear pub in San Fransico. Fluffy, long lasting white head. Really clowdy yellow color. The aroma has both corriander and belgian phenols blended with a perspiring horse. Fruity with some citrus and lots of typical belgian taste. Litle too sweet and low body.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Tap at the brewpub. The look is very light, yellow in color, and has a thin white head. the smell is wheat, yeast, clove, esters. The taste is wheat, floral, fruity, esters.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: On tap @ the brewery during San Francisco 7/7/14 beer tour. Pours a cloudy yellow appearance with a thin white head. Aroma is cilantro, green leaves, dull citrus. Dull carbonation. Periphery/green coriander flavor. Fairly sweet. Pass.

name: Thirsty Bear Valencia Wheat
review: Draft Flight 3/23/05 (Brewery)-Pours a cloudy orangish yellow with a decent white head. Aroma of wheat, orange, and coriander. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew was not bad but a bit weak.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: From tap at the brewpub. Clear golden amber color with offwhite head. Malty and light hoppy aroma, bread, grain, grass, light citrusy fruity. Light sweet and light bitter taste. almost medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Comes a clear golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and fruit. Taste is malt, wheat, and citrus. Decent.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: Clear orange-brown with a thick foamy head. Aroma of dried apricots, pecans, and fresh biscuits. Crisp bitter flavor, mouthfeel is a bit astringent. Very good.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: [2/3/16] Draught at Triple Rock in Berkeley. Clear golden. Rather dry, crackery malt, citric hops. Medium-bodied.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Clear golden / light orange coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma is subdued, pale grains. Light pine hop. Flavour is composed of very dry light grains, faint pine, some carbonic acid,. Palate is light. Some sweetness, highly carbonated. Drying carbonic acid bite in the finish. Lacks flavour.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: "well rounded stout that borders on an american imperial. flavorful and aromatic, with lots of roasted coffee and a decent share of bitter hops. a solid entry."

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: Tap at the brewpub. Light yellow in color, modest white head. The aroma seems grassy, cascade hops notwithstanding. Flavor follows, a mild hop snap, as sessionable as it is unexceptional.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: On draft at the brewpub. It pours a clear golden yellow color with a white head. The aroma is lemony with some light herbal notes and grapefruit. The flavor is dry with some pine, bread and herbal spice bitterness. They label this as an English Pale Ale, but it is more American influenced than I would have expected. Fresh, light and clean. A nice alternative to the other hop bombs they do here.

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: A good pale ale. Pours an ugly clear yellow, but smells good, like strawberries and honey. Taste is creamy, and sweet up front, but a slightly strange straw aftertaste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Pinnacle Pale Ale
review: On tap at Triple Rock pouring up clear deep gold with thin copper core and tiny near bright white head. The mild aroma offers up some sweet malts, a touch of slightly roasted malts and a dash of vague hoppiness. The taste has carbonation enhanced punchy notes of spicy to floral hops mixing with some sweet malts and a thin river of malty sweetness. Nice Pale where the hops are a bit on the bright side for an, as stated, English Style Pale but I’m totally cool with that.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: still a pale, just a stronger, hoppier version of pinnacle, with a different malt bill. pretty good. light even at this abv. very fresh cut hop/grassy aroma and flavor balanced with sweet malt. well done."

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: A good, if slightly boring pale. Pounds an average clear orange. Smells slightly peachy. Taste is creamy, like the pinnacle, but a nicer aftertaste. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: On tap at Triple Rock poured a clear orange amber with a small lingering ivory head. Aromas of bread, fruittiness and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread, light citrus and light earthiness with a crisp lingering citrus finish.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: A decent beer, but I definitely prefer Triple Rock’s IPA. I felt it somewhat lacked in taste and on the palate.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: A - Served a clear golden-orange color wit ha finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down slowly leaving behind some nice lacing. S - Aroma is a mix of some light citrus hop with some sweet caramel malt and some graininess. A bit of breadiness as well with some fruity esters. T - Starts out with some caramel and other sweet malts with a bit of citrus hops and bitterness. Through the middle, more sweet grainy malts come through with a bit of breadiness and a bit of fruity esters. The finish is a mix of a touch more bitterness, more sweet bready malts, and a bit of sugary sweetness. M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth a sweet and moderately dry finish. D - Very drinkable. Flavors feel just a bit off. The beer is a bit too malty and could have used a bit more hop presence to balance.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: On tap. Aroma is of earthy, citrus hops. Flavor is well balanced malt and hops. Palate is OK, a little on the fizzy side.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: On tap at the source. Pours with a completely clear golden to copper body with a small white head that fades to a ring. Aromas are toasty, grainy, caramel, estery and lightly hoppy. Flavors are sweet, caramel, toasty, fruit esters, light hop flavors. Malty, basic. Medium bubbles, medium body, somewhat dry finish despite the sweet malt flavors up front.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: Poured golden amber, balanced, caramel malts, piney and citrus hops, clean dry finish.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: Amber pour with a white head. Great lacing and head retention. Malt and fruit stand out with subtle citrus hops and a clean dry finish.

name: Triple Rock Titanium
review: draft at Triple Rock, Berkeley. medium golden pour, aroma filled with medium bitterness & hops. Flavor was solidly bitter, good dose of malts. Decent

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: 5oz on tap @ Triple Rock Alehouse. Pours cloudy golden with a medium head. Aroma is malts with fruits. Bitter orange. Flavor is fruity malts with some pine and hops. Quite good.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: From tap at the brewpub. Clear golden orange color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, bread, caramel, pine, citrusy fruity. Sweet and bitter like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: On tap at the brewery. Comes a hazy gold with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical. Taste is grapefruit, orange, mango, pine, and malt. Pretty good.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: On tap at the brewery. Hazed golden / yellow coloured pour with a lasting thin greyish head. Aroma is strawberry, jammy fruits, eater, Neapolitan ice cream, semi sweet grains. Flavour is harsh grains, husks, bitter hop pine, harsh alcohol bite in the finish. Spicy pi e needle and ,woody finish. Palate is medium bodied, grainy, very highly carbonated.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: Tap@ Trip Rock. Clear amber with ivory head.  Tropical fruit, citrus aromas. Medium body.  Citrusy, herbal, green hop, sweet pale malt flavors----off a bit.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: bitter grapefruit and orange peel in the nose and flavor. this would be wonderful cask conditioned. another winner in the ipa category (going into overload)."

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: On tap at triple rock. Pours copper with white head. Taste is medium mouth with with lots of Carmel and a hop bitterness with some pine.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: Tap at FWIBF. Pours a medium yellow to light orange. Aroma of peach and mango. Taste is again very stone fruit forward. Fades to a light sweetness with some bitterness and a dry finish.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: Pours a burnt gold color with a long lasting white head. Hop, citrus, pine and malt aroma. Hop, citrus, caramel, pine and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Mild bitterness and a citrus and malt finish.

name: Triple Rock IPAX
review: On tap at Triple Rock Brewery in Berkeley, sticky, hoppy aroma, some grapefruit, boozy palate.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: [2/3/16] Draught at Triple Rock in Berkeley. Clear red. Aroma of malt, toast, caramel, light fruitiness. Sweetish flavor, malty, with caramel, toast, and a bitter hops finish. Medium-bodied.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: On tap - rusty red in color with good lacing. Nice hop taste up front. Some nice malts in there as well. A bit of a grass taste. Medium thin mouthfeel.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: A decent if not super complex red. Pours a nice red color. Not much of any smell. Taste is nice, but a little boring. A slightly hoppy finish. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: On tap at Triple Rock poured a clear reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of carmel, fruittiness and light earthiness. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, earthiness and light fruittiness with a smooth lingering carmel finish.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: A - Served a clear copper-red color with a finger of frothy white head. The head fades fairly quickly leaving behind some good lace. S - Aroma is a mix of sweet toasted caramel malts with some pine and grassy hops. T - Starts off with some toasted caramel malts with some pine hops and light bitterness. Through the middle some more hop flavor and bitterness comes through with a bit more sweet malt. The finish is a mix of pine hop and lightly toasted malts. M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a nice dry finish. D - Very drinkable. Nice red ale with a good hop and malt balance without much metallic flavor.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours with a lightly hazed amber-bronze hued body with a slowly fading white head. Aromas of rosewater, estery, earthy, bready, caramel with a lightly spicy hop note. Flavors are bitter, a bit chalky, chocolate, lightly estery. Lively bubbles, dry and well attenuated.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: It pours amber with an off white head. The aroma is lightly tropical with a touch of toasted malt. The flavor is rather dry with some toasted malts and a watery, hoppy finish.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: A: The pour is amber in color with a dense khaki colored head. S: A solid citrus hop aroma such as grapefruit and orange with a bit of floral notes, too. Plenty of sweet caramel malts, toffee, and some toasted bread character. T: On the hoppier side of the style but still a good balance of the toffee and caramel malt along with the citrus and slightly piney hops. M: The body is medium and so is the carbonation. D: A nice red/amber ale, which seems to usually be a terrible style for brewpubs. Would drink this again.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: Draft. A hazy amber beer with a thin orangey head. The aroma has notes of caramel, hops, and malt. The flavor is sweet wtih notes of malt, toffee, and hops.

name: Triple Rock Red Rock Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours reddish copper with a thin beige head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty smoked malt flavor with some carbonation and a dry finish.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: On tap - caramel color with a wall of lacing. Has a nice caramel or molasses aroma and a smooth malty caramel taste. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Excellent brew.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: On tap @ Triple Rock. Amber pour with a small white head. Aroma is caramel, light peat, and a fair amount of dark fruit. Good raisin and toast. Sweet malty flavor. Lots of caramel and toast. Dark fruit notes of raisin and plum. Some peat, smoke, and a touch of chocolate.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: A very nice scotch style ale. Pours a very nice dark red. Smells like bourbon. Taste is very sweet up front, with a smokiness and a bourbon, but not boozy finish. Very interesting. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: A - Served a clear red with just a touch of orange mixed in and a thin finger of frothy slightly off-white head. Head fades slowly with some good lace. S - Aroma is a mix of rich sweet caramel malts with a touch of earthy hops coming through. T - Starts off some rich sweet caramel malt with a bit of a syrupy taste. Through the middle a bit of earthy hop comes through with some more caramel malt. The finish is a mix of rich caramel malt sweetness with some light bitterness. M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a lightly syrupy feeling and a sweet and lightly warming finish. D - Very drinkable. Fairly rich and sweet, but still well balanced and not overbearing.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: On tap, aroma is mildly malt and caramel. Flavor also follows this, but with a sweetness.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: 8 ounce sample on tap at the brewpub. Very sweet caramelly aroma with some hints of peat. Light roastiness, and minimal smoke present. Nicely aromatic. Transparent garnet-amber body with a medium off-yellowish head and good lacing. Starts sweet, sticky, and caramelly. Becomes a bit peaty and a little smoked in the middle. Some buttery diacetyl seems present late, which is mildly off-putting. Long-lasting roastiness late. Scantly burnt.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: Pours amber with an off white head. The aroma is very smoky and grainy with a touch of peated malt. The flavor is nice with smoke and caramel. Very silky and smooth on the palate. The finish is smoky and and bitter with a touch of roasted malt. Big flavor and mouthfeel for a smaller beer. A nice treat for Scottish ale lovers.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours with a mostly clear amber hued body with a small, off-white head. Aromas are malty, lightly smokey, raisins, caramel, bready and slightly sweet. Clean, no hop aromas or fermentation character. Flavors are lightly smokey, raisiny, and caramel. Very noticeably bitter for the style. A bit too much, but still enjoyable (ratings are not to style anyway). Medium bubbles, smooth finish.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: Draft. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel and straw.

name: Triple Rock Tree Frog Ale
review: Sample at the brewpub on 8/8/10. Pours clear reddish copper with a medium tan head. Caramel malt nose with peat, roast, chocolate and a bit of metal. Toasty caramel flavor with chocolate, peat and a roasty bitter finish. Nice.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Amber / copper coloured pour with a lasting creamy head. Aroma is nice fruity hops, lemon rind with tropical fruit notes., passion fruit. Good bright hop on the nose. Flavour is composed of nutty toasted grains, pine and orange rind hop, some alcohol, some jammy notes. Palate is medium bodied, semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Decent brown ale.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Tap - really more of a black IPA, but lets go with this. Pours clear hazel, small tan head that dissipates quickly leaving good lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, a bit of roastiness. Light sweet and light plus bitter, a touch of caramel, a bit nutty. Lightish body.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Pours dark brown with off white head. Citrus, hop, malt, toffee and caramel aroma. Citrus, hop, pine, caramel, malt, toffee and toast flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a citrus hop finish.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Draft. A hazy red beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of hops, malt, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, malt, butterscotch, and bread, leading to a bitter finish.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Clear orange-brown coloured with a medium sized off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma of hops, caramel and pine needles with notes of grass. Fruity and light roasted flavour of hops and grass with notes of grapefruits. Dry hoppy finish.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Draught at MikkellerBAR. Clear brown - offwhite head. Fruity. Nice hoppy. Citrus. Nutty. Chocolate. Light bitterness. Ok malty and nice fresh hoppy.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Chopp. Red brown colour, clear like, medium beige head. Sweet well toasted malty caramel hoppy fruity aroma, pleasant. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fresh, sweet like, well toasted malt and caramel, fruity hops, citrus and piney. Nice!

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours clear and golden amber to brown with a huge tan hed. Aroma is fruity, pine and toffee malty. Dense malty, pine and crisp solid hoppy. Toffee malty and rather dry bitter. Bitter and dry pine hops finish.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: On tap. Pours with a clear brown body with a lofty and foamy off-white head. Aromas are of brown sugar, lots of hops (mostly notes of pine), nuts and light roast. Flavors are hoppy, brown sugar, citrus, and pine. Very light roast. Medium carbonation, medium bodied, creamy. Good beer. India Brown Ale -esque.

name: Triple Rock Dragons Milk Brown Ale
review: Pours dark amber with a tan head. The aroma is dominated by fruity hops. The flavor is the same with a slight hint of toasted malt in the finish. Dry, bitter finish. Not a Scottish ale in the slightest.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: From tap at the brewpub. Dark brown to black color with off white head. Roasted malty aroma, bread, chocolate, coffee. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: On tap at the brewery. Comes almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and grass. Pretty good.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: [2/3/16] Draught at Triple Rock in Berkeley. Very dark brown to black. Aroma of roast, coffee, nuts. Sweetish flavor, roasty, with coffee, nuts, and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: On tap at the brewery. Black / dark mahogany brown coloured pour with a lasting dirty tan head. Aroma is toasted barley, fruity berry, grape, grainy, toasted. Flavour is bitter dirty roast, light soy, some berry fruits, roasted barley. Palate is medium light bodied, slightly thin, gassy, grainy. Lingering black forest gateau.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: On tap at Triple Rock poured a clear dark brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee and light bitter chocolate. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of cocoa, coffee, roasted malt and light vanilla with a smooth porter and a good potent hop finish.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: Enjoyable no doubt. Nice and smooth but maybe lacking some flavor. Would get it again.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: "only 4.6%? i suppose you can tell in the thin body, but there’s plenty o flavor. roasted malt and chocolate balanced with a kiss of hops. a nice porter if not quite a standout."

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: Draft. Pours a dark brown black color with a tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel finish.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: Good standard porter, black with white head which dissipates gradually leaving decent lacing. Coffee and chocolate aromas. One to try if porters are your bag.

name: Triple Rock Black Rock Porter
review: Tap. Pours clear chestnut, medium creamy tan head, great lacing. Aroma is burned malts, ashy, coffee. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter. Medium body, a bit acidic. Decent.

name: Triple Rock Agate
review: Draft. Amber beer with an off-white head. malty aroma. Malt and citrus flavor with some mineral and grass notes. Medium bodied. malt and caramel lingers with citrus and mineral notes.

name: Triple Rock Agate
review: Sample at the brewpub on 8/8/10. Clear copper pour with a medium beige head. Malty aroma with some crisp bitter hops. Dank malt flavor with roast, caramel and a bitter hop finish.

name: Triple Rock Agate
review: Dark orange with a fizzy head. Good strong malty aroma and taste with a long lingering earthy finish.

name: Triple Rock Agate
review: Nice nose and decent bite, a fine beer, a classic ESB.......................

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: Dark black. Sweet. Almost under-fermented sweet. Cola. Claims to be full body, but is actually somewhat thin. Growler that was a wedding git from Joey.

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: On tap at the brewery. Black black coloured pour with a dark tan coloured head. Aroma is dark choc, roast, jammy fruits, dried plum. Flavour is composed of milky roasted grains. Some lactose sugars, burnt milk. Palate is semi sweet. Slightly creamy. Lingering burnt toffee. Gassy.

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: Tap@Trip.Black w tan foam. Nice earthy, dark chocolate , roast aromas. Medium body. Sugared up black coffee, roasty, dirt earth flavors----good

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: "well rounded stout that borders on an american imperial. flavorful and aromatic, with lots of roasted coffee and a decent share of bitter hops. a solid entry."

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub - dark with a beige head. Veeeeery silky, veeeeery smooth! Nice coffee aroma and taste. A wall of lacing all around the glass. Very nice!

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: A very good stout. Pours a deep black with a brown head. Smells slightly like cigar. Taste is very smooth and creamy, with some ice cream in the finish. Favorite from Triple Rock. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: A - Served a dark black color with a hint of brown and a finger of chocolate colored head. The head fades down slowly leaving behind some good lace. S - Aroma is a mix of roasted and burnt chocolate malts with a touch of coffee and sweetness. T - Starts off with some roasted and burnt chocolate malts and a touch of sweetness. Through the middle, some earthy hop flavors come through. The finish is a mix of burnt bitter chocolate malts with a bit of sweetness. M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth and a touch creamy with a dry finish. D - Very drinkable. Good roasted and burnt flavors with overall good balance. Nice dry finish.

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: On tap at Triple Rock in Berkeley. Great flavor though the aftertaste was a little light for my preference and for a stout. Less of a meal in a glass and more of a refreshing sweeter stout. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: On tap (don’t remember it being on nitro, nor do I see that in my notes, but I could be wrong) at the brewpub. Pours with a deep brown to black body with a minimal tan head of bubbles that fades. Aromas are roasty, molasses, brown sugar, minimal esters, no hop aroma. Coffee, chocolate. Flavors of brown sugar, some estery notes, alcohol, and chocolate. Some higher alcohols noted. Medium to light bubbles. A bit of an earthiness in the finish.

name: Triple Rock Stonehenge Stout
review: A: The pour is essentially black with a finger of creamy, tan colored head. S: The nose is very roasty with plenty of coffee aromas to it. There’s some dark cocoa powder that is somewhat bitter and maybe even a touch of nuttiness to it. T: A mild bitterness, some moderate chocolate notes, and a very heavy roasted malt component. There’s a touch of acidity to it, but it works out alright. Lots of coffee flavor, too. M: The body is medium and the carbonation is smooth and low to medium. D: I’d definitely have this beer again. Smooth and easy to drink, like the style should be.

name: Truckee Dark Lager
review: Gives a soapy odor. Really sweet with just subtle caramel. Amber color. Strange but OK, except the aroma.

name: Truckee Boca Bock Lager
review: Flat as a board. Tastes and feels like some roasted malt was boiled in water and bottled. Bad.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Bottle from Wegmans. Dark reddish brown, clear with brief bubbly head. Sweet malt aroma. Mod carb. Toasted malt with nuts and licorice, not too sweet. Overall pretty mainstream but nice

name: Yards Brawler
review: Poured into a pint glass. Professional appearance with s filtered look, solid head, and brown hue. Better nose from the empty bottle than the pint. Caramel and roasted oats. Clean and crisp. Malty session beer. Very English “special” style. Cheers!

name: Yards Brawler
review: Clear, brown color . Caramel malt dominates the aroma, faint notes of bread. Same caramel malt in taste. Balanced, easy to drink.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Pours a nice brown color with a two finger khaki head. Some nice sweet caramel malt on the nose. Taste is sweet and easy going. Nice.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Bottle. Pours dark brown with thin, off-white head that dissipates very quickly. Roasted malt and chestnut aroma. Chestnut and bread crust malt with a rather thin finish. Light-medium body.

name: Yards Brawler
review: At the Nassau Inn, Princeton NJ. Brown in colour, with a moderately-sized, off-white, head. A sweetish mild, with brown sugar, ripe malts and a hint of toastiness, before a gentle finish. Fine.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Stopped for a roast pork while traveling for business and I can’t pass up a mild. Amber brown pour. Nose is light wood and caramel. Tastes malty, some caramel, and like licking furniture. Mild easy going palate. Pretty good.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Tasted at GABF 2018 in a sampler glass, a past-year winner in English-style Mild Ale category. Reddish brown color with beige foam, lasting with lace. Malty, toasty, nutty, chocolatey, fruity. True to style, good, no flaws.

name: Yards Brawler
review: Malt. Caramel. Almost like a toasted biscuit with a little butter. What's not to love about this beer. Incredible amount of flavor at a low abv. It could be part nostalgia since it's one of my first crafts, but it truly is a great beer. Just because something isn't imperial this or double that or triple dry-hopped doesn't mean it's not a great beer.

name: Yards Brawler
review: 7/28/18 With A watching Lady & the Tramp. Deep translucent brown with a thick foamy head. Yards kills it in the graphic design dept as always! Nose is dark and roasty. Could easily be mistaken for a porter based on smell. Taste follows tons of maltiness. Dark roasty caramel malt, bready & chocolate. Somewhat light tasting but still retains that porter-like character. Relatively sweet. Almost no bitterness. Smooth & delicious malt-bomb. Medium-light palate. A bit heavy with lighter carbonation - easy-drinking but not particularly crisp. Overall, a solid tasty beer. Tons of flavor for such an approachable, low-abv beer!!

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Pours clear dark amber with a one finger, light tan head. Aroma is dried fruit and light roast. Taste is raisin, moving to light roast. Finish is raisin and roast.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Bottle. Caramel malt aroma with notes of toasted mal and nutty malt. Pours clear caramel colored with half a finger of tan head that has excellent retention and lacing. Starts with toasted and caramel malt flavors. Finishes smooth with nutty malt flavors that linger on the palate after each sip. Pretty good Scottish Ale.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Smells like whiskey malts. Clear light Amber red tint. Taste is caramel, malt, whiskey.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle poured into a pint glass at my cousin's wedding at Garden of the Gods Club in Colorado Springs. Pours a clear amber with a beige head that settles into a ring and film. Malty, with notes of caramel, brown sugar, nuts, and a bit of tea. Maybe a bit of muddled fruit in there, too, but it's really just your run-of-the-mill red malty beer. Light-medium bodied, with a malty, sweet mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Fine for what it is.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: 5oz pour at Bristol brewing. Pours a clear amber the aroma is sweet carmel. The taste is carmel and sweet but a little to watered down, it's ok but not as good as other Scottish ales

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Mash malt vibe like the booze got lost in a potato batch. Mahogany pour with ok head. Tangy finish. Bottle.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: From a bottle. Pours a dark, ruddy amber and makes a medium white head. Aroma of lightly roasted malt barley, and some nuttiness. Tastes of fresh grain, sweet malts, and hazelnuts. Just wonderful example of the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Draft @ Thunder & Buttons (Old Colorado City). Faint aroma of sweet malt. Dark amber color with light beige head that dissipates. Good malty flavor, but not a lot of complexity. Appropriate slightly heavy body. Overall a good beer, but could use a little more complexity.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: Sample. High creamy lasting white head. Clear brown body. Sweet berries, solid malt caramel, little hops aroma and flavor, low carbonation, long finish.

name: Bristol Laughing Lab Scottish Ale
review: 12 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of malts, nutty and very sweet. Taste is nutty and malty.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Draft at the brewery in CO. Clear amber color with an off-white head. Good lacing. Taste is hoppier than I expected for a red ale but not bad for a pale ale. Not much caramel flavor. Meh.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: 5oz pour at Bristol brewing. Pours a clear gold. The aroma is hoppy. The taste is a subtle hop flavor that finishes smooth, not too bitter. It's a good pale ale for someone who wants to try something more bitter than a ale or lager

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Bottled. Hazy pale amber, coarse head. Grapefruit and grass up front. Dry with light-medium body and clean, crisp mouthfeel. Crystal malt meets grapefruit and grass. Really bitter finish. Basic, but drinkable,

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: This has a pleasant bitterness with decent hop character. The finish could have been longer with a stronger malt backbone, in my opinion. It is refreshing and better than I expected.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Poured a slightly hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma of sweet malts and a decent crisp hoppiness. A solid sweet malt backbone in the taste, with a good balance of floral hops, citrusy. Mild and drinkable, with a light-medium body. Not bad.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: 2015 bottle. Poured a deeper and cloudy amber color with an averaged sized off white head. Lots of small floaters. Aromas of some flowers, light caramel, and cookie dough. Tastes of cookie dough, caramel, oranges and some citrus. Thin body. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Sampled at GABF 2015, in the tasting glass was amber .White head. Nose of citrus on caramel malts. Medium body. Flavor is odd.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Not a bad pale ale. Some light citrus hops, lingering grassy aroma and a caramel malt base.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Aroma was faint but hoppy, which one would expect from a dry-hopped beer. Nice color and clarity. Medium weight with a crisp and clean finish. Mild pale malt background with a mild hop flavor.

name: Bristol Red Rocket Pale Ale
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours clear bright amber with a fizzy white head. Tastes like caramel, corn, doughy malt, and dry grapefruit hops. Light/medium body and medium carbonation. Smells like caramel, corn, a hint of vinegar, and some doughy malt.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: Bottle. Sweet honey aroma with notes of wheat malt, bread and a touch of citrus. Pours clear, pale golden colored with a half a finger of off white head that has excellent retention and good lacing. Starts with wheat and bready malt flavors. Finishes smooth, clean and refreshing with prominent honey and a touch of citrus flavors. Really nice summery beer.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: Cloudy yellow. Large white fluffy head. Nose: grains, wheat bread, phenols. Similar taste. Light-bodied. Light bitterness. Not a highlight.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: 12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear, yellow color, with a big, frothy, white head. The nose is clover honey, ripe bananas, apple, and biscuit dough. Sweet and yeasty, with a light, spicy bitterness. Light body, with a chewy, syrupy mouthfeel. This is a nice, balanced wheat, if a little simple.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: 5oz pour at Bristol brewing. Pours a hazy yellow, smells of honey, the taste is wheat with a little honey, easy to drink but nothing special

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: From a bottle. Pours a hazy gold and makes s thin white head. Weak aroma is not distinctive. Taste is of wheat, sweet barley, and honey. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: 12 oz. bottle. Pour was cloudy golden, white head. Aroma was wheat, hay, grass, bread. Taste was medium sweet, wheat grain, yeast, light grassy bitter finish.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: Sample at the brewery. Low fluffy white lasting head. Clear yellow body. Mild fruity aroma and flavor with little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: 2015 bottle. A hazy golen color witrh a foamy white head. Aromas of wheat and subtle honey. Taste is also predominantly wheat with a sweet honey or caramel accent. Medium crisp body. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: A hazy golen color witrh a foamy white head. Aromas of wheat and subtle honey. Taste is also predominantly wheat with a sweet honey or caramel accent. Medium crisp body. Refreshing. A good wheat beer.

name: Bristol Beehive Honey Wheat
review: 12oz bottle from Supermarket Liquors Pours cloudy straw golden with a medium sized white head, some lacing. Aroma of wheat, banana, fruity and hay. Flavors of wheat, grainy, honey and straw Decent, mild sweetness

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Bottle. Pours a clear golden amber color with a small white head and fair retention. Has a nice caramel flavor without being too sweet or too hoppy. Smooth and clean. Nothing unique, but very repeatable.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: 5oz pour at Bristol brewing, pours a clear gold, not much of an aroma the taste is light malt with some hops after wards, good middle of the road beer.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Bottle, thanks to Zach. Pours clear, bronze orange, with a small, fleeting, beige head. The nose is rye bread, allspice, bitter orange peel, and caramel. Sweet and malty, with a sharp, nice bitterness. Medium body, sticky, grainy, and clingy. This is a pretty good, malty beer. The palate is a bit harsh, but the flavor is reasonably well balanced, and the malt aromas are nice.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Called it an "ale", boring, grainy male flavor. No complexity. Colorado suffers from too many beer makers who don’t bother to make beer that is outstanding, just like their shitty weed.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Pours a hazy dark golden with a decent white head and good lacing. Light aroma of pilsner malt, caramel and earthy hops. tastehas a light sweetness with some bready malt, earthy hops and a slight peppery flavor. Nothing special but not offensive and easy drinking.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: 2015 bottle. Pours copper with a white head. Smells of caramel, roses, some earth, touches of honey. Tastes of caramel, copper some peppery splashes with a floral touch on the finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: 12oz bottle from Supermarket Liquor Pours slightly cloudy golden with a small off-white head, some lacing. Aroma is grainy, straw and cereal. Taste of cereal, straw and spices Bland

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: This was lacking. No real aroma to speak of. Nice Amber color though. Palate was average and the flavor was bland and forgettable. Not planning to revisit.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Draft at the brewpub. Pours hazy amber with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like creamy woody malt with a hint of butter, caramel, corn, and some citrus hops. Medium body and light/medium carbonation. Smells like woody malt, butter, a hint of vinegar, caramel, and some citrus hops.

name: Bristol Mass Transit Ale
review: Nothing special. Kind of plan - corn based Amber ale. Slightly sweet. Inoffensive drinkable but no reason to.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours an orange gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is wheat and citrus. Medium body, wheat, bready malt, light finish, decent.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: Faint aroma of wheat and yeast. Not a good looking beer. Flavor was spicy yeast and wheat. Balanced. Light palate.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: On tap at the brewery. Cloudy yellow-orange appearance with a lingering white head. Aroma and flavor is spicy yeast, herbal hops, peppery spice, light bready malts, clove and banana. Somewhat refreshing.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: Draft at Coopersmith’s. pours cloudy yellow orange. Aroma is thin w/ lemon (they put a lemon on the glass) very small hint of wheat. Taste is decent wheat with a harsh amber malt note. Tastes like dirty tap lines

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: On tap @ Coopersmiths. Hazed golden pour with a white head. Spicy aroma of pepper and coriander. A touch of lemon, sweet bread and dough. A touch of grass. Flavor has some bready sweetness, dough, and light citrus. Pepper, coriander, and a bit of grass.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: Pour on tap at the brewery, slightly hazy orange-yellow with thin white head, aroma brought clove, banana notes, hints of fruity esters and bubblegum, very slight bready note as well. Taste is a bit on the sweet side, some slight clove but mainly biscuit, banana, bubblegum and some fruit notes. Decent.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: (Draught) Pours a hazy pale yellow body with a moderate white head. Aroma of mustiness, grain, and banana. Flavor of toasted wheat, some banana, citrus, and light clove.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: On tap @ Coopersmiths. Fairly hazy, light yellow appearance with a white head. Nice yeasty, banana, wheat malty nose. Banana, light clove, medium yeast wheat malty flavor with a fairly dominant banana yeasty aftertaste.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: (Draught at Coopersmith) clearish white/pale yellow, ring of white bubbles. Nose has tons of clove, funky, ripe banana. Taste has tons of clove, ripe banana, funky and bubblegum. Soft but abundant carbonation.

name: CooperSmiths Mountain Avenue Wheat
review: Draft at Brewery Aug ’08: Poured a cloudy yellow. The nose was banana and spice. The flavor was clove, spice, banana, wheat, and citrus. Overall, not a favorite of mine, for a wheat beer.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: Taster at the brewpub. Pours brown, nearly black, with a small, tan head. The nose is cherry, brown bread, toffee, and maple syrup. Sweet, without much bitterness. Light to medium body, with a sticky palate. Fun, malty, and easy.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark amber with small off white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is cocoa and raisin. Medium body, roast, cocoa, bread, light dry finish, good.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Clear, lighter brown appearance with a tan head. Caramel malt, coffee, chocolate, toasted grain and light roast in the nose. Similar flavor, adding a moderate, earthy hop bitterness and a mild malt sweetness. Medium body with ample carbonation and a crisp feel. Solid brown ale.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: Clear deep chestnut with a thin light beige cap. Lovely malty biscuit nose with nutty notes and a wee dash of pepper. Nice calm nutty flavor with a bit of cocoa and earthy sweet nutty malt. Not shabby.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub Clear dark brown with a small beige head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, nutty and caramel. Taste of toasted malts, coffee and chocolate A nice solid brown ale

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: This was a solid brown. Sweetish and mild with a nice roasted aftertaste. Tried at the brewery with the parents in 2013.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: Draft at Coopersmith’s. Aroma is Carmel nutty, pecan, amber malt. Taste is chalky amber malt, some which hops and a big malt bite. Finish is long and full flavored.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: On tap @ Coopersmith. Brown pour with a khaki head. Nutty aroma, some roast, and toast. Slight sweetness of caramel. Grass, water, and cocoa powder. Flavor has some nutty sweetness, caramel, and cocoa. Coffee, roast, and coffee grounds. Toast, grass, and a touch of water.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy brown pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, biscuit, grass and nutty notes, touch of chocolate and cocoa powder. Taste is a mix of caramel, nut and earth notes, touch of cocoa, hints of bread, finishing fairly sweet.

name: CooperSmiths Not Brown Ale
review: Tap @ CooperSmiths Pub & brewing. A stop on grand tour of Fort Collins breweries and bars with Tim, Aaron and Armin, Thanks !! Pours dark ebony with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, dark chocolate, caramel, wood notes, fruit. Taste is malts, chocolate, nuts, caramel, dark fruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry finish. 250212

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Taster at the brewpub. Pours brown, nearly black, with a big, velvety, beige head. The nose is butter toffee, bitter chocolate, orange, and dust. Sweet and very malty. Light to medium body, with a grainy, malty mouthfeel. This is a pretty mild, easy brown ale.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy beige head that lasts. The aroma is roasted malt and brownie. Medium body, cream, roast, dark fruit, light dry finish, decent.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Aroma is very subtle. Appearance is darkest brown with a fine sepia head. Taste is a balanced, mildly sweet ash with chocolate. Smooth mouth feel from the beer gas, but not exceptionally thick. Overall, a solid, mildly sweet stout.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: On nitro at the brewery Black with a medium sized tan head, good lacing. Aroma of dark malts and chocolate. Flavors of dark malts, coffee, ashy and chocolate Ok but not balanced. Just doesn’t meld together.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: A pretty basic stout. Plenty of roasted malts, lots of coffee and some chocolate sweetness. Tried at the brewery with the parents in 2013.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Poured on site. Lots of coffee on the nose, some roundness on the mouth from the oats. It’s not bad, but it’s certainly not very memorable.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Pour on tap at the brewpub, dark brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of roast, oat, some coffee, hints of caramel, dark cocoa powder, slight nutty notes as well. Taste is a mix of lactose, oat, some chocolate, coffee, and roast notes, hints of slight earth, spice, and caramel, finishing slightly sweet, slightly bitter.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Sweet. Low carbo. Good lasting head. Nice chocolate/coffee overtones. Almost milk stout.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: Draft at Coopersmith’s. pours black with big chocolate milk head that lasts forever. Aroma is chocolate roasty burnt malt s’mores, not smooth, it doesn’t really come together.

name: CooperSmiths Horsetooth Stout
review: On fucken nitro @ Coopersmith. Black pour with a dense tan head. Smells of roast, dirt, and coffee. Water, earth, and a hint of metal. Meh. Flavor is pretty much just dirt. Bitter, earthy, and coffee grounds. Roasted malt, cocoa, and some metal.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: From Sep 2007 Sampled Sept 22, 2007 It poured a clear medium gold with a small head of foam that shrank slowly leaving a fine layer with a bit of lacing. The smell has some sweet malt, hops and grain but it's light on the nose. The taste on first sip....very smooth was my initial impression. Light flavours of citrus hops and caramel malt with a bit of grain. Very buttery mouthfeel to it with medium carbo. A few more sips in and I notice a lot of bread and the hops are more noticeable. It finishes slightly bitter and has a short aftertaste. In my book, this is a good APA that maybe could benefit from kicking it up a notch or 2 in the flavour department. It went well with the pizza I had. ;^)

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with small frothy white head. The aroma is english yeast and bready malt. Medium body, wheat, grain, bread, light dry finish, ok.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: Had it on tap at CooperSmith’s brewery! Aroma: Malt, Yeast, and Wet Basement Color: Beautiful clear Amber copper hue Appearance: thin white head and uneven lacing Taste: stale malt hop taste

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: Middle of the road on this one. Faint aroma of pale malt. Average golden color. Medium palate. Almost flavorless with a slight hop hint on the back end. Easy but unexceptional.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Clear golden appearance with a lacy white head. Mostly hoppy aroma with notes of earth, hop spice, flowers, grass, light herbs and toasted grains. Fairly clean, light malt sweetness and a moderate hop bitterness. Decent pale ale overall.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: Clear pale golden with a thin white head. The nose has a little lemon but otherwise a bit bland. Nice bright malty flavor with sturdy cracker tones and a touch of lemongrass. Mostly cracker and bready blonde malt.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery Clear golden with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma is floral and citrus. Taste of pale malts, grains, citrus and wheat Ok

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: A pretty basic, really mild pale ale. Some grassy hops, but mostly just a watery afterthought. Tried at the brewery with the parents in 2013.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: Draft at Coopersmith’s. pours clear bronze. Aroma is non existent, air, something like hops I guess. Taste is harsh malt, thin flavor, dirt, bad old earthy hops.

name: CooperSmiths Poudre Pale Ale
review: On tap @ Coopersmiths. Golden pour with a white head. Grape, bread, and caramel sweetness. Grass, light floral hops, maybe a touch of orange peel. Flavor is really, really sweet. Tons of grape and bread. Some sugar, caramel, and grass. Very light hops.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Taster on cask at the brewpub. Pours a clear, dark, copper color, with a small, creamy head. The aroma is caramel, pine, light earth, toast, and oak. Sweet and malty, with a mellow, hoppy bitterness. Light to medium body, with a flat, smooth, and silky mouthfeel. Nice, mild, English-style IPA.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: From Sep 2007 On Cask This poured a clear, well, slightly hazy gold with a good 2 finger head of foam with lots of lacing. I love to watch the cascading head and, quite frankly, that gives it a good edge when it comes to my scoring on appearance. The smell has strong notes of grapefruit *and* caramel malt. One of the best balanced noses for brews of the style. First sip and the grapefruit just jumps out at me and is absolutely delicious but, in the background and swiftly moving in to share center stage, is that very tasty malt. Further sips and I find a complete harmony with the hops, which now also take on a floral presence, and malt and I reaffirm my belief that this is one of the best balanced IPAs out there. It finishes bittersweet, the carbo is very light, and the mouthfeel is silky smooth. Wonderful stuff! Bottom line: My favourite brew from Coopersmith's and it's going to take a hell of a brew to knock it off its thrown. Highly recommended!

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Malty sweet aroma with some earthy hops. Burnt orange color, feint white head. Taste is earthy muddled hops. Palate is low carbonation, thick for the style. Standard to slightly above average IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange gold with medium frothy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is pine and grapefruit. Medium body, citrus, pine, light bitterness, good.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Had it on tap at CooperSmith’s brewery! Aroma: Smellz like Punjabi Color: cloudy brown Appearance: creamy head and solid lacing Taste: A Malt Yeast Beast

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Amber and a touch hazy appearance with a lingering, lacy off-white head. Bold hop aroma with notes of citrus, pine, hop resin, flowers, herbal notes and grass. Similar flavor, adding medium to heavy hop bitterness and a hint of toasted grain sweetness. Medium body with ample carbonation and a dry bitter finish. A little harsh.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Clear deep golden with a thick sticky white head. Lovely floral and orange zesty fresh hoppy nose. The flavor is a tad too bitter and dank with grapefruit and floral resins with a too-subdued sweetness.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Draft at Coopersmith’s. pours bronze. Aroma is amber malt some earthy hops but not much. Taste is harsh malty notes with a little bad hops, his beer sucks.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: On tap @ Coopersmiths. Golden pour with a white head. Grassy and floral hops. Slight pine, straw, and apple. A bit of bready sweetness. Flavor is sweet bread, apple, and some floral hops. Straw, grass, light pine, and a subtle bitterness.

name: CooperSmiths Punjabi Pale Ale
review: Amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruit. Taste is of citrus, pine.

name: Glenwood Canyon Hanging Lake Honey Ale
review: Sample at GABF 10/08/2016, thanks to my sis for assistance with note-taking. The beer is a clear orange-gold color with a thin white head that burns away quickly. Spotty lace.
