review: Pours a nice amber red color with off-white head. Caramel malt, some citrus, and pine on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a nice malt backbone.

name: Dunedin Red Head Red Ale
review: Enjoyed a sample from a pint on tap at the brewpub. The beer had a clear deep amber to dark red color with a foamy tan head that had average retention and lacing, but good cling. Its aroma featured caramel malt and toffee along with some lighter earthy and grainy hops tones. It was a sweet, malty, caramel beer with flavors of toffee, and a very light grainy bitter aspect. The beer had a wet and watery body with low to average carbonation.

name: Dunedin Red Head Red Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Red in color with a small white head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt. Sweet caramel malt with a touch of chocolate malt. Light to medium bodied with a sweet finish. Not bad.

name: Dunedin Red Head Red Ale
review: Pint pour of amber brown with full white head. Nose is mostly malt and sweet caramel. Flavors come through pretty similar. Not really complex or heavy, just an easy drinking amber that goes down smooth. Medium body with mild lacing. Not bad.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: On tap. Dark amber in color with small tan head. Interesting floral aroma. Mildly sweet flavor with toasted malt notes. Medium bodied. Nice.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Dark amber pour with a small off white head. Nose of sweet malts, small amounts of piney hops, funky yeast and fruits. Tastes much the same, nice balance of the fruity sweetness and the hops. Good stuff.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Bottle: Poured a hazy amber color with thick fast accuating head, very reactive with lots of carbonation. Sweet wheat and hoppy aroma. The flavor was sour and bitter at first but subsided to a mellow sweet malt.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Dark copper color with a thin head. Dry and dirty hop aroma. The taste is a little barnyard-ish, almost like a dull Saison. Way too carbonated. It feels like Champagne.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: 16 OZ bottle via degarth(thanks!). This pours out a semi-hazy copper with a small white head. I really cannot detect much in the nose, maybe some mellow caramel and toasty malts. Taste starts with some somewhat sweet but uninspring caramel, a bit of toastiness, a bit of hay, some lemon, and some mild British hops. Finish is almost dry...medium body. Chalky mouthfeel. Over-carbonated....

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Bottle from Degarth. Pours a dark copper with an off white head. Smells of earthy hops, some metallic elements, and some malt. Tastes of malt with aminimal hop presence and some nutty tinges.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Bottle. Very sour aroma. Cloudy red/brown colour. Small white head. Quite sour flavour, a little malty and spicy. Infected.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: 16oz bottle. Clear copper color with thin off white head. The aroma is on the light side with mostly sweet malts. Nice flavor. Starts off sweet then hops enter the picture almost midway. A rich caramel and slight fruitiness build right at the midpoint and recede into a grainy pale malt character. Tasty beer.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Thanks to Degarth for this. Pours coppery with 1-finger off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, brown sugar, vinous fruit, peaty earthiness, with a flvaor of peaty malt, caramel, some honey, brown sugar, and earthy notes. Finished slightly dry with some backdoor hops. This one isn’t as bad as the average might have you believe.

name: Dunedin Oktoberfest Ale
review: Mildly hoppy with a slight caramely touch. Honestly, it’s pretty thin and bland. Oktoberfests just aren’t my thing.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: Pours to a bronzed body with a tall creamy rocky off-white head and great lacing. The aroma is a dusty dry spice like a collectibles store. Spicy wreaths. The flavor is spicy Christmas wreaths. Overly spicy and not blended well. The palate is overly spiced. I didn’t like this one much.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: cloudy off orange pour w/ a big frothy light tan head and thick lacing. Spicy aroma hints of honey and ginger some white pepper. pal is light delicate and a bit fluffy. Flavor is light, hints of ginger definate lemon zest white pepper... blah.. not a fan.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: Pint courtesy of Degarth, thanks! Cloudy orange pour, with a big white head. Malty, spicy smell. Heavy on the malts, citrusy taste along with some spices. Seems a little unbalanced, but definetly an interesting beer.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: 22oz. Thanks to jdg0608. Poured a reddish murky color. Aroma is very strong with mint. Taste is minty and has ginger in it nice finish.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: Bottle from Degarth. Thanks Joe. Pours a copper-amber color with a bit of off white head. The blend of aromas come together to resemble a Christmas pot pouri or some dessert cooking in the kitchen. Not heavy notes at all but rather hard to define. Taste was the same. the flavors were subdued but still not bad.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: 16 oz bottle. Poured a clear copper color with thin white head. The aroma is on the light side with slight malt sweetness and hints of wintry spices. The spice flavors are bright with nutmeg, cinnamon and maybe even coriander. Behind the spicy veil is a murmur of sweet caramel malts. Lighter still is the note of hops. Too subtle for my hop stunted palate to discern. Nice tasty winter brew. The only negative I have for this low gravity ale is that the spices could be a bit softer. Sure wouldn’t want ‘em too soft though.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: 22 oz cl Bottle via Mystery swap from Degarth (thanks!). Pours a clear amber with a massive head that hangs around for almost forever. Nose is nice with some toasted grains, vanilla, honey, ginger. This doesn’t really come out in the taste though. Mostly just the toasted grains, way too much ginger, some malts, and some citrus hops. Chalky finish and tart aftertaste. So-so...

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: the aroma is quite festive and strong! I can smell the cinnamon and ginger from at least a few inches from my nose. There is a strong pine presence as well. The flavor is filled with spices, but it is pleasantly earthy and not too sweet at all. As a "winter warmer" it is a bit too low in the alcohol, but nonetheless it is a pretty well-balanced and decent beer. Almost chewy mouthfeel, smooth.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: Bottle from Santa - cloudy copper pour (hurray for unfiltered beer!), with a huge, frothy head - strong gingerbread aroma, with some doughy/yeasty hints - quite an earthy smell - quite sweet, but not overpoweringly so - the honey is quite evindent, and it mixes quite well with the ginger and nutmeg - bread/dough character from the yeast - it gets a nice zing from the orange zest near the end, before closing with a long finish of clover honey and herbal flavors - a nice change of pace from most Christmas beers.

name: Dunedin Christmas Farm Ale
review: Bottle at Cock & Bull, Sarasota, FL. Poured hazy brown color with a large fizzy white head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate spicy sweet yeasty aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Heavy sweet spicy flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: A: The beer pours almost black with a finger or so of tan colored head. S: A mild smoke to the aroma. Some dark chocolate and roast, and maybe a little of dark fruits. The roast becomes more intense as it warms, maybe becomes a bit ashy. There are some definite problems here, especially a noticeable acidity. T: Slightly watery, but quite a lot has gone wrong here. Chalky and astringent with a strong roasted malt bitterness. Ash and roasted malt, a hint of coffee, a little bit of dark chocolate, too. M: Medium in both body and carbonation. O: Can’t say that I was too big a fan of this particular beer.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Bottled. A dark amber beer with a fast disappearing brown head. The aroma is sweet and acidic with notes of brettanomyces, smoke, fruit, and wood. The flavor is sweet with notes of smoke, brettanomyces, fruit, and wood, leading to a dry finish. Had it blind - my guess on a style was a thin smoked Flemmish sour - hmmm. Thanks Papsoe for sharing.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft and redlight. This would have been much better I think if I would have had a half of a glass. Just got to be too much towards the back half. Tobacco...really tobacco. Nice smoke to it...really liked the mouthfeel, but it should have been in a smaller glass.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft at Redlight Redlight. I almost feel bad reviewing this so poorly. It just wasn’t a flavor I like. I can understand people liking it, though. The aroma was smoked pipe tobacco. Flavor is lightly smoked with some mint and loaded with tobacco. It really reminded me of chewing tobacco. I had to pour it out.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft at Redlight Redlight. Dark brown pour with a thick creamy head. Sweet malt, tobacco and hints of peat aroma. Taste is smooth malt, smoky, tobacco and hints of fruit sweetness. Decent brew.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft @ redlight redlight. Pours a semi-transparent brown/black with a fuzzy brown ring of head on the edge of the glass. Some chocolate, tobacco, a touch of roast, malty caramel with a bit of peat smoke in the nose. Very tobacco-like in flavor, mildly roasty with hints of chocolate towards the finish. Towards the thin side of things, chocolate/roast notes are toned down for a porter, but still enjoyable.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft at Redlight Redlight. Pours a dark chestnut color with a slightly reddish hue. Mostly clear and translucent. A small, khaki colored head leaves a soapy wash behind. Aromas of sweet caramel malts and lightly pungent pipe tobacco are permeated by a distinct, meaty smokiness, while overly ripe, dark fruits and spices lend earthy depth. Flavors follow suit, mostly sweet and earthy, with a big dark caramel malt presence, and perhaps just a bit too tobacco forward for me. The smoke level is nice, and it really ties all of the varying elements together well. Medium bodied and balanced on the tongue, the mouthfeel doesn’t detract. Nice brew, but not something to go crazy for.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: On tap at Redlight.Poured a murky black color.Smoke and roastiness on the nose.Lots offlavor of roasted malts and slight smoke.A quite delicious brew.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft at Redlight Redlight. Big dark brown pour. Very nice aroma of smoked wood. Flavor was smokey and peaty, and Hoppy bitterness.

name: Dunedin Highland Games Ale
review: Draft at Redlight Redlight. Pours black with a small light tan head. huge peat comes through in the nose, which really surprised me. Got some roasted malts, and coffee as well, but the peat overpowered them mostly. The flavor was much of the same. It says a hint of smokiness in the description, but its definitely a big hint of it. Made the beer more interesting for me, because I wasnt expecting that. Pretty tasty, maybe a bit underrated here.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: 4 oz pour on draft at Hops in Alexandria, VA. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Bland aroma. Tastes of malt, light citrus. Light body with a dry finish.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: Standard light watery pale lager aroma and smell. Very very generic, but to its credit, lacking the skunk factor of some mass protests diced swill.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: Tap. Pours clear straw, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is light, grainy, lemon. Flavor is oddly sweet, lemon lime, grains, very light bitterness. Light body, soda like carbonation. Is this a shandy??

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: So begins a lovely week of lagers. Waiting around outside Reagan for a flight that doesn?t leave to Honduras for a while. Golden, crisp. This is not terrible for a light Mcbeer. Tap at Alexandria brewpub.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: Draft Flight 9/1/03 (FLL)-Pours a clear golden with a small head. Aroma of corn and sweetness. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew was not too good.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: About 4 oz. served into a tasting glass. From notes. A: Pours a pale straw color with only a small white film. No real lacing, as expected. S: Almost nonexistent. There’s a touch of corn sweetness, and MAYBE some crackery malts...that’s it. Inoffensive, at the very least. T: The flavor - though minute - actually isn’t bad. A bit of mild graininess to start, only to finish with faint lemony hops. As a light lager, it’s actually a success - it lacks the sickly sweetness most of its BMC brethren have, due to its hop presence. Still, it IS a light lager, which means it’s boring. M: Very crisp, light, and easy to drink. This is pretty much how a light lager should drink. O: For a light lager, this is actually pretty great. Key words being "for a light lager". It’s still really bland and lacking in flavor compared to even an average pilsner. If you absolutely must have this style, this would probably be the one to seek out.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: This beer screams generic. Drink this instead of your water. No head, no aroma, no flavor worth mentioning.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: Man, this is one of the palest beers I have ever seen. Mind numbing. Metallic and grainy. Kind of ’assy’ if that makes sense. Very light body with no hop character.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized creamy white head. Poor head retention. Almost no aroma... a faint bit of grass. The taste is almost pure grassy hops with a faint sweetness. Thin bodied.

name: Hops Clearwater Light
review: On tap in Matthews nc, watery, slightly sour notes, grainy and astringent, blah.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: 4 oz pour on draft at Hops in Alexandria, VA. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of malt, citrus, light biscuit. Tastes of malt, citrus, light caramel. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Liked the light better than this garbage. While that was barely beer flavored water, it wasn’t as inherently unpleasant as this. This was "bolder" in that it had more of a flavor kick, but it was bitter and unpleasant.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Tap. Pours clear yellow, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is almost nonexistent other than a touch of grain. Flavor is lemon again, grains, light plus sweet, very light bitter, hints of grass. Light body, annoying carbonation.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: On tap at brewpub, in frosted glass. Yellow gold with dissipating head. Light malt aroma. Taste has no off flavors, and a touch of hops. Not a beer for fussing over, but better than I expected from the reputation of the place.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: This is arguably worse than the light beer here. Pours dark golden without any head or lacing. Light bitter finish. Some acridness and astringency. Too much copper peeling of the McKegs here. Tap at Alexandria brewpub.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Draft Flight 9/1/03 (FLL)-Pours a clear golden with a small head. Aroma of grains, malt, and slight hops. Taste of sweetness and grains. This light to medium bodied brew was not bad but not good.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: About 4 oz. served into a tasting glass. From notes. A: Pours a golden straw color with a small white film. Looks pretty unremarkable. S: There’s a touch of caramel sweetness, and the mildest kiss of hops. T: This is pretty much a bigger Clearwater Light to me - which means the flavor is still low, but there are some noticeable lemony hops to balance the crackery malt. Actually, it goes too far into the other direction and ends up being soapy on the finish. M: It’s light with good drinkability, but a little low on carbonation. O: Honestly? Clearwater Light was better than this. This may have a bit more flavor, but it’s also too soapy. Not one I’d bother with again.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Draft. Another pointless offering. A small white edge head gives this one an extra point for appearance, otherwise it’s wasted space in the glass.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Meh. Almost average, but just lacking in all respects except clarity and clean character.

name: Hops Lightning Bold Gold
review: Clean straw gold pour with a white head. Grassy hop and wet hay on the nose. Bread dough. Sweet with a very light, almost nonexistent hop bitterness. Very light and plain.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: 4 oz pour on draft at Hops in Alexandria, VA. Listed as Thoroughbred Red. Clear amber with off-white head. Aromas of malt, light caramel. Tastes of toast, biscuit, malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Very generically malty and sweet, watery caramel - but not really hateful in any way. Just something you’d expect from a kit.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Tap. Pours clear Amber, small off white head, hints of lacing. Very light caramel aroma. Flavor is quite sweet, caramel, wort, grassy hops provide light bitterness. Medium body. Not getting the astringency noted below, but this is still not a good beer.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: This McBeer flight just keeps getting worse. This amber is positively offensive. Very acrid, lots of astringency. Pours amber without much h head or lacing. Terrible. Tap at Alexandria brewpub.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Flight 9/1/03 (FLL)-Pours a clear red amber with a small head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and slight toffee. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew was not bad but not good.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: About 4 oz. served into a tasting glass. From notes. A: Pours a cola color with a thin khaki film. This is a red ale? S: I note some toasted caramel and a touch of citrusy hops. It suffers from the same problem the others beers in the flight did, the aroma was dreadfully weak. What was here was acceptable, though. T: Actually, this one seemed pretty roasty in its flavor. The roasted, toasted, burnt-to-a-crisp malts are followed up by touches of fruit esters and a very mild hop finish. Not bad. M: It’s thin, easy to drink, and with a dry finish. It feels a bit insubstantial, though (it’s not a light lager, so it can’t get away with it) O: A drinkable brew without flaws. Though it’s pretty bland regardless. I at least liked it enough to where I’d get it again on a future trip.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Draft. Ted. Almost headless. Aromaless. Flavorless. Why sell this? Who would drink it?

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Nice clear red, with off-white head. Sweet malt nose and taste. Caramel. Some herbal/grassy hops, but light. A light plum ester. Ok beer.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Reddish orange with a sandy head. Nose has caramel notes and a definitive malt sweetness. Dextrinous with a light citrusy quality. I actually really enjoyed this one. Medium body with a light bitterness.

name: Hops Hammerhead Red/Thoroughbred Red
review: Served on draft at the brewpub. Finally a beer with SOMETHING happening. Pours a clear dark red color with a medium sized offwhite head. Poor head retention. Extremely faint tart malt aroma. The taste is caramel malts, herbal hops and a bitter finish. Thin bodied.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Some chocolate and heavily roasted burnt malt...also a significantly smoky off aftertaste not advertised in the Brewers description. Not hateful, but not really good either.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Tap. Pours deep mahogany, large tan head, good lacing. Aroma is roasty, ashtray. Slacks is light plus sweet, medium plus bitter, burned malts, rubber, black licorice. Medium body, heavy lingering bitterness. Ummm.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: This will go down in history as the best beer I?ve had tonight, at this brewpub. Almost three times as good as the worst beer I?ve had on tap at the Alexandria brewpub tonight. Some roast, light caramel and even a hint of dark chocolate. Pours dark brown with OK head and lacing.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Flight 1/22/09 (Tampa)-Pours a ruby brown with a small head. Aroma of caramel, malt, toffee, and slight hops. Taste of the same with a bit of nut on the back end. This medium bodied brew was pretty well balanced and not bad.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: About 4 oz. served into a tasting glass. From notes. A: Pours a dark brown color with a well-retaining khaki film. This one looks pretty good, even in such a dinky serving size. S: It’s got roasted malts...and that’s it. Pretty generic. T: Roastiness builds to an acidic, mildly watery finish. Meh. M: Like everything else I’ve had here, it’s light and easy to drink. O: This wasn’t very good. Maybe I let it get too warm? Wouldn’t get again.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Aroma/Malty-Ligth, Appearance Head/size-small, Head/Color-light brown, Head/Longevity-fully diminishing, Body/Hue-light, Initial Flavor/bitter moderate, Finish Flavor/bitter ligth, Palate Body/light, good beer

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Draft. Dark brown, headless. Aroma of subtle chocolate. Taste us watery chocolate.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Burnished copper brown pour with ruby highlights. Yellow tan head. Grass/husky nose, nice grain character and roast with notes of coffee and cacao. Light sweetness and well balanced. Enjoyed this one too.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear dark reddish brown color with a large creamy tan head. Fair head retention. Aroma of roasted malts and a bitter hop finish. The taste is chocolate, nuts, roasted malts and faint hops. Thin bodied, just like all their beers. The best of the 6 I tried, but that’s not saying much.

name: Hops Alligator Ale
review: On tap in Matthews nc, bland, boring and slightly Off again, I don’t want to be cynical by this place really sucks. Wish they had a guest tap

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: [On tap at Whiskey Park, Naples, FL.] A bright amber pour with a thick cream coloured head; malty aroma; sweet malty taste with some caramel and a light bitterness with a little spice to finish. A straightforward American-style amber ale.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: can from the variety pack. ticking away. it's hot and this is cooling me down - noice! words words words

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: On tap at Sheraton hotel in Orlando. Really a solid beer it’s not an A but it’s a B+ for the style in my book. Smooth.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: Can at Coconuts on the Beach. Reddish pour with an off-white head. Caramel malt in the taste and aroma.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: On tap @ Schooner Wharf bar, Key West. Amber beer with cloudy head. Taste and aroma has bitter and caramel. Decent one.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: On tap at the Boat House Tiki Bar & Grill (Cape Coral). Clear amber appearance with a beige head. Mild aroma of malt syrup, gentle caramel and light fruity notes. Similar flavor, malty and light with a touch of hop bitterness. Light and crisp with a plain finish. OK.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: It's an Amber, it's light tasting, but quite good if you felt like an Amber.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma of sweet untasted malt. Taste is light and sweet, molasses influence is easily apparent. Palate is much the same, slight hop notes on the back of the tongue. Easily drinkable, light.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: 355ml bottle. Amber pour, very basic brew, a bit papery and fruity, light caramel maltiness, easy to drink.

name: Florida Beer Key West Sunset Ale
review: Yardbird: pretty much as expected. This is a light amber ale without too much going for it. Meh. Is what it is. Malty, caramel... in small amounts.

name: Panama City Nut Brown Ale
review: Nutty aroma and flavor, decent brown ale....................................

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: Tap at brewpub. Copper brown color, small white head, lace. Nutty, dry aroma. Light-bodied. Nutty a bit chocolaty, sweetish flavor. Quite English. Simple.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: Tap at the brewpub. Pours a reddish brown with tan head. Aroma is slight coffee and toffee. Taste is light roast malt, slightly coffee forward. Ok but just nothing special.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes reddish brown with a nice off-white head. Aroma of malt, nuts, and spice. Taste is malt, nuts, chocolate, spice, and fruit. Nice Brown Ale.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: A bit of roast in the aroma. This has a surprisingly strong coffee flavor and a fair amount of nuts. Also a bit carbonated. Not for me. the nuts outweigh the coffee in the finish.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: Tap. Clear dark amber pour with a small head. Nutty nose. Taste is nut and mild chocolate.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: A nut brown ale that’s a little over done. Very nutty and very sweet. Still a very enjoyable brew.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: Draught at Titanic on January 21, 2012 Clear brown color, white head. Malty, nutty, sweet taste. Moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Roasted, sweet scent. Roasted aftertaste. Nice twist to a brown ale, I like it.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: On tap @ Titanic. Pours a nice red-brown color with a soapy off-white head. Nose is nuts, earth, spice, and slight brown sugar. Flavor is nuts, earth, and slight bittering hops blending together. Light to medium-bodied and interesting overall.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: Dark amber colored beer with an off-white head. Nice nutty aromas mixed with some toffee scents. The taste is similar to the smell, very sweet and nutty, caramel, the toffee is really noticeable and is a nice touch. Mildly sweet aftertaste, a bit thick on the mouth feel. Drinkable and tasty.

name: Titanic Brewing Boiler Room Nut Brown Ale
review: On draught at the brewpub in Coral Gables, FL. Pours a clear copper reddish color brew with an average size off-white head that slowly dissipates and leaves behind some nice lacing. Aroma of roasted caramel malt, roasted nuts, a touch of flowery hops and some toffee. Taste is medium bodied with flavors of roasted caramel malt, toffee some dry fruit and a touch of chocolate. Finish is slightly bitter with a slowly disappearing fruit and roasted nut aftertaste.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Tap at brewpub. Amber color, steady medium-sized off-white head. Earthy hops, some sweetness in the nose. Light-bodied. Earthy, honeyish, rustic English ale.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Tap at the brewpub. Pours a light brown to orange with white head. Aroma is slightly floral and hoppy. Taste is mildly bitter malty brown ale. Just doesn’t stand out for any reason.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes a somewhat cloudy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt and fruit. Taste is malt, caramel, and citrus. Pretty good.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: 3 ounce sampler at the Grovetoberfest Miami beer festival 10/13/12. Very good.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Has a definite creamy almost soapy aroma. This is a bit indistinct but has some malt and is quite smooth. Unfortunately, some of the soapy flavors come through at the end.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: A good flavorfull bitter with no strong after-taste. Best to drink it cool. Great value for money

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Tap. Orange pour with a white head. Musty bready malt in this, plus some hop kicker. Okay.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Draught at Titanic on January 21, 2012 Sort of hazy amber color, white head. Malty, bread, cream taste. A bit flat and bitter aftertaste. Moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Sort of sweet scent. Standard bitter, though could perhaps do with a less ABV, so you could session it even more.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: Not awful. This certainly does not taste like a bitter one would get in the UK, but it is indeed drinkable. Not much of a nose, but there shouldnt be too much of one. Tasted like fugles hops. A little grassy / bitter.

name: Titanic Brewing Britannic Best Bitter
review: On draft @ Titanic. Pours slightly hazy yellow-orange with a receding, soapy white head. Nose is buttery and slightly biscuity malt with background hops. Flavor is similar with biscuity malt, background citrus hops, and miscellaneous bitterness. Light to medium-bodied ale that finishes with lingering bitterness. Interesting take on the style.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: 12 bottle fresh from the brewery store. Hazy medium amber body with a good head. Hop dominated aroma with an earthy and spicy nature. Flavor: more like an APA than a amber ale, this brew is more hoppy than malty. Overall: just OK

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: 2015 BJCP Category: 2B International Amber Lager AROMA: Restrained nose with light honey malt. Generic lager aroma. Slight lemony note indicative of oxidation. 7/12 APPEARANCE: Gold/maize hue. Very clear. Spastic carbonation visible. Small, white head; Average retention and lacing. 1/3 FLAVOR: Fairly low malt profile; more dry than sweet. Faint honey or caramel flavor; hint of bread. Minor hop bitterness. Clean fermentation. No flaws. Not bad tasting, but far from delicious. 11 /20 MOUTHFEEL: Light/medium body; crisp throughout. Clean finish. Not especially refreshing though. 4/5 OVERALL IMPRESSION: Better than any macro amber lager, but too mild and generic to be memorable. Easy drinkability, though. 6/10 TOTAL SCORE: 30/50

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: A good clean crisp amber, with a good amount if tropical hops. Well-balanced. Good beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: A skunky smelling malt lager that has a decent malt body but no supporting characteristics.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: This is the typical amber. Goldish/amber color, with a light caramel sweet taste...semi-bitter aftertaste. My buddy from Tampa brings it camping so we drink it as a "warm-up" daytime beer. Kind of light, not much alcohol. Not bad for a Florida beer, but doesn’t really compare with the premium microbrews out there.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: Drank from 12oz bottle in Tampa FL. Not much to report on as the beer didn't set itself apart in any way. Very malty without a balancing hoppiness that was needed. --you've been Dubbed.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: Bottle at home. Pours clear dark gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is biscuit and honey malt with light earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is sweet malt, light hops and bitterness with a clean lager character and a sweet finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: -sweet honey like aroma slight sourness earthy hop. -pours a cloudy golden color with small white creamy head -bready sweet malt flavor with lots of earthy hop flavor -medium body medium CO2 lingering bready earthy finish - good balance, enjoyable. Would be great with spicy food ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: Medium gold, thin head. Nose = not much(vague malt, hint hops). More sweet than bitter. Middle is caramel malt. Finish is dry, a little bland. The label promised hops in abundance I did not find.

name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
review: Pours clear yellow with an good amount of White head. Aroma is of malt, straw and grain. Taste is somewhat Skunky and straw follows up with a better grain bread type finish. Mouth feel is thin.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Poured from a bottle at Costoberfest A slight nutty flavor with toffee and caramel. Smooth finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Aroma of malt and molasses, abmer color with a lasting white well laced head. Sweet malt taste with a watery feel and a sweet malt finish.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Bottle. Clear brown with a nice 1-inch off-white head. Smells malty and slightly nutty. Tastes a little less malty than what i expected. Body’s more medium than what’s showing on the label (closer to full). Mouthfeel is pleasant and smooth. Very drinkable.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Entering in an old rating,12 ounce bottle poured a brownish amber color, aromas of light cashews, caramel, and toffee. Flavors are the same, light and watery, ok beer overall.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Ybor City Brewing Company--YBOR Brown Ale--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 3.90% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Light clear brown color with a touch of red. Light fruit nose followed by thin flavorful body with hints of caramel and cream. Light finish and light hop character throughout. Nice but light. Sampled 12/27/1998. Ybor City Brewing Company--Ybor Brown Ale--200012 oz. Bottle. 5.10% ABV. 25 IBU’s. (3.5 / 5.0) Clear thin copper red color with hint of brown. Lightly toasted mild hop front. Clean smooth toasted light nut thin brown ale body. Minimal sweet fruit notes. Clean dry end. Good but light flavor. Sampled 11/21/2000. Ybor Gold Brown Ale--2004 12 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. 19 IBU’s. (4.0 / 5.0) BOMC Selection 1004.Mild lace head. Clear thin ruby brown color. Mild nut cocoa hop front. Creamy doughy mild sweet milk chocolate caramel nut biscuit English body. Clean smooth mild hop end. Mellow Brown. Sampled 11/14/2004. Ybor City Brewing Company--Florida Beer Company--Ybor Gold Brown Ale--2006 12 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. 19 IBU’s. (3.25 / 5.0) Beer of the Month Club Selection April, 2006. Mild lace head. Clear thin amber red brown color. Very mild chocolate hop front. Mild toasted fruity thin toffee body. Tart citrus estery mild hop end. OFF. Missing biscuit flavors. Sampled 4/29/2006.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: 12oz bottle. deep copper color. Aroma of toasted grain some caramel and toffee. Watery texture. Too thin. Some bread flavors. very fizzy. boring.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: 12oz bottle Courtesy of Degarth. Pours a clear chestnut brown with a small ring of head; looks a bit like flat Pepsi. Gives off a mostly pleasant aroma of toasted grains and brown sugar punctuated by alcohol and a slight tartness. Smells stronger than its indicated 4.4%ABV. Flavor is nutty dry grain at first, then the ample malt comes forth to smooth out the dryness a bit. The slight tartness that showed up in that aroma also makes an appearance on the palate. Body is medium-full with a pretty thick palate. I don’t know if the tartness was by design as some English browns feature a slight tartness or if it’s from the fact that this sample is well over 3 years old and wasn’t always stored in optimal conditions. But in either case it held up pretty well considering I figured it might be undrinkable by now.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Extra in trade, from i forget? BM me. Dark amber, decent off-white head. Aroma is full of toffee. Smeels like the house, when boiling a starter. Flavor lacks a little compared to aroma, but decent. Toffee and faint buttery (not infected) nuts. Creamy smooth mouthfeel. Decent brown for sure, easy drink, make a nice fall session. Actually going to finish the bottle, which is more than I can say for most browns.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Courtesy of Degarth Medium brown color. Medium sized white foamy head. Aroma is nutty, malty and sweet. A medium bodied brown ale. Malts are malty and sweet. Touch of toffee. Slightly spicy hops. Nicely balanced. A lighter tasting brown ale. A touch thin in the mouth and kind of mild in flavor. Mouthfeel is thin. Finish is crisp and clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

name: Ybor Gold Brown Ale
review: Clear brown with an off-white head, little retention and lacing. There are some very sweet malt and toffee aromas going on in this which I found to be pretty good. First taste is a little light, but some nice sweet flavors come through quickly and finishes with a bit of nutty flavors. Medium carbonation and body. Thanks to Degarth for the bottle.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: 12oz bottle. Had this in college between 1997 and 2000, then I dont know what happened to it. Nice and smooth easy hop drinker. Was a weekend beer that had regularly. Where did it go and whjen did BBC brew it?

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: I know I’ve had this because I am looking at the bottle. So I will rate the bottle. Nice artwork but the backpack leaning against the tree looks like it could be uncomfortable if over packed. Would probably opt for an interior frame. Twist off cap with a descent drawing of the afformentioned pack. Bottle smells as though it used to hold beer, i do smell malt. Label says best enjoyed by Nov of 2000. So I hope I enjoyed it.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Had this beer on 5/12/1999. Color is a deep rich brown with low carbonation and head. Aroma is a sweet malt scent. Taste is refreshing, clean and dry. It starts with a medium body that goes down with a medium malt flavor. The finish is a somewhat dry hop flavor and a mild bitterness. The finish does get a bit stronger as you drink. It’s not a brew I would go out of my way for but it is somewhat refreshing.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Art of Beer Fest ’04: Light orange amber hue. Faint toasted malt, caramel nose. Small whitish head. Buttery, toast, caramel, somewhat thin body, finishing with a toffee sweetness.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Art of Beer Fest ’04. Light amber in color with a small white head.Sweet toasted malt aroma and flavor.Subtle hop character.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Art of Beer Festival 2004: Has a orange/amber color with some carbonation and a small white head. Smell is malted/light hops. Taste is also malted/sweet and finishes with a very slight bitterness. Overall I am not a fan of ambers, but this one isn’t too bad.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Art of Beer Festival 2004: Clear orange with a small white head. Sweet caramel aroma, medium bodied, starts and ends slightly sweet. OK, but boring.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Sweet and toasty - almost buttery. Pretty much on the side of too sweet - very little hop flavor or aroma. Very average at best.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: I had no idea this was made by BBC - is it still made? WHen I was a newbie beer geek, this had become a standard for my weekly drinking sessions. Lightly hoppy and generally clean. Some full soft sweetness bordering on caramel and crisp somewhat herbal hop flavor. A bit light in color for an amber.

name: Trail Stash Amber Ale
review: Redbrown, roasty and rather bitter beer. Harsh. ...........................

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Misty, yellow-white pour. Sweet, malty aroma with banana esters. Negligible bitterness and very light spice. Watery, low CO2 retention. White sticky head. Poor. On tap, Cannon Brewpub, Columbus, GA with LuckyDog.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: 6/11/18. On tap at the brewpub. Light golden orange pour with a small white head that fades, medium lacing. Light aroma, husky grains, soft wheat, touches of citrus, Light flavor, doughy, soft white wheat, a touch of citrus, grass. Meh.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Poured a cloudy yellow color with aromas of light wheat and lemon. Flavors follow suit light wheat and husk a touch of citrus.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Very Old rating, one of a flight. None were great, I think they had some cleaning issues cause they were all soapy. Maybe bad glasses, but who knows. Kind of generic brewpub malt. Other than the off taste, pretty normal wit.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Very nice wheatiness. Peppery hops, just enough bitterness to balance the light sweetness. Very bright flavors and aromas. Nice American wheat.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: On tap. Served a slightly hazy straw color with a small head. Aroma of citrus, fruit bit of malt and yeast. Light citrus and malt sweetness and bit of grain. Mild bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Light body, crisp and quite refreshing. Nice beer on a hot day.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Tap. Golden in color with white head. Citrus aroma with hints of wheat and hops. Sting taste of citrus and wheat. Wheats aftertaste. Good beer.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Tap. pours hazy gold with minimal head. aroma of what and malts. Taste of malts with a slight sweet taste thrown in.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: Clear light yellow with a fizzy white head. Grainy wheat bread aroma and taste with a sweet tart finish.

name: Cannon City Mills Wheat
review: I liked this one as well. I drank it on draft, with a lemon, at the brewpub. Citrus aroma. Hazy yellow in color without much head. Lemon and citrus flavors. Very drinkable. Liked it a lot.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Clear, pale straw pour with a lacy white head.Doughy, lightly acidic aroma. Sweet, hominy notes. Low bitterness, light body, low carbonation Watery. Quick finish. Poor. On tap, Cannon Brewpub, Columbus, GA with LuckyDog.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Poised a light golden yellow color with aromas of hay, stale hops and some light musk. Flavors are hay and light hops me not good bot great.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Old rating, one of a flight. None were great, I think they had some cleaning issues cause they were all soapy. Maybe bad glasses, but who knows. Bland cereal golden ale. Better character than most major pale lagers, but they are clean tasting.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Served. A pale golden head with spotty lacing. Light aroma of lcitrus, bit of malt sweetness and grain. Taste is fairly bland malt sweetness and grain. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, smooth and a bit short on flavor. Decent non-offensive beer

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Tap. Yellow in color with white head. Flora and hop scents. Taste of weak, watered down hops. Similar to a cheap beer.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Tap. pours pale gold with slight white head. aroma of hops and malts. Taste of mostly bready hops with carbonation.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Clear lightyellow with a fizzy white head. Deep grainy aroma and taste with earthy malty notes on the back end.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Date: 11/03/2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear gold, dense cream head, sweet grain aroma with light floral hops, sweet malt flavor, lots of grain character, nice light balancing hops, Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.4/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Appearance: Clear, yellow body with a small, foamy, ivory-colored head. Smell: Light cereal aroma with a bit of lemon and a hint of diacetyl. Taste: Cereal flavor with a further pronounced citrus character and a light floral hoppiness and equally light bitterness. Again, there’s that diacetyl. Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium carbonation. Drinkability: All diacetyl aside, it’s still fine for a blonde ale.

name: Cannon Golden's Foundry Ale
review: Tap. Sweet apple, peach, malt aroma. Golden yellow with small head. Slightly sweet apple and malt flavor with light hops finish. A good, easy drinking beer.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Misty, tea-colored pour. Toasted malt aroma. Cereal, bland, toasted. Flat. On tap, Cannon Brewpub, Columbus, GA with LuckyDog.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Pours hazy copper with a frothy off white head. Nose is generic with a little hops and caramel. Flavor follows suit with a little skunk and muted fruit added in. Pedestrian.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: 10/31/15. Craft on Draft. Amber pour with a small khaki head. Diacetyl on the aroma, yuck. Otherwise some caramel and grassiness if I search. Butter flavor, diacetyl, caramel malt, grassy. Not good.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Poured a light amber is red color with aromas of cotrus, and malt. Flavors match the aromas with light citrus and hops little to no bitterness.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Hazy dark amber. Nutty malt, but flavors come through a little muddy. Not as good as the wheat.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: On tap at Barley and Vine. Nice amber color with a little haze. Very enjoyable maltiness and gentle hop bitterness. A faint almond flavor in the background. Good!

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Tap. Amber color with white head. Citrus aroma. Flavor of citrus and hops. A very good IPA

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Tap. Pours clear transparent amber with slight head. Aroma of malts. Taste of malts and hops.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: On tap- Served an amber color with a small head that faded quickly to bits of lacing. Mild aroma of sweet malt and some citrus. Nice malty taste with a bit of fruit. There is a mild bitterness with a clean finish. Fairly light body, smooth but a bit bland. Decent and unoffensive beer. I was hoping for a bit more.

name: Cannon Red Jacket Ale
review: Clear pale orange with a fizzy white head. Brassy malt aroma and taste with a citrus finish.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Clear bornze. Sunny, malty citrus sweet aroma. Floral, tannic, prickly. Light body, long aspirin-bitter, tannic finish. On tap, Cannon Brewpub, Columbus, GA with LuckyDog.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Pours a mostly clear golden orange on tap with fluffy off-white foam that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of piney and earthy hop notes over a mild caramel and toasted malt base. Taste is more the same, nothing crazy, but nothing terribly bad. A little lacking on the hops aside from bitterness, but expected from a new brew pub.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Sampled on tap at the brew pub. Pours a clear, bronze color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is strong orange peel, a little pine, and some straw. Good, assertive bitterness, and reasonable malt backbone. Light to medium body, with a sharp, lightly acidic mouthfeel. Pretty good.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: The wife surprised me with a growler on the way back from Columbus. Thanks wife. Mild hop profile. Good chewy malt and caramel flavor. Grassy herbal hop flavors. A little green tea. Finish is smooth and sweet. Good American pale.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: 10/31/15. Craft on Draft. Orange pour with a small khaki head. Nice aroma, fresh hoppiness, citrus, floral, light maltiness. Good flavor, light malty presence, a touch of chalk, floral. Not bad.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Poured a clear orange amber color with aromas of how’s and light pine. Flavors were hops and bitterness light citrus and some soap. Meh.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Old rating, one of a flight. None were great, I think they had some cleaning issues cause they were all soapy. Maybe bad glasses, but who knows. Probably the best of the flight, but still underwhelming IPA. Lots of malt presence and amped up bitterness. Maybe they've gotten better.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Tap. Clear amber in with off-white head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Taste of hops, flora and citrus. Dry hoppy finish. A pretty good beer.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Tap. Pours dark gold with a slight layer of cream colored head. Aroma of floral hops. Taste of initial bitterness that has slightly floral notes.

name: Cannon Special Ops IPA
review: Bottle 12fl.oz. Clear medium amber orange colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, fruity, grass, mango. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120515]

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Dry, roasted, chicory aroma. Bland, but twangy with burnt straw. Light body, low carbo. Aroma was pleasant, but the rest of the beer was a letdown. On tap, Cannon Brewpub, Columbus, GA with LuckyDog.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Pint on tap. Ebony with a thin film of foam. Mild but pleasant aroma is cocoa, espresso, green herb and a touch of caramel. Flavor is cocoa, graham cracker, prickly green herb, espresso, sour cream, charred wood and a touch of marshmallow. Medium body has a very drinkable balance and a smooth low-medium fizz.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Poured a deep brown color with aromas of earth and roast light chocolate. Flavors are roast and ash with some earth not bad overall.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Old rating, one of a flight. None were great, I think they had some cleaning issues cause they were all soapy. Maybe bad glasses, but who knows. Anyways, beer itself was presented as their Guinness (not a great well to sell something). Black pour. Malty and slightly astringent. Thin for a stout, not a winner.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Very nice roast on the nose. Unfortunately, that roast transitions into slightly astringent ash in the flavor. That being said, this isn’t a bad beer by any stretch. I’d just like to see a little more richness and complexity in the flavor to finish it up.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: On Tap. Served a virtual black color with a thick tan head that faded very slowly to ample lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, cjocolate and coffee. taste of chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Malt bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, creamy with a distinct character.. Solid offering from a local brewer.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Tap. Dark beer with white head. Flavors of chocolate and roast. Aroma of coffee. Sweet aftertaste. A good hearty beer

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Tap. Pours a dark opaque brown with a layer of cream colored head and nice lacing. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste of roasted coffee.

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Bottle 12fl.oz. Clear dark black brown colour with a small large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, dark roasted, heavy bitter roasted. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, roasted - burnt bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20120515]

name: Cannon Ironclad Stout
review: Bottle poured a clear dark brown nearly black with a lasting creamy brown head. Aromas of bitter chocolate, roastiness, dark fruit and coffee. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of roastiness, coffee, bakers cocoa and dark fruit with a smooth lingering roasty finish.

name: Max Gold
review: Clear golden color with white head. Light berry fruit, pale malt aromas. lagered grainy pale malt flavors with spicy hoppage, crisp bitter finish--good

name: Max Gold
review: Sample at brewpub. Comes pale gold with an average white head. Aroma of malt and floral hops. Taste is malt, grain and hops. A bit sweet. Above average.

name: Max Gold
review: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma with grassy hints. Sweeetish malty fruity grainy flavor. Has a sweetish fruity malty grainy finish.

name: Max Gold
review: Some servers at the brewpub will aim you toward this as Max’s lightest offering - making one think maybe this "Gold" is a "training" beer. Don’t be fooled! If you love a HOPPY as hell PILSNER, the current version on tap now is one of the best I’ve ever had. YES...it rivals Victory Prima Pils- Huge aroma, delicious hop flavors - fantastic! Now is the time to try this beer again.

name: Max Gold
review: Yellow pour with watery white head and lace. Aroma of light malt. Perfume start with a medium bitter. Medium bodied with good body.

name: Max Gold
review: Tap at brewpub. Appearance is gold with a nice white head. Aroma of floral hops, light grain aroma as well. Taste is moderately hopped, and very crisp and fresh tasting. Light bitter finish. Body was light and lively. Overall, a decent pils.

name: Max Gold
review: Draft at pub. Pale gold, decent head. Pleasant floral hop aroma. Some diacetyl in the flavor, over a crackery pils malt, bitter finish. Lacked the promise of the nose. As it warmed, the faintest note of infection became present as well. Too bad, as that is probably what was muting some of the flavor hops along with the diacetyl.

name: Max Gold
review: Pale yellow, white head. Aroma is sweet, corn, pear, apple fruitiness. Taste is corn, sweet, lightly fruity.

name: Max Gold
review: Appearance: Served up a clear, yellow body with a smallish, white head. Smell: Max Gold is sweetish and spicy on the nose, with hints from the light pale malts and spicy, floral hops utilized. Taste: Sweet, lightly grainy malts impart a small hint of honey. Particularly spicy Noble hops with a medium-light (though perhaps not quite the purported 40 IBU’s listed) bitterness. Drying finish with a light, lingering spiciness. Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Lightly carbonated. Drinkability: A self-described Bohemian Pilsner, it suffers from a case of undercarbonation. Instead of even reasonably crisp, it falls flat and flabby on the tongue.

name: Max Gold
review: Location: On tap at the downtown Atlanta location 4/16/09 Overall Impression: Found this one to be an accurate example of a style that is usually pretty boring. I didn’t enjoy this one much at all. It’s a drop better then most of the macros, and that’s about it.

name: Max Red
review: on tap at the brewery; clear red color; bready malt aroma; mild toasted, bready malt flavor; well balanced with floral hops; decent

name: Max Red
review: Tap. Pours clear copper, small off white head, minimal lacing. Aaron's is malty, toffee, hints of coffee, copper. Flavors is medium sweet, light bitter. Lingering metallic bitterness.

name: Max Red
review: So far my favorite, not overpowering but flavor. Beautiful color. What a red should be. I could drink this everyday.

name: Max Red
review: Part of a flight at Max Lagers in downtown Atlanta. Pours red with a small off white head. Aroma of sweet malts, lager yeast, some sweet fruits. Flavor follows the aroma with a smooth mouthfeel, smooth finish, and medium carbonation. Perfectly fine for the style, but nothing to call home about.

name: Max Red
review: Reddish pour, creamy head. Malty caramel up front finished by some cereal grains and light citrusy hops.

name: Max Red
review: Sweet with very light bitterness at end a very enjoyable beer. No aroma fading head. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Max Red
review: Pours a clear copper on tap with nice fluffy tan head that displays to leave light lace. Aroma of nice bready grain and lager crispness. Taste is more toward the fruity esters of the yeast, nice and clean. Well done for the style, easy.

name: Max Red
review: Just a little thin but clean and a tad spicy with clear hops notes. light golden color and modest head

name: Max Red
review: Draft to taster at the downtown brewpub. Looks decent; a transparent light copperish orange with off-white lacing. Smells of caramel and lager yeast with a bit of toastiness. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Alright.

name: Max Red
review: Location: Draft at Max Lagers, 4/17/13 Aroma: The nose has some caramel, toast, a bit of spice, and some hops Appearance: It pours a clear orange-amber color, with an off-white head, drippy lace Flavor: The flavor is pretty good for the style, balanced, medium sweet and medium bitter Palate: This is a clean and drinkable Vienna, with an average carbonation, and a dry finish Overall Impression: I thought that this was a pretty nice example of the style with a pretty good flavor profile to it. Another good house brew on this trip to Max Lagers.

name: Max Pale
review: On tap at the brewpub, 4/24/08. Golden amber colour with a mostly lasting creamy off-white head. Initial “green” character is taken over quickly by a bready, fruity, citrus, and woody aroma. Bready malts with a citrus, fruity, and woody bitter finish. Medium bodied, soft, but very nearly flat mouthfeel. Enjoyable pale ale.

name: Max Pale
review: on tap at the brewpub. This is very cloudy and on the darker side of IPA’s, kind of a murky dark copper. Good head here. I am surprised by the hop definition in the aroma. It’s very bright, sharp with grapefruit and pine with a dash of caramel. Palate is smooth with just enough blatant malt sweetness. Citrus is throughout with a dry, bitter finish and a tiny sour twang. I can’t believe what a drinkable beer I’ve stumbled across. Props.

name: Max Pale
review: Location: On tap at the downtown Atlanta location 4/16/09 Flavor: Nice bitterness, decent flavor Palate: Medium-Light body Overall Impression: I thought this was a solid APA, I’m not sure if this is a new beer, but from reading the ratings of the Max Pale I have to believe this is a different beer, as it was definitely not an IPA.

name: Max Pale
review: on tap-pours a retaining off white head and hazy yellow/gold color. Aroma is nice citrus/pine hops. Taste is nice citrus/pine hops-some bitter, faint medium malt-some sweet. Semi-dry finish. OK carbonation.

name: Max Pale
review: Date: 03/27/1998 Source: Brewpub hazy dark yellow, whispy head, sweet citrus aroma, medium body, good fresh citrus grapefruit flavor, would be great for breakfast, lasting bitter finish Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 17/20 Rating: 3.8/5.0 Score: ****/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Max Pale
review: The best beer of the bunch, but the more I had, the less I liked it. I think a lot people may have only had the sampler and thus overrated it. IT truel y got worse as it went on, IMO. It had a nice enough head, which was the only thiing from keeping this a 2 in appearance as it looked almost like a hefe with hazy hues and light colors. Not what an IPA shoudl look like. The aroma wasn’t bad. A lot like an American IPA should, citrus, grapefruit, pine, floral. The flavor was good, but like I said seemed to lesen over the pint.

name: Max Pale
review: On draught at Max Lager’s on P-tree. Nice light golden-amber appearance with virtually no crown and light lacing. Aroma is very prominent with citrus hops, moreso than the Imperial IPA they had on tap. Nice bitterness throughout and nice hoppy finish. Good subtle malt backbone provides a nice balance between the hops. Mildly carbonated and overall a very drinkable and enjoyable beer. It would be great with some white or common fish.

name: Max Pale
review: tap at ewery. top ten in atlanta isn’t saying much if this is in it. straw color pour. hop and grapefruit. too much fruit. As I found with many of their beers the finish is too tart.

name: Max Pale
review: Draft......Very strong citrus-hop aroma, mostly grapefruit. Disappointed in the appearance, light orange, with absolutely no head or lacing, but had a . good taste and finish. Drank this outside in 80 degree weather, a perfect fit for a warm May evening.

name: Max Pale
review: Pours a clear pale golden with a frothy, nicely-lacing white head. Earthy, lightly bitter hoppy aroma has some pale malt presence. Grainy semi-sweet flavor has some mild floral bitterness before a dry bittersweet finish. Doesn’t have that big fresh hop presence and malty balance I like in IPAs.

name: Max Maibock
review: Date: 06/11/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear light amber, thin fine white head, sweet carmel malt flavor with light bitterness, simple but nice Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: **/4

name: Max Maibock
review: Draft....Pours to a golden orange color with medium white head and good lacing. Not much aroma that I could detect. Good taste, starts out on the malt side, with the hops becoming more evident at mid-glass. Bland finish. Not a bad beer, but I enjoyed the Max Pale more.

name: Max Maibock
review: Medium amber, edging on copper with a lovely bubbling soup of a head. The body is not quite perfectly clear, but the hazing is only slight. Great lacing. Slightly hoppy on the nose. There is a surprising burst of malt up front on the flavor, but it fades to a nicely balanced lager after a few sips. Nice and clean without being bland, but not as crisp as some.

name: Max Maibock
review: Golden color, good head and medium body. Good balance between malts and hops. Clean aftertaste. Pretty good offering.

name: Max Maibock
review: Golden brew without much of a head. Aroma is yeasty, sweetbread and slightly peaty. A sweet beer with a clear orange gel flavor. Clean finish, perhaps a little on the thin side. (Personal Note: FH Relay trip with Wayne & Leo)

name: Max ESB
review: Quite confusing the place searching in Atlanta. This beer was fine, not much os bitterness and quite drinkable in every weather.

name: Max ESB
review: 22 ounce bottle - $7.69 at Barrel and Barley in Woodstock, Georgia. Appearance: Pours a ever-so-slightly hazed, bright orange-gold body with a few fingers of white suds. Effervescent. Smell: Agreeably citrusy, though scantly soapy with a varied range of spiciness, cut wood, and pepper. The malts underneath are understated, at best, with only present mild, subtle crustless bread notes. Taste: Pale, wheat malts with a slight breadiness, light graininess. Very little sweetness. The addition of the white peppercorns is boosted by the earthy coriander, robust hopping, white ash aging, the orange peels, AND the alcohol. So, the spiciness hits and wraps around the tongue like an old slap bracelet. Lemony hops, also some tangy mango hints, and a slight grassiness. Medium-high bitterness. Drying, citric, bitter, and still fairly spicy on the finish, with a lingering spiciness and bitterness. Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-plus carbonation, sudsy mouthfeel overall. Overall: Goes beyond complex and does become a bit jumbled.

name: Max ESB
review: Ahh, beer on a patio in early march. Thin white head, golden/copper body. nose is off-slightly heife up front. Past that lies some light caramel, bready malt, faint herbal English hop. Flavor is grassy, doughy malt, some phenols. Hoppy finish with a solid long lasting toasted male.

name: Max ESB
review: Light gold color with a creamy head. All ESB’s should be served on a hand pump. Light hop aroma and only slightly bitter. Way too malty. Finish is slightly dry but this stuff is just way too damn sweet.

name: Max Stout
review: Date: 05/29/1999 Mode: Draft, Nitro Source: Taco Mac, Cumming black, big tan head, slight sweet malt aroma, rich malt flavor, low bitterness,lots of roasted,touch of chocoldte, very smooth and creamy, slight unidentifyable twang Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Max Stout
review: Malty front, a bit of sweetness. Woody note, some cellar, lactic. Smooth, subtle palate. Carbonation is mild, a bit frothy (but not Guinness-like). 95% opaque, very dark. (on tap, downtown Atlanta location)

name: Max Stout
review: A deeply dark stout, with hints of espresso. Very creamy and a nice thick head.

name: U.S. Border Tombstone Gold
review: Date: 01/02/1997 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub hazy golden, frothy head, strong floral hop aroma with a touch of sweetness, mellow malt flavor with just a hint of hops and a slight bitter finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 01/17/1997 Words: Draft Words: Brewpub hazy golden, whispy head, mild floral hop aroma with a touch of sweetness, mellow malt flavor with just a hint of hops and a slight bitter finish Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: U.S. Border Tombstone Gold
review: Light golden ale with thin head. Slight hop bitterness and light aroma. Low maltiness.

name: U.S. Border Tombstone Gold
review: Nice light hop aroma. Real light body with ahint of bitterness. Like any other light micro...not really that exciting.

name: U.S. Border Tombstone Gold
review: Pretty good golden ale. For the style it's a good bit above average. Decent light malt taste with the slightest hop bite. It's refreshing with it's mild sweetness and moderate citric fruitiness.

name: U.S. Border Boom Boom Brown Ale
review: Name: Boom Boom Brown Date: 08/22/2002 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Brown, thin tan head, thick lace, slightly sweet malty aroma, rich nutty malt flavor, touch of sweetness, just a hint of bitterness in the finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name: Boom Boom Brown Date: 09/27/2002 still lots of malt, but the bitterness really comes through, touch of burnt character enforces the bitter profile, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: U.S. Border Boom Boom Brown Ale
review: Clear burnt copper color. Nose is grassy, citrusy hops rising over the malt. Taste is more hops than malt. Actually less malty than I like my browns, but not a bad beer. Some caramel as it warms.

name: Whalers Wild Wahine Wheat
review: Draught. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, lemon). Flavor is lightly sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

name: Whalers Tutus Guava Wheat
review: Draught. Body is hazy dark pink. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), with a generic tropical fruit note (guava I presume). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

name: Whalers Tutus Guava Wheat
review: Fresh, fruity nose and an orange-pink color. Interesting - fruity and lambic-like, but the beer comes through. Thin body, but appropriate and refreshing. Hey, when you're in the guava capital of the world, why not a guava beer? Though this is just guava syrup mixed into their wheat offering, I liked this.

name: Whalers Tutus Guava Wheat
review: Hoppy but weak aroma with a hint of guava. Wonderful orange colur with a little orange head. Flavor guava and hoppy - makes nice mixture. A little bit to bitte for my taste. Refreshing summer beer.

name: Whalers Heepa Heepa IPA
review: Draught at the brewery. Drank this years ago on our honeymoon but I found out Whaler’s is now closed. This was a little below average IPA but I can imagine that quality hops are hard to maintain in Hawaii.

name: Whalers Heepa Heepa IPA
review: Draught. Body is medium amber. Aroma is moderately hoppy (grapefruit, lemon). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

name: Whalers Oktoberfest
review: Draught. Body is medium amber. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted light bread, grain), trace hops (grapefruit). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately bitter. Finish is moderately bitter, slightly husky. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Bock at the Moon Maibock
review: Tap @ Brewery: Caramel amber color, light head and lacing. Nose of light fruit and esters, light metallic fruits in the flavor but a decent robust body. Tangy finish. Decent but not good.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Bock at the Moon Maibock
review: Brown pour with light tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, some roast, and a hint of chocolate. Flavors are sweet, malty, and roasted. I small a mount of hops. Flavor and body are fairly light. Nice and easy to drink.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Bock at the Moon Maibock
review: Medium brown, amber colored pour with a minimal head. Aroma is malty, mild in intensity. Taste is also malty, with some balanced hoppiness. The flavor was not as strong as I had expected - this is a medium bodied beer with a moderate flavor.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Snake River Porter
review: Dark brown with mahogany edges. Foamy head and good lacing. Chocolate aroma leads to a mocha touch. Small amounts of bitterness. Flavor again is touched with chocolate and bitter hops. Creamy mouthfeel finishing dry.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Snake River Porter
review:
Tap @ Brewpub in Lewiston, ID
Black, tan head and lacing. Nose of light maple, very little roast or coffee. Lots of chocoalte, sour and acidic flavor, some kind of infection thing. Very little porter flavor left.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Snake River Porter
review: Very drinkable porter. Body is more mild than medium, hints of chocolate, nuts and roasting. Sort of a stock porter for the majority of beer drinkers. I liked the finish the best, it shows character with a modest sense of bitterness.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Snake River Porter
review: Reasonable-modest roastiness make this a pretty standard tasting porter. As the beer warmed the roundness of the beer increased a great deal, making it rather tasty: coffee and nuts. Nothing too special though: this was good, but one of the most nondescript porters I''ve ever had.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Snake River Porter
review: This porter came off a little thin and wasn''t backed up with a huge taste. Not much of a head or lacing on this beer. A smooth porter ready for the minor leagues.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review: Tap - Very light in color, almost like the micro-brewery had to make something that would appeal to the Bud and Coors light crowd. I guess this is part of having a full selection, but I will pass on this one in the future.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review: Gold with a foamy head. Wheat and some citrus in the nose. Slight wheat in the flavors followed by a slight nothing. Leaves me with a blah feeling.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review:
Tap @ Brewpub in Lewiston, ID
Same appearance as the Huckle. Nose of husky light malt, some hop notes. Bland musky malty flavor, finishes light, decent body, ho-hum. This is what they push onto the bud drinkers.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review: Medium in body & hops, less than satisfying in taste. If I was new to micros, I’d stick to iced tea. This brew is MJ’s black sheep and should be kept in the closet.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review: Hahaa...this is kind of funny. If ever you are in Lewiston you will understand what I am about to unfold. There is a paper mill on the Snake River that creates an overwhelmingly terrible smell similar to burning ham and cow pastures. The makers of the plant didn''t give much thought to the fact that Lewiston is in a valley so the entire place is just basking in this "odeur de shiznit." Upon entering this bar I thought I had finally rid myself of these toxic fumes, until I tried to Harvest Weizen - the smell came back in the aroma and taste; the wheat used in the beer must be grown in that valley.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Harvest Weizen
review: Not good. Came off skunky and offensive. I can see why the Bud swiging locals love this stuff.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Barleyhopper Brown
review: Brown with amber edges. Caramel and cardboard in the nose. Not too special. The flavor is full of caramel and some hops. I wasn’t overly excited about this one.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Barleyhopper Brown
review:
Tap @ Brewpub in Lewiston, ID
Brownish color, tan head, light lacing. Nose of light plum, chocolate and strong caramel malt. Near a schwarzbier ale. Toffee. The flavor is grassy and chewy. Balanced and a sticky dull mouthfeel.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Barleyhopper Brown
review: Another brown ale with typical tones of maltiness and a bit of nuts. Rather smooth with medium body and average taste. Didn’t notice any of the chocolate malt, but kept tasting the walnut and pecan tones.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Barleyhopper Brown
review: The flavor is traditional brown: malty nuts and toasted sugar. I think Portlandrunk and I had very similar reactions to this, as I also think there was nothing special with this - just a good brown ale.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Barleyhopper Brown
review: A fair brown ale. Nothing that really jumps out at you, but drinkable none the less. An agreeable beer.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review: Tap @ Brewpup. This has amazing visual character with a rich black color and a big creamy head. The flavor has heavy coffee overtones but is smooth with mild bitterness.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review: Black with lighter edges. No head or lace. Chocolate and roast aromas with some bitter coffee notes. Chocolate and bitter in the flavor. Again a touch of roast coffee. Thick mouthfeel with a cocoa finish.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review:
Tap @ Brewpub in Lewiston, ID
Black, light lacing, tan head. Nose of clean roast, lots of chocolate and coffee. The flavor is creamy, a bit too sharp of astringency and finishes tart. Nice full bodied stout.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review: Dark brownish, near black pour with an amazingly creamy head. Aroma aplenty and it is full of coffe tones ( I couldn’t taste much else ). Medium in dryness, a very versatile stout overall.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review: Very dry and full of coffee goodness. The first time I had a pint of this was with an enormous seafood buffet the restaurant associated with MJ''s has; that seemed to taste a lot better: rounder and more flavorful, but it isn''t unheard of for a dinner like seafood to affect your beverage...for the better even.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Steamboat Stout
review: This beer pours with a huge grey head that must be slurped away. Tastes very creamy as it enters the mouth and finishs with hop presence. Coffee flavors dominate the palate. Not too dry although listed as a dry stout. A beefed up Murphy''s.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review: Well this one was not half bad for a fuity beer. It would be great on a super hot summer day, but in the middle of fall was a little out of place. The beer is crisp and has a nice palate. If you are not a big fan of beer flavor and want to enjoy a cold one, go for this one.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review: Golden with a filmy white head. Chock full of huckleberries in the nose. I do so love huckleberries. The flavor is not so intense in the usage of huckleberries. Some maltiness there as well. Berry finish.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review:
Tap @ Brewpub in Lewiston, ID
Pale gold, light head and lacing. Nose of huckleberry, light malt, simplistic. The flavor is more malty and husky with light chemicals and more fruit. Decent but they could have used a better base beer.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review: Huckleberry is present in mild amounts and certainly doesn’t dominate this beer. Normal amount of hoppiness for a German Hefeweizen meshed into a fruit beer. The best fruit beer I have tasted to date. Very tasty and possibly underappreciated?

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review: Portlandrunk and I went to this brewery together, and although neither of us said anything (due to the presence of the bartender) we were both waiting for the other to try this before submitting ourselves to the horribly sweet world fruit beers exist in. This was actually quite good. The "hint" of huckleberry was just that, and not only was the flavor pleasing, but there was this very apparent grassiness that added a lot to the beer. It may be the lightest beer at MJ''s but it certaintly isn''t the worst.

name: M.J. Barleyhoppers Huckle Weizen
review: Interesting fruit beer. Great huckleberry flavor highlights the beer and is followed with a tinge of bitterness. A very leafy as well as fruity palate to the beer. They have captured the taste of the entire huckleberry plant in this one. First class for a fruit beer.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Cask at PoW, Farnborough. Vague sweet chocolate aroma. Dark. The beige head clings to the rim. Initial light sour before sugary creamy sweetness comes through. Light-medium bodied. Slick. Flat carbonation. Long finish. Sweet but basic stuff.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Cask at JDW. Darkest brown. Small head. Loads of dried fruits, raisins, dates, chocolate, earthy. Surprisingly good stout.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: black with lasting beige head. smell of sweet malt and chocolatey notes. bitterness, coffee, some dark fruits. lovely

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Pint at the Gatehouse JDW Doncaster. Medium creamy beige head. Clear almost black pour. Some chocolate. A nice smooth stout.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: 1Sep2018 Dark roasted malts, dark fruits, prunes, cacao, dark roast coffee. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Light sweet and bitter. More dark chocolate, cacao, toasted bread, dark fruits, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice, rich and complex. Cask at The Wibbas Down Inn, Wimbledon.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Cask at Congress, Longton. Pours black brown with a light tan head. Roast, some cream, smooth, choc. Good session stout.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Uit de fles. Zwart bier met dunne beige schuimkraag. Geur: Geroosterde mout, vanille, fruitig, bessen, cranberry. Smaak: bitter, zeste en het wit van citrusvruchten, Lichte body. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: lang, bitter, droog, citrus.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Cask at The Reginald Mitchell, Hanley (JDW) A deep brown colour with a frothy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, milk chocolate, some nuts and subtle dark fruits. Taste of roasted malts, nuts, some dark fruits, slight earth, a little chocolate and subtle coffee. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A lightly roasted, fruity bitterness in the finish. A decent balance but nothing’s standing out. Your regular stout flavours, jut nothing exciting.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Dark rich ale. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, slightly smoky. A good winter ale.

name: Mauldons Black Adder
review: Often on in my local spoons.very enjoyable dark ale. coffee background roast after taste
