name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: 12 ounce bottle at the house. Sugary With slight wine aromas. Clear golden in color with white head. Taste sweet clean and cr. Light bodied and easy to drink. Just a sweet aftertaste. Interesting beer. Cheers!

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: Beer that lends itself to drink around 4 bottles, then you've had it. But very tasty, maybe a little too sour.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: I liked it quite a bit. It wasn’t the best or even really that above average but very drinkable.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: 12 ounce bottle from Costco New Berlin. Hazy orange, large frothy white head, good retention. Aroma of wheat, citrus, spice. The taste is wheat, spice, orange in the finish. Medium bodied, lingering spice. Nice, even if it was on a clearance sale.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: Bottle at home. Aroma is flaked wheat, coriander, orange. Light bodied. Smooth wheatty palate. Fruity, spicy. Meh.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: On tap at Two Brothers, pours a clear golden blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of spicy coriander upfront, with some orange peel and fluffy wheat. Flavour is along the same lines, with spicy coriander, clove, orange peel and a little banana. Pretty standard stuff, but it’s well-made. Decent.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: From tap. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma is mild estery, slight fruity. Mild fruity, mellow estery and wheaty. Medium dry. Slight estery, vague estery fruity finish. Mild spiced.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: Bottle. Hazy, golden color with a nice two finger head. Aroma is the usual witbier smell with bananas and spices. The taste is the same. Bananas with spices but it’s a good beer.

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: B-. Pours a clear yellow orange color with white head. The finish is a little tart

name: Two Brothers Monarch White Beer
review: Pale, hazy yellow, with a loose white head. Smells like banana and vanilla. Taste is more banana and vanilla with some mellow spices mixed in. I get a bit of pine in the finish, as well.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Amber to dark gold in color. Medium bodied. Aromas of caramel, citrus and hops. Nice Head. Decent lacing. A little hoppy bitterness. Pretty good beer.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: There is a nice hop flavor with a background off musty flavor. If the aroma was there this would be awesome for the abv... I probably have a bad batch. Thin lasting head. Taste is nice citra fruity hop. Very nice mouthfeel for 5%. A very nice beer (if you have a cold and can’t smell).

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle thanks to queenholly. Slightly hazy yellow color with mall white head that vanished slowly. Nose and flavor of a traditional APA, some bread malt, lemon, light grassy and fruity hops in the finish. Very light and easy to drink.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Bottle from Bloomingfoods, Bloomington (among many other places over the years). Not quite as solid as Helios in my opinion, this one always had a raw homebrew kind of character to it. Dry, brashly citric, but with a slight overdose of sweet malts here and there depending on the batch. Crisp and refreshing wins the day, though.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Pours crystalline light copper with soapy white head. The aroma is fruity citrus with some slight butteriness and a touch of caramel. The flavor is hop bitterness with some buttered toast. A strong toastiness develops fairly quickly. There’s a little bit of an orange note with some bitter zest.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Golden amber in color with a generous white head and good lacing. Light citrus hops and caramel malt in the aroma. Medium carbonation and light in body. A dry caramel malt flavor with a strong floral and grassy bitterness on the end. Not for my palate, but a well-crafted beer.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle a golden pour taste of citrus, grass, fruit.- pretty smooth and easy with a nice bite

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Clear gold pour. Barely any head. Aroma is very lighht contains some faint yeast, caramel and maybe a smidge of citrus hops. Flavor is very light. caramel malt and watered down apple juice with a tiny hop finish. Meh.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Pours a clear glowing orange/amber with a nice frothy white head. Aroma of sweet fruits, peach, mango, papaya, fruit salad. Flavor of sweet juicy cocktail fruits, toffee, doughy, cotton candy, medium sweetness and light bitterness. Fairly drinkable. Medium/light bodied with nice even feeling mouthful, smooth sizzling uniform carbonation, not sticky at all.

name: Upland Pale Ale
review: Draft at tap room. Pours amber, and lighter in color than their house amber...weird. Aroma of fruity ale esters and Cascade hops. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation. Flavor of caramel with some notes of citrus, countered by a peppery bitterness. Just a tad thin on the finish.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: A classic porter. Pours dark with no head. Dry dark chocolate slightly bitter but asmooth creamy feel

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: A rather fizzy pour that thins off the head in this dark brown bounty. Aromas boast of chocolate, biscuit and cheap smoke. Flavors light roasted malt, slight wood, slight smoke in the finish. Lacking in complexity and a charater that defines a real porter. To light and east for my taste of a porter. Medium sweet with just a light smoky aftertaste.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Pours opaque coffee with a fair buff head. Aroma delivers roast malt, molasses, and subtle coffee notes. Flavor provides roast malt, quality coffee, molasses and slight charcoal and chocolate tones. Texture offers fairly firm body and jazzy fizz. Get your bad on.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Sampled at an ESBLs. Dark brown with a tan head. A smoky aroma with roast. Grain flavor that is dry. Very earthy.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Bottle thanks to Eric and Bryn’s uncle. Dark brown, khaki head. Lots of roast and chocolate with hints of dark fruit in the background. Really solid classic Porter nose, and taste backs it up. Leans slightly to the sweet side, but dry roasty lightly bitter finish. Medium body, average carbonation, creamy smooth texture. Overall: really nice.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: draft - pours dark brown tan head -nose/taste of chocolate, coffee, light creamy chocolate - med body

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Draft - Dark roast and chocolate with a touch of liquorice. Jet brown with a light brown head. Molasses, roast and dark sugars.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Mild dark malt and chocolate in the taste and aroma, Slight bitterness in the finish, Nice.

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: Bottle - Pours an almost completely opaque brown - tight light tan head that recedes quickly - no lacing. Aroma is mild chocolate and coffee, mildly roasted (shall I call it ’toasted’?)...some nuts. Pretty good, though not intense by any means. Flavor is even more mild - roasted malt, coffee, mild bitter chocolate - not bad, but not as good as the nose. Medium to light bodied - seems appropriate for the drink. Not bad, but nothing to come running back for!

name: Upland Bad Elmer's Porter
review: 12 oz. bottle from Jungle Jim’s International Market, Fairfield, OH (best enjoyed by January 2016). Dark brown cola-like pour with a short khaki head. Mild coffee and light floral hop aroma. Taste of roasted coffee and light chocolate. Mild lingering bitterness. A good porter.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: Faintly cloudy golden lacing creamy white head like most of their beers. Potent raspberry aroma and flavor, being medicinally sweet and tart in the mouth. Lacks any richness or clove character. Not too good I did not finish this sampler. Did have a nice creamy feel.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: On tap at the brewpub. The body was slightly hazy medium light bronze. The aroma was lots of raspberry with some light pears and cloves. The taste was subtle raspberries with some nice cloves. This was a good fruit wheat.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: Draught at the brewpub. Slightly hazy orange gold color without much head. Distinct raspberry aroma and flavor that was a bit too sweet and cloying.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: On tap at the brewpub during the 2006 Crescent Moon Beer Bus Trip. Cloudy gold in color with a good lace. Strong raspberry extract aroma. Harsh medicinal burning palate. You can’t hide all of a beer’s problems with sugar.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: Lightly hazed, muted yellow with a creamy cloud of a cover. Nice little berry aroma. Sweeter than I expected, more sugary than berried, but OK.

name: Court Avenue Capital Raspberry
review: Everyone at our table of legal age had this beer. The aroma of raspberries was there, but not overpowering. Appearance was nothing special, with no head by the time it got to our table. This could be a function of many things. The taste was consistently good from the start to the end. Not overdone with any syrupy level of raspberry, but just the presence. I could drink a couple without growing tired of the raspberry taste. Palate was a little thin, with not a lot of mouthfeel, but adequate to not detract from the enjoyment. The beer was of a dark golden color

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes a golden amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and a bit of citrus. Taste is malt, citrus, florals, and caramel. Not too bitter. Pretty good.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: Hazy with a small head with a light orangish color. The aroma is faint and mildly floral. The flavor is fruity and mildly hoppy but well nuanced, some mild caramel shows it’s self.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: TAP: light amber/gold pour, high malt component, some nuttiness, earthy, and slightly bitter. Decent.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: Fair amount of the English vomit character. Small amount of nice malt sweetness. Pretty dusty.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: Copper amber with a lacing creamy white head. Galena hops reported in description. Generally seems fairly malty, hops are faintly there with a slight floral grassy presence. Dry malty body lingers. Light to medium oily palate.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. The appearance was a dark copper with a slightly off white/beige head. The aroma was of citrus and earthy/dirt with a hint of caramel. The taste was also caramel and light orange zest. The body was smooth and had a slightly "tarry" finish.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. The body was dark copper with a slightly off white head. The aroma was oranges and iced tea with a hint of caramel. The taste had some dry caramel with some light orange zest. There was some cheese rind in the finish. The body was smooth, but the beer was bland.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: Draught at the brewpub. Slightly hazy orange color with white head that left a bit of lace behind. Malty caramel aroma and flavor with a pleasant buttery finish. Minimal sprucy hop flavor with no detectable hop aroma or bitterness.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub during the 2006 Crescent Moon Beer Bus Trip. Rich amber in color with a slight off-white head. Aroma is elusive. Middle flavor produces some hops, but finish is dry and quick with little to impress me.

name: Court Avenue Topping Pale Ale
review: Ruddy, burnt orange with a fairly quick-dying top. Definitely in the English style ... earthy and dirty rather than citric, with a clear bitter end.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: Keg at the brewpub. Clear dark brown, thin tan head, fair retention. Aroma of chocolate, nuts. Taste is chocolate, citrus , nuts. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: Did’t really want another beer but i needed to let my phone charge so here i am, asked bartender what her favorite was and she said this. Nice brown pour and nose os earth and light chocolate. tastes slightly hoppy, earth, cocoa powder, and light spice. fine brown ale.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: Draft - Toffee, toast malts and some light chocolate. Clear deep brown with a decent light brown head. Toffee, toast and a bit of twig. A light bittersweet finish.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Brown and clear appearance with a light brown head and some lacing. Malty aroma of caramel, chocolate and earthy hops. Similar flavor, malty and mildly sweet with light bitterness, nicely balanced. Medium body, creamy and smooth with soft carbonation. Good.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes reddish brown with an average tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and nuts. Taste is malt, caramel, nuts, bread, and a bit of chocolate. Pretty good.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: On tap at hyvee bar in urbandale... pours brown with light brown head..taste is typical brown. Nothing really sticks out..not bad tho..

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: Pour is brown with little to no head...smell is sweet malts, nutty, then definately hoppy...taste is not "crazy complex" by any means...sweet up front, but bizarre spicy bitterness in the finish...not their best beer...

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: on tap-pours copper with a light tan head. Aroma is medium malt-bready. Taste is medium malt-roasty/bready, some earthy hops.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: On tap @ Court Avenue. Dark amber brown appearance. Hazelnut brown malty nose. Low carbonation and slightly syrupy mouthfeel. Nutty, thick caramel malty flavor. Slightly nutty aftertaste.

name: Court Avenue Pointer Brown Ale
review: Pours a reddish brown color with a medium head. The aroma is molasses and some bready bisciut-y things. This smells plenty malty. The flavor is lightly tart and toasty with some cherry and apple fruitiness. Mild but nice.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: At the brewery in downtown with A and M, pours a dark black color with a java head. Nose is deep dark malt wth java notes. Taste is smooth , silky and malty. Finishes on the same malty notes. Descent !

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: Nitro at the brewpub. Clear dark brown, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of roasted malt, mild dark chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruits, coffee, lactose. Medium bodied. Solid.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: Draft - Roast malts and some dark fruit. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Creamy light roast, some chocolate and dark fruit. Decent, but nothing interesting.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: On tap at the brewery. Almost black with a light brown head and thick lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, oats and earthy hops. Similar flavor, nicely balanced. Medium body, creamy smooth velvety feel with soft carbonation. Super smooth.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, and coffee. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee. Rich and creamy. Very good.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: Poured on draft at 515 Brewery in Des Moines. Black pour with tan head. Nutty and chocolate notes. Somewhat malty. A very good stout

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: On tap at court ave ..pours dark black..thick creamy kacki head..mocha aroma..taste is creamy and cocoa..VERY smoith

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a black body with a finger-width, very dense and creamy, chocolate milk brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is richer, milky and dark chocolates and smooth oats with a moderate roast and coffee. Flavor is similar. Smooth oats and milky dark chocolates up front before some earth and a coffee-forward roast comes on nicely to balance. Finishes smooth and creamy with a rich malt sweetness, but dry and somewhat bitter from the roasts and earth. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a soft, creamy, medium-light carbonation. Overall, a really solid and well done dry stout. Plenty of chocolates balanced nicely with a solid roast, coffee, and earthy bitterness. Good one.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: on tap-pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is medium/dark malt-chocolate. Taste is medium/dark malt-coffee/chocolate, some earthy hop bite.

name: Court Avenue Blackhawk Stout
review: Had it at the brewery. Really enjoyed the taste, I liked the hints of chocolate and coffee. It finishes nice and smooth.

name: Peroni
review: 0,33 bottle. Sweet corny aroma. Small white foam. Medium carbonated. Light and sweet taste. Very refreshing good for hot days

name: Peroni
review: 2019 - 10 - 21 330ml bottle. yellow golden colour. small, white head. cardboard and hay in aroma. light bitter taste

name: Peroni
review: Klarowne i z³ote. Z ³adn¹ pian¹. Bardzo nik³y s³odowy aromat. Œrednie wysycenie. Wytrawne raczej. Skromna zio³owa goryczka.

name: Peroni
review: # 351; 7/2016. Nevýrazný, sladový ležák s nedobrou vùní a nižší plností a obilnou dochutí.

name: Peroni
review: Helder lichtgeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitter en enigszins zoet met een wat rare muffe bijsmaak. Valt zwaar tegen.

name: Peroni
review: First time I’ve ever seen a canned Peroni so I had to try if there is any difference between a bottle or a can. To be honest it tastes fresher, it seems more crisp and also smells better. Although it’s just a “regular” macro-brewed beer it’s quite good and well balanced, I like this wayyy more than Heineken and Amstel for example. But Hertog Jan still is my number 1 easy-to-drink pale lager/pilsner!

name: Peroni
review: Blik gekocht tijdens vakantie in Italië. Goudgeel helder bier met een vreemde geur. Schuim trekt snel weg. De smaak is licht moutig. Voor mij is dit een pilsener in de lagere regionen.

name: Peroni
review: Pours golden with a thick white head. Aroma of rich malt, grass. Taste has floral malt, rich. Palate is much of the same. Much better than a typical international lager.

name: Peroni
review: Nice refreshing lunchtime beer. Doesn’t taste as strong as its big brother, but we shall see.

name: Peroni
review: It tastes more like some kind of a corn syrup than beer, but, all in all, I found it very refreshing on hot summer days. It's fine with the Serbian barbecue specialties.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Bottle. Light sweet malt and paper aroma. Yellow with moderate head. Bland wheat flavor - really nothing unique. Wasn’t really offensive when I drank it but looking at the other ratings, it must have went even more down hill before they went out of business.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: If this were my dog, I’d friggin’ shoot it. If this were a dog in the pound, I shut the lid on the euthenasia tank myself. Absolutely horrid, with an adjunct that has to be wood chips. The malt tastes like fresh dirt from a junkyard, and the hops scream rancid potatoes. If this is an American wheat, let’s all move to Canada.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: so when you finally realize that the woman you have been after is just going to keep rejecting you, partly due to some asshole friend who introduces a smooth talking pretty boy into the situation you start thinking you need to suffer, no, you deserve to suffer. because apparently you are not good enough for anyone, so grab a bubba dog, hate yourself, treat yourself like the broken piece of empty crap you feel like, ahh, nothing like a bubba dog with its amber pour and ring of white head to make you feel like you are really paying for your sins. so when you decide you don’t deserve anything good, stick your nose in a glass of this and take in grainy aroma of dead bananas and self pity. oh yeah, now your paying, now you feel the same pain physically that you do emotionally, yeah balance is cool, just take another drink of this twinge inducing beverage. tastes like wood shop. rancid pop tart finish. lingering finish of caramel and slick oily clay. yeah, i’m a worthless piece of crap and this beer goes great with that outlook. but i’m gonna drink the whole damn thing.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: The name is reasonably befitting for this beer--a Golden Retriever is a dog that is friendly and familiar, if not exceptionally unique. This is a straight-up American wheat, pouring a standard bronze/brown with a middling head. Unremarkable and reclusive aroma, perhaps a bit cardboardy but otherwise lacking the sour edge that sometimes troubles Great Grains beers. Some malty hints, slightly caramel, watery, with a late metallic twinge. Decent carbonation, giving it a bit of life. Not a terrible beer at all, just run-of-the-mill like your average Golden Retriever.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Poured hazy brownish amber with mild off white head...smell is malty and is indeed of cardboard...taste is thin and watery and nutty...metallic and fizzy...not good at all...

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Bottle pours a very cloudy unfilterd honey color with a huge coarse foamy white head that is maintained very well. Aromsa are of honey and cardboard, light malts and a little fruity hops. The flavors leave much to be desired. Metallic, rusty burnt. Just all around not good. "This award winning beer" WTH !?! Still, thanks to Kaggie97 for this unique brew. Hey Cool! My new loest ever rating. W00t

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Bottle. HUGE foamy head on a hazy gold body. Smells like really sweet roting fruit. Taste up front is simpily of a bad wheat, but the aftertaste is bad wheat plus vinegar. This is the last straw. Great Grains needs to throw the towel in. Their beers suck ass.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Hmmm, I never would have guessed that something called "Bubba Dog" would be my 100th brew. As the bottle states, this is a foggy pour. It is decently heady and is not overpouring to the nose. It has decent taste, however it is noticeably hollow. An OK lawnmower beer, but not a recommended beer for body and unique palate.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Pours like apple cider with no head or lacing. The aroma is sourish and fruity. Slick and undercarbonated body, with a really unpleasant flavor. I didn't even know this was supposed to be a wheat beer. The flavor is kind of what a Flemish Sour would taste like if it sat out for a couple days. It is just sour and fruity throughout. The finish is fruity like cider and the tart sourness lingers. So far the Yellow Rose beers have been thorough disappointments.

name: Yellow Rose Bubba Dog
review: Smells like a compost heap full of old rotting vegetables. Thin as hell, mouthfeel (not taste) like weak coffee, with no carbonation.. seems like a mixture of 1/2 beer and 1/2 water. Tastes like bland notebook paper and tobacco, with an absolutely empty and awful finish. Tastes like dirty dish water left in a sink.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: Bottle poured i to a shaker. Pours caramel color with a quickly dissolving off white head. Mostly caramel on a very light aroma. Initial taste is a hint of caramel malt with watered down pine hops. Aftertaste is mild, toasty, and unremarkable. Watery palate and light carbonation. Well, it's beer...

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: 12 oz. bottle. Poured dark amber with an off white head. Aroma was caramel, toast, brown sugar. Taste was light sweet, toasted grains, malty, caramel malt, light burnt sugar. Okay.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: 12oz bottle. Filtered amber-brown-red body. Foamy, glass rimming head. A pretty classic, doughy Amber. Most brewers don't even attempt this style anymore, and this has more of a feel of a good amber of 15 years back than most on the market in 2017. Big caramel malt tones, could benefit from a little more aggressive hopping. OK.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: 12floz bottle with a BBD 05.31.2017 imprinted on the neck. Looks about as amazing as a beer can get. A one-finger head settles to a frothy half-finger leaving webs as the dark-copper body lowers with each drink. Smells good too, consisting of toasted caramel and mossy earthiness. This is carries through in the easy going palate. An excellent American altbier/amber ale as it is a very well composed malt centric ale.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: From a bottle into pint glass. Amber color, big beige head. Mostly molasses on the nose. sweet, well balanced, medium carbonation. Solid satiated, solid beer.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: I get it, there’s lots of American Amber Ales out there, but to my mind, Ad Astra is underrated. Deep amber pour with a light brown head and lacing. Biscuit and toffee aromas from the toasted malt. Flavor goes with what you smell. You also get some caramel. Tea and apricot hop flourishes, too. The hops are present, but the bitterness is kept low. Smooth and partially creamy mouthfeel. A paradigm-shifter? No. A tasty beer? Absolutely.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: Pretty good Amber. Malt, caramel, toffee, biscuit, some fruitiness. Down the middle of the plate.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: APPEARANCE- Dark amber color, in the darker range for an Amber ale, which like. Head is nice, and laces well. FLAVOR- clean drinking ale flavor. Very little hop is evident (bittering or aroma).NOTES-This one surprised me a bit. It?s better than I anticipated.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: Weird mineral, slightly astringent aroma with some Sugar Daddy caramel lurking within; amber color, pale beige crown; toffee and caramel, brown sugar, fruity/berry quality in the middle, dried dates and other fruits; earthy bitterness in the finish, balanced overall; light medium body, ample carbonation; tastes far better than it smells, solid amber ale.

name: Free State Ad Astra Ale
review: Pours an amber brown color with a khaki head. Caramel, toffee, biscuit, toast and light fruit aroma. Caramel, toffee, biscuit, toast, floral, slight fruit and nut flavor with a bit of astringency. Medium light body and medium carbonation. Astringent caramel finish.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Dark yellow with a fluffy white head. Sweet malty cereal grain citrus and light earthy spice aroma and taste.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Growler, purchased for me at the brewpub by Gregis. I brought this to a friend’s BBQ Saturday night, and shared a few glasses around. The beer was generally well received, with a few people pretty excited about how distinctive it was. Pour is a very hazy golden auburn with a very white head. Really nice lacing left behind on the Pils glass I was using. Aroma is cloves, coriander and a bit of Belgian yeast sweetness. Nose was somewhere between a Wit and a Hefe for me. Taste is light and refreshing with the spices represented in the nose along with a full wheatiness. This beer worked really well on a hot summer evening. However, the lighter body led to a bit less definition in the taste. As with the nose, the taste was somewhere in between a Wit and a Hefe, which I liked. Thanks for bringing this one from Lawrence for me Greg, always appreciated.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Poured from a growler. The pour is hazy dark straw yellow with a snow white head. Nice lace. I get coriander up front in the nose. Every now and then I pick up a whiff of the orange peel. There’s some other spice notes that I’m guessing is from the yeast. The flavor is pretty light, and I must say uninspiring. Some coriander and orange are there, but they seem kind of muddled. Not as sharp as I’d like them. Even a bit soapy. Medium body with lots of carbonation. This isn’t all that bad of a beer, but its not all that good either. It just left me wanting more.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: On tap at the brewpub.. Pours a hazy lemonade yellow with a thin cap of white head. Citrus, wheat and a faint coriander on the nose; less citric than many wits. The mouthfeel is thin, soft and lightly dry; noticeably smoother than a lot of the wits that I’ve sampled. The flavor also deviates a bit from the typical formula for this style. Not as sweet as I’d expected, the flavor is wheat, orange and coriander with a dry coriander finish. Rather than leaning on the citrus, this beer goes more towards the spice and ends with a slightly funky finish. I found it a decent witbier but I won’t order it again.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Decent, makes for a nice beer to drink during the hot summer days. A bit of a sticky soapy flavor, with some really nice fruitiness, rinds perhaps a bit of corriander and clove. Nice!

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Draft at the brewpub, 7/3/06: Hazy yellow with a foamy film. Yeasty to be sure, this is slippery smooth with a light orange-iness shining through. OK.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: On tap: A great summer beer, I also thought it had a little more flavor than your typical Belgian witbeir. I really enjoyed this, another winner from Free State. The oargne and coriander are very noticable, the honey is a nice undertone. A little bit mild, or plain dispite the notes of spice mixed in there, but overall another very good brew from Free State. Some serious bubble gum flavors and aroma.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Draft. Hazy gold, off white, somewhat rocky head. Nose is corriander, wheat, with some muted yeastiness. Taste is spicy with soft wheat flavors and some mid and late citrus. The mouthfeel is soft and smooth. I didn’t know that oats were added until after I had it, that would help explain the great mouthfeel. Nice wit.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Draft: Dull lemon. Ever so hazy. Retentive, rocky wisp of foam. Flowery hops, orange peels, and rose petals in the aroma. Hint of hay as it warms. Juicy texture mirrors the grittiness. Notably creamy carbonation. Early toasted hay sweetness tempers the honeydew melon onrush. Sensuously soft orange peel, floral hop, and rose petal mélange. Glimmering grassy herb notes, as well, and a restrained note of crushed coriander. Quenching lemony acidity cuts the starchy wheat and filmy oat notes before finishing with a balanced flurry of floral hops, chalky yeast, and fresh dried orange peels. Rather plain-spoken, but the degree of refinement, cleanliness, and dryness largely distinguish it from last year’s catastrophic example.

name: Free State Belgian Wheat
review: Citrusy aroma, cloudy pale appearance, a little to sweet....................

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Draft: Clear walnut with ruby highlights. Frothy light caramel head. Elegant aroma equally loaded with fruity esters, chocolate, caramel, nuts, and cream. Substantially hoppy with a hint of maple and buttery yeast. Soft and mellow on the tongue. Fruity start is balanced by a healthy fresh hop tingle and a long pale malt, caramel malt composition. Ringwood yeast hints. Persistent caramel malt, dark malt finish with a coarse hint of leather and accompanying hop belches. Exactly what I seek in the style.

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Medium dark brown with and orange hue at the edge of the glass. Frothy tan head... hoppy, rich and creamy, very sweet and rich, like drinking espresso or french roast. The roasted malts are picked up, and the roasty chocolate flavor coats the mouth. A great beer from Free State. Enjoyed this with lilannie, ChimayBabe and TAR passing through on my way to Chicago.

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Free State does so many different styles well. This ale is no exception. Caramel-fruit flavor and huge hops balanced by a ton of nutty, dark malts. Some banana-y esters noted. Quickly disappearing head with average lacing. Nutty dark malts with some fruity caramel. Bit of fitting diacetyl.

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Nice strong ale. Very fruity for such a dark beer; I tasted raisins, and, discordingly, lighter fruits such as peaches and apples. The hop varieties I have honestly never heard of, but finish off the tremendous malt complexity that this beer offers. Looks simply great in the glass.

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Dark red in color, roasted carmel, full body, not much head................

name: Free State Bison Dark Ale
review: Great dark, slightly strong ale. Deep, dark red color, slight head and relatively low carbonation, Great marriage of maltiness and hop spiciness. Incredible bittersweet aftertaste. Well done again, Free State.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: I had this at Flying Saucer in KC. Pours copper with thin white head. Taste malt, caramel, biscuits. I thought this was ok. I could drink this again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: 12oz bottle pours a clear gold with some ringing, white head. Nose has malt, honey, candy, grain. Flavor has more yeast, malt, honey, mild stone fruit. Creamy finish. Decent.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: Some candied malt and grain. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet finish with ok mash. Good for style. Bottle.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: From a bottle at the DC tasting July 10, 2016. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Aroma of caramel. Flavors same.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: Bottle - small foamy head, medium gold color, sweet malt and almost corn like aroma and flavor, mild hop balance, ok overall ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: At brewery...earthy grassy and slightly musty. Some piney hops presence. Pretty smooth. Not my fav style but good showing.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: Pours a medium yellow body with an average white head. Aroma is faint musty sweet, fruity. Taste is slightly bittersweet, hops and citrus. Mild-bitter finish.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: Draft at the source. Clear amber color, white head. Light cherry aroma. Taste is light straw. OK.

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: Pours gold with a white head. Nose of grassy hops. Medium body. Flavor is citrus and grassy hops. Light bitter finish. i

name: Free State Brinkley's Maibock
review: 12oz bottle: This one pours a clear, golden color. There was a very small white head that didn’t linger long nor leave any lacing. The aroma is good, with notes of the malts, fruits, grass and some earthiness. The taste is good. Malty, with a good hop balance. Fruits and some mustiness to the taste. An easy drinker. I would definitely buy again!

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: Had on tap at the brewpub while visiting the university. Nice. Probably their best beer while I was visiting.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: 12 oz draft at the 20th anniversary party for Free State. Pour is hazed golden with a 1/2 inch white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of sweet blueberry, cranberry and raspberry. Bit of lemon with some sugar. Some wheat behind that in the nose. Taste is syrupy berry (the same as the nose in this order) cranberry - raspberry - blueberry, all with more sweetness than tartness. Not really natural tasting, after the sweetness is the grainy earth wheat, which was actually quite nice. Some tart sour jumps out at the end. Grassy grainy thin medium palate. Clean finish.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: Excellent aroma and appearance. Best fruit beer I’ve had because the fruit flavor is a perfect balance between sweet and tart. The right amount and mixture of berries make for a pleasant fruit flavor and excellent level of alcohol.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: 5oz sample. Hazy gold with a finger high, off white head. Aroma is berries, in fact pretty much a good combonation of the berries used (cranberry, raspberry, blueberry) Mouthfeel is not too bad at first, but thin at the back. Initial taste is mildly tart berries, mostly cranberry, with a touch of wheat. The finish is sourish and a bit tart. Not bad, but not good.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: On Tap: Loved the aroma and taste, I was very suprised by the tartness of the cran and raspberries. Probably the best fruit beer I’ve had, if not best, the best redberry. Also a very pretty beer. Standard gold color with just off-white head.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: Nothing crimson about the color- light with a foamy head. Aprreciable wheat content, but the gravity makes it a little underpowered. Seedy aftertaste would suggest that they use real berries and not fruit extract.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: Very natural aroma and flavor. Much more subtle and upscale than the other cranberry-based beer I've tried (Sam Adams Lambic). Delicious and slightly creamy.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: An amazing fruit wheat beer with a great balance of sweet, sour, yeast, and hops. It’s hard to beat Free State wheat beers. A great biergarten selection from a wonderful brewery!

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: If there's a better fruit wheat out there I haven't met it. Many of these kinds of beers get so bogged down with fruit that it winds up tasting like vaguely yeasty kool-aid; this one gets it right. A great, crisp wheat, with just enough berry to make it incredibly refreshing. Great carbonation, too.

name: Free State Crimsonberry Ale
review: Lightly tart, fruity and flowery aroma, quite berryish indeed with just a hint of wheat. Faintly hazy lighter golden color, head is slight but leaves some nice lacing behind. Flavor is citric, sweet, tart and juicy, again plenty of berry flavor coming through. Refreshing and lightly acidic on the palate, light-medium bodied. Not too sweet, plenty of real fruit flavor to accent the light wheat ale base. Very little hops or bitterness. Nice fruit beer, very refreshing.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Fresh growler from the brewpub. Pours a deep, deep brown with two inches of thick tan head: a creamy pillow from the top with large pits when viewed from the side. I’ve never seen a schwarzbier with head retention like this one. When it eventually recedes, it deposits patchy lace in its wake. The nose is a blend of toasty cara-Munich and chocolaty malt notes with supporting spicy/herbal and floral hop notes. Light-bodied and fairly thin with a drying, roasty and mineral-forward finish, the palate is not at all what my brain was expecting, especially given its appearance. It’s a bit sour and a touch astringent at the finish, as well. The flavor is equally "off" from the expectations created by the pleasant aroma: up front, there’s a heavy mineral-water base that gives way to a roasted malt (burnt chocolate and Munich) and "green" hop combination that remains a bit disjointed even as my tongue acclimates to it toward the bottom of the pint. I’ve come to expect Free State to produce "above-average" to" truly stunning" examples of whatever lager style they attempt. While I’m sure that skewed my expectations for this beer, the bottom line is that I’m just not diggin’ this one.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Black with a fizzy tan head. Roasted grain and light chocolate aroma and taste with a big coffee bite.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: 10 oz draft at the brew pub in Lawrence, Kansas. Pour is black, touch of brown with a well formed 1/2 inch light khaki head. Nice lacing coats the glass as it drinks down. Aroma is roast malt, along with some light cream chocolate sweetness. Taste is the lightly sweet cream chocolate, followed close behind by a muted char taste, finishing with dry pine and mineral. Palate is medium bodied, coats the mouth initially than clears with the drier finish. Decent Schwarz, not quite as clean as other recent Free State Lagers.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Draft: Light prune liquid. Spiderweb lavework. Lovely aroma of raisin, toffee, glazed pecan, cocoa, and concord grape. Undertones of earth and chocolate. Firm, snappy carbonation. Very toffeeish. Starts mildly roasted with notes of toasted marshmallow, followed by a green, floral german hop snap. Big notes of caramel-coated coffee bean, nutty bread aspects, chocolate, toffee, and vanilla in the resounding finish. A truly impressive piece of work.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Chestnut color with a a stable light tan head. Aromas of griany malt and a hint of cocoa. Grainy extract flavors with a small hops bite near the end.

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Malty goodness, cherry cordial colored. Caramel taste and texture...very smooth. Not complex but so well done. My non-beer drinking friend said this replaced Ad Astra as her "favorite."

name: Free State Cyclone Black Lager
review: Deep, clear dark red-brown color with an even head. Dark bready malt aroma and flavor, with some roastiness and hints of brown sugar. Malty, sweet, lightly toffeeish finish with a creamy, smooth, effervescent mouthfeel. Decent.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Blah. Had this in Lawrence. At their tap room. Not much to it. Wouldn't pay money for it again.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: A not bad irish ale released near St. Pattie’s. Amber in color, thick and creamy. Some bread and caramel in the flavor and a bit of mellow hoppiness.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Comes reddish orange with a nice biege head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and grain. Taste is malt, caramel, grain, a bit of smoke, and a bit of hops. Very enjoyable.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Pours a translucent amber with a large foamy very light tan lacing head. Aroma of nuts, toffee and toasted cereal grains. Flavor really showcases a nice fresh lightly toasted cereal grain maltiness, some toffee and light caramel notes.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: On tap @ Free State Brewery. A nice red color with a bubbly tan head. A light aroma of toasty malts with a bit of sweetness. The taste is sweet and malty with a nice buttery mouthfeel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: On tap @ Free State. Red orange appearance. Slightly creamy amber malty nose. Nice Irish amber flavor.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Malty. A heavy beer for it’s size. I’m getting some scottish taste to this, but not enough to turn me off. A nice seasonal to have in March.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Draught @ Brewpub: Interesting pour. It has a bit of the Guinness-like cascade going on with it. It pours a coppery-amber color, which ended up being almost clear. Needless to say, it ended up with a decent size off-white head that leaves some lacing. There is a hint of roastiness to the nose. Earthy, grassy hops predominate the aroma, with some caramel also. It has a decent malt body, with a slightly dry taste. Very little sweetness to it. This is a very good beer!

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Growler shared with theisti. Pours reddish-brown with a thin skin of off-white head. On the nose are: caramel, flowers and a faint peat note in the background. Light to medium-bodied and slick with a clean, lightly dry finish. This one tastes like a blend of about two-thirds Irish ale (caramel malt base) and one-third Scottish ale (peaty smoked malt). This is a solid and tasty session beer.

name: Free State Grace OMalleys Irish Ale
review: Growler generously shared by Gregis. Pour is clear orange amber with an off white 1 inch head. Some pretty lacing on the glass. Aroma of malty, earthy, floral hop with some distant sweetness - brown sugar. Taste has the smokiness from the nose, but none of the sweetness. Some bitter, almost ear waxy hoppiness to the body / finish. This was interesting, nicely made. Thanks for bringing this one over, Greg!

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: A middling hefeweizen. It has a bit more hop bite than the standard banana and clove bomb, but otherwise standard. Tried for the first time back in 2008.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: 32 ounce growler. Pours a mostly clear pale gold with a decent white head. Mild aroma of fruit, malt, and spice. Taste is lemon, spice, malt, and grain. Hardly any banana. Very, very mild.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Draft in a sampler at the brewpub. Pours a hazy, pale yellow-gold with a finger of soft, resilient bone white head. Aroma of bready malts, banana, bubblegum, coriander, and wheat. The flavor is identical, with just a hint of lemon citrus. Light-medium bodied, with a soft, bready, wheaty, estery mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Sweet take on a hefe.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Tap at the brewpub - looks like a hefe alright - sadly, that’s as good as it gets - aroma and flavor are very sweet and sugary for a hefe - loads of banana and fruity esters - some undercurrents of off phenols - just a touch of spice, but overall really just too sweet to be enjoyable.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Reviewed from notes. On tap in August 2009. Pours a hazy light apricot color with a white head. Starts out at about two fingers but dies down quickly without all that much lace. The nose brings a lot of clove with just a bit if banana. The yeast is a bit more quiet in the taste with a light amount of semisweet malt. Pretty good body and nice drinkability on a hot summer day. Serving type: on-tap Reviewed on: 11-11-2010

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Growler filled five days prior (at the brewpub). Pours a hazy dark straw with a dense, fluffy, meringue-like white head with sticky cascading lace. The nose is of big banana esters and soft, sweet wheat. The banana note is so pronounced it’s almost like straight banana extract or banana Now & Later candy. Light-bodied and wheaty with a lightly astringent sourness at the back sides of your tongue. Soft, light, sour wheat with a solid, yeasty, banana backing and a touch of spiciness (clove?) at the finish. This is a solid hefeweizen. I’d certainly order it again.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Pint @ brewpub. Pours a completely hazy, cannot see through it, golden/thick yellow color. Has a nicely sticky lacing as well. Aroma is candy sweet bubblegum. A bit sweeter smelling than standard Hefe. Taste is slightly less bubblegum and more just sweet candy. With a light herbalness in the aftertaste. Hey I like estery brews and this is definitely got plenty of that.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Poured from a growler into my ,4 liter Kulmbacher glass. Growler was generously transported from the brewpub to my house by csbosox. Pour is hazy straw yellow and orange with a big white head. Nice thick lacing left behind as the head retreats. There are a bunch of carbonation bubbles clung on all sides of the glass. Bubbles rise to the top as well. Aroma of bready wheat toast, perfumey lemon citrus and bubble gum. The bubble gum comes on last but certainly is the strongest. Taste is the wheat, with a touch of lemon citrus and standard Hefe yeastiness. Palate is medium. Overall a nice hefe. Thanks for being my Free State mule, Chris.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Hazy straw yellow with a big white head. Very corny nose. Some spicey phenols, but where in the hell is the banana? Grassy and some pepper flavor. Dry finish. Blah.

name: Free State Hefe Weizen
review: Overall pretty mild in the typical hefe spice notes. Not really memorable at all.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes a mostly clear gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, fruit, and malt. Taste is citrus, fruit, pine, and malt. Nice addition of the Hop Jack series. Earlier Rating: 1/11/2013 Total Score: 3.8 On tap at the brewery. Comes a clear light amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus, malt, and caramel. Taste is tropical fruits and caramel malt. Uncomplicated but very tasty!

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Pint on tap. Mostly clear orange-copper with a lasting film of bubbles. Nose is resin, green herb and orange. Tastes the same with some metallic notes. Light-medium body has medium carbonation and a decent balance.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear gold with a grayish head that dissipates completely. Aroma has an earthy combination of earthy pine and grass with a solid grain backbone. Flavor has a nice earthy pine with some underlying nice sweet grain.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Draft. Cloudy deep gold/orange. Dense, off-white head. Aroma of orange, citrus, raw hops. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Earthy, raw hop flavor. Taste of citrus, orange, dough. Standard fare.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Growler. Consumed same day. This would be a decent hoppy pale ale, except for the fact that it is virtually flat.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Pours a mostly translucent copper with a smaller white head. Aroma of citrus, mango and light caramel malt. Flavor is dry and hoppy. Really well done pale ale. The citrusy and tropical fruit hop notes shine. Some bready malt poking through.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Very good pale ale. I wish this was available more often. Pungent hop aroma. Pours golden yellow. Tangy and delightful.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma of floral hops and bready malt. Flavor is very very bready with a bitter hops finish. Pleasantly drinkable and an interesting pale ale. 7/4/7/4/14 [3.6/5]

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Clear golden with a fizzy white head. Caramel cereal grain and earthy hops aroma and taste with a pungent bitterness.

name: Free State Hop Jack Ale
review: Citra version 10oz long thin tulip glass. Beer pours beautifully with a frothy head and a definitely unfiltered, dark orange color that allows little clarity. Aroma is fresh and crisp with tangy, light, citrus hops. The hops are accompanied well in the flavor with a malt backbone that is present but does not get in the way of the hops. Goes down easy. German Norther Brewer Similar score, the floral/herbal hops work well with this malt bill as well. Calypso This was by far the least interesting. It felt like there were less hops or the hops were more subtle, can’t pinpoint exactly the defining character of this hop.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: Not bad, though it can’t compare with the top shelf doppelbocks. Doesn’t have the same rich, thick flavor. This has a nice caramel and toffee background. Tried at the brewery.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: Pours a translucent amber with a medium bubbly off white head. Aroma of toffee, toasted malt and soft pretzels. Flavor of dark fruits, pretzels, cherries and toasted sweet malts.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear deep amber with a tan head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of sweet grains and bread with a hint of cookie. Flavor has similar notes of sweet grain and bread that finishes smooth.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: at brewpub This pours deep amber with a fine white head and has a sweet & vinous nose full of raisin and dried plum scents. Initially tastes sweet and full-bodied, but as the flavour develops the sweetness is balanced by a nutty hop character, lots of malt, a hint of roastiness and a dry alcoholic bite. The finish is dry and gently bitter

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: On tap at brewpub. Comes clear copper with a nice biege head. Aroma of malt, sugar and dark fruit. Taste is sweet malt, caramel, fruit and a bit of alcohol. A bit of hops at the finish. Nice.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: Taster @ the brewpub. Color is completely clean copper. Aroma is lightly fruity and earthy German lager yeast, that only that combination can bring. Taste is clean and lightly earthy. Fine stuff for a doppelbock but a bit boring at the end.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: On tap at the brewpub. The body was deep copper with a light khaki head. The aroma was sweet bread with apples. Perfume is in this one. The taste is sweet caramel and almonds. Nicely balanced with just enough sweetness. Obvious alcohol, but it is still a pleasure to drink.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: Glass from a growler graciously shared with me by csbosox. Pour is clear ruby brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel sweetness, some grainy hay. Taste is caramel maltiness, sharp sweetness, with hop bitterness in the finish. Grass and dirty straw throughout. Palate is thin to medium, easy drinking, though still quite a bit of flavor. Overall nice beer. Super cool of you stop by and offer me a glass of this Chris.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: Pours a clear, deep orange with a dense, creamy, off-white head that laces nicely. The nose is a sweet, malty brown sugar and raisin. The mouthfeel is on the light side of medium-bodied with a lightly metallic feel on the tongue, transitioning to a fairly dry and mildly astringent finish. Sweet malty raisin and caramel with a hint of alcohol at the finish. A solid Doppelbock but it’s probably not one that I’m inclined to order again. My opinion is probably tainted by the fact that I drank a Paulaner Salvator and Sprecher Doppel the night before sampling this one, but I just wasn’t blown away by this one.

name: Free State Invigorator Doppel Bock
review: On draught at the brewpub, pours a clear dark amber with a slight head. Malty aroma, medium body, slightly heavy mouthfeel. Rich but clean big malty flavor, slightly sweet malty flavor balance. Very subtle hop bitterness. Slightly rough/coarse finish. Very nice.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Pours a deep brown-black color with off white head. Roasted malt aroma. Roasty flavor, a bit chocolatey and fairly sweet. Light bodied. Notes: on tap at the brewery, Feb ‘18

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Bottle from a friend into a snifter. Pours a nice black with tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, hops, and licorice.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Bottled, 355ml aged 4yrs many thanks to Doppelganger. Black with tan head. There is a milk chocolate character to this along with a fruity, plummy note, some tarry notes some caramel. Not as deeply flavoured as many Impy Stouts but there is a reasonable palate. Overall pretty decent.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Dark brown/black color with a thin tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and cocoa. Flavor is the same.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Draft/Fest. A- Weak, bland, subtle cocoa. A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head. T- Roasty, cocoa, malty. P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish. O- Aroma was a bit of a let down and the taste was really traditional forward but still lacking. Needs some work but could be great.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Backlog from the Brony Bottle Share at Travlr’s. Dark brown with small lite tan head. Oats and roasted malt. Thin, boring.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Aroma is a little weak. Standard Imperial Stout scent, but muted and with a strange red wine vinegar characteristic. The appearance is nice - flat black color with a tiny cap of tan foam that leaves a lot of lacing. Nice creamy flavor with a welcome sweetness that opens up before giving way to hops and roasty bitterness. Booze burn in the aftertaste; I have never taken away points from a beer for that. Great palate, thick yet smooth. This beer was good, not great.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours dark black brown with a big creamy tan head that retains well and laces the glass. The aroma is roasted chocolate malt, black licorice and a little fruit. The flavor is roasted chocolate malts, black licorice and some dark fruit and an ashy bitter finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation. Overall, a nice imperial stout.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: Dark black. Milky chocolate. Roasted. Heavy body. Bitter aftertaste. Good but not great.

name: Free State Ironman Imperial Stout
review: 12 oz bottle. Dark brown with a sparse tan head. Nose is dusty caramel, faint coffee and raisin. Coating medium body with a tang. Taste is coffee, grass, chocolate, licorice and caramel. A little bit of everything. Solid stout.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Sweetish aroma, slight coffee. Brown with tan head. Tastes of coffee, lactose and roasted malts. A good representation of a style that I’m not always a fan of. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Pretty mild brown ale. I'm generally a fan of the stronger brown ales, but as a sessionable brown, this was tasty. Chocolate, has some brown sugar, some bready finish. Tried for the first time at the brewery back in 2007.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Brown color with a red tint. Cream colored head that left foam on the sides of the glass. Chocolate malt aroma with sourish notes. Malty, lactic/sour notes, little or no hop character. Nice mouthfeel.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Tap at Old Chicago, Olathe. Dark red brown with a thin off white head and moderate lacing. Big roasted malt aroma, cereal, mild coffee and a little nutty. Flavor is dryly sweet with a chalky aftertaste. Body is lighter with a fizzy feel.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Pours a deep brown with amber notes and a large foamy light tan head. Aroma of caramel, peanuts, milk chocolate and molasses. Flavor of caramel malt, almonds, light brown sugar, some spicy hop notes.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: On tap at the brewery. Comes dark brown with a small biege head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is sweet malt, caramel, chocolate, and a bit of vanilla. Kind of sweet, but easy to drink. Nice.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Draft in a sampler at the brewpub. Pours a dark, amber-tinted brown with a small beige head. Aroma of toasted and caramel malts, brown sugar-tosted nuts, vanilla, and chocolate. The flavor hits pretty much all the same notes, getting sweeter as it warms. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a toasty, sweet mouthfeel. Good brown ale, and of course they had to name it John Brown Ale- love that part.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Pours a dark brown with a very malty aroma. Taste is slightly bland with not much going on flavor wise. It’s ok. It’s sessionable but nothing in this beer stands out to me. Not bad but I probably wouldn’t buy it again.

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: On draft @ the Brewpub .. . Pours a deep brown, low head, light but sticky lacing .. . very light roast, light molasses, shaved bark, and brown sauce .. . Duffman can’t breathe! OH NO!

name: Free State John Brown Ale
review: Deep copper brown with a fizzy white head. Sweet molasses and malt aroma. Molasses and nutty taste with a malty finish.

name: Free State Janes ESB
review: Very nice tatse of hops in this ESB. Finish is very smooth. The here is very good to and goes well with the beers!!

name: Free State Janes ESB
review: This is a fine beer, but as the commercial description implies, this really is not that different from Copperhead. A bit too citric in character to be a proper English ESB. BTW, the hops recipe has changed: They use Fuggles and Horizon hops now.

name: Free State Janes ESB
review: I don't like the sour edge this one seemed to have. It goes beyond bitter and tart, into the nether regions of sour. I like the Copperhead more, the hops in that brew seem to be better balanced.

name: Free State Janes ESB
review: Mahogany/dark amber color. Filtered. Nice carbonation, a slight yet uneven head and some rather thick lacing. The aroma is very slightly fruity, but is mostly hoppy. I believe the recipe for this brew has changed slightly, as in the description above it is stated that only E. Kent Goldings are used, whereas on the menu last night the mix was noted to be Goldings, Fuggles, and Victory. Anyhoo, there is a certain caramel sweetness to this beer, along with the same slight fruitiness found in the aroma. This beer has great balance. The hoppy flavors come in right at the right time. Medium-bodied beer. Finish is quite smooth, with a slightly spicy aftertaste. O.G. - 1058, 50 IBUs.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: 5 oz sample draft at the brewpub in Lawrence, Kansas. The pour is a clear golden with not much of a white head. The aroma is soft citrus, rye and the grass in the back. The taste is a bit of the spice rye up front followed by the citrus Lemongrass and finishing with grain cereal malt. Nice integration of flavors. The palate is medium bodied with active carbonation and lingering rye Lemongrass in the finish.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: Pours a translucent golden with a creamy white lacing head. Aroma of rye spiciness, bready malt, lemongrass and citrus. Flavor had a spicy rye bite, cereal grains, lemon and other citrus notes.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: On tap at the brewpub. With Travlr. Comes clear straw yellow with a small white head. Mild aroma of citrus and malt. Taste is lemons, rye, spice, and malt. Light and refreshing.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: Draft at the source. Clear yellow color, thin white head. Aroma of citrus and light fruit. Taste is lemonpeel and light spice.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: From fresh Growler, Bright yellow with a thin white crisp head. The rye adds great thick mouthfeel which is hides the lightness of this beer. Not super lemony but enough to bring out the spice of the rye. Super refreshing for a hot day of mowing the lawn while still having enough bite and weight to make it worth it

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: Growler procured by beastiefan2k. Thanks for snagging this for me, Eugene. Pours a surprisingly clear dark gold with a creamy white head and nice lacing. This looks nothing like any other rye that I’ve sampled. The nose is of pale and biscuity malt with a touch of rye spiciness and some citrus and herbal/floral notes in the background. On the light side of medium-bodied, the mouthfeel is silky soft (almost like it came off cask) with a touch of light spiciness at the finish; super drinkable. The flavor is of pale and biscuity malt with a supporting rye spiciness and a bright yet well integrated lemony floral note. Time and again Steve puts out supremely drinkable session beers, and this one is no exception. This is one growler I will have no troubles polishing off by myself. :)

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: Cloudy amber with a off white foam,fruity esterey ,wheat like I didnt get the rye but the lemongrass was nice citrusy and clovery I bet they had tamed it down from previous batches.Easy drinking and my wifes favorite of the day

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: From a growler. The body was a medium copper color. The aroma had oranges, caramel and sweet iced tea. The taste was iced tea and toffee. There was also some roasted walnuts. A decent beer. Very smooth, like most from Free State.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: On Tap: This was one of my favorite Free State beers. Very easy to drink, and quite enjoyable. The appearence is a light golden color with a tiny white ring around the top and some nice carbonation throughout. The aroma is lemony, grassy, (not to sound too stupid considering the name), hops, citrus, etc. The taste is a touch of malts, just enough to offset the hops, citrus and other great flavors. I enjoyed it.

name: Free State Lemongrass Rye
review: Nothing offensive about this beer at all. Crystal clear. Golden. Light lemon. Soft on the palate, with some rye spice. I’d love to have this available all the time.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle, best by November 30, 2018 from RobertDale poured into a glass. Black with small off-white head. Aroma is cocoa, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is cocoa and oats. Nice oatmeal stout.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Bottle poured into an English pint on 6/17/18. Pours deep ruby brown with a small tan head. Aroma is caramel malt. Initial taste is mildly sweet with lots of roasted coffee flavors. Aftertaste is roasted malt and pleasantly bitter. Medium palate with good carbonation. Good stuff but nothing outstanding.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Pours cola brown, sweet aroma but rather tasteless body, oatmeal does coast your tongue, bottle.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: On tap dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is dark malt and light coffee. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter and light sour. Palate is silky with sharp carbonation.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Pours near black. Thin head with little lacing. Chocolate aroma and flavor. Palate is a little too lovely with carbonation.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium creamy tan head that retains well and laces the glass. The aroma is sweet roasted oats and chocolate malt. The flavor is sweet roasted malt and some black licorice and fruit with an ashy bitter finish. The mouthfeel is rather thin and watery and nitro like. Overall, a nice oatmeal stout. I remember liking this more last time I had it.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Drank right from the bottle; big thanks, moody. Has a big dark presentation. Could be a sweet stout but it tries to get into the more bitter stout or even looking at impy stout with its 6% and all shit. Yes, big and almost bold, but never quite gitz-thar. Goes down pretty easy, somewhat bitter burnt damp wet fire wood that was put out a couple of days ago, just not quire charcoal. Even has some attributes of baltic porter. Gets better as the session continues thru the middle but becomes a tad medicinal in the end.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Bottle, thanks to Unclemike. Pours dark brown with foamy beige head, faint oatmeal/mocha aroma, medium carbonation, lightly tangy mildly bitter mocha taste, smooth body, long medium bitter mocha finish. Nice one, a bit tangy.

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: Pours deep brown with off white head. Nice ce roast aroma and taste. Notes: on tap at the brewery, Nov '17

name: Free State Oatmeal Stout
review: 12oz bottle. Brown black body. Thin, fading beige head. Creamy..almost drinks like an English Porter. Classic, no gimmicks...pretty refreshing in that regard. It does indeed have a well rounded flavor. Mild coffee and chocolate notes. Solid offering.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: 12 ounce bottle thanks to Wes. A burgundy like color with notes of malt and caramel. Some amber in taste.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: 12oz bottle pours a clear copper amber with some white head. Nose has malt, root veg, a little candy, yeast. Flavor is sweet, malt and dough, root veg. Finishes a bit sweet. Simple.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle, best November 23, 2018 from RobertDale poured into a glass. Clear amber with small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, medium/light body, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Bottle from the September DC RB Tasting. Poured a dark amber color with a small white head. Aroma was light toasted malts, roasted notes. Some grassy notes. Earthy notes.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Tutu arima with sweet caramel flavors.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: 12floz bottle, BBD: 12.03.2017, $9 for a six-pack, nonic glass. Aroma: butterscotch-caramel. Appearance: dark amber (cherrywood), translucent, off-white head with good retention. Taste: biscuity and honey-caramel. Palate: Medium bodied, malty with a rather reserved sweetness. Overall: Clean and well composed. A fine U.S. brewed Octoberfest.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Taster at brewpub. Pours light brown with a white head. Leaves trace lacing in the glass. Solid malt notes on the nose. This beer seems to coat the tongue with a thin layer of maltiness. Finished clean. Not my favorite style but it’s very quaffable.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Draft @ Free State - clear copper with a white head. This might be the best Märzen I’ve ever had. Great ready malty sweetness, spicy bitterness, but not too much. Very nice!!

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Reddish, mostly clear pour with somewhat lasting foam. Bread and malt in the nose with some richness, perhaps chocolately. Flavor follows, but the spice gives the finish some bitterness. Medium body, mild fizz.

name: Free State Octoberfest
review: Tap at Whole Foods, Omaha. Pours dark amber, fleeting off white head. Aroma was roasted malts, earthy, caramel. Taste was mild sweet, toasted malts, spicy finish.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle from RobertDale poured into a glass. Hazy brownish red with off-white head. Aroma is bread, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is bread, malt, some anise, and a little fruit.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Dark red brown with a tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, pine, brown sugar and barley. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Palate is sticky with average carbonation.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Fully depends on the year. Last one I had was from 2016 (I think) and it was undrinkably sweet. Prior years had been awesome, though.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Pours a dark copper with off white head. Malty forward aroma, sweet. Flavor is malt forward as well, but roasty and not overly sweet, well balanced. A nice barleywine. Note: Westport Strong Ale Fest '17

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Pours a dark brown with minimal head. Nose is funky - some malt and chocolate, but a bit of an odd smell, too. Taste is awesome, though - some bourbon, black licorice, coffee. Chewy mouthfeel - almost like food. Good stuff. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: I didn't get the burbon taste at all. Strong toffee taste. Just a little bit of a head. Tried this because i was told it was a very popular beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: Free State’s Old Backus is a malt bomb with lots of class. It pours brown. It has a nose that leans heavily toward toasted malt sugar - brown sugar, caramel, and cooked fruit. Caramel, molasses, butterscotch, vanilla, chocolate, stone fruits, and dark fruits make up the flavor profile. While this definitely leans more toward the English malt-forward style, you still get some zesty hops toward the finish. Gorgeous stuff.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: 6 oz pour from chilled bottle into sniffer. Deep burnt orange, opaque, weak off-white head. Nose of plum, stone fruit, raisin, a little apricot, caramelization. Body is syrupy, thick, a little carbonation on the finish. Taste is sweet, molasses, malty, raisin a little lingering boozy-burn on the finish.

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: 12oz bottle shared. Nice caramel color. Nice hoppy caramel toffee aroma. Taste pretty much follows, bitter up front, sweet in the middle, dry finish. Pretty solid!

name: Free State Old Backus Barleywine
review: 12 oz. bottle. Poured murky brown, thin tan head. Aroma was fruity, plum and malty. Taste was bitter, peppery.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Refrigerated 12.5 oz. brown bottle with gold wax from RobertDale. Black with small beige head. Aroma is bourbon, thick body, medium/low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is bourbon, oak, chocolate, some vanilla, and hints of booze.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Smells boozy. Boozy. Hot. Woody. Tasted at dars for march madness. The Chris.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Bottle from trade. Pours a dark brown black. Light brown head. Aromas of bourbon and dark fruits. Some cocoa. Taste is well incorporated. Medium body.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Bottle share with art. Poured pitch black with min tan head. Aroma boozy and sweet barrel. Taste sweet chocolate wooden cabinet. Min alcohol burn but decent in mouth viscosity.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: June 19, 2015 - bottle shared by Brian. Black pour with limited head. Aroma was chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit and bourbon. Taste was a nice blend of everything mentioned in aroma. Thanks for the big time want, Brian!

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Bomber. Dark dense brown pour with a soapy light beige head. Whiskey, wood, fudge, vanilla, soft but still fairly dense palate, dark fruit on taste. Yum.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: 750ml bottle from trade with RobertDale. Thank you very much Bob! Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, lot of dark fruits, raisins, plums, caramel, chocolate, wood, vanilla, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: 2013 22-oz. bottle. Solid nose of charred oak, molasses, mild bourbon, and heavy milk chocolate. Pours flat dark brown. Nice, balanced taste of whiskey (solid heat to start), cocoa, oak, light vanilla, a touch of raisin, and some tobacco. The alcohol burn increases as the beer warms but never hits overpowering levels. Medium body with a slightly prickly texture. A delicious top-drawer barrel-aged stout.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Bottle shared by Eugene as part of a blind BA imperial stout tasting. Dark reddish brown pour was the lightest of the bunch. Nose brings chocolate, vanilla, touch of oak, and with perceptable alcohol. Some oxidation, more chocolate than roast, but pretty much right at the center of the flavor profile I’d expect from an imperial stout + barrel. Just doesn’t really gel for me the way I’d expect -- like all the parts are nicely there, but somehow the sum is less. Wish there was still some left this morning for me to give it another shot, though.

name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
review: Growler during RBWG Grand Tasting. Pours a very dark brown with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is roasted malts, cocoa, and booze. Thick mouth, strong roasted malt, cocoa, coffee bean, nice booze presence, really enjoyed this one.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of light floral hops, sweet fruits, and malt. Flavor is sweet, almost tangy with lots of fruity notes, also some pale malts. A good albeit unusual pilsener.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: 12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grass, grains and caramel. taste is malts and grains

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: This is a pretty solid pilsener by any standard. Golden and hazy. Thin, white head. Aroma is super light lemon. Has a very nice, grassy hop body. Nice amount of bitterness. Tried for the first time years ago at the brewery. Now they're bottling it and I can't believe I've never rated it before.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: 12oz bottle. A solid offering. Grassy, dry, with a crackery clean malt backdrop. Almost has a touch of lemony Sorachi Ace type of a feel..but I guess it is all Saaz. There is something not quite perfect about it...doesn't really have any nice lagering tone. Better than a typical US Pils, would like to try it on tap.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: Sampler at brewpub. Pours golden and clear with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glsss. Has some grass notes on the nose and tongue. Finished clean. Solid example of style.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: 12floz bottle, BBD: 09.22.2017, paid $9 for a six-pack, and poured this bottle’s contents into a nonic glass. Bubbles rise in the middle of the golden body to support a thick half finger of foam. Very nice nose consists of herbs, grass, and hay. This is a very fine Americanized pilsner. The hops are fresh providing vibrancy, and cereal grains provide just enough of a base to to lend a bit of grit. The body is light, but flavor flavor is maximum in this pilsner. More traditional than what most American craft brewers produce as pilsners. I approve.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: On tap at the brewpub. Comes a clear light gold with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and grass. Taste is sweet malt, grain, grass, and citrus. Nice Pilsener.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: Pours a translucent golden with a larger foamy white head. Aroma of spicy hops, bready malt, and grassy notes. Flavor of bread, lemon and

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: On tap at Free State. Pours a golden color with white head. Crisp, pils malts, noble hops flavors. Very solid pilsener.

name: Free State Post Rock Pilsner
review: On tap, minimal smell, some sweet maltiness. Smooth malts and a little floral hops go down easy. There is some herbal dryness in the finish with a rough grainy palate. As it gets warmer it gets more grainy and oily and less smooth. ok beer.

name: Free State Populist Porter
review: On tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a thin creamy head that laces nicely. On the nose are roast, chocolate, nuts and citric hops; an interesting blend. Light to medium-bodied and oily with a slick transition to a roasted and mildly bitter finish. Medium roasted malt, nuts and light chocolate with moderately earthy and citric hops at the lingering finish. This is a nice porter, one that I’d recommend it to any fan of the style.

name: Free State Populist Porter
review: On tap at the brewpub. Brown in color with a tan head. Nice chocolate and citrus aroma. Same with the flavor. Sort of thin palate. Really a nice beer. Could have drank several pints.

name: Free State Populist Porter
review: The beers at Free State change. The beer I had today was different than the beer Indra had in 2001 and is probably closer to the beer cb and grant had in 2003. This beer just went on tap recently and I loved it. On to the review. Dark brown with reddish tints. Aroma is hoppy! The hops seem to be citrusy, they smell great. The taste is roasted malt -> hops flavor. The hops flavor lingers with a slight bitterness. Nice finish. Mouthfeel is nice, about right for a porter. I kinda think they got it right here. I like hoppy porters, this isn’t by any means a super hopped beer like a Alpha Klaus, but the hops really go weel with the malt.

name: Free State Populist Porter
review: A mediocre offering from FS. Not bitter, but sour. A citrus flavor overwhelmed everything else good about this beer, except the aroma which was the consummate coffee/chocolate. I don't think I'll be getting this one again.
